Reviews.Title: “love the grounds”
Reviews.Author: K1956
Reviews.Content: 1st time to PDC and was happy with most of this resort. We upgraded to a superior room when we booked this trip but that was a waste of $. I emailed ahead of time with some of our needs (travelling with a 2 and a 5 yr old) but have to date not received a reply nor was any record of it at the front desk when we arrived. My only big complaint was the condition of the bath tub. It was cracked and not one you would want to bathe little ones in. The food was good and plenty of variety. You do have to keep and eye on the beach towels they provide. People take them and then you have to spend time getting another towel card and signing a slip that if you loose them again you will have to pay $35 per towel. There are people with white braclets that are day users, nearby residents. The drinks were weak but if you pay the $18 per day upgrade you get the premium liquor. The staff were all friendly. Beautiful grounds and beach. Not enough negative aspects to stop one from coming back. I would go here again for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Very Satisfied with this Great Little Resort”
Reviews.Author: J-MOT.
Reviews.Content: We just returned from an awesome week here. Our family of 4 including an 11 year old and a 14 year old loved everything about it. How much we liked the small size of the resort was a real surprise, as we usually stay in much bigger places and I was worried that the Reef would be too small. Turns out that having your room 30 seconds from the beach is a great thing! We loved the sun beds on the beach and around the pool (although there is a shortage of both and we had to play the save early game). This resort is really separated into 2 parts: The pool, beach zone which is very interesting and visually pleasing and the "jungle zone' that had lovely paths leading to the lobby and to the pools. The pool area is tiered on 4 levels with a few steps in between. This provides a lovely view as well as breeze to the upper pool areas. The pools were a nice temperature and 1 had a swim up bar. Speaking of bars, the drinks were great. I only drank mojitos and they were awesome. My husband liked the beer and wine with dinner. There were minimal lines at any bar and this is during March Break. Bartenders, as well as all service staff, were lovely. We enjoyed the food in the buffet restaurant very much. The view was also beautiful (pool and beach) and if you sat out on the terrace, the breeze was great. We also ate at the a la cartes, which were very good (we enjoyed the Grill more than the Italian). It was great not to have to get reservations but to just walk in whenever we wanted. To be honest though, we loved the buffet better. Great fresh fruit in the morning as well as omelets and fresh baked cinnamon rolls (my weakness, I ate 3 every morning with my coffee, which was very good).Lunch and dinner had lots of selection and always had something Mexican which we loved. One unique and sweet feature of the Reef was the ice cream parlour in the 'jungle'. Only open from 4-6 every afternoon, my son and I went everyday. Our favourite flavours were chocolate chip, coconut and almond. There was also a coffee lounge close by (right in the middle of the jungle) with delicious specialty coffees and snacks. The only area that was a little less than impressive was the lobby. We were quite underwhelmed when we arrived, however we soon realized how unimportant this really is. Some huge resorts we've been to had spectacular, grand lobbies but needing to take a shuttle between buffet and your room numerous times a day soon got very tired. I will mention that we did not get the room I requested and upgrades were not available so the 4 of us stayed in the double room which was rather tight. We had no complaints about the rooms, ie. bedding was very nice, pillows were nice and fluffy, water pressure was good, balcony was cute. Our room was in the jungle so it was a bit dark but there was very good lighting in the room especially for reading. There was no service or guest noises at night which is very important. In the future I would like to book a 1 bedroom apartment although I don't know if those are only for timeshare people (couldn't really get a clear answer from the front desk).. The beach and water was spectacular. Fantastic waves! We had perfect weather the whole week so that always helps. My son and husband participated in the beach volleyball most days. We walked to Playa Del Carmen several times (beach and street). Both were an easy 15 min. walk. We enjoyed looking at all the beautiful houses on the way but 5th Avenue was a bit of a disappointment to me. Too commercial, and too many huge stores. We did enjoy eating at Senior Frogs which is great for kids. In the future when we go back I would like to try some of the non-touristy restaurants and see the 'real' side of PDC. We went on 1 excursion, Xel-ha, which was awesome! Cliff jumping, zip lining and snorkeling among many other activities (we went for a full day) kept the kids busy all day. My husband and son went diving several times and have nothing but praise for the dive master, David and the Reef Marina. My husband and daughter went parasailing as well and loved it. Overall we greatly enjoyed our week here and plan on returning next year with some relatives.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice for group vacation.”
Reviews.Author: farmersfrommn
Reviews.Content: Our group of 15 just returned from a 7 day stay at The Reef Playacar. We were a group of parents and our 18 year olds on a “Spring Break” vacation. I want to point out that it's NOT a typical college "Spring Break" destination and there were NO typical college kids or "spring-breakers" there and we knew this ahead of time. We chose this resort for it’s location, smaller size, beach, and affordable price for an A.I. and we were not disappointed. The three BEST features of this resort are the BEACH , LOCATION and the SERVICE, which is exactly what many other visitors have reported. I would like to describe our experience by topic. Check –in and rooms: Our group arrived at around noon and 2 rooms were ready and 2 were not, which we really didn’t have a problem with since we arrived earlier than the 3:00 check in time. Don't be surprised if people who "don't know how to wait their turn" butt in line. It happens a LOT at resorts in Mexico, and it just comes with the experience, don't sweat it ! We all put our things in one room , changed clothes and hit the beach/pool. The rest of the accommodations were lined up just fine, with some of our party having “suites” to accommodate everyone conveniently since we had the group of teens with us. This worked out very well for our group. Rooms were clean and comfortable and the housekeeping service did an excellent job each day. I asked for additional bottles of water , and were supplied extra each day. Service: There were so many friendly staff members everywhere, it’s almost impossible to name them all. Always ready with a smile and “Hola” everywhere we went. Buffet tables and service , BARTENDERS , wait staff , and entertainment personnel ALL top-notch . Special thank you to Humbierto at the swim-up bar and Orlando at the roof-top bar who took such good care of us, remembered what we liked to drink, kept up with the requests even when VERY busy and put up with our crazy “bar games” and 18 year olds ( and some of us 50 year olds ) !!! We always tipped our servers, they work very hard and deserve it…and at times, there was a slight wait for a drink but they usually only had one bartender on duty so it was hard for him to keep up at “rush” times. As a suggestion, there should be 2 bartenders at the lobby bar when the 5:00-7:00 rush occurs as people are trying to get drinks before dinner, or going out for the evening. The Beach: This beach is AMAZING. Huge, lots of room to walk down and up all the way to Play del Carmen ( 15 min walk ) the white soft sand and blue clear water are what go there for. We were not disappointed. There is a bit of an inconvenience in getting a beach or poolside chair. If you are not out there by 6:30 – 7:00 am, good luck ! We had a large group, and usually had to split up, and it was difficult to get chairs with shade. There were LOTS of chairs “saved” with towels and nobody sitting in them most of the time. They do allow outside guests to purchase day passes, so this may account for the over occupancy of visitor-to-chair ratio. Food: The Buffet was best at breakfast, and often lunch too. More crowded at lunch than dinner. Always found something we liked, even in our large group. The boys, particularly , ate VERY well considering all the yummy choices at the snack bar near the pool as well. Nobody went hungry! We enjoyed the Italian restaurant twice, and our whole group was even seated together outside terrace which was really nice. On Tuesday night the buffet was closed and the Show Room was transformed into a huge Mexican buffet and show. There was an abundance of Mexican dishes to choose from, but if that’s not your favorite you were a little out of luck that night. Location: One of the main reasons we chose this resort was for the location to Playa. 5 minute 7.00 ( USD ) cab ride or 15 minute walk. Our kids all wanted to shop and do a little “night life” in Playa so we went into town 4 of the evenings usually after eating and drinking as much “free” at the resort first. There is really no night life at the Reef ( which we knew ) except for the nice , low-key roof top bar open until 2:00 am, which was perfectly fine for us several of the nights. This terrace overlooked the beautiful and quiet neighborhood of the Playacar gated community on the street side, and the resort grounds on the other. Additionally, I would like to add that the buildings and grounds were beautiful and the jungle-like setting was very scenic and comfortable. Just take a look at the pictures, it’s much more beautiful in real life! We would return to the Reef again, and certainly recommend to others who are looking for a smaller A.I. , great location, great beach, with everything you need, and not expecting a big “night life” atmosphere. The Reef Playacar certainly fits the bill.

Reviews.Title: “Great Vacation!”
Reviews.Author: MominMN66
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I just returned from a wonderful 11 day stay at The Reef Playacar. The resort is definitely on the small side as far as AI's go, but the service was top notch and not having to walk long distances to get places was great. The food was pretty standard for this level AI, but the two ala carte restaurants were good and since they didn't require reservations, we could decide our dinner plans late in the day rather than scheduling ahead of time. I have to give a special thanks to Vita and Daniel at the front desk for helping with my special room requests - they were very accommodating and managed to handle our requests even though the resort was booked to capacity at a peak time. The Sports and Entertainment staff was very friendly and tried to get the guests to participate in scheduled activities as much as possible. My daughter really enjoyed Jesus, Sara, and Mariela and beach volleyball in the afternoons. We didn't see many of the shows, but I would recommend the Michael Jackson one to anyone that sees it on the calendar. Casino night was fun too, just be prepared for non-Vegas rules :) The one downside for us was that there is no real nightlife to speak of on the resort. There is a bar that is open late, but no "disco" as in most of the other resorts, just pool tables. We met some others during our stay and made our own fun at the bar. Thanks to Orlando and Erick for putting up with our group and even remembering what I wanted to drink! The pool bar was fun, but allowing little kids next to the bar seemed a little out of place. Humberto at the pool bar did a great job keeping up even when it was busy. The snack bar had pretty standard food and was open late, which was great for the later nights after the buffet was closed. Overall the trip was great and I would return. If you're looking for a big party place though, this isn't it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: sunrise003
Reviews.Content: My husband and I, and my sister and her husband went to The Reef 1st part of March. Wanted a place close to Playa Del Carmen, because we wanted to be able to walk to the town and just basically relax. We were able to do all of that and enjoyed our stay also. The resort offered the usual all inclusive stuff, but we found that even though some of the reviews were not happy with the food was not the problem, we found it very good and even my husband who will not eat everything was very happy. We tried both of the restaurants and enjoyed our meal without reservations which I am very happy with because it always puts a damper on things when on vacation you have to make a schedule. Will I will second everything Dan from CT. said and more. One thing I will like to say is the staff is the best I have ever seen, so someone there must be doing something right. Will for sure go back again, enjoyed our time, Thanks again to The Reef.

Reviews.Title: “DISAPOINTMENT”
Reviews.Author: Djuric83
Reviews.Content: First and main problem was when i got there they did not have my room ready. They said A/C in room was not working and they didnt want to put me in room like that and my room was gonna be ready first thing in the morning the next day. They made me and my girlfriend stay in different hotel across the street. Room there was in bad shape and had dirty covers, and pillows so we asked for clean ones and never got them. We checked out of that hotel around 9am and went back to the Reef Playcar and they told us that we have to wait till people check out of our room, which is noon, n we can have the room.We had to change in lobby bathroom! Imagine how nice our vacation started. So this means they LIED first day when they said A/C wasnt working. They told me that they wanted to make it up to me and they will put extra and special things in my room. however i didnt find anything extra or special in my room and after coppola day i found out that extra and special was a coffee maker because other room did not have them "wow man i felt so special". It was so disapointing. Next day someone stole my girlfriends bikini from the balcony so we went to the front desk and asked if maybe wind blew it away and maybe they had it in lost and found. First they could not locate bell boy who had a key to the lost and found place so we had to wait till next day to go ask them again. They said nothing was found and they told us to make report and talk to coustumer service which we did and were told that they will talk to us in 2 days and and they will c what they can do and i also told costumer service about expirience we had first day and lady was so "supprised" and she say she didnt know nothing about it. Only after 2 hours they left a note in our room saying "We would like to inform you that the hotel is not responsible for the loss of the belongings out of the safe box" So in another words that means they can clean out your whole room and not be responsible for it. And it very obvious that people there have low income and if they know hotel is not responsible for anything why wouldnt they take something. Other than that, food was ok, beach was nice and whole grounds on property were nice. Best time was at at the beach bar with best bartender there named Armando. At our checkout they just handed us little yellow paper with room # on it and that was it. Nobody asked us bout our stay or anything and the lady from Guest service who we talked to about our problems for at least 45 minutes 2 day before and who was supposed to talk to us again was just walking by us like she never seen us before. I tried to make this as short as possible and again big DISAPOITMENT wit front desk and guest service. Will never go there and will not recomend this place to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Cant beat it for the price!”
Reviews.Author: FairfieldDan
Reviews.Content: My wife and I booked a 4 day trip to the reef based on 3 criteria. Price, location, and all inclusive. We hadn't been to Mexico in 5 years since the birth of our children. We have stayed at downtown hotels and the coastal all inclusives. This resort more than exceeded our expectations and criteria. First-Location- For all you experienced Playa Del Carmeners-The beach is back over 100ft from the resort to the ocean. It is a 15 minute walk downtown, on the sidewalk or beach, in the gated village of Playacar. For all of the naysayers,this is not a border town with drug violence. I read all the govt warnings and blogs and Playa Del Carmen is SAFE. My wife jogged downtown thru the village every morning-I slept in. Second-Price-When we booked our trip we paid around $109 a nite a person. There were a couple of competitors at the same price point but The Reef is the closest hotel to downtown. The room was very clean. We requested a second floor room because prior reviews claimed there was a bug problem. We never had any bug issues. Remember, the Riviera Maya is more of a jungle landscape, not a desert. A few bugs would not have been a shock.Our room had very good air conditioning and within minutes of check in, the room as fresh as any. We tipped the cleaning lady $10(a good courtesy by the way, they work hard and make very little) and our room was immaculate everyday with swan shaped towels on our bed. We experienced no pilferage or had even heard of any. We left cash out every day. The service was excellent everywhere we went on the resort. At the buffet, there was always a server to bring you a beverage. The bartenders at every bar were extremely attentive without gratuity-which of course made all of us tip them more. We were never asked once about a timeshare although we saw many tours. By the way, If you dont feel like simply saying no, tell them you won the trip and you're really poor. Third-All Inclusions- My wife is the tough customer at buffets and she couldnt have been happier, from the omelet station in the morning to the fajita station at nite, there was always something good to eat. Were you eating Filet and Lobster? No, but it was above and beyond prior buffets we have had. We though the two restaurants were great. Yes, the selection was a little limited, but heres the kicker-no reservations needed! Ever been to a resort and the day you check the half full restauarants are already booked? Not here. Dine inside or out. The food in these restaurants was excellent. To sum up the food, the wife and I were planning on eating downtown alot because we have our favorite restaurants and only ended up dining out once-and were disappointed. The drinks-never had any problem with my rum-Appleton Estate- or my beer-Dos Equis. What more do you want folks? Most people are drinking frozen drinks anyway. Who cares if its top shelf or not. There were at least 20 sun beds laidout between the beach and two pools and too many umbrellas to count. Yes, you had to be out early to stake your claim but such is the case at most resorts. There was never a shortage of lounges. Names such as Hector and Guillermo stick in my mind but there was truly not one unhelpful person.You almost tired of walking by a staff member saying "Hola". In summation folks, do your homework or blame your travel agent if your not satisfied. The old saying- Remember where your shopping. This place is smaller and much easier to get around. I truly want to thank all of the staff for a wonderful time! Dan and Sara, Fairfield, CT

Reviews.Title: “Been to The Reef Playacar 9 times”
Reviews.Author: Bruce B
Reviews.Content: My wife and I really enjoy The Reef and this was our 9th visit here. We do not own a timeshare so we always end up coming back to The Reef because we want to, not because we have to. We sometimes stay at larger, more expensive hotels in Cancun for a few days, but still like The Reef best as our first choice. Everyone at The Reef is always so friendly and helpful that it really makes us feel like we are at home. The grounds are lush and beautiful, unlike the bigger hotels which are very open and cold. We first started coming to The Reef after the hurricane devasted Cancun in 2005. I was worried about staying at an all-inclusive, anticipating that there would be lines for food and drinks, and the quality would not be good. I was wrong and the food at The Reef is excellent with a huge variety of very good food. There are three sit down meals a day in the buffet and two restaurants for dinner. You can get something to eat or drink in many of the different bars, restaurants and snack shops almost 24 hours a day. The rooms are very comfortable and clean. I like the firm beds and can get a much better sleep on them rather than the soft beds at some resorts. All of the rooms are good but I especially like the upper floor rooms as they have a nice view from the balconies. The Reef is in a great location in North Playacar and it is an easy walk into the town of Playa Del Carmen. There are a lot of off-site activites in the area if you want to explore something else.The beach at The Reef was rebuilt a few years ago and is very large and flat. You can now easily walk the length of the beach from the end or into town. The Reef now has a premium bracelet option for $18/day. This may seem expensive at first but is worthwhile, as there is a renovated section of the beach that is open only to premium customers all day and all night, along with top shelf drinks. I continue to recommend it to my friends and family, and we plan to return again this summer or next winter. The Reef is a great value for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Good...not Great”
Reviews.Author: Keith M
Reviews.Content: We are a couple in our mid 20's and we went to the Reef in the last week of Feb. Beautiful rain forest feel to the whole resort.All the workers were extremely nice and helpful. We were a bit disappointed with the buffet food. The breakfast and snack bar were pretty good. The two restaurants have decent food but very limited menu. Also some items on the menu there you have to pay for. Pool was kinda small and also being a young couple we missed some good music and maybe some fun games at the pool. Drinks were satisfactory but then again we don't drink heavily. Beach was beautiful...there was some sea weed washed up but was not too unsightly. Water was a beautiful turquoise color and the beach was clean and plenty big. Personally we were not bothered by any time share ppl. We sat down once with one person for about 20 mins ...10 mins of which she helped us understand what was around in the area. Just say no if not interested. Special mention to Mayaland tours with who we booked all our excursion. They were very helpful and spent a lot of time telling us what to expect on each excursion and gave us a decent discount for booking multiple excursions. As we did not stay on hotel premises too much we didn't mind the relative lack of activities and music...and mind you we were not looking for a crazy party just a little more life to the resort. Also def check out the tea spot in the middle of the resort which opens from 4-6, unfortunately the ice cream place was closed for our entire trip there. We went to one of the shows at the resort which was the Michael Jackson tribute and it was really good ..way above expectations. The rooms were serviceable...not great not bad. We were on the second floor right in the middle between the pool and the lobby. Overall I would give the resort 3 out of 5 stars. We paid about $2K with airfare for 6 nights which was a really good price imo. For that price i think it was a pretty good place to stay. You have to check out the 5th ave area...a bit commercialized but nice Miami feel to it. Felt safe the whole trip there and we went to multiple places so no worries there. We went snorkeling in Cozumel - recommended, Went to Xplor - recommended , I went scuba diving (gf is chicken) - recommended and its right on hotel premises, Saw the Mayan ruins (2.5hrs away) - Recommended

Reviews.Title: “Great Location. A few issues.”
Reviews.Author: cotto19
Reviews.Content: We stayed 1 week the last week of February 2012. First, the good points. The location is great. The beach is great. It is about a 20 minute walk to downtown. You can walk the beach or take the road. It is perfectly safe. We had no issues walking around. The grounds are wonderful. The resort is built around a small cave system and has lots of trees and vegetation. The rooms are decent. Nothing fantastic. Our bath tub was a set wrong and it leaked water on the floor. We used a towel to damn the water once we discovered the problem. The beds are firm to hard. The staff was very good overall. They work really hard for you and they work long days. The same guy at the pool bar at 11am would be pouring drinks at midnight upstairs. Now, our concerns. First, this is a time share resort. Upon arrival we were given a blue bracelet. Apparently, you can upgrade to premium alcohol and some other things or if you are part of the time share program you automatically upgrade to a silver or gold bracelet. The problem is that blue band makes you a target on and off the resort for time share sellers. On two occasions the concierge tried to set us up with a time share meeting. Not my idea of a concierge. And on one occasion we were approached downtown. The guy downtown, said "hey, I see you have blue band"..... The food isn't great. 3 of the nights had decent choices. The other nights we had a little trouble finding something. The non buffet restraunts have 5 or so free choices and 4 up charge choices. The free choices were not that great. The presentation was good, but the taste and satisfaction were lacking. We ate at each only once. Breakfast was good. They have an egg and omelette station that is made to order. The drinks are weak. If you tip a little the drinks get stronger. I had Kaluha. Before the tip my glass had maybe a shot glass full of Kaluha. After 20 pesos, Kaluha filled half my glass. They have about 12 beach cabana beds and 12 or so umbrellas. If you want a cabana you need to claim one by 6:30 am. If you want an umbrella you need to claim one by 7:30 am. Otherwise your in the sun on beach chair if you can find one. The rooms are setup in individual 3 story units. Each floor has 4 rooms accesses from the outside. It is all stairways, no elevators. So if stairs are a concern for you, request a ground floor room. Overall, the resort is average, 3 star. Our only all inclusive reference point is a Barcelo resort that was fantastic and the rooms were top notch but you typically pay more.

Reviews.Title: “We'll be back!! :)”
Reviews.Author: Jennifer L
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Reef from February 20-27th, 2012. What a beautiful property...WOW! We absolutely LOVED it!! The fact that it's a smaller resort was just exactly what we were looking for. We travelled with 3 other families, all with teenage kids, and we thought this place was PERFECT! Everything is so close! The beach was a 2 minute walk from our room, the restaurants were a 2 minute walk, the lobby and bars were a 2 minute walk...perfect! We saw a lot of trip advisor reports complaining about the time-share people, but none of us were bothered by them at all! I think if you just stay out of the lobby during the day, you'll be fine. We found the service was great - house keeping, bartenders, waiters, entertainers... A lot of the bartenders and waiters float around between the bars, so you would see them in different positions during the week - they were all really great. Rooms were fine - beds a bit small (2 double beds in standard room), but you're not in Mexico to stay in your room right? Location of this resort is perfect as well. It was under an hour from the Cancun airport! Playacar is such a beautiful little community too - (StarBucks just a couple blocks down the road never hurts either!) Only a 15 minute walk to 5th avenue shopping in Playa del Carmen (or a $7 cab ride). The food was good too. We took advantage of the buffet mostly, but did eat at both of the ale cart restaurants as well, and enjoyed both of them - it was nice to get pampered at them! (We couldn't believe how good the roast beef was at the buffet - coming from Albertans - that's a compliment!!) All in all, we thoroughly enjoyed our stay at this little "gem" of a resort, and we wil most definitely be back!!

Reviews.Title: “Reef in decline 2/15/12-2/29/12”
Reviews.Author: OrangeHaze
Reviews.Content: This was our third year at the Reef PlayaCar. The location is wonderful. But... the food got boring by the 2nd week. There wasn't ANY ice cream; The bar products were less than "bottom shelf". The only way you could have decent drinks was to pay extra for an upgraded armband, or after you have been to this resort for 5 years. The beach needs to be cleaned regulary; Too many people use it as their own private ashtray. Doubt we go back. The staff is great.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it! Exactly what we were looking for”
Reviews.Author: jetsetter_xoxo
Reviews.Content: We were a young couple going out to enjoy the beach and stay at decent hotel at a nice resort and that's what we got. We loved it! Here's a rundown of what we experienced: LOCATION This hotel was right off one of the most beautiful beaches. For that reason alone, I could give it 5 stars... From the photos, I didn't expect the fanciest rooms and/or amenities... but I came here for the beach. I'm not trying to get stuck inside a hotel. I think having a decent room was my main goal, along with a decent hotel and decent food... and of course, good customer service... and that's what Reef Playacar had. CUSTOMER SERVICE The customer service was pretty good. I expect a lot from people in Customer Service and I can honestly say that I was happy with how the people treated you at this resort. Kudos to them all. We tipped well because of such a great attitude and professionalism from everyone. Hector, at the front desk, was very cool/awesome. He helped us find some good restaurants where the locals eat (which we asked for) and the waiters were mostly pretty smiley and attentive. Most people would remember you. They were good at that. HOTEL DESIGN The hotel design is great! It looks beautiful... more beautiful than it appears in pictures, and we were already happy with the pictures that we had seen online... It has a great beachfront, beautiful canopy beds on the sand, bright blue umbrellas, beautiful pools, a swim up bar, etc. They also had this cool/awesome tree in the center that had all of these lights/lanterns hanging up from it. We loved the coziness of the hotel. It was exactly the feel that we were looking for. Inside, the hotel room was decent... nothing too fancy, but we did book a superior room, which gave us access to a safe, robes, and a stocked fridge, which we could use for free, and which they re-stocked daily. FOOD The food was... alright... But we figured this coming in, having had such a great package (hotel/air/food). Most days, we ate at the buffet, which would have good food some days, ok food other days.... But they also had a snack bar, which had pizzas, tacos, nachos, etc. that were really good if you couldn't deal with the buffet, so this place is good if you're okay with food like this. Plus, the snack bar would be open until 2 a.m., so if you were ever up late and still a bit hungry... you could easily go there. Aside from the buffet and the snack bar, we tried one restaurant that came with our all-inclusive package, and that restaurant was called Terraza Grill... We did not like it all. The food just did not have good flavor. I don't know how else to describe it except to say that I felt like the foods people make at home taste better, so... I wouldn't recommend their "fancy" restaurants... Just the buffet or the snack bar. AREA This hotel resort is located in Playacar, a gated community within Playa del Carmen, and it is so uber safe and pleasant. We could literally walk on the street to their downtown area at the latest hours and feel extremely safe. Sometimes, I would even take out my camera to take pictures, and still... nothing. Very nice area. MAINTENANCE The maids were great. We'd come back to a well-kept room. We thought they did a great job! WI-FI Wi-Fi cost an additional $37.00 or so for a week (and less for however many days you decide to purchase it)... and you could only use it in the lobby... but I rationalized that for 7 days, that's about $5.00/day... and having it in the lobby kept me from staying indoors all day when... hey I can do that any day... Let's go out to the beach! **Anyways, I guess to say that, if you are looking for a reasonably priced hotel on a great beach that has a decent room and pretty good food... go here! We loved it. It's a slice of paradise at a great price. A great hotel for a great deal.

Reviews.Title: “Had a blast!”
Reviews.Author: kellieisluvnthesun
Reviews.Content: Loved The Reef! Beautifully manicured grounds~like being in a rain forest! Staff was excellent...always friendly and smiling and truly aimed to please at all times. Check in/out was a breeze. Beautiful beach, weather was great, too. Good food for a mid-priced AI. Good drinks and great bartenders. Just wish there was a bar closer to the beach that stayed open late. (they closed @ 6) Only 1 complaint: They never gave us any more soap after our check-in. Oh well, we managed with the shampoo! If you're looking for a small resort at a good price with not a lot of frills and a beautiful beach and over-all setting, you'll love The Reef! Walked to Playa Del Carmen in 15 minutes! Never bothered once by time-share people, either. That was a major plus!

Reviews.Title: “So many other places that are nicer!”
Reviews.Author: Karen L
Reviews.Content: This was a disappointing vacation. The campus is lovely, built around a natural cenote. unfortunately that's where the compliments end. The food was.... old. Like they just kept putting the same bowl of food out until it was gone. By the third day, or fifth serving things were looking a little rusty, too liquified, too dry or off colored. Drinks were light on the booze, so I asked for doubles. That worked.The rooms are a little beat up, but usable. Had to be careful the toilet didn't keep running and there was a crack in the sink so it wouldn't hold water.And yes, the beds are hard! The ocean was full of trash and my sister came home with an unidentifiable rash on her leg. Other hotels in the area are much nicer. Look around!

Reviews.Title: “THIRD VISIT TO THE REEF”
Reviews.Author: C0RNUC0PIA
Reviews.Content: My wife and I like the Reef well enough to return for the third time. It is not a high society resort, but it is more that adequate for us and a good value with an awesome location. We stayed 2 weeks and I will go back if their price doesn't go up, otherwise I will look at its neighboring resorts because I love the Playacar area. I have one minor complaint. The WI-FI internet access is hit and miss. They want $10 a day, which is a total rip off and then it doesn't work half the time, especially in the morning when the hotel workers are using it. One more thing for the managers of The Reef, if you happen to read these reviews and I know you do. You need to communicate better with your guests. Put up larger signs in multiple locations to advertise any events taking place at your hotel. You have a small sign in the lobby, but I think that is inadequate and not updated very well. One night you closed all of the restaurants and the buffet and moved all of the food up to the bar above the lobby and I think very few people in the place knew what was happening until they found the restaurants dark and abandoned. In summary, go there, just remember it's not a five star resort.

Reviews.Title: “Honeymooned there Feb 2012”
Reviews.Author: Vadster
Reviews.Content: First of all, if you are looking for a big resort with "crazzy games" during pool hours and "crazy nights" this is not the place! We had not known what to expcet as we came using our timeshare...but it was fabulous!!!! Its like walking into a rainforest :) and the beach is breathtaking :) food is great :) spicy though -we love Mexican food so we thoroughly enjoyed it. A few pointers: Rooms- pay for the upgrade Silver Honeymoon Package-well worth the money for king bed, dinner on beach, ect! Restaurants: Always eat dinner upstairs at the 2 restaurants, many people do not and they are always empty and happy to have costumers. The menu has a full 5 course meal that is of no cost (of course you can select a few dishes that cost $ but we never did). We alternated each one each night! Grabbing a beach chair w/umbrella: Get up by 6am and head there with towels in tow (bonus you get to watch sunrise and there is a continetal Bfast by buffet for you since u are up!) Transportation from airport: We paid for a private taxi- Cancun Shuttle booked through airports website ($50 each way). Didnt have to worry about a thing there or back! and it was private so no stopping to drop off/pick up others :) Pool Bar makes the best drinks! Dont pay extra for Premium bracelet, NOT worth it!

Reviews.Title: “Very rude time share salespeople.”
Reviews.Author: WGlenn
Reviews.Content: My family didn't stay in this hotel but we did a tour there for the time share sales. When we informed the sales person that we weren't interested we were passed to a rude man that told us we already received the gift we were promised, breakfast, and the taxi was leaving now. We were in fact promised a parting gift as well as breakfast and even though we confirmed upon arrival that the taxi would take us back to the hotel when we left it dropped us off at the edge of town. Very friendly until there was no sale and then we were treated like dirt, I wouldn't recommend staying here at all.

Reviews.Title: “Second time at the Reef”
Reviews.Author: joann g
Reviews.Content: This was our second time at the Reef. As much as we love it, this year was a bit different we are assuming due to the new ownership that took place 7 months ago. Our check in was not as smooth as last year. This time the desk personnel seemed a bit clueless. They did not offer a room safe, we had to ask for it. There was a phone message in our room on the second day and they were no help getting it resolved. The message was not in english. After finally forcing someone to come to the room to listen to it, turns out it was an emergency call that hit the wrong room extension. This took some time to resolve. The food is good, the workers are all quite friendly and house keeping did a great job with our room again. There are very few thing to complain about when it comes to the Reef. They created a VIP section where you can pay an extra $18.00 per day to enjoy higher end drinks but there were very few people in it. I feel they did nothing but absorbe quality beach space. Last year it was used as an extension of the beach. This would have better served as the place to hold all the pain in the neck wedding we had to endure. There were a total of 4 weddings in the 9 days were were there. Everyone loves a wedding but the rest of the resort guest should not have to be inconvenienced for them. For one wedding, the workers literally came to the beach and moved people with their chairs, towels, umbrellas and belongings and moved them off to the side because "the bride wanted a clear view of the beach and water". Really?? There was almost a riot on the beach. Some people compained to the front desk, but they just shook their heads like they cared, but you know they did not. Don't get me wrong, we love the Reef, but the new owners need to wake up. We will be back, but not next year.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: New York, New York, United States
Reviews.Title: “Had a wonderful, relaxing time!”
Reviews.Author: MikeG91179
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at the Reef from February 10 through the February 17th. We found the resort through Tippr, one of those deal sites and for the both of us for 6 nights, it was $1100. You could not beat the price. After an incident in our intial room (they provided us a room with no sink!), they moved us the next day to a different room that was much bigger and made us very happy! Overall, we had a wonderful relaxing week. The resort is not luxurious - but that is not what we were looking for. The grounds, set in a jungle theme, give the resort a character on its own. The food was great - we ate breakfast and lunch at the buffets, dinner twice at the two on site restaurants and two other nights in Playa del Carmen. On Valentine's Day, my boyfriend and I had a romantic lobster dinner on the beach, which was beautiful, with a saxophone player. The whole beach was set up beatifully and it really made our trip. The best thing we can say about the resort is the SERVICE. The service was great and friendly and everyone there really made you feel so welcome. A lot of the reviews complain about the time share people and while we did see them everywhere, they did not bother us once. I will say though that I wish the hot tub was accessible to the rest of the guests. It was in the "VIP Lounge", which was only accessible to the people who paid $18 per day for premium drinking. In my opinion, it really wasn't worth paying the extra money because the drinks were just fine with what they were serving. I would have, however, liked to have been able to use the hot tub. But, that is a minor complaint. If you are looking for a 5 star, luxury resort with tons of amenities then the Reef is not the place. But, if you are looking for a quiet, romantic, relaxing week with your boyfriend or girlfriend and you just want to eat, drink, relax on the beach or the pool, then this is the perfect place! I should add that my boyfriend and I are a gay couple and there were NO issues about that whatsoever. We were made to feel so comfortable, especially when we were on the beach for dinner on Valentine's Day. I would definitely recommend the Reef and would stay there again as well!

Reviews.Title: “There, got the stars right this time 4 star”
Reviews.Author: Diane499265
Reviews.Content: The Reef is not a 5 star and isn't pretending to be, either. It's a 4 star in top form. If you want booze in your minifridge all the time, an umbrella in your room, a really big standard room, specialty coffee included, go find a five-star. If you want a big hot tub, go somewhere else. Theirs was small and empty, likely for cleaning or something. It didn't look gross or anything, just empty. Our room size was fine, big enough to put down an additional blow-up bed for one of my 2 sons, but not much more. The bathroom was clean and everything worked well. Love that clothesline in the tub! Air conditioning worked and is thoroughly modern (has remote), but I didn't use it much, preferred the overhead fan. Nice little balcony. Our room faced the outside, and that was nice and quiet. There was a lawn and shrubbery that hid the parking lot next door. Inside lower rooms mean you get to do lots of people-watching on your porch. The food is excellent and you can go to one of the two a la carte restaurants any day you like. WOW, they are really nice! The Italian is a little more formal, and there is friendly competition between the two restaurants (they are next to each other). The buffet is perfectly fine too. It's amazing what these people have done with a small space. This place is on various levels and terraces and that sort of thing, and spaces are hidden from one another, making it intimate and interesting. I love the waterfalls and this beautiful relaxing central patio-thing that you can relax on and have treats/drinks at 4pm daily. There are many agoutis - we got to see a mama agouti nursing her baby. I wouldn't say the foliage is truly natural as it is mostly philodendrons on the ground (and trees) but it is rich and plentiful. The beach is lovely and big. It is very cool that we could easily walk down the beach to Playa del Carmen. Snorkeling was fine but way too busy, lots of people and groups. Sadly, the underwater flora has paid the price of all that use and is dying off in spots. The resort has two pools, both of which are nice. I liked the lobby bar where we bought specialty coffee in the morning. They have merchants in on a couple of evenings (the jeweller is charging WAY too much) but it is pretty and fun to look. I felt comfortable with the clientele here - there aren't the pretentious types who seem to need to act rich and snobby. People here were very pleasant and friendly. Lots of families with babies and very small kids, but it never seemed to be a problem. My sons (12 and 14) liked it, especially the ice cream and beach. This IS NOT a place for the type who wants to party hearty. It is too small and peaceful. A bunch of young men showed up right before we left and they stuck out like sore thumbs with their own boom box and taking over the bar. This is too small of a place to accommodate that kind of behaviour. I hope security was able to handle it. What security I saw were pleasant and diligent. All the staff were pleasant. I almost don't want to make such a good review because then everyone will go here and I don't want this place to get any bigger than it is or more commercial. I like it just the way it is, and will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Nice setting with some negatives”
Reviews.Author: NEtraveler999
Reviews.Content: We just got back from 7 days at The Reef. As with most places there were good and not so good points. First staff, mostly great with some real good ones tossed in: Jhonathan, Saul, Victor, Jose for example go the extra to actually get to know you. I am sure there were others but once we met these guys - we tended to seek them out. Check in: We arrived before our room was available, decided to get a snack at the buffet and a cocktail. We put bags in storage so as not to have to drag them around. The lobby 'condo sharks' were present at check in, and the concierge came right over to 'help' us. We blew her off and headed out of the lobby and thru out the trip we would walk briskly past them or alone. We never were bothered after that first encounter and we had a few cocktails in the lobby bar. So they are there and if you allow them to divert you from your vacation - they will. Just say No, gracias and keep moving. No calls or anything ever came so no harm no foul. One item on check in that seems to be prevalent is the computer systems. Not sure if this is a real problem or operator error. Getting a printed bill seems to be a problem. Our room: we tried for a higher end but got a king room with superior extras. The place was pretty busy and our friends did get the top floor double decks with hot tub. We visited and the room (1032) seem a little more cramped than ours (923). We had a small view of the beach/water and very large view of pool area. The room is a great spot for people watching as this sits right off the main route back to front. A little noisy with the workers and carts heading down the path to the spa area but not horrible. Back to our room. we sat on the deck for a good amount of time and noticed a huge amount of insects (ants running around) and then I noticed termite tubes on the main wooded post. These were active tubes and breaking them will show this. The post is in pretty bad shape, maybe why the units across the path are going changed to metal and glass? Beware do not lean up against these wooden rails you may take a dive. 923 also has seen some issue possibly from the tube on the third floor, the ceiling has been repaired and water damage on the wall is evident. Also if your getting a room opt for closer to the pool. The further up the path to the lobby you go the breeze cuts off and the apparent heat rises dramatically due to the jungle like plants. Beds: Yup they are a little hard - inspecting ours - looked like the pillow top was place down on the frame vs up. We left it was not a major show stopper for sleep. A small word of caution for those with young children - would be best to keep them on the paths and watch were you are walking. One day I came out of my room to see a staff member looking at something on the steps. Turned out to be a 2 ft Green Tree snake of sorts. For a smallish snake it had a big attitude, held its ground and was pretty aggressive. Mildly poisonous apparently. A little girl oblivious and not able to understand my english words of warning missed getting bit by inches. Also there are some ants around there that a big on bit as well. Remember this is a jungle like setting and there is wildlife around. Rumors of a boa on site were also heard. I am sure this is not an isolated event. It is the tropics and the Yucatan. We did purchase the extra bling (upgraded from blue band to gold) which gets you a little more. We thought it was worth it and it was short money. Food: The buffet gets a bit tired after a while. Breakfast was pretty decent wide array of choices. The upstairs grills were fair nothing special. The snack bar also was pretty decent. Just go easy on the cheese for the pizza and nachos...they tend to put on way too much IMHO. Downtown: is a short walk away. We walked it once then when going in the evening we opted for a cab. Try De Casa Del Aqua. Very good. The scene is crazy when the ship are in Cozumel. Go later in the afternoon. Beaches: I can not remember being on vacations and seeing a beach that was littered to this extent and with such a variety of trash. The PlayaCar resots should get this under control soon before it gets worse. It was not only our hotel but pretty much the entire beach. Some is from onshore activities (for example the weddings at our hotel) and a lot is being blown on shore with the tides/wind. Wear foot gear or watch your step - several people in the hotel got medical attention (iodine and band aid from the towel hut) after stepping on something. The water is pretty clean and was very pretty with the variety of colors. Bars: We went once to the upstairs bar above the lobby, it was not too late nor too early. We looks for a place for the four of us to sit and gave up as no seating was to be had. We had the extra bling so we would just go to our bling bar and always got a seat. At times we were the only ones there! The music, breeze, view and the attention was fantastic. Worth the money per day adder. Pool bar was ok, seats there are very uncomfortable. Lobby bar was good for people watching. One thing that seems to be a problem is stocking the bars. More times than not the bartender would be short of glasses, ice, mixers or did not have the choice liquor and we would move to a different place. Not a big deal but a stocked bar should be set up before opening to limit the bartenders need to run all over the facility. Summing it up: Nice place. Some negatives. Would I go there again, probably not but we say that about even better places - too many places to see to go to the same one over and over.

Reviews.Title: “Two weeks at the Reef”
Reviews.Author: Lilly003
Reviews.Content: First the bad... Our advice would be to forget about paying the extra for the upgrade to a superior room. We did receive a bottle of wine and free safe, but robes for only 3 nights of 14, coffee maker for 5 days, our mini fridge was not stocked and the upgraded amenities (shampoo, etc.) appeared only 1 day of 14. We tried more than a few times to have the issue rectified and complained again on check out. Only an apologie, so feel somewhat ripped off. Now for all of the good... A nice budget priced resort with a perfect location, beautiful grounds, and the best beach I have experienced near to Playa del Carmen. Although I had read many reviews with complaints about the food, beds, paper thin walls and the relentless time share people, our complaints would include none of those. The buffet restaurant had more than enough variety, if you didn't try to eat everything in one sitting. The breakfast buffet was amazing; especially the omelettes my husband ate every morning, freshly prepared by Maria. Unlimited visits to Boticelli and Terazza Grill should break up the monotony for any who tired of the buffet. The snack bar food menu wasn't the greatest but the tacos and burgers were tastey. Our king bed was fine and we didn't even need a topper. We also found the resort to be very quiet in the evenings. We had a number of children in our building and did not hear a peep, except for one night of debauchery by a few college age kids who were in our hallway.. and we must have flown under the radar of the time share salesmen...didn't speak to one! We did have the opportunity to meet many wonderful guests from all corners of the Earth, including Kathy and Ben from Montana. The jungle walk through the center of the resort provided sightings of opossum, mongoose and many agouti... loved it. I also need to mention we found all of the staff to be friendly, and helpful, especially Humberto who could line up the shots as quick as we could drink them. We loved to watch the specialty coffees being prepared served in the center of the resort each late afternoon. The location provided the opportunity for many walks to the eclectic and fun 5th Ave. in Playa del Carmen, and a couple of ferry trips to Cozumel. Would we visit the Reef again? Absolutely... just no superior upgrade.

Reviews.Title: “Going back”
Reviews.Author: itswhatumakeit
Reviews.Content: My wife and i stayed at this resort on jan 28th/2012 for eight days and loved everything about it, the grounds and beach are beautiful, the staff awsome , always smiling and friendly, dont understand other reviews about the food being poor, we have never seen so much variety, lots of different vegetables, salads, pork ,fish, beef--( prime rib three times in eight days), and we found everything delicious. About a fifteen minuete walk to 5th ave shopping, or seven dollar cab ride where you can spend all day shopping and sightseeing, you can also catch the ferry there to cozumel $26 per person return,lots to do and see there aswell, we rented bikes and peddled to money beach for fantastic snorkelling, word of advice- dont do the bike thing ,lol, we are lucky we werent run over, to much vehicle traffic, rent a scotter or mexican ferrari ( vw bug). We go on vacation every year and have been many different places, never the same place twice as we like to experiance different places and cultures, the reef playacar has changed that, this is now going to be our home away from home,shame on us for not remembering everyones name to thank them for a wonderful holiday, to mention a few- marco, carolina,jesus,paulino,rosy,victoria , you people are the greatest, see you next year. One last thing, we went with sunwing as we have in years past, never again, we will be switching to a different carrier, 7 hours 45 minutes late leaving toronto, pretty much stole a day of our vacation as we didnt arrive at the reef till 10pm and we were offered $75 toward our next vacation if used within a year, ouch!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Trip to Reef Playacar”
Reviews.Author: Mikesflyin
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed to vacation, the beach was a bit small and was just a narrow strip but that was the same as all the hotels in the area. It was a nice stroll south of the resort as you reach the end of the hotels and then it was just beach and jungle and perfect powder white sand. The meal in the restaurant was very nice with a candle lit ambiance. The pool bar was a lot of fun and met some interesting people there. There was a guy who had a small monkey that you could get your picture taken with as well as a guy with an Iguana. The beds were a little bit hard to sleep on, firmer than we are used to. It wasn't far to catch the ferry over to Cozumel and our visit to the Blue Parrot and Senor Frogs was a lot of fun. We also rented a car and drove to Tuluum one afternoon and that was a good trip.

Reviews.Title: “Good Budget Resort”
Reviews.Author: H2OS
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Reef from Jan 27 to Feb 10. I think this resort is a good value for the money. The grounds are beautiful as is the beach. The rooms are somewhat worn, but clean and comfortable. The waitstaff were wonderful, Humberto at the swim up pool bar, Gilbert at the open air seating at the buffet and Fernando at the front desk, all went out of their way to make our stay enjoyable and comfortable. I also received wonderful service at the Spa. I'm sorry to say I don't remember the woman's name at the spa who gave me an awesome full body massage. It was so relaxing, I scheduled another one for a few days later. The one thing that was depressing at this resort was the food. I have been to several AI's in Mexico, I never expect stellar food, but this was bad. I generally choose to go to town for dinner, when I stay at an AI because I like to experience the wonderful restaurants in a given area. In this case it wasn't a choice. In summary, I would recommend this resort, but don't expect too much, you'll be disappointed. It's a budget resort with a nice beach and great price. I was not unhappy that we chose it. It afforded us to be able to stay 13 days in a beautiful place at an affordable price.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect and just beautiful”
Reviews.Author: Ksenia S
Reviews.Content: This was a very great experience. There is nothing i can say, but good things about this resort. Everything was as perfect as we wanted to be. Clean rooms, spotless. Great variety of food. The jungle style is just unbelievable, makes it one of the best styles. When it`s hot you can cool off under palms and leaves. The staff is friendly and nice. We are going back for sure. Recommended to everyone, especially for a family vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Good little resort for the money”
Reviews.Author: Alyssa V
Reviews.Content: I am a 34-year-old female who traveled to Playa Del Carmen from Jan. 28-Feb. 11 (13 days) with my parents who are in their mid-50s. My husband was unable to get the time off from work, so he had to stay back in wintery Wisconsin while I caught some rays at Reef Playacar. First of all, if you're in your early to mid-20s and you're looking for a mega resort with eight restaurants and five pools, this is not your resort. If you're looking for a fist-pumping "Jersey Shore" party atmosphere, this is not your resort. If you're looking for four-star dining, this is not your resort. But if you're looking for a good deal (while airfare is through the roof) and you just want somewhere to chill by the pool or on the pristine beach while you sip on foo-foo drinks, this is your resort. The GOOD: This is the fifth time I've been to Mexico (once to Cancun, twice to Puerto Vallarta, once to Cozumel) and there is no doubt that this is a small, budget resort. Prices aren't what they used to be. It's difficult to find a decent hotel/air all-inclusive in Mexico for under $1,000 per person for one week. When we booked our trip (in October) the cost was $1,300 for one week, or $1,800 for two weeks (per person). We booked the two weeks because it made more sense. We learned while talked to other people at the resort that many were staying for two weeks because of the fantastic price. That said, you get what you pay for. People who are complaining that the rooms are outdated should consider the cost of this resort and compare apples to apples. The rooms may be a bit outdated (think Best Western compared with The Hilton) but they are extremely clean and a good size, even for three adults. I can't say enough good about the staff. These people work nearly 12 hours every day of the week. Every day. If I had to work 12 hours a day, seven days a week, I would be snippy and crabby and just a royal pain, but not these workers! I saw Humberto (pool bar bartender) deal with rude Americans (I am an American) and Canadians by being polite and smiling. And when he wasn't running his butt off making every blended drink under the sun, he was cleaning his work area or running around the pool collecting glasses. And it wasn't just Humberto ... nearly every worker I encountered was just as hard-working and friendly. Best service I've received anywhere, including my Midwestern hometown. For the most part the breakfast buffet is delicious. There was one day where the hash browns were lukewarm, or as my dad joked, "Just the right amount of cold." But overall, the omelet station was great and there is definitely enough to choose from. Put your toast in the toaster before you get in line for your omelete and it will be ready for you when you return. I was really impressed that you didn't have to pay more for the cabanas (like other resorts do) and that they were fairly easy to get. Typically we were early risers and were able to pick out chairs by 7 a.m. but on our last day we waited until 8:30 a.m. and still were able to get a cabana. Very nice. Manuel, at the ceramics stand, saw way too much of my family. We probably kept him in business the whole two weeks we were there. Manuel has ceramic figures that you paint yourself and then he puts finishing touches on them and glazes them overnight. You get them back the next day. Manuel is so talented, and we had tons of fun with him. Prices range from $15-$25. They make great gifts. The beach was wonderful! For someone who doesn't get to see the ocean on a normal basis, this is one of my favorite things to do. We walked down the beach and dug up sea shells. We swam in the water. My parents rented jet skis. There are no rocks on the beach, and although seaweed might make its way onto the beach because of wind, it didn't change my opinion of the wonderful beach and sand. The BAD: Although I did go down to the beach almost every day to hang out for a while, the pool is really my stomping grounds. The two pools were very clean, and I saw a worker checking the chlorine levels every day, but the second day I was there I cut my big toe on the bottom of the pool and it hurt for a good part of the trip. A few days later I cut the ball of my foot on the bottom of the pool. It's not an isolated incident and those tiles should be fixed asap. The pools are not very big, although that didn't bother me as much as not having a designated pool for the children. I love kids, but I wanted to be a little more relaxed on my vacation. Two times my mom and I were lounging in the pool (the swim-up bar pool and the other) and kids playing tag were almost running into us because they were so close. Not a big deal, but not really relaxing either. Many people have complained about the hardness of the beds. I didn't have a problem. My parents also slept fine. I don't like really soft beds though, so maybe it's a personal comfort thing. The lobby bar is a cash bar and it opens at 3 p.m. That's just silly. If you want a free drink you have to go either upstairs outside the dinner theater or to the swim-up bar. Again, silly. This bar should be open from noon until midnight and it should be free. The "Premier" bar, where you can choose to pay $18 a day to drink top-shelf liquor, is also silly. No one was in the premier bar, and really it's just a waste of space. Take that out, put the kiddie pool/play area down there and call it a day. The UGLY: I feel bad for this resort because it can't do a darn thing about people who drink 15 too many drinks and then stumble back to their rooms while screaming "YEE HAW" throughout the entire complex. Around 3 a.m. every morning we'd hear the drunks stumbling home. The "YEE HAW" lady sticks out in my mind. Every two minutes she would scream it while walking back. Dad heard commotion one night and saw a girl bend over on the walkway, and then dive head first into the concrete. The First Aid worker helped her out. It was kind of the entertainment for the night. I didn't mind it too much because I'm a good sleeper, but a light sleeper might have more to say. Dinner at the buffet was horrible. I wouldn't say this if it weren't true. I'm not a picky eater, and I can always find something worth eating on a buffet. I've been to plenty of AI resorts and never has the food been this terrible. :( I truly believe it wouldn't take much to make it good -- make sure the food is hot while it's being served, add spices, etc. But those easy fixes were never made. We started going to town every night for dinner, which was fun but very spendy! Playa has it figured out ... tourists = lots of dinero. We never had a dinner that was under $70, and all but one was over $100 (with drinks). If the food at the resort was better, people would feel like they're getting a better deal. Asking for things from the front desk is a waste of time. That's not to say that the front desk people are lazy or rude. In fact, they were very nice! But they're really not interested in helping out with amenities. Since we had three adults in one room, we needed three towels instead of two. It took three days until we started getting three towels instead of just two. We also wanted extra hangers and an extra chair for our third-floor balcony. And about half way through the trip the blow dryer in the bathroom stopped working. Mom made several requests for these things and accommodations never were made. Finally, while exchanging money mom asked if we ever were going to get what we asked for (chair/hangers/blow dryer) because if not, she would stop asking. He said no, and she stopped asking. Good thing I brought my blow dryer. I do have a few things to say about the timeshare people. We never were bothered because both my mom and I have traveled so much that we can spot a timeshare person a mile away. Timeshares are the biggest waste of money. They are a horrible investment. Don't believe me? Put your faith in Clark Howard: http://www.clarkhoward.com/news/clark-howard/scams-rip-offs/major-hoteliers-getting-out-of-the-time-share-busi/nDqN/ Now, if you read that and you still want to waste four hours of your hard-earned vacation on timeshare people so you can get a free appetizer at Coco Bongo, then go right ahead, but don't complain to us about it. And don't assume that because you said "no" 47 times to the timeshare sellers and they got snippy with you, that all the workers at The Reef are jerks. If you haven't stayed at the resort, you hardly are qualified to write a review on it. I've said my peace. OVERALL: I think this is a nice, budget resort with a great beach and fantastic staff. If you want to cure your winter blues at a comfortable, albeit small place, this is it.

Reviews.Title: “Just what we were looking for”
Reviews.Author: texascousin
Reviews.Content: Our multi family group of 15 stayed here the week before Christmas. It was a perfect choice due to the small size of the property. The front desk did a great job of putting us all in the same area with the requested bed arrangements. Being such a small resort, we could always keep track of where each other were. There was a good variety of food on the breakfast and lunch buffett and we always found something we liked.I liked the Italan restaurant better than the steak restaurant, but service was always top notch and the waitstaff really try hard to create a upscale dining experience.We all took advantage of the upgrade to the Premium bracelet. It was definently worth the extra $ Not only are your drinks during the day made with the better liquors, you have access to the "exclusive" area of the resort which includes a nice hot tub and a wonderful outdoor lounge area in the evenings. Armando the bartender could make anything and had alot of his own recipes that were delicious. Ask him to make his "electric lemonade"delicious! I mostly drank champagne though. Alex and hostess Carolina were wonderful as well. Our group also enjoyed the spa services. I have to say though, the evening entertainment wasn't really my taste but others in the group never missed a show. The resort provided bicycles to us at no cost and we enjoyed riding around Playacar.(It would be nice if they had newer bikes though)Very lush and tropical resort at a great price...don't except a 4 star resort, just a very laid back vibe on a beautiful beach!

Reviews.Title: “Staff Amazing!!”
Reviews.Author: crkirk
Reviews.Content: Staff are Amazing!! Returned from our stay at the Reef Feb 2. My son was married there January 21. A traditional Mayan ceremony which was very meaningful and beautiful! It was a wonderful wedding! The night before the wedding we hosted a cocktail party at Nico’s for all of the wedding guests. There were 56 of us. It was wonderful – all the details were looked after and it was a beautiful event. Elsy and Nuris listened to what I wanted and everything went smoothly. Thank you. Adrian was so accommodating and could see my vision. Caroline works so hard – what a gem! Martin and all the staff that worked the cocktail party were wonderful! The day before we were leaving I had an accident in the ocean, broke my leg and had to have surgery in Cancun. Rafael at guest services was so accommodating - our room was held for the extra days until we returned. Our room was on the 3rd floor, when we returned from the hospital they had a ground floor room ready for us, and a wheel chair. I was in a wheel chair as I couldn’t walk. It truly felt like coming home after being in the hospital for 5 days. They gave us a late check out the next day which was so appreciated. The food was good and staff amazing! Adrian, Caroline, Eric, Jesus, Martin, Gilbert, – there are too many to mention. The staff is caring and very accommodating - truly one of the best things about the resort. The resort is small and charming. The rooms are basic and clean. The beach is beautiful and you can walk into Playa within 20 minutes. We were not bothered by the time share people once! For all of the negative people on this site – stay away! When we go to book next time maybe we’ll be able to get the dates we want! If you want a charming resort with good food, great staff and a wonderful beach – this is the place! We will be back next year – can hardly wait!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful family vacation at the Reef”
Reviews.Author: Sadie W
Reviews.Content: As a family of 11 (with 2 children) we spent our family vacation at the Reef Playacar. We chose this resort because of the size, it's smaller and more personal, and dispite some of the reviews it's beautiful!! The rooms were a little outdated and the beds were a bit hard, but in general well kept and clean. We all loved the buffet, the breakfast omlettes were fantastic!! and the supper meals with the pasta station was fabulous!! The beach was very nice and clean and there was always enough beach loungers available, and we really liked the 20 min. walk to Playa Delcarmen along the beach. As for the activities in the resort, our 2 grandaughters went to the childrens play area once and they really enjoyed it, and one evening we really enjoyed the Mexican show, but due to the 3 excursions we booked through Sunwing (Alex) we came back each evening looking forward to lounging on the coffee deck, a great place to relax!! The overall apperance of this resort is great, there was always staff keeping it clean, and while we were there they were fixing wooden railings, pruning trees etc. and the waterfall & cenotes together with all the vegetation it gave a real jungle like feel. We really enjoyed it!!

Reviews.Title: “Skip it”
Reviews.Author: phils2cup
Reviews.Content: We went to the reef only scouting for next years winter vacation. We went were invited for breakfast and a tour. The place look nice from afar but that was it. The walk way wind thru the jungle. No breeze anywhere the wooden steps and stairs rotten in several places. Stagnated water in cenote and trash floating in it. Pools and restaurants very small. Also has to get to as it had rained and ramp way slick. We went both were ill after eating breakfast and spent the rest of the day in the rest room at our resort.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Property We'd Never Stay At”
Reviews.Author: Stacey M
Reviews.Content: We were reeled into this timeshare resort by promises of tickets and a table at Coco Bongo. We were staying next door at the Riu Palace Riviera Maya which was a wonderful place and we did a lot of walking around looking at other resorts to see if we managed to pick the best one. We had walked through The Reef late at night and the grounds were appeared very nice and somewhat private so when we were offered a tour, breakfast and Coco Bongo tickets in exchange for a hearing a 2 hour sales pitch we took it. We were very skilled at saying ‘no’. Their sales pitch was actually very weak and not quite as bad as we were prepared for. The tour during the day showed a different side to the resort in which the people staying there were subjected to hoards of people parading through observing them and the resort. The breakfast food was HORRIBLE and over cooked while the service we received was sub par for Mexico standards. I must say they did serve a green juice that was really quite refreshing though… when we got back to our resort, I found it was native to the area and served there as well. The lobby was busy with timeshare activity and the rooms we saw looked like those you’d find at the local motel. It could be from touring the place that the sales pitch was so easy to say ‘no’ to but once the manager came by to try to help our salesman ‘close a deal’, it was even easier to say ‘no’. She was rude and condescending to us and our thoughts were, if the management is like that to potential buyers, in front of other potential buyers – just what is the rest of the staff like to people who already bought. NO WAY!! DO NOT STAY HERE!! There are many, many other resorts right next to this one with much better service and I would recommend any of those over this one. Even the staff at the others (Wyndham, Riu’s, etc) were more welcoming.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay”
Reviews.Author: tahitijin
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our time at Reef Playacar. I was apprehensive because a lot of the reviews were saying that the walls were paper thin and they were woken up a lot. I slept like a baby. I thought our room was very quiet. Maybe we got lucky that there weren't too many loud people walking by, but we honestly had no problems. The food was decent. Nothing to write home about, but then again, for the price, nothing to complain about. The grounds were very nice. Tropical feel. Nothing like Fontainebleau or any of the big commercial resorts. More down-to-earth, roms were modest but nice enough. One complaint would be the water pressure in the shower, but we could live with it for a week. Another major plus was that the hotel was a 15 minute walk to downtown Playa del Carmen which was a surprisingly large stretch of shops, restaurants and bars. I like doing a half day at the beach, and a half day walking around town, so this was perfect. The walk felt totally safe. We did it everyday and at night as well. I would recommend Reef Playacar for a nice vacation.

Reviews.Title: “vacation fund/timeshare”
Reviews.Author: joe g
Reviews.Content: This is the most shady/frustrating exprience my wife and i have ever been so unlucky to be involed with the supervisor(Jerry) is as snakie as they come he is full of lies and twisted decieption and has a problem with just saying the truth nothing but problems with this vacation package if the overall rating system could go any lower i would have chosen it !!!!!!The reef is a beautiful place to vacation everything there is what dreams are made of except Jerry the snake so when you are asked to be part of this resort/time share reach back put your hand on your wallet/purse and run like hell!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Very average resort; nowhere I'd return”
Reviews.Author: ktyg
Reviews.Content: I traveled to The Reef Playacar with a group of friends; there were 6 of us total. We are all in our 20s-30s and were looking for a fun and relaxing vacation. We chose this resort from a few I had investigated via TripAdvisor and thought it would be acceptable based on other user reviews. And it was OK, but we all agreed that it was not anywhere we would return in the future. The drawbacks of the resort: Limited restaurants available on the premises and on one of the nights we were there all the restaurants were closed and ALL resort guests had to eat in the theater room and watch a mexican performance and eat from a Mexican buffet. This was a surprise to us and not a pleasant one. Additionally, the nicer restaurants (Italian and Steak) barely had the tables to accommodate a group of 6 each evening and would accept reservations for us. And finally, particularly at the italian place, you could order the same dish 2 nights in a row and receive COMPLETELY different dishes. This was very odd and offputting because if you liked something from a previous dining experience, you could not be sure you were going to get that again. Another drawback was that there was really nothing to do in the evenings. The outdoor "sports bar" in the upper level did not have any TVs for actually watching sports and the pool table was in very rough shape. The shows each night were not really our scene and there was no real entertainment nearby for us to explore. Additionally, the lobby bar was very small (6 seats maybe?) and the bartender was quite rude. For example, one of the evenings we were the only group in the bar and we asked him to please turn on the Brewers playoff baseball game and he first refused, but then after some negotiating (in spanish, thankfully a member of our group is fluent), he gruffly put the game on. And finally, the lobby and sports bar only served certain drinks and did not have any red wine available ever. Apparently you can only get red wine in the restaurants. And finally, our room was in need of a deep cleaning and some redecorating. The coverlet blanket had an odd bleach spot on it; the bottom of the lampshades were burnt (I will try to add a picture of this); the bathroom grout was very dirty and the bottom of our bathtub was dirty and cracked. We probably should have asked for a new room, but since we didn't plan on spending much time in the room, we didn't bother. The bright spots: I think there were 2 highlights to this hotel; the afternoon tea/coffee service and the ability to walk up the beach into Playa del Carmen. The afternoon tea service was as wonderful as all other reviews have mentioned. Unfortunately it rained our first few days on the trip and so the tea area was too wet to use, so we didn't get to have tea each day. But we definitely made a point to go each time we saw it was open. The bartender was wonderful and you got to have premium liquors in your coffee without a fee. The little cookies and sandwiches were tasty too. And, it was just a very beautiful atmosphere to be sitting under the trees enjoying a little treat. And finally, it was nice to be able to take a 30 minute walk up the beach to get into Playa. While we only did this once, it was a nice way to spend half a day. And it certainly beat having to pay for a cab. In summary, this resort was fine, but certainly nothing spectacular. Next time I travel to the Riviera Maya I will spend a little more money and get many more amenities at a larger resort. Reef Playacar was just too small and not maintained well enough for my travel taste. I prefer to travel to resorts that have more to do; especially in the evenings.

Reviews.Title: “Great place!”
Reviews.Author: allyouneedisthesun
