Reviews.Content: We were 3 couples (between 26 and 56 years old) staying at the reef for a week and everyone had a great time! AMAZING STAFF ( hi to Hector at the reception, Jesus at the pool bar and Paulino at the buffet ) BEST LOCATION (safe 20 min walk down to playa del carmen, 15min by the beach,) GREAT BEACH (always chairs and sun beds available, white sand and clear water..very clean:)volleyball, water sports...) NICE ROOM ( everything you need, very clean, hot water and good air conditioning, a lot of 2 double beds room so just stick them together ;) go for the second floor ) Over all The Reef is a very nice small cozy hotel near town, great beach, sweet staff, good food , 1 buffet, 2 restaurant(no reservations required but dress nice) quiet at night so its good to go out in town for a nice walk or 5$us taxi .. very safe !! (( just 2 details you have to pay for good coffee and also for your safe-locker in the room ..)) We would recommend this hotel for couples , friends and families anytime! would certainly go back:) Thanks to everyone for making our stay a vacation to remember!!

Reviews.Title: “Location Location Location the Reef can be that perfect Vacation”
Reviews.Author: VacationsSouth
Reviews.Content: The Reef is a Beautiful little Resort Hotel. We have been twice before. The location and staff should sell itself. This trip the Restaurants still had the Great atmosphere, good soups and salads but main courses where questionable. The Buffett was alway good. Water sports were good other than no booty boards this trip.??? The place has so much going for it. It's to bad they need that many timeshare people to keep it profitable. They put a very negative spin on our recent stay. So if you can stay out of sight of the Marketing group unless you truly want to know what they have to offer. You should have a safe enjoyable stay with helpful staff clean rooms Great beaches and booze or if you wish take that quick walk into town on the beach or cobbled street for the true taste of Mexico. It's all The Reef

Reviews.Title: “Average for a All Inclusive”
Reviews.Author: enjoyandkeepitsimple
Reviews.Content: Grounds are exceptionally clean and well kept. Concierge was very helpful. Bar staff are friendly and attentive (specially if you tip when you first get there). We were 3 in a room and not once did they give us more than two towels. We had to grab a few extra when the storage room was left unattended.(Maids don't speak English) Beds are quite firm. If you have a ground floor room expect to hear the sound of running water from all the other units drain out near your balcony. Not sure where it all goes and I don't want to. Sometimes the smell was a bit nasty. Food was OK but alot of things were either deep fried or swimming in grease. Unfortunate the neighbor has an issue with the Reef and to prove his point kept on playing some type of Asian Opera music through huge speakers aimed right at the beach area. OK if you like that type of music, but after a while it did ruin the peace and tranquility you expect from a beach resort. And yes, beware of the time share people. Eduardo in the Dining room was the best!

Reviews.Title: “Would we stay here again?..yes Are we going to?...no”
Reviews.Author: drumpoint2003
Reviews.Content: The good. The grounds at the resort are beautiful and well maintained. The staff was wonderful aside from the timeshare nuts in the lobby. There is a dive/watersports place on premise. You can get a hobie cat, kayak or boogy board for free. I would recommend the snorkel trip. The bad. We had to pay cash for a room upgrade when we checked in. The wifi is only in the lobby and is 10usd a day. So, if you decide to use it, you are stuck with the timeshare idiots who will not leave you alone. This is not cool!! The food is not very good. The two resaurants that are included only have two or three options that are not extra charges. I paid 17usd extra for a steak that was terrible. We ended up eating out.

Reviews.Title: “We'll be back - We all loved it”
Reviews.Author: junebug14
Reviews.Content: On January 14, 2012 ,14 Comrades from the Royal Canadian Legion landed in Cancun to go to the Reef for 1 week. I'm not sure where to start with this review as I can't think of any negatives. The check in staff were wonderful they realized we were all tired as it was around 10 PM when we arrived. The check in was speedy and soon we were all in our rooms with time to find the buffet and get some delicous food. Then off to Papa's Bar where we met Eric the bartender, what a wonderful person he is.His attendance to us was over whelming and alway knew just what we wanted and when. Jesus on the bar behind the snackbar has a wonderful way about him as well. After only speaking with him once and after a hour later as we walked up to the bar and our glasses were already waiting for us. The rest of the staff is just as charming Roxanne with her lovely smile every morning and afternoon made you want to come to the buffet for every meal. Mary was also very attentive. The rooms are spotless as are the grounds. Every day they are out working to make The Reef the best. The pools are cool but with the heat your looking to be cooled down. As you walk through the grounds you really feel like your in the jungle. We went to the Italian resturant for dinner one night it;s ok but we enjoyed the Mexican resturant the following evening the best of the two. The food at the buffet is plentiful with a lot of choices so no one would get tired of your choices. We also had the honor of watching a young couple from Edmonton get married on the beach. It was done in Mayan style and it was so beautiful to watch and we wish the bride and groom all the best. All in all when it came time to leave we all wanted to stay another week and will definitely be back in the near future. Thank you to all the management and the staff for believing in what your doing and doing it so well and giving us a great week at the Reef. Hope to see you all soon June- Toronto Jan 2012

Reviews.Title: “Stay away from their timeshare presentation! It's a scam!”
Reviews.Author: JustaVacationJunkie
Reviews.Content: We were lured to this resort for a viewing. We had a quick lunch with one of their employees and then shuffled over to the timeshare bungalow where we were passed on to another salesperson. The alcohol started to flow and the salespeople started to talk and talk and talk. If our salesperson couldn't answer a question, they would send someone else over. After two hours, they sent over an American, Gerry from Georgia, who tried to tell us what a wonderful deal it was. They had us sign paperwork but wouldn't give us copies of what we signed; we were told they had to mail them. They also refused to give us a phone number and told us that we would need to contact them by email. Well, guess what. What they promised us, wasn't what we got and we are out over 5K and have nothing and we are still getting phone calls from them asking for more. STAY FAR AWAY! These people are crooks!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay for the money”
Reviews.Author: ayvah
Reviews.Content: Our group stayed here for a week in January and had a wonderful time! This is an all-inclusive resort which has amazing service (thanks Franklin!). Don't forget to bring some money to tip these people as they do a great job! We tried one of the restaurants however the buffet is really the place to be for all your meals as they have a wide selection of food (however the amount of Mexican food selections are surprisingly low). There is also a snack stand open till 2am which makes awesome club sandwiches, fries and tacos. There are multiple bars around for drinks and they have a hidden icecream stand and 'tea and tequila' area which are nice. There is a VIP area that you can get into for an additional $18 with premium liquor and a jacuzzi. If you are going in to drink, its worth it to pay the extra amount as the drinks are surprisingly a noticeable upgrade (though the regular drinks are fine to begin with). The beach has soft sand but beware of some jagged shells. The water is warm-cool and clear. There are people that will walk around the beach to sell cigars, pictures with an animal or day trips but they aren't overly bothersome. The day trips that they sell on the beach are actually incredibly worth it, as we went on 2 all-day all-inclusive excursions for $65 each which includes transportation, lunch, and admission to places like Chichen Itza, and activities like snorkeling. This was a very relaxing place to come. (We did get a phone call on the first or second day asking us to come to the front desk, but once we got there we found out it was for a timeshare presentation. Simply say 'no' to the things like timeshare presentation or if someone is trying to sell you something, and they will leave you alone) Each room comes with a balcony which we used several times, but really, you won't be inside your room much. The city is a 15 minute walk away. For those traveling from abroad, USD is fine to use as currency 99% of the time (expect to pay around $30 in fees if you still wanted to switch to pesos). This is about a 45 minute ride from the airport (expect to pay around $50 for transportation). Great trip!

Reviews.Title: “We will be back”
Reviews.Author: Izalitta
Reviews.Content: 16 of us stayed at the Reef for 1 week last winter and had a blast, we all have nothing but fantastic to say about this resort. Food was great, very friendly staff (Jesus and Eric were the best bartenders ever). The resort was very clean. We will be back the end of February for another great time.

Reviews.Title: “I loved this place!!”
Reviews.Author: Alikatt62
Reviews.Content: I have to agree with many of these reviews. Smaller, newer, jungle like setting with the cenotes and little seregues throughout the property. Very Friendly staff, decent buffet, great snack bar and nice restaurants. White sand as far as your can see and the bluest water I'd ever seen. I loved playing in the ocean. But...I have to agree with the "Membership" Presentation. I couldn't pass up the the great deal but now I am finding all kinds of hidden set up fees that weren't made clear or even mentioned. All in All, I'll be returning. Loved that your were in a gated community but a 15 minute walk to the real Mexico.

Reviews.Title: “We love this place!”
Reviews.Author: sulha
Reviews.Content: This was our third trip to The Reef and we still love it. We spent Christmas and New Year's Eve in this lovely, intimate little resort and enjoyed every moment. If you like excellent customer service, incredibly friendly and helpful staff, and an absolutely beautiful beach, this is the place for you. We chose to alternate our evening meals between the 2 restaurants and the buffet. Every night we were impressed by the attentive service regardless of where we ate, (they really do have wonderful staff!) and the quality of the food. Breakfast was always a treat. We loved tucking into custom made omelets made for us by Victoria. The snack bar has the best clubhouse sandwiches ever and very friendly staff too. The bartenders were all fantastic. New this year was the VIP lounge which is right on the beach. Loved it! We are wine-lovers and were sometimes disappointed not all the wines on their wine list were available, but hey, we survived.:-) The wait staff went out of their way to find alternate choices for us. They were fantastic . . .so helpful. We have nothing but praise for the entire Marina crew. My husband got his scuba certification this trip and spent countless hours bombing around on the catamarans. This group of people are friendly, professional and provide truly excellent service. Kudos to them. The folks at the Reef do their best to provide top-notch service. If you want sprawling, opulent over the top luxury, maybe this isn't the place for you. But if you enjoy a smaller, more intimate kind of get-away that is perfectly situated . . .to our mind, this place is a terrific choice. The rooms and grounds are spotless, and should any problem arise, the staff quickly and efficiently remedy it. We've read some of the reviews posted here and are puzzled by some of the more critical reviews. If you look for the negative you will find it, I guess. But how can you complain when you are in a little part of heaven, in glorious sunshine and surrounded by stunning beauty and people who go out of their way to ensure you are comfortable, happy, well-fed and watered??? It's beyond us. We have absolutely no reservations in recommending this lovely little resort. We travel a lot and love going to new places, but we will be back to The Reef. It is the perfect place to relax and unwind, get pampered or party if you are so inclined. It has it all.

Reviews.Title: “Reef is very nice but watch out for the Timeshare Sales”
Reviews.Author: Steve G
Reviews.Content: I like the Reef. It is smaller than many resort hotels but is it close to the beach (one you can actually swim in) and close to Playa Del Carmen. The food is good and the rooms are nice through not as elegant as some other hotels. However, we made the mistake of going to the timeshare presentation. They presented a great program. We spent a few hours talking to them about it and various deals that were always getting better. Then came the contracts. I am afraid by then we were too weary to really read them. Now we find that they do not resemble what was presented to us. We have not decided what to do yet, but stay away from the timeshare operation. You will end up owning a little time in the Reef and more time in Elite Guest Circle which is worthless. You end up paying for what you get for free with Expedia and Expedia has a better website. A few cheap places but they are not that great. My advice, get you best deal on a room and don't consider the timeshare.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful & Fun!”
Reviews.Author: KISSA513
Reviews.Content: We went here for our Honey moon in January and it was absolutely perfect! We had never been to Mexico, so we were both very hesitant. Is area in Mexico was great and the resort was amazing! We didn't think we would leave the resort but we decided to take a 15-20 min. walk up the beach in to town, it was so nice went to town again while we were there. The buffet was really good and had different options every day. They even had two fancy restaurants that were included in the all inclusive, but did have some fancier food choices if you liked for additional cost. I would totally recommend this place & would love to go back again! :) .... oh! and p.s. the water/ice that they serve is totally fine! *bonus!*

Reviews.Title: “A very good experience!!”
Reviews.Author: Peter G
Reviews.Content: The staff was exceptionally polite and helpful, the rooms were nice (not that one plans to spend much time in them), the food and drinks were great and the views were completely worth the trip. I would recommend this resort to anyone from family with kids to couples or even by yourself. It is a great place to go and relax and have a good time! *Tips make your service a lot better though it is not required.

Reviews.Title: “wont comeback!!!”
Reviews.Author: Serene M
Reviews.Content: i would say that we had a goodtime in Mexico... staying in the hotel wasnt so bad coz we know how much we paid for the trip and know what to expect.. BUT be careful with their photo service.. they have people to go around with monkeys, couple parrots and iguana.. when you go pay photos check the convertion rate first if it's really the rate your paying... i got cunned by one of their front desk.. i was in hurry because our pick-up bus is coming I was just supposed to pay $50 US but they charged me $94... It was in Mexican peso.. I contacted the front desk Manager and told me they will refund it but never get the credit.. so be careful guys!!! for us we don't want to comeback here, and don't wanna refer to friends.. food always the same everyday... we've been to Jamaica and Dominican republic before but never encounter this... anyways, the front desk gave themeselves tip by overcharging their customer/guests that's my opinion..!!!

Reviews.Title: “I'm Going Back”
Reviews.Author: Lovecasinos
Reviews.Content: My friends and I traveled for the first time to Mexico and stayed at the Reef Playacar to celebrate Roger's 60th birthday. I cannot say enough good things about this hotel. Small, intimate, easy to get to different areas, great staff. The only complaint I had was that I found the bed to be very hard, but all I had to do was ask at the desk for a mattress topper, which I should have done earlier. Carlos and Jesus were extremely friendly. We are planning to return soon and this time stay longer than just 1 week. The food at the buffet was great.

Reviews.Title: “Our Favorite Place to Be”
Reviews.Author: DKopp
Reviews.Content: We made our 6th visit to the Reef Playacar December 2nd -12th and can hardly wait the 11 months until we go back. The Reef is a tropical paradise with one of the most beautiful beaches in the area. The hotel and all it's staff are great, and as "repeat visitors" we are treated like royalty. Roberta & Jade in Guest Relations are super. Always willing to help with anything. Hector at the front desk is great. He's got a wonderful sense of humor and is there to please. And bartender Jesus is #1. Always smiling and never forgets what we drink. My husband vacations to go scuba diving and loves going diving with all of the Reef Marina dive team. He said they are very knowledgeable & experienced, (not to mention a great group of people,) and he feels very safe with them. Our room was always clean and the fridge stocked with soda & water. Many people don't care for buffet dining but we love the buffet. The specialty restaurants there are very good and we go to each atleast once in our 11 day vacation for something different. I have read some negative reviews about this property but believe me... anyone who doesn't like the Reef would find fault in anything. In my experiences there, if by chance there were something I wasn't happy with, it was rectified with one call. My only regret is that I can only afford to visit the Reef once a year. Hopefully at some point we will be able to extend the visit from 11 days to 14.

Reviews.Title: “The Common areas were nice.....but that's about it.”
Reviews.Author: dawfogle
Reviews.Content: The common areas at the hotel area amazing. It feels like a jungle when you area walking through the main area the grounds. The pools were clean and the bar service was good. The food was average to poor, depending on where you got it from. Now for the rooms....they were AWFUL!!! The beds were hard, one of our comforters had dried blood spots on it (and they never replaced it) and our A/C and drain in the bath leaked the whole time we were there. When we asked to be moved to a different room we were told that the hotel was overbooked and that the rooms that were ava. were for the "timeshare" guest. Just horrid service. We had a small child with us and and when we asked for a roll away crib or pack and play for her to sleep in we were told that if they could find one they would send it up .....needless to say the crib never came and we ended up sleeping 2 to a bed with our children. Talk about a fun time, LOL. So, the pics of the grounds are accurate but the rooms are horrid. I will never stay here again as I like to stay in a place that is nicer than my house to feel like I am on vacation and this was certainly not anywhere near nicer than my house. Just awful.

Reviews.Title: “reef playacar december 21-29-2011”
Reviews.Author: 77johnson
Reviews.Content: My family of 4 stayed at the Reef, and initially had 2 rooms. We were upgraded to a suite, within a day. the grounds at the Reef are beautiful, and well kept, and the rooms were very clean. The AC worked just great. We only saw little bugs in the room on the counter if any food was left out. The staff were all very pleasnt. The gymn is small but suits the purpose. The food was a large variety. we would totally recommned this hotel, and would return. Jane/Canada

Reviews.Title: “Romantic and relaxing getaway!”
Reviews.Author: Kylee B
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Reef Playacar from December 8 - 12, 2011 and loved every minute of our time there. Everything was even better than we expected! We had a King sized Superior room on the third floor (we did receive a King sized bed upon check-in, per our reservation request). The room and bathroom were spacious, spotless, and nicely decorated. The bed was firm, but we found it very comfortable, especially after requesting and receiving a foam mattress pad from housekeeping. The private balcony was surrounded by trees and overlooked the sitting area where they serve coffee in the evening. The grounds of the hotel are incredible! Beautiful vegetation, real waterfalls, agoutis and coatis galore. At night, there are lanterns hung from the trees that give a romantic and unique glow. You really do feel like you're in a secluded jungle paradise. We were amazed at the beauty of the place (and we honeymooned in the jungle of Costa Rica, so we've seen good stuff!). The beach is expansive with that powdery white sand that you come to the Caribbean for. We had no trouble getting lounge chairs on the beach, and we usually came down around 8:00 am. The beds at the beach/pool area are a wonderful touch, too. The water is not perfectly calm, but it is that gorgeous blue-green shade, warm, and lovely for a swim. We took the kayaks out a couple of times, and had fun paddling up and down the beach. The food is perhaps the only part we weren't wild about. I'm glad we were only there for four days, as we probably would have tired of the food had we stayed much longer. We did like the buffet; there were plenty of choices, and we were rarely disappointed. My husband was not a fan at all of either of the specialty restaurants. I liked the Italian place better than the Mexican, perhaps because my salmon dish at the Mexican restaurant was still raw in the middle when I got it. It is true that for some dishes in the specialty restaurants you have to pay extra. The ice cream parlor is a fun stop in the day, and I loved their coconut ice cream! Playa Del Carmen is a 15 minute walk either down the beach or the road, and it's safe to walk even at night. A tip for getting from the airport to the Reef: Take the ADO bus! It's inexpensive ($10 USD per person one way), very modern and comfortable, and a nonstop trip from the airport to the Playa Del Carmen 5th Avenue bus station. Just find the ADO counter at the Ground Transportation area in the airport and order your tickets from there. There are plenty of cabs waiting at the bus station in Playa, and a cab ride to the Reef will cost about $7 USD. All in all, this is a fantastic place to stay, especially if you aren't interested in one of those huge mazes of resorts. It's unique, charming, well-kept, and more. Honestly, I'm not sure if the negative reviewers on this site were staying at the same place we were! We could not have been more pleased with our stay, so thanks to all the wonderful staff at the Reef Playacar for making our romantic getaway all we hoped for and more!

Reviews.Title: “AAA+Resort”
Reviews.Author: janet1140
Reviews.Content: This is a very beautiful hotel, right on a gorgeous beach. Just walking distance from Playa del Carmen. The staff.....Wonderful. The sales people......equally wonderful. If you say you are not interested, they leave you alone. But.....why wouldn't you want a piece of paradise like this? Trade for a vacation at an equally nice spot, or a cruise all for a guaranteed low price. No maintenance fees, Only pay when you use it. Everyone at this Resort looked Happy, including my husband and I. Thank you Reef staff, Dan & Janet, Winnipeg, MB, Canada

Reviews.Title: “Great Value Resort”
Reviews.Author: MDSunkel
Reviews.Content: I was at this hotel for a conference. I just loved the lush grounds of this resort. Truly spectacular! This resort really photographs well due to their bright colours. The beach is large and beautiful, but the water was too rough for pleasurable swimming at the time I was ther (early December). The rooms are clean but pretty standard. The spa looked incredible and there are lots of indigenous creatures to be seen which is exciting. The food and service was excellent at the La Terazza. The buffet was great, I loved that they had real Mexican food and a big urn of Cafe Mexicana which is my favourite coffee treat in the morning. Snacks at the snack bar were yummy. The standard alcohol is terrible, so we upgraded our alcohol for an extra $15/day. To us it was worth it. I do find it odd that they have specialty coffees avaialble for an extra charge, its supposed to be All Inclusive, if there is a charge, why even have it? Service around the resort is okay, everyone is pleasant. I would reccommend this hotel for Value travellers.

Reviews.Title: “Good bad and the Ugly”
Reviews.Author: Denise A
Reviews.Content: My husband and 4 year old son stayed here for a few days. The check in was ok. Our room was not the best but we did not need much since we planned on being out most of the time. The AC worked. The bugs can be ferocious so keep the patio door closed. We had some tiny ants in the bathroom. The beds were not comfortable at all. Wifi was only available in the lobby area at a cost. This is not cool in today's world. This made it very inconvenient to check email etc. The sports and entertainment committee was very friendly to us. The Kids Club coordinator was excellent with our four year old. The shows at night were at bit tacky but they did their best, it was entertaining at least. The service was always friendly and polite. The food at the restaurant was ok. I was expecting it to be horrible from the reviews but it was actually pretty good. The beach was great and lots of fun. There is beach volleyball, this was fun. The snack bar was acceptable, no the best at all. We chose to eat at the restaurant and not at the snack bar. The service at the restaurant was pretty good. Playa Del carmen.. town area is wintin walking distance, maybe a 15-20 min walk. It was nice to walkl around. The prices are very expensive. They give a card to exchange for a beach/pool towel. I guess they lose alot of towels. They are kind of OCD on the towels. There were three of us in the room with two bath towels. We did not make a fuss, since my son is so tiny. Overall we had a lovely experience. The guests here were mostly families. So no partying till 4 in the morning.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful location..but”
Reviews.Author: anniky
Reviews.Content: First I have to say I would give the resort a 5 star for its beauty, location and beach. The setting is perfect, surrounded by trees, cenotes and little animals called agouti all over the place. This resort is great if you are looking for a very quiet holiday without too much activity. Never saw anything going on around or in the pool. Did hear an announcement for beach volleyball but that was all I saw. We didn't even dip our toes in the pool since the beach was so amazing. We did request to switch rooms to a king bed which as another reviewer wrote, is not a problem. Our room was second floor and faced the garden and cenote. ||Amazing. The negatives I would say would be the lack of spunk at this resort. Would be a nice touch to have some mariache playing at dinner or anywhere for that matter. Barely heard any music at all. I think travellers appreciate latin music. The shows we saw were kinda cheesy and unfortuanately we arrived and left the day of the folklore mexican show so we missed it all together. Heard this is worth watching and they bring in professional dancers for this one. I must say the staff do try to make it the best they can but it is the same group of entertainment staff that work all day and do the shows at night so I think they are overworked. We were very satisfied with both the grill and italian restaurant. Not too much selection if you stay with what is included but very delicious. There is an ice cream parlour which is quite yummy, small cones but you can go back as much as you want. Between 4 and 6 they set up tables at the seating area beside the cenote and make coffee with alcohol. Its quite a show with the fire and spoons. They offer sandwiches and cookies at the same time. The snack bar and beach bar are amazing and so is Jesus. He is so great. My husband would go back after dinner to the snack bar to get tacos since they are only served after 6. The pizza was just ok but the fries were out of this world declicious. Buffet did get a bit repetitive but always found something good to eat. For trips we took the ado bus and went back to cancun and took ferry to isla mujeres. Rented golf cart and explored. It was amazing. Cozumel did not appeal to us too much and glad we didnt go since we heard from others that went that it is a bit of a tourist trap since all the cruiseships dock there. All in all, I would go back if the price was right (did see if drop into the $600 range after we booked) but would prefer a resort with a bit more activity escecially if we were to bring the kids. We did thoroughly enjoy ourselves though and the beauty of the resort is better than any 5 star we have stayed at.

Reviews.Title: “A dream come true!!”
Reviews.Author: Zenwilson
Reviews.Content: Just back from a week in paradise!! We stayed at the Reef from November 24th to December 1st and found this resort to be an absolute “dream come true”!! As our original trip date had to be postponed, I had lots of time to research resorts on-line and I kept coming back to The Reef Playacar. It’s price point and close proximity to Playa Del Carmen (5th Ave.) offered us everything we wanted and more. I’ll try to be as concise as possible although I could go on for ever about this hidden gem!! GENERAL INFO: The Reef is a small, beautiful boutique resort (18 buildings, 202 rooms), located in the gated community of Playacar. No vans or taxies get into this area without first having to go through a check-point to leave their I.D. Certainly gives you a very “secure” feeling. We chose to use USA Transfer for private transport to the resort and it took us 45 minutes from the airport to the check-in desk. I was told my other travelers that it took them almost 2 ½ hours to get there using the big bus provided my the carrier (this time would vary depending on how many resorts it stops at on the way to The Reef). After a seamless check-in the porter took us through sliding doors which open onto the most beautiful grounds with winding paths through the a lush rain forest, passing the “cenote-café” and waterfalls to our rooms. The property itself is set up in sort of an oval with the main lobby at one end, the pools, restaurants & beach at the other and the buildings (rooms) in between. Everything is within easy walking distance, NO golf carts or trolley’s required!!! Everywhere you look there are staff members tending to the grounds. They take great pride is making sure that all the paths are swept and raked. ROOMS: We were on the third floor and although there are no elevators it’s an easy walk up. The rooms are lovely, simple, nothing fancy. Two double beds, a dresser a table and chairs and a t.v. The bathroom was large and keep spotlessly clean! I loved finding a cloth line on the wall in the bathroom as well as an ironing board and iron in the closet!! The beds were very comfortable although a bit on the hard side. If this is a problem for you, just call down to the front desk and they will be happy to send up a mattress topper for you. The room was cleaned daily and mini-fridge topped up with soft drinks and water. We had a beautiful balcony overlooking the cenote-cafe. Great place to just sit and contemplate the beauty around you!! POOLS AND BEACH: The two pools and the grounds around them were immaculately clean. The pool bar was a hoot to hang around at, make sure to ask the bartender to make you a “Miami Vice”!! The “towel-game” was a non-issue and we never had any difficulty finding either a chair or a palapa. The beach is sandy, no rock issues and no water shoes required to get to or in the water. Great for swimming! No lifeguard so keep an eye on the flag for conditions. RESTAURANTS: We loved the food and the variety!! Carolina at the buffet is absolutely lovely, always a smile and ready with helpful advice. Never had the same thing twice and everything was delicious. As a “birthday treat” we booked at the Terraza Grill and the meal was fantastic as was the staff who really went out of their way to make it a fun evening! An extra perk that I enjoyed is that for those of us who are early-risers (to catch the sunrise) they always had tea, coffee and pastries set up outside the buffet between 5:30 & 6:00 a.m. It was VERY appreciated!! BARS: Although they were all lovely and the service was great, my favorite was La Chiquita. Special shout out to Carlos, he’s absolutely fantastic. Always a smile and a cheery “Ola”. He’d see me coming and by the time I got there, my drink was ready!! THINGS TO DO ON-SITE: Make sure to stop at the ice-cream bar. Their flavors are out of this world and it’s lovely to just sit and enjoy the waterfalls. -Don’t miss going to the “Cenote-Café” between 4 and 6. They make the most amazing flambé Mayan coffee!! They also serve lovely pastry’s and sandwiches. A lovely way to unwind before heading out to dinner. -Take advantage of the “free intro to Scuba” in the pool. A great way to see if it’s something you’re interested in. Tony was incredibly patient with those of us who were a little apprehensive. Very thorough in his teaching and by the end of the hour, we were ready to sign up for a day trip! It was great!!! -If you have an overcast day, spending time with Manuel at the “pottery kiosk” is an absolute must!! Making your own “Mexican Souvenir” is the way to go, and it’s not just for the kids!!! You pick what kind of item you want (mask, fish, plate, bowl), paint it and then, when you think you’ve created an absolute work of art, Manuel takes it away, “fixes it up”, glazes and fires it and then brings it back the next day. It’s not as easy as it sounds…after a few margaritas…it’s hard to paint inside the lines!!! Manuel is a lovely gentleman and has the patience of a saint with those of us who thought we were the next Picasso!! -If you forget to pack some reading material, there’s a little kiosk set up right by the first level pool which houses a little library of books you can borrow for the duration of your stay. Vey convenient! -3 or 4 nights during our stay there was a little “market” set up with various vendors coming on site to sell their wares. Very convenient, especially if you’ve forgotten to buy someone a souvenir!!! STAFF: What can I say, they were all great! From the check-in staff to the ground keepers, always smiling, courteous and helpful. OFF-SITE: Take advantage of your proximity to 5th ave. It’s an amazing, vibrant place to walk around, shop and just people watch!! Fabulous restaurants, bars and shops. A 15 minute walk or 5 minute taxi ride (aprox. $7.00) from the Reef. -Excursions: Chichen Itza and snorkeling at Dos Ojos Cenote with Edventure Tours (the review will be us soon on their site) Amazing!!! TIMESHARE: Although we saw them walking around, not one member of our group was approached. In summary, we absolutely loved The Reef. The price point, the location, the staff and the resort itself made our Mexican vacation a dream come true. We’re already planning our next trip in January of 2013 and The Reef Playacar is our destination!

Reviews.Title: “Wedding 2011”
Reviews.Author: Nikki_and_Ben1985
Reviews.Content: After reviewing every hotel in the Mayan Riviera, my fiance and I decided on The Reef Playacar as the resort we wanted to get married at. We arrived on November 19th (stayed for two weeks), and had a group of almost 50 people staying with us at the same resort, some staying for one week and some staying for two. When we arrived at our hotel, it was a very quick check-in for everyone that was in our group. This is the third resort that I have stayed at in Playacar, the other two being Viva Wyndham Maya, and the Allegro Playacar. The grounds are absolutely gorgeous, very lush, like a jungle, the best grounds of the three hotels I have stayed at. And it is extremely close to Playa Del Carmen (5th Ave) if you want to go shopping. Basically a 3 or 4 minute cab ride or a 15-20 minute walk down the beach. The food in the buffet was just okay to us, but alot of our group loved the food.. we loved the egg station for breakfast, and the pasta station for lunch or dinner. The fruit was not the best here, I found that it never seemed ripe enough. The snack bar was usually a hit or miss, but usually a hit.. We ate there the majority of the time because we loved the french fries and the hot dogs and hamburgers. We also ate at the Italian restaurant a couple of times. You didn't have to make reservations for it, which was amazing! It was delicious and had great service, but some nights it was extremely noisy and it felt like you were screaming to talk to the person beside you. Most of the staff were very friendly. We never had a problem with anyone at the front desk, they were always extremely helpful and nice. We had our 3 favourite bartenders that we would hunt down to get a drink. They were Santos at the pool bar, Erick who worked pretty much everywhere, Jesus who was usually down at the bar by the beach, and Alfonso the Spa Manager was great. My favourite drink is the Melon Sour, but probably 80% of the time, no one had the proper mix to make my drink. Then I met Jesus, and when he said he had no Melon Sour mix, he offered to make me something like it. From that point on it was my favourite drink! It had no name, but it was pink and slushy and tasted absolutely amazing! Every girl that was in our group starting finding Jesus to make the drink for them too! The room that we got was very nice, huge bathroom, lots of counter space, and a huge tub. We went into some of our friends rooms, and they would smell disgusting, like wet and mold, and just be filthy. A couple of our guests had to request a new room (which was no problem). The walls were paper thin, so you could hear every person walking up and down the stairs, slamming their doors, moving stuff in their room. I LOVED the bed. I slept better at the resort than I do on my own bed. But I LOVE the firm mattresses. Most of our guests did not like the beds as much as we did. The nightly entertainment was not good at all. It doesn't even compare to the other two resorts I have stayed at. We went to the 70's and 80's show one night, and we couldn't even stay to watch the whole thing. The best part of the show was when they played music clips on the big tv screens on either side of the stage. The staff didn't do any singing like the other resorts I have been to, it was all lip-syncing, and the majority of the time the staff had no idea what the words to the songs even were. And a couple of the staff could dance, but the rest of them looked like they had no idea what they were doing. The daily entertainment seemed almost non-existent. We played beach volleyball once, and then I never heard of any other activities going on. Unlike other resorts where they have dance lessons and spanish lessons and beach soccer and pool volleyball and water excercises and anything else you can think of. The Viva Wyndham Maya is definitely the best resort for daily and nightly entertainment. Staff would constantly be coming around trying to get people involved and to have fun. It was tons of fun at that resort. The beach was absolutely amazing. Tons and tons of chairs, no matter what time of day we went down to the beach, we were always able to find chairs. The pools were nice, the only weird thing was that the pool that had the bar in it, was also the pool that had the kids pool area in it. So when we would be sitting at the bar drinking, there would be kids running around screaming and splashing everywhere. I didn't understand why they set it up like that? We personally never had an issue with the time share people, I think they targeted the older crowd that looked like they had money. But we did hear lots of bad stuff about the time share people. And at one point during our trip there was a huge fight between a guest and a time share person. I heard that the guest was not given ALL of the information before he signed something, and was told that he owed them money, so he was furious. It's better if you just stay away from them. But you can't really tell who is a timeshare person, because they all have Reef Playacar nametags and look like they are just regular staff. So they will come up to you and take you on a tour of the resort, then an hour later you find out who they really are. Now onto the Wedding reviews....... I had been emailing Nuris (the wedding planner) back and forth for probably 10 months to plan the wedding. When I first emailed to find out about the wedding packages, I was sent information on the buffet choices, alcohol choices, color choices and ceremony choices. The one thing I would like to say is that they should work on getting more and better information to the bride and groom on their choices. There were a few aspects of the wedding that I thought were included in my package price, being the reception centerpieces, and the reception dance floor (if you are having your reception on the beach). I was never asked if I wanted to add these items to my quote so up until I arrived at the resort (4 days before the wedding) I had no idea that these things weren't included and that I had to pay an extra fee to have these things. That was the first thing to disappoint me. Then the night that we arrived (we didn't arrive until 9pm or so), after I checked in, I had to find Nuris so that we could have a meeting to pick out my flower choices. I had asked numerous times if she could just let me know the flowers that were in season for the end of November, so that I could choose them before I arrived in Mexico. But I was not allowed to know what flowers they offered until I got there. So after a LONG day of travelling, I had to meet with Nuris to pick out my flowers. And by that point I was grumpy and exhausted so I really didn't even care to think about wedding stuff at that point. I picked my flowers, bridesmaid flowers, groomsmen boutinnieres, father and grandfather boutinnieres and mother of groom and mother of bride corsages. We were told that all the flowers would be in my room by 2pm on the day of the wedding (the ceremony was to start at 4pm). On the day of the wedding (after 2pm), while I was busy getting ready, my mom was stuck running around the resort trying to find out why the flowers had not been delivered yet. She went to Nuris' office and they were all sitting on her desk, so my mom grabbed them and a stranger offered to help her carry them all to my room. Then my mom finds out that the father and grandfather boutinnieres are missing, so she has to run around the resort again looking for Nuris to find out what happened. Turns out that those two boutinnieres were never even ordered. So my mom had to wait for the florist to rush through the two missing boutinnieres and then bring them to my room. By this point it is already 2:45pm and my mom hasn't even started getting ready yet, so now she was in a panic as she was supposed to be in my room by 3pm for when the photographer arrived. We were also told by email that we had to pay for the flowers at the resort, and it had to be paid seperately in US funds. My mom brought the money for flowers in US funds, and when she went to pay, she was told that she had to go to the front desk and exchange the US money into pesos, because they would not accept US money for the flowers. This is ridiculous because we were specifically told we could NOT pay with pesos and we HAD to bring US money to pay for them. This was the second thing to disappoint me. I had also requested to Nuris that each row for the ceremony have 6 chairs in it. I later found out that my dad and a couple guests had to go down to the beach and fix the chairs themselves, as the people setting up would not change the chairs around like my mom had already asked them to. This was the third thing to disappoint me. I had asked Nuris to find 50 to 60 sparklers for me, so that each guest could light one and stand around the stage for when my husband and I had our first dance. We ended up spending $150US for 50 sparklers, and when the guests tried to light them, they didn't even work. So that was $150 bucks down the drain. This was the fourth thing to disappoint me. I had asked Nuris for the DJ's playlist so that I could see what type of music he had for the reception. He had no country music, so he told me to just make a list of all artists and songs that I wanted for the reception. I spent a long time asking family and friends if there were any special songs they wanted on the playlist, and I made a massive playlist of all of the special songs that I wanted played at our reception. When I went to the DJ to request a country song, I was told that he had no country, and that Nuris had never sent him the playlist that I had requested. I was extremely disappointed, as all of our guests are from Calgary, and love country music, and we didn't have a single country song to dance to that night. Instead of paying all that money for a DJ, I should have just had my ipod on shuffle so that the music we liked was actually playing. This was the fifth thing I was disappointed about. Originally, in emails, I had been told that the DJ had a microphone that our MC could use, and we could use it for all of our speeches as well. When we had our meeting the night I arrived to the resort, I was then told that we had to pay $200US for a microphone and speaker system because we were not able to use the DJ's. I was angry, but whatever, I got over it. Then, at the reception, the microphone didn't even work! It would keep cutting out, half of the speeches you couldn't even hear! And our MC spent most of his time wandering around the reception area trying to find where the microphone would work best. This was the sixth thing I was disappointed about. We had our wedding day planned 8 to 10 months before the actual wedding. We had planned to arrive to the resort the night of Saturday November 19th, then the Monday morning November 21st at 10am we were supposed to get our bloodwork done for the legal ceremony. And then on the Wednesday November 23rd was the ceremony day. The day before we were leaving for Mexico, I received an email from Nuris saying that the Monday when we were supposed to get our bloodwork done, was actually a holiday and she wasn't working that day, so now we had to rearrange all of our plans (and our witnesses plans) to change our bloodwork to the Tuesday, the DAY BEFORE THE WEDDING. When numerous times I had been told that they needed 3 business days between taking the blood and the ceremony so that the wedding could be legal. So I start freaking out thinking that we wouldn't be able to legally get married now because somehow for 10 months they forgot to tell me that the Monday was a HOLIDAY! Nuris ends up rearranging plans so that the Monday morning at 10am, we get our bloodwork done with another staff member, and our witnesses sign all the papers. Then we have to have another meeting on the Tuesday at 10am for the rehearsal and final details. Two of my bridesmaids were not staying at the same resort as us, so now they had to pay for a cab to come to our resort twice for meetings, instead of once like it was originally planned. So on the Tuesday at 10am, I make sure my entire wedding party and all the grandparents and parents are all ready and waiting for Nuris to start the rehearsal. I would like to add that the Monday night was our Coco Bongo night, so everyone was extremely hungover and not in a good mood. Once we find Nuris, she tells me that she never told me the meeting was at 10am, that it was supposed to be at 11am, but she will rush through to finish what she is doing so that we don't have to wait long. The group of us head down to hang out by the pool while we wait for Nuris to arrive. I believe it was around 11:15am that she finally showed up to do the rehearsal with us. This was the seventh thing I was disappointed about. The judge performs the ceremony in spanish, so we asked my husbands step-father to read the ceremony in english following the judge. He was very honoured but extremely nervous to do this, and he asked if I could get him a copy of the ceremony so that he had time to read it over and practice. Nuris told me that she would email it to me the week before we left for Mexico. When I emailed her back to ask her for it, she told me I could get it when we arrive. So when we arrive, I ask her for it. And she tells me that she can't get a copy until the day of the ceremony. He never ended up seeing the copy until he had to read it at the ceremony. This is the eighth thing I was disappointed about. Nuris told me I had the option of playing the normal 3 ceremony songs, or I could pick 3 of my own. One for the wedding party walking down the aisle, one for me walking down the aisle, and one for the end of the ceremony. I picked the 3 songs I wanted and emailed them to her, all with youtube links so that she could hear what they were supposed to sound like. In our meeting the night I arrived, she asked me for my songs, as I had never sent them to her. So then I had to go through all of my paperwork to find the 3 songs, as I wanted to make sure I told her the correct ones. This is the ninth thing I was disappointed about. I also sent her 3 songs, one for the first dance, one for the father/daughter dance, and one for the mother/son dance. I was told she had them all downloaded and they were fine. While my new husband I were dancing our first dance (and the sparklers weren't lit), the song I had chosen kept skipping and cutting out and starting over. Nuris went up to our MC, and asked him if I had my ipod because the first dance song wasn't working properly. He didn't want to interrupt our dance, so when it was finished, we were asked if we wanted to hook my ipod up and dance to it again. The moment was already ruined by the sparklers not working and the song not working, so I just said no it's done. This was the tenth thing I was disappointed about. I was told that for any guests that were not staying at our resort, but were to attend the wedding, they would have to pay for a pass. The $45 pass allowed them to come in just before the ceremony started, and leave as soon as the reception was finished, and they weren't allowed to get any drinks or food unless it was the wedding stuff that we paid for. The $60 pass allowed them to come in first thing in the morning and spend the day at our resort, eating and drinking and doing whatever they wanted, and then they had to leave when the reception was over. All of our outside guests wanted to spend the $60 so that they could come for the whole day. And my two bridesmaids were booked into the spa for 10am to start getting their nails done (which Nuris knew about). The day before the wedding, Nuris tells me that my guests that are buying the $60 day pass are only allowed to stay until 4pm, and if they want to stay longer they have to purchase a second day pass. I was absolutely livid because she knew the entire time that my bridesmaids were from another resort, she knew they had the spa booked for the day, and she knew they had to stay for my wedding and reception, but yet she never told me any of this timeline stuff before. I was not okay with making my guests pay an additional $120 just to come to our resort for the wedding, when they had been told months before that it would only be $60 and they were allowed to stay for the entire day. And it wasn't fair to my bridesmaids, because had they known this, they would have had their hair and nails done at their own resort and just showed up in time for when the photographer started. In the end, my mom and sister had to argue it out with Nuris until she allowed the guests to come for the entire day and night for the $60 she had originally told us. Then on the wedding day, all of our guests were still charged the amount for TWO day passes, even though Nuris told us they wouldn't be. So my mom had to run back to the front desk to get all of our guests half of their money back. This was the eleventh thing I was disappointed about. I booked myself and my bridesmaids into the Spa to have our hair, nails and make-up done, and I also got a massage and facial. All of my girls loved their nails and hair, and I absolutely loved my make-up, hair and nails. And my massage and facial was sooooo relaxing! It was the perfect day for me because it took away all of my stress, while my mom and sister (maid of honor) had to run around dealing with all the problems. The staff at the spa were amazing! The resort recommended we use Sian Photo (Christian) as our photographer. He did a great job, I was so happy with the pictures! And he delivered the prints to me 7 days after the wedding, before we even left Mexico! I was very happy with his work! In the end, it was the perfect wedding day. The weather could not have been better, the ceremony went off without a hitch. All of our guests raved about the BBQ Buffet that we had for the wedding. They all said it was the best food they had their entire trip! The set-up for the ceremony and the reception were absolutely beautiful, as we had it all down on the beach. The DJ could have been better, if I requested a song it would usually get played right away, but if any of my guests requested a song, it wouldn't get played, so I would have to go up and request it for them, as the DJ kept playing a bunch of songs that we didn't really like. And the staff that were serving for our wedding did a great job! In the end, after getting over all of the problems, it was a great day. I heard numerous people raving about how great Nuris was, and that is a big reason why I chose this resort for our wedding. I would not recommend this resort for a wedding, as I found it difficult dealing with Nuris most of the time. It seemed like she would get annoyed with my questions, half of the time not even giving me an answer. It all turned out beautiful in the end, but if you want to get your money worth, and not deal with never-ending problems then I would suggest finding another resort. If you are not getting married but are looking for a small and beautiful resort, I definitely do recommend this resort. It was beautiful, most of the staff were very friendly, the food was good, the beach was amazing, and I thought the spa services were great!

Reviews.Title: “Great vacation spot!”
Reviews.Author: pittsburghric
Reviews.Content: This is a great place to stay. It's more of a European vacation spot, less Americans than many of the other big resort's. Staying here is like staying in the jungle on the beach, it's really great. It has a nice boutique feel. The beach is great, rooms are nice, clean & the AC is cold. The staff are friendly & helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint and lush”
Reviews.Author: addicted2thesun
Reviews.Content: We spent 10 days at the Reef Playacar and after walking the beach in both directions we were very happy with our choice. The hotel is very lush and jungle like. Rooms: The rooms are clean and nice. If you are unhappy with the room given you can ask to switch. We had no problem doing so. The one thing we did notice was the rooms are not very sound proof. Depending on the location of your room you can hear people walking by or people in the next room. We were awoken a few times a night by our neighbour with a phlem problem. Not the most plesant noise to awoken by but not enough of a problem to switch rooms. If you value your sleep and want to spend your day sleeping in you may want to stay higher up or at a higher star. Staff: We can't say anything bad about the staff. They are all very friendly and will go out of there way to make you happy. Beach: The beach is the best part. Its clean and the ocean is very beautiful. nice calm water on most days. It can get a few waves if it is windy. You can walk to 5th ave from your resort in about 20 minutes. Excursions: We did our own activities. We took the ferry to cozumel and snorkelled at the money bar. it was a nice place but similar to playa del carmen so a bit expensive for what was there. The shore snorkeling wasnt great as we saw more fish in Akumal We took the collectivo to Akumal for 30 pesos ($2) and snorkelled at the bay with the turtles. It was amazing. We went back taking a taxi there because we had walked back and forth into town countless times. It was our last day there so we splurged on a taxi. We narrowed it down to $20 with the taxi and paid the same on the way home. Its a must do! Why we would reccomend it: - it is a nice quiet resort. There aren't entertainment staff trying to get everyone involved in activities. They dont blast the same music on the beach so you can listen to the ocean - its a quick walk into town - Its simply a beautiful resort -staff and very friendly and nice. They have internet available at the resort for 60 minutes it is about $10. The computers were down one day and the technician wasnt able to come in. They let us use one of the hotels computers to send an email without us even asking. We were very happy with this as it was our last day and needed to send an email.) Things to do: -GO TO AKUMAL -piola is a quaint restuarant at about 36 or 38 calle off to the right of 5th ave. it has the best pizza and service. try the sangria! you can read reviews about it on trip advisor -fussion is a good place to hear live music on the beach. Service is slow so dont expect it to be fast. - veronica's massage is great. $33 dollars for a 60min message that is very proffessional and private. its not on the beach but very legite -Always confirm a taxi's price before you get in. if you arent satisfied with the price you are given in a taxi or shop try to barter them down. If it doesnt work start to walk away and they will call you back. If the taxi doesnt give you the price wait a minute and another one will come by.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful holiday in Playacar”
Reviews.Author: ccchicasf
Reviews.Content: Tropical/ jungle paradise. This resort is not the ritz but a family friendly tropical oasis. The service was a bit of hit or miss depending on the person you interacted with. The cleaning staff was nice and helpful. We had a superior room on the third floor which included a king size bed, minibar and huge tub. The balcony was unsafe for a small child so we did not use it much. The breakfast buffet was my favorite, the cooked to order Mexican dishes were great. The snack bar was available from 11 am to 2am which had a decent burger and club sandwich. The drinks from the bar were ok, somewhat watered down. Definitely bring an insulated cup to keep your drinks cold. Although the resort was pretty full for the holiday week it was easy to get chairs both by the pool and beach. The wifi fee was a bit high for something that should be free and it only worked in the lobby, also note the fee is per device so it can add up if you have multiple phones, iPad or computer. The taxi ride to Quinta is 70 pesos which is a bit steep since it's less than 5 mins away. Overall this resort is a great value and we would definitely stay here again. A couple negatives to be aware of, the sales people can be a bit pushy, overheard some of the sales folks at the restaurant laying it on thick, reminded me of a used car salesmen. Also smoking can be a bit of an annoyance since folks can smoke anywhere, some days not a bother and some days overwhelming.

Reviews.Title: “Returning to the Reef in January 2012”
Reviews.Author: Denise D
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Reef nine times. After taking a few years off and exploring other places, we have decided to return to our "home away from home" because as they say, there is no place like home. The rooms are always comfortable and clean, the food is great, the grounds are gorgeous, and the best part is the amazing staff that has treated us so well over our many visits. It is the staff that keeps drawing us back to the Reef. We feel like family! We are counting the days until January 23 when we reunite with our Mexico friends. Hola, Marja!!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome +”
Reviews.Author: Don G
Reviews.Content: This may have been one of the best vacations we have taken, the beach/animacion staff was more then anyone could expect . Room was very nice and food was also . THe hotel is about a five minute taxi ride to 5th avenue which is nice to shop and get a bite to eat. We went to Coco bongos with staff for my birthday and was a night to remember, (you need to go at least once for the expeirence-check youtube for videos) . The beach is good and as well as activities. At night the staff usualy puts on a show, alot of fun and they put alot of effort in to it. The bartenders are great and drinks good.We can not wait to go back , met alot of great people . The vacation would not be the same without these people , Jesus ,Jonathon ,Sara,Alajandro ,Jesus the bartender ,Jose the bartender ,Oskar ,Raul,Zouhaila. I thank them all

Reviews.Title: “First time to Playa Car”
Reviews.Author: travelerabroad79
Reviews.Content: This all inclusive resort was wonderfully tended to by all the staff. Everyone made sure we had everything we needed and made sure we were enjoying ourselves. The staff is very interactive and energetic. Bar tender was top notch.

Reviews.Title: “Fun for all the family”
Reviews.Author: Claire G
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Ambience Set up like a Mayan village in the jungle, several three story buildings with Palapa type roofs for the hotel rooms, recommend the second or third floor and near the pool. Quiet hotel, nice that the evening bar is away from the rooms. Love the winding paths through the lush green tropical setting, the cenotes, waterfalls and at certain times of day seeing the Cereques. Evening lighting is gorgeous, lanterns hanging from the trees and on the beach when they have the impromptu barbeques and dinners. the Martini bar is set in the middle of the hotel under these lit up trees, the ice cream palour our kids loved too set near the waterfall and cenote. This hotel is right on the beach which is awesome, we switched from pool to beach and loved both, plently of loungers and beds with linen curtains, staff were always cleaning up empty glasses and plates so it was kept pretty clean. Can't wait to see what the beach bar will look like when it is finished! The room First room was great location - 2nd flr, quiet room, but air-conditioner broke and dripped all night, it was quickly resolved but I honestly think my husband's quick thinking to video the leaking helped. We were given a much nicer room close to the pool and had a ocean view. Gorgeous, clean and quiet, apart from the jungle like noises of the birds at certain times - but we liked that. The water does smell a bit funky,gasey but that could just be how it is down there, after the first couple of days you get over it. Yes the beds are firm but that's how I like them. Food Restaurants were good for the price we paid and staff were for the most part attentive. The Buffet was way better than I anticipated, I loved getting my custom made omelet in the mornings - Victoria was a pro. Our kids loved the pancakes and fresh pastries, my husband, the Huevos Rancheros and I loved the fresh fruit and yoghurts too. Carolina was a great host at the buffet as were our waiters Paulino who just smiled all the time, Gilbert, Servando and Mary. Lunch was also Buffet or Snack bar, we tried the snack bar the first few days but kept going back to the buffet. The Snack bar is good for pizza and hot dogs but did not like the wings there. We like the Terrazzo and the Italian restaurant was good but not amazing like some of the reviews, hard to compete with restaurants in San Francisco though, so good for the price we paid. One word of advice, ask for the price in Pesos for the wine by the bottle and make sure when you sign the bill that night that it is in Pesos, we forgot to do this one night and at check out were charged the extra $7 (US) for the price difference. Our waiters were great - Franklin, Eric and Guilarno. We had a pretty good Salmon dish one night, the chicken was a bit dry but the bruscetta was awesome as was my daughter's pasta with pesto. Bars The bars were good, we stuck to mainly the beers and margaritas, the white wine was terrible but the red good - once you got used to drinking it cold! The bars were the buffet bar, the swim up pool bar, the snack bar drinks bar, the lobby bar and the Palapas Bar by the Theatre at the front of the hotel, with pools tables, fooseball table and giant chess. This is the one that is open the latest. otherwise bar times were fine but did not really reflect the times that were advertised - the beach bar was never open til 7pm as it said it was but it was not really a problem, we asked for drinks to go after dinner and took them to the beach or back to our room. Entertainment We didn't really go for, so can't comment there. There was supposed to be some Lion King show one night but we went up there and there was a wedding reception instead. We really got to know about things that were going on by the entertainment staff on the day; i.e. the beach buffet one night, the barbeque on the beach another lunchtime so that was ok. Towels - the girl at the towel desk by the pool was very rude, we got there dead on 5pm one day and she refused to take our wet towels (despite there being a pile there) said that we had to return them to the reception as they were closed at 5 (it was about 5 minutes after), another time she wouldn't give me ping pong paddles as she said they were closed, at 5pm, also told us to go to the front desk. Twice the front desk said they had paddles but no balls! Not much good to us then. But other than her everyone was friendly. Word of warning - do not leave your towels - one of ours was stolen and the hotel wanted to charge us $35 for it, we refused and they were ok but after that we were more careful. Also when we checked out they tried to charge us for 4 towels that we had returned, someone said to us - "welcome to Mexico" - so I guess that is just how it is and you have to check everything before paying! All in all despite some issues our first family vacation here was good. Lastly, listen to the travel reps, do not waste half a day listening to the vacation club/time share stuff (there is alot at this hotel) and if you go to Cozumel - rent a car from a reputable company. Extra stuff Tulum is great but go by local bus, Xcaret is a must for families, snorkelling in Cozumel very cool too.

Reviews.Title: “Another fun trip to Playa..........”
Reviews.Author: Sandee16
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Reef Playacar Nov 11-19. Booked on Travelocity and had my transfers though Olympus. My first impression of the resort is that it’s very lush, and very well kept grounds. I really enjoyed the jungle like feel of the resort. You felt like you were in Costa Rica. After changing our room 3 times we finally got a great room on the 3rd Floor in Building 15. The 1st room was ground floor facing the Riu I believe in Building 1. We felt like we were in the basement and there was also construction going on in the room next to us. Front desk was accommodating to switch us to another room but again it was ground floor but facing the lush greens. I prefer the 2nd or 3rd floor so we stayed in the second room that night and then by noon the next day we got the 3rd floor room. Room was perfect and patio was private which we liked . Front desk was helpful. Beach is beautiful and never had a problem finding a chair at the beach or the pool. Buffet was good and we always found something we liked. The snack bar was pretty good as well. All the bars were great as well as the service. The bartenders work hard so please Tip ! They deserve it! When we go away I go to the bank and get $70 in singles. It comes in handy when you tip the maid and bartenders. Even the cooks at the snack bar. Specialty restaurants are just ok… We went to the Terrza Grill and it was nice to get dressed up but we were in and out of the restaurant in 40 min. Very limited menu. Did not eat at the Italian restaurant… I heard it was not worth it. My suggestion would be venturing out and having a nice dinner in town. We had dinner at Xulam and it was out of this world!! It is 100% worth going to. Best service I have ever received. Now I know why it #1 on TA. Location of this resort was a big attraction to me. It is a 15 min walk into town. Also if you walk out the back of the hotel and where the hammocks are, take that road into town. It’s a nice walk and a bit shorter. Some really nice houses too. The gym was the only downfall to this resort. It smelt terrible and would be scared to contract ring worm or something from the machines. Smelt and looked dirty. Yes gyms do have that smell but this was over the top. As for the spa I had a spa appointment but canceled it,. The massage room also smelt funky. It’s not like a traditional spa at a hotel. It’s just a room where they massage you. That is the only negative was gym and spa. I would recommend this hotel and may even stay here again next year. Stayed at the Viva Wyndham the year before that and really liked it, nice beach, food, and great spa but was a little further walk into town and not as nice of grounds.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice and quiet”
Reviews.Author: RedshoesMontreal
Reviews.Content: I was travelling on my own this time so I wanted a small quiet hotel. Got exactly what I was looking for. Small hotel (200 rooms) clean, with wonderfull gardens, great friendly staff and a beautiful beach. The room was comfy, the bed was very good and I was facing the garden and the lounge and it was very quiet. There were plenty of chairs to choose from on the beach and around the pool, and a few lounge beds with white cotton drapes. Very nice and comfortable. You can take long walks on the beach and Playa Del Carmen is 15 minutes in walking distance. The food was good but I went for diner in Playa Del Carmen mosts nights. There are lots of very good restaurants to choose from out there. Vacation timesharing concierge. They will grab you as soon as you get to the hotel to do your check-in under a "Concierge" identity. If you are not interested, just decline politely, and I found that even if they were insisting a bit on giving me gift certificates and that it would cost me nothing to listen, they were respectfull as I firmly said I was not interested. To the hotel managers, one delicate thing: The hotel plays a selection of music by the pool, and it's very nice and relaxing in the morning and a little more upbeat in the afternoon wich is great. The only thing is that some people will bring their own music to the beach or pool, and play it on speakers rather than earphones. At one point I was stuck between Bob Marley playing by the pool, classical playing to the right and hi-hop playing to the left. If everybody starts playing their own music, the place will not be as relaxing as it is at the moment! ;-) All in all, it was a great relaxing vacation with people from different countries, great staff and I would definatly go back!

Reviews.Title: “Veryyyyyyyyy disappointing!!! First time to Mayan-usually go to Huatulco or mazatlan”
Reviews.Author: Calgary17
Reviews.Content: I want to first say that this is NOT the first time we have travelled to mexico BUT it is the first time to the Mayan. Wowwwwwwwww what a disappointment. Very rude staff!!! Even more rude when you turn them down for their TIMESHARE deal. They lie to you upon your checking in and tell you that its NOT a timeshare and that they just want to show you their "suites". Wow---why not be honest!!! Nobody helped us to our room (rooms are not easy to find here) nor did they help us with our luggage to our room. Air conditioner did not function properly and was very loud. We called maintenance and they came 3x and each time they did nothing (literally nothing) and said they would be back in a moment however they never did come back nor did they fix the air conditioner. We asked at the front desk how much it was to call local phone numbers since we needed to make arrangements for our wedding and they quoted us 70 cents per call and then when we checked later they were charging us 3.00 U.S for 2 calls. ??? The resort does NOT offer FREE WI FI--really??????? nope you had to pay 12.00 U.S per day. How ridiculous. If you wanted specialty liquor you had to pay xtra for that. If you wanted specialty coffees you had to pay xtra for that. No poolside or beachside service AT ALL. 1 buffet with less than average food. I can honestly say though the veggies (particularly the beets and corn) were good. Everything else was not great. Service here as well was veryyy poor. Always having to find a waiter/waitress to ask for coffee. Try locating bottled water--again, wow!!! Stuff was like gold there--the bars didn't want to give it out or said they didn't have. I would NOT EVER recommend this resort to anyone. I would go to the mayan again but i would spend more $ and stay at another resort. The people here seriously are so rude and not friendly. Even if you do throw them some U.S $ it doesn't help any. Very odd!!!!! I just want to be extremely honest and let people know BEFORE they make the mistake of booking this resort. Seriously, the RIU is right next door as well as there are several others within walking distance--i would recommend checking those out. We did speak with someone there that had stayed at the Blue Bay and they said the food and service there was fantastic and they too were dissatisfied with the REEF. I was just so glad that the resort never answered any of my emails when i was inquiring about getting married at this resort because i ended up hiring a wedding planner from local and we married AWAY from the resort thank goodness for that cause it was perfect.

Reviews.Title: “speechless”
Reviews.Author: Olivia S
Reviews.Content: I LOVE JOSE. sweetest waiter ever. The resort was absolutely beautiful, and the wedding i was in was the most beautiful wedding ive ever attented! love love love love. the food was great, awesome view, could pet a new animal everday. great

Reviews.Title: “Unique, friendly, and wonderful family vacay spot!”
Reviews.Author: ymyoh
Reviews.Content: Went for small family wedding Nov 8 --13. Excellent value is the bottom line at The Reef. Unique because resort has two environments with a literal rain forest and exotic pathway through the three story complexes of rooms and then gorgeous pool/beach vistas where the buffets and other community areas are found. Staff was hard working and friendly and everything was clean, tidy and well kept. I loved the size which was not overwhelming and we could gather together, or not, with ease. Nightly entertainment was spotty but the one night of the Folkloric Ballet of Mexico was worth it all. LIked that the pool area was quiet and music/ambiance was not overpowering. Great relaxation, enjoyment and family fun. Nice mix of euro clientele, older couples and not too many kids.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Honeymoon Considering...”
Reviews.Author: Erin B
Reviews.Content: We had a fabulous honeymoon at The Reef- especially considering the few downfalls we had... It rained 5 of the 7 days we were there, we had a "food mixup," and it took forever to get our fridge stocked daily... but overall, I would still go back! STAFF: The Reef Staff were all very friendly and accomodating. I have to give special notice to Felix (the pool bartender) and Charlie (the photographer), they made our stay even that more delightful! They went above and beyond to make us feel welcome! The entertainment/activities staff were also very welcoming and friendly! There were always activities going on if you were interested... ATMOSPHERE: The resort is absolutely beautiful- with it's jungle-like atmosphere and the fabulous beach, you really can't go wrong with the ambiance... FOOD: The food was just average. Don't get me wrong, the food at the buffet tasted good (especially the Omelet Station and the Pasta Station- YUM!), but the buffet would've been great if they had more of a variety from day-to-day. The snack bar food was delicious (nachos, hamburgers, french fries, etc...) if you like more "American" food. I wouldn't recommend the Italian restaurant if you are allergic to seafood (every dish seems to have seafood in it). My husband was given mussels in his dish, told them he was allergic to seafood so they returned it, but then they came back and after eating some of it, he realized there were still mussels in it!!! I will say however that the restaurant manager and his boss were very quick to remedy the situation when they offered us upgraded meals and eventually a room discount. The Grill/Steakhouse was absolutely fantastic! The steaks were delicious, the soup and salad was excellent, and the dessert was too die for! SERVICE: The service was generally very fast and friendly; with the exception of trying to get our room fridge stocked daily... That was like pulling teeth. It took several phone calls every day/night to get someone to come and restock our fridge. BUT- considering all of the other great service, we could live with that... I mean, there were free drinks a few feet away from our building at the pool bar or restaurant, so we didn't let that bother us too much. THE DOWNSIDE: The most annoying and worst part of the hotel/resort are the timeshare people. They are everywhere! And contrary to what others have said, they did not leave us alone after we told them "no thankyou!" They hounded us every day and then got an attitude when we didn't agree to do their presentation. If they would've kindly let us go about our business, the experience would've been much more pleasant. OVERALL: I would definitely go back to The Reef. I would try to get a similar room as we had, I would avoid the timeshare people like the plague, I would skip the Italian restaurant, and I would also make sure to make time for "other activities." And next time (since we won't be on our honeymoon) I'll be sure to check out the "nightlife" and entertainment. We're sorry we missed that. While we were there, we did a lot of "side excursions" that I would highly recommend: Xplor (ziplines, cave swimming, rafting, and ATVs) was amazing and totally worth the money, and swimming with the Dolphins at Delphinus was a once in a lifetime experience- while it was a little spendy (the pictures were outrageous), I wouldn't trade it for the world. We also went parasailing which was (again) completely worth the money and was unbelievably fun; and lastly, we got a couples massage down on the beach which was out of this world! I would recommend any of these things to anyone staying in the area- it made our experience that much more incredible!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel with great staff”
Reviews.Author: Anthony L
Reviews.Content: Our stay was from nov 6 - 12 and enjoyed it very much. I will try to break down what we liked and didn't like.
