Food- buffet was like what we've eaten at other all inclusives in Mexico. Good food but not the best ever but honestly who expects it to be? There are plenty of choices at the buffet and the snack bar. A la carte restaurants...We did not like Botticelli that much but the Terraza Grille was awesome. Bars - this is the first time in Mexico we spent more time at the beach than by the pool. The bar closest to the beach la Chiquita I believe, had Jesus as the bar tender (that just sounds funny) and Alex on the beach taking orders and picking up cups. These two guys were absolutely fantastic! The bar by the pool was also great even though we used it twice. We never hit up the late night bar but we could hear the music til about midnight. Rooms- I noticed as a common occurance on here that you would get a room that had two doubles vs 1 king even though you reserved 1 king. We were told they didn't have any rooms with kings but to check back in the morning. They switched us but they were very hesitant and kept asking if we were sure we wanted to switch. The walls are thin and there are some large gaps between the doors so you can hear when your neighbors shower, and leave in the morning. In our first room in the closet there was a door to the next room, it was sealed, not well, so we could hear our neighbors tv and when they were going through their closet it sounded like they were in ours. Second room did not have that so it was quieter (333) we stayed on first and second floors and agree they feel secure even though we never felt our security was threatened. The front doors did have slats but they were decorated that way not actually open as other reviews suggested, you can tell when you close the door from the room because it was completely solid on the other side. The safes are built into the wall (they can hold and iPad and many other things) but you have to rent the locks ($2-3) a day. We always kept our valuables and passports in here with no issues. The rooms are musty and you see some moldy spots in certain corners but people have to remember that it's humid all summer, the a/c is usually on 24/7, and people rarely open up all the windows and sliders to air out the room. Time share/ vacation package people - they try and get you to a welcome breakfast or lunch but having been to enough of these in Cabo and ixtapa we know what to expect and since the excursion discount wasn't that big we opted out. They put up a bit of a fuss but they let us be and no issues. Hotel grounds - awesome. It's like you're in the jungle and then when you hit the pool area you are looking at the carribean and have cabanas and chairs with umbrellas. The employees whether porters, maintanenece, house keeping, bell boys, etc always say hola with smiles. The gym was good (weights are in kg) , treadmills, elliptical, a quasi smith rack/ bench, lots of free weights, stationary bike, sit up machines, etc. They have these half squirrel half possum things around which are cool as well as a friendlyish raccoon. We saw something that looked like a lemur but no one could say what it was. They were building a new bar by the second pool, so hammers and chainsaw during the weekdays. It didn't bother me since I had my iPod but for others that could be annoying. It was also close to the cabana where they give massages, which seems like it would be hard to relax while hearing a chainsaw 30 feet away. Random bits- we did the Xplor park which was awesome! My wife got bit up by bugs( we even brought repellant) not sure if it's from the grounds, the room, or what but this happens in Mexico. Look at people's legs on the way home at the airport, you will see you're not alone. Negotiate cab fares before you get in. I think you get better rates on excursions through expedia than through hotel. More Europeans here than on the west coast of Mexico so that meant more topless women (this is good and bad depending on the age) and more speedos (always bad). .

Reviews.Title: “The timeshare experience”
Reviews.Author: d4dogs
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were walking down 5th av, in Playa del Carmen and were approached by a man, who wanted us to visit the Reef Playacar. He promised us $150, 3 bottles of booze and some t-shirts. My wife was skeptical, but we went along with it and went to the place. We were told that it was a 90 min presentation and no commitment to purchase. 3 hours later, the tour ended and the head lady salesperson comes and asks us how we liked it. I said it was nice, but would like to think about investing almost $20,000 for a timeshare. Well she huffs and puffs, tells us that that she thought we were so nice and now were being rude because we did not want to buy right now( she was rude to me first...I just reacted back to her ) and left us waiting. She eventually comes back with the head honcho who says we would not receive anything because we lied on a question, and then gave us a bill for the food we had eaten for breakfast...which was fine, but nothing to right home about...off course we did not pay. As we were leaving the resort, you would think we were aliens, refused to even acknowledge us. I promised my wife we will never again do a timeshare tour...oh by the way...we own a timeshare at Captain Morgans in San Pedro, Belize and have come to realize it is an extremely good deal...you get a week per year for 89 years for just over $10,000. Mike and Keith our very pleasant and do not pressure you to buy...thats why we purchased it. I hope this helps anyone reading this review....Mark V

Reviews.Title: “Simple resort great for a family with young children.”
Reviews.Author: GBMShop
Reviews.Content: The Reef Hotel is 5 min taxi ride to the 5th Ave of Playa Del Carmen or you could walk it in 25 - 30 minutes and is a beautiful walk through Playa Del Carmen’s premier gated and secured residential area. If you walk the opposite direction from the 5th Ave in 10 minutes walking is Plaza Playa Car, and here you could find the same type of stores which you will find on 5th Ave. but not as many of them. It is totally safe and wheel chair friendly to go walking or stroling outside your resort in this area, I stayed at The Reef for a week and what I liked about it is, it is not a very large resort where you require a golf car to get from your room, to the restaurant, to the pool, and to the beach, Everything is with in a short walk which is good for families with little children making getting around convenient. Furthermore the resort is wheelchair friendly where there are ramps to get around except for the rooms on the 2nd and 3rd level. It is simple to have one restaurant which is kept well clean and neat, and I give the food five stars. Breakfast, lunch, dinner is always good food and its buffet so you could pick and choose what you want to eat. The variety is very general for people of all diets. The Reef has everything you need to have a fun vacation but may lack some items that other resorts offer, but for what it offers and the price at the time it sure was well worth it. They have a pool with bar and close to it is a snack bar so if you are not interested in eating at the restaurant you have the convenience of eating hamburgers, french fries, ice cream, and etc. The pool area is always kept clean and there is also a heated whirl pool close buy. The Reef shares its beach with other popular resorts such as The Riu Palace, Iberostar, and Sandos, making the beach well taken care of and is in my opinion it is the most beautiful beach within Playa Del Carmen. Yopu could also sighn out various items such as life jackets, kayacks, etc. In general, the service, the food, cleanliness, and the employees where very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “THIS IS THE GREAT ESCAPE, ESCAPE TO PARADISE”
Reviews.Author: RonnieJxx
Reviews.Content: I LOVE REEF CLUB. I have been here twice and beats every other Hotel in the world. I would like to tell all you negative people to SHHHHH. GO TO REEF CLUB!!

Reviews.Title: “Used to love this place !”
Reviews.Author: jjkg2000
Reviews.Content: This was a return visit to the Reef. We were there last Oct. and decided to return this year for two weeks and brought more people with us. Not only did they not give us the "special treats" that they promise to repeat clients,they didn't even know we had been there before.So we got nothing,not even a note.Last year when we arrived in our room we had tee shirts,a bottle of wine,chocolate covered strawberries and body lotion.None of that matters. What matters is they took a great resort and turned it into a zoo.Last Oct. and the times before there were no menu items that were extra,no drinks that you couldn't have and you certainly did not have to pay for coffee. in the lobby:( There were no "time share people all over the resort)the problem now seems to be that there are people working at that resort that are thieves.After being there for four days,we return to the room to discover my phone had been stolen. We went to the customer service desk to report it,so what do they do search my room. REALLY. They informed us that they could find out who came and went in that room.they stuck some type of computer thing into the bottom of thee door handle ().Didn't know they could do that ) Went back days later only to be told that it wasn't working. Of course.A few days later went back to the same desk and was told no one was in the room but my husband and myself.What I wanted to know was who was cleaning my room and how were they getting in.After spreading the word about the theft we heard from 2 other couples that had money stolen from their rooms. Not a couple of bucks but hundreds.Of course none of us got anything back,but I didn't expect to.Now we are home and get the phone bill $160.00 in phone calls to Merida Mexico,those calls were made from the time I reported my phone stolen and the time it took to have it shut down. We have traveled a lot over eighteen years..NEVER have we had anything stolen and if you let something sit and walked away you could find it in lost and found,not any more.I used to love the Reef,but the food has gone downhill I can't deal with the time share idiots and i won't deal with thieves by the way my husbands sun glasses also disappeared. But the beach is very nice .I have seen nicer ,but is is nice.I believe that The Reef has just gotten greedy and they really don't care about the people that come there.The staff was great as they always are, but something has to be done about security.No more reef for me........:(

Reviews.Title: “Loved it...but”
Reviews.Author: Tashxxo
Reviews.Content: I went to the reef with my boyfriend for a week in October. First off location, the hotel was beautiful it was like a jungle trees and plants everywhere! It was small which we loved easy to get from one point to another. The beach was great! Always I spot to sit there was room got everyone it was nice not having to wake up extra early just to get a spot. The only thing I didn't like about the location is that we were so close to the road you could see the busy steet from the upstairs bar and lobby. Thats just me, I thought we would be a little more secluded. Food: the buffet breakfast and lunch were usually good, but we could never find anything good at dinner we ate at the el carte for dinner almost every night which were great and had the most amazing service. My boyfriend and I still crave the ranch BBQ salad from the grill ! Bar: the bars were awsome great drink we only had a problem one night when my boyfriend ordered 5 shot of tequila. When he took the shots we could tell they werent tequila we didnt complain on the mess up on the shots but soon after he asked for $40 he said that it was premium vodka and we now had to buy the whole bottle even though it was 3 quarters empty. We said no due to the fact we didn't even order the vodka. The bartender insisted we pay grabbed my boyfriend wrist and told him to leave then called security. Luckily there were some girls that defended us because they heard our order. We left anyways. Rooms: the rooms were nice they got cleaned and stocked with pop and water everyday. But the walls are paper thin! We could hear everything including slamming doors and the couple next to us that fought everynight. We were on thr ground level and to tell you the truth we both didn't feel 100% safe even though are doors, windows and safe were locked. We just had a weird feeling. If we were on a higher level I think I would have felt a little but different about it. I did request a higher level room when I booked but I never received it, and didn't bother to ask for one. There was some construction while we were there right next to the buffet so every time we ate it was VERY loud, the construction made the hottub un useable. Over all the hotel was beautiful great service almost ALL the time small and cozy I would deffinatly go back now that I know what to expect. It's great for couple, family's, weddings ect.

Reviews.Title: “Great Relaxing Vacation”
Reviews.Author: Juan M
Reviews.Content: I can not say enough about the staff. They are friendly, courteous and always ready to lend a hand. The hotel is beautiful, food great and drinks of good quality. I highly recommend the hotel as it is small and personal.

Reviews.Title: “Will be certain to return with a Caveat”
Reviews.Author: jersegal
Reviews.Content: #5 on my list of 14 different Rivera Maya area hotels I have stayed at based on its low key, tropical vacation vibes. IMPORTANT TO NOTE…. we left The Reef Playacar abruptly when Rina was forecast to hit as a slow moving Cat 2 and our flight home scheduled the next day on 10/27 was canceled and not re-scheduled until 2 days later and we could not get any information on hotel emergency plans. We checked out a day early and moved for the next 3 nights to a much more secure resort nearby until we were able to fly home. That being said, Stayed in room 813 a jungle view 1st floor room. The room and bath was spotless, the beds were comfortable enough. I am used to Mexican firm, others who enjoy pillow top softness may need to adjust. The older patio door already shaky on it’s runners would certainly not withstand hurricane force winds. The only enclosed public space without a palapas roof was the theater. A flat roofed windowless room without toilet facilities. I would not want to be hold up there in a storm. If a layed-back “flipflops and shorts” resort with tasty food, cold drinks as strong as you request, on a great beach serving an international mix of families, couples and singles close to 5 Ave and easy on the wallet fits your wish list you will love it here. My only caveat is not during hurricane season . There are several other hotels in the area that were constructed to higher standards with storm training and plans set in place should the need arise. I am certain I will visit The Reef Playacar again I enjoyed my time there!.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Enough for a Relaxing Week”
Reviews.Author: kzimzim
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I are in our 20's and wanted to have a nice relaxing week on the beach. We got a good deal on the vacation and I think we got what we paid for. The food wasn't great, but it was filling and edible. The drinks were pretty good. It seemed like the frozen drinks had very little alcohol, but the mixed drinks the rum and coke had a bit of a kick to them. The only downside is that their cups are pretty small, so we found ourselves order 2 at once so we didn't have to go to the bar very often. I saw a few people with mugs, they had the right idea! The bartender will fill it up for you. If you are sitting near the beach there is a very nice waiter, Alex, who comes by to pick up your empty cups, he will also bring you drinks if you ask. If you don't ask, you don't receive! The rooms were decent. We booked a king sized room and when we got there we were given a room with two doubles. When we told them that we would like a king bed, they said that they did not have any more available but they would get us in one the next day. That was a bit of a hassle, but the king sized room was much nicer for the two of us so I was ok with waiting the night. The room size was decent and clean. If you need more than two towels you'll have to request them, some nights they forgot to give us any at all! But the maids closet seems to always be unlocked, so we just grabbed our own. The beach was nice. I'm personally afraid of ocean, but the water was so blue that I ended up swimming everyday! There were lots of people in the water and the waves were fairly gentle. This hotel seemed to be the place for groups of people to go. Lots of friends together in groups. They were all very friendly. We apparently should have brought some more people! There were also a lot of Europeans on the beach so be prepared for topless women and people of different body sizes all in bikinis. It made me feel better about myself, and by the end of the trip it didn't even phase me anymore! Great place to go to relax and enjoy the ocean!

Reviews.Title: “The Good and The Bad”
Reviews.Author: Jimmy M
Reviews.Content: The Good and Bad Upon arrival, we were promptly greeted by courteous staff member who assisted us with our luggage and directed us to registration. Our room wasn’t available for an additional 1 hour, however, the front desk staff member instructed us to go get some lunch, have a drink or two, and return in one hour. All of this was fine until “The Bad” happened. Before we left the registration area, we were approached by person wearing a resort name tag and asked us to come to the Concierge Desk for some additional information. I was thinking they were going to provide us with a map of the resort and an activities list. We are immediately asked to take a 90 minute tour of the resort which would provide information to make our stay more pleasant but we had to bring a card card, identification, and put down a $20 refundable deposit. When asked if this was a time share sales presentation, we were told no and I quote: “We are not selling time shares.” We did not participate but did over hear one of the salesman tell another couple it was $4000 per year for 25 years. We did speak with one couple who informed us the 90 minute presentation was 3 hours of their time wasted. Seems reasonable….RIGHT….. So with that being said, steer clear of the “No Time Share Salesperson(s)” unless you are looking to invest in one. Second part of the story. We were having some communication issues with our transportation agencies (Olympus - Roberto) and when we went to the concierge desk to ask for assistance, the supervisor stated “Why should I help you, you didn’t participate in our time share presentation.” He also stated that he and the others there are not part of the hotel, but part of the time share only….WOW…Wearing a Reef Resort name badge, in the Reef Resort lobby, at a Concierge Desk and doesn’t want to assist a customer. Can you say GET ANOTHER JOB…. I immediately went to the Front Desk and was promptly assisted by a staff member (Fernando). Now that’s great customer service. Now to the GOOD. The resort is very nice, clean, and accommodating. All staff members were very helpful and attentive. The food was very good and there was a wide variety in the buffet area. We ate at the snack grill and both restaurants as well and they also very good. Both pool areas are very nice and the beach area is wonderful. All four bar areas for very nice and have a wide selection of drinks. I would like to especially thank Alex (beach bar area) for his hard work. He had only been employed at the Reef for four days, but wow, he went way above and beyond. He was always pleasant, had a smile on his face, and proficient at his work. The Reef would do even better if more staff members would follow Alex’s lead. For the diver…..I can not say enough about David, Stephan, and Bruno. They are extremely knowledgeable and very accommodating. My dive buddy and I had seven dives with David and two Cenote dives with Stephan. They dive shop has everything you need with top of line AquaLung equipment. For those Nitrox certified divers, it is included a no additional charge. If you are thinking about getting certified, they provide an intro to scuba at the pool at no charge. I HIGHLY RECOMMEND the Reef Resort and the Reef Resort Marina (Dive Shop). Just remember to say no to the Time Share sales people in the lobby. They are very rude if you don’t want to waste 3 hours of your vacation for an $80 spa treatment.

Reviews.Title: “Small Resort - Good Location”
Reviews.Author: Smert4
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed at the Reef Playacar from October 8-15th. I had previously stayed at Blue Bay Grand Esmeralda with my husband in the spring. The Reef Playacar is a small resort with around 200 rooms. The resort turned out to be better than I anticipated. The grounds are beautiful with a cenote and tropical foliage situated between the various buildings. We did not arrive until late on Saturday, October 8th. After checking in, we were escorted to our room. We were put in a room with a king size bed so I called the front desk and said that we requested double beds. Within 10 minutes we were moved to a room with double beds in building one. We were told that it may be loud as it was close to the bar and if we wanted to move to a different room in the morning after people checked out, they would move us. We took them up on the offer and by 12:30 the next day we were in another room. We were very pleased with the room we were given: 1634. The rooms are small but clean. There is a little balcony with two chairs. No coffeemaker – we asked and were told it only comes with a superior room – not sure what that is. Ours faced the inside of the resort which gave us a view of the tropical garden. There are two windows but neither one had screens on them so we did not like leaving them open but you almost had to open the one in the bathroom as there was no way for steam to escape when you showered. I did see some small ants on the vanity in the bathroom – not sure where they were coming from. Room was quiet – there are only 3 floors in each building with 4 rooms per floor. We never had a problem sleeping. As stated in other posts, you do need to rent a lock for the safe at $2.00 a day. There are two pools, one with a swim-up bar and baby pool. There is also a hot tub. The beach area is beautiful – very wide with plenty of chairs. I do not know if the resort was full but we never had a problem getting a good spot around the pool. They have lots of beds with canopies over them and we were able to get one of them a couple of days. You have to get up to get your drinks when you are at the pool – there is no waiter who comes around but the area is not that big and there is a bar right up from the pool. Felix at the swim- up bar is an awesome bartender. Restaurants – there is a buffet which is opened for all meals and there are two sit-down restaurants that are opened in the evening. You do not need reservations for the sit-down restaurants. There is also a restaurant that serves burgers, pizza and hot dogs by the pool during the day and tacos and pizza at night. I found the buffet to be tiring – a lot of the same food at every meal. Tried both sit-down restaurants and the food there was okay but they both were not opened every night so your choices were very limited. There are several items on the menu at the sit-down restaurants that cost additional money. My friend didn’t mind it – this was her first time to Mexico and she loved everything about it where I was comparing it to Blue Bay which has many restaurants and a wide variety of food. Entertainment – there is a show every night near the rooftop bar. We only saw two – 70’s show which the staff put on. They worked very hard and did a good job. We also saw the Mexican show and this was excellent – these were professional dancers. There is a rooftop bar and if you want to hear bands, you are 20 minutes walking distance from downtown Playa or a $7.00 taxi ride. We did have some rain towards the end of our stay and the staff did come around letting us know of other inside events they had going on to entertain the guests. All in all, I would go back to this resort again. The resort is quaint and the grounds are beautiful. We did not pay a lot for this vacation so we feel we got what we paid for. I wish they would up the room price a few dollars to include the safe and the coffeemaker. I just feel that these things are usually always included in all-inclusives. A little more variety on the buffet would also be great. But you cannot top that beach and view, it’s awesome!

Reviews.Title: “BEST SPOT IN PDC”
Reviews.Author: John T
Reviews.Content: Visited from 8 till 15 October Lets start with other bad reviews, if you check the websites you will see they are upfront about upcharges for things like steaks and specialty coffees, shouldnt be a surprise if you do your homework. Check In: A breeze plenty of help to get you checked in, we were given our wristbands and off we went to lunch and the pool. Room: King just as promised clean, comfortable. Cleaning staff were thorough and we never saw them. Food: Buffet was great plenty of choices for breakfast, lunch, and dinner. If you cant find something here you are to picky. Snack bar was awesome, burgers, dogs and wings were great. Specialty restaurants were great, service is wonderful, food is great choices are limited by menu but we had different meals on 4 different nights. Bars: Although the amount of bars are limited I didnt see anyone wait more than a few minutes for a drink, bartenders are great Jesus at the chiquita bar is incredible, as is Felix at the pool bar, take care of these guys they work hard to keep your glass full and to make sure you have a smile on your face. They dont use cheap liquor or water down drinks, if you want top shelf they let you know up front there is an extra charge, but regular drinks are great. Staff: After a couple days most staff remember your name and everyone has a smile and a friendly "HOLA"everywhere you go. If you have problems go see Roberta at guest relations she is the most incredible person I may have ever met, she solves problems and schedules things I thought impossible. Irving, Miguel, Gladys, and Gilbert in the Chula Vista were the best. Pools: Well maintained and plenty of space Beach: Incredible is an understatement plenty of chairs, you can walk the beach to town in about 10 minutes. In short dont listen to the naysayers about the REEF club, we have stayed here 4 times and will be back, I would love to keep this place a secret but I cant stay here you wont regret it. I

Reviews.Title: “I will never get the smell out of my belongings”
Reviews.Author: Stacy D
Reviews.Content: We got to the hotel and everything seems nice. The grounds are very beautiful and very well kept and the little rodents running around are neat to see BUT the room we were put in stunk BAD. We got there on Friday early afternoon and were checked into room 712. I sprayed every piece of cloth in the room with a whole bottle of febreeze but the smell persisted. It was a mixture of mold/mildew/BO. The second day we were there I just couldn't stand it anymore. I went to the front desk and begged them to move us to another room and they said I would have to come back in the morning. UGH soooo went back in the morning and they gave us 2 rooms to choose from. The first room smelled different but definately no better than the first. The second room 732 was ok so we moved for our last night there. I have washed my clothes 3 times and the smell from that first room will not come out. Really sucks, now my house smells from the items that I brought home from my vacation. To add to the dissapointment the food was aweful. The breakfast was ok if you got an omlet but that is the only edible thing we found at the buffet restaurant, even the "special" dinner restaurant upstairs was aweful. We spent so much money eating elsewhere that we could have just stayed at a nice hotel. On second thought the burger shak for lunch and snax was great. The burgers were good as well as the hot dogs. The beach was beautiful, the pools were great. The option of beach beds and chairs with umbrellas was wonderful. Most of the staff was great and the activities were not hard to find but we will not be back because of the smell and the lack of tasteful food.....aweful. There were 7 of us that stayed here and we all agreed about never returning. Also the term "all inclusive" does not apply to so many things here you would be amazed.

Reviews.Title: “Great Time”
Reviews.Author: GiselleD
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip to the Riviera Maya and i would return. The Staff was really good ,,, the food was enjoyable. I always found something a liked, and i was pleased with my room and comfort of the bed. The only thing that really botherd me,,, was the time share people hounding you like crazy shortly after check in claiming to be hotel staff and making you all kinds of promises. Be very careful to there invitation to breakfast. I got suckered into it telling them if it was time share i was NOT interested at all,,, but they claim that it is not time share.. After going through a lenghly process and waisting half a day with these people... who by the way wanted at lowest cost 17,0000 dollars to buy into a plan there by the end came down to the same offer for only 1000.00. If you could avoid these people,,, your trip will be great. The room is good,,, the beach and ocean are absolutely amazing and the staff were very friendly. If you are looking for night life however this hotel is not for you... The entertainment sucked when they did have any... in the 5 days i was there,, there was only entertainment 2 nights,, The other nights,, they suggested you go off the resort to party in playa del carmen which is not all inclusive. The weather was great,,, it rained maybe 2 or 3 times but for very short periods of time. I just back on Thanksgiving day... and i would return. Charlie the photorapher,,, is highly recommended for a fun photo shoot. YOu will have the time of your life with him. ;) Great photographer with alot of talent. I highly recommend that if you travel to this resort that you make reservations in playa del carmen and check out the restaurant called the Alux and take the tour also... This is one of the best experiences i have had in dinning. :) Enjoy,, and make the best of your trip. :)

Reviews.Title: “The Rainy Reef”
Reviews.Author: NewlywedPV
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Reef October 1st to 8th with my husband, brother in law, and his girlfriend. This was me and my husband's second time traveling to this area. The previous time we stayed at the Gran Bahia Principe Tulum a 5 star, larger resort. We wanted to be closer to Playa Del Carmen and stay in a smaller resort and the price was right at the Reef so we booked. LIKES LOCATION - 10 minute beach walk to Playa Del Carmen...nice to be able to drink at Senior Frogs then take a nice beach walk back home BEACH - Amazing. Can snorkel right off the beach, clear waters, white sand, not crowded and calm waters. ATMOSPHERE - The grounds are amazing, liked that you felt you where in an actual jungle not a concrete jungle. The coffee area and ice cream parlor is a nice touch! DISLIKES ROOMS - The rooms where clean and your typical resort room, maid service was excellent, and air conditioner good however, it made my dislike list because if you don't upgrade you have a horrible view and like others say...if people are in the "hall" it sounds like they are in your room. I brought ear plugs and still couldn't get decent sleep. SERVICE - Unfortunetly this made my dislikes list as well due to the front desk staff being overly rude to my husband when he inquired about an umbrella on a rainy day. One of the bartenders who was in the upstairs bar (didn't catch his name) was SO rude anytime I would get a drink to the point where I just made my husband go for me everytime. The service I recieved at the pool bar from FELIX was amazing, best bartender ever! The service in the buffett was always great. FOOD - Okay...I personally didn't mind the food but the couple we were with hated it. I never had a problem finding food I liked at the buffett but some things I tried just weren't good. My husband and I were really looking forward to an a la cart meal and got dressed up only to find one was closed and the other that was opened only had 2 items on the menu "free" the rest you had to pay upwards from $20 American. If I was going to pay for a meal i'd just go into town...and thats just what we did. ENTERTAINMENT - Some people might hate the dance music blaring from the pool area but I enjoy it and instead I got faint Mexican classical music at the Reef. This is not a resort for the younger crowd as there is no disco (at least the week we were there) and the activities during the day were lacking. There were nightly shows at 9pm everynight...well I wish. Out of the whole week there was only 3 shows we went to (Pop Show, 70's show) they were bad but entertaining and had us laughing, (Mexican Night - great show) we enjoyed those nights. The other nights were a show for kids, kareoke and casino night (no thanks!) and that was a little disappointing. I'm pretty impressed with my stay at this 3 star hotel compared to the 5 star I stayed in previously. We debated this resort with the Wyndham resorts and Grand Coco Bay (All around the same price) and just from what I saw dropping people off and picking them up I think we made the best choice. If you are debating this resort with the others I'd say you won't be disappointed. The only thing that was a bit disappointing about the resort really was the entertainment....lack of music at the bars, no disco and nightly shows...in the end though your trip is what you make of it!! Have fun! Recommendation - Eat out at Alux Restaurant in Playa Del Carmen. You eat dinner in an actual underground cave. Meals run for about $45 a plate, but the experience alone is worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Theresalinda
Reviews.Content: This was a mother daughter vacation.It was out first time to Mexico we loved our stay at the Reef Playacar.The rooms were clean and the beds were comfortable.The staff were very friendly, The bartenders were always smiling and friendly.Buffet and dining room staff were excellant. The entertainment was "Great" we never missed a show the events staff very friendly and alot of fun. The beach was beautiful and the grounds were very clean and well cared for.The food was good but bland, great variety. Over all our stay was fantastic at the reef. We will be returning next year.

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort”
Reviews.Author: sillygoose1977
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 5 day trip at The Reef. This was our second trip to Playacar and our first time at The Reef. We arrived early for check-in but they had a room available for us anyway. We were very pleased with our room. It was very clean and bright with a nice sized closet and good air conditioning. The bathroom was spacious with a nice deep tub to keep the water off the floor. I loved the window in the shower to look out at the gardens. The grounds at The Reef are beautiful. You can see that they put in a great deal of effort to keep things looking very nice. The pool could have used some work, specifically the pool bar which was getting a little run down looking. We didn't spend much time there so it didn't bother us. The beach had plenty of chairs and shade and was a very quiet place to relax. We spent most of our time out there. We also took advantage of the included non motorized water sports. Kayaking in the ocean was wonderful! We found most of the staff to be very friendly and helpful. Jesus, the bartender near the snack bar, was always very friendly and funny. We never had to wait long anywhere for a drink. The whole atmosphere at the Reef is very relaxed which was exactly what we were looking for. It is also one of the closest hotels to town which makes for a very convenient walk. Like others have said, he food in the buffet is not good at all. I know it is hard to please so many different types of people but all the food was very bland. Breakfast was the best time to go. They had good sausages and a lot of good bread choices. We stuck to the snack bar for lunch which had great burgers and hot dogs cooked upon order. The nacho bar was good too. Dinner was not great but they had a lot of salad choices. We checked out the other restaurants but without paying more, we weren't impressed with the menu items. I personally don't mind that the food wasn't spectacular because I hate over eating on vacation but it could have been better. They would also be wise to have the Chula Vista air conditioned. It was fairly unbearable to sit and eat in the heat. The nightly shows weren't as good as other shows I've seen at resorts but they were okay. We only went to a couple and they were entertaining enough. I would most definitely return to The Reef. I had a hard time finding anything to complain about except the food. It is a wonderful place to stay for the money. I did not want to leave.

Reviews.Title: “Reef Playacar - review”
Reviews.Author: Beachlover30330
Reviews.Content: My husband and I (36 and 34) stayed at The Reef Playacar from August 22-30th. Overall I would stay at this resort again if the price was right. Those that say it is within walking distance of Playa are people that can handle the 90 degree 90 percent humidity better than I can, however, I found that I did not mind the $7 or 70 peso cab ride to wherever I wanted to go in Playa. We did walk one day but found by the time we got there we were dripping wet and did not really enjoy being there. I have to admit that this is one of the most relaxing vacations to the Riviera that I have had in a long time. We booked with Book-it and used BestDay transfers which were seemless and on-time. We found ourselves arriving before check-in which was expected so we decided to check out the resort and grab a bite to eat. Upon first walking into the only buffet restaurant I really did realize what everyone meant by the limited food selection. It was good - do not get me wrong - but it was just very lacking. We ended up only eating breakfast at the buffets (which was the best meal in my book and very comparable to other all inclusive resorts we have stayed at including the Iberostar, Barcelo, Xcaret, Now Jade) - then we would grab a burger or nachos at the snack bar (which were good for a Mexico burger) and then we went to the a la cartes to eat dinner. We found ourselves to be the first ones to the restaurant almost every night and must be accustomed to eating much earlier than others. The entire week we were there we met probably only 6 or 7 couples that spoke English well enough that we could have a conversation with. This resort seems to be frequented by Europeans and Canadians very heavily (not that that is bad). So this meant that us eating dinner at 6:30 p.m. was understandably way earlier than they normally eat dinner. The Steak and the salmon at the Steak a la carte was the best and by the end of the trip I was pretty sick of it - but I certainly did not starve - which is the main reason I say - for the right price - I would go back. I found the pools to be very adequate and liked the separation - I like the fact that you can see the beach from the pool and - YES - everyone is exactly correct - THIS is the best beach in the Riviera - (unless snorkeling from your hotel is important to you because there is NONE of that - but okay with me on this trip). It is beautiful and very good for swimming. There were always enough chairs and usually even a bed or two open for getting there later in the day. We did see some of the small bugs that people spoke about - although I was not bothered by them as much as others (they did not bite). We upgraded our room so we had a great air conditioner and our bed was very comfortable. We had troubles with the pillows the first night so we went to the front desk and got 2 softer pillows - they brought them right away and I slept as well if not better than I do at home. In fact a few nights I woke up and forgot where I was……. The negatives of this resort could be easily corrected - I think the staff for the most part was good - but there are a few people who you could tell did not want to be there. If they would turn the beach massage area into a bar it would be fantastic and a very well received investment. The only bathrooms are by the restaurant so if you are in the upper pool by the swim up bar it is probably just as close if not closer to your room to go to the bathroom than to their facilities. Hence the reason I think many suspect that people are using the pool as their facilities (also you do not see many of those people who park their butt at the pool bar leave very often). The only other thing that would be great is drink menus. If you find a drink you like - no 2 bartenders make it the same and they all do not know the names of everyone elses drinks. I have been to a few all-inclusives so I knew some of the drinks that should be available but if this is your first AI resort - you better have some drink recipes handy.

Reviews.Title: “An awesome place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: Cando2
Reviews.Content: Beautiful beach, great setting, friendly & helpful staff. Not for party animals but great atmosphere. Visit Felix at the pool bar for a delicious bahama mama!

Reviews.Title: “Good Beach..... but....”
Reviews.Author: jackhop618
Reviews.Content: Well where to start- I had read several reviews before booking at The Reef. We have traveled several times to this area and Cancun and have had great success in choosing a hotel- well not this time. I will start with the good things- the beach, it was clean and large. Most of the staff were very nice and hard working, especially the entertainment staff- this guys/gals are amazing and always smiling after putting in long hours- we Really enjoyed them. The grounds were nicely kept. Now the bad stuff- Ok first of all, while on vacation you expect to be able to relax in you room - sleep in or an afternoon siesta- well not at this place- you can hear everything. The hotel grounds crew would start mowing at 8:00 am- and sawing- yes sawing- replacing balconies. This would go on until about 6:00 pm. The food at the hotel was very poor- we went out to eat in town 3 or 4 times. The best meal by far is breakfast at the buffet. The steakhouse was just ok- the Italian just terrible - nothing more then velveeta and pasta. Also, you never know what is open- very limited hours- the buffet is not open for lunch until 12:30 and closes at 3- ok then dinner it does not open until 6:30-6:45. The ice cream is only open 3-5 and normally is either out of cones or has no spoons. The hotel walks get very slick and I watched several people fall down. Our bathroom was in need of a new bathtub- well on our 3rd day of 7- it gave loose and my husband literally when through it while showering. i tried to call the front desk- well our phone did not work. So, I went down to the front desk and i told them what happened- about 25 minutes later a staff member can up with a plunger- Ok? I told him I don't think that is gonna work. he said it will have to wait till in the morning. We waited and waited and nothing until 10:30. I was told that I would have to change rooms- but there was nothing in the same building and I did not want to repack and move into another and waste my vacation time. i checked periodically through the day to see the progress- well they just patched it instead of a new tub. They used very strong smelling epoxy- it was terrible. The guy was seating on the side of the tub fanning it with a piece of cardboard trying to speed up the drying- I went in and handed him the blow dryer- and I opened the balcony door and the sliding window to help with the fumes. We returned about 5;30 ad the room was totally closed up and it smelled horrible. However the tub was fixed and they also painted the inside- very weird. So, we used it - but we had to spread eagle and place your feet on each side -because the bottom was so mushey feeling. I did go down to the manager and voice my displeasure- what a joke. he could of cared less- then I asked what was he going to do for me - Well I finally walked a way and told him not to worry about it- he was very rude. I told him that I would make sure that people knew about what had happened an how they do not take cake of their guest at all! He just looked at me. Oh and the phone never did get fixed. Everything at the hotel is an extra charge- from the coffee in the lobby to the food in the ala cart, the safe, beer and soda in the room fridge, certain vodka and whiskey and so on. The pool bar is joined to the kiddie pool? Kids all over the bar- just not a good setup at all. The adult pool was not enforced- it had kids in it all the time. rooms were just ok- tv was awful only 3 english stations - CNN, Discovery and HBO plus. There must be a shortage on bath towel - 2-3 days we only got 1 for 2 people. With all the extra charges here at The Reef you may as well choose a better hotel that is truly an all-inclusive. All in all I would not return to this hotel ever! And yes the beds are so hard- I thought I could sleep anywhere- well not in these. We did travel with another couple and they have the same feelings about this resort.

Reviews.Title: “Never again”
Reviews.Author: JudiLynn
Reviews.Content: Just returned from the Reef and here is a short review. Timeshare is shoved down your throat. As soon as check in is complete you are turned over to a timeshare guy who wants you to pay $20 to listen to his speech at breakfast the next morning..No thanks...And he keeps hounding you. Just let me get to my room... Room was small so we upgraded for $150 cash. Paid the guy at the front desk cuz he said their credit card machine was broke and had been for days and didn't know when it would be fixed So cash it was right into his pocket. Few hours later I observed folks checking out using their credit cards???? Hmmmm Restaurants are not always open with no prior notification. Also buffett is not air conditioned which makes it miserable to sit in. Food was ok not always hot. Snacks ok. Don't expect service around the pool or by the ocean. It wont happen. Had to do alot of walking because nothing is marked. It would be nice if it showed beach this way or restaurant this way but no. Air conditioning in the room is cold during the day but not at night and very noisy. Beds are hard as a rock. Beach is beautiful with plenty of chairs. Been traveling for over 20 years and this is the first time I could not wait to leave. Find another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed there twice - will go back again.”
Reviews.Author: 482Cat
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Reef for three weeks my latest trip and had a great time. I find the grounds beautiful, and I'm not a fan of the high-rise type of structure with too many people and too much concrete. The staff are friendly and helpful and I had no trouble with any time-share pressure. I think the beach is close to the best on the coast. Also, it's easy and quick to get to 5th Ave and other attractions. This time I found the bed softer and more comfortable than the first time I stayed. I stayed both times in the building near the pool with a sea view and didn't find it at all noisy. I love that location, so close to the buffet and easy to get back and forth from the pool and beach to my room. The food is good, but did find that the service was not as good as the first time I was there. All in all, though, I will go back again. (Had fun times at Bad Boys Beach Bar in Playa as well - the ribs and potato salad are my favorites.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: Shivors
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Reef for our honeymoon. We read all of the reviews, poured over every bit of information and I pulled the trigger on this property because of the size of the resort. My wife and I don't care to wait in lines or fight for beach chairs and we didn't have to do any of that at The Reef. We liked the buffet...nothing groundbreaking but plenty of choices. We loved the restaurants on property. Each meal was fantastic. The pools and beach were good with constant upkeep. The swim-up bar was fantastic. (try the cranberry mojito) The room was nice...nothing fancy but well cleaned. The nightly shows are horrifically cheesy and we loved them. (The same staff that handed you a towel dances and performs) Front desk was stand-offish but the other staff were all pleasant and engaging.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful place to visit!”
Reviews.Author: Arodzull
Reviews.Content: Me and my family were lucky to spend 5 days at The Reef. What a beautiful place! We went there at the end of July and had an awesome time. The gardens and surrounding areas are amazingly green, it feels you are in the middle of the rain forest! A few steps and you are at a beautiful beach where you can relax and spend the day under the sun. The two pools are very nice and clean and perfect for both adults and kids. The food was very good, I recommend the Italian restaurant which was very good with an awesome staff. The hotel is close to many attractions and within walking distance of Fifth Ave. I would love to come back very soon!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Vacation”
Reviews.Author: lhdm
Reviews.Content: The Reef is a very nice hotel with beautiful maintained grounds in a jungle like setting.It is a smaller resort and is easy to get around.The staff is very nice and they go out of their way to be sure you are comfortable.The rooms are clean and well taken care of and are nice in size even with three people.AC also worked very well.Beds are hard but comfortable.Two bottles of water are left in your room each day but you can get more bottled water at any of the bars.Bartenders are very good and you should tip them once in awhile because they work hard to keep everyone happy.When you check in if you don't like where they put you ask for something else and you will probably get it. The only drawback to this hotel in my opinion is the food.There are two sit down restaurants that alternate each night and the buffet.The selection is very limited but you will probably not go hungry.The walk to Playa Carmen is 20 minutes.All in all it was a nice resort.The grounds are what makes this resort.You can get into the sit down restaurant with shorts on.One other note about the food in the restaurants.You can get chicken,salmon or flank steak free of charge,everything else is an additional charge.To sum it all up it was a nice place and I would probably go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great honeymoon even during hurricane season”
Reviews.Author: Jolyne_11
Reviews.Content: Just got back from our honeyomoon at the Reef Playacar. We had a superb week, even if it was during the hurricane season, which worried us a bit before leaving. Sunny and very hot all week. Rain for about 2 hours one afternoon. We loved the Reef because it is a small complex and you don't have to walk for miles to get to everything. Good food. The deserts are really really very good. Beach is great. Overall a great place.

Reviews.Title: “Reef Playacar has it all”
Reviews.Author: mel9661
Reviews.Content: My GF and I stayed at the Reef in Sept. 2011. The location is excellent for access to restuarants/shopping in Playa del Carmen's 5th Ave (Quinta). It is also withing an hour or less from Tulum, Xel-Ha and Coba'. Just minutes from Xcaret. The Reef is located in the gated resort community of Playacar. It is completely safe, even at night. Never once did we feel unsafe anywhere in the area. Our room was big and comfortable. The air conditioner was quiet and made for a huge relief when coming in from the hot humid outdoors. The bed was very comfy as well. My GF only wished there were more English language television channels. But hey, you're in Mexico. The resort itself is built within a natural setting of jungle and cenotes with waterfalls. It truly makes you feel you are far away. The traditional Mexican colors and polished wood and cement tile walkways make getting around the property easy. It is one of the smaller all-inclusives and as such, more attention is paid to individual guests. The food at the main buffet restaurant was really very good. The selections were far beyond what I would have expected. Just the variety of various juices was a bonus. As a coffee drinker, I was very pleased with their morning brew. Besides the buffet restaurant there was a more formal Grill and Italian Restaurant. During the day, there was a snack bar with pretty decent food for those laying around the pool and beach. The two pools were clean and always filled with people. Their main pool has a swim up bar. The beach was exceptional as well. All throughout the property were lounge chairs and cabanas for the guests to relax in. All the areas were clean, comfy and safe. Every night they had entertainment in their theater. You need to check the schedule posted in front of it on the second floor above the registration desk. It is not posted anywhere else or communicated to guests. We watched a Mexcican show one night. They also had a Caribbbean, 70's and Casino Night while we were there. One thing to beware of is the hard sell Time Share/Vacation Club. One one hand it was worth the three hours of our time because we got heavily discounted tickets to local attractions. But on the other, the hard sell was not what we wanted on our vacation. All in all, I would return to this resort.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful second time at the Reef”
Reviews.Author: utahmom14
Reviews.Content: We had previously stayed at the reef the year it openned and really loved it. The a few years ago we stayed at another resort in playacar just for a change and as walking by the Reef they had sustained alot of damage with a hurrican and were not openned at the time. We were so happy to see that Fun Jet once again was offering the Reef . We were looking for a 6 day get-away and price was a issue for us. As we knew we loved the reef before and the price had just gone down as it was within a 3 week window we dicided to give it a try again. We emailed the resort about two weeks before checkin and mentioned we had stayed there before. They emailed us right back that we would have some special gifts ready for us. Which was really nice. We were lucky to have a direct flight down, and Lomas travel took us right away to the Reef. Jhonathon checked us in and we had a room with an ocean and pool view, very nice. They have actually upgraded these rooms and they are much brighter, better AC units and the linens are improved. Our AC was so cold we had to adjust the temps a few nights. They now have nice large flat screens with improved TV channels. The resort has really made alot of improvements and the forest area has grown even more lush. As always people are always cleaning and keeping everything beautiful. The pools and beach were still perfect, we could tell they had to rebuild the beach at some point as it is not has fine of sand but there were many more loungers, and now beds that were very nice. It was not too crowded so we got a nice spot each day no matter what time we came down. The food was not quite as good as our first visit but still tasty each day. You now can go any day to the specail dinners with no reservation. I enjoyed both the grill and itailian. Playa is still a close walk, and fun for a day trip we went twice and enjoyed shopping. really we did not feel the need to leave the hotel it was still so relaxing.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected from reading reviews. Would go back.”
Reviews.Author: jdavid68
Reviews.Content: I was a bit apprehensive about my stay at the Reef Playacar because I had read plenty of mixed reviews. I have to admit that I was pleasantly surprised once we got there. I went with a friend for a wedding being held there. We were two of about 50 people in our party checking in that week. Check in was quick and easy. We asked for a third floor room facing the gardens as I had read those were the nicer rooms. Once we checked in we were immediately faced with someone who wanted to schedule our hotel tour. From reading the reviews I knew this was a timeshare pitch. I told him I already had plans for the next day and was unavailable and he let me go without a fuss. Our room was decent. The beds were a bit harder than I like but they didn't prevent me from getting a good night's sleep. The air conditioning was nice and cold, which was great considering how hot and humid it was the week we were there. The fridge had 5 sodas for 2 people and was not restocked the entire week we were there. It was expected from what I had read in previous reviews and wasn't that big of a deal. The water bottles were restocked daily whether we used them or not which was nice. The rooms were clean and always well taken care of. I was also very impressed with laundry and pressing service. One day we had a bag of laundry and it was picked up in the morning and delivered early afternoon. The next day we needed a dress pressed for the wedding and it was picked up, pressed and delivered within 90 minutes. The restaurants were acceptable. Breakfast was always the best meal of the day. There was always a good variety of food available. I did not find the food bland or greasy as others have stated. I enjoyed the meals I had there every day. The sit down italian restaurant upstairs was wonderful. We had a group of 12 one day and they took great care of us. They got my order wrong and offered to redo my meal. Two things that could have been improved: 1) The restaurant wasn't always ready at the listed open times for breakfast and usually you found people waiting outside to eat. It wasn't much of an inconvenience except when you had an excursion and were on a tight schedule and 2) by the end of the week the service at the restaurants seemed to be slipping. The wait staff came around less often and one day we actually finished our breakfast before anyone came around with coffee. The afternoon tea was a wonderful touch and I would recommend you try it. The ice cream shop was open daily and offered a variety of tasty selections. As we are not big drinkers I couldn't really rate the bar service. We usually had one or two drinks and didn't have to wait very long. The staff were all pleasant. I have to commend the sports and entertainment staff. They seemed to be at the facility all day and night and were always very friendly. They put on a different show every night and although it wasn't high budget, it was always enjoyable. They remembered us every time they saw us around the facility and always made small talk. I have to say they were a big part of making our vacation very fun. We attended a wedding at the hotel and I have to say that it was exceptional. The staff did a wonderful job of setting up the site right on the beach followed by a cocktail reception and dinner on the beach as well. We had a dance floor with dj and lights and a full bar. It was a wonderful night and I was very impressed by the job the hotel did that night. Kudos to everyone. The grounds were always meticulously maintained. Everything was always clean and well cared for. I got a massage on the beach and it was wonderful. It definitely isn't a five star resort but I got my money's worth and would stay here again. It is a wonderful smaller resort. If you want to be waited on hand and foot and want every amenity under the stars, this is not the place, but if you want a decent smaller resort at a decent price, then I recommend it. I would take my friends and family back without concern.

Reviews.Title: “a long detailed review, hope it helps others, i had a blast!”
Reviews.Author: torinshadow
Reviews.Content: 5 of us went to the reef from 9-3-11 to 9-9-11 and here is my review...i will give everything a star rating from 1 to 5 FRONT DESK check in was smooth and the desk staff seemed to be nice. when we got to our room and found out that our request had not been met we returned to the desk to ask for another room (my balcony faced a fence not the garden as requested) they pretty much gave us the runaround saying "we are too full right now you will have to come back tomorrow and ask" we knew this wasn't true because someone had already told us they were less than 65% full. it appeared that they just wanted to get you in a room knowing it would be too much a hassle to repack and change rooms...that was irritating, but a minor thing. the other issue was the person at the desk that checked us in promised us they would restock our fridge daily because they weren't that busy but it never happened...when i went back and asked i was told by another person that it was only done with the upgraded package....COMMUNICATE PEOPLE! still check in went smooth and we were in our room in a flash and NO ONE at the desk was rude at any time. the concierge did try to get us to listen to his time share speech, but never persisted or got rude when we said we weren't interested like other reviews had said, he just let us go about our business. front desk= 2 stars THE GROUNDS the grounds are beautiful....its not some huge mega resort. you can walk anywhere easily and get a great view...jungle setting, trees, little animals, even a few cats live on property for people missing their pets. always clean and someone alwasy sweeping or cleaning up. 3 story cabanas make it a quaint little resort without the "hotel" feel. the beach is gorgeous, plenty of chairs (you may have to get there early for a bed) they even wait for people to go to bed and then rake the sand in the common areas to make it look pretty. vendors do set up around the pools in the evenings, but no big deal they dont pressure you..if you want to buy you do, if not feel free to browse. 2 pools both relatively small but clean and warm. the only issue would be that the kids area was right next to the pool bar, so kids would sometimes be sitting at the bar..a little inappropriate. the grounds gets a 4.9 stars THE ROOM the rooms are small, but not near as small as people say (we had 3 adults in our room and were comfortable) nice size closet all mirrored. small desk area with old school 21" tv balcony. decent size bathroom...deeeeep tub which was nice..tubs could use some remodeling (chips and such) poor water pressure. no problems getting towels or bottled water as some people say....now the beds HORRIBLE..hard as a rock and flat pillows, at least you could request different types of pillows so noo problem....the beds just need updated! the cleaning people did an ok job.....;mostly just made the bed, replaced the towels if we left them on the floor, bottled water and shampoo....but stayed away from the desk (i left a coke can to see if they would throw it away...they didnt)...this may be to stay away from your personal stuff though....we even got a note one day saying the hotel wasnt responsible for personal items because we had left our camera out...so it was a nice reminder to put stuff away.....all in all you are there to sleep and thats about it..with a little updating the rooms would be prefect so they get a 2.5 stars would have been 3.5 but the bed was too hard THE RESTAURANTS the food places are all open at different hours so you are always able to get something to eat which is nice the snack bar....during the afternoon you can get hamburger, hot dog, nachos, fries, pizza, wings, with small cold sandwiches or little deserts....the staff is nice, the pizza "eh" burger and dog not bad..fries good. wings good, all in all pretty good evening....tacos, pizza and a couple others..also not bad the buffet............ breakfast lunch and dinner...all ok..not great, but what you would expect at a buffet....i am picky and was still able to find something to eat and get full at every meal....some stuff you will like some stuff you wont..period! if you want gourmet meals..why are you at a buffet anyway? omelets for breakfast are great! and the wait staff is great...make sure to tip..they work hard for you and a couple dollars goes a loooong way...we had our drinks waiting for us every time we went in! the grill.....good atmosphere..good food fun staff if you joke with them they play back....ask for the Mexican tom cruise. drawback...only a few options on the menu "all inclusive" different steaks are an extra charge. i expect an extra charge for lobster but 50$ holy crap...and if i want a sirloin instead of flank steak its another 17$...so not totally all inclusive, but i had the flank steak as i didnt want to pay and it was yummy!...nice sit down time the Italian restaurant....same as the grill..a few options the rest was up charged, and not all that great..the staff was just ok..not fun but not rude...and the food was pretty much just eh the drawback to the Ala cart restaurants is they are not open every day and you dont know when so be prepared to eat at the buffet just in case. the ice cream parlor....all i can say is all good!!! tea time...never went but was told by another traveler with me that it was nice..different types of coffee or tea with or without liquor,cookies and such all in all....the food does get repetitive but if you cant find food thats good enough to eat then you are wayy too picky!! therefore ill give the restaurants 3 stars THE BARS all the bars are open at different times ensuring that you can get a drink at pretty much any time once you figure out which is open when....and dont forget that just because the first bar doesnt open til 10am you can get alcohol for breakfast at the buffet if you wish (go mimosas) the lobby bar..while a little more "formal" not a bad bar..you can watch tv or play on the internet (if you pay) the hours are like 3-10 or something 3.5 stars papos bar....upstairs bar..open evenings like 8-2 or something.....while it has a pool table and music playing, or you can play the giant chess set..the service SUCKS the bartender was extremely rude and if you didnt tell him EXACTLY what you wanted immediately he would just walk off and ignore you...a total jerk!! that sucks because its the only bar open late! im giving this one 1 star only because its a nice view from the roof and cool atmosphere there is a bar by the dive shop, but i was only at that one once, when i was they were friendly so a 4 star the pool bar....here is the fun! the best bar by far!!!! jesus and miguel are the best..they are fun..will joke, play and make a show for you, ALWAYS friendly and easy to get along with!! all you have to do is say "jesus...gimme a special" and he will whip you up something pretty darned good, usually frozen, maybe not really strong alcohol wise, but if you want that order a rum and coke or something...vacation is all about trying new stuff! the best thing about it is you can get what you want...if you want strong...we had tequila or johnny walker red....if you want fruity or mild so you dont get wasted and ruin your day nooo problem jesus will take care of you...be sure to tip him well he is worth it! so pool bar 5.5 stars yes its over the range but it was that darned fun! THE ENTERTAINMENT you can get bikes or play ping pong, bingo, always something going on just look at the board...the staff tries really hard and are all really nice..they will sit down and eat with you, learn your name (which is a nice personal touch) get you to do a dance lesson by the pool etc...they are from all over, Germany, Mexico, USA, Denmark..a well rounded crew. Alejandro was constantly saying hi and calling us by our names and trying to get us to come to the nightly show. they do try to sell you tickets and get you to go to the club with them around 10 but same thing..not pushy at all. the shows were what i would call a high school production..quaint..not some professional show, which was nice to see normal people doing their thing. we saw a disney show (more for the kids but get the kids involved) so pretty good a 70s show with dance numbers and music from the 70s....cute! love is in the air!! a pop show where they each do a number as some pop idol like justin timberlake, madonna, j-lo, michael jackson...etc....also fun..not perfect..a few mistakes but thats part of the charm! an anything goes night where they pull audience member up and make them play games...cute..i had fun! a mexican show...professionals brought in...i liked the staffs shows better, but authentic and cool none the less! only recommendations i would have is a little more audience participation on the 70s and pop show...like a good idea would be to..after they take their bow, play one more song like we are family for the 70s or something....and the staff go into the crowd and get them up and dance with them!! it would be a great personal touch! they make a fun time even better so 4.5 stars go Alejandro! THE DIVE SHOP very nice crew.....got the impression that Bruno was getting annoyed with me because of the questions day after day (it was too windy so we couldnt dive til the last day) but the dive was great..David is a great instructor...Bruno was great on the dive, David even though he lost his mask he kept a good spirit and helped us, Stephan was very respectful and helpful.. .4.5 stars THE RUNDOWN its not totally all inclusive like you may think..with the extra charges for certain food...top shelf alcohol....internet (12$ an hr)..35$ if you lose a towel....3$ a day for the safe unless you want to upgrade......but realistically you get what you pay for and i fully believe i got WAY more than i paid for...a good solid vacation and i would go back in a heartbeat...so a definite 4 stars

Reviews.Title: “Excellent vacation !”
Reviews.Author: anni2000
Reviews.Content: We recently returned from a 1 weeks stay at the Reef. We travelled with our 3 young adult children. We had an absolutley fantastic time .We chose the Reef based on the size, the beach, and our budget. We had read the reviews prior to going and we weren't sure what to expect. Let me begin the the staff.... in a word, just great. The desk staff was helpful and courteous, the cleaning ladies did a nice job, the wait staff and bar staff were friendly and helpful. One day, my daughter was sick in bed. The cleaning ladies came in and cleaned around her and then left her with extra bottles of water. The wait staff was also very eager to please. The man at the tourist help desk was very friendly and helped us plan our trip to Tullum, He helped us rent a car for the day and he gave us some money saving tips on tours off of the resort. The same can be said of the staff at the bar. We fouind that if we were kind and respectful to the staff, then they were as well. We did tip them throughout the day and it was appreciated. They work very hard and it gets very busy at the swim up bar. The rooms were average, somewhat small, but very clean. I only slept there, so it was fine for us.The beds were hard, but not uncomfortable. The pillows were too hard for me, so I requested something softer and I was given it. They were very sparce with the towels, but that was fixed with a phone call to the desk every day. Looking back, I should have just talked to my cleaning lady. I'm sure that she would have iven us what we wanted. The resort was beautiful and well kept. The jungle feel was authentic.The beach was gorgeous. Yes, the chairs on the beach were close together, but we just moved ours out a ways to feel a little more private. We chose a small resort because we wanted the intimate feel. We didn't want our kids at one end of the resort and us at the other. Overall, we really liked the size of the resort, although I do think that the size presented some limitations in the dining room. The food was average, but we found something that we liked at every meal. We particularly enjoyed dining on the outside patio. The specialty restaurants were good. We did have to wait to get into one of them, but this was OK with me. I have been to other all inclusive resorts where waiting was not an option. If you didn't have a reservation, you couldn't get in and reservations were hard to come by. Some of the menu items were at an additional charge. If you didn't want to pay it, then just choose something on the menu that is included. If you wanted to participate in activities, they were available, or if you just wanted to relax, it was perfect. This was a vacation on a budget and we felt that we got a good value for our money spent. Overall, I would say that this is a 3-31/2 star resort. If you are looking for fine dining and luxury, then this is not the place for you. But if you are like us, and looking for a nice place, friendly atmosphere and beautiful surroundings, then you will be very happy. You are not paying for 4-5 star accomodations or food, so don't expect it. What we got was well worth what we paid for and we hope that we get to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Looking forward to our 5th visit”
Reviews.Author: currysparks
Reviews.Content: We are looking forward to our 5th visit in 6 years. We go every October and have brought family and friends along with us. The beach is wonderful. The grounds are very clean and well kept. Food is good and the staff is always friendly. The main reason we keep coming back is that the resort is small, reasonably priced, staff is great, beach is unbelievable, swim up bar is the best and the layout of the resort is beautiful. For the money, The Reef is the best way to go. For repeat guests, they give you lobster dinner, snorkel tour and many many more. You seriously can't go wrong with this resort. We've traveled the U.S. and we have traveled Puerto Vallarta. But we keep coming back to The Reef. My wife and I along with 2 others, look forward to another wonderful trip next month.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible, horrible, horrible”
Reviews.Author: Cecilia C
Reviews.Content: The hotel is nice -lots of vegetation, and a nice sort of authentic feeling to the architecture. We got a nice room and it was comfortable. Unfortunately, the service we got and many of the hotel "rules and regulations" ruined our family vacation. Staff at the three restaurants was nice and really made an effort. They were the only ones, though. Staff at the bars was mostly awful (and so were their drinks) and some of the staff at the reception was very unhelpful and even rude (I got yelled by someone who seemed to be a manager at the reception). The hotel tries to make money out of everything they can. Wifi prices are outrageous and you can only use it in the lobby- what is more, they want to charge you the outrageous price for every device you want to connect! They try to charge you for using the safe in the room, many drinks and meals are not included in the supposedly "all-inclusive" plan, etc, etc. Food in the main (buffet style) restaurant is terrible to a level I can't even describe. Breakfast was ok (mainly because I only ate fruits and ham and cheese), but lunch and dinner were awful- food was greasy, badly cooked, just plain horrible. Food in the other two restaurants was ok (and some of it was even good) but the menu was limited (at least what was included in "all-inclusive" plan) and the restaurants were small (had to wait for 30 min at one of them and the hotel was not even close to being full). Restaurants are closed on some of the nights (rotating or so). The cleaning service was not great. You got the feeling they only made the bed and left. The beachfront is TINY and chairs and gazebos are all crammed in a very small space. We went there because we were traveling with my brother's family and kids stayed for free. I think we would not go back to this hotel even if it was free for children AND adults.

Reviews.Title: “Great location/ average food!”
Reviews.Author: Feex
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for our honeymoon, it was my first trip to Mexico. We loved the jungle setting, the agoutis and lizards running around, and the size of the resort. Our room was right by the pool and restaurants, it was a great location, we could also glimpse the ocean through the palm trees. The air conditioning was also great! One thing we didn't like was how hard the beds were but it was tolerable. The staff were really friendly and helpful. Our romantic dinner on the beach got rained out by a terrible storm and Elmer and the guys at the italian restaurant went out of their way to make sure we still had a great night. I would say the major drawback of this resort is how not great the food is. The food was usually just ok, we would have loved some more mexican dishes at the buffet. It's probably fine though if you are going on a lot of day trips or heading into Playa del Carmen to eat once in a while. I would definitely reccomend this resort to others as long as an extremely gorgeous beach is more important to them than an extremely delicious meal!

Reviews.Title: “Great vacation for husband's birthday”
Reviews.Author: jaimepatterson
Reviews.Content: My husband and I visited the Reef for his 30th birthday. It was our first trip to an all-inclusive resort and I did a lot or research about this particular hotel before booking. After the reviews my expectations were pretty low but the price was right and we figured as long as there was a beach we could make the best of it. We were very pleasantly surpirsed. The grounds were beautiful and they took very good care of them. One thing we both loved is that it wasn't a giant resort and they did their best to help the buildings blend in with the natural surroundings. The pool and beach area were great - clean and plenty of chairs/beds. Our room was clean apon arrival and cleaned very well every day. We didn't hear people through our walls but we definitely heard people outside walking up the stairs and to their rooms. It wasn't so terrible that it interupted our sleep, we only heard it when we were awake. Drinks and the service were good. The service was especially good in the nicer restuarants and Papo's Bar. My only complaint would be the food. It was not the best, especially in the buffet. Although, my husband and I are pretty picky. The restaurants were definitely better - I would recommend eating at them each night for dinner. Although, even the restaurants were not the best food and could get kinda of repetitive if you eat there each night. Overall we had a great first time experience at an all-inclusive. We have already talked about going back with friends and/or family next year.

Reviews.Title: “Don’t know where to start!”
Reviews.Author: North54
Reviews.Content: I guess I’ll start with something positive. The grounds were beautiful. The jungle setting, the giant squirrels, geckos etc. were a pleasant surprise. The groundsmen kept the walkways spotless despite the ever falling fruit. The restaurant and bar staff were very friendly and courteous with one exception, the pool snack bar, where I waited in line for quite a while then ordered, several Spanish speaking guests behind me ordered the same food and were given their food first. I should mention this was in the daytime and the time we visited in the evening it was a different cook who was very helpful. The buffet restaurant was very good, the food was excellent quality, though not a lot of seafood besides fish. The a la carte restaurants were very nice. The food at them was cooked perfectly but over half the entrees required a surcharge of $17. At the steak restaurant the only steak available without surcharge was flank.
