This differed from the last place we stayed (GR Caribe) greatly where everything was included except lobster. When we booked the website said domestic and premium drinks were included. This was not the case. When my husband asked for a Crown and Coke he was told it cost an extra $15 for the premium drink wristband per day. The rooms were just O.K. and the fridge was never restocked with pop. We were only given 2 water bottles a day for the three of us and had to call the desk for extra. Our room and balcony faced a fence. The desk staff was great! The concierge however soured the whole stay. I asked for directions to the Expedia rep so I could book my shuttle back to the airport. The concierge tried to sweep us into his desk area and told us we needed to sit down so he could tell us about the hotel. As we were already late to meet 2 other couples at the Cozumel ferry, I tried to explain we only needed to book our shuttle tickets, he semi flipped out and told me he would no longer speak to me as I had a bad attitude. My husband told him he wouldn’t have him speak to his wife that way and that he needed to apologize. He said, “ I will not apologize, look at her face she has a bad attitude and doesn’t need our help” In a very mocking and sarcastic manner. My husband asked to speak to his boss and he said, “I am the boss” I talked to the desk staff and the manager and they did assure me they would deal with it. After it was clear we were not interested in the timeshare demo we got almost no bell/taxi service until the night we left. We found the guests at the resort especially friendly and made friends with people from all over the world. The entertainment staff was also a pleasure. Overall it was not a terrible resort but after staying at the GR Caribe in May, I guess we were spoiled and expected a lot better. I would not go back.

Reviews.Title: “OK for the size of the resort”
Reviews.Author: mnbeachlover50
Reviews.Content: Upgraded our room and our fridge was never filled. Charged for the safe on check out, but they removed the charge. When I told them I didn't want to pay for the upgrade, $30 per day, because we didn't get the whole package there was conveniently no one to remove the charges. They will have to ask their staff if they filled the fridge because they were never in our room! Nice resort, food was not the best, Very boring at night. Walk into Playa, taxi back. we have been to at least 10 resorts in the area and this one would not be on the top of my list. Beautiful beach!

Reviews.Title: “Heading back!”
Reviews.Author: jessa0614
Reviews.Content: My husband and I visited The Reef last September for our honey-moon, and we had a lovely time. It was our 4th trip to Mexico in just as many years - 3rd time to the Riviera Maya. In our previous 2 trips to the area we stayed at VERY large resort - we picked The Reef because it was the exact opposite. We loved it so much that we're heading back there almost exactly one year to the day - and we can't wait!!

Reviews.Title: “Great time!”
Reviews.Author: lukac7
Reviews.Content: Had a great vacation at The Reef. The resort was very clean and the gardens were beautiful. It rained a few days during the vacation, so the wooden planked areas were a little dangerous, but the staff mopped the areas and signs were posted. The rooms are very nice - not as large as some of the other resorts, but they served the prupose. One benfit was cooling the smaller room - the air conditioning was very cold at night. Had a nice bathroom with a large soaking tub and a window in a vaulted space with shelf in the tub enclosure. I read alot of reviews regarding noise and thin walls. At some times during the day, you could barely hear people next door. We did not have any issues with this the entire trip. The pools were very nice and refreshing due to the rain. We loved the canopy beds around the beach and the pool - great spot to relax. The pool bar was a bit clique-y and you had to tip Jesus to get fast drink service. Felix at the beach bar was great! The food was very good. I can't figure out how some other reviews would comment on the lack of variety - there was always plenty of choices, including some very good traditional authentic Mexican. It was convenient having the restaurant located by the pool/beach. A few nights, they had vendors around the pool selling jewelry, cigars, crafts, etc. We ate at the steakhouse restaurant one night. The service was excellent. We were given a choice between 2 salads, 2 soups, 3 entrees (additional entrees available at extra cost) and 3 desserts. There was an additioanl charge for a bottle of wine with dinner, and the views of Cozumal from the roof terrace are really nice. One night, the regular buffet was closed in favor of a dinner theater with a show, which was also very nice. We plan on returning next year to The Reef. I would definitely recommend this for the service and value.

Reviews.Title: “Had a beautifull time in this beautifull place even if it's not perfect. It's a good deal for a not bad place.”
Reviews.Author: mimiQu
Reviews.Content: Went in August 2011 with 2 teenagers and one other adult. Pros - Little resort with a lot of nature. Beautiful trees and animals everywhere, bravo - Lots of possible shade on the beach and around the pool - Jesus, the pool barman, the lady at the omelets oven, every waiter in the buffet and even better at the two a la carte restaurants are very sympatico - Snack bar, Beef and Italian restaurant are fine - Lots of bed on the beach and pool - Rooms are fine - Beach if great but they should pickup weeds more often - Water activities are fine - Everything is near - When they offer something or you ask something, they will respect it, but you have to remind them - Small walk to 5e avenue of Playa Del Carmen witch id great - Cons - Service at the bar on the roof is not very good - Pool are small and water gets very hot - The have a lot a people pushing sales of timesharing or special club membership. They will give you an interesting compensation but you will have two hours of pressure, believe me since we went - Bath and shower should be retouch - The middle bar in the center is very nice but each time we wanted to go it was closed - Only two a la carte restaurant but they are fine and without reservation - Better reserve chairs/bed at 6am for the best places since the go fast but their always some free chairs - If you need an extra beds, they are very hard - When you ask for something’s like missing beds or towels, would better ask more then once to get it - Would be nice to have a bit more shade in the pool - Kids should be concentrated in the no bar pool Results - A beautiful resort with personalized service that needs to be modernized a bit. It’s not a 5 and not a 4 but a 3 with a plus touch. For the price you get a good deal and will have a good time.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: mortyWinnipeg
Reviews.Content: Went there in February, went with a group of 8, had a great time. food was fantastic. Staff were great, would go back in a heart beat.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Holiday”
Reviews.Author: Karen T
Reviews.Content: Just arrived back in dreary Wales, U.K, after a fantastic holiday staying at The Reef. We would just like to stay that we could not fault anything about this place. Our room was lovely on the top floor and just opposite a cenote and beautifully decked area where you were served high tea. The rooms were spacious and spotless and cleaned daily. The grounds are awesome, it felt like we were in an eco-jungle like setting and the Agoutis and Coati mundis delighted us. The food was excellent, the buffet catered for every taste and the waiters who were always immaculate could not of been more diligent and hard working. The pool areas were delightful and the beach was to die for. There was always enough sunbeds for everyone and we never queued for anything. You couldn't do better on location, there was a really cute shopping area for crafts "Plaza" just 10 minutes walk away and 5th Avenue was a few minutes taxi ride away 70 pesos, we were just too lazy to walk! Anyone who complains about this hotel must be crazy or just plain miserable! Special thanks to all the staff especially Gilbert our waiter who always had such a lovely smile, Victoria the breakfast chef who cooked the most amazing omelettes and Gilberto waiter/barman main lobby for his friendship.

Reviews.Title: “We have booked our 13th stay!”
Reviews.Author: Jane K
Reviews.Content: We love The Reefplayacar!! We have been going for 12 years and one year we went twice. Last year we brought the whole family, and they loved it! There were 21 one of us. The beach is awesome and the sunrises are breath taking!!! The food is plentiful, and something for everyone. The staff is great and some have been there as long as we have been going, and remember us when we come back. You can book excursions right from the hotel or just stay on the beach all day. Shopping is within walking distance, either right of left from the hotel. There is also a gof course across the street. Can't wait to get back there! Bill and Jane

Reviews.Title: “Stay someplace else!!”
Reviews.Author: sljames121977
Reviews.Content: The Good- Location and Beach. The Bad, Service was below par, food was medicore and the room was not good. Small and smelled like mildew

Reviews.Title: “7 days not enough!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: usaanduktravelers
Reviews.Content: Having been to all inclusive resorts before, you find a standard and anything less than that just wont cut it. The Reef surpassed any other all inclusive resort we had been to before. The hotel itself is beautiful, the grounds are amazing. Most resorts are built up and feel like you are surrounded by buildings. At the Reef you do not feel that, as the grounds are so tropical and beautifully manicured. Every day we saw staff members sweeping the paths of leaves. The rooms were cleaned daily and to a good standard. Now for the food, plenty of choices if you go hungry its your own fault. They have two reservation restaurants a steakhouse and an Italian. We ate at the steakhouse the waiters catered to our every whim. The food was wonderful!. One really neat place was the taco bar by day it was a snack bar next to the pool and served Chicken Wings, Burgers, Hot Dogs and pizza. But what we loved after we had partied on the roof bar with Miguel the bartender, before going back to the room we stop at the snack bar where they served tacos until the early hours of the morning.The beaches were beautiful and the day beds on the beach and around the pool were great. They had 2 pools one by the restaurant and the other with the swim up bar where Jesus and Marco made sure our glasses were never empty. Take care of your bartenders and they will take care of you. We meet so many great people there, many were returning guests. The entire staff were very friendly it was a truly great vacation. We will be returning in May

Reviews.Title: “The hotel Reef is excellent!! has the most Beautiful beach of playa del Carmen”
Reviews.Author: viajeraeanda
Reviews.Content: The food is nice with a good taste. The personel (waitress,animation, etc.) is kind the beach is so Beautiful, Turquoise sea, they have beds in the beach and umbrellas. I will Definitively get back in december. The hotel was built in a natural environment and they took care about it. They have to improve the bedroom cleaning

Reviews.Title: “My 1st visit,very pleasant!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Act5273
Reviews.Content: This was mine and my husbands first trip to mexico and it was very pleasant!!!!i had a great time and have very few complaints,the ac n the room could have been colder,thats all!!!!!!the swim up pool bartenders were excellent,jesus jonathan and marco!!!!!!were not greedy with the liquor by any means!!!!!!!i WILL stay at the reef again n the future!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Reef!”
Reviews.Author: policegirl911
Reviews.Content: This was our 5th trip to Playa del Carmen Mexico. We have currently stayed at much higher priced resorts (AI) in the area and decided to stay at the Reef this year because it fit nicely into our budget. I can tell you right now that we were not disappointed at all! We loved it and had a fantastic time! The grounds have a beautiful jungle feel and the rooms are in like a bungalow style with 3 floor bungalows with only 4 rooms on each floor! Which is fantastic because you don't get all the hotel hallway noise you experience in regular hotels! Also the buffet is good and the two specialty restaraunts were fantastic, with no reservations needed so it was nice to be able to go when you just felt like it! Also, the ice cream bar opened back up just prior to us leaving and the ice cream was fantastic, i especially enjoyed the coconut ice cream!! yum!! The Reef is right on a beautiful beach and within walking distance to 5th ave or a little taxi drive if you are not in for the walk. Our room was clean when we arrived and cleaned every day we were there and the staff were fabulous!!! They always had a smile no matter how hot or how hard they were working and dealt with some terribly rude disgusting people with that same smile! We had a great time, would recomend it to friends and family and will definately consider this hotel the next time we stay in Playa! Thanks Reef!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful and Relaxing!”
Reviews.Author: trvlgal1969
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I traveled here to celebrate his 40th birthday and what a celebration it was! We cannot say enough about the property, the staff and the beautiful beaches! The bartenders were excellent! Contrary to some reviews, the drinks were not weak or watered down. We of course tipped our bartenders and wait staff for their services as it is a "service", allbeit, all-inclusive, the staff certainly contributes to the overall experience.The room was sufficient, not fancy but comfortable. The room was clean and the bed was fairly comfortable. It was noisy at times as some reviews indicate, but who cares?! You're in Mexico! The noise level never reached an untolerable level and was generally short lived. Our room was also very close to the pools and of course the beach! The food was okay, nothing to complain about really. Our favorite meal of the day (although you can eat all day) was breakfast! We are normally very health conscious but threw caution to the wind when it came to eggs over easy with bacon!! The lady working the grill of the mornings must have been steaming hot, but every morning, she greeted us with a smile and dished out eggs made your way! The hi-light of our trip was obviously the beach! The beach was not over crowded, there were plenty of chairs and if you like to walk the beach, either direction is good people watching and sea shell finding, if that's your thing! We also went inot the beautiful town of Playa del Carmen. If you're going to eat in town, we would highly reccommend Karens and our very favorite, Adela's! Delicious steak and lobster and of course wonderful margaritas! We also met lovely tourists from Uraguay, Argentina and Norway. Everyone was so friendly! We cannot wait to go back and next time take the children and grandparents. Oh, I nearly forgot, we purchased a deep tissue massage for the birthday boy on the beach from Anna. I'm almost positive he was in a trance like state he was so relaxed at one point! Definitely splurge and use this service!

Reviews.Title: “Great resort with only a few quirks.”
Reviews.Author: SLB4vaca
Reviews.Content: The Reef Playacar was a great resort. I went with friends and family. There were 13 of us, so we were a rather large group. I do not have any huge complaints about it. First, I will tell about the positives. The staff was excellent (with only a few exceptions). The grounds are kept up beautifully, the beach is large and there are TONS beach chairs. We never ever had any problems finding one. The rooms weren't large, but they were relatively clean, with the occasional spider and mosquito. That can't be helped though. (BRING YOUR BUG SPRAY! We got eaten alive by mosquitos!) There were lots of bars... One by the beach, one in the pool (this was the best bar, by far), one in the buffet restaurant, one in the lobby, and one above the lobby (this one was open until 2 am, which was fabulous!). The bartenders were happy to make you whatever you want (at least the ones we had) and we got drunk. Some other reviews were saying how the bartenders acted like the alcohol came out of their own pocket. Not so.. A few of them actually joined in! All of the restaurants were good and the food was always fresh. A few reviews said that the food made them sick. We never had any problems with this. But now for the negatives. The buffet got really repetitive and by the end of the week I was completely burnt out (but technically I guess it's my fault since I am so picky. I didn't like a lot of the stuff they offered.) Like I said before, the mosquitos were awful! A few of the staff were rude, but I think it may have been because some of them couldn't understand much English. We got into it with a staff member about something and in the end they were the ones in the wrong. This gentleman apologized up and down. So at least they are willing to admit they are wrong. Overall, this resort was a great value. It was one of the cheaper resorts, but I don't think we could have gotten anything better! If you are comtemplating The Reef, be assured that it is a great place to stay and you will not be sorry!!

Reviews.Title: “It's just Okay. Not great, not horrible"”
Reviews.Author: DGoettsche13
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in Playa Del carmen several times before and The Reef was just Okay. I'll break it down: The good and the bad by catergory. ROOMS: The good...the rooms were clean, maid service did a nice job cleaning,supplying fresh towels, ameninties, bottled water everyday. Room was average size for 4 people. Air conditioner was COLD!! That was awesome. The bad...ants all over the bathroom counter, air cond. leaked, the ceiling in bathroom leaked and bathtub would not hold water. I addressed these issues with the front desk, they said houkeeping would take care of it. Nothing was ever taken care of. The mini refrigerator was never stocked in 7 days. Only 4 cans of soda for 7 days?? It's very noisy. You can hear everything going on outside. POOLS: The good...the pool areas were clean with plenty of chairs, umbrellas and daybeds. We brought our children and they were able to play, pool snorkel and have fun. Great view of the ocean from both pool areas. It was nice to look out across the beauty while relaxing by the pool. The pool bathrooms were nice and clean. The pool snack bar had good choices that my kids would eat. Nachos, burgers, dogs, fries etc. and very fast service. The bad...the swim up bar is very crowded with lots of smokers hanging out. The pool hot tub was broken. The poolside activities are a little boring. SPA: The good...best massage I've ever had! Very relaxing/calming, enjoyable, quiet. The bad...The Spa hot tub was broken. Would have been nice to soak after such a great massage. CHULA VISTA BUFFET: The good....the wait staff was fantastic! Always asking you for refills, clearing your plates and if they can get anything else for you. We enjoyed Marco the evening waiter, he just brought drinks without asking because he remembered what we wanted. Nice selection of fruits, veggies, beverages. The white cream fruit topped cake for dessert was awesome! The bad.....the overall selection was not great. I'll eat anything because I'm not picky, but alot of the time the presentation of the food was not appealing. I love fish, but most of the time the fish was dry and overcooked. My kids hardly ate anything at the buffet, they didn't think it looked good either. I never left the buffet hungry, but would have liked to have seen more appealing meat/maindish choices that were cooked properly. BEACH: The beach was fantastic! Beautiful and plenty of chairs, umbrellas and daybeds. The Reef Marina is right there to help you with snorkel, diving, boats etc. My kids enjoyed the use of the snorkel gear that they used in the pool. PROPERTY: The grounds are very pretty. Definately one of the nicer more authentic jungle type of resort settings. The big treehouse in the center was a nice place to relax and enjoy a Mayan Coffee in the late afternoon. The property is not huge so it was nice to walk wherever you needed to go very quickly. The groundskeepers are always out there cleaning the paths and taking care of the trees. The cute little Sereques' are roaming around and are fun to watch. We even saw the babies that were just born. The only thing I was unhappy about was that the ice cream parlor was closed the whole time we were there. My kids were looking forward to that part and were sad that they couldn't enjoy it. BARS: The bars are open mostly during the day. The only place to get a drink after 10pm is the rooftop bar. The bars at the pool and in the buffet are avrage. I think they were understaffed so you had to wait a little bit to get a drink at times. I was disappointed that everytime I tried to order a mojito, I was told they were out. Huh? I never did get to enjoy a mojito :o( I do have to say that they make their drinks very strong. Mine were never watered down like I've experienced at other resorts. The bartenders were nice. OVERALL: This trip was for our kids. They had a good time , so that part made me happy. This resort is NOT luxury, but I would say it was a good value for someone justing wanting to take an inexpensive trip. I however, would most likely not return to this resort. We only go away on vacation one time a year so next time I will pay a little higher price to get more luxury/amenities. I was disappointed that it really wasn't all inclusive and the bathroom had leaking water and ant problems.

Reviews.Title: “The Reef Playacar is a fantastic resort for the value!”
Reviews.Author: gray01
Reviews.Content: We just returned from Playa del Carmen where we stayed at The Reef Playacar resort. We stayed from July 3rd through the 7th. My husband and I have been to Mexico many times but have never stayed in Playa del Carmen. We really loved this quaint little resort. It is smaller with only 200 rooms and the resort did not feel like it was at capacity. The rooms were simple but kept extremely clean. The jungle ambiance of the resort is beautiful and the grounds are kept immaculate. All the staff was friendly and accommodating. We were surprised at how good the food was in all three restaurants. We have never stayed at an all inclusive resort before and we were very pleased with the buffet restaurant and the two other a la cart restaurants. My only suggestion to them would to offer more vegetarian friendly options in the restaurants and the snack bar. I also was surprised there wasn't more Mexican fare to eat. I love Mexican food and I was looking forward to eating plenty of it but there wasn't many options I noticed. I had really been looking forward to fish tacos on our trip, but had to go off the resort to find them. The pool was great and there is a swim uppool bar, it would get pretty busy though, and I had wished kids were not allowed in that pool. They did have a pool for kids, so it would be nice to have a kid free pool. Even though it was an all inclusive with gratuity included we tipped everyone all the time including housekeeping. I doubt they make very much and a small tip goes a long way. The beach at the resort is absolutely beautiful and the hotel has lots of lounge chairs, umbrellas and beds on the beach and at the pool for guests. We walked to the 5th Ave. area of downtown Playa twice from the hotel. We could walk to downtown from the beach and the sidewalks in about 15-20 minutes. A cab ride either way from the hotel is $7 plus a tip of course. We would definitely stay at The Reef again. You can not beat it for the value you get. We had a relaxing vacation and hope to return to Playa and The Reef soon. Charlotte, N.C.

Reviews.Title: “Great Trip”
Reviews.Author: muncas
Reviews.Content: I just got back from Playa del Carmen, and I was very happy to have stayed at The Reef Playacar, Its not a big resort like the others around it but it was very charming and the staff were very helpful and friendly, I would strongly advice any of my friends to stay there, there was an incident but it was quickly fixed!!!!

Reviews.Title: “A unique resort”
Reviews.Author: kcrisham
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed at The Reef for 5 days at the end of June. I really liked the uniqueness of the resort. It seems as though they took great pains to provide a very natural setting. We felt like we were in the rain forest while walking along the trails leading from the villa to the lobby or to the beach. I loved the "tea time" area. It seemed like we were in a spectacular tree house having a drink. The beach was spectacular! The rooms were large and clean, but could use a little bit of an update. Overall I didn't mind our room, though. However, what I did mind was that construction began in the room right above me at 7 am! There was nail pounding and chiseling sounds that were so loud, that we has no recourse but to get up early everyday. That's not something I was planning on during my vacation. I also was disappointed in the bar-tending staff. They were very unfriendly and at times, downright rude. This was in direct contrast to all of the other wait-service staff who were very friendly and helpful to us during our stay. Also, be careful regarding the all-inclusive package. The Reef is truthful on their website and they state the different levels of their all-inclusive packages. However, if you book your trip through Priceline, Cheap Caribbean, Apple, etc. They just state that it's an all -inclusive resort. We booked an all inclusive package, but we couldn't order some of the dinners on the menu, unless we wanted to pay a significant extra charge. We couldn't order wine or any top-shelf liquors without being charged, also. In addition, if you don't purchase the correct tier of all inclusiveness, you can't have a coffee maker, free safe, bathrobe, mini-bar or room service. That was disappointing to us, as the price that I'd paid to stay at The Reef was the same as it would have cost at one of the RIU hotels that includes everyone in their all-inclusive program. In closing, a couple of other things that I truly enjoyed about staying at this hotel; It's a safe 20 minute walk to the center of Playa del Carmen. Walking around 5th Avenue was a blast! Also, the nightly entertainment that the Reef provided was quite charming. The entertainers consisted of the daytime staff. The had dance numbers and played games with the audience. It was pure Mexican cheese, but so very cute and charming non the less. I was impressed with some of the choreography and the entertainers were very friendly and personable. Overall, it was a very nice stay.

Reviews.Title: “Undecided if we'll return”
Reviews.Author: HappilyMarried01
Reviews.Content: Though the front desk staff was rude and unhelpful. When we checked it the girl didn't know what she was doing and kept asking for help. Maybe she was new but I think it would have killed her to smile. We loved our room and how rooms were in a "jungle" like setting. We chose a top floor so it would be a little quieter and more relaxing and it was. We loved how close the beach and pools were. We never had a problem getting a lounge chair near the beach, but we usually didn't go until late morning/ early afternoon. Water was a little rough but we didn't care! Only down fall of the beach was all the cigarette butts. It seems like where ever you sat they were everywhere! Food was okay, but we mostly ate at buffet restaurant. We went to the grill one night for anniversary and it was great! Good food and service! We tried the Italian restaurant on night and were very disappointed, The service was horrible and food wasn't that good. It took way too long and felt like we wasted out night. Bars were okay. We had a hard time getting service at pool bar. We were very disappointed that in order to have a special celebration for our anniversary, (we were celebrating our 10 year anniversary which happened while we were staying there), we had to pay an extra fee. There was a Mexican Dance party/ dinner on the beach which you could have paid extra for and had no clue about it until we saw it going on. We would have went especially since it was on our anniversary! Would have loved it the resort had informed us about it, even it we were asked at check in. We also found out the hard way that there is no way to get fresh/ new beach towels before 8 am. We are people who like to swim until late in the day, usually until after 7. We though we would be able to get some clean towels before we left for snorkeling in the morning, but were given the run around. We went to where the towels were given out during the day and were told to go to the front desk because none were available until until 8 am, (it was 7:45). We went to the front desk were we were told very rudely that we could only get them at the pool and it wasn't their problem we were given wrong information. Time share people were annoying. We got a note under our door telling us that we had an "important" welcome package waiting for us. We had to meet with the rep. from the travel company to get our return travel information, so we went and it was a stupid "VIP" card that we told them to keep. We were also returning from the beach and were stopped by our room by someone that was dressed like all the staff and ended up being a time share person. We also were disappointed there was no where to get anything to eat or coffee before we left on our departure day. We had a morning flight and our shuttle picked us up at 5:50 am.

Reviews.Title: “We'll be back for sure...”
Reviews.Author: steelhdr80
Reviews.Content: This was our second trip to Playa del Carmen and second time staying at a resort within Playacar (last year we stayed at Allegro Playacar, a few hundred yards down the road). Travelling with my wife and a good friend, we were there to relax on the beach and take our friend to a few sites we visited on our first trip. We did a good bit of research prior to the trip and after staying at a 3.5 star resort last year and trying to stay within budget, we had a good sense of what to expect (or so we thought). I can tell you that our expectations were easily exceeded and I am so happy that we chose the Reef this year. The Reef is a smaller resort compared to some of its neighbors, but what it lacks in size, it makes up in charm. Our check-in process was smooth and our luggage was waiting in our room when we got there. The Rooms: We stayed in 1313 and found it to be exactly what we wanted… King size bed, large closet with plenty of hangers, a mini fridge stocked with soda and water, a flat screen TV, a safe, and a decent sized and very clean bathroom. The air conditioning worked a little too well for my wife’s liking, but hey, it was hot outside. Yes, the walls and door are thin so there is a slight noise issue, but nothing unbearable or worth worrying about. You do have to pay for the safe, but it’s worth it for peace of mind. A 9.5/10 rating due to the minor noise issue. The Pools/Beach: There are two pools at the resort, one with a bar and one just steps from the beach. The pool bar is nice and the service was quick. The pools are spacious and we never felt crowded, but we didn’t spend much time in them to be honest. The beach was great and the surf even better. There were plenty of lounge chairs to go around, but get there early to claim one with an umbrella. Unless you like to really bake in the sun, you will need it! We usually laid our towels on the chairs by 9AM and had plenty others to choose from. Overall, a 10/10 rating. Restaurants/Food: There are 3 restaurants to choose from – the buffet, Italian, and steak house. We found the food at the buffet to be satisfactory, but somewhat repetitious. The selection was decent but always luke warm. There is a salad/fruit/dessert bar which is also decent. We tried the Italian restaurant and found it to be OK. Service was good, but not enough choice. The waiters at the buffet were great and made it a point to keep the table free of used dishes and your glasses full. Overall, the food gets an 8.5/10. Service/Staff: The staff and service was impeccable. There’s really not a whole lot to say about this. Everyone you met wore a smile and always greeted you with a hello. The bartenders had our drinks figured out and a couple of times, had them ready to go before I got there… I guess they saw me coming? Jose at the lobby bar loves his card tricks and is an all around solid dude. The house cleaning/maid service was on top of their game as well. Our bedroom was always clean with fresh towels, water/soda. I forgot my wallet on the night stand one day with a few hundred dollars and not a dime was missing. 10/10 rating. (On a side note – Please make it a point to tip if the service warrants it. If you can afford to travel there, I am pretty sure you can afford a few extra dollars for tips) Grounds: You feel like you are living in a tropical rainforest. The staff is always sweeping the paths free of leaves and litter. There is a lot of local wildlife running around including Agoutis, Iguanas, various birds, and even a Coati. Also a female cat with the smallest black/white kitten I have ever seen. Plenty of shade to keep away the hot sun, but also very humid under the canopy… you will notice the difference. 10/10 rating. Overall, we had an excellent stay at the Reef and our friend is already talking about a return trip next year. It rained a few days we were there (didn’t realize there was a tropical storm lurking offshore), but even then, everyone took it in stride and we never heard anyone complain. As we learned last year, rain showers are an everyday occurrence here, but seldom last more than 10-15 minutes. Pack a poncho or an umbrella if you feel you might melt… no one can control the weather. A few words of caution – be careful walking around on the wooden walkways and the restaurants… they tend to be a little slick after a rain and we saw a few people slip. I read a lot of negative reviews on here, but after a week at the Reef, I can’t say that I experienced anything that would make me give this place less than 5 stars. Aside from a few “holier than thou” families, we felt that most everyone shared the same views as us. Maybe it just has to do with showing the staff the same courtesy and respect they show you…

Reviews.Title: “Back for the second time and it was great!”
Reviews.Author: TweetGavin
Reviews.Content: This was my second time staying here. I went the first time in October of 2009. It was just as I remembered it. This is a great resort for what you pay. If you want fancy meals 24/7 you should pay twice the amount and go elsewhere. If you like an awesome beach, a great pool bar and being close to 5th Street, this is the place for you! The food is good but really just average. The bartenders at the pool bar are great. Look for Jesus (he remembered me from my first trip), Marco and Jonathan. They will take care of you. TIP THEM! You don't have to but they appreciate it and take extra special care of you!

Reviews.Title: “Lousy and NOT All Inlcusive”
Reviews.Author: djmann4
Reviews.Content: This hotel is not as described and certainly isn't "all inclusive" .. Certain meals on the menu are not inlcuded and you will have to pay for lattes, espresso and wines. I was traveling with my 2 children and mother - 4 in a room and we were only allowed 2 towels and 2 bottles of water in our room per day..ridiculous. Oh and the air conditioner did not work - had to be fixed which took all of an afternoon. Hotel staff are not at all friendly or helpful...in fact one of the front desk employees actually said "too bad madame, it is what it is" when I requested more towels in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value for Family”
Reviews.Author: dms15226
Reviews.Content: Beautiful resort. The positives really outnumbered the negatives for our trip. Room--Ours was clean and beds were comfortable (despite what we read in other reviews). The comforters were cotton and soft. Hate going to a hotel with thin polyester scratchy covers. We had 2 double beds for the 4 of us (kids are 9 and 12), so it was an average size. Our view from balcony overlooked center surrounded by trees. I didn't see any rooms with view of ocean since the pool and dining area face the ocean. I still liked our view--it seemed secluded. We also had no problem with noise. It could have been our location, but only one incident when someone banged on a door at 1 AM. Other than that we heard no one. Pools/ lounging/ bars-- We had no problem getting a spot for either chairs or the larger beds, but we were early risers. I did see one family who always had towels out for the same spot (even by 6:30 AM). Service was fine at swim up bar. Of course we received better attention when tipping. I didn't feel the demand to tip; it was just something you may want to do if want extra attention and promptness. There is no service to any of the chairs, pool, or beach area. I have been at other resorts where they do have that service, but they do not do that here. There is a shaded dry entrance to swim up bar. You don't have to get in the water for the other side. Activities- Pretty disappointed in this area. Shows are not their main draw here. One night we went up and they had a private party in the room, so that was out. Another night, they decided to show the USA vs. Mexico soccer match. Understandably a huge draw for Mexico, but we didn't really care for it. For entertainment, room was smaller than what I have seen at other resorts. Although we saw many families at this resort, they did not cater to them. Great Parnassus in Cancun entertained and involved kids in activities, but not the case here. My kids did play volleyball and other games, but did not have the sense of importance played on involvement. Can be seen as a positive or neg. depending on how much you and family want to get involved. On one day we walked down to Playa del Carmen shops. It was about a 15- 20 minute walk on the beach. Once there, you will see a Senior Frogs and then a market of stores for souveniers. (It is hte port for Cozumel). Had a great time looking around. On the other hand, I really noticed the lack of things to do when it rained for two days and we really could go nowhere. The lobby is the only enclosed area to go, so we stayed in our room for one of those days, and then second day the kids swam in the rain and we just gave in to it as well. Overall, the kids were pretty bored. There was one or two staff members for activities and they had a laissez faire attitude. Again, it is what you want for your family. I wish there had been more. Excursions- We puchased a snorkeling trip. Approx. 1 hour of snorkle time. I had read about other packages prior to leaving and almost pre-purchased one but glad I didn't. My advice would be to wait until you get there to see what you and your family would like to do. We paid $106 for the 4 of us and it was a great experience! It felt as if we were swimming in a huge aquarium. Water was clear and shallow, and we enjoyed the boat trip out there (approx. 20 min. to get out to the reef). Food- Not a lot of choices, but food was good. I have experienced better and worse. I know that is not so helpful, but food was pretty average. Kids loved the steak restaurant. We also liked the Italian rest. too. Plenty of food given to you and it was delicious. Kids also like the snack area during lunch. Easy and quick. Ice cream area was closed for renovation. :( Last bit of advice--After arriving at the airport,walk straight outside to your transportation. On our first trip to Mexico, I stopped and listened to those trying to "help" us save money on excursions. They show you a map and it seems as if they are helping you show you around. Don't fall for it. It comes with a price to go to another resort for hours and check them out. On this trip, I fell for it again, but didn't give them the time to get into the explanation. We stopped him in the middle of his speech and walked out to meet our driver. Overall, we enjoyed our stay. You can decide what little to do or more to do. I think if you want to do more, you may have to pay for excursions. If you want to relax, swim, or walk on the beach then this is your place. The beach is absolutely beautiful. We will continue to travel to different locations. There are so many to choose.

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME”
Reviews.Author: Sara92405
Reviews.Content: Ok I'm a little late writing this but I'm so sick of seeing all of the negative reviews. This place was spectacular and my husband and I had the time of our lives. Is this place fancy smancy..no but I didn't want that. We wanted a place that was small and intimate, that you didn't have to walk miles and miles to get to everything and this place is just that. Was our room fancy..no but who the hell cares, I was there to sleep and take a shower and nothing else! The food was good. We ate at the buffet and the Terraza Grill and it was fantastic. We spent most of our time at the pool bar and let me tell you, that is the place to be. Jesus and Marco are the bartenders and they are fabulous!! I had the best time with these guys and they made our trip so much fun!! If you go please tip these guys, they work their butts off and a dollar here and there won't hurt you and it is much appreciated! They made wonderful drinks and fantastic shots!! The staff all were so nice and there was always a nice hello when they would see you! We met so many people from the United States that had just got married and made so many new friends. We are planning to go back next May!! The beach is also gorgeous and there are plenty activities to keep you busy if you want to get involved! Don't pay attention to the negative reviews..if you want fancy go somewhere else, if you want a great time with great people please go here..it was great!

Reviews.Title: “Ok for our first trip, open to the public! Won't make it back.”
Reviews.Author: kristencarter22
Reviews.Content: I researched this resort as much as I possibly could before we went. We were all very excited, it was our first trip (mine and my boyfriend), the couple we were with had been to Playa many times, but not this resort. We wanted something small, accesible to town, and with plenty to do. It is very charming and clean, all of the staff was very friendly. A few things we had to ask for, and only knew about them because of the research I had done. When we checked in they did not let us know about the amenities offered, and there is no literature in the room. We paid an extra $15 per day for "premium alcohol" bracelets. We made sure this included Crown royal. Only 3 of the 4 of us wanted this, but they forced us to get 4 saying if 1 person in the room has it, all have too... there is also pottery painting by the towel pick up near the pool, but you have to pay for the pottery, but this was one of my most enjoyable times! We were taken to our clean room, it was perfect and had everything we needed, no complaints other than a not incredibly comfortable bed, but a large selection of pillows, and the noise outside of the room is quite loud. We were on the first floor and our friends were on the 3rd. We immediatly walked around to view the facility, very nice pools, lovely beach, a very short distance to everything. The ice cream bar is not open. Not while we were there anyway. Saw some iguanas and those rat looking things everywhere, very fun to watch. They were having drinks on the middle area near the waterfall, you had to charge the drinks to your room even though we had a premium bracelet. With our premium bracelt we were also able to get canned beer, so we took some back to the room. We had to sign for that and premium liquor each time. Note: they ran out of Crown royal after about 5 drinks. Not nice. we did have absolut however, and bout redbull in the gift store to mix with. We had dinner at the buffet, good choices, some a little sketchy, but no terrible complaints. Staff is nice and helpful, nice view. We then went to the rooftop bar, not many people (friday night), and to the entertainment show they provide, it felt VERY cheesy, maybe if I hadn't been so tired from flying and had a little bit more to drink it would have been better. Breakfast buffet, again, many many choices, fruit and juices were wonderful. We hung out by the pool and beach all day, but started to notice a LOT of people in the pool in the afternoon, lots of families, seemed like they were local.... come to find out from another couple, the resort apparently let's locals in for $40 a day!!! We were appaled at this point. It would have been more to ourselves and MUCH more relaxing if it was NOt open to the public. I was very upset. FElt like it wasnt a resort any longer. We had dinner in the resteraunt that night (not the italian one), it was very nice, the waiter was delightful, could speak 4 languages, we tipped him well. have to pay extra for premium meals... Again spent the night in the rooftop bar, playing the broken foosball table... ate a late night snack by the pool. Quesadillas or tacos. Tacos were no bueno. The hut during the day by the pool serves hotdogs, burgers, nachos, pizza (that has obviously been sitting out for a while) and fries. I ate about 15 hotdogs while i was there.. oops. One night we paid the guy $10 to make me a hotdog bc i didn't want a quesadilla... The italian resteraunt was ok, fine dining, but not wonderful. You have to pay extra for Filet Mingon and other fish choices... this is NOT an entirely all inclusive place. We would prefer more activities.... We will go to a larger resort next time that is truely and all inclusive, and that is more customer oriented. We went to town twice, once we alked and it poured rain, but that was fun, the 2nd time we took a cab and went to Senor Frogs for the night, had a BLAST! The maid service is spectacular, our rooms were SO clean and organized when we got home. A gal was SUPER wasted by the pool infront of her children one day, but security was present and escorted her out, she was very innapropriate. The bartenders at the pool are great, and so is the man in the evenings in the lobby. We mingled with the entertainment staff quite a bit, became friends with them actually. When we kayaked one morning very early, they helped us get them in the water. We walked for miles down the beach, apparently you can walk around topless bc we saw quite a bit of that on our walks!! The rain was really nice as well, but ruined about 2 1/2 of our days on the beach, but no complaints about rain coming from a Texas girl!

Reviews.Title: “Never again!”
Reviews.Author: Trishtabet17
Reviews.Content: It is he worst place I have ever stayed! The bathroom window was cracked and the handle fell off the first night! The rooms were very small and there were no place to put your clothes. There were no screens on any of the windows or the patio door so Mosquitos were everywhere! It was nothing like any all inclusive resort I have ever stayed at! They did not have alcohol in the room just a few sodas in a very small ridge! There was no room service, most of the restaurants were buffet, and there was no pool service for food or alcohol! If you wanted a drink you had to walk to one of the three bars on the entire property (unless of course you wanted to swim up to the pool bar) through clouds of cigarette smoke! If you happened to be sunning on the beach or swimming in the ocean and you got thirsty or hungry you had to walk all the way back to the resort and wait in line to order a drink or to order food! The food was not good at all! Sitting under heat lamps all day! The kids club was a joke! It was a hut, no air conditioning for the kids and the kids end up being lunch for the mosquitos! No laundry room to do your own laundry. No activities for the kids! The kids pool is right by the bar with all the drunks and cigarette smokers! There was no kid friendly food! Every day was a battle trying to find something the kids could or would eat! Thank goodness for McDonalds in town! I would never go back, I have never been so nickeled and dimmed at any other resort! I would not recommend this place to anyone! And you had to pay for the Internet access! No house phones, except in the rooms. No mobile phone service so very hard to stay in touch with family members. Broken furniture in the room and broken outlet plugs! Difficult to charge your camera equipment, kids hand held video games, no DVD or cd players in the room so you could not watch movies with your kids. Overall I would give this resort a poor rating!

Reviews.Title: “WONDERFUL”
Reviews.Author: jerseybeachgirl57
Reviews.Content: We just got back from the Reef Playacar and I just wanted to let everyone know what a wonderful resort this is. It is not big, which is what we like. It is very comfortable. The rooms were very nice. They were large and very clean. The bathroom was spacious too. The shower had good water pressure and was very relaxing. The restaurants are all good. If you go to one of the specialty places be prepared to pay from 10-17.00 for certain steaks. The wine list is very good in both places. The buffet is also good. Make sure you feed the adorable and very polite kitties that come by. There is a little black and white one with a baby that is just precious. Also enjoy the other native animals roaming around. They are very peaceful and will take bread or fruit from your hands. The pool is nice and the beach is the largest we have ever seen. It is clean and there are plenty of chairs and umbrellas. The pool bar pool must be visited. Check out Jesus, the bartender there. He is a doll and very good at what he does. We also had a young man named Jonathan help us at check in and he told us about all the hotel had to offer as we checked in. The ocean is so nice and warm. We loved it. At the bar try a Dirty Monkey, very good and the tequla is not bad either. We had a wonderful vacation with my brother and his wife. We were talking about going back next year before we even left. Oh, the place is also filled with gorgeous vegetation. There are palms and flowers every where. Loved every moment of our vacation. This resort is a definite must see. Beds a bit hard, but the king was nice and large and pillows great.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed the Stay at the Reef...”
Reviews.Author: Luv2Travel2011128
Reviews.Content: I have never posted a review but feel compelled to share my point of view. We have kids ages 4 and 7 and went with another family kids ages 5, 13, 17. The reef is actually a very nice hotel, beautiful beach, great pool/s, the food is good....and no we did NOT get any food poisoning. For breakfast there were omelttes, waffles, pancakes, sausage, hash brown, cereal, fruit, yogurts, crepes, chilaquiles, sometimes tamales, and a lot of other items. The lunch buffet had a great variety too, there are many desserts at the buffet for lunch and dinner, there was the snack bar by the pool that also served hamburgers, hot dogs, pizza, chicken wings (awesome), night snack served tacos my favorite were the steak tacos with flour tortillas with hot sauce. Drinks were great we usually had a Paloma--tequila with lime and sprite also had Miami Vice and Pina Colada and Margaritas all were great. The ice cream bar is ongoing renovation but they have ice cream available by the snack bar. The walk to 5 Ave. is about 10-15 minutes from the hotel and it's pretty enjoyable....there are some ruins on the way (small ones, but we had great pictures of them). The beds were not as hard as some people have been writing about (and I am used to pillowtop). I would say that my only minor complaint would be that you can hear people go up/down the stairs outside your room or talking-(it wasn't too often though). The water temperature in the ocean must be like 75 or 80 degrees it was amazing. It did rain a few times when we were there but the rain showers did not last very long-maybe 10 minutes and then the sun comes out although on our way back to the airport in cancun it did rain for a few hours and our flight got delayed (but that was 1 day out of 6). We also went to both the Italian Restaurant and the Steakhouse....The chicken florentine was great at the Italian restaurant and the Arrachera (steak) was excellent at the steakhouse. There is a bar by the Theatre (upstairs) and they have 2 pool tables and a foosball table. We only saw one show (the Michael Jackson show) it was enjoyable (but make sure they tell you the exact time the show starts because it started an hour after they had said it would). There was a dinner/mariachi show by the beach one night but it's an extra cost (it seemed like a lot of fun) we did not pay the extra cost so we kind of watched it from far away. I would say that it is worth it if you don't have kids with you--it seemed like lots of fun. Overall if you are not a super picky person you would enjoy the hotel very much.

Reviews.Title: “Food poisoned, terrible food, but great staff”
Reviews.Author: VLDL
Reviews.Content: I was glued to trip advisor before we booked our trip, and I found it very helpful, so I am happy to write my own take of the Reef Playacar. Please bear with me, it might be long! The grounds: Very well-manicured hotel grounds, with a neat cenote and 'jungle' in the middle. Nice beach, and the pool is ok, though we found it annoying to be trying to cool off with a drink in hand while kids jumped and splashed in the water RIGHT next to us. The room: We had a standard room with a king bed in the 700-building. It was adequate, but nothing to write home about. Our air conditioning worked VERY well, which was good. We found the room to be incredibly noisy, and the walls are paper-thin. We could hear every single door opening, shower running, and people talking. Quite annoying, but we just kept our A/C on all the time to try to drown it out. We did also appreciate the HBO movie channels on our flatscreen tv in our room, too, which was nice to watch on the days we got rained out and hung out in our room. The food: Politely put, the food was not good. Borderline terrible in many cases, actually. We ate at the grill the first night we were there, and were very put off by the fact that the "better" steak meals were an extra charge of $10-$17 USD. We both ate the BBQ chicken with ceasar salad and it was fantastic, but I was still unimpressed that not everything was "all-inclusive" like we thought it should be. The second night we ate at the Italian restaurant with a few friends. Everyone but myself had pasta, and I ordered the chicken and spinach, as well as had some caprese salad from the salad bar. My chicken was really gross. The spinach in it was dry and crunchy, and the lumpy white sauce on top was not appetizing. The entree pasta was not cooked enough, and there was no meat (chicken, etc) in it. We also found the portions in the Italian restaurant to be quite small. ALSO, within 20 minutes of finishing our meal, I was VIOLENTLY ill and threw up so hard that I broke major blood vessels in both my eyes. It lasted all night, and I felt horrible all the next day. No one else who ate with us got sick, so I am thinking it was the chicken or the salad I had, but I was quite put off that I got that ill from presumably poorly-cooked/handled food. We did not return to the Italian restaurant after that. The buffet in the morning is all right. I had an omelet every day, and the lady working at that station does a great job. I found most things to be quite heavy/greasy, though, and not much variety from day to day. Some items in the buffet were ok, but none of it went together. So most meals there were not cohesive or as good as they could be. There is no room service here, and no beach drink waiter service, which we didn't realize until we arrived. It is quite a hike from the beach to the nearest bar or snack bar, so keep that in mind when choosing a lounge chair for the day. The snack bar is sub-par. The burgers are strange-tasting and VERY greasy. I was too scared to try a cold cut meat sandwich after my food poisoning incident, so I mainly stuck with fries from the snack bar during the day. The ice cream parlour was also not open the whole time we were there. If you decide to book with this resort, PLAN ON EATING IN PLAYA DEL CARMEN at least a few times. We were only there for one week, and we ate 3 of our meals in town, as we were SO bored of the same stuff everyday. Also, make sure you bring a lot of Immodium, as your stomach will likely be sick from the heavy and greasy food. The drinks: We were expecting to get bottles of beer, but were met with chea-tasting draft beer instead. The generic mexican liquor they use is awful, but after a few drinks, it's all the same. If you drink at Papos bar, ask for liquor like Smirnoff vodka or Appleton's rum--both aren't top shelf, but are MUCH better than what you'd normally get. A little lime in your drink also helps take the bite out a bit. The staff: The service and staff was absolutely amazing. We hung out at Papos bar (above the lobby) in the evenings, and Eric there is awesome. A few dollars in tips goes a long way in always getting good service. In fact, our favorite drinks were always ready for us within minutes of walking in. When we ate in the grill restaurant, the wait staff was very attentive and friendly. The buffet dining room staff were good at clearing all the dirty plates in a timely manner, and always stopping by to ask what we wanted to drink. All in all, we had an ok time. We were definitely ready to come home, though. The nice grounds and awesome service didn't make up for the awful food, in my opinion. We won't be returning, and we would not recommend this resort to our family and friends.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay in Mexico...Playcar is THE BEST”
Reviews.Author: CCENZ
Reviews.Content: I am a seasoned All-Inclusive Carribean traveler. I've been to Mexico close to a dozen times. I've been to several resorts in Hotel Zone in Cancun and several resorts in Riveria Maya. This was the first time I stayed in PLAYACAR. I think I enjoyed this LOCATION better than all of the other places. Playacar is a gated community. We felt TOTALLY safe. Whether walking into Playa Del Carmen via side walk or walking the beach. Resort: Reef Playacar is nice & quaint. If you're looking for MEGA RESORT there are plenty to choose from. The Reef is much smaller and easy to get around. Beach is AMAZING; Ocean is spectacular; Pools are OK.. Jungle like atmosphere was great. There are wild freaky animals that live on the property...don't know WHAT they are. One looks like a dog size hampster. The other is a combination of a monkey and a cat with the face like a possom. Curious animals who are calm/friendly and NOT afraid of humans. Room: A/C was awesome - which is important when it's 90+ degrees outside. Beds were hard...but I slept like a rock. Yes...you can hear when your neighbors come/go...but it wasn't an issue for us. We stayed in room 1531 (3rd level) with double beds. The room was always clean and always cool. Balcony was cool to people watch. Food: Restaurants were very good. Service was fantastic. Buffet...no better / no worse than any other Mexican All Inclusive. You can always find something to eat. Snack bar was good. Chicken Wings were amazing. Pico was so fresh. Bars: OK...I'm not much of a drinker. They kept filling my water bottle with ice water so I was happy. Staff: They work very hard. They're constantly walking the beach to pick up garbage / cups. They keep the resort immaculate. Enjoy your stay @ The Reef Playacar !

Reviews.Title: “Avoid The Reef Playacar at all cost! Bad! Bad! Bad! Please read!”
Reviews.Author: gordonstech
Reviews.Content: I brought my wife and 2 adult sons. We went there and stayed 9 days. We were gone all day the first few days so we were only there at night. The first thing that we noticed was that the food at the buffet was not very good. They really need a better cook. The second thing that we noticed was that the servers were very nice. But if you did not tip them everytime you ate, they remembered you and would not be as helpful and friendly the next time you came in. One night the buffet was closed from 5:00pm to 7:00 pm. Very confusing! Stay away from the snack bar. You would be better off at McDonalds in Playa del Carmen. Here is what really ticked me off. They allow local vendors to come in and set up their little stands inside the resort every day. They are strategically placed so that you cannot get to the beach, buffet, bar or snack bar without passing all of them. When you pass, they offer to sell you silver and cigars at the best prices. They are like vultures trying to squeeze every last penny out of you. I truly feel that you should be safe from their marketing practices in your resort. Here you are not. If you want to use their internet, you must go to the lobby and pay cash of $12.00 US daily. If you get sunburned and need Aloe, go to the convenience store and you can pay a hefty price of $13 USD for a small bottle of Aloe. Just another example of the squeeze that they put on us the american tourist. But what prompted me to write this review is this incident. My oldest son went into the bathroom and slipped in some wet substance on the floor. It looked like urine to me. When he fell, he hit his head on a glass door and split his head open. They were very nice and offered to call for a doctor but I examined my son and determined that he did not need medical care or stitches. A bandage sufficed. So we went along through the week enjoying our stay. But when we went to check out we got a little surprise. They charged us a whopping $350 US for the glass door. I was floored. I didnt know how to respond but as soon as I gathered my wits, I told them no! I would not pay for this. That is ridiculous. Their response was that they were calling the police and that we would be detained and miss our flight home. Can you believe this? It really happened. Needless to say, I paid for the glass because I certainly dont trust the Mexican police. This was a horrible way to end our vacation. It was high stress and I simply dont want to go to Mexico anymore.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice, but could improve some areas. Had great time!!”
Reviews.Author: GO_TEXAS
Reviews.Content: Let me start by saying this is an unbiased review by an American who has previously stayed at 2 other all-inclusives in the Playa Del Carmen. I am NOT a picky person, so here is the real deal review. WHAT I LIKED: THE BEACH - What can I say, but this is the absolutely best beach in Playa. All sand, no rocks, blue water, gentle slope. Very large wide beach. THE ROOMS - Very nice rooms, large, cozy, beds are not too hard as some describe. In fact I realized I slept better on these beds, than my own at home. They are kept clean. Just be sure you get one with one of the new "Trane" air conditioners. Ours was on the blink when we were there and after we complained, they replaced it with a brand new Trane one, while we were out on the beach. They seem to be replacing them as they go. As far as complaints on noise. The doors ARE NOT louvered as some suggested. They are faux louvers and you can hear people next to you slam their doors, but it is not as bad as people have said on these reviews. Nice balcony's too. THE GROUNDS - Wow, very cool jungle small setting. VERY well manicured with cool cenote waterfall in the front and middle. I also liked the fact that it was small and easy to get around. I like the building arrangements. THE BARTENDERS - Worked their tails off and made great drinks. Just tip em every now and then. THE SPECIALTY RESTAURANTS - These are good. The Italian is better food and better service. The grill is good but most things on the menu are $ upgrade items. If you don't want to pay, there are only three entree choices. We caught a Wahoo fish and they grilled it for us and it was great. The grill service was kinda slow though. WHAT I DID NOT LIKE OR MEDIOCRE: EXTRA CHARGES - you would think that since you are paying for all-inclusive that some things would come with it. Had to pay extra for the room safe. Extra for coffee in the lobby. The restauraunt coffee is free. There is extra charge for premium liquor. But what was the worst is that they actually charged for one of the shows. It was a mexican beach party and they wanted $20 per person!! Come on, those should be included. AIR CONDITIONING IN THE LOBBY - They keep it closed and don't turn on the AC until 8am. Why is this? We had to wait before then and I sat there and sweat BIG TIME. I don't get this one. THE SHOWS - absolutely terrible. The staff worked hard but sorry they just don't measure up to other resort shows. I am sure that is budget related. The only one that I got excited about was the mexican beach party, but they wanted to charge and I am cheap. UMBRELLAS - There seem to be plenty of them on the beach, but why not put Palapa's out on the beach, they are much nicer, mexican authentic, and provide more shade. They are only small enough to shade 2 people each, but they work. Don't worry you will find shade. SAILBOATS - there was only 1 working one and it was so beat up, I could not sail it for long. You are just asking to be stranded on one of those and I am an experienced catamaran sailer. THE FOOD - I thought the dinner buffet was just so so. I only ate there twice for dinner. The first time, it was absolutely terrible. The last time it was just ok. The deserts totally suck on the buffet. There seems to be fairly good variety. The breakfast and lunch buffets were good though. I liked the snack bar, buffalo wings. THE POOLS - very small swim up bar pool and is too crowded. It was also about 5 degrees warmer than the other pool and I can only guess why. The other pool was larger and not as crowded as it is the activity pool and not much activity was going on. I actually used that one since I could hardly get a swim up bar seat and that pools "warmth" grossed me out. All in all this is a very nice resort and I would go back, we had a great time and enjoyed the staff. I would recommend it, but very picky food buffet eaters might want to choose something else. I will say that I never really got sick while I was there.

Reviews.Title: “We love this resort!!”
Reviews.Author: Postalguy
Reviews.Content: First of all we've been to Mexico 4 times so I do have something to compare this to. The location and the beach are by far the best. The food is average and by that I mean it's as good as the other resorts that we've been to. The resort is small which is one of the things that make it unique. We met some very nice people from all over and because of the size of the resort we ran into them numerous times. Hats off to Marco and Jesus at the pool bar. Thanks for the Tequila. I wish I could remember drinking it! We like to think of this resort as our home away from home. Just remember that this isn't a 5 star $10000 per couple resort. You won't be eating lobster and having people kiss your feet. You may have to get up off your butt and get a drink yourself. After eating all day a little exercise won't kill you. We plan on returning in September. With the price of this place we can afford to go more than once per year.

Reviews.Title: “Good resort, great location, beautiful beaches, great staff, some improvement neede.”
Reviews.Author: 2jq2u
Reviews.Content: This was our 1st trip to Playa Del Carmen. We traveled with 25 people for a friend’s wedding. Upon arriving the grounds are beautiful and the staff was very nice but busy. It took over 1 hour for our luggage to be delivered to our room. Rooms: We were a little disappointed in the room. The rooms are a little small and very outdated. The beds are very hard, bathroom has no ventilation and the walls are paper thin. We could hear all of our neighbor’s conversations, babies crying and people walking up and down the stairs ALL night long. Some rooms in our unit must have been under renovation because construction started at 8:00 am most mornings and lasted throughout the day. We had to be up and out of the room earlier than we wanted. The maid service did an excellent job at cleaning our room but would only leave two towels and washcloths every day when three of us were in the room. The mirror in the bathroom always had water stains down it so there must have been a leak from the unit above us. Forget using the refrigerator, it was never cold. Staff: Jesus was great at the pool bar but we gave him a large tip right away and tipped him throughout our 7 day stay. I didn’t catch the other gentleman’s name at the pool bar but didn’t want to. He was VERY rude and wouldn’t even stir our mixed drinks after making them (bloody mary’s). We watched him with other customers and he treated them the same. The entertainment staff was very friendly. Allejandro, Jonathon and Daniel did a great job. They were constantly keeping us entertained and would call out to us from a distance just to wave. The dive shop staff was excellent. Food: The breakfast buffet was okay but we were very tired of it by the end of our stay. We never ate at the lunch buffet and only ate at the dinner buffet the first night of our stay. We were pleased with the grill and Italian restaurant. All 25 people in our party were very pleased with the snack bar after a long day of playing but they ran out of food often and the ice cream station was rarely open, when it was open it was a bit dirty. Alcohol: Upon making reservations we upgraded to premium bracelets for the two adults in our family. Upon check-in we were given and charged for (3) premium bracelets. I told them we had one minor in our room, they switched the bracelet. I tried explaining the difference in the cost but he could not understand me. I figured I would correct it at check-out but he also said he could not understand. They never gave me credit for the difference in the cost. The alcohol was VERY watered down. Although we had premium bracelets we were served the same alcohol as EVERYBODY else. Pools & Beach: The beach is beautiful and plenty of chairs and umbrellas for everyone. There is no drink service on beach so it’s a small hike to the nearest bar. The pools are well maintained and very clean. There is no entertainment at the pool, no music unless you brought your own, which we did. Overall: You get what you pay for and nothing else. I was a bit confused as to why the bars were only open at certain times for alcohol only but open at all times for soft drinks, especially the lobby bar, it should be open all day for whatever beverages one wants with customers checking in and departing. I must reiterate that the staff was extremely pleasant besides the one gentleman working the pool bar. I would also like if someone would clarify the premium upgraded bracelets that is paid for in the beginning for 3 guest when only 2 guest were adults, no credit was given.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: KillerCoconut
Reviews.Content: Let me start with the good. The beach was quiet and beautiful! Always enough chairs and beds to go around. The staff at the pool bar (specifically Jesus and Marco) were attentive, social & fun. The two formal restaurants (Terraza Grill and Botticelli) had amazing food and great service. Also, skip the buffett for lunch and hit the snack bar by the pool which had your basic finger foods like hamburgers, nachos and deli sandwiches. Overall the resort is in a great location and short walk to Playa with small ruins on the way. Now for the not so great: Rooms: While the room size was okay for us, the walls might as well have been made of paper. It's so noisy with doors slamming and people walking up and down the stairs. The buildings are open so there are 3 floors with 4 rooms on each. Every night we were woken up by our neighbors because it sounded as though they were in our room. Closing the closet door helped minimally so we left the tv on in an attempt to block out the noise. Also, mold in the room and moisture issues due to no fan in the bathroom. On our second to last day our air conditioner stopped working as well. We heard from others that their beds were hard but we had no problem (had a King with pillow top). Unfortunately though, our balcony faced the back of the property (facing the back of another resort) where the workers walked (talked and pushed noisy carts) and were working on digging a drainage ditch the entire length of our stay. Food: The buffett was okay but we were tired of it by the time we left. Breakfast was by far the best. Resort: While it was nice that the resort was smaller so you could walk to whatever you needed, there was only 2 pools and NO entertainment options. Minimal music at the pool and during dinner. Also, there's no drink service on the beach so it did get tiring walking back and forth to the pool bar for drinks. The ice cream parlor was never open either which was a bummer but they did have options in the snack bar. There is no room service and be careful with the fridge. You have free pop one time then you pay. You can get water from anywhere in the resort so no worries there. Staff: Once again Jesus and Marco were great at the pool bar. Hector the bellboy was also very friendly and helpful. There were a few hostesses at the resort that were rude but the servers were always great. Overall, if you need anything extra they won't do it. Be careful of the extra charges they have on some drink and food items too. If you are looking for an adult-like resort this is not it. I think kids stay free and there are mostly families at this resort. While our stay wasn't horrible, next time we will be spending a little more to stay somewhere with more options and services.

Reviews.Title: “Hated it!!”
Reviews.Author: FunMom02
Reviews.Content: Ok, I read the reviews ahead, and thought "how bad can it be".... BAD!! The staf was SO incredibly rude to me. I even watched a girl mock me TO MY FACE, when I returned towels. The bar staff wants to be tipped constantly for their watered down drinks. They even watered down the beer! No beach service, no poolside service, had to ask for TP. They never have money to exchange. The breakfast buffet was ok, but the staff behind the stations are hard to find. Also, they charge an arm and a leg for wifi...but they never change the password (reef2011) so feel free to use it on me! I will never go back, I would rather pay a little more and stay in a better place.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Content: We stayed here from May 29 to June 5. This is a well laid out hotel. Love the fact that it really doesn't look like a hotel but a living area. The jungle setting gives this hotel a sense of sleeping in the forest. The rooms where a little small than we are used to but it was still comfortable. Bathroom was bigger than we expected. The tube was a little too high for my mother and mother-in-law to get in and out. The rooms could use more accessible outlets, I had to move the tv to get to an outlet. Both pools were good. The bar pool was a little crowded and at times too many rowdy people. Both pools were kept clean. The buffet was okay but breakfast and lunch got tiring after awhile, not much variety. Dinner was okay with some changes each day. The two sit down restaurants were okay. The Italian wasn't good at all, food was very bland. The steakhouse grill was very good. Food had a lot of flavor. The snack bar was pretty good. The chicken wings were very good. The tacos were good. The pizza was not good, it was always cold. The grounds were always kept clean. Someone was always sweeping the leaves off the walkways, even the dirt walkways. They were even scrubbing the walkways. The few shows we saw were not good. Over all the hotel was a great place to stay. Will consider it next year.

Reviews.Title: “Will return back to Playa Del Carmen but NOT the Reef”
Reviews.Author: playagirl0713
Reviews.Content: This was our 10th trip back to Playa Del Carmen. We have always stayed at either the Iberostar Resorts or Dreams Resorts. Because this was our first time traveling with our baby, we chose a resort within walking distance to town with a stroller and since we weren't sure how the baby was going to act in the warm weather, we didn't want to spend too much money (in case we had to stay in our room most of the time.) Thankfully, we didn't! Because we have so much experience with other resorts in the Playa area, I am going to be as honest as possible. My husband and I are NOT picky people. We just wanted a nice room, good food, and friendly staff. Transfers: We always use USA transfers. They are fantastic (great prices, great service, and even had a baby seat for us waiting in the van.) Arrival at the Reef: There was no one to greet us upon arrival. When we approached the front desk, we were not greeted with a smile but rather rushed us through as fast as they could. After about 10 minutes, a bell boy finally came to help us with our luggage. Room: The rooms aren't too bad, just very outdated. The maid service did a great job cleaning each day. However, we have never heard as much noise outside the room as we did in this resort. It's as if all the windows and doors were wide open. VERY LOUD each night makes for a difficult nights sleep. Also, if you want to use the safe, be prepared to pay for it. Beach area: Beautiful! Pool area: clean and never had any difficulty finding a spot under an umbrella, which was great for the baby. Wait staff and bartenders: VERY disappointed. They were often rude or wouldn't help us at all. This was the first time in 10 years my husband and I didn't tip once. Food: Let me begin by saying I am not a picky eater but I was quite disappointed. The breakfast was by far the best meal they offer. The lunch buffet/snack bar is the same each day and my husband and I were taken aback at how some menu items at the dinner restaurants cost extra money! If you didn't want to spend the extra money, you were only given 3 entree items to choose from. Location: This was the main reason why we picked this resort. It's a 10 minute walk to town or just a few minute walk to the shops in Playacar. Perfect location. Overall: As my husband said "you get what you pay for." There is no room service or poolside/beach wait staff. The food was below average but what turned us off the most was the lack of friendly service whether at the lobby, bar, or in the restaurants. I was also quite surprised about the lack of security within and outside the resort. I never felt unsafe but we were always used to security checking our bands when we leave and return to the resort. This never happened (anyone could walk in the resort and no one would stop them). We also never saw security walking around within the resort which we thought was strange. We were also turned off to see the resort Entertainment Crew constantly flirting with guests including myself. This was also the first time in which we could "upgrade" our band for premium alcohol. Where we stayed before is a TRUE all inclusive: the safe, coffee makers, all menu entrees, and premium alcohol is included.
