For those of you that have only been to the Reef, I would HIGHLY suggest trying a different all inclusive within Playa and then updating your review of this resort. We are used to and expect the beautiful resorts with the most outstanding staff and service. We didn't receive that here. We will be returning back to the Iberostar or Dreams resorts.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Beach and Location, Decent Resort”
Reviews.Author: amvm99
Reviews.Content: I am going to try and be as fair as possible with my review. The Reef Playacar is located in a beautiful location in Playacar. The beach was amazing and it is just a short walk to town either along the beach or via the street. The area seems very safe, but at night there is not too much light on the street or on the beach. A cheap cab is your best option late at night. The resort grounds are very nice and the staff tries hard to keep everything clean. The rooms are nothing to write home about. They are your basic standard rooms. The first room we had required us to move due to a leaking air conditioner and a clogged sink and bathtub. The 2nd room that we had to be moved to was fine. They only stock the mini fridge once with beer. If you drink any more than what is in the fridge your first day then you are charged for it. Water and soda is unlimited I believe. The food is decent. Again nothing to write home about and it does get pretty redundant after a while so while we paid for an all-inclusive resort we opted to go out for meals once in a while. The drinks at this resort are terrible. They are very cheaply made. Tons of ice and very little flavor or alcohol. They don't always have all the ingredients either. Sometimes there were no bananas for a dirty banana or at times there would be no curacao for a blue Hawaiian. You get what you pay for in the food and drinks category at this resort. The restaurants are pretty good. The steakhouse was better than the Italian restaurant and you do not need reservations which is nice. These places are pretty empty. I cannot comment on the nightly entertainment because we never went to see a show and on the last night when we attempted to, it was casino night at the bar instead. We did not stay for that either. It just seemed cheesy. We did however head to town every night and that was really fun. There are so many good restaurants and bars to try out that it seemed silly to stay at an all-inclusive at times, but we are still debating that. Another point that I should mention is that this place is a bit of a wedding factory. Almost every day/night there was a small wedding going on. They must be an affordable option for a destination wedding and the staff seems to try hard to make it a nice ceremony for the bride and groom. They certainly have a nice beach for it. With the weddings comes big groups of families and friends too. There were not many children at this resort at all, but that could have just been the week that I was there so I cannot comment too much on that. I don't think I would stay here again. The place is nice, but I think I would rather either spend a little more for a nicer all inclusive or skip the all-inclusive all together and take advantage of the great food and drinks in town. Basically you get what you pay for here.

Reviews.Title: “completely insulting treatment by management”
Reviews.Author: viajeromex
Reviews.Content: I arrived on monday night may 23 with my family to attend a wedding and to spend a week vacation at the reef hotel playacar,the first impression was nice and the people at the front desk were very friendly, the only thing I did'nt like was that they charged my credit card for the whole stay on arrival but I figured We'll be here all week so is the same as paying on the way out. We spent tuesday 24 enjoying the pool and beach and notice that the food was not the best but there were different choices so We did'nt mind,it was an all inclusive so what can you expect. The problem started when We woke up on wednesday morning and noticed my laptop had dissapeared,security manager came and sincerely felt sorry and took the report saying he will speak to the manager and expose the situation,that he will get back to me, as thursday came and had no response I went to the front office found the manager that claim to be by the name of Mr. Lagunas,he told me he knew but he had to send his security people to check our room because more than likely we had misplaced it and not stolen,He invited me to go to the police and file a report ,that if I thought He was going to give money for my lost computer I was wrong,I honestly have never been treated as bad and insulting as he treated me, and let me make it clear: with low voice tone but with all the wrong words even accusing me of going often to my room to call "somebody" that it was not his business, because i mentioned to security that i kept going to my room on tuesday to check my e-mails. The manager was a person that completely has no professional ethics and even worst whom ever hired him. I decided to check out that morning and while we were finding a hotel to move to,writing a report and settle the account since they had to credit the original charge and charge for the 3 nights we stayed it became after 12: 00 noon that is the check out time so they charged for another night in both rooms!! it was only 2 hours after and most of it had to deal with their paperwork. Our family and the rest of the group that attended that wedding will never even think about staying again in this place. No wonder being such an spectacular part of Mexico is so vacant, because of people like this

Reviews.Title: “A "WOW" Resort”
Reviews.Author: semtorque
Reviews.Content: This is a perfect resort for my family.... This is approximately my 5th time in Playa del Carmen and I have traveled significantly for both work and pleasure in Mexico, but this was the 1st resort style trip with my daughter 4, my wife and my in-laws (in their early 80's) 1st off... This is not a Mega-Resort so don't expect a ton of "fancy"restaurant choices, a buffet table as far as the eye can see, hairy back contests or spring-breakers. But here's where this resort really excels. This is a multinational resort: Grade = A+ Everyone (employees) at the resort speaks English to some degree, but they also speak: Portuguese,French, German, Italian, Russian, Chinese, Japanese, and some even speak a but of Canadian, Ehe... Americans are not the biggest consumer... This is something I love.... I was ecstatic that daughter made friends that spoke a language other than English, and she had fun playing with them for a week, and by default my wife and I tried out our high-school level Spanish on her friend's parents.... that was a bit rough but a fun time regardless... The Food: Grade = B+ The breakfast and lunch buffets are very good. The menu is repetitive only in major categories. At lunch, for example, there is always Mexican food area (not tex-mex), a meat/fish area, a pasta area and a desert area. We were always able to find a very tasty meal... but there were some people complaining that they didn't know what some of the food was or it looked funny... just the typical buffet complaints... There are also 2 formal restaurants, a steak house and an Italian Restaurant both were very good and willing to work with our special requests. These restaurants also offer, at additional cost ($10 USD), upgraded meals; we tried them, the regular meals were better in our opinion... Just remember its a multinational resort they cant really please just one segment of their clientele base, the food is meant to be agreeable to people of all different nationalities The General Decor: Grade = B+ I would put this place in the "boutique hotel" category. There is a jungle/Swiss Family Robinson theme through the entrance and middle of the resort, complete with waterfall and natural cenote/underground fresh water river and mosquitoes (bring insect repellant) and a traditional beach style resort theme as you move closer to the ocean and the pools. the paths between the buildings are not flat so if you are opposed to climbing small hills some of the pathways in the cenote section of the resort may put you off a bit and you may want to ask for a room closer to the pools (but be aware that the rooms near the pools are a bit louder due to the pool activities) The Rooms: Grade = B Overall just ok. The rooms are big , The AC works great, The bathrooms are decent size, the balcony is perfect for smoking cigars. But there is some wear and tear on the rooms, there was a bit of minor grout mold in our shower and some water glass stains on the furniture.... it was nothing that would put me off... but if you're looking for "Mc-Mansion perfect" maybe this is not the place for you. The Pools and Beach: Grade = A - There are 2 pools, one has a swim up bar and a kiddie area, the overall pool size would be a kidney bean sized high school pool. The other pool is about 2x the size of the first and is adjacent the main restaurant and overlooks the ocean. I played a lot of volleyball and did plenty of wading in this pool with the family. Now around each pool there are both lounge chairs and beds with a shade net... there were plenty of spots... no need to hurry out to save a spot unless you want the same spot every day... but by second pool there is also a sandy area for kids to play in so we had a pool with a sandy surround to play in daily... great for my daughter and plenty of shade to keep the burns away.... The beach was fantastic as well, the water was warm, there are plenty of umbrellas, beach chairs, hammocks,=. one thing to note though the ocean drops off quickly so keep an eye on your kids. Other Activities : Grade = A I'm a huge fan of ocean sports, especially catamarans... and the ones at the Reef never seamed to be in use and the guys manning the equipment were always up for letting me go out... and there were kayaks and snorkel masks and boogie boards. To top the cake there is a fantastic PADI Dive Center on the resort "The Reef Marina", set up a free SCUBA demo... its a blast, and if you do make sure to ask for Bruno or Bert.. they are great and they can hook you up with your 1st dive after that through the PADI Discover SCUBA program...additionally the hotel provides water aerobics, Zumba, Yoga and sets up nightly trips to Coco Bongo and other hotspots for the good time seekers The Staff : Grade = A+ it seamed like their moto was "Whatever, Whenever"; Fantastic all around staff, accommodating, welcoming and hard working... just great... Make sure to look for Roberto in the main dining room... he's the sweaty guy waiting on the entire balcony...with a smile on his face.... Go Roberto! Go! Other notes: There's a new ploy in the city... watch out for shop keepers claiming to be the waiters or other staff from you hotel... they are not whomever they claim to be...they are planning on you not recognizing them and feeling bad in order to follow them into their shop... just be aware..

Reviews.Title: “A little Slice of Heaven”
Reviews.Author: takemeaway53
Reviews.Content: The Reef is a small resort with beautiful gardens and a great beach. Exactly what me and my travel companion were looking for. Instead of a grand lobby, we strolled through a beautiful mature garden complete with furry little critters and tall coconut trees, soft music was playing in the background. We scored a great room on the second floor with views of the pool and turquoise ocean in the distance. I was already sold. Our rooms had all of the basics and a remote to adjust the AC to your desired temp, flat panel TV and two chairs and a table, however we spent most of our "indoor" time on the beautiful balcony enjoying the scene I just described. The staff was ever present asking if you were enjoying your stay or if they could do any thing for you. These hard working and friendly people are what set the Reef apart. My water or wine glass was never empty and they made every effort to learn your name and be helpful in any way. The beach was outstanding and there were always plenty of chairs and umbrellas. I got up early to see the sunrise and was able to enjoy one of the three palapas on the resort but there are plenty of beds for those who want them. The food was very good for an A.I. Chicken wings and nachos & guacamole were outstanding at the beach shack. I enjoyed a nice piece of salmon at the Mexican restaurant and The Botticelli had a beautiful lasagna. ( and I'm Italian and live near the North End of Boston) As for the buffet, it could be spotty at times, but I always managed to come back to my table with a heaping plate. Overall, I would say for the value it, can't be beat! Already missing those lovely Pina Colatas, Mohitos and Rum Punch! And by the way, they served a very nice house wine. Go to The Reef....you won't regret it!

Reviews.Title: “Love The Reef, Love Mexico!!”
Reviews.Author: Eluci1985
Reviews.Content: My partner and I very much enjoyed The Reef playacar resort!!!! The resort grounds are very charming. All pathways remind you of a jungle and give a tropical feeling which creats a relaxing atmosphere. Rooms are great, enough room for two. Always cleaned and stocked with water. Had a great AC kept the room cool, sometimes too cold!!!! The bed was heaven after a long day in the sun and or a day out at Xplor and Isla Mujeres. The food was okay, beef dishes were great!!! Many dishes in sauces and sometimes not warm enough. The snack bar is where to be. Great burgers, buffflo wings,fries ,pizza, salads, sandwiches, nachos and few other items!! Drinks are yummy and plentiful!! Staff is very friendly and always greet you!!! Playa del carmen 5 th ave is a great night spot!! Went to dinner twice on the town .. Senior frogs which was lots of roudy fun and La Parilla steakhouse which had great shrimp ad steak!!! The beach is sooooo beautiful. Take many photos and get up early at least once to see the sunrise!!!!WOW!!!! Mexico is beautiful and the reef is all we needed to put the cherry on top!!! Thank you for the good times!

Reviews.Title: “A Little Paradise”
Reviews.Author: leelee030
Reviews.Content: A little resort amongst the big commercial resorts! The staff was very friendly and met to all our demands! Jonathan (the bellhop) was great...he was the first person to greet us and answered all of our questions! Upon checking in, we requested an upgrade to our vacation...word to the wise, take the upgrade on the room...even though the rooms throughout the property is not far from the beach, pools, and restaurant...the double double bed rooms are nice and clean, yet the beds were hard as a rock! take the upgrade on room, its only xtra 50/night! dont take the upgrade on amenities...you get 5 sodas, 2 dos xx, 4 bottles of water, coffee maker, 2 robes and shampoo and conditioner! plus, you don't replenished until the next day...even if you call the front desk for more beer...they send it up to you free the first time but you have to pay after that!! so it wasnt worth the 30/night! all in all, the resort was great! jesus and orlando were great bartenders at the pool! the beach was absolutely amazing! if you're looking to not spend a whole lotta money on a resort...this place is it! All Inclusive was great!

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice!”
Reviews.Author: Shanynlee
Reviews.Content: Traveled with a large group of friends. We were looking for an affordable vacation, all inclusive, and chose The Reef. Rooms: The rooms were a nice size. My husband and I had a king bed, very comfortable. Many different types of pillows. Safe was an extra cost per day. Had very loud neighbors a few times, and the rooms are nothing close to sound proof (the doors are made from slotted wood). Some nights it bothered us, some nights it did not. The worst part of the trip for us was our air conditioner - if left on too long it would get ice build-up inside, quit working, and make a loud buzzing noise. The staff were quick to fix both times. It also leaked a LOT - we had to leave a towel on the floor under the unit. I did notice that our friends rooms had updated air conditioner units, so I hope they plan to upgrade the one in room 112. No bug problems besides the last day - found a dead cockroach type in the bathroom and lots of ants. Housekeeping did a great job of keeping it clean otherwise. Bars: Jesus, Miguel, and Marco were great bartenders. Please consider bringing a few dollars to tip them each day if you plan on spending a lot of time at the pool bar or roof bar. Many drinks to choose from - Mojitos, Sex on the Beach, Bahama Mamas, Margaritas, Blue Hawaii, Tequila Sunrise. Our group would occasionally give them a dollar and they would make fun shots for our group to take. Also many times we would just ask for "something fruity with vodka" or "something without coconut" and would get a delicious drink. Food: Best food we found were the tacos at the snack bar. Wings from there were very tasty too. Buffet was good, breakfast the best - lunch and dinner were pretty similar always. The two sit down restaurants were great - Erick especially. Loved the Italian place. Two of the nights we went to those restaurants as a group they brought out shots for us. No reservations needed - and neither place was very busy any of the times we went up which was surprising! Staff in those places were awesome, fun sense of humor, lots of joking with us. Pools/Beach: Loved the swim up bar, lots of socializing there. Chairs were available around the pools even if you didn't get up early. Beach volleyball and soccer available, and they set up pool volleyball for us when we asked. Activities are listed on a sign by the activity pool, where you go to get beach towels. A note: if you check out a beach towel and do not return it same day, you have to return it to the lobby. We kept two all week, exchanging them at the towel station until the last day when we finally turned them in. Very safe, was able to leave towels/books/etc on our chairs to go get a drink without worrying about someone taking them. Staff: VERY courteous and friendly. All say hello as you pass. Rooftop bartenders were having tons of fun with everyone our last night. Quick service at the bars - you don't have to wait 30 minutes for a drink. Cleaning staff constantly working to clear leaves from paths and empty cups. Were not bothered about time shares, and vendors selling items were courteous and understood when you said no. Would have liked for Internet to be more readily available (was told it was $10/hour) as we wanted to watch a hockey playoff game, but we were fine otherwise. Overall: Excellent value for what you pay. We arrived in Cancun, got a shuttle to The Reef, and were on the beach within minutes upon arriving. Tons of drinks (other all inclusives can have a certain list you have to choose from), food always available, and a great place to relax!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic vacation - loved the Reef!”
Reviews.Author: KSEMR
Reviews.Content: I have never written a review, but feel compelled now. After reading some horrible reviews, I was extremely nervous about my stay at the Reef for 6 days, 7 nights. I initially picked this hotel for the price and location and figured that even if it was sub-standard, it would still be a steal. I was more than pleasently surpised! I can't say enough about the staff - they are all so incredibly gracious and courteous. I was never bothered by anyone regarding a time share either. The buffett was great; plenty of choices for everyone. The steak restaurant was fantastic, too. The pools were nice and the beach was absolutely amazing. You do need to get up early if you'd like to reserve a bed, but it's well worth it. The rooms were clean (yes, the beds are hard) and served their purpose. I especially liked the balcony area. You will hear some noise outside of your room, but it didn't bother me, and it wasn't extreme. I've stayed at other all inclusives ( Hilton, etc) and felt like I was on a compound. Yes, the rooms may be nicer, but there is no personality or culture to those places. I've also found the food to be better here than other places, too. This is a laidback and fun resort. I especially liked that people of all ages were at the resort; it's not catered to a specific group. We are in our 30's and had a great time. It's not a party place, and I liked that aspect. There are plenty of choices for people who like to go out at night ( the bar is open until 3:00am and there are places downtown), but I would say this place if perfect for anyone late twenties and up ( with or without families). We liked it so much that we plan to return next year with our children. You can't beat this place for the value, location or staff! Bottom Line: If you're debating between this resort or another in the area, save your money and stay here. You won't regret it.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, great vacation !”
Reviews.Author: pbpb2
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Reef from May 1st - May 8th and we are very satisfied with our choice. It is truly the best value in Playa Del Carmen. Location is ideal, 10 minutes walk from the 5th Avenue, and about 45 min. taxi from Tulum and Cancun. The property is very clean, plenty of chairs and shade at the beach. Food was excellent, great choices were available at the buffet, very fresh and excellent service from all the staff from the restaurants and the buffet (special mention to Alphonso who went out of his way to amuse our 6 year old, thanks ! ). Rooms were clean and confortable, the only thing we noticed was that it was vey noisy at night, especially with unconsiderate neighbors... So our sleep was not the best, but other than that we would go back for sure !

Reviews.Title: “very affordable, clean, neat, close to town”
Reviews.Author: pattigardner
Reviews.Content: for the price this hotel has a lot to offer. went with the husband and two girlfriends. food and service was excellent. location was great. the mix of people was great! enjoyed every minute of it. didn't run into a bunch of time share peolple. the restuarants were great. didn't have to make reservations. food at the extra restuarants was awesome. the people that worked there were also wonderful.. will go back again. was a great place for an all-inclusive. rooms were great, beds were wonderful. not a huge resort so never very far to walk. loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Worth the price - Staff are amazing - Beautiful Beach”
Reviews.Author: stephers06
Reviews.Content: This was the 5th trip to the Playacar area for my husband and I. This year we were traveling with his daughter,her husband and their 6 month old. We chose this resort because of the price, location, small size and the beach. We booked through Expedia - and I must say we will try not to fly U.S Airways again! CHECK IN: Was fine - the only complaint I have is the ridiculous price for WIFI and or use of the computers. I chose to pay the 35.00 for WIFI for the week as i brought my Ipod. I could only use it in the lobby even though I could pick up secured WIFI for the Reef down by the pool/beach. When I asked about logging on down there - they just said no - only at lobby. NOTE TO RESORT: Having access to WIFI by the pool/beach would be nice and convenient for paying customers :) - we also paid 25.00 for the safe key for the week. THE ROOMS: weren't fancy 5 star as expected. They were comfortable and clean. We had a bottom floor room 1411 - this was the perfect spot for us - near the pool and not facing the busy walkway. We didn't have too much trouble with noise, the shower worked (there may have been a few tiny ant like bugs in there - but hey we're in the tropics) the beds were comfortable - not too hard. the mattresses were not hard - they may have been recently upgraded??? They even have a pillow menu with different pillows on your bed. The flat screen was nice and we had enough channels for our liking. ROOM SERVICE: we made sure to tip our maid. $5.00 a day we never had any issues getting extra bottles of water from her, or beer. They have an ecological program and would rather you fill your water bottles up with filtered water at buffet. less waste - i don't blame them - people waste canned beer/water too much at resorts. BEACH/POOL: We never had any issue getting beach chairs or the loungers. We got up between 7-8am every morning and reserved them. The canopy loungers worked really well for the baby. It kept him shaded and provided some privacy.The beach was amazing - lots of it, the pools were great. It seemed adults go to the swim up bar pool and kids use the activities pool. FOOD: the food at the Riu resorts we stayed at was 10 times better. By mid week we got sick of the food. There wasn't enough variety for us. We weren't able to eat off the resort as much this trip , so relied on breakfast, lunch and dinner here. What we loved were the tamales,omelets,fresh juices and coffee, in the morning. Lunch and dinner we preferred more of the Mexican fare if they had it (tacos, taquitos,etc..) Some things were questionable and you wondered if they were using left overs. THE STAFF: Miguel was outstanding as our waiter. Always a smile - we tipped him well because he was sooo great. Dennis & Alfonso were great too :) Ice cream bar had great cookies, hand made ice cream and coffee during the day. BARS: Felix, Jesus were great bartenders. We loved our miami vices, pina coladas, mango tangos and mojitos. The snack bar was handy if you wanted a quick bite. NOTE: you had to pay for wine and specialty coffees??????? ENTERTAINMENT: We never experienced the entertainment nor did we participate with the activities. We were there just to relax with family. They put on a Mexican themed buffet and show on the beach one night but you had to reserve for it and be there by 7PM and pay 10.00 a piece for it!!!! Also they announce these events at the pool during the day - so if you don't hear it - you miss out (no bulletin board around to advise of events at the resort) all in all - I knew booking this resort we would have a great priced vacation. I didn't expect 5 star rooms, service, or food. I wouldn't pay money for an upgrade - if that is what you are looking for then you should have booked the palace next door. This place was friendly, quiet, and laid back. We were never hassled by front desk, we never had any issues with our rooms, or maids. No "do not disturb signs" so if you are in the room make sure to lock door on inside and latch so they don't pop in :) would we go back? probably not and that is only because after trying this resort and the Occidental last year I would rather go back to a Riu. The Riu's animation team was friendlier, the shows were better (and their theme nights were FREE, more variety with their food , FREE WIFI & SAFE and the staff has always been amazing there.

Reviews.Title: “Could not be better”
Reviews.Author: Vernoline
Reviews.Content: I usually never write reviews but this hotel is amazing and we will be back in 2012 for sure! The only thing that needs improvement is that the orange juice is like sunny delight and not real orange juice! If they could change that they will get a 5! Keep up the good work reef! Dont listen to the bad reviews! This is the place to be

Reviews.Title: “Already planning our next trip.”
Reviews.Author: windandwater4
Reviews.Content: We returned from our first trip to Mexico almost a week ago and I can not wait to return. When looking for a place to stay I read SOOO many reviews of different places, and to be honest, I was a little worried at some of the comments on The Reef. However, price won over concern and we booked. I am so glad we did. Let me start at the beginning. When we arrived we immediately handed over $210 cash for an upgraded "Superior Room." We were they taken to our room in building two, second floor. Nice location, but I realized that my $210 was a mistake. The room was small yet fine, but I was hoping for an upgraded flat screen TV that I had read about in reviews (no, we don't watch at home at all, but the kids do like it on vaca), a fridge that would be restocked everyday, fluffy robes, a coffee maker, etc. I realized that they put a 4 cup coffee maker and two laughably small thin robes in the room and that is what I paid for. Our bellhop told us that there must be some confusion because our fridge was not to be refilled, as this was a "standard room." After a phone call to the front desk and a bit of confusion, we were told we'd be moved to a room in building 14 the next day and I should be at the desk by 9am. It was a little tough not letting the kids unpack all the way and set up their spots, but we managed. The next day was very mixed up. There was confusion about the new room at 9am and we were told to return to the desk at 11:30. Then 12:30, as the room was not yet ready. Then once more told to either return or to allow our bags to be moved when things were ready. This was a fine option, but was a bit inconvenient to have to stay close to 'home' on out first day until is was figured out. Somewhere around 2ish we found our things were moved. I was very pleased with the room. I could be wrong, but I think the square footage was a bit bigger, flat screen TV, fridge to be restocked daily, etc. Yup, smallish robes again, but really, who cares? The kids (ages 8 and 10) wore them well:) If you do the upgrade, you should know that they only put some soda cans, 2 water bottles, and 2 beers a day in your fridge. And if none have been removed, none are added. I only mention because I think we scored maybe a six pack of beer all week. Maybe it is just human behavior, but I would have liked to crack open a few beers in our room, but seeing that there was only two beers at a time, one for each of us, I felt like it needed to be coveted. lol. The rooms, as well as the entire place was very clean. The people were kind and warm. The grounds were absolutely beautiful. We loved the little critters that roamed the area. We also fell in love with the resident cats, stray I assume. My husband was caught off guard to have a stray cat hiding under our dinner table at first, but this became a much looked forward to part of our meal. The kids were thrilled, and I must admit, so was I , as it appeared the small black and white cat was expecting and I was happy to offer her some fish every now and then. The buffet was one of our favorite things. There were many choices and the variety changed each day, with a few favorites remaining a constant. My son enjoyed a fresh made omelet each morning (don't forget to tip the sweet lady there) and we enjoyed some more traditional mexican food. There was something for everyone. The fresh fruit was always wonderful. And the morning juice choices always made us smile. The coffee at the early morning continental breakfast? well... lets just say I'm glad we paid for the coffee maker in the room:) We tried the other two restaurants as well, and were pleased. The kids LOVED the snack bar and the freedom it gave them to munch when they wanted. I gotta say, it was pretty darned good. My daughter went to the ice cream bar about three times a day and loved the coconut ice cream. I agree with her. The drinks at the bars were pretty good. We were introduced to the Speedy Gonzales, which became a fast friend. Yum. And they make a great Mojito. The kids also loved the freedom of ordering banana daiquiris, made with 1/2 a banana each, which made me happy. The kids didn't love the kids club, but I really don't think they gave it much of a chance. The lady that ran it, I wish I could remember her name (Claudia maybe), was a lovely kind person and I trusted her completely. She was dedicated to keeping the kids busy and entertained in healthy ways and not letting them sit in front of video games all day. I really think my kids missed out on some fun stuff. Maybe next time. The adult activities were not well organized, but I'm sure the folks get tired to trying to motivate folks who would rather sit in the sun and drink. They did manage to recruit my husband into a volley ball game, which was nice for him. The pools were spotless and a great temp. The hot tub however, was the same temp as the pools. We very much wanted to grab some nice relaxing hot tub time, but it was just to cold. The beach was amazing. Windy the week we were there, but spectacular nonetheless. The beach chairs were fine, some broken, but we never had a hard time getting a few. The outdoor beds were heavenly and you did need to get out fairly early to mark one with a towel. Another thing we loved was the pottery hut on the beach. Our son was very serious about painting his piece and loved the way it looked the next day when it came back glazed. While there we took a few trips into town and a few excursions. The staff was helpful in giving info on transportation, where to get good deals on hammocks, and such. We were never approached about the dreaded time share we read so much about. The internet was spotty in the lobby, but they were always ready to help me reconnect, even though I knew I was becoming a pain in their collective butt. The gift shop was nice, but E-Gads! Over $7 usd for a small bag of chex mix? Oh well, it was daughters $ to spend. I also liked the on site Travel Agent and booked a trip through them. They were warm and very informative. At the end of our stay, we hated to leave. My daughter cried the whole time we packed and waited for a cab. Hector made her feel better by telling her when she was grown she could come back and he'd get her a job there. That was a sweet thing to say, and really helped:) So sum up this ridiculously long review- Well, we travel time to time and just last year stayed at a 5 star in Disney World. It was perfect in that it all ran 100% smoothly. The Reef was not 100% smooth, nor did we expect it to be. What it was was 100% human. Kind people who really tried and largely succeeded. Nature at its best. There were bumps, but the bumps disappeared in the humanity and willingness to please the folks who may be used to a bit more. And still offered pleasant surprises that we didn't expect. It was 100% comfortable, not stuffy or snobby how some places can be. For my family, it was a perfect experience and I hope to return very soon.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, great location”
Reviews.Author: jeskea20
Reviews.Content: my fiance and i stayed at the Reef Playacar from 25 Apr - 2 May. This was our 2nd stay in Playa del Carmen - last year we stayed next door at the Riu Palace. We chose this hotel primarily for the location and the price. We are both very down to earth and easy to please, so i knew that even though this wasn't a 5star resort, that we would be happy. here is a fairly comprehensive review: location: the reef is in a small neighborhood within about a 10 - 15 min walk from the center of town. it is right next to the Riu Palace and a couple of beach side condos/properties. accommodations: the rooms are separated into little apartment like complexes that line both sides of the main walkway that runs from the lobby to the beach. along this main walkway you have branches to the side that lead to the rooms, the ice cream parlor, a sitting area, the gym, pools, restaurant and then finally, the beach. its a very charming layout set in the midst of trees and a cenote and is easy to navigate. the rooms were great - we had a king size bed, a tv, mini fridge and a small patio. it was very clean, the fridge was stocked with soda and beer, there was bottled water which was replenished every day and a small coffee service. i saw previous reviewers complaining about bugs or ants in their room. i saw a couple - it was definitely never a problem and nothing to worry about. the bathroom was clean and we had no problems with leaks or anything like that. one thing that i thought was kind of weird - the shower head is low. im about 5'10 and i couldnt stand under it or it would be resting on the top of my head. i dont know if this is typical for all of the rooms. one huge oversight that i noticed was the fact that the hotel does not provide "do not disturb" door tags. the people next door to us had brought one with them and i wished we had done the same. the cleaning people and the guy who replenished the fridge were persistent about getting into the room. during an afternoon nap the maids knocked three times (each time we told them we didnt need anything...clean? no. towels? no. coffee? no. i felt like i was in tommy boy) and then they called our room three times in a row. if you like to take naps in the afternoon, want to sleep in, or don't want service to your room every day i would highly recommend bringing your own door tag. as far as the noise level goes...it is incredible. this has to be by far the worst hotel i have ever stayed at as far as noise goes. any little sound outside the door sounds like it is right in your room with you. several times i woke up because i thought my fiancee had gotten up and was shuffling around. the only times this really bothered us was when we slept in. if you are a light sleeper and want to sleep in past 7 or 8 am you need to bring ear plugs. food: we only ate at the chula vista buffet and the snack bar, so i cant speak to the other restaurants. the nice thing about the buffet is you can come at any time within their service frames. for breakfast i believe it was 7 - 10, lunch was 1230 - 3 and dinner was 630 - 10. the bad thing about this is that if you are not there right at the beginning, you might have to wait and you might have a dirty table. they do not change the table cloths and we are late eaters so i would say almost every single meal we ate was on a table with a spotted table cloth. i didn't really care but i think some people might. also one night we ended up waiting almost 30 minutes to get seated. i dont know if this is typical or not, but after that we made sure we showed up earlier. the food. well...theres a lot of it! theres plenty to choose from and lots of variety. we got sick of the food towards the end of our stay but i think if you eat at any buffet 2 - 3 Xs a day for a week straight you'll get sick of it. if you do - go eat at a restaurant in town a couple nights. thats what we did. the food at the snack bar was great (open 11 am - 2 am), but they transition their menu around 6 pm - and if you go at this time they are pretty much out of food. the drinks: i drank beer, water and vodka tonics. all three were great. the juice and mixers were basically cheap fake substitutions. if you dont mind sugary imitation drinks youll be fine. the pools/beach: the beach is perfect. like everyone else has said - if you are not up early all of the beds and umbrellas will be taken, but there were always free loungers. there are 2 pools, 1 near the buffet that had a basketball net and activities, and one with a swim up bar. they were both full of kids and after getting repeatedly splashed in the face by them and seeing a giant hair ball float by i never got in again. it didn't really matter though - i came to go to the beach and thats pretty much where we stayed. the gym: um it looked really nice! sweaty happy people pumping away at the machinery. i was a lazy bum, so i didnt actually USE it, but if you are more motivated than me i think youll be happy with it. the service: the cleaning people are tireless. they are constantly cleaning and the place is really spotless. i think the buffet is understaffed. the servers really tried, but if you dont feel like waiting 10 minutes to get a drink or a refill youll just need to get it yourself. my overall impression of this hotel is that i got exactly what i paid for and what i expected. i didnt pay a lot - so i didn't get a lot in return. the food is cheaper (you wont find lobster, shrimp or filet mignon on the buffet), the drinks are cheaper, the amenities are sparse and they are a little understaffed. on the plus side the hotel is incredibly clean, the rooms are great and the location is wonderful. if you are looking to be pampered this is absolutely not the place to go, but if you are fairly easy to please and can overlook some minor details you will enjoy your vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing holiday!”
Reviews.Author: LondonTraveller0181
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel just before midnight after a very long trip from the UK and were greeted by very friendly staff at the front desk. They checked us in quickly and we were shown to our room and also given a tour of the hotel grounds which was a very nice welcome. The room was spacious - twin room with two double beds - and very clean. The air con was constantly on a very nice temperature which made it pleasant to return after a day outside in the hot sun. After reading other reviews on here, a lot of people seem unhappy with the beds. Some people prefer hard beds and some prefer soft beds, it's very much up to each individual person. I slept so well for the entire 10 nights we were thee and actually quite miss that bed! The food in the buffet restaurant was great and the service friendly. The grill restaurant has amazing steaks that must be had at least once! I wasn't too impressed with the Italian restaurant, we only ate there once and the fish i had was very dry and my friend found her food too salty. The pools are clean and have nice temperatures, although i think there should be a smoking ban in the swim up bar since we quite often found cigarette butts floating in the pool which wasn't very nice. The hotel is set in beautiful lush gardens which are very well kept and we found it really peaceful and relaxing strolling through the grounds. It's so beautiful in the evenings when it's lit up. The service in general in the hotel is super friendly and since it's not a very big hotel, the staff quickly recognize you and call you by name. We had great fun with the Animation team, an extra big shout out to the lovely Alejandro and Daniel for recommending us which clubs to go to and selling us wristbands. The night clubs in Playa del Carmen are amazing! The only complaint I have are about the towels you get at the pool. At no point are you told that each lost or unreturned towel will be charged at 35USD which is a crazy amount of money for one towel. Apparently this is in small print on the card you sign when you collect a towel but that should definitely be much clearer. You should be told by the front desk either when you check in or when you first collect your towel. Apart from that this is a fantastic hotel and great value for money. The staff all smile and say hello to you, from cleaners to chefs. The beach is beautiful and the location of the hotel is fantastic. It's within easy reach to Playa del Carmen, a 5 minute cab ride or a 15 minute walk on the beach. I will definitely be returning to The Reef and i have already recommended it to friends. Thank you so much for one of the best and most relaxing holidays i've ever had! Thank you Jesus for awesome cocktails, Hector in the front desk for the warm welcome and help during the week and the Animation team for the fun times. We loved the crazy balloon game in the pool!

Reviews.Title: “A Pleasant Surprise”
Reviews.Author: lovestotravel060
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Reef Playacar for my brother's 30th birthday trip. It is by no means a luxury hotel. However, the location, staff, and the price cannot be beat. We found the staff to be one of the most enjoyable aspects of the trip. By the end of the week they called us by name, and we were very sad to leave them. The beach is beautiful. The rooms are average for Mexico. The grounds are beautiful. You feel as if you are in a jungle along your very short 1 minute walk to the amazing beach. I would not hesitate to recommend this hotel for a relaxed beach getaway with friends.

Reviews.Title: “We may have found "the one" - if they replace the mattresses.”
Reviews.Author: jibreach
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a one week stay at the Reef Playacar. I have to admit that this was the cleanest, friendliest (staff) all inclusive we have been to. The employees were all fantastic, very polite and provided great service. The pools were sparkling clean, as were the grounds and room we stayed in. We stayed in a 1st floor room close to the pool and thought noise might be an issue but it wasn't; nor did we hear our "neighbors" above or next to us during our week stay. (We stayed in room 1014 April 13 - 19, not a holiday week.) The place is quaint, intimate and beautiful. This resort also had the best policies and access to sailboats, kayaks and boogie boards. No hassles regarding time restrictions or availability - it was a wonderful surprise! Finally! The activities staff did an OK job but I think they need to organize more beach and pool volleyball (basketball) per day as that seemed to be a bigger draw than other activities. Plus the teens like those activities. We didn't attend evening shows, opted to play pool instead and turn in early after a full day outside. My teenage son found a few other teens to hang out with during the week. We felt very comfortable letting them do their thing around the resort, it is a safe environment - not a huge "party" atmosphere, more laid back adults / families resort. The buffet was good, food not quite as warm as I would have liked or experienced elsewhere, but plenty of options and tasted good nonetheless. The steakhouse and Italian restaraunt were both great. The snack bar was fine, great for lunch (my son suggests allowing hamburgers and hotdogs even after 6:00 p.m.). Another nice surprise...the drinks were very good! Finally! Like I said previously, we may have found "the one" - a spot we could see ourselves returning to over and over - IF - they get new mattresses. (Less dense pillows would be nice as well.) The previous reviews stating the mattresses were as hard as a rock were, unfortunately, 100% accurate. I could barely sleep 3 hours before tossing and turning due to the pain associated with sleeping on such a hard bed. Out of desperation, I folded the soft comforters and stacked them on my side before putting freshly laundered beach towels on top as a makeshift pillow top (also to keep them protected and clean). Unfortunately it didn't help much and I left on the 7th day exhausted. I slept 11 hours when I got home. I would love to try this resort again if the price is right and IF they get new mattresses. If that happens I could see myself being their non-paid spokesperson - my family too!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Family Vacation Spot!!!”
Reviews.Author: md1027_11
Reviews.Content: Just returned from The Reef with our 3 kids, found the resort excellent on all levels, clean, attentive and plenty of activities and opportunities for inactivity. The size of the resort is perfect for young families who can rest comfortable giving the kids some room to move around at all times while knowing they are close by. We will definitely return..

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing Vacation”
Reviews.Author: ndbrit06
Reviews.Content: We had a really good time overall. The grounds were really pretty and the staff was good. The rooms need some updating but it didn't bother us becasue we didnt plan on spending much time in there. The only thing that I was a little upset about was the shower... everyday after a long day in the sun and feeling sticky and sweaty all i wanted to do was shower and every night the shower would be clogged up and I would have water up past my ankles. The beds are pretty hard but it didnt bother us too much. The beach was great and I like playa a lot more then cancun (not so spring breaky). Eric was our favorite waiter at the bar and in the resturant. He took really good care of us the whole time we were there. Also we had massages on the beach when we were there and I would NOT recommend it. There were $100 a person and not worth that much money.

Reviews.Title: “Dont believe the Nay-Sayers - Top Resort”
Reviews.Author: maritimetraveller1
Reviews.Content: Let me begin by saying i work in the Travel industry and visit 30 + resorts a year for work. I am used to looking at resorts , and how these cater to ALL people. This resort was looked at from a personal standpoint. We usually travel as a couple with our daughter and son in law. We look for smaller, intimate resorts, where you meet and get to know the staff, and resorts must have balconies (for morning coffee), and a swimup bar, and great beach. This resort hit on all points. Any issues i had with this resort were minor and definately fixable. Lets start with.... Rooms - Rooms were a good size, not huge, but not tiny. Best to request a 2nd or 3rd floor unit, although we spend 2 nights on a ground floor unit. We were moved upon request, no questions asked. No hassle and great service form the front desk. Yes, the air conditioners are loud, but not enough to keep you awake at night. The rooms are clean and housekeeping is great, honest and personable. we left ipods out on the nightstand and actually i left my wallet out, and had no issues with security at all. The balconies are a good size for 2 people, great for relaxing and enjoying a coffee. POOLS - There are 2 pools. small but not tiny. the upper pool is the swim up bar and used for relaxing and enjoying the sun. The Lower pool is almost on the beach and is used for activities like water volleyball, the crazy games, STAFF_ Jesus at the swimup bar. Berst drinks . ask for the Miami Vice. Edgar upstairs above the lobby - ask for the Riviera Maya.. Animation Team is busy all day and all night. Say Hi to Chiquita and Nelson. great people. Finally, people who shoot down this resort should be locked in a hotel unit for a month. These are people who do not understand that resort vacations are about experiencing local life, customs and people. Nuff Said. Book this resort. you will not be disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent customer service and beautiful grounds and vistas!”
Reviews.Author: NoelleJesse
Reviews.Content: We have never been treated as well as we were at The Reef. The staff is exceptional, friendly, helpful, and genuine. The atmosphere combines the sounds of the jungle with the crash of the ocean. A glorious resort!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place for a Vacation”
Reviews.Author: Andsar99
Reviews.Content: Just got back from the Reef Playacar (March 26 to April 2, 2011). I enjoyed the reef, the resort is different. It has a natural feeling to it, with the walkways and waterfalls. The rooms are clean and are cleaned well during the week. There is some repair needed, however nothing that would bother anyone. The facilities are good, there is a ice cream stand, store, jewelry shop, gym, and pool tables. The resort has a very nice beach and pools, plenty of room. Also it is close to town (10 minute walk), you feel safe walking. The staff is friendly and helpful. The food is good no complaints. Try the cactus, yummy. There is a steakhouse and Italian restaurant. If you want a steak it is 10 USD extra but is does taste very good. As for safety on the resort, we were out late every night on the resort and security never hassled us, they were friendly. If you can stay at this resort for a good price, do it. If you are looking for marble floors and all the trims, stay away, go to a 5 star, RIU is next door and caters to those tastes, this resort focuses on nature, nothing fancy, but well done all the way through.

Reviews.Title: “Ok but ... Not Happy”
Reviews.Author: bouchard01
Reviews.Content: The reviews are pretty much spot on. The beds are hard as a rock & it's noisy. We had requested a king bed upgrade but didn't get it so we paid extra when we arrived to get one. The food is ok but tired of it after the week. The omelets are good but service is not the greatest. The other two Bottecilli as a great Head Waiter. Wine is good. Swimup bar is good but lots of kids and noise. Have to get up real early to get a spot around the pool. Beach is nice & it's easy to get chairs. I dislike that they let people come in on day passes as it really overcrowds the resort. Customer Service needs to be improved, not many seem eager to serve or over friendly. My camera case with camera and iphone went missing in the lounge. I left it & went back in 5 minutes or less and of course no one saw it. The whole lounge was full of all the friends from the wedding we just attended. I'm pretty sure the waiter took it as another person bought it off a guy on the subtrain. Luckily this person has a heart and at looking at the photos got ahold of us and I know where it is. We are home now but he is going to ship it back. I also hear of another person who's camera when missing at the snack bar. Pay the extra and stay in a 5 star, it's worth it.

Reviews.Title: “not a very peaceful vacation”
Reviews.Author: gert82507
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel is wonderful, just a 10-15 minute walk into town, but that was about the only benefit of the hotel. It is all-inclusive, which is nice, but there were not a lot of options. It did have a swim-up bar, but in order to get there you had to make your way through all the splashing children in the pool. There were two pools, but both were rather small: one with the bar (where all the children/families were) and the other was right next to the buffet resturant so people could watch you swim/tan while they enjoyed their food. The rooms were OK, but not much of a view no matter what side of the buildings you were on. The hotel was composed of smaller buildings (3 levels, with 4 rooms on each level) which made sort of a diamond shape around a 'jungle' (that's what it looked like to us). The rooms with the 'garden' view had WAY more comfy chairs (with cushions) out on the balcony, than what we had (we had a very nice view of a tree and the next door hotel with whicker chairs and no cushions). Our bed was VERY uncomfortable (like putting a sheet over a slap of concrete). We could hear our neighbors so clearly through the walls/doors it was as if they were right in the room with us. All-in-all, it was our first time down to Playa Del Carmen and we really enjoyed the area, but for a tiny bit more money we could've had a WAY nicer and adult only hotel. This place is great if you are traveling with family or younger children as The Reef has a TON of activities for them. We love children, we just didn't want to spend our relaxing vacation with so many of them.

Reviews.Title: “Great deal, service, and surroundings”
Reviews.Author: puravidachica
Reviews.Content: The Reef is a perfect spot if you like the benefits of all-inclusive, but also want a resort that isn't too big or flashy. I was highly impressed by the service. Even though waiters and other staff didn't receive tips, they still were super friendly and helpful. The grounds have a lush, jungle appeal, and were kept very clean. The rooms were perfectly comfortable, although not very soundproof. Bring earplugs if you wake up easily to sounds. We go to bed early around nine, so groups returning from elsewhere at midnight would make a bit of noise coming up the stairs. Keep in mind this is not a college booze hang out, so the noise is not so bad compared to other rowdy hotels. The buffet was incredible. We've stayed at all inclusives before, and the Reef has the best buffet by far. Lots of fresh fruits and salads, Mexican dishes, American standars, as well as European favorites. We go to Mexico every year, and tend to hit the Pacific Coast since it is closer, but now that we've discovered the Reef, we'll go back there in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, relaxing stay”
Reviews.Author: Mada2010
Reviews.Content: I was very affraid to go there after reading negative opinions about this hotel. But there are always people who complain about everything, even if they spent holidays in heaven ;))), there would be always something to complain about. I travel a lot and I would reccomend this hotel. This is not palace but has great, relaxing atmosphere, so if you are expecting luxury find another suitable place for you. Resort is small comparing to huge in neighborhood, what is great - small distances, comfortable, lovely green garden, nice atmosphere. Staff very friendly, helpfull. Food ok - the best meal of the day is breakfast - omelet first class!!!!.Snacks served till 2 am - when you give a small tip - they will serve you untill 3am - I would reccomend tacos there. Beach lovely, pools small but ok. The only negative thing are rooms - very average standard, need renovating and has specific smell - but you can get used to it. I knew about it when I book so I was not supprised. If you like privacy, nature, calm and great views and you are not a person who is looking for neative things everywhere you are - do not hesitate - Go to Reef Playacar and have a wonderfull stay. ps. sorry for not perfect english

Reviews.Title: “Great vacation - low key at resort but close to town if you want action”
Reviews.Author: KevinKman
Reviews.Content: Our second time at the Reef, went back on March break because we enjoyed it so much the first time. The resort itself is quite small but that only gives you an intimate feel. You tend to meet the same people day after day and it allows a sense of framiliarity to develop. Spend any time at the swim up bar and you will meet and make new friends. While drinks are not high end they are good and plentiful, the beer on tap is dos XXes. Bartenders are great and follow direction well as well as being creative when left to their own devices. Food at the buffet is very good with a wide selection. Several dishes are repeated but there is usually something new to choose from every night. A la carte restaurants are good if you want to be waited upon but the food quality is not much different from the buffett. Downtown Playa is only a 10-15 min walk down the beach so if you want to shop or a more active night life it is well within reach. All in all you can make a vaction here into anything you want, relaxing and quiet or more rowdy if that is what you are looking for. Grounds are beautiful and staff is super. We will probably be back again next year. Excellent value for the $$.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, lovely, relaxing...OK food”
Reviews.Author: AmanteDePlayas
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I (both in our 20s) had a wonderful and relaxing 5 nights at the Reef Playacar. I had low expectations from reading negative reviews, but was pleasantly surprised! The hotel grounds are gorgeous and lush, with overgrown plants and palm trees to provide a shady walkway. The buildings look authentic and are cheerful yellow and orange. The rooms are average in terms of amenities but very clean and we tipped $2 everyday for more towels. The size of the resort is a definite plus, because no matter where your room is you can arrive at the beach, pool, lobby, gym, or spa in 2-3 minutes. We woke up at 6am everyday to secure a sun bed and that was pure bliss with a view of the ocean. Not too many annoying guests - lots of families and older people. We wanted a real escape and went to bed w/o any night life, though I don't think there's much to do at night on the resort anyway. Another positive to note is that the hotel is a short walk (15 min) to town from either the beach or the road. Food was below average in my opinion but I am picky. My boyfriend liked the variety. Lots of variety, yes, but I felt the quality was not good. I wished they had more authentic Mexican food. The guacamole came from a bag and pico de gallo was only available during lunch (not with nachos during regular snack hours.) We LOVED the late night tacos at the snack bar but unfortunately did not discover it until the 2nd to last night. (Saludos a nuestro amigo, Alberto!!! He's so friendly and sweet, GREAT cook!) The a la carte restaurants were just OK - the salmon was pretty good and soups were tasty but otherwise the meat dishes were too drenched in sauce. Same menu every night. We did enjoy sitting on the rooftop of Terraza Grill with a view of the moonlight. Overall, great stay. We came back rejuvenated and the R&R was appreciated. Weather was beautiful Thanks for a great vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Best Place to Stay in All of Mexico”
Reviews.Author: Fnrcan
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a week at the Reef, This being my first time to the Yucatan I didnt know what to expect, the Reef was awesome to say the least. The staff was great, They went out of their way everyday to make sure our stay was as pleasant as possible. The grounds were absolutely amazing and the rooms were perfect. The resort is the perfect size and there are plenty of lounge chairs at the pool and beach every day to go around. The food was amazing, especially the late night Tacos at the snack bar. The Reef can be as lively as you want it to be but is very kid friendly. We travelled without our children and we found as much fun as we could handle. The staff organizes nightly trips to night clubs in Playa Del Carmen. The beach staff works very hard to get you boogie boards, kayaks, and catamarans which are all included in the price, thank you "Xavier". The Bars are spaced throughout the resort and we never had a problem getting drinks anywhere. Felix and Jesus would even remember our choice of drinks and have them ready before we were done the drinks we had. The jungle theme gives the resort an exotic feel. The rooms are large and the beds mattresses were being swapped out for new ones while we were there but we found the old ones totally fine. The time share people didn't bother us at all and seemed to respect everyones wishes. We tipped our cleaning staff, waiters and bar tenders because I think everyone would agree they work incredibly hard for you. We will definately be returning to the "Reef", Our vacation was everything we has hoped it to be.

Reviews.Title: “Great Small Resort with lots to offer”
Reviews.Author: awolfe
Reviews.Content: We are a group of seven who have been to Mexico each March for about the last 6 years, staying at different resorts. This year, something about The Reef pulled us and we chose it for our vacation. The resort is small, so everything is close. Having the beach so close to the pools and all the action is great. There are two pools and neither is very crowded. Our weather was great. The staff is extraordinary - Mary and Elmer in the buffet, Jesus at the pool bar, Tim, Anel, and Nelson at the activities pool . We had no complaints - not even about the beds that everyone had warned about - none of us lacked for sleep. If you want a little hotel with a lot of heart, stay at the Reef!

Reviews.Title: “Our first All Inclusive/Rivieria Maya Treat”
Reviews.Author: debbutch
Reviews.Content: We researched and researched for a resort on the Riveria Maya that would suit our needs and stay within a tight budget. The reef was it. We have wanted to visit this area for a long time The first time we thought we would be able to make it Hurricaine Wilma got there first and we had to change our plans. This time we made it and we were totally and completely content with the resort and side trip we booked. The Reef was the answer in every since. We especially enjoyed Jesus at the pool bar along with Marco, Gilbert in the buffet and our housekeeping maid( we didn't get her name). We enjoyed the grounds and the interaction with the other guests. We were however a bit surprised to find that for a small resort with a smaller nuber of guest the fact that what was an over abundant amount of lounge chairs and cabanas onsite that we had to make sure we had marked/reseerved ones we wanted by no later then 6:30 am. we later were informed that people living in the area can have limited privliges to the resort and come onto the resort property and use the facilities. Thus taking away from the actual guests stayting at the resort.This will be a large consideration if we plan to return to the area. We were also suprised to find that the resort does not provide a list of activities that occur daily, the nighthly shows or which nights the restaurants are closed. Other resort we have visited provide this type inforamtion in written form upon check in. The Reef has a bulletin board they have somw info on but you are not rtold anything about where to find it. Or that is even exists. we found it quite by accident, We also were not given a map of the resort and where things were located and had to figure things out for ourselves the first couples days.. We did book a side trip to Chichen Itza with Carlos Diaz at --.. This was a private tour, we did not have the concern of other travelers to worry about. We were promptly pick up at the resort and taken to Chichne itza. Where we met our private guide set up thru Carlos. Rafeal our guide who happens to be a Mayan archeologist/anthropoligist who works on the site took us around the site without any vendor interference and answered all our questions and gave us a tremendous understanding of these people, the culture and the intelligence they attained.

Reviews.Title: “Cheers to the Reef! A wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: ErinDee
Reviews.Content: THANK YOU REEF PLAYACAR! Just returned from 8 nights at the Reef with my boyfriend. We had a wonderful experience, and I would return to the Reef in a heartbeat. Service: Phenomenal. All of the employees were courteous, helpful, and went out of their way to ensure our stay was a pleasant one. Bars: One of the best parts. The bartenders are great, and will even start making your favorite drink when they see you coming! Jesus at the pool bar and Jose at the lobby are awesome creating drinks for you too if you are not sure what you want. (Try Jesus' guava special). Also recommend the meloncoladas. I became addicted. There's a place to find a drink whenever you crave it. Setting: The hotel is lovely. I truly felt as though I was in paradise. All paths are lined with beautiful trees and they create a jungle feels. No issues with mosquitoes at all either, which I was nervous about! The beach is breathtaking and not overly crowded. Pool: 2 pools--one fun for relaxing/drinking, and the other is great for playing games (volleyball, basketball, water polo) or splashing around. Chairs: If you want a chair by the pool or one of the chairs designed as a "bed", be prepared to put your towel out early (7 am), but there are always chairs available on the beach any hour. Food: Buffet offered a decent variety (especially breakfast--I couldn't get enough of the made-to-order omelettes and french toast topped w/ caramelized bananas. And a mimosa every morning didn't hurt either!). The 2 restaurants were delicious, particularly the salmon at both. We alternated between them for dinner each night. By the end, it was a bit repetitive, but the quality was great, so we didn't care. If you are a strict vegetarian, food options will be a little more challenging. Fun extras: Tea from 4 to 6 is lovely! Irish coffee or champagne and a chocolate chip cookie? Yes please! Hang out, play cars, soak up the good life. Cleanliness: Could not have been better. The employees work hard keeping this place pristine. Rooms: Perfectly clean and acceptable. Bed is hard if that bothers you big time, but I had no trouble sleeping at night. They are cleaned daily and were left spotless. Tipping: Do it. These employees are working so hard to make your stay a pleasant one. A few dollars here and there in the end are not going to break your bank, and they are appreciated (and deserved). Gym: Small but did the job. Never had trouble getting a cardio machine or access to weights. Overall Value: Extraordinary!

Reviews.Title: “sixth visit and have not been disappointed yet!”
Reviews.Author: cglon_11
Reviews.Content: We have just returned home from our sixth visit to the Reef Playacar. We have traveled to this same area 10 years in a row, and have tried different resorts but always come back to The Reef being our favorite. We have been satisfied with food choices whether it is breakfast, lunch or dinner. Fresh fruits and vegetables in abundance, and there is always something offered to satisfy. We like The Reef because it is a smaller resort, with the staff superior to any other resort we have stayed at. We like the fact that our favorites remember us, and they always go the extra mile to be helpful. The location is ideal, as we usually go into town almost every night. The entertainment might be a little cheezy, but the top floor bar is the perfect way to unwind and end the evening. Our girls are now in their 20's and as they usually travel with a friend, they find a way to wake up the crowd and carve fun into every day/night. We didn't find it a problem getting up early to reserve a chair, as we like to be right at the water's edge and the early morning is so beautiful. Great walking beach, which goes on for miles. Quick service with drinks and our favorite bartenders were Jesus and Orlando. Other favorite employees were: Daniel, Simon, Angel...the list could go on and on. Every single one of them always had a smile. The salon pedicure was amazing. As was the upgrade to a suite next to the beach. Time share issues? Never....we are smart enough to avoid that problem before even being approached. Will be back for a 7th year in 2012!

Reviews.Title: “Wasnt was what we expected, for stars not higher than a 3”
Reviews.Author: dentonniki
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for 2 weeks over christmas. Well i got food poising twice while i was there which was the worst thing that ever could happen to a person! (I got all my shots before my trip) The food was just ok, in the begining it was good but after a week it was the same ol food....they sell you phone cards that you cant use with the pay phones there and you can use them in your room for a extra charge, I found everything there was a extra charg. I know I might be complaining but it was one thing after another for us, when you first arrive there they tell you they have a welcome package for you its them trying to sell you a time share! we didnt really know of any activies to do there so we went to town alot! we paid to much for what we got! you could smell sewage! The rooms were clean, beds were not to soft. I dont care what other ppl have put on here this hotel is not 4 star at all!!! Everything was so over-priced. Breakfast was the best meal there. Most of the staff were awesome tho!

Reviews.Title: “Would I go back? Yep!! Here's why:”
Reviews.Author: cordium23
Reviews.Content: So, this might take a while. My husband and I chose this resort from looking at places from the earth view on Google (really) and ultimately the recommendation from our travel agent. We prefer the low-key all inclusives with some character, and the reviews overall looked good. It wasn't a long drive from Cancun airport, and easy enough to find (we rented a car for the trip). It was after dark when we arrived, but the dinner buffet was still open, as was the upstairs bar. Other than the nightly show, there wasn't a whole lot going on. The next day and all the days following were a great time though. The location of the resort itself is pretty great. It isn't a long walk to town along the shore, the beach is great, and it's located just north of some of the larger resorts. You can enjoy the waves crashing in the water, or sit back and people watch. If hanging on the beach gets old (ha!), they have two pools, including the one with the swim up bar. Jesus will definitely take care of you. All the great comments about him are no lie. He is a great guy. One bummer for us was the little hot tub was never warm, but no big deal. And even though EVERY ONE of the beach beds and a good amount of the loungers are reserved before we were even up at 7 for breakfast, we never had trouble finding a lounger when we were ready to chill on the beach. The resort overall was very beautiful. All of the lush plants, weaving walkways, and little treasures to discover never got old. We stayed in room 513, first floor, near the tea time social area. Our patio looked out onto one of the walkways. It was quiet and peaceful. I enjoyed our room. It was a good size and very clean. I especially liked the "moon" light on the patios. It set a very intimate feel for an evening walk. Our air conditioner had a leaking problem, but we've dealt with worse, so we didn't bother calling. As for the beds, I know a lot of people commented that they were too hard, but I didn't have any problem myself with it personally. There were plenty of pillows and I would always go to bed tired from the day. You do hear a lot going on in the surrounding rooms, and you will smell it when your next door neighbors are smoking pot. But how much time are you planning on hanging in your room in the middle of the day? The bars were plentiful, we usually ended up at the pool bar. Eventually, you get used to the hours of the bars and restaurants. As far as the food went, we never went hungry. Breakfast was nice. They had a little area set up so you can make yourself a mimosa or bloody mary if you please. There were always pastries, fruits, juices, omelets, and even some authentic specialties. For you picky eaters, well, there's cereal. Lunch was a pretty basic buffet. Outstanding, no, but we always had something decent to eat. I'd recommend keeping that meal small if you are doing a lot of activities. Dinners were usually good too. The buffet for dinner did the trick fine. I usually went with pasta. Three of the nights we ate at the a la carte places. Botticelli's is in a dimly lit telephone shaped room, with windows all around and a very romantic feel. They had good pasta, a decent little salad bar and I really liked the house red wine. The salmon there was very good. The chicken and lamb I wasn't as impressed with. Terraza grill was something I assumed to be more casual, but when we went to eat there, it was very upscale looking and was good as well. The resort also had a great ice cream bar in the afternoons, which was set up overlooking the cenote by the lobby, and a snack bar open pretty much all day for more a more casual option. Be patient though, it can get backed up quickly. We did get an invitation to pick up our "welcome gift" which did have something to do with listening to the timeshare deal, but we just said we weren't interested. That was that. No big deal. The resort does die down at nighttime, but you can always make your way to the front area of the resort and hang by the bar or go see the nightly show the entertainment crew puts on. We saw a couple of them. Not bad. My only suggestion would be to amp up the performance room. Maybe remodel the room or make it an indoor/outdoor style venue. They do a pretty good job but it would be nice if more guests were able to see the show. We did have an outing one day to Chichen Itza, and the Dzitnip cenote (sp?). We rented a car which I recommend if you want to choose when you leave rather than waiting for a 7am tour. Eric the concierge was so helpful about making sure we knew where we were going and gave us maps. It was a great venture and a really nice drive. Our camera broke at Chichen Itza, so we didn't get many pictures. The cenote was fun (cave swimming!). We didn't bother stopping at Coba since the camera broke. The second to last day, it rained all morning. The canopy of trees on the resort kept the walkways relatively dry, and we passed the time by playing billiards upstairs. After the rain stopped, it was perfect for walking into town and shopping on 5th ave. There are some good places to eat, and a lot of shopping. We even found a place with a "tequila museum", it was pretty insane. The overcast day made the walking weather perfect along the shore. The resort allowed us to have a late checkout, so we were able to enjoy every minute of our last morning. Not only that, Eric helped us out when our rental car wouldn't start. What a great help he was! I'm not planning on going back to Mexico any time soon, but I would go back to this place because I wasn't ready to leave.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful, intimate resort... wonderful beach”
Reviews.Author: islatiempo
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent the week of Feb 12 at The Reef and had a wonderful experience escaping Chicago's dreadful winter weather. We have been to larger resorts in the area and purposely selected The Reef because we wanted a small resort. We spent every day on the beach--reading sailing, relaxing, swimming, walking... Unforgettable! The food was very good--lots of fresh fruit, different veggies... We ate every meal outside on the terrace of Chulavista (Elmer was our terrific server). We were too content to try the special restaurants--maybe next time. We loved the little critters roaming around, the ice cream shop, the Mayan coffee between 4pm and 5:30pm. This resort makes fantastic use of their space(there are a few places where the addition of hand rails would be helpful). This resort attracts a nice mix of people from countries other than the US (very refreshing). We loved our vacation and would definitely recommend The Reef.

Reviews.Title: “A Beautiful resort, Although we did have some issues with our vacation”
Reviews.Author: garymary
Reviews.Content: We were guests at the Reef Playacar from 2/2711 thru 3/4/11, The trip was booked through Expedia. Upon arrival, check in was quick and efficient. Gus came over and said he would be our consierge at the Reef. He gave us a brief summary on the hotel bars, restaurants and then quickly veered the subject to visiting a sister hotel for a tour and getting our Mexican package aka a timeshare presentation. I signed up and we were escorted to our room 531 which had a lovely view of a parking lot. I might add, the Reef does not have elevators so if you have health or mobility problems, that could be a problem. I did ask if ther were any rooms on 1st or 2nd floors and was told they were full.. The resort grounds are gorgeous with the hotel being built in to a jungle environment with cednotes and water falls. It is a short walk to the 2 pools and pool bar and the beach. Since we have been to Mexico 9 times and have visited 7 resort areas, we canceled our time share presnetation the next day. It is our opinion that the resort does not have enough chairs pool side or beach side. I know many people are up at 6am to throw their towels on loungers thinking it is there own private lounger that they can have all day even though in many cases, the loungers were un occupied for 4-5 hours. We have been to resorts in Ixtapa and Huatulco that did not allow this to happen. the service at the pool bar was excellant. Jesus and Orlando were great bartenders. Upon arrival, our room refridge was full of cans of soda and water, We were told to go to the lobby bar to get cans of soda. We did this and were told to go to the pool bar. The pool bar said they didn't have cans of soda and we felt like we were getting the run around. We never did get any more cans of soda in our fridge, although we did get bottled water. Also a first, we did not have any drinking glass in our room. This was a first for us in all the places in Mexico we have been to. I asked at the front desk and never really got a direct answer. To make a phone call to the USA from your hotel room was 25 usd for 4 minuted which was highway robbery using a credit card to place the call. the food at the Reef was very good, no complaints on the food at all. Gilbert who worked the breakfast shift was a delight. He was so friendly and a very hard worker. a plus to the Reef. Our room was cleaned every day and although we did have some ants in the bathroom, it was only a a few and the came in though an opening in the window frame.
