Our daughter tried calling the reosrt from the US and could not get through. The phone switches to an automated system and she would enter our room number and the system would not transfer her to our room. Fortunatly these were not any emergency or ungent calls. I went to the front desk and said she tried calling at 930pm and the man at the desk insisted they answer all the calls which he obviously did not .Since the Reef is only a 15 minute walk to downtown, we found internet cafes where we could send emails and make calls to the USA at a very reasonable rate. We found the grounds throughtout the resort to be very clean and well maintained. One thing I did not like was during our stay, we were approaced by 3 different employess to get our Mexican package aka time share. I do not go on vacation for this unless I am interested in taking a time share presentation. While we did not have any major problems, I did talk to some people who were not happy at the Reef. whether they will post it on trip advisor or not I dont know. We have been to many locations in Mexico and prefer smaller resorts rather than the mega resorts. The Reef Playacar was beautiful, very clean and we did not experience problems that some people talked about. The location is great, most of the staff was friendly, although I think some of the staff needs to be better trained in customer service. The food was good and even though there is not much nitelfe there, a shaort cab ride in town will get you to the clubs if that is your interest. any questons, please feel free to email me. Gary and Mary

Reviews.Title: “Had a great time”
Reviews.Author: lemonid50
Reviews.Content: I spent a 7 day all inclusive there at the end of January. Everything was great. I'd recommend the Reef to friends and family. I liked the fact that it wasn't a party place and the guests were older. Good food, comfy beds and good location (walking distance to Playa). I'd go again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Resort - Amazing Beach”
Reviews.Author: Geit123_11
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Reef Playacar Feb 14-21, 2011 and had one of the best vacations in our life. We loved the resort and found it very cosy, unlike some of the huge resorts in the area. The service was great in all their restaurants; the staff were always friendly and obliging. Kudos to Gustavo who was always informative and friendly and all the hard working staff. We would go back in a heartbeat. Our day trip with Yukatours to Tulum was also amazing. It was my birthday and I will never forget the beautiful day and the memorable trip. Brigitte & George, Toronto

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING!”
Reviews.Author: kaylijo
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed from February 14th-21st at the Reef and we are already dying to go back! We were a little nervous going there because of some of the mixed reviews but don't listen to any of the people telling you it isn't worth the money. NEGATIVES: We went knowing not to expect much from the rooms, so when we got there we were not surprised by the hard (like sleeping on the ground) beds, the paper thin walls, the musty smell and the air conditioner that worked when it wanted to. We weren't going to be spending much time in the room anyway, we came here for the beach! POSITIVES: The grounds are beautiful! The size of the resort was so perfect, no overcrowded pools, beaches and restaurants.The staff is amazing, every worker is always smiling and saying hola. The bartenders are the best, always have another drink ready for you. Jesus at the pool bar was our favorite, always remembering our names and what we wanted to drink. The beach was gorgeous, didn't have trouble finding a chair but to get one by an umbrella or a bed you had to be up and out there pretty early. We always felt safe no matter what time of day/night it was. It is a 10 min walk to town by beach or street or a cab ride is only $5. Yes, the rooms do need to be updated but chances are if they did, this resort would be a lot more expensive because that was the only negative we found on our whole trip. We thought this trip was worth every penny and would return and recommend it to any friend. We spend one day at Xplor doing the zip lines, i also would recommend this to anyone who is at all interested.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderfull”
Reviews.Author: lilley85
Reviews.Content: What a great place for a great price it's almost like your walking through the jungle its beautiful and the ocean is literally 2 min from your room.. My mom and i went for 1 week and had just a blast, wonderfull resort, clean, cozy, and wonderfull staff. Jesus as the pool bar was awesome he even came out clubbing with us one night. The restaurant staff are always smiling and offering tequila sunrise ha ha. overall we had a great stay and i would recommend it to my friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, Little Resort”
Reviews.Author: yazzy13
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Reef Playacar in early February and had a wonderful time. My wife and I have taken trips south for the last 7 years. We’ve stayed at 5 star resorts and at barely 3 star resorts. The Reef Playacar is definitely one of best places we’ve been to, and we wouldn’t hesitate to return. One of the nicest things about the Reef is that it is small. As a result, there is great staff service. Plus – no long walks to the beach or any other services. When you’re on a holiday in the sun, who wants to waste their time? Another great thing about the Reef is that it is so close to Playa del Carmen. It’s an easy walk if you choose. I also like the fact that it is in a neighbourhood of vacation homes, which gives it a livelier feel. At no time did we feel unsafe. The grounds are gorgeous – intimate, lots of lovely greenery and nice design. Small wild (but very tame) agoutis wonder around all the time, and they add a cute flavour to the place. There are two pools, both of which are lovely and were never crowded. One has a swim-up bar. There is a small hot tub which was not all that hot. The beach is awesome – one of the nicest we’ve been to. There is a TON of room there, and there are lovely terraces leading down to the beach so you can choose the surface you want to lounge on. The resort has a number of outdoor ‘beds’ on these terraces, which looked nice but were in great demand. Otherwise, lounge chairs were abundant. The swimming was lovely, and there are lots of water activities available if you wish. The main restaurant was fine. It had a decent variety of food which changed daily. Certainly not luxury but just as good as other resorts we have been to. The a la carte restaurants were good, with excellent service. In many places you have to reserve those tables - the material in the room said the same. However, we were told that you could just walk in. Surprisingly, they weren’t all that busy. Well worth checking out. The bars are well stocked and there are lots of great drinks. We had excellent service from Felix at the beach bar. The night time entertainment was typical resort fare but fine. Our room was fine with the standard amenities. It was nice to have a balcony to enjoy the view. The air conditioning worked well and kept us nice and cool. The only downside is that the mattress was quite hard. I was ok with it but it was not as great for my wife (though she still would happily return). Finally, the resort has at least 3 sweet, stray cats. We loved to find them lounging on someone’s patio or looking for food. They weren’t a nuisance and, if you are an animal lover, it was nice to have their company. Overall – we had an excellent experience at the Reef. It’s a gorgeous, small resort with amazing staff and all you need for an enjoyable vacation. We would not hesitate to recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “The RUDEST and MOST unfriendly service. Security physically acosted me & my GF”
Reviews.Author: linfisher
Reviews.Content: Warning to All..., First, please note that I am a senior executive who works with many of the world's largest and well known hotels in the world. I have a very keen eye and ear to how hotels operate and treat their customers. This was a total scam! The hotel was nice enough in quality of build and sense of arrival. Check in was fairly smooth. After checking in and asking standard questions about the property, I was relatively satisfied and ready to settle in to my room. The room was not 100% what I asked for but i didn't stress since I was on holiday. My girl got there 4 days before I did and we wanted two places to stay. One on the beach at the villa and one at the hotel close to all the parties and people. So she was NOT staying with me as her primary lodging. SHE WAS JUST VISITING. THE SCAM... I walked my girl into the hotel and was abruptly stopped by security. They said we had to have her check in with the front desk. We said "ok." Once we got to the front desk, I was expecting to have some type of wrist band given to her that would state "THIS PERSON IS NOT TO BE SERVED ANY "ALL INCLUSIVE" SERVICES." A guest pass of sorts. In short **********They tried to charge me $50 A DAY for her to even walk on property. I told them to put a band on her that would keep employees from serving her all inclusively. They said everyone who comes on property must pay and must have a band. We just wanted to grab a few items and maybe have a quick smootch fest. In ANY all-inclusive hotel that I have been, if you don’t have a band, you don’t get served. And in some cases, they give you a band that clearly states not to serve that person and if you don’t have a band that is when you get kicked off property. Suffice to say, I was livid! Think about it… If I wanted to have 3 friends over for a glass of wine in my room that I purchased it would cost me $150 a day for that privilege. That is worse than a night club! They were total jerks and not customer friendly. I told them that I was not told this would be the case and since my whole plan was to entertain from time to time some friends who were down there… that would be an absurd thing to do… I want out! When I asked to simply be refunded my money due to their lack of communication when I was asking them about the property, they said NO. The manager couldn’t care less and had no empathy. I tried every combination of option to get what I was asking for and to ensure they could adhere to their policies. They couldn’t care less. *****The physical accosting***** After 30 minutes of trying to work it out and explain why I was totally misled and not informed about their policies, I told them I was leaving and that I would take it up with AMEX and EVERY travel site I could find to let the world know what kind of racquet this hotel had set up. I told my girl to follow me regardless of their policy so that I could pack and get the EFF outta there. I told the staff that we were going to leave and we had NO desire to be stay there a minute longer. When we started to walk to the room a security guard came running after us. My girl was walking in front of me and to my left. I saw the security guard reach aggressively for her arm to pull her back so I grabbed his arm and pulled him back from touching her. After removing him from our personal space we kept on walking towards the room and then the security guard ran in front of me and grabbed my shirt. I’m 6’4” 205… he was 5’7” 150… you do the math. I moved him like a sheet of paper in a hurricane. If he wouldn’t have been so aggressive we would have stopped or not engaged that way. He kept yelling, I’m going to call the policia. We kept saying please do…! They expected us to trash the room and take stuff… We just wanted to leave that place fast as possible. Don’t get trapped in this hotel thinking they work like other All-Inclusive hotels. It’s a scam and trap if you want to have any visitors, plan on paying more than the hottest night club on a Saturday night with a line of 500 people. Total BS.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Holiday”
Reviews.Author: kjbart
Reviews.Content: We just got back from the Reef Playacar and loved every minute of our stay. When we checked in, we were offered an upgrade from our two rooms one with a king bed and the other for our teenage boys with 2 double beds. The next day, they moved us to a suite where we had a beautiful room with a king bed and the boys were put in a attached room to our suite where the bed folded out to a sofa and a cot was brought in. They had a 50" plasma tv in there room so they were thrilled. The room also happened to be on the top floor of a building 2 in from the pool, so the location was outstanding. The wonderful thing about this hotel is that even if you are in one of the buildings closer to the front desk, you are still only a 2 min walk to the pool and eating areas. The beds by the pool are wonderful but you have to be up very early in the morning to get one in a prime location. It is definately worth getting up early for in my opinion. Jesus at the pool bar was incredible, having our drinks sometimes ready for us at the bar as we walked towards him. He was not the only great staff member, however, we ran into them all through the property. Vita at the front desk, Pedro from the scuba dive shop, all the wonderful waiting staff at Boticelli's restaurant which we enjoyed two of the evenings we were there. Another area of the hotel that we thoroughly enjoyed was the tropical area in the middle of the property. Every evening from 4- 6pm they served specialty coffees, cookies and sandwiches. We loved that area and sat and played cards, it was a wonderful way to wind down the day. Everyone is incredibly friendly and because of the nice small size of the property , they make you feel like family. The food at the buffet was very good and both restaurants were excellent. Breakfast at the buffet was always our favorite. If you are looking for a quiet get away weak with family that will be thoroughly relaxing, I highly recommend the Reef Playacar. We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous Hotel, Sincere & Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: Winnipeg-Go-To-Girl
Reviews.Content: This area of Mexico is beautiful, no matter what. This resort in particular adds to the beauty by the sweetness and genuine care of the people that work there. The details and photos shown on their website are just what you get upon arrival ... it's a momentary walk no matter where you're going ... the lobby, the pool area, the beach, the buffet ... even Senior Frogs is only a short walk down the beach (about 15-20 minutes). Our room was spacious, clean and inviting. The surroundings are lush and aromatic. The sand on the beach is like sugar, and the ocean glows turquoise like a giant gemstone. The meals in the buffet offered a nice variety, and the service was impecable. Mary cheerfully refilled our coffee cups in the morning, Simon entertained us during dinner and recommended excellent wine for our meals (among other beverages), and Felix, Jesus and Miguel looked after us any time we were thirsty - which was pretty much all the time! We were so impressed by all the staff - they seemed to instantly remember our names (or nicknames), which drinks we prefer, where we're from, and just made us feel like family. Our thanks to everyone there, and we hope to see you all again as soon as we possibly can! Best wishes from Winnipeg, Canada!

Reviews.Title: “Good value, wonderful ambiance!”
Reviews.Author: Lafrend
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Reef Playacar in Feb '11 for one week. It's a beautiful resort with a sort of "urban jungle" landscaping and meandering walkways. The beach is beautiful--white sand, clean beach. This resort is at least 20 years old and they have maintained it well. Our biggest complaint was the noise level from the service carts going back and forth on the walkways right outside our room. They start at 6:00 am and go until about 11:00 pm. However, the entire resort did not seem to have this issue. If I go back, I would ask for a room near the cenote, where it is quieter, or at least away from the restaurants. Our room was on the first floor, close to the pools, restaurants and beach, but I would have preferred to be further away from the beach to get a quieter room--or, at least a room on an upper floor. I also think that they need to upgrade their towels. They've been in service for quite awhile. The restaurants were very good, but not exceptional. We never got tired of the buffet--better than expected! We loved the omelets by Victoria and fresh fruit in the morning. The Italian restaurant Botticelli's was very good. Likewise, the steak house was very good. (Men need to wear long pants at these two restaurants. My husband was sent back to change into long pants on one night that we forgot.) We ate in Playa del Carmen one night and at Cozumel another night. (Be sure to check out Alberto's in Cozumel for some AWESOME seafood!) The staff was very friendly and helpful. We loved Jesus at the swim-up bar. Ask him to make you a mango daiquiri--my new favorite drink! We found that tipping was much appreciated and received great service in return. Get up early to save a beach chair, or wait until late afternoon for one to open up. We didn't go to any of the resort shows, but we did go to the Mexico Spectacular show at Xcaret. It was fantastic. I would recommend going early to get good seats. We also had the dinner, which added to the whole experience. We walked into town a couple of times. It takes about 20 minutes to get to the pier. We took taxis home for $5. All in all, I believe that you get a good value for the price at this resort. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Four Star Resort with Five Star People”
Reviews.Author: CantWait2Bback
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 weeks starting Jan. 9th, 2011. Starting with the negatives, the room was OK but needed updating. Did not complain to the front dest as we were not in our room very much. Our view was terrible from the balcony, ground level when we requested upper floor, looked at a fence with the employee walk running between. Air Conditioner leaked alot so ended up not using it at all which was fine (we were there for the heat). The information put in the room from the timeshare was misleading (our records show that you have not picked up your welcome package or something to that effect), although the guys that do the timeshare pitch are helpful as well. Now for the loooong list of POSITIVES...I can't say enough about the staff. Every one was very friendly and helpful, it was fun trying to learn Spanish and they would help you along although a good number of them spoke English. The bartenders were fun and poured great drinks. Make sure you give whoever treats you well a good TIP, find a bartender or 2 that you click with and throw them a twenty, they will treat you like Gold for the duration of your stay. Had a great time bantering with the grounds crew and maids who do not speak any english, but made an effort to understand what was being said. The interior of the resort was amazing, with the walk through the "jungle" to your room very peaceful. There was a good variety of food choices at the buffet that were tasty and fresh and the two a la cartes were great (not alot of menu items, but what was there was very well prepared). Only once were we not able to get a table at the a la carte and we did not make any reservations. I can't comment on the pools,as we spent all of our resort time on the beach which was fabulous. Never had any problems getting a lounger, but would have had to get up early to get an umbrella or a cabana. The location was perfect, a 15 minute stoll along the beach and you are at the Ferry dock and the beginning of 5th Ave with it's shopping etc. A 20 minute walk the opposite direction and you leave the masses behind for a more private shoreline. I highly recommend this resort if you are NOT looking for a huge resort with lots of nightlife or partying.

Reviews.Title: “Leave Your Worries Behind”
Reviews.Author: gr8fuldave
Reviews.Content: We were very pleasantly surprised by this hidden gem. We booked last minute just to get out of a very snowy New England, and boy were we pleased! After being kindly greeted by several staff members, we soon found our way through a lush, beautifully groomed tropical garden/forrest, to our spacious room. The grounds were meticulously cared for. We found our week to be PERFECT at this all-inclusive resort...The food was fantastic with a decent variety of local dishes as well as home-styled comfort foods. The views were nothing short of captivating! The water sports were great and the weather was spectacular. The only concern we had was with the bed...way too hard, but when we brought it to their attention, they offered to put us in another room. Athough there are 188 hotels in Playa Del Carmen, we will definately be back to The Reef Playacar!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great place for the price....”
Reviews.Author: HondaTraveler38
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I visited The Reef for 7 days in mid December. We got a great deal on our trip so we decided to give it a try. I would rate the resort average, but for what we payed for it, it was worth it. I have been to many all-inclusive resorts, I would say that this is at the bottom of my list for a couple reasons. 1. The buffets were as expected, bad. The food was not hot, there was no variety, and breakfast( which is usually the best buffet) was horrible. We did try both of the sit-down places for dinner, they were both better than expected. The steak-house was the better of the two, my steak was done perfectly, not the best cut of steak mind you, but very tasty and not tough. The Italian place was very good as well. I can tell you that we lived off of the snack bar most of the week. The cheese fries and burgers were great, just make sure you ask for a fresh burger on the grill! The after dinner tacos at the snack bar were also very good. But again, my expectations for the food was very low having been to many all-inclusives, and I was still dissapointed in the buffets. 2. The bars were never open when advertised, and the drinks are made with some kind of fruit mix. I am not a big drinker, but on vacation I like to kick back with a nice fruity drink...not here, stick to the beer. The rooms are average at best, bed wasn't to bad, but the lack of sound-proofing was a problem. I am a sound sleeper, but my girlfriend woke up a couple nights from banging and yelling. The staff is okay, a little pushy until you give them a firm NO about the time-share. I would go back if I could get the same deal I got this time, but The Reef would be nowhere near my first choice of places to return to. Again, for the price, not bad.

Reviews.Title: “Not perfect, but generally excellent resort”
Reviews.Author: io_saturnalia
Reviews.Content: The only drawbacks I found during our recent stay were the dinner buffet -- it tasted fine, but was unexceptional and hardly authentic Mexican (though I understand that's the way it is with all-inclusive set-ups) -- and the fact that some of the staff with something to sell were a TINY bit on the pushy side. I get that moving product and services is the name of the game, but I don't want to be "invited" to a breakfast (to hear about time shares) when I'm trying to check in to the place, especially after a long day of travel from Boston. Similarly, if I'm chilling by the pool with my eyes closed or glued to a book, that's not the time I want to hear about snorkeling. OK, those are minor drawbacks. In general, the staff were cheerful and helpful and the vibe was just about as relaxing as I had hoped for. Here are some of the highlights: The Azul swim-up bar was fun with Jesus keeping the booze flowing and the action entertaining. This was a great place to meet new friends. Tip a hundred pesos every couple of days and the service is even more exceptional. The beach was beautiful and the water warm enough for all-day swimming, but still refreshing. The buffet breakfasts and lunches were excellent, though we usually took our mid-day nourishment at the estimable snack bar. Never made it there for late-night eats. At the buffet, the server Mary was top-notch, keeping the weak but tasty coffee filled. Other staff was a lot more lackadaisical, but it was no big deal in the buffet setting. Better service, in general, if you sit on the patio, and you can't beat the seaview in the a.m. The Italian restaurant on site was quite good; the "Mexican" one was more of a steakhouse. Good food, though limited options. Papa's bar -- the one that goes until 2 a.m. -- was OK but, frankly, a little lackluster. Still, there are plenty of seats. The last thing I will say is that, as a childless couple, we were a bit bummed out by the abundance of children on the property at first. However, and perhaps b/c most of the kids weren't Americans, their behavior was exemplary. It was refreshing to see and, despite the property being at full occupancy, it was just about as quiet (even in the mornings) as we needed it to be. If you're looking for adventure, there's plenty around there, too, though you're probably better off renting a car and driving to Tulum and the various attractions yourself. Cheaper that way. However, we were all about catching rays, swimming, drinking and eating.

Reviews.Title: “Not if you want any sleep, but a beautiful place none the less”
Reviews.Author: arwen944
Reviews.Content: THE BAD FIRST: If you don't really care about sleeping on your vacation, then this may be a good option for you. We stayed the week before Christmas and the first night was a disaster. We were on the 2nd floor of our building and we could hear every single door slam from our floor and both above and below us. The buildings are all tile and there are 4 rooms per floor around a tiny foyer so everything echoes REALLY badly. Then the doors are not true hotel doors, but rather wooden plantation shutter style doors than you can see under and over. Definitely not very private. We could even hear when the people around us went to the restroom. This noise went on until everyone came back from the clubs at around 4 am, and then the early birds above us were up stomping around and slamming drawers at 5:30 am. Wow..1 and 1/2 hours of sleep-great. Even my husband who sleeps like a log was up all night, and that despite having our white noise maker on it's loudest setting next to the bed. (I highly recommend one if you usually sleep with a fan). Our 2 year old was in a playpen, so she kept waking up crying all night because when any of the neighboring rooms would slam their door it would vibrate and shake her out of her sleep. Our 5 year old and I headed out at 7 am to the front desk to get a room change. We were switched to the 3rd floor (top) of another building on the back side to try to get farther away from the noise. This did help a little, but it is honestly just a severe lack of soundproofing. You could hear every step people took up 3 flights of stairs because of the echoing tile. One person came in the middle of the night and actually DRUG all their bags up the stairs..boom, boom, boom -you get my drift. And a lot of the younger clubbing crowd were VERY rude. One night at 2 am some girls came into the adjoining building and were yelling so loud across the courtyard it woke us up. I peeped my head out of our door to nicely ask them to keep it down since our baby was sleeping and all I got was a string of obscenities. I complained to management and all they said was...it's Christmas..people are partying. They did offer to finally move us across the street to one of their other properties on the last night, but by then it wasn't worth packing everything up to go to a place I had no idea about. KIDS CLUB: We went EVERY single day for 6 days straight and never found anyone there. Even when they first opened and at the end of the day, there was always a note on the door saying "we are at the beach". I was not going to trust complete strangers to supervise our 5 year old anywhere near the ocean OR the pool. We wanted him to do some fun games or art and take a break from the sun, which is one of the reasons we booked this hotel. We did search for them at the beach one day, but they were nowhere to be found (kinda like the elusive unicorn-does it really exist or not?) THE FOOD: We were happy enough with the selections, and we are VERY, VERY picky eaters. I knew from other reviews that we should fill up on breakfast and grab fruit for later. Be warned that one of the cooks pours a lot of milk (leche) into the scrambled eggs in the morning, but if you can catch her before she pours the milk in you can have regular scrambled eggs. Many of the staff don't understand english (to be expected), but if you at least try a little spanish and learn the words you need to know before going it will help a lot. There is a lot of pork for all meals on the buffet, so be warned if you are allergic or can't eat for religious reasons. We don't drink alcohol, but the non-alcoholic pina coladas, daiquiris, etc. were some of the worst we have ever had at a beach resort. Very kool-aid mix tasting-Yuk. The 2 nicer restaurants that open for dinner were elegant and the outdoor dining areas for both were very romantic. The steak at the mexican place was delicious..even our 2 year old wanted more (and she hardly eats anything but fruit and bread).*LOCATION: WOW-absolutely stunning. This was our 2nd trip and the beach was even more spectacular than I remembered. White sand and crystal clear blue water with plenty of chairs and shade nearby..our idea of heaven. The addition of the lounging canopy beds is a luxurious touch that we deeply appreciated (if we didn't have the kids we would have slept out there at night!) The grounds of the hotel were always clean and are very exotic feeling with the wooden pathways up in the trees, the waterfall, and natural cenote. The ice cream parlor was a favorite with our family -YUM! Warning--This area, along with many others around the resort, is not handicap accessible or for people with unsure footing, so be careful. **THE GOOD: The concierge and staff were very accommodating for our son's 6th birthday and our anniversary, which made us feel special. The people here are very hard-working and genuinely friendly (unlike Jamaica) and we never felt bullied into tipping or that we were a burden with any request. There was free bottled water at the lobby bar every day if you just asked (we brush our teeth with it). Our son swam with dolphins at Dolphinaris for his birthday and it was a beautiful facility with lots of dolphins and trainers. Extremely good priced compared to the US and worth every penny. We booked online before the trip and saved quite a bit. We did splurge for a few professional pics which were outrageously expensive~ $29 each(knew from previous reviews), but they do let you take pics from afar and I actually got some pretty good videos since my camera has a zoom function. The market down the street to the left of the resort was nice and had many value priced souvenirs. We tried going to the aviary/zoo down to the right, but the price has gone up astronomically (from about $5, to $22 per person), so we knew it wasn't worth it since we had been before. I will say that during our previous stay we were in a honeymoon suite closest to the beach and it was much quieter. If you can get one of those upgraded rooms, I would definitely recommend this hotel because it is so beautiful.

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort, however Beds of Concrete!”
Reviews.Author: smootzy
Reviews.Content: The hotel was beautiful and the beach amazing. We stayed 7 nights and I cant say enough good things about the hotel and staff. The food was good but I wish they would change it up a bit. Pretty much same thing on the buffet for every meal. There is a good sit down restaurant on the property but has somewhat of a dress code. I will not stay at the Reef again because the beds are absolutely made of concrete even with the added egg crate mattress. We were extremely miserable and could not sleep at most of the night. We are in our 40's with no previous back problems but the beds caused us not to sleep and left us very stiff and sore the next day. We even slept out on the beach chairs some nights that was more comfortable. Talking with other guests ..they felt the same way. also... Please watch out for the time share salesmen!!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Resort....Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Nanc01
Reviews.Content: Just home from 7 days at the Reef. Charming, quaint, just what we were looking for! No matter where your room is, it is not far from the beach. We loved the afternoon coffee in the jungle like setting....the making of the coffee was entertaining! (Irish, Mexican, Mayan coffees) The staff worked hard to keep everything clean and to give good service with a smile. The drinks were great and had plenty of liquor in them! The buffet was good as were the restaurants. The egg lady could really whip up a great omelet! And always a nice choice of fruits and desserts. Also, pay no attention to the weather forecast. Although we had several overcast days, we were able to enjoy the beach. (There were 2 days of 60% chance of rain forecast and we had maybe 10 sprinkles on us.) Although we like to try out new places each vacation, I can't imagine going to Playa and not staying at the Reef. Of all our vacations, this was the best value!

Reviews.Title: “Reef Playacar is a wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: cancunmama327
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Reef Jan 15-19. There were six of us, all women, travelling together. The Reef is so quiet and private. The grounds are beautiful and so well tended. One never knew what kind of little critters might scurry across the path. Rooms were clean and adequate. The room next door was sealed up with duct tape and stickers. The smell was horrible...we were told there were termites and the room had been sprayed. Needless to say, we're both still coughing... food was okay, if you're not picky. Never got to the Italian Restaurant it was always closed. Resort personnel were so nice except last Tuesday morning I asked the bartender for a Coke. He YELLED at me that he was closed. The cooler was open and full of Cokes. REsort is a quick walk into Playa. Would definitely return to the Reef and hope to do so soon. Oh, mini-bar was never restocked after the first day. We had 1 Sprite and a Coke when we arrived. Was told it would be stocked but never was.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed feelings”
Reviews.Author: rayne1
Reviews.Content: This was our third time into the Playa area and our first at this resort. This is also the first time i've chosen to write a review and it has compelled me to write a review on our resort from last year as well as it was far superior and this hotel left me nostalgic for it. I'll start with the positive: The grounds are incredible, beyond beautiful. The beach is perfect, the location is ideal an made getting around very easy. We got out quite often to do some deep sea fishing, Xplore and lots of trips into town (town itself is becoming quite annoying due to the constant pestering. It can be charming your first time there but it really does take away from the vibe of the town. I was asked every 5 minutes if I wanted coke or weed and twice called expletives for not accepting.) Some of the staff are very nice and do a great job. Felix at the bar closest to the Marina and the sweet lady that makes omlettes at breakfast were a few of the stand outs. The food is decent for this type of resort. what we've come to expect. I tried scuba diving for the first time through the reef marina and couldn't begin to say enough great things about the staff there. Bert (my instructor) was calming and patient which made my first dive and experience I will NEVER forget. The drawbacks. The beds are horrible, had some of the worst sleeps of my life. We woke up many times during the night with back/neck pain. This would be something very simple for them to fix that would make a huge difference. Some of the staff is quite rude and selective on who they cater too. ie. spanish speaking guests. (we always try to speak spanish when we are in mexico and this is the first time I felt talked down to for not being fluent.) The time share people are liars and can be very very aggressive. We booked a presentation with another hotel just to be able to see the grounds and out of curiosity. When that rep came to pick us up we were "intercepted" on the front grounds by three of the reef reps in an intimidating fashion. The one rep Eric made an offer to us to come to their presentation. Wishing to avoid further conflict on our holiday we accepted. None of the promises were met and we ended up getting way less for our time than if we had gone to the other presentation. Eric became more and more fake and obnoxious as the days went by always calling out "hey buddies, you guys are awesome , my best clients, I love you." I've never met such an annoying person. Needless to say we didn't buy a time share. All in all we had a great holiday mainly because of what we made of it. It's really too bad this hotel is so lacking in some key areas because it really could be the perfect place with a little tweaking. I would not recommend this hotel to friends nor would we return ourselves as we have been to other resorts that are far superior in key areas. However next time we are in mexico I will be booking a Dive through the reef marina. Cheers/

Reviews.Title: “Great Service!”
Reviews.Author: MissMegsNewYork
Reviews.Content: My husband and I honeymooned here and really enjoyed our time. The highlight was the great service throughout all the restaurants, bars, etc. The food was much better than we expected and the drinks were generous! The scenery is beautiful and the close proximity to downtown Playa del Carmen made getting around really easy and fun. The only slightly negative points would be the super thin walls and loud slamming hotel room doors. If you are near loud neighbors, you will hear everything. We moved our room to a more quiet area, and were fine - we also understood that people want to party on their vacation, so it was hard to be annoyed at people having fun, that said, it was still frustrating to hear talking and partying all night long. The rooms are arranged around a stairwell, 4 rooms per floor, and each door is really close the other. You can hear neighbors walking up and down stairs and especially in front of all the doors. Another point worth mentioning was the time-share and tour booking touters at the lobby - they don't work for the hotel, they work for other companies within the hotel. They can be helpful at times, but some are extremely pushy- one called our room two separate times. Unless you are stern, they can run you over and even if you don't purchase a tour, they can monopolize your time while in the front lobby. Overall we loved our time and plan to return in a few years!

Reviews.Title: “Loved our Stay, the Reef was Better than we Expected!”
Reviews.Author: yoda220
Reviews.Content: We went with few expectations, given that we had never been to an all inclusive before and some of the negative reviews. It's hard to believe that they even went to the same resort! We loved the Reef! The atmosphere is quiet and private, the grounds are incredible, the view tremendous. Neighboring resorts are huge and noisy in comparison. We went with friends and they loved it as well. The Reef met our request for rooms near each other. The rooms were smallish but renovated so others might not be as nicely equipped. Food and drinks were very good, especially check out the chicken wings by the pool, the ice cream and tea time. Staff do make the time share pitch but you can tune that out. Playa del Carmen is a nice 15 minute walk on the beach or a quick bike ride; it was very touristy and we were happy to lounge about the resort. Only one negative to report, and it is significant: Mayaland Tours/Grey Line, the tour office located on the property is to be avoided. We got a day trip for four (Tulum and Xel Ha) and it was a disaster. No one showed up to pick us up, after waiting an hour they got us a taxi but with unclear directions. It got complicated, but we wasted hours trying to undo their mess and they refused to compensate either the taxi driver or us. It was a classic case of passing the buck. It would have been funny if it hadn't been so contemptible. No reflection on the Reef except that Mayaland/Grey Line are located on the property. Find another vendor! As for the Reef, we'd love to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Totally disappointed! Worst Mexico trip ever!”
Reviews.Author: TotallyHonestChic
Reviews.Content: First of all this hotel is a 2 star! I have travelled to Mexico over 10 times and have stayed in numerous resorts and I have to say this one was awful! The room was dirty, the sink was plugged and had to have a worker pull out a foot long hair ball, the food was a huge disappointment, I had to call a doctor in to give me a shot because I had an allergic reaction to the MSG that coated the fruit and veggies! The bartenders were miserable even when we through them huge tips! They made virgin drinks many times without us figuring out until our third or fourth drink! We are in our 40's we do not look like children! When we checked out they took half our luggage and left the other half in the room. We asked for a shower before we flew out because we had a midnight flight and they directed us into a room that the maid was cleaning! We were given another persons dirty room and bathroom to get ready in! We are one couple out of a group of 30 people with all the same experiences! Don't go here!

Reviews.Title: “What a wonderful world at the Reef”
Reviews.Author: hoejlund
Reviews.Content: Its funny to read all the different reviews good and bad, but most of them in the middle section. I would like to put The Reef Hotel in the top, why?. We have been in almost every corner of the world, lived in zero star hotels and five stars hotels. In our mind the most importent thing to evaluate is the atmosphere in a hotel. We found the atmosphere, food, activities, rooms, pools etc. great. But what made our stay ekstra great was the staff. The great guy in the reception (cant remember his name), changed 3 small rooms to at suite, that could take all eight of us, Kids, parents, and grandparents. First great impression of flexibility. Pedro, Jesus, Elvis, the staff at the divecenter etc. gave us a great time, and treated our kids with great patience, eventhough we would have believed that they would tired of these noisy kids. The hotel is very cozy and we felt like in paradis. But the best of all is the price. We stayed the week before christmas, and got 50% off, and the kids for free. Comparing what we payed and what we got, this was the best choice we have ever made. For a family this is so much recommendable. If you are looking for relaxation and fun for the kids, go there. You can buy your way in to much more luxury and much better food, and other exclusive stuff at other hotels. But if you want a good atmosphere and flexible solutionseeking employes, go to The Reef. If your looking for errors you would always find them, but we were 8 happy family members aged 4 to 70, and we would go again. Thats the way. The only thing to complain about is that we all got to fat and to lazy after one week of playing kings and queens. A special thanks to Jesus in the pool bar who took so good care of our little blond Martin and his sister Maria. When people treat our kids well, you automatically treat the parents well. Kenneth & Family from Denmark.

Reviews.Title: “What a beautiful setting! Family vacation/wedding.”
Reviews.Author: vacation_bug_bit_me
Reviews.Content: I have been to the Riviera three times in the last 13 months. While this wasn't my favorite resort, it had some great qualities. I'll break the review up into sections. First impression/Check-in: Wonderful! The lobby area is small, but beautiful. I usually prefer open air receptions, but this lobby was enclosed and did stay nice and cool. We expected to be hounded by time share reps, but there wasn't a single one that I saw. I know others in our group did sit through a presentation, but they all said no firmly and were not bothered after that. Check-in was easy and efficient. Eric in the reception is wonderful and greeted me by name before I even checked in!! We were with a larger group (several of which had been at the resort for a couple days) and he recognized me from my mom's description. That was really nice...attention to detail and genuine interest in the guests. Grounds: Stunning! This resort is set in a tropical jungle, and the natural beauty is breath taking. This is definitely not a stuffy, concrete, 5* resort. You leave the lobby and immediately feel as though you've been transported to an oasis. It's wonderful. I can't say enough about how beautiful and well maintained the grounds are...you just have to see it for yourself! There are sereques (I call them "squirrely rabbits"), anoles, and kitties (we named the little black and white one Moo-Moo...she loves pork and milk!) all over the resort. Beach: Pretty nice. The beach is a good size and there are always plenty of chairs. The sand is really soft, it's just littered with broken sea shells which can be a little sharp. The view is priceless. I spent the majority of my five days sitting on the beach soaking up the sun. Pools: There are two pools, both very small, one with a swim-up bar. While they were small, they did look very nice and clean. I never went in them because I spent all my time by the ocean, but I heard they were cold this time of year. Bars: My only real complaint is that my fruity drinks weren't made with real fruit. I'm usued to ordering a strawberry daquiri and it being made with real strawberries. The sugary fakeness wasn't all that appealing. I did find a few drinks that I loved though, including my favoite, the Cabanas. You usually have to ask for a straw, you don't automatically get one. Tip these guys and you'll get better drinks (and straws!), plus they deserve it. Food: I'm not going to lie and say that the food was great. Some of it was, but most of it was just ok. I've definitely had better at the Iberostars and other resorts. There was always fresh fruit and breads which were good, but a lot of the other dishes were hit and miss. Lunch and dinner were much better than breakfast, which surprised me as it's usually the other way around. My breakfast foods were always cold and unappealing. For lunch and dinner, the buffet did have really good entrees (fish, chicken, pastas, etc.). The a la carte restaraunts were really good, we tried both the Italian and the Steak House. We had lasagna which was really great, and the flank steak which was much better than I expected...tender and juicy, even for being prepared well done. I had read a lot of reviews about the snack bar being gross, but that was one of our favorite places to eat! The chicken wings were awesome! My husband loved the cheeseburgers, and I really liked the hotdogs. I heard that you could order room service, but it was an extra charge (would be nice if that was included). Rooms: Our room seemed to be nicely updated. We had a flat panel Sony Bravia TV, although most others in our group had older tube TVs. Didn't really matter, we only watched TV one night. We didn't have a tub, but all of the other rooms did. Our shower was really nice and clean, though. The beds and pillows are absolutely horrible. I've come to expect that in Mexico, though. Drink enough Cabanas and you won't care. Seriously though, the beds do suck...it'd be great if they would provide some sort of matress topper. The pillows were like laying on sheets of plywood...very hard. As I said, that is expected in Mexico. The water pressure in the shower wasn't all that great and the temperature was a gamble. Overall, nice rooms. The things that were annoying (the beds, water temp) are more of a Mexico thing than a black mark against the resort. Housekeeping: I don't think that our sheets were changed every day, which is ok...conservation! Our water bottles were replaced every day and we had no issues (as did anybody else in our almost 20 person group) with our items going missing. Just to be on the safe side, we did lock our valuables in one of our suitcases. I was annoyed that you had to pay for a safe...most resorts don't charge for that, so that was a bit disappointing. Activities/Shows: This isn't the most lively resort, and I didn't notice very many activities going on other than beach volleyball and water aerobics. The nightly shows were really impressive though! It's amazing how talented and hard working the event staff are. There isn't a club/disco on the resort, so it definitely isn't for partiers. We did have a lot of fun at the roof top bar though! Wedding: The reason for the trip was because my brother got married at the Reef. The setting was gorgeous and intimate (well, as intimate as it can be with an entire beach watching!). However, I was a little disappointed in the ceremony. It was extremely short and didn't seem to be all that well organized. They didn't even get to recite any vows!! I wish it would have been a little more personal. Also, nobody was informed that the bride and groom would have to sign the marriage certificate and be fingerprinted after their first kiss, so that was really awkward as we all looked around like "Umm, ok...why are they doing this now?!". It would have been nice to have the heads up so the guests and wedding party weren't looking around all confused. There was a nice little cocktail reception afterwards, though, and that turned out beautifully. Be prepared that you have to pay extra for everything....including a stereo if you want to hook up an iPod. Staff of note: Eric from the reception was SO incredibly friendly and helpful...anything we needed was taken care of. Eric the waiter at the rooftop bar was so sweet and offered great service. He was always right there when our glasses ran empty and always had a smile on his face. Fernando, event & activity staff, was very cool. He was a ton of fun...quite the jokester. Our entire family loved him and he made sure we were always having a good time! Leonard, the DJ, was a lot of fun, too. Felix at the beach bar made great drinks! Overall: Everybody in our group had an amazing time. We couldn't have asked for a better location. We are not stuffy people and don't do mega resorts. The Reef was exactly what we were looking for. The food got repetative, but it was fine for under a week. The beds could use some serious improving, but we didn't let be a damper on our trip. The staff is mostly great and seemed very friendly. The positives far outweigh the negatives, and we would return for future vacations!

Reviews.Title: “dont use the travel agency at the Reef!”
Reviews.Author: rena59
Reviews.Content: First I would like to say that while I was staying at the Reef It was an overall good experience- it has beautiful grounds, good food with very friendly & hard working staff. However, I booked a trip with the hotel travel agency there- a day trip to Xel Ha- after paying for it on my Visa we decided that we would like to go to Tulum as well, we went back and the man helping us said that it was a bit more in price to do both, so we gave him cash- which he directly put into his pocket??? Getting home and looking at my Visa bill I realized that they had charged me twice for the tour under two different names! One under Mayaland tours,which is the hotels company, and again under Easy tours- which is the tour he actually sent us on!! So beware of the scam artist that works at the travel agency there and would not recomend using your visa anywhere there.

Reviews.Title: “We would stay again”
Reviews.Author: RonWinnipeg7
Reviews.Content: My wife & I are frequent cruisers. Occasionally we take a land based winter break and this year our family decided we should have Xmas in a warm climate. Collectively we choose Playa del Carmen. In searching for a resort, we stumbled upon a gem, "the Reef Playacar resort " a mere 20 minute pleasant walk to Playa del Carmen's 5th ave. This resort is for those who like smaller boutique hotels. The hotel consists of 18 colourful Mexican styled villas set in a lush tropical garden. A meandering tiled path, leading from the beach to the hotel lobby, separate the villas. A pleasant stroll. A bonus is a tea house nestled under a giant Banyan tree in the centre of the garden. A pleasant place to relax and enjoy a light snack, tea & made on-the-spot Spanish coffee. The resort's dining is generally good with a Mexican flare. The staff was polite, friendly and helpful. The pool and beach area are clean and never crowded. Even Santa made 2 visits to the pool area, a nice touch.

Reviews.Title: “We Loved the Reef!”
Reviews.Author: mimi057
Reviews.Content: Whenever I travel I spend a lot of time beforehand researching various resort/hotel options on Tripadvisor. I feel that my expectations were met or exceeded in many areas with the Reef Playacar. The resort is beautiful - in a natural, intimate way...not the huge posh resort type of feel - but very comfortable and easy to navigate. The natural surroundings added so much enjoyment to our stay there. The staff is friendly and helpful and the place is kept very clean. The pools weren't very crowded even though it was quite hot out (the pools were pretty chilly). the food was great in both the buffet and the Italian restaurant. We were disappointed that we were never able to try the Terraza Grill - it was closed all three nights we attempted to go. We only saw 2 shows - the first was the MJ show on New Year's Eve. I have to comment first on the amazing party the staff put on for New Year's - they transformed the theatre room into a beautiful setting for the party - complete with ice sculptures and beautiful lighting. They had a live band playing throughout the evening as well as the staff's Michael Jackson show. both were very entertaining. The location of the hotel is perfect - on a beautiful beach and within walking distance to 5th avenue in Playa del Carmen. A short cab ride will cost $5 each way. Oh and a definite highlight are the sunbeds on the beach and poolside - fabulous! If those are all taken then you will still be able to find a regular deck chair by the pool or on the beach - I cannot say the same for some other Cancun resorts we have stayed at! All in all - we were really pleased with the Reef and would definitely return next time we go to Playa del Carmen.

Reviews.Title: “Reef Playacar, thank you for the nice week- might see me again”
Reviews.Author: Claudia1971
Reviews.Content: This was my 4th trip in the Myan Riviera and must say this was my favourite hotel due to its beautiful beach, its proximity to Playa Del Carmen (walking distance either on beach or sidewalk), all rooms were close to the beach (furthest room was probably a 50sec walk) and enjoyed the fact that the pools, the restaurants, rooms, bathrooms, towel service, and snack bar are all by the beach. Best of all...do not have to take little trains to get around like bigger resorts. Rooms were clean (mattress checked), choice of pillows (soft-hard). Rooms are basic, fridges stocked with water, and pop, bathrooms have hairdryers. I felt safe, it was clean, and the locaton is amazing...and I was on vacation to be out and about, not spending the week in my room. If looking for early coffee, it is served near the buffet at sunrise. We walked 45 minutes each way on the beach and never had obstacles except dock in Playa del Carmen but walked under it and continued. Playa del Carmen has good nitelife and lots of shops. There is a Starbucks, Guess store, Subway, McDonalds... . The a la carte restaurants were good. Food on resort was good, a mix for everyone. This hotel is the closest hotel to Playa Del Carmen situated in Playacar. Playacar is a gated community with beautiful houses, grounds, and resorts. In Playa del carmen you will find the ferry to cross over to Cozumel if snorkeling or scuba interests you - or make it a short day trip seeing that you are a skip and a hop away from the ferry. I have previously stayed in 2 five stars and one 4 star and did enjoy their luxuries but the location, beach, and quaintness of this hotel was quite satisfying. Activities done: deep-sea fishing arranged by Pablo, snorkeling, Tulum, para-sailing, and snorkeling in cenotes(caves) Dos Ojos (2 eyes). Once in Playa del Carmen, we took a Collectivo (3$), small 8-10 passenger public bus that brings you up and down main road. Dos Ojos is not very touristic yet and it is quite a snorkeling adventure. People travelling: 49 yr old, 39 yr old , 18 yr old and 22 yr old.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Christmas holiday - hidden gem Reef Playacar”
Reviews.Author: globetraveller1010
Reviews.Content: Travelled December 20 - 27 with our 2 teens age 16 & 18 Picked up at airport by Sunwing Luxury Coach bus and the ride to hotel took about an hour because we made 6 hotel stops along the way. We had requested 2 rooms side by side,1 with king bed and 1 with two double beds. Check in was a breeze but got 2 rooms both with double beds. This was corrected the next morning and we were moved to a room with king bed. Rooms - were standard size, very clean and had bottled water and a stocked mini fridge with assorted cans of pop. Yes, you have to pay $2 day for the room safe but definitely worth it. There is no charge to have the bottled water or the cans of pop restocked each day. Actually bottled water is available at all bars anytime day or evening. There was no limit as we have read in other reviews. You can ask for 1, 2 or 5. A side note - ask for a room facing into the cenote area, much quieter. We had a room facing the outside of the property and it was quite noisy 3-6am each day with the service staff bringing in carts of supplies, etc. Wheels squeaked along and carts rattled. As well there are no non smoking rooms however the rooms did not smell of cigarette smoke at all. We believe because it was Christmas and the resort was full, there were a number of families with small children - definitely not an adults only resort! The hotel is a small 212 room 3 storey villa style with walk ups. Each room has private balcony with chairs/table. The hotel is very well maintained, very clean and has dense jungle like vegetation. Beautiful pathways of wood and beautiful wooden railings everywhere. The cleaning staff polishes and dusts each day - there were no broken railings anywhere as we have read in another review. If anything, the wooden walkway areas and railings are gorgeous and are taken care of in a meticulous manner! There are agoutis seen at anytime but are silent creatures and did not bother or scare anyone. Quit interesting to watch them eat bananas! The beach is wide and long - beautiful sand, very clean. You can walk the beach for 30 minutes from either direction of the hotel (longer if you choose). Water is clean and warm. The beach is about 60-80 feet wide with lots of sun loungers and covered sun beds. Never a problem getting a lounger even though the hotel was fully booked. The covered sun beds usually had towels on them by 6am but loungers always available. If you want a covered sun bed (and we highly recommend!) go down at 6am and place your towel or book on one - grab a delicious Mexican coffee to go from the buffet restaurant at the same time! The food was very good. There are 3 major venues - Chulavista buffet (7am-11am, 12:30 - 3pm, 6:30 -10:30pm) Botticelli and Terraza Grill. Botticelli was our favourite - Italian food, excellent Italian food! No reservations required however you must dress up - no shorts, sandals - men its long pants (no jeans) and covered shoes or they will send you away to change! The key is casual elegance. Definitely worth it! The food, service the best ever!! Chulavista Buffet is great for breakfast & lunch - lots of variety and the hot food is hot and the cold food is cold - we read a number of reviews complaining about the food - there is something for everyone and the food is tasty - Christmas Eve there was a special feast prepared, truly amazing!!! There is also a beach snack bar (11am - 5pm and 10:30 - 2am) for burgers, fries, wings, tacos, nachos, pizza, sandwiches. The kids loved it! Booze - drinks were cold and delicious. All bars had good drink makers. Felix was our favourite - he manned the beach bar and makes the best mojitos! Ask him for a frozen lemonade & tequila...yummy! Tipping is always good but doesnt get you better service or better quality alcohol. It does get you recognition though! Felix had our regular order started before we reached his counter ! Always a big smile, anytime during the day!! Beer you can get as draft in a glass or ask for a tin (Sol, Tecate, Dos XX) 1 can or 3, they give you what you ask for. Including water lol Staff - were very friendly and accomodating. We never ever had a problem with anyone. Daniel the front door bellman is fabulous if you need anything (taxi, restaurant recommendation, store luggage, special favour). Polino was a great waiter as was Edwardo, Juan, we could just keep going!. Victoria makes a wicked omlette in the morning!! Safety - the whole Playacar area is gated so safety was never in question. Walked around outside and in Playa del Carmen - on beach and on road, took taxi back at night for $5. No problems whatsoever, very comfortable at all times. We took a full day tour to Tulum which included zipling, canoeing and jungle trecking in a jeep, lunch with a Mayan family at their home. Lots of fun and reasonable at $99 person. A visit to the Lapis factory (they provide free transportation to and from) has negligible lapis pieces. Lots of silver, good quality jewellery a bit overpriced even at 50% off. However, the quality speaks for itself. We picked up a couple pieces and do not regret it. The beach is mercifully free of annoying vendors. You can get anything you want at Playa del Carmen. Most stalls selling silver, etc. They will bargain 40-50% off asking price. Entertainment was ok - provided by hotel staff (yes, towel girl by day and entertainer at night hahaha) First day was good, next two mediocre. Special Christmas shows, last day was a Cirque de Soleil style entertainment, very professional and amazing to watch! There is a coffee service in the cenote area each afternoon from 4-6pm. Absolutely amazing! You can have a Spanish, Mexican, Mayan coffee made (as many as you want) and there is NO extra charge. Also great sandwiches and chocolate chip cookies. We loved the champagne and sat there each afternoon chatting with other guests while sipping our coffee and drinking champagne. The ice cream palor serves up a variety of flavour in a cone or cup. Also has a variety of coffee, expresso etc - No additional charge Beach massage is a definite - Mauro is amazing and will do a total body exfoliation included with massage!! We enjoyed our vacation and would definitely recommend this resort to others. A vacation is what you make it - we went in with no expectations as the reviews are so varied - we did not know what to expect, but were pleasantly surprised at this little hidden gem!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice unique small resort, great value for money...loved the Reef”
Reviews.Author: Beachlover420
Reviews.Content: The Reef Playacar It was our first time to Mexico and we wanted to choose a small resort. Reef was the perfect choice. We went in April, sorry for the late review. We are a couple in our 30s and this is a pretty honest review. Airport/ Check-in: The line-up for immigration and baggage was extremely long and ran through the whole airport. It took over an hour. From Cancun airport to Reef, after a few drop-offs, took another hour. Check-in was quick but had to meet the resort rep right away and get a general intro. Jeanine was nice. Room Room was basic, spacious, very clean, nice balcony, nice clean bathroom, plenty of water bottle, big sink. AC was loud though but in good condition. Bed wasn’t the most comfortable but nice enough. Alarm clock on bedside. TV worked fine. Maid was very thorough. Weather It was hot, nice tanning hot. April is a good time to visit. Water was warm after 10. Beach/ Pool: Beach is long, pure white sand. Loved it. Ocean was light green color, just gorgeous beach altogether. Waves are quite strong but not much seaweed. You gotta wake up early to get shade. Towel rules apply. Beach volleyball and yoga was nice. Pool was small and crowded but still nice. Kids everywhere. Pool was 2 minutes from our room and the beach was 4 minutes, so no complaints. Bars Bars made drinks very well. They knew their stuff. Pool bar was really busy. They work very hard and are friendly. please tip! It goes a long way and will get you better service and will make a difference to your trip overall. Restaurants The a la carte was nothing special, alternating between Italian and Mexican. We loved the food. Authentic Mexican food also available and tastes spicy but great. The main buffet has great variety. Pizza and soups were a constant and we had different dishes everyday. The late night snack bar offered fresh chicken tacos and hot dogs, and they must have liked us a lot because they would bring us beer or wine from the main buffet area and walk it over to us on the sunbeds at night. The meals were always fresh and tasted great. The main buffet’s best feature is the ocean view on the terrace. We sat on the terrace for almost every meal with the ocean beside us. Resort Facilities For a 3-Star Resort, The Reef packs in a whole lot of value for your money. The hotel lobby is the only thing about this place that resembles a hotel. After you check in and walk through the sliding doors, you’re greeted with an exotic in house waterfall and immediately taken away into a lush green hide – away. The pathways are either waxed hardwood or strategically placed cement blocks that take you through the resort to your room, and are very will lit at night time. They have stuck with a well maintained rustic look and are consistent with the wood railings along the path to the wood railings on your room balcony. This creates a special ambiance for you and lasts your whole stay. We never got tired of walking around the resort, and enjoyed the wicker furniture and hardwood deck patio built around an ancient gigantic AVATAR tree at the resort’s centre. They have done well to preserve the land that was there before and we loved calling it home for a week. You can see multiple gardeners out all over the resort constantly watering the grounds, they take very good care and memories of the resorts inner landscape will stay with you long after you leave. Entertainment We never made it to any shows. The bar there is very busy at night. Resort Activities are posted on the wall next to the ping pong table. They actually do what they say they’ll do at the times they say they’ll do it. We did Step Classes, Stretch Classes, Beach Volleyball etc. Some resorts post their activities but don’t actually do them. Excursion Went to Chichen Itza to see the ruins and Cozumel for snorkelling. Highly recommend both. The history is amazing. Snorkelling was a memorable experience. Nothing too fancy but well organized by Fury Catamarans, booked both from the agent right outside the lobby, great price. Parasailing was short but fun enough. For 5 bucks you can go to Playa Del Carmen, and it’s a quaint tourist town, great to walk around, shop and enjoy a Cerveza at the restaurant with swings instead of chairs. **We can’t climb the pyramids anymore, but it’s worth the money to see the Mayan Ruins. It’s scorching hot away from the water, so bring lots of bottled water and a sun hat. I didn’t like that they allowed vendors inside the site. Sometimes you will be followed to buy trinkets and such, but it doesn’t ruin the overall trip. Snorkelling in Cozumel. You can bring your own snorkel gear, but if not, it’s provided for you on the Catamaran. You can take the Ferry to Cozumel and back to Playa and if you buy the Ferry ride separate from the excursion, you don’t have to wait until the 9pm Ferry, you can leave when you’re done. You get 2 snorkel sites and usually if the waters are too rough, only 1. We were fortunate to have mild waves and do jump off and snorkel twice. The bbq lunch on the Cozumel beach was nice. Tips: - No internet access at the hotel, but you can catch a ride for 50 pesos or $5USD into town and find internet cafes for very cheap. - Playadel Carmen is well prepared for tourists. If you forget for you Hawaiian Tropicana sunblock, they have this brand in the local shops in town, no problem. - Vendors on the streets are aggressive, just say no and they will leave you alone as soon as you walk past them. We chose to buy our excursions from our resort. - Air conditioner unit is inside your room, bring ear plugs. - There are warnings for time share selling, but were never bothered by anyone for this during at all. - There’s a safe in the room, but you have to pay to use it for the week. DO NOT LOSE THIS KEY, THEY CAN ONLY BREAK WITH A HAMMER  - They had absolutely no cookies. - You get 3 large bottles of water a day, and they are replenished whether you finished them or not, very nice and much needed in the hot April weather. - Pools are few and small, so wake up early to reserve your pool chairs. The Magic The white sand, the spectacular ocean, long beach, cocktails, Mayan history and the pyramids, snorkelling in Cozumel and the deep blue ocean, great taste and variety of food and architecture of the resort itself. Overall, as a 3 star resort, the Reef provides great value. Compared to Cuba, amenities are great. We definitely intend to go back one day!

Reviews.Title: “Expected 4 star as websites adverised. But actually 3 star at most”
Reviews.Author: Traveller154914
Reviews.Content: Lets see... The air conditioning was so loud we couldn't sleep. Walls stained and sheets were stained as well. The resort is quite small so not much activity. And at nigt time, its pretty dead. Beach was small very small. I'd advise spending a little more and go to a differnt resort for your vacation. We did after 2 nights. Moved to Sandals Playacar and thats when I felt the vacation truely began.

Reviews.Title: “Not handicap friendly.”
Reviews.Author: 2008OklahomaCity_OK
Reviews.Content: No coffee pots in room. Only certain bars open with 1 server. Long walk to get a cup of coffee when you are handicapped. Wheel chair access to rooms is non existence. Wheel chair access to other areas the same. Bars not stocked. Ran out of jack Daniels and had to drink Jim beam. Staff did not understand English! Laying on the beach was awesome except no cabana boys. Not a place for handicapped!!

Reviews.Title: “Looking for some R&R?”
Reviews.Author: MexicoFan33
Reviews.Content: My friends and I went to the Reef to celebrate our 40th Birthdays. We loved the scale of the property, the beach, pools and activity staff. Great value for the price - If relaxation is your goal - The Reef is a hotel you should consider. The massages from Mario where fabulous and the Dive instructor - Bruno - is the best tour guide. There is more of a personal feel at the Reef then you will find at the bigger hotels.

Reviews.Title: “ok”
Reviews.Author: AlbertaHappycamper
Reviews.Content: I have been travelling with my husband for a few years now. We decided to do a family holiday this time with our children who range in age from 18 to 10. The pools are in need of repair. My son who is 12 cut his leg open in the pool on a broken piece of tile. He should have gotten stiches. The activities staff are really bad. They don't do anything unless there is upper management around. We were there for 8 days, on the 7 day they finally decided to do actitives with the people around the actitives pools. The staff is ok. Some are friendlier then others. We spent alot of time with jesus and jose. They were the best. The food was good. The alcarte resturants were great. The beach execellent. Would I recommend this hotel to a friend. No, the staff blantley drank right in front of you exspecially at the tea time between 4 and 6pm . They really like the champaine. They also were asking for smokes. They were serving my 16 year old alcohol when we weren't looking. The legal age for drinking is 18. I was throughly disapointed with this hotel. I have stayed at 3 stars and had way better service and much for fun for less money. I will not be going back to this hotel in the future, unless, they have significant staff improvements.

Reviews.Title: “The Reef- Solid 3 1/2 Star Property”
Reviews.Author: sea_breaze
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Reef Thanksgiving Week. There were six of us, three college aged and three of us old timers. When staying at All Inclusives we usually stay at 4 or 4 /12 star properties, ie: Iberostar's, Grand Bahia Principe, RIU's. Since we were paying for 5 this time and because of their location to Playa Del Carmen we booked the Reef. We had spent the the day at the Reef on a free Day Pass given to us by the Condo we rented across the street last February so had an idea of what it was about before arriving. The Day Pass didn't include Food or Drinks so really we only knew what the beach and pool were all about. Check In: Arrived at 11:00am and all three rooms were ready, they were all two double bed rooms and we wanted one King Bed so had to wait until 3:00pm for the King Bed. No big deal and we were happy that we had a room to change into our Bathing Suits. Check in was fast, courteous and efficient. Was not approached at any time by a Time Share Representative as reported by others. Grounds: Smaller, much smaller than the Resorts mentioned above and we loved it. Forgot your sunscreen in the room???? No big deal, short walk to and from the beach to get it. Loved,loved, loved the size of this Resort. The Jungle feel it has walking from your the rooms to the beach or Lobby was fantastic. The canopy so thick that we were able to walk from our room to the Reservation restaurant on the other side of the Resort in the pouring down rain and barely getting wet. Very Cool!!!! Grounds are kept very clean as previously reported. It is an older Resort so there are some nicks but all in all in pretty good shape. Pools & Beach- There are 2 pools which are also on the smaller side but held all of the guests perfectly fine. Pools were kept clean, sparkling clean even, for the whole time we were there. Beach was awesome and that was expected, it's the Riviera Maya after all. There is a small cliff to overcome to get into the water from the beach which was caused from the Beach Restoration, guessing this will settle down over time. Not a big deal there are low spots to get up and down just need to locate them. Plenty of lounge chairs around the pool and beach. Never had a problem, even with trying to keep six of us together. I must admit that this is the first All Inclusive I've been to where Lounge Chairs weren't a problem. Kudos to The Reef!!!! We walked the beach into PDC 5 times, twice in the evening, twice in the morning(for coffee) and once in the afternoon. What a great way to work off some of those cervesa's. The afternoon walk landed us at the Pirata Bar for a couple more beers and to refill our mugs for the walk back. Love it!!!! Bars: Four Bars: Lobby Bar, Beach Bar, Pool Bar and Roof Top Bar. We used them all except the Lobby Bar :). Fast, friendly service by ALL of the Bartenders we met. Yes, sometimes there were a few people in front of us getting served but the bartenders were efficient at getting the drinks served. What's the hurry anyways, chill and enjoy the view. Roof Top Bar had Pool Tables (very good shape) and a view of the street. Beach Bar had an excellent view of the beach and ocean and a couple of tables to sit and enjoy your drink. Pool bar was just that, a pool bar. Careful walking down the stairs into the bar area "Slippery when wet". DosXX was the beer on tap and they would also break out cans in various other flavors in the evening or upon request(I think). This was convenient for our evening walks into town in the evening. Watered down drinks???? Not according to my hangover's in the morning. :) Restaurants: I usually don't comment on food as it is completely speculative but being as there were 6 of us I can say it was good. Boring, same old thing, blah,blah,blah. What are these folks looking for???? How about you don't eat everything in the whole buffet the first night. There was always fish, pork,chicken, beef and a carving station. All kinds of vegetables, salads, soup, and bread. Pasta I believe was available every night as well. Everything we had was very good, especially the freshly grilled Salmon at the Carving Station. Awesome!!!! I will also mention the freshly prepared Taco's at the Snack Bar for the the Late Night Snack, good stuff. Pizza and pre made sandwiches at the Snack Bar during the day didn't look so good so I passed but the wings were some of the best I have had anywhere. Breakfast Buffet was always good and never used the Lunch Buffet so can't comment there. Kids said it was good though. We went to one Reservation Only Restaurant, the Terraza Grill. Now I'm not a big fan of these restaurants, I have a big problem with wearing pants on a Caribbean Vacation. I don't show up in a tee shirt or bathing suit for any dinner but pants when it is 80F out and many times without Air Conditioning, No Thank You(Rant Over) :). Put on the pants for this Dinner as I was out voted and was glad I did. Outstanding!!!! In quality and presentation. I can say without hesitation that this was the best AI res only restaurant I have ever been too and unfortunately I've been to many :). Our group had the Salmon and Arrachera both excellent, service was impeccable- 5 star. We were out of there in 1 1/2 hours including coffee and deserts, Yeah!!!! There was a Wine List for the Wine Lovers at an additional cost or House Wine included, which to us anyways wasn't bad. There was also an option to upgrade to Lobster and NY Strip at an additional charge, I want to say in the $15-$20 range. None of us opted for the upgrade and quite frankly didn't need to. Excursions: We have been to the area many times (even bought some property there) so didn't feel the need to hire a tour guide. We had two newbies with us so rented a car from Budget at The Reef to take them around to some of the sights. This is where my only complaint comes in. I went down to the lobby to reserve the rental the day before we needed it. We needed something for 6 people and car res lady says we could get a minivan for $100/day or a midsize for $40. She assured me we could get 6 in the midsize and showed me a picture of the car, looked doable. Okay I'll save the $60, give me the mid size. It was not even close to the the car in the picture and we had to have one sit on a lap. Car was old and in bad shape, we couldn't get over a Tope at any speed without bottoming out. We did have a bunch of laughs throughout the day about the "Tin Box" so a memory was made.:) I had also specifically told her we needed the car by 8:00am as we had a Dive scheduled in Akumal for 9:00am. No problem she says. Nobody showed until 8:30 and we weren't on the road until 8:45 so missed our Dive. I understand this is Mexico but was really looking forward to that Dive. Went to the Tulum Ruins which the newbies enjoyed very much. Get there early (9:00am to avoid the crowds and the heat. Then to Akumal Bay to snorkel with the Turtles.
