Saw many turtles and looks like the reef there is recovering nicely. Great place for first time snorkelers as it is a easy walk into the water from the Beach. Rented Lounge Chairs at Lol Ha for $6 each and brought a collapsible Cooler full of beer to save a few $$$$. Lol Ha still got there share in "Girly Drinks" throughout the day. Parking was by the hour but was fair, I think it was about $5 for most of the day. From there we went to Puerto Aventuras for Dinner at Gringo Daves, excellent Fish Taco's. GF also did a Cenote Dive and Bull Shark Dive. I don't dive with no Bull Sharks and am not particularly fond of being underwater where I can't escape if there is a problem (claustrophobia) so she was on her own. The rest of us headed to Cozumel for the day. Ferries run on the hour every hour and we rented a car from Isis Rentadora (very nice lady). Spent 1/2 the day at the Money Bar snorkeling and the other 1/2 at Coconuts on the East Side of the Island. I love Cozumel!!!! In closing, yes I would recommend The Reef Playacar for those that aren't looking for the Wow factor of some All Inclusives. It is clean, great location for walking into town and the staff were exceptional to a person. Every single staff member we came across were friendly and courteous. Of course the beach is outstanding as well. Personally I'm not liking what Playa Del Carmen has become. It has gotten much too busy for my liking. Maybe if we spent more time on the North End I wouldn't feel that way but we will be heading further South for our future visits to the area, Akumal and Tulum.

Reviews.Title: “AVOID- Head South For Akumal or Tulum!”
Reviews.Author: NJ1980
Reviews.Content: We were supposed to stay at this hotel for 9 nights and left after 4. The hotel is set in a nice jungle/garden setting, but the town of Playa del Carmen is so over developed now that you might as well stay in Cancun, rather drive an hour. This was my third time to this area and sadly, I wound never go back. The city is being ripped apart and in Mexico, that means lots of traffic, unclear street signs and caios. Going for a drive and even a walk through town a nightmare. There are also lots of police cars just waiting to pull you over and take your money. This happended to us twice. Another reason why I'd avoid this town now. From the start, we found this resort to be very unrelaxing. The front desk clerk told us to check in with the concierge to schedule our "welcome to the hotel tour" for first thing the next day. We were told this was to show us around...after we signed up and I read the fine print on the paper, it said this was a sales pitch for relstate. I promptly called the front desk and cancelled. Again, nothing was as it seems there and you are always on high alert to pay attention to everything. The room was ok. The bed was ok. There was a leek in the ceiling in the bathroom, but not a big deal. The biggest problem was you could never have enough drinking water. They stock your room fridge with cans of soda, but bottle water for drinking and brushing teeth was always a challenge! All the rooms were very dark and had a garden view. The food was TERRIBLE and I think thats what finally did it for me. Everyday the same tasteless slop and after 4 days of crappy meals, your body feels terrible. Breakfast was ok, at least you had fresh fruits and the french toast was yummy. Lunch and dinner, oh buy, where do I start?! The food had no flavor! The alfredo sauce for pasta was like tasteless white liquid, the tomato sauce was ok, cause it was literally just crushed tomatos out of a can- hard to mess that up... but the salad dressings were weird, the Ranch was like a vinegrette and was sour, same with the thgousand island dressing. All the desserts were tastless, except the flan, which was ok. Everything was just not good, not tasty and blah...the snack bar had pizza, but again it was like cardboard! After 4 days of chips, quacamole and quesadillas, you are over it! The beach was ok, not as nice as the Tulum beach we wound up going to which was amazing....the bars again were so-so but not a very good alcohol selection and we felt nauseous after 2 drinks...Very difficult to get drinking water..My advice is skip this hotel, skip this town....you want a resort? Stay in Cancun. Its already developed and close to the airport. You want to see the real Rivera Maya, or what's left of it? Head south to Akumal or Tulum. Beaches are beautiful, towns are quiet but they have many beautiful beach bungalows and best of all, food is YUMMY and has flavor!! For the price we paid at this all inclusive in Playa del Carmen, we spent almost the same amount renting a place on the beach and eating basically whatever we wanted and didn't have to be surrounded by caios and annoying tourists.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect all-inclusive, small and clean clean clean!”
Reviews.Author: Karen-cheek
Reviews.Content: Wow, so much better than any mega-hotels. Great staff, super clean rooms, lovely pools and beach... and always a beach chair available, what a refreshing change from other all-inclusives! Quiet and low-key, decent food and beautiful sitting area around a natural cenote. FREE bikes, they are in bad shape, which makes it all the more fun! GO, you won't be sorry!

Reviews.Title: “Great place! Would definately go back.”
Reviews.Author: lexie713
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Reef from November 12th through the 19th and loved it. Don't get me wrong there were some things I would have liked to be better which includes the room. We stayed in a basic room on the first floor which was right near the main path to get to the beach, pools and everything else so there was no privacy at all, we didn't keep the curtains open at all because everyone walking by would have seen everything. The room was small and needed a desperate update but although it was a bit of an issue for us we usually don't spend a lot of time in the room so it was not that big of a deal. The grounds were absolutely beautiful and we truly enjoyed walking through them all the time, it was a really nice rain forest feel and the grounds are kept immaculate! The beach was beautiful and the chairs, umbrella's and beds were plentiful. We stayed in a resort last year in Cancun that you had to be out at 5am to put your towel down on a chair to save it, this was not a problem here. This resort is small but in a good way. The buffet was pretty good as were the two restaurants, the walk to Playa del Carmen is about 15 minutes and a cab was 50 pesos if you didn't want to walk, which is pretty good to me. I loved the ice cream parlor (as did my 11 year old son and 3 year old nephew) and the coffee/tea service, they were both in beautiful settings. The employees work so hard and there were a couple that were just so wonderful, unfortunately I don't remember their names. One thing I want to add is PLEASE TIP!!!! I know this is all inclusive but if your lazy butt does not feel like getting off your chair from the beach to go to the bar and get something and you ask one of the employees to do it for you, you absolutely should tip them something. We saw so much of people not tipping and actually being rude about it, these people work very hard and $1 is not a big deal to part with. There really is no nightlife but that wasn't something we needed since we were traveling with kids. The Reef has a very laid back, relaxing feel to it and we really enjoyed our stay there, so much so that we will probably be back next year.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful small resort and great for a relaxing holiday!”
Reviews.Author: Valeska77
Reviews.Content: We had a fantastic vacation at the Reef Playacar, the hotel staff is great and they help whenver they can. The rooms are clean, the beds are very comfortable with a choice of pillows and fresh towels every day. Buffet was very good and, in opposite of some reviews, we had no problems at all with eating the wide choice and we did not get bored of the variety they offered. All, breakfast, lunch and dinner had a nice choice of Mexican food, always fresh salads/vegetables and fruits and a nice dessert buffet. Having the option to eat at the 2 restaurants (you have a wide choice of food, which is included in the 'all inclusive' offer, though you can get wine or certain dishes for an additional price as well, if you wish) makes it even more varied. We just had positive experiences with the staff in the restuarants, the bars and the entertainment staff, the cocktails were good and Jesus from the poolbar already had the drinks ready for us when arriving ( a little tipping of course does not hurt, but cocktails are also good without tipping :)). The beach is just beautiful with a lot of sunbeds and the 2 pools also have a lot of sunbeds available. During the day you could have icecream at the ice cream parlour or you could have tea and coffee in the tropical gardens. The hotel is perfectly located directly at the beach and a short walk (the best on the beach) to Playa del Carmen, or you can go by taxi for 50 Pesos. All in all we definitely would/will go back to this hotel and the Reef is so much more charming than the big chain -hotels we saw around in the area.

Reviews.Title: “NO HOT WATER FOR SHOWERS, AND 25 PESOS FOR AN ESPRESSO ??????”
Reviews.Author: Cohiba69
Reviews.Content: The very good: Javier and Bert, Xavier and Luis Carlos from the dive shop. Javier and Bert where the most professional knowledgeable dive masters I have ever met, well done people. Xavier and Carlos do a good job selling the package, funny and good guys. The good: Beautiful, very clean rooms, very comfortable beds with various pillows to choose from, had a bottle of wine and a cheese plate with chocolate dripped strawberries waiting on arrival. Air conditioner is good with a remote control, good luck figuring it out. The very pathetic bad: First day, very minimal to nothing for a hot water shower. Called the front desk on Sunday, no action. Called Monday and demanded service immediately, two maintenance men showed up in 30 seconds, ran the water and said, there it is, there what is ? Luke not even warm water, they shrugged their should and that was it, nothing fixed, in comparison to my friends showers, they where all cold and hardly warm at all. So we had cold showers all week, the guests at the RIU next door had boiling hot showers. The one thing that made me really mad was the lobby bar. I got a free espresso (as expected) upon arrival on the Sat. then Sun the machine broke, and Monday morning there was a brand new machine, but when we went to ask for an espresso, the bartender said, " Oh sorry senior, that is an extra 25 pesos. Extra !!!! we just spent over $1,500 to go to this "all inclusive rip off" and they want the guests to pay for their machine ? how pathetic is that. So we walked down to Starbucks instead. I hope the management have saved up a good stockpile of pesos wisely as millions of potential customers read this review and think of booking elsewhere, how cheap can you get, bad decision people, really bad !!! Then there was the Cenote lounge, open for barely an hour or so in the afternoon, oh and of course all the booze being offered that was extra as well, wow woopee, not at the RIU. hint hint. Went to the Botticelli Ala carte on Friday, we were asked to leave and come back 45 min to an hour later as they did not have enough staff to serve us, how bout NO, the stupid thing is, we went back to the Le Terazza grill restaurant and there was a huge amount of staff wandering around, with maybe 4 customers, why did they not simply take some of those waiters and put them in the Botticelli ???? its not brain surgery people !!!!!! The safe's in the rooms are all .......here it comes.......EXTRA, wow what a surprise This resort is a definite 2 star at best. I've been to Mexico and Cuba to various 2 to 5 star resorts and have never had to pay extra for a room safe, yet another money grab from a cheap resort. NEVER AGAIN, GO TO THE RIU NEXT DOOR PEOPLE or anywhere but here!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, Relaxing and A Greatt Resort!”
Reviews.Author: PVDREAMIN
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just arrived back from The Reef. What a wondeful, quaint, relaxing resort. The grounds are absolutely wonderful. When we first arrived, the air conditioner ran all night and was very loud. We simply asked the front desk and they gladly switched rooms for us. The staff was great. Very friendly and glad to help with anything! the food was very good as well. We were very satisfied with the choices and the food and service was great. This was a very relaxing resort. The beach was wonderful. Very beautiful! This resort was everything we wanted and much much more! If you are looking for a smaller, relaxing, friendly resort, this is for you. I am definately going back and hope to go back every year!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent relaxing holiday”
Reviews.Author: 8632whistler
Reviews.Content: The Reef Playacar is an outstanding smaller all inclusive resort. It might not be to everyone's liking as much as it was to my wife and I however. Those looking for a 'super sized' resort will find it lacking for some of the variety found in the neighbouring huge properties that we find quite 'plastic' in comparison. The staff was one of the unexpected highlights of the trip. This was our first holiday in Mexico, although we have travelled extensively throughout much of the world. The Mexican staff were sincere, cheerful and friendly, each and every one of them. They were very understanding of our lack of Spanish and were always helpful in making sure we were understood. The food was very good at all locations, for all meals. There are two a la carte restaurants, unfortunately one was undergoing renovations during our stay, but did reopen for the last two nights. The a la carte dinners were excellent and the service was very professional and personable. The house wine wasn't great, but the wine list has good variety for reasonable prices. The main dining area was clean, pleasant and comfortable. The food variety was very good with a wide variety of fresh fruit at all meals, plus a salad bar. I suspect at the larger hotels there would be a greater variety of eating options, but for a smaller resort, our opinion was that they tried very hard and succeeded in giving good variety. Our room was very clean and although possibly a bit basic in some respects, very comfortable. We slept very soundly and found the beds to be excellent. Not sure if this is the same in all rooms, but we had a choice of three types of pillows, so hopefully anyone should be comfortable. In our opinion, the grounds of the hotel are superlative and far better than any of the surrounding hotels we saw. I would suggest potential visitors to The Reef Playacar check out the photos of the grounds to make sure this is to their liking, but everyone we talked to while there, loved it. There was a wedding on the beach while we were there and the staff did an excellent job of setting up for what appeared to be a very enjoyable time for everyone. As others have mentioned, the nightlife is not the reason to go to this resort. The town of Playa del Carmen is nearby (fifteen minute walk or short cab ride), so anyone wanting to party has no excuse not to, although the drinks wouldn't be free. We met a number of young families who loved the resort and they found no need to leave for their entire trip. The gym is well equipped and maintained. The event staff was fun and very friendly. We had a feeling of complete safety while on the grounds and in town as well. There is a small but excellent bird sanctuary about a eight minute walk from the resort with flamingoes, egrets, peacocks, parrots and toucans, although it costs US$22, the wrist band is good for the entire week. Make sure to bring a camera with a telephoto lens. We would gladly go back tomorrow if we could, but hope to return some day before too long. Being first time visitors to the Yucatan, we were amazed by the clean white sand and the warm, clear blue water. Easily the nicest beach we've ever experienced.

Reviews.Title: “good but not great”
Reviews.Author: lovincarribbean
Reviews.Content: My spouse and I stayed at Reef Playacar from November 4-11 and we both agree that this resort is good value for the money spent. That being said, there are a few highs and lows about the resort we would like to share. Highs: Outstanding scenery and landscaping, beautiful beach, amazing staff who were always friendly and attentive to needs. Food was excellent in all areas (snack bar, chulavista, terraza grill) although the a-la-carte restaurants had the same menu day in and day out. Lows: Small, basic "holiday inn" type room with a very hard mattress and pillows. Bathroom was very small with only one sink (although we're not sure if the upgraded rooms had different bathrooms) Rooms and surrounding buildings need a facelift, as they seem outdated. The best part about the rooms were the balconies. Of the 2 a-la-carte restaurants, one was closed for renovations, and the only one open served as both with menus alternating from day to day, leaving only half of the availability for those looking for a nice meal experience. In addition to the above mentioned, we also were disappointed in the EXTREME LACK OF NIGHTLIFE. We knew going in that there was no disco on site, however the place was a ghost town after 10:00pm. In order to have some dancing and music, you either make your own fun with an iPOD and a lot of drinks, or you go with the Sport and Entertainment staff to one of the local bars in Playa Del Carmen (coco bongo, Senior frogs) however that will cost you an extra $45.00us. Actually, there were many items that were an additional cost: wine with dinner(except house), $15usd/day for premium booze, $40usd/pp for private beach dinner, $50usd/pp for lobster dinner(only 1/2 lb), in-room safe $2/day. However for a mere $5/day tip to our day and night bartenders, we received amazing service, never waited, given drinks others were not, worth it!!! Overall, we would most likely not come back, but if there is a good deal, then we would reconsider that thought. What would bring me back is the knowledge of how friendly and accomodating the staff are. Thanks to Orlando and Felix, our 2 frequent bartenders for making the stay at least entertaining during the day.

Reviews.Title: “The best of Jungle and Beach”
Reviews.Author: Leader103110
Reviews.Content: I recently lead a trip to Playa del Carmen region of Mexico. The group of 54 stayed at the Reef in Playacar and used Olympus Tours as our tour company. The Reef was a beautiful old world resort. Smaller and more personable then the large mega resorts, it offered beaurtiful beaches, rooms set it a jungle setting, good food , a dive shop , spa and a friendly staff. The rooms were spotlessly clean, if not overly fancy and each had a balcony or patio area, but who spends time in their room when the draw to the area is the sun, beaches, diving, ruins and the beautiful waters. I would was more then pleased with the resort and would stay there again and recommend it to my friends. Our tour agency while in the region was Olympus Tours and our special agent was Antonio Alcocer. Tono did an absolutely wonderful job getting our group to all of the various activities they wanted to do or see. Using a tour company when traveling with a group of this size made my job easier and it made all of the group feel like they had their own private guide to the region.

Reviews.Title: “The Reef was a wonderful and experience for my friend, my son, and myself”
Reviews.Author: Adventurer082
Reviews.Content: The staff at the reef was incredibly attentive. Jesus at the bar provided outstanding service. The food was always fresh and offered healthy alternatives to the usual Mexican Fare. Pancho and Luis did a successful job entertaining the guests. The rooms were comfortable and clean. The resort has an ideal location near Playa Del Carmen. Claudia at the Kid's Club has a special gift with children and my son looked forward to spending time with Claudia and playing there each day. It is easy to meet other guests there since the resort is small. Overall, I would recommend the resort to anyone and would visit The Reef again. The price, for what we received, was amazing.

Reviews.Title: “I had a great time my first visit to Mexico.”
Reviews.Author: sherfelkner
Reviews.Content: My experience with this hotel stay was very good. I had a wonderful time and did not have a major problem at all. The only suggestion I might have is a check list for towels to be left in the bathroom. We had two people in our room and some days we would have only one face cloth and towel and some days we would not have any clean face towels. The room next to ours had a medical emergency and the hotel personel did not seem to respond until our travel advisor got involved. This was quite a problem. These are not major problems and I am just mentioning them as suggestions for possible changes of protocol. We had a wonderful time and the staff could not have been more helpful, accept for the one incident.

Reviews.Title: “The hotel and side trips were great because of Antonio.”
Reviews.Author: dabonette
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip to Mexico and it went so well. Olympus tours had friendly helpful people to guide us all of the way. Our main contact was Antonio, and I felt he did all that was possible to make sure we could enjoy our trip and relax. Initially I was nervous about coming to Mexico, but first and foremost he made me feel safe and happy to be in such a beautiful part of Mexico. I did two side trips, one to Chichenitzu, and one to Island of Women. Our tourguide to Chichenitzu was outstanding. Vincente was so knowledgeable and answered all of my questions. It felt much more personal with his personal backround being Mayan as well. Antonio, was a delight! He represents your company and the entire Mexico adventure in the most positive way possible. He seems so dedicated to helping us to do as much as we want there with no headaches. Our transportation was great, our guides great, the staff of our catamaran was incredible. Thank you Antonio!! The food at the hotel was very good with many options. I appreciated the staff. All of the hotel staff seemed friendly. Congratulations on that too! I want to come back to visit again! I traveled with a large group called Columbus Ski Club from Columbus Ohio. I would come again alone OR with a large group. Thanks so much for everything.....especially our friend Antonio!!

Reviews.Title: “The Reef Playacar was all-inclusive, but had very little to include.”
Reviews.Author: iammaryburke
Reviews.Content: For an all-inclusive resort, there were several things added into the bill, such as use of the room safe and all top shelf liquor. They also charged extra to use the internet, and what free wi-fi we managed to find, was only available 2 days out of 7. The drinks that were included were great, if you could find a bar that was open to serve them to you. The food was good, but the menu never seemed to change. If it weren't for the people in our group, the vacation would have been a miserable one.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect in every way.”
Reviews.Author: birder63
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend, his mother and I had logged several trips to the Yucatan at separate times. We all agreed that no other matched ideal the location, service, friendly and helpful staff, the food and accomodations of the Reef. We loved the landscaping, the quiet,comfortable rooms, the Mohitos (who could forget the Mohitos) ! What I liked best was that I felt as if I was in the jungle (with all the amenities), but was within walking distance of downtown Playa Del Carmen. We loved the agoutis, the grackles and the shore birds. What we liked least were the super-agressive salesmen at the airports and on 5th Ave. The latter I realize was not the Reef's fault. Carole Ludwig

Reviews.Title: “Wish we were there now”
Reviews.Author: shaybee71
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed the last week of July at the Reef...and it was wonderful. We were first-timers to Mexico, and particularly an all-inclusive, and were very happy with the whole experience. Staff was great, and the bartender named Roberto was fabulous. Don't forget to tip him well, and you will find he will take care of you. The bed was comfortable, the room cleaned daily, and the a/c was perfect. The balcony was so nice to sit outside and relax, and the vegetation makes you feel secluded. The food was good, especially the breakfast buffet with the omlettes. The evening dinners were fine, even if you get tired of one item, there are many more to choose from. I believe that the complainers about this resort are just being snotty. The beach was beautiful, the pools were never crowded, and the atmosphere was so relaxing and pleasurable. On a side note, that has nothing to do with the Reef, watch out for those who want to book your day-trip excursions. They are misleading like you cannot believe. Go with Edventure Tours--you must do this! We booked it online and loved it. Those we took booked in Mexico were crappy. Also, DO NOT fall for the "helpful" attedants at the airport who want to assist you. Rip-off artists. Anyway, we loved it so much, we would like to be there now...but reality won't allow. It was beautiful, memorable, and wonderful. Go and enjoy with no worries. Oh, yes, I must add that my husband has a touchy stomach, and he was never sick. That's a definite plus.

Reviews.Title: “would I go back???”
Reviews.Author: loyasrus
Reviews.Content: We just got back from the reef, Oct 12-18. keep in mind this information is for the hotel to improve in their resort ,and help travelers on their vacation. Let me tell you our experience, when we arrived there was only one guy attending the counter which took a wile for him to help us , when it was our turn it felt like he was new and struggle to give us our room. when we got our room keep in mind we book 3 months early and requested king size bed for my wife and I . we opened the door and to our surprise it was a double bed!!! I went to the lobby to try to fix the problem, and was told that no king size wasn't available till next day, I dint wanted to star my vacation on a bad note so we said OK, and was told to come back the next morning at ten am. we left everything in our luggage knowing we were going to move the next day. next morning went to the lobby and a different guy was there he dint know anything about us our what we requested, we almost had a pissing match with him about how long I book our stay, and inform him that I was told to come back the next day for my king size room, he told me that hell have a room for us tomorrow!! I ask to talk to his supervisor and he pretended to check his computer for a minute and then told me to come back at one pm and get the key for the new room , go figure. When we moved to the new room I had to carry all my luggage to the other room! I guess it was my fault for not calling them to help us, and they did try to help but because there was some items out of our luggage they dint wanted to touch it , that was nice of them. We regretted switching because the king mattress was so hard that we were so sore in the morning what a disappointment. so stay whit your double bed they are more comfortable, the other issue we had , we had two towels and I guess we had them past the time of returning them! common we are on vacation we are not there to keep time of towels,I went to turn them in at the towel shack and be cause I was past the time I had to walk to the lobby and turn them in there, so I dint be charge, I was at one end of the hotel hat to walk all the way to the other side what a waste of my time I told the guy at lobby why I had to bring this towels all the way to them! and he said that was there policy, I said cant a phone call from the person at the shack be enough?? of course i was wrong!! oh!! and its slippery when it rains all they have to do is put down rugs on the most dangerous spots .at the buffet you can feel electricity on the soup pots if you are wet!! a few mats thats all to take care of the slippery floors. the snack bar hours are not true they suppose to be open from 6-2am nope close at 7pm??? I ask one employee why? he said be cause it was low season and they dint have enough help!! I'm from mexico living in USA for a long time I new going to mexico I shouldn't expect allot but common it's all common sense. that keeps you from getting better reviews. hope this will help other travelers to mexico or this resort. no pool sports very little or no entertainment from the staff at the pools, its up to you if you want to have fun, food is great,shows are good, rooms are good , the bed no good!!! will I go back hmm!! knowing what I know now, maybe......

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC!!!!”
Reviews.Author: body_candy
Reviews.Content: To returned to Australia from our stay at The Reef Playacar, we were only there for 1 week after being in Orlando for 2 weeks and i wish we had made it longer as we had a fantastic time there. The hotel is in a great location, 10 mins walk to Centro, the beach and scenery were beautiful. The hotel staff were all so friendly, especially Jesus & Sergio (pool bar) Annel & Lois(entertainment staff), Roque (breakfast waiter), Nestor (photogropher) the entire staff were very welcoming. The rooms were very clean and adequate and the whole rainforest area was amazing with the wildlife and the afternoon tea deck was so relaxing and watching the guy making coffee was something not to miss. We loved this place so much that we are planning to return again next year!

Reviews.Title: “Reef Playacar - great time had by all”
Reviews.Author: Cdngal
Reviews.Content: A large group of us stayed at this resort and loved it. The grounds are beautiful!!! Rooms could use updating but we were hardly ever in them!! Buffet good and always changing. Snack bar was fantastic!! Playacar area is a wonderful area to be at - well maintained and within walking distance to Playa Del Carmen. I would stay here again in a heartbeat!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, quiet, perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Brando1229
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this resort with another couple for our 10th wedding anniversaries. We absolutely loved it! We had booked via Expedia, and ended up with 2 separate beds instead of the one King as we had reserved. But after two nights they were able to get us moved. Since we went during their slow season, the hours of the various food/beverage stations were different than what was listed. And the two nicer restaurants upstairs-they alternated which one was open each night, rather than getting to choose between the two. All of this was ok, we had read reviews from during slow season. And we sure didn't go hungry!! Most of the time we dined at the buffet. We thought they did a really good job working with what they had. There were items each time of day that were the same, but they always had new additions at each meal. The desserts were great too. Do not leave out in your room anything with sugar. The ants are sure to come and help themselves. They are tiny, not much of a bother, and there is nothing the hotel could possibly do about them. But they do love the sugar. Tip your bartender if you want to get any kind of buzz. Or don't and just stand there asking for more. We gave $20 to the bartender one night and he took care of us the rest of the evening without us having to ask. The shows are good, some a little cheesy, but it's not like you are buying tickets to broadway. These people work 6 days a week and all day at the resort already. I don't know where they find the time to practice for the evening shows. We went out with the entertainment crew one night to the Brahma Club. It was fun and we felt safe. Luis (sports and entertainment guy) did a great job at communicating what is custom, and never left our side. Location-perfect location and hotel if you don't want to be in a mega resort. The resort looks just like all the pictures I had seen. We got exactly what we expected. It was a 15 minute walk to downtown, the beach was absolutely gorgeous and loaded with shells. Tips: For excursions, take the ADO bus. It will save you tons of money. We went to Tulum and it only cost us $8 each round trip. You just have to walk into town to catch the bus. Bought our admission tickets when we got there. Timeshare shpeel-We did sit through the "investment" presentation on the first morning. We were promised a tshirt and massage. We said no to investing our money, and got our stuff anyway without a problem. Airport-don't talk to anyone inside!! More timeshare stuff. In the end, we would stay here again. The staff was great, location perfect, beautiful beach, food good.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and price...”
Reviews.Author: 22Vegas
Reviews.Content: The location is excellent. Within walking distance to 5th Ave. where all the shopping and restaurant are located. The beach area is very nice. The grounds at the hotel is like being in a tropical jungle. There are two pools and one has a swim up bar. Food was very good... The rooms were just average but always clean. Our first room the air conditioning did not work so they upgraded us to another room in the spa area. Not much difference in the upgraded room except the bedspread was nicer. Staff was nice. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A comfortable out going location!”
Reviews.Author: ecc0130
Reviews.Content: This was my second time going back to The Reef this year. It's a great get away! The staff is wonderful ...Roberto is a young but great bartender I hope the hotel keeps him for a good while! Rosie does some of the best breakfast !! As for Luis and Pancho very out going people and will make the best to keep you entertained! I have plans to continue returning !

Reviews.Title: “Mixed Feelings”
Reviews.Author: JorkaDog
Reviews.Content: The Good: Beautiful Grounds, beautiful and well groomed beach. Bartenders (Roberto!). Restaurant staff, at both the buffets and a la carte. The Reef Marina - the best dive shop in Playa. Some of the buffet food was excellent. Italian a la carte restaurant was excellent. The Bad: Beds were very hard and uncomfortable. Lock on the room safe was extra. Minibar/fridge not restocked. Pesos mysteriously disappearing from the room. Room was clean, but otherwise unremarkable. Some food was cold. Some food was obviously leftover/reheated (I'm ok with that sometimes, but deep fried breakfast hash browns don't really work on their 2nd day on the buffet - turn into grease bricks). Children and babies (with and without diapers) in the pool with the Pool Bar. The Ugly: Upon arrival, our assigned "concierge" offered drinks, bag assistance, and then the pressure conversation into the Time Share presentation. When I asked directly if the morning meeting was a timeshare presentation, I was told no, that it was simply a guided tour of the facilities. Signed a form to reserve the spot. Upon reading the form in detail back at the room, it was in fact a Timeshare presentation they were doing. I spoke with the "concierge" on duty and was told that our assigned man would get into trouble if we cancelled, and that I would have to tell him about the cancellation personally. Good luck with that! LOL. What a low sales tactic. This left an extremely bad taste in my mouth - a very unfortunate way to start our vacation, and enough to turn me off of the hotel, pretty much completely. I spent my vacation diving, so the excellent team at The Reef Marina made up for many of the shortcomings of the hotel. If I were to say at the Reef Playacar again, the dive team would be the only reason. I'd more likely stay at a nearby hotel and walk to the Reef Marina. This was my first trip to the area, so I can't compare the hotel to any of the other hotels or resorts in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Will be Back”
Reviews.Author: Goodtimesroll4me
Reviews.Content: Well you cant go by a review all the time you get out of a vacation what you put in no matter where you are. Let me start by saying what this hotel lacks in size it makes up everywhere else. We have traveled somwhere for the past 15 years and stayed in huge 5 * plus resorts which were nice but lacked in alot of areas as this is where the Reef Made a big impact on our vacation. The rooms were clean the maids amazing we needed a cot as we traveled with an 8 and 15 year old the maid brought it to us right away our fridge was stocked everyday and no you dont have to pay for the water as some have stated in there reviews. The pools were great! Loved that they had two pools one with a swim up bar and an activity pool nothing like getting splashed or hit in the hede with a ball while your enjoying a drink. The bars quick friendly service and amazing drinks Orlando made the best Mojitos.....and by the way you can get a drink at the bar upstairs til quite late. They also have a few pool tables and foozeball . The food was good at all resturants and the buffet. Kids club and entertainment staff made our trip they we all fantastic. We are haeding back to The Reef in Jan 2011 only difference is were bringing along 15 more people with us to enjoy the best little place in Playa cant wait.........to see you all soon..

Reviews.Title: “Good experience overall.”
Reviews.Author: dcardozo
Reviews.Content: Nice rooms. The environment is great. The beach is very good and very close to every room, something that doesn't happen in the bigger hotels. The worst part was the owful time we had when we arrived and someone named Erik tried desperately to sell us a Vacation Club. I've been in hotels in 12 countries in 4 continents, and had never been subjected to such a determined attempt to sell us something we didn't want. When you arrive to a hotel after a long plane journey, you want to go to your room as fast as possible, not to hear a speech trying to sell you something. I think they try to sell you the vacation club, and all other sort of tours, in the first few hours you're there, because you're tired, your defenses are low, you just want to get rid of them and maybe even you buy them something just to be left alone. In the next 24 hours, we received calls in our room from no less than 6 different people, trying to deceive us, purporting to be 'the local representation of your travel agent' or things like that, trying to sell us something. It didn't stop until I actually insulted the Nth. guy that called, furious about the whole issue. After that, nobody else called, in the whole week we stayed there. The hotel should protect their paying guests from all these people, instead of actively collaborating with them. (they should not have my name and my room number, in the first place). We talked with several other people while there, and all of them were very annoyed of this practice. It's a shame for a hotel that, besides that, it's pretty good for its price, and very nice.

Reviews.Title: “This place is absolutely beautiful!”
Reviews.Author: arwen944
Reviews.Content: We stayed here some time ago but I forgot to leave a review and decided it was time. We loved it so much that we just booked another trip for this December to celebrate our 11th anniversary and my son's 6th birthday. We have stayed all over the Caribbean and this resort has to be near the top of our list. We are VERY picky travelers and usually stay in 5 star resorts, but something about this hotel made us fall in love with it and we have never forgotten it. The beach is stunningly beautiful, the rooms are clean, and the grounds of this hotel are to die for. We also enjoyed the free water sports activities, which is a nice bonus for adventurous people and families with kids. Although you are in close proximity to shops and excursions, this resort makes you feel as if you are in the middle of nowhere..in your own little slice of paradise. I love the jungle feel of the resort and I can't wait to take our children to the Reef Playacar for the first time this year and make new family memories with them there. We are so excited!

Reviews.Title: “The Reef Playacar was even better than I expected!”
Reviews.Author: HedaK
Reviews.Content: I traveled to The Reef Playacar Resort and Spa on 8-28-10 with three friends. Our stay was seven wonderful days long, I only wish we could have stayed longer. Based on the reasonable price of the trip, I was nervous from the time I booked. I’ve stayed at 5 other all inclusive resorts and this one what certainly measured up to the rest. The Hotel Lobby- I won’t lie, this was the most obnoxious part of the trip. Don’t judge this hotel by the appearance of the front desk like I did at first. It might scare you, but it’s just a front desk and could it use some updating-most definitely. Check-in was fine, a little slow but not terrible. The concierge was intertwined with a timeshare pitch. We politely said we weren’t interested, several times and eventually the pressure stopped. I understand it’s their jobs to do it, but it’s probably in the best interest of the hotel to separate the concierge from the timeshare pitch. It can come across as deceiving. The Resort- As a whole the resort was beautiful. Well kept, maintained and clean. The bell boys and maintenance staff work their butts off to keep it this way. Wildlife is everywhere and it’s so nice to stay at a non-commercialized place like this. Iberostar and Riu are nice, but the feel of the Reef was much different, in a good way. I like to compare it to going out to dinner at a Olive Garden vs. a family owned Italian restaurant-I prefer the one of a kind types of places and the Reef is just that. The Beach- Gorgeous! Perfection! Almost no seaweed to be found and if any was found it was taken care of by the most hard working staff ever! Please get them a wheel barrel and proper rakes. Had working people! The waves were calm the first 4 days and the last three days they were wild and there was the best boogie boarding imaginable. The Pools- The Pool with the swim up bar was fun but crowded, the bar needs a few bartenders, but the one who was working was working very hard. The activities Pool was one pool I preferred when I wasn’t soaking up the beautiful beach. I think I played more sports and games during my stay at the Reef than I ever have in all of my other vacations combined. Water Polo, Volleyball, Water Aerobics, etc… What a fun time we had with the Reef Activities Staff-they were one of the most enjoyable parts of our stay. It was like having an additional 10 friends on our trip with us. Luis, Leonardo and all others were just great! The Entertainment- The shows were great, the staff consisted of some very talented dancers and performers. The casino night was fun! The karaoke nights were AWESOME! Special thanks to Leonardo De Costa for making that happen. He was so accommodating to our group and made it more fun than I could have imagined. The Bars- The best bar was definitely the bar upstairs on the roof/patio. Jesus M. was the best bartender I’ve ever met in Mexico, and I’ve been five times. He played great music and made fun drinks, always made a point to check up on us, say hi. He was wonderful! The Restaurants- The food at the buffet was good. The woman making the omelets was amazing-tip her…she deserves it. I wish I could have brought her home with me. I woke up starving and craving one of her omelets for a week after our vacation. All of the wait staff and hosts are very funny and made dinner more fun than typical dining. The food was good, I ate everything on both menus. But I was really wishing for Mexican. Oh well, Italian and Gourmet was good too. The Location- Great spot, so close to Playa del Carmen. We walked there once via the beach and spent an afternoon there. It was a long day, take a cab back. WE took a cab to town a few nights, had a great time at the Parrot Club and a few other places. The Rooms- Nice, clean. Ask for a King size bed if you’re traveling with your spouse. My boyfriend and I got two full size beds, which we thought was very small for both of us. We didn’t ask to be moved because the bell boy had already ran back and forth a few times to get us settled in, we felt bad. Don’t drink the wine in your room unless you want to pay for it. We got bamboozled into those charges. We tried to debate it upon check out, but lost that battle. Even if it says complimentary, it doesn’t really mean its free Excursions- We chose the Tulum Extreme Adventure which was the best excursion I’ve ever been on in my life. Zip lining, Rappelling, Swimming in a Cenote, Snorkeling in Caves, Exploring the ruins in Tulum and swimming at the infamous Tulum beach! The BEST!!!!! I highly recommend. The Weather- Perfect. A little rain here and there, but almost a perfect week of sunshine! Overall-the place was awesome. I’d go back in a heartbeat. Great value, fun times, great staff.

Reviews.Title: “2nd trip at reef in 4months. not as good as 1st time”
Reviews.Author: sunglow
Reviews.Content: i travelled to the reef last may 2010 and liked it a lot so i decided to come back this september and found the quality and variety of the buffet went down from an 8 to a 5. I would advise the hotel tp go easy on how they approche giests for the vacation club meetings, we were asked to sit for 30 minutes right when we arrived and after declining a breakfast meeting with a rep, got 6 reminders each day in our rooms, this is not the way to get your customers to go back, some customers are actually running away from their busy lives and do not need to be asked over and over to assist a meeting on their vacation. i will still return to the REEF , they gave me great service and staff is simply great (except from one doorman who asked us to pay him $50us for a private taxi to airport because he said the taxi fairs anown at the door are whe. you sgare taxis!!!!! we took one oursleves and paid $38 and never had to share, managme t should not permit this at all, we are planning on going for two weeks next time, staff is worth it and especially the location

Reviews.Title: “Best Vacation in Years”
Reviews.Author: dorgeron
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at "The Reef Playacar" resort for a week in late August. I am no new comer to this part of the world since I have been vacationing in Mexico for over 20 years. We were extremely pleased with our stay at The Reef. The beach was beautiful and not too far of a walk to the water. The restaurants were very convenient. The food quality and the menu selections were very good. The bars were always stocked and we had no problems getting drinks. The grounds are magnificent, mature jungle gardens between the cabanas. The staff was friendly and helpful, and most spoke some English which was convenient. The resort is located close enough to walk to Playa del Carmen, but for $5 US you can take a cab. NO COMPLAINTS. I read a few bad reviews prior to going to The Reef and almost went elsewhere, glad we went. Tips before you go: 1) I do not recommend "Best Day" shuttle service, you will pay about the same as a cab but will have to put up with a sales pitch before they will book your return to the airport. Take a cab. 2) The Reef is in Mexico. You will be approached by staff asking if you would like to sit for a presentation or a tour. This is how things are done in Mexico, they do not consider this as rude. A simple no thanks, or manana usually will make them disappear.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful grounds. Food could be better. Very noisy.”
Reviews.Author: rbblue
Reviews.Content: I love this hotel because, unlike other places, they've done a great job of conserving the natural natural habitat with large native trees growing among the buildings with (apparently) wild serequeques running around (a native animal). The staff were very welcoming and friendly and all times and, contrary to other reviews, never tried to sell us anything (perhaps because we're Mexican!) The pool is great and so is the beach. The rooms are smallish but perfectly adequate and somehow keep very cool even without the air conditioning turned off. The rooms are in individual blocks of about 10 rooms per block and all are with a minute or two walk of the pool and restaurants. The food is acceptable but definitely not the best out there. A lot of things seemed to be unintentionally spicy, like fried plantains and french fries. At night the noise in the rooms was very irritating, from the buzz of the air conditioning in the room next door, the comings and goings of all the other ocupants of the block, and the sounds of carnal pleasure. In fact in the morning I had to turn on the television to drown out that particular noise and avoid my young children asking me what it was. WiFi available in Lobby only.

Reviews.Title: “Time Share Type Hotel- Beware”
Reviews.Author: pamdaniels
Reviews.Content: As soon as we walked in the door we were approached by 3 different men to get our bags, get us drinks, and one man introduced himself as our hotel representative. Before giving us the room keys he had us sit and talk to him about different activities that we could buy from him at a lesser cost than other places. Well, after talking for at least 25- 30 minutes (after a 50 minute drive from the airport), I was ready to rest and freshen up, not continue talking to this stranger. Then, came the scheme- he pulled out a brochure of different vacation spots and insisted we make a 90 minute breakfast appointment to talk about our interests in what we like to do on vacations. He mentioned it was NOT a time share. Well, if someone says it is not a time share probably means it is a time share. He was trying to get us to book future vacations and we had no interest in doing so. There is nothing at all mentioned in any of their websites speaking of a mandatory breakfast to talk about booking future vacations. And to top it off, I avoided the front desk at all times but my husband would go there for any help and information. That should be the place for a guest to feel secure about directions, activities, purchasing other activity tickets... However, when my husband went to the front desk, each time they asked him to make a breakfast reservation FIRST with our rep who would then give us this information. What a scam- what kind of welcome is that? We were there to relax and enjoy in the present, not wanting to think of any future trips. I do not recommend this place unless you LOVE car salesmen!

Reviews.Title: “Terrific family holiday”
Reviews.Author: John528878
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Reef May/June 08 and would not hesitate to return . The food , drinks staff , entertainment and overall atmosphere was brilliant . Disregard any bad revues as some people make a career out of whinging . Hooray for Jorge , Eddie and the rest of the staff !

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: SunBusterHolland
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel, we had no complaints and really enjoyed ourselfs, friendly personal and i give two tips: get a massage at the spa because that really relaxes and get a tan with the tanning specialist! He helped me really good when i was burned and he's honest and gives you good advice. The sun is burning really hard over there, make no mistake like i did enjoying the sun to much, it ruined my vacation. The "tanning man" ensures a brown body and not painfully red. Greetings from Holland

Reviews.Title: “An AMAZING Vacation!”
Reviews.Author: Kurona84
Reviews.Content: First, I need to say that some of the reviews on this website were so off! I don't know if some of these people are either completely stuck or just feel the need to complain about everything. If that's the case, spend a few hundred bucks more and go somewhere else. I can't understand why you'd want room service when you have a gorgeous beach a few feet out your door....get out of your room. The Beach - The beach was amazing. Very clean and well kept by the staff. Beds could be hard to get if you don't put some towels out early (around 8am) but they open up throughout the day. Beach chairs are plentiful. There is a bar about 20 steps up from the beach with a great bartender. Also, the beach is very accessible at night. I read a review that said there was a guard on the beach that asked for money or denied access at night. That is not true at all. There was no one there at any point during our week and I'm pretty sure I could have slept on the beach if I wanted to. Food - The restaurants are excellent. They really make you feel like you're at a top notch restaurant thanks to the setting and very attentive service. The food is also very good. (Guys - They do expect slightly better than "I'm on vacation" clothes. I saw them turn away people because they were in shorts. But I was in nice jeans and shoes, so you don't need to get too fancy.) The buffet is very good for breakfast and lunch, and not bad for dinner. The snack bar had great burgers and is good for grabbing some food and taking it down to the beach. Bars - I don't think you need to upgrade your package to top shelf liquors unless you're very picky. Beers that are included are tecate and dos equis. I recommend asking for cans of these two. The cans last while you can get them, but that usually ends up being most of the day. Your other option is to bring your own mug. They serve their drinks in plastic cups (I really don't like my beer out of anything plastic). Their cups also have a slight soapy smell/taste (but it really isn't as bad as the reviews below.) The bartenders had great personalities. The guy that works at the nighttime bar was fantastic and by the second night had my mojitos made for me before I even got up to the bar to ask him for another. Rooms - The rooms looked better than the pictures led us to believe. Air conditioning worked a little too well. I woke up a couple times looking for a blanket. You can even set them to an exact temperature. The rooms were very clean. A maid came everyday. Nothing was stolen from our room (I even left a dollar sticking out just to see if it would be taken.) However, we kept our valuables and money locked in our luggage. A lock costs a dollar or two - it's always good to bring one along. The beds were a little stiff, but nothing horrible. Staff - The staff was probably my favorite part about this place (aside from the beach and included alcohol, of course). We didn't pass a single worker throughout the grounds without having a friendly "hola" sent our way. They loved joking around with us when they got a chance and were very eager to serve the guests. They are very hard working people. You'll see the same waiters early at breakfast, lunch, and then late at dinner. The person you got your towels from on the beach at 10am is often performing at a show at 10pm at night. So be sure to TIP. Tipping a dollar here and there can make your stay even more pleasurable. That dollar or two also means a whole lot more to those hard working people than it does to you. Also, most of them speak a lot of English, but if you want to try out your Spanish, they seem to really appreciate it...don't be afraid. -Water - I drink a lot of water so I was worried about Montezuma's Revenge. You get 2 large bottles in your room daily, and you can get bottles of water at the bars. Also, the bar by the beach has a water cooler of fresh water. I got a couple extra bottles at the bars and kept them in our fridge. I never went thirsty. Also, we brushed/rinsed with the water and never got sick. None of the food got us sick either, including some raw veggies and fish. I may just have a stronger system than some others. Overall, I had one of the best vacations of my life. If I do Mexico again, I'd definitely go back to the Reef. I have no complaints other than the heat, and there isn't much anyone can do about that. Oh - Snorkeling is only 30 dollars a person for a 45mins-hour long swim in a really pretty coral reef. It's definitely worth it!

Reviews.Title: “beautiful resort, terrible management”
Reviews.Author: frgnadorbl1977
Reviews.Content: this is a copy of the letter i sent to management at the reef when i got home. we spent a full week at the resort with a group of 10, from 7/18-7/24. we arrived very happy, and left quite disappointed. we have already gone through our travel agent for a partial refund. also know that when i sent this to management, i received an email the next day that said this was received and that i would have a response shortly. i have not heard from them yet. it has been 4 days. "I wanted to write and let you know what a great time we had on our vacation last week! My husband and I did not receive the bottle of champagne that you had promised, but that was not a problem at all. We had a wonderful time with our group of friends that traveled with us! The grounds are absolutely beautiful, the pool was great, the food was fantastic, and the employees were always ready to take care of anything we needed! Obviously there were some minor problems, but the positives FAR outweighed the negatives, so I will simply look past them! That is what my review would have been until Thursday. My husband told several employees that there was a loose board on the bridge in the back of the lobby area outside the gift shop. Nothing was done about this board, and on Thursday, he fell through it because of the negligence of the staff. When he spoke to the manager on duty (Rafael Laguna) before we left yesterday (since your note said he could follow up with him), he was simply told that no one said anything. We would have loved to have this resolved before we left yesterday, but it was clear that there was no way to come to an agreement for compensation. A massage over bruises is unacceptable. I just wanted to give you a heads-up about my review so it’s not shocking. I also want to let you know that there will be 9 more that are quite similar, as this injury did put quite a damper on the end of 10 people’s vacations. My new review is as follows: When we arrived, we were not bombarded by the time share nonsense, as many people have complained of. We checked into our room, which was nice and cool. We went to eat at the buffet, which was ok…but we were not there for the food. We immediately hit the beach. As we looked down the beach, many in our group of 10 thought that we definitely had the best looking resort on the beach, and I had to agree! Tuesday our room was never cleaned, we did not get water, and did not get towels. I called the front desk at 4, and was told someone would be right over. At 7, my husband called again. When someone finally showed up, he still had to ask for towels. At one point during the day, my husband told an employee that a board was loose on the main path out of the lobby building. On Wednesday, I went to the front desk and let them know that one of the lights in my bathroom was out, and that it was collecting water and leaking. I was told that someone would be sent to fix it. On Saturday when we left, no one had been in to look at the light, and it was still dripping water on the back of whoever was sitting on the toilet at the time. Wednesday again, my husband let another staff member know about the loose board. Thursday we went on an excursion to XPLOR, which is something I highly recommend! We had an absolute blast! When we got back to the resort, we were walking down the steps in back when my husband went through the very board he had mentioned to several employees on several occasions was loose. Not only was the board not replaced when he first told them it was loose, but it wasn’t even marked with a caution cone or anything. The board snapped in half, he scraped his entire calf on the way down, and hit his knee on a board which left a huge bruise. This left him in pain and limping for the remainder of our vacation. Up until this incident, I looked past any other problem we’d had during the week. The drinks were great, the staff was nice, the food was good (I encourage anyone to eat at the restaurants for dinners…AMAZING), the grounds are beautiful…couldn’t say enough nice stuff about this resort. But when my husband fell, the management denied that there was a problem, denied that he was told they knew of the problem, and offered him a massage on top of his bruises to compensate for his injury as a result of their negligence. At the beginning of my vacation planning, I had seen MANY negative reviews of the Reef. I contacted management and was given the name and website of the company that is responsible for their health and safety checks. They were wonderful to work with, and we all decided to give it a chance. Though in hindsight, it seems that Reef management will do what they can and need to do to get your business, but once something happens, you’re on your own. Until Thursday I would have recommended this resort to anyone I knew looking for a great time on a budget, but I can’t in good conscience do that anymore."

Reviews.Title: “by far the worst vaction i had so far..”
Reviews.Author: jessica26_10
Reviews.Content: i was so dissapointed by the service of staff at the reef. The resort it self was beautiful but i couldnt enjoy by stay there. On my second day i fell down the lobby stairs due to the rain. i strongly recommend anybody who stayes there to be extra careful when walking around the resort its very slippery. the staff wasn't helpful or caring in the situation i was in. not even asking me how i was or the hotel manager seeing if i would need anything in rest of my stay. i felt so frustrated and upsest beacuse i sprained my left arm due to the fall because of that i couldnt even enjoy the wonderful two pools and beach that they have. that would be my first and last time at the reef playacar.

Reviews.Title: “THEFT, THEFT, THEFT”
Reviews.Author: fritomom
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Reef on Wed, 7/21. First impression. BEAUTIFUL. Resort is gorgeous, food was great, grounds well kept. Then the nightmare began. There was a total of 26 people in our group split among 7 rooms. 3 out of the 7 rooms had major thefts. I had 150 dollars stolen one day, 20 dollars the next. 2 other rooms had money, clothing and shoes stolen. Made multiple reports to front desk with absolutely nothing done. Manager wouldn't talk to us. We asked EVERY day to not have our room cleaned. Requested that NO hotel employees enter. They continued to come every day. Even took our shower curtain one day. Very strange. But didn't clean. The beach hotel security guard wouldn't let us on the beach late at night unless we paid him money. Of course he said this had to be kept hush hush. All in all, i would warn at everyone to not stay at the Reef and it's a shame because the resort itself is great but the staff is very crooked.

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Senchy
Reviews.Content: This was my second visit to The Reef and I enjoyed it even more....especially because of the extended beach,,,,that the whole playacar area has now. The staff was wonderful, rooms were clean, and the food was good. I would recommend this hotel to everyone , no matter what your age is.....It's not as big as the other resorts in the area which makes it even better....more private!......Location is great, 15 minutes to Playa Del Carmen, and about 30 minutes to the most beautiful natural beach. Just amazing!!!!!!!!!. My special compliments go to beach bar bartender Zamudio. The best cocktail maker:)!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Reef playacar is a beautiful famliy resort”
Reviews.Author: allisongoke
Reviews.Content: My husband and I found a great deal on The Reef Playacar for July 10-14. We had read great reviews. We are early 30's and just wanted to relax. The resort is small and beautiful. There are lots of trees and bushes. The staff was friendly. There is alot to say so I broke it down-- Location: We loved that the resort was in a safe gated community near 5th Ave. We walked to 5th Ave one day... it is just a 20 min walk up the street. We felt safe the entire time. We took a cab in the evening. Cab fare from the resort to 5th Ave is a flat rate of 5 bucks. Free entertainment: The resort has things you can use for free, such as snorkel gear, kayaks, books to read, boogie boards, bikes and hobie cats. We used the bikes and they gave us a lock so we could lock up the bikes if we wanted to shop. The bikes were not new but it was a nice way to explore the area. We also used the hobie cat. It's like a mini sail boat. We went and asked to use it several times. The guy working at the stand asked if we knew how to use it and we said no. He told us that since we had no experience using it then we can't use it without a taking a $25 lesson. We left and came back the next day. This time we told a different guy that we had done it before. They told use we could use it in 30 minutes because someone was getting a lesson. So we came back in 30 minutes. Then they said that they had another lesson and we would have to come back again. Eventually we got to use the hobie cat and it was really fun. The best part is that there is a flyer in the room that stated the hobie cat is free and the a staff would be a happy to give you a quick lesson for free. If you want to use it tell them you have done it before but it has been a long time. They will show you how to use it... you don't have to be smart to do it...it's easy. Food: The food was not bad. I thought it was as good as any of the other places that my husband and I have stayed in Cancun. This was our 3rd trip to Canun/Rivera Maya. Our only complaint was that there was only one buffet and two resturants that are open at night.The steak place was pretty good. I liked my steak. We wish there had been more choices. The buffet seemed to have alot of the same stuff for each meal. There was a snack bar but all they had during the day was nachoes, fries, hot dog and hamburger. I felt that I ate alot of the same stuff all the time. The lady working the snack bar worked in slow motion. We spent alot of time waiting for the food. The line was not long but she would grill one burger/hot dog at a time instead of finding out if several people waiting wanted the same thing and prepared them together. Ocean: The beach was gorgeous. Awesome beach. There were good sized waves and it was not rocky at all once you were past the spot where the waves rush the shore. Pool: There were 2 good sized pools. I didn't think they were over crowded. Drinks: We had no problem getting drinks at the bar. The drinks were tasty. Sometimes it took a few minutes but we never had to wait a long time. Rooms: Rooms were clean. Air conditioner worked great. The king size bed was hard. My husband loved that. I thought it was a decent size room. No ocean view but the rooms are all located between the lobby and the pools/ocean. You don't have to walk far to get to the pool or ocean. We got there at 12:30pm and the room wasn't ready... they gave us our bracelet, stored our luggage and pointed us to the food. We came back an hour later and the room was ready. Overall the resort was good. We liked the small feel of the resort. The trip was super cheap so we didn't expect Ritz Carlton service and rooms.There were alot of famlies. Sometimes the kids were annoying but we didn't chose adults only so we accepted it as part of the package. The resort was great for the price and we had a good vacation. We are not picky and just wanted to relax on a good beach.

Reviews.Title: “Overall a great place but ....”
Reviews.Author: KYtraveler48
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the reef June 24 through July 1 2010. Was there with my partner. Overall we had a great time. The review is a little skewed because while there Tropical Storm/Hurricane Alex came through which affected the weather most of the time we were there. Here it goes: Hotel: The resort was very cool witth the jungle settling. It was well maintained and clean. The layout was nice with lots of interesting plants and gardens. Due to all the rain from the storm the resort was extremely slippery (ttile floors) just about everywhere and several people fell. The walk to the ice cream was especially treacherous. Room: Our room was pretty basic. Had two double beds and we would have preferred a King bed. We had a third floor room overlooking the interior jungle setting and the cool deck in the middle. It was like being in a tree house. The AC worked fine and room was always nice an cool. The beds were frim but I thought they were comfortable. The bathroom could use a little updating but was fine. Tub/shower had a window you could look out over the jungle. Maid service was good, and always had 2 new bottled waters everyday. Pools: There were two pools, both of which were nice. Preferred the upper pool that had a great pool bar. Didn't care for the activities too much in lower pool area, but think if you had kids they would like it. Due to hight winds most people were at pools so chairs were a little scarce. There was a hot tub by the lowere pool but several people told us it didn't work and wasn't hot so we never went in it. Towel service was fine. One thing I thought was a little odd was that the baby/kids pool was right next to the pool bar. The Pool bar was best place to hang out and meet people. Beach: Beach was awesome!! Very wide and soft sand. This is by far the best part of the resort. If you walk down beach to the south you pass other resorts then nothing but jungle and beach which was very cool. If you walked south you walke past condo/homes and ruins and hit Playa Del Carmen. The ocean was very rough. I thought it was a blast but am a strong swimmer. It really beat you up which was fun!! I am told this was very abnormal and the ocean is normally fairly calm. Drinks: Drinks were a bit dissappointing. Mixed drinks were weak (I like a stiff drink). I tried ordering doubles but that didn't work so would order a drink and a shot and add the shot to it. Frozen drinks were delicious but again weak in my opinion. The beer was draft beer and was only one kind. It was fine but glasses could have been larger. Sometimes you could get beer in a can but was warm so stuck to draft beer. We were told that the room fridge was stocked with beer but it wasn't. They put a couple in there when we arrived but when we called for more they brought one more beer for the entire week for two people. We finally just bought some been in town and stocked the fride ourselves and those ice cold beers in a can were by far the best we had at the resort. We did love the Mimosa and Bloody Mary bar at breakfast! You made your own which was nica as could make it how you liked it. Bars: The pool bar was by far the best bar. Felix the bartender worked very hard and was fantastico. There was another bar by the snack bar that we used for beach beers. It was still a bit of a hike to get a drink if you were at the beach. A beach bar would have been nice. The lobby bar was a bit dull. The bartender there didn't seem too happy. Plus I don't like watching people leave from theri vacation which is sad. lol. We did use the lobby bar a fair amount as it was close to our room. Finally the bar upstairs could have been really cool under the large plapa but again was a little dull. A dance floor or kareoke would have been fun. Bar stools around the bar would have been great! Food: Mainly ate at the buffet which was Great!! The snack bar was also great. Cheeseburgers and the fries were very very good. There was a cool area above the snack bar that we ate in one day but it seemed to be closed off most of our trip. It overlooked the ocean with larg glass windos and had outside table. Didn't seem like it was being put to good use. It was a great area if they would open it up. We went up there during one of the downpours. Not sure if we were supposed to be there. Went to the italian restaurant one night, Bochellis I think. It was very nice but my filet was the worst piece of meat I have ever had. It was unchewable. Not sur what happeed there. My friend had fish which he said was good. We went down to the buffet to eat afterwards. Breakfast by far was the best meal!! Location: This is why we chose this place. You can walk to Playa Del Carmen either on the street or on the beach. Playa Del Carmen is an awesome town and very fun. We were there almost everyday (even during the storms). Activities: The ocean was too rough for to try the kyaks, snorkeling, windsurfing, jet skis, sail boats, etc. I would have tried them but couldn't. We did look at the tennis court on the thrid floor and it was in shambles so if you want to play tennis its not going to happen there. Negatives: My friend slipped and fell in the bathroom by the pool (floors were slick from Alex) I wasn't with him. He busted his head open and had a lot of bleeding. Workers at the hotel wrapped his head in bandages in sent him back to his room. When I got to the room we undid the bandages and he was still bleeding heavily. We went to the front desk and asked where the nearest hospital was. We were given a map and that was it. We were on our own. We don't speack much spanish. We caught a cab to an immediate care center on 20th ave and Juarez. He had severed a vein and required 5 stiches. It wa kind of scary being in a foreign country in a emergency room. My gripe is that the resort should have taken him to a doctor when discovering him covered with blood and not just wrap his head and send him back to his room. Furthermore they should have helped us get him to the emergency room rather than just give us a map. This occurred probably around 5 or 6 p.m. so it wasn't late night or anyhing. The only other negative experience is not the hotels fault but was just another extremely rude guest from Holland. There were several people there from Holland all of who were great and nice, but this one guy made it a point to be a jerk to us upon our first meeting for reasons unknown to us. We tried to avoid him for our stay but as my friend said... it just goes to show you that there are jerks in every country.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: TenaSunflower
Reviews.Content: I absolutely loved the Jungle style grounds. It was beautiful, natural and clean. We definitely got the restful feeling of being on vacation. The food was great. I loved the exotic fruit that I wouldn’t normally have access to regularly. I liked the variety of traditional/regional food and basic American that was offered. I absolutely loved the beach! The water was clean and beautiful. It was not over crowded like the neighbor hotel and there were always lounge chairs available. The staff was very pleasant and always working hard. I felt bad for some of them having to work in the heat. Elidio was our favorite server. If I could change a few things about Reef Playacar, one would definitely be the pony tailed snorkel salesman that asked us numerous times throughout each day if we wanted and would like to take advantage of his snorkel tour. The second thing would be to ad a dance floor for evening fun. Third: More drink servers on the beach. Lastly, the Jacuzzi hours needed to be extended. Overall, we loved the place and would love to go back again soon!

Reviews.Title: “If I could go back to The Reef at Playacar I would go back again!”
Reviews.Author: ecc0130
Reviews.Content: I have to admit I did not know much about the Reef... But I was shocked at what a beautiful simple resort it was! You want to feel safe secure and enjoy a nice place this is the place! Single ladies ask for Johnthan great and handsome bellboy Ana at the dinner buffet is the best and Roberto behind the snackbar makes great drinks!

Reviews.Title: “insect repellent”
Reviews.Author: beezer20
Reviews.Content: Nice resort had a great beach and food was good. Thought the bartender didn't seem to enjoy thier job but the rest ofthe staff were great.The down side was the Mosquitoes.They were in the lobby and you couldn't sit out at night.

Reviews.Title: “Great Time at The Reef!!!”
Reviews.Author: KaKa75
Reviews.Content: Just got back from The Reef Playacar last week ,we left the husbands and kids at home and we had a great time. Dont believe the "BAD" reviews this place is great. Beautiful beach, great location, friendly staff, great price. This is a smaller hotel which I like and will be returning.

Reviews.Title: “Way better then we expected for the price”
Reviews.Author: jezzy987
Reviews.Content: I have been to Playa before, and this is a much better resort then I expected. Food was good, yummy pasta bar. Bartendar at pool, Felix was excellent! Tons of chairs and shade in the pool/ocean area. Staff was helpful, very close to downtown. In the condo district its a pretty area of playa. Wine was good for free wine. Will stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Ok for what you pay for......”
Reviews.Author: Jp1up
Reviews.Content: My husband and I, along with another couple went down from 6/12-6/18. The weather was amazing, and sunny everyday. The resort was small and quaint. After reading some of the reviews before we left, I was a bit scared to see what I got myself into. Here's my breakdown: 1) Food-it was always warm and had a variety. Did it taste like "American food"...maybe not, but then again, we were not in the States. And I thought they did their best to try and appeal to everyone. Did I starve? No-I was always able to find something on the buffet, keeping in mind to stay away from perishable food (for those that posted they got sick, I'd like to know wha they ate). You have to think about what you're eating, and choose "safe options" 2) Buffet/Sit down resturants-The buffet was not air-conditioned, so towards the end of my stay, my body could not handle eating in a warm, humid enviroment. The service in the buffet area was great. Always willing to refill your water (which was bottled) and bring you a drink. We tried the Italian place once. My husband thought the steak was good. I got the vegetarian dish, and it was horrible....so I went down to the buffet later that evening. 3) Pool/Beach. The pool water was so warm! It didn't feel too refreshing. And not to mention many people at the swim up bar didn't leave that area (to use the restroom). Granted, there was plenty of chemicals in the water...but something to keep in mind. It was clean when I went in, and I saw them cleaning it every morning. Plenty of chairs and cabana beds open, and never had a problem finding an open chair. The beach was clean, and not too crowded. 4) Bar Service-Felix was our bartender while we were there....he was amazing and had great customer service. It puzzled me that he was the only one working, when clearly they could have used 2 bartenders at the pool bar. Papo's bar--the same could be said there. 2 bartenders would have been nice. A couple of times they ran out of bottled water, and didn't have more brought up...that got a bit annoying, when the least they could have done was make a call and get more. My drinks were always yummy, and I tried a good variety of them. Always service with a smile. Overall, we got what we paid for. My only downsides: 1) We ordered a room with a King bed and got a double. They said they would have a king bed available the next day, but we didn't want to hassle moving around. Still turned out ok. And yes, the beds were rock hard, but I've stayed at other resorts/hotels and they are just as bad. After a long day outside, it didn't matter, I was tired and was able to sleep just fine. 2) The staff doesn't seem to all be on the same page. We went to the Italian place, and that had a dress code.
