The dress code seemed to be different for each person you talked with. However, if you haggle with them, they'll let you in. My husband and friend's husband dressed in nice shorts, collared shirts and nice sandals, and we were told that closed-toed shoes were needed. We were also told that women need to wear a dress/skirt. When we brought up what we found on the internet, they let us in. But it's not too clear on the brochure or website. So if you go, bring pants, dress shoes, and a skirt....because you never know what the dress code really is.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with beautiful grounds and excellent service”
Reviews.Author: MMHouston
Reviews.Content: I spent one week at The Reef, and the food was great, as well as the pool bar. The beach has been extended, so there is more sand. Having stayed there before, this was the best experience of all. The room was large and clean. The staff was very accomodating. It is convenient to Playa Del Carmen and Tulum is about an hour away. The only negative was having to ask more than once to get something fixed (water leak in the bathroom).

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, would return”
Reviews.Author: jealba4travel
Reviews.Content: My Husband and another couple stayed at the Reef Playacar from 6/5-6/9. This is a very nice small hotel that has that true Mexican flavor. It doesn't look out of place or goddy, like some of the other hotels nearby. The area was very secure, and we felt safe everywhere we went either at the hotel or downtown. The hotel grounds are beautiful, almost as if you are in the middle of a rain forrest. Made for a nice cool walk to the lobby, or pool/beach, which was short since the resort is small (nice plus). Rooms were small but nice, again who wants to spend time in the room when you're at the beach? No complaints about the food. The only downside was that the pool bar closed at 6:00 pm, a little early when the pool is still full of people. Staff was friendly and eager to take care of you. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “We would DEFINATELY come back!!”
Reviews.Author: olea2709
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Reef from 5/21-5/26 with 3 of my girlfriends! We had an amazing time and would definately return to this destination. I have been to other all inclusive resorts and thought the food at this one was by far the best! The sit down restaurants were incredible too! We were upgraded to an oceanview suite upon arrival...claiming to be "overbooked". It worked out nicely for us because we ended up being able to all stay together and to have a room closer to everything! I have heard so many people mention that when they arrive the hotel claims to be "overbooked" but I don't think that's the actual case. I think they have difficulty explaining things in English so they just say that. We did many things on this trip including going into downtown Playa Del Carmen to go shopping and also at night to the bars/clubs. We felt very safe in this area and did not have any kind of problems with scary people (as so many people warned us of before going to Mexico). We also took the ferry into Cozumel and were surprised because other than the first block or 2 which had overpriced shopping and beautiful buildings, it was fairly run down and a bit unsafe to walk in. I don't recommend going there for the day unless you take scooters to explore. We enjoyed an excursion purchased through gray line (office located right outside of the lobby door). It included off-roading in jeeps in the jungle; zip lining; swimming in a cenote; having a delicious Mayan lunch cooked for us; and also a tour of Tulum (ancient ruins). It was $99 and well worth it!! We booked our trip through Expedia and purchased the transportation as part of the package. It was well worth it because we really didn't know what to expect upon arriving. After getting there, we realized that Expedia uses a specific company "Best Day Travel" to do the transportation. They were extremely kind, professional, and nice! After being there for a while we felt that we could've just taken a taxi to and from the airport, however, we are glad we did so with Best Day Travel. The exchange rate of pesos to USD is a little bit different everywhere you go (restaurants etc.) I think it's generally 12.5 to 1 USD, just to give you an idea. I brought $100 in singles with me and went through almost all of them. Many vendors WILL NOT give you USD change, only pesos so be sure to bring singles!! All in all, it was a great resort and was close to everything...we loved the location, and the beach was the most beautiful I have ever seen!! Good luck!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful resort, excellent service”
Reviews.Author: Bonelini
Reviews.Content: We are family of four and this is our second visit to Reef Playacar and we would like to come again. The resort is nicely located in so called Playacar Hotel Zone and the closest one to Playa del Carmen. 15min walk next to beautiful houses will bring you to 5th avenue full of shops, clubs, restaurants, street entertainment.... real fun. The Reef Playacar is the most beautiful resort we have even seen because it is small (5min walk from lobby to the beach), romantic and it looks like a jungle. You could touch the palm trees from your balcony and the whole resort is like that rather then massive resorts where you need shuttle (on +35C) to go anywhere. There is even a small cenote in the resort next to ice cream place. Really nice. The staff is also amazing and hard working. Of course they work for tip but you don't have to tip them in order to get service, you can tip them once you get the excellent service. You can tell they are working hard under really hot Mexican conditions but still really positive which makes you feel good. Entertainment staff is also really friendly and good, working from 10am exercise by the pool until 9pm show and even leading people to Playa del Carmen club after that. The beach has been re-sanded completely so it is really wide now and there are no more send bags in the ocean (for the waves) so it is really nice view. Enough space for everyone and you don't have to fight for a chair. The food in the restaurant is good and there is always something nice to choose. Never heard anyone had any food poisoning or something. There are two a la carte restaurants, we visited only one and the service was amazing. No need for reservation you just show up. Besides there is snack bar (fries, burgers, wings, nachos...) open until 2am so there is no chance you can be hungry. The alcoholic drinks are not watered down which is really good so be careful...hahaha. If you have kids then Kid's club would be an interesting place for them and Claudia is doing an excellent job. Our kids loved her, so my wife an I had some moments for ourselves too. There is really nice scuba diving center in the resort ran by some French people. If you are into that they are really professional and you can feel confident and safe. As a side note we had the rent a car all the time, no problems, parking is free in front. We went to see Chitchenitza (205km from resort, tickets 11$) and Coba (110km from resort, tickets 5$), the highway is good and we felt safe to drive. Don’t expect shiny expensive stones in the bathroom of flat screen TV in your room, but you will be amazed with natural environment preserved in this resort.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this place!”
Reviews.Author: Postalguy
Reviews.Content: First of all this is not a 5 star resort nor is it priced like a 5 star resort. I would however say that this resort is as nice as the 4.5 star resorts I've stayed at in the past. The buffet food is very good and the Filet Mignon at Botticellis is delicious. This is the first resort that I've stayed at where nobody in my family got sick. The beds are a little hard and the rooms could use a little updating but how much time do you spend in your room really. The beach is beautiful, the location is terrific and the employees are the best I have encountered at any resort. This is the first resort that I would definately return to.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to go back!”
Reviews.Author: simplytx
Reviews.Content: This was our 2nd trip to Mexico in a year. I must say the resort is absolutely GEORGEOUS...The beach the water everything is set up for peace and relaxation. The Spa was amazing with the deep tissue massage. Had a great time. The main restraunt is a buffet-the fresh fruit and salad bar are excellent quality. The cooked food is great too. We ventured up to the Terrazza Grill and the Flank Steak was very tender and well prepared-save your money- You don't need to get the Rib Eye or NY Strip at extra charge for a good steak. The Salmon is to DIE FOR and the Cheesecake was awesome as well. There is plenty to do-we only left the resort one time for 2 hours to buy trinkets to take home. We are definitely taking a group back November 2011 to celebrate my 50th birthday. The Reef will be my home away from home!

Reviews.Title: “If u like sleeping in a dump & eating garbage stay here!!”
Reviews.Author: SunLuvnGirl
Reviews.Content: We arrived for our friends birthday knowing we weren't staying at a 4 star hotel but it wasn't even a 1!!! That being said we walk into our rooms w/no working AC in the middle of Mexico's hot summer. The bathroom had a colony of ants migrating to the front door. I checked the rest of the room and found all dead bugs all over the floor! We asked to be moved and after a lot of hassle we were finally moved. New room had stained sheets, rickety beds, paper thin towels with hair on them and the floor was filthy with sand and dirt, and the AC (which worked) barely blew out a breeze. The rooms are in need of a major overhaul. Food was atrocious, old food was always recycled to the next meal, there was hardly anything edible. The beans from the night before at dinner were served for breakfast the next day. The hike from our rooms to anywhere felt like we were trudging through the jungle. The pool was small & overcrowded. TRUST ME spend your money else where, you won't regret it like I did!

Reviews.Title: “The Reef Playacar is a Good Resort”
Reviews.Author: Figgee
Reviews.Content: We spent two weeks at the Reef , May 9-22 2010. If you want a smaller hotel at an economical price, then the Reef is a great deal! We had a King room (recommended) that was spacious and overlooked the central courtyard. There are "ocean view" rooms available, but I think the courtyard rooms are much nicer. There are only 200 rooms so it's very easy getting around the resort. The pools are nice. The beach is great. The food was good and plentiful. The restaurant staff were great. The pool bar staff were not friendly at all. If there is one thing that could have made our vacation better, it was the pool bar staff. There were two guys on the bar and they were definitely in the wrong job. No customer service skills, not personable and sometimes just plain rude. We tipped all the staff, but gave up on the two pool bar guys, even healthy tips couldn't get them to break a smile. The restaurant staff had some real stand outs...Elidio, Jaime, Sergio, Carlos all were really great!

Reviews.Title: “Don't believe the bad reviews. This place is great!”
Reviews.Author: CALIFORNIADUDES
Reviews.Content: I just got back from the Reef Playacar and I must say that everything far exceeded my expectations. I knew that this wasn't a 5 star resort but I didn't expect the great customer service, the excellent cuisine, and the spotless accommodations! I came with a party of 16 and I must say that that all of us have vowed to return next year! Jesus (Chuy) at the front desk really made sure that we were well taken care of. He was great! The bar staff worked relentlessly to make sure drinks were flowing even though at times they were a bit overwelmed, they never complained and always had a smile. The grounds were lush and very well kept. It had the feel of a real tropical getaway not just another cookie cutter resort. The waterfalls, the cool coffee bar in the middle of the vegetation, the ice cream parlor near the waterfall were unique touches to a beautiful resort. The buffet restaurant was great with very well prepared dishes and the hand sanitizer at the entrance of every restaurant insured healthy dining with no fear of that dreaded norovirus! The goourmet restaurants, especially La Terraza were awsome. The best Lamb chops and Sea Bass I have ever had. I have stayed at the Riu Palace next door and the found the food at this resort to be far superior. The head chef at the Reef Playacar obviously takes great pride in his cooking and it certainly shows. I didn't make any of the shows. Being located so close to Playa Del Carmen, I chose to go into town for my evening entertainment. I must conclude that this vacation was one the best trips I have ever taken. I have traveled all over the world and for some reason this place and destination have really made an impression on me. My sincere thanks to this resort and it's wonderfull staff for making my vacation so special!

Reviews.Title: “Good resort, Beautiful landscaping, Nice location.”
Reviews.Author: WistaWio
Reviews.Content: The Reef Playacar is a very nice little resort. The grounds are beautifully landscaped. The surroundings are almost like in a tropical rainforest. The rooms are pretty comfortable. It is a 3 star property so don't expect too much. I have found the stay to be very satysfying. The beach access is nice. The water clean and beautiful blue. There are plenty of chairs and cabanna beds to accomodate all the guests. The two pools on the property are very adequate as well. The hotel is located about 15 minutes walk from downtown Playa del Carmen in a quiet and safe neighborhood. This allows you to enjoy the bustling town with all of its restaurants, stores, and nightclubs. Definately a big bonus if you want variety and some nightlife. One thing we were not pleased with was the quality of food. You can usually find something to eat and the variety is there but after a couple of days it gets old. Evertyhing is seasoned the same and generally it has a taste of a school cafeteria quality. You can do one or two meals there in a day, but not all of your meals.Good thing is you have an abundance of places to eat very close by.

Reviews.Title: “Can you say FOOD POISENING?????”
Reviews.Author: FrozenWasilla
Reviews.Content: This was by far the worst vacation I have ever experienced. I was extremely ill. High fever, running to the bathroom to puke or with the runs. When I asked the front desk to bring me water as I was extremely ill and my husband was gone for the day, they wanted to charge me for water. POS'S! I was sick because of THEIR food! Do not stay here. The food will make you sick if you eat the wrong item on the wrong night. There is NO quality control. NONE! They ruined my vacation! I was sick for days on end..............took a long time to work those bad germs out of my system. To make matters even worse the maid laughed at me when she saw how sick I was. No compassion, no offer to help. Just hilarious to her. NO WAY WOULD I EVER STAY AT THIS DIVE AGAIN. EVER! I hope this sorry establishment drops into the sea! Along with the front desk personnel and the maids. I wouldn't recommend this hotel to my worst enemy. Describe this hotel? HA! It is a dump. If you are going to spend your hard earned dollars on a vacation, I would suggest you spend a few more in order to get food that will not make you sick.

Reviews.Title: “Best vacation ever!! Loved Reef Playacar!!”
Reviews.Author: vacationjenlr
Reviews.Content: I highly recommend this hotel. Great beach. Great pools. Great service! Great food! All around wonderful experience!!!

Reviews.Title: “I agree "Save Your Money"”
Reviews.Author: Buffey1
Reviews.Content: I too stayed at the Reef Playacar. Not one of the greatest hotels I have been to. Although, sometimes I felt alone, most people loved it. Let me start with the Jungle that is in the centre of the Reef Playcar.....although it is what people love about this resort, it is far too overgrown. It makes the rooms very dark and must smelling. I know that most of the resorts are musty from the humidity, however, these rooms had a terrible smell. The food is mediocre.....you won't starve, but there is not a huge variety to choose from. They claim there is two restaurants, which there is however, one of those restaurants is not included in the all inclusive, you have to pay extra. The staff is overworked and there is a large staff. I felt sorry for Gorge at the beach bar...he was alone and tried to be pleasant however, he was so busy. Having said that, the staff are very accomadating and try to make you happy. The shows are really bad....they are in a dingy auditorium kind of building with chairs that are rusty and falling apart.....one lady sat in one, the chair broke and she fell to the floor. She had a senior lady with her and it was a god send that she didn't sit in it. The pools are very small and over crowded. I would not recommend this resort to anyone and especially if you are paying anymore than $500.

Reviews.Title: “Last Minute booking - cheap price - thankfully”
Reviews.Author: DreaminoftheBeach
Reviews.Content: What can I say, it is definately not a 4 star resort. I am glad that it was a last minute deal price because I certainly would not pay full price to stay at this resort. The rooms are out-dated, no coffee makers and fridge is only stocked with pop. We actually moved twice, finally moved to a room in the building closest to the Pool, much better room. First room was 'in the middle of the jungle' no view very dark. Second room, was first floor and was very musty, couldn't even sleep the first night. The beach as others have commented is very nice,however they could use newer lounger chairs on the beach. Most of the chairs on the beach have 'old smelly' cushions on them.. should be updated to the 'mesh' chairs. Staff are extremly friendly in the restaurants and at the Beach Bar. I might also add that they do seem under-staffed and they work hard. If it wasn't for the staff, I'm sure our trip would have been worse. Food at the buffet wasn't bad, you could always find something to eat, however the selection is not great. Then again you are only paying for a 3.5 star resort. Being a small resort, there was not much for 'entertainment' at night, or even any place to really take a stroll around the resort. The 'jungle' setting may have been nice at one time, however it appears the trees and shrubs have overgrown and could use some 'trimming' to allow for a little more sunshine. It is close to Play Del Carmen, so a quick walk to town in the early evenings was a nice escape. If you are use to larger 5 star resorts with plenty of entertainment I would not recommend the Reef. However if you are looking for a smaller resorts, mediocre rooms and a place to relax on a beautiful beach then you may like the Reef.. just don't do it at full price! All in Alll would I go back - only if I had another last minute deal and was in desperate need of lying on a beautiful beach.

Reviews.Title: “Save your money”
Reviews.Author: Melliebay
Reviews.Content: Very crowded, bar staff was rude (probably overworked and underpaid), the food was mediocre at best. Beautiful grounds and beach, could be a great place to stay if they would be a little more hospitable and work on the food. Minibar which was only stocked with sodas to begin with was never refilled. The phone in our room did not work. We could also hear everything going on outside in our room, it was very noisy. Overall a very disappointing experience. I've traveled to Mexico 10 times now and this was my only negative experience, but was my first time at this resort.

Reviews.Title: “great location, terrible hotel”
Reviews.Author: Boris2001
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in the beautiful Playacar - suburb of Playa del Carmen - the town is approx. 15 minutes away - or 5 minutes and 5 USD by taxi. The beach is amazing - water very clean, white sand, no stones and rather big so you never have a problem to find a chair. We made a booking via Booking.com - when we arrived, the hotel had no booking in our name and gave us a room on 1st floor with a lovely view to a busy parking lot.... The room was a 3 star standard - the beds rather hard, minibar empry and never re-filled (apparently we did not leave enough tips/. The bathroom was not renovated - water was dropping off the ceiling which was full of mold. Everyday we got a tiny bottle of shampoo. Whenever one passed by the reception, a time share "seminar" was offerred, whenever one passed by the pool, the animation staff offerred diving courses - it was rather annoying - just like the loud music all over the place. The bars offerred watered down drinks - for a real drink you had to pay "tips" - some of the bartenders were rather unfriendly and stressed all the time. One of the bars was in the pool - as a result the water was not very clean and it was constantly full of loud, drunk people. In general the property was rather small and loud, full of people who spent most time at the bar. The food was definitely not 5 star - the choice was rather limited and tasty is something else. Luckily Playa del Carmen is very close - there are many great places to eat. The people at the reception were friendly - as long as you had no problem - we could withness several bad arguments with unsatisfied clients - in the end the receptionist said she does not speak English and stopped talking to them.... There is a board with taxi prices in front of the hotel, but these are "not valid" - when you order a taxi to the airport, they charge you 500 pesos and not 440 as given on the board. When we asked for reason, they said the board is "out of date".... So if you want a taxi to airport or elsewhere and want to save the commission for hotel, you can get one in the street just in front of the hotel. If you want a nice beach, dont mind simple room and boring food, like it loud and with lots of alcohol, go for this hotel....

Reviews.Title: “WE LOVE THE REEF PLAYACAR!!!”
Reviews.Author: magnumhorses
Reviews.Content: This was our second visit in 3 years and we had a fantastic holiday again. The gardens are beautiful and natural, the food delicious, the staff is helpful and friendly, and of course the location is stunning and very close to 5th ave shopping. I would recommend this place to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to unwind”
Reviews.Author: 26ocean5
Reviews.Content: We only had three days here but thoughly enjoyed the staff. The buffet restaurant offered a great choice of food was excellent. The staff was always willing to help where ever they could. The location of the hotel allowed us to walk into the town of Playa del Carmen. The hotel rooms could use some upgrading. Be aware that there are no elevators at this hotel but they do offer wheelchair access on the ground floors. I would definetly recommend this hotel and I will definetly try to go back to this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “The Staff were fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Scherette
Reviews.Content: I would just like to let everyone know that we had a wonderful time at the Reef, despite all the rain. The Animacion y depoute staff kept everyone busy with fun things to do. They all had many duties at the hotel, I just wanted to thank....Penoto, Pancho, Patheieio, Zoo Haila, Perla, Greta, Anna, Lupito, Estell, Rafael, Fernando, Rosarita, and so many others that made our stay so enjoyable...thank again...the Scherettes

Reviews.Title: “A nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: PFOLKU33
Reviews.Content: My wife and I took a quick trip to Mexico and had a very pleasant stay at the Reef Playacar. The major factor in choosing the Reef was price, but the Reef still delivered good value. The rooms are clean and adequate but take heed that the beds are rock hard. The beach is fantastic and provides a quick 15min walk to Playa del Carmen. The main source of food is the buffet and it is about what you would expect from an all-inclusive. I wouldn't say it was good or bad, but I never went hungry. The resort itself is small but is laid out very nicely in a jungle type setting. It doesn't have much in terms of a night-time scene so into town is your best bet. By far the best part of our stay was the swim up pool bartender Eddie, we watched him work for a 8hour shift without any break, and the whole time he was serving everyone with a smile. Definitely hang out with him and leave him a nice tip for taking great care of you.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place to unwind!!!”
Reviews.Author: cpodkesler
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I just spent 5 days at Reef Playacar to celebrate her graduation from college. We left April 9th, 2010. The rooms were always clean, roomy and comfortable. they are not 5 star, but who cares, you're at teh ocean!! The outdoor walk to the beach was fantastic, with lots of green folige and beautifully kept. I usually like beach front rooms, but the outside was so pretty and quiet, i did not mind the quick walk to the beach. The service was great and everyone very accommodating. Food was good and plenty of it. The drinks were great! I anticipated watered down but the bartenders took care of the guests. We did not do any excursions, only the beach and food, which was the plan. If you are needing 5 star surroundings, the room won't make you happy, but everything else was beautiful. The rooms are clean, but more simple, which I am fine with. If you are looking for a laid back, easy going atmosphere, this is the place for you. I want to bring my husband next time and we will be staying at the reef.

Reviews.Title: “Spend the extra money and stay somewhere else.”
Reviews.Author: SPQR51
Reviews.Content: When you imagine the Reef Playcar, think All-Inclusive at an older Holiday Inn. For some people that is perfectly fine, for others it's not. For the price you really should not expect more. The staff was generally friendly, but slow to respond to requests. It was difficult to discern staff from employees trying to sell time shares. It could get pretty frustrating when all you wanted was advice on a good local restaurant. The room quality appears ok when you walk in, but that wears off pretty quickly. We found the bedding and mattress to be very low quality, particularly the mattress, which was well used a pillow top. The bathroom had a decent set up, but the plumbing and fixtures were pretty suspect. After a heavy rain storm we found a layer of something in our shower. I honestly don't know what it was, but my initial reaction was to ask my wife if she got sick. She assured me she did not get sick. The Reef Playacar had some very redeemable qualities which included: affordable pricing, a decent buffet with a variety of options (available for all 3 meals), a quality dinner restaurant (only one), well maintained landscaping, two large pools and close proximity to downtown (5 minute walk). All in, we felt the poor room quality and the limited dinner options did not outweigh the money we saved by staying at the Reef Playacar. My best advice would be to spend a little bit extra to stay at a solid 4 star all-inclusive; you'll have a more enjoyable vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Totally Agree With Massachusetts's Review”
Reviews.Author: GOHABSGO68
Reviews.Content: My wife , myself , and my 10 year old were at the Reef the same time (returned April 6). I could not agree more with their review. This was our third trip to Playa Del Carmen and thoroughly enjoyed ourselves. THE GOOD: The staff was fantastic.I cant say enough about Pancho, and Claudia from the Animation team. They did a Disney inspired show with my daughter , and a host of other children from the resort and were absolutely fantastic with the children. Felix and Guilermo were two of the best bartenders we have ever had at any resort. All of the wait staff , the housekeeping , and the chefs, did their very best to make our stay the best it could be. The beach was breathtaking,no real need for water shoes it was all sand.THE BAD: Definitely the worst thing was the BEDS , they are small and hard as rock. The walls are paper thin and if you are a light sleeper you may have a problem. All in all we met some real nice people from Sask. and Ont. as well as from all over the USA , cant wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to go back!!”
Reviews.Author: newby49
Reviews.Content: This was our first ever vacation to any tropical locale but we had done our research and for the cost of travel with our 3 teenagers we wanted to be sure we got value for our $$. We had a beautiful vacation at the Reef. The beach is as beautiful as the pictures, there are lots of longe chairs although some of them are broken. If you want a bed (nice) just get up early. The staff were amazing! They work so hard & such long hours, always with a smile & 'Ola'. The food was good & there was always lots of fresh fruit and a variety of dishes. Not a lot of authentic Mexican food but enough to get a taste. Make sure you go to the ala carte restaurant, mexican or Italian night, you can go every night if you want, just get there early. The service is excellent, no extra charge, just leave a good tip. If you enjoy a good glass of wine, bring your own. You can get international wines at the al a carte restaurants but at an extra charge. The service at the bars was inconsistant but the swim up bar was always good thanks to Fast Eddie! The buildings are only 3 stories tall so you feel like you are in a small community. Everything is very close. Every evening around 5pm the little oasis in the middle of the resort offers special coffees while you relax on the outdoor couches. It has a bit of a jungle feel, zen music, you get the idea.....awesome atomosphere. We attended the "Party on the Beach" which cost a little extra but was so nice to feel the breeze, the moonlight, the music & your feet in the sand. The entertainment was average but still very enjoyable, the entertainment staff work night & day and it can't be easy to keep things fresh. We had read other reviews that said how hard the beds were but I found them to be very comfortable and slept great! I would definately recommend this hotel to anyone. Minutes away from Playa del Carmen - walk along the beach or $5 for a cab. Beware the timeshare sales people though, not just @ the hotel but also in the town. They will promise you deals on daily excursions but only after you have sat through the sales pitch. Xplor!! We spent an awesome day the this new adventure spot just 15 minutes taxi ride from the resort. Zip lining, cenotes and all terrain vehicles. It was $99/person but worth every penny! Very professional, excellent food a great way to reconnect with the teens. The kids parasailed, all 3 together! My husband & I had massages on the beach. We loved every minute of this trip. I just wish we hadn't waited so long to go.

Reviews.Title: “A happy stay at the Reef Playacar”
Reviews.Author: londoner_in_yucatan
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at a number of the All Inclusives in Playa and enjoyed this 2 night/3 day-stay much more than others. One key plus is that the hotel & its grounds are small. This means you don’t have long walks to the beach, restaurant, etc. It also allowed us to let our kids run pretty much free. The architecture and gardens are also VERY attractive. The thick, lush vegetation gives plenty of shade and keeps the pathways very cool. There are only 2 pools, as well as a kiddies pool, but neither got crowded. In addition, they only have one buffet area, so be prepared to wait a few mins for a table in the evening. These are a couple of negatives of being in a small hotel, but the positive is the more personal attention from the staff. The hotel is very well located in Playacar, an almost traffic-free residential development sufficiently close to Playa Downtown to be walkable. We did however have problems parking our car in the hotel lot, and off-street parking is very limited. Our check-in and check-out were lightening fast and we got a free upgrade to a suite, too. The room was excellent, very comfortable bed, plasma TV, high quality décor, efficient air con, etc. We felt the food was better than in other hotels, though you might want to steer clear of the house wine. A part of the gardens has been turned over to an ice cream parlour, which our girls loved. The main grumble we had was the poor quality of the evening entertainment. The shows they put on were cheap looking and the bar area needs to be made more welcoming. Overall, this is a 3 star hotel that offers good rates and a good level of service. We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “I wouldnt stay there again”
Reviews.Author: rusty6010
Reviews.Content: Food was terible besides always being cold ,,if your looking for a veiw of the water well forget it ,if you were to stick your head into a bush thats about what the veiw from yr room would look like,.The drinks were bad,,no onedrink would be the same if you were to go to each of the bars.Most of the staff need an attiude adjustment , but I would say the best part of the hotel is the beach,,world class!!!

Reviews.Title: “What a cozy beautiful place! And the beach is absolutely stunning!!!”
Reviews.Author: KalindiKatya
Reviews.Content: We just came back form our trip and we were very happy with the Reef Playacar hotel. We chose it randomly,mostly basing our desicion on price and area. It is a 15-minute walk to Playa Del Carmen - or a 10-minute bike ride ( the hotel has bikes you can borrow, included). Very convenient if you want a change of scenery, if you want to shop or eat elsewhere or go to a club. We even came back on the beach from the club one night. Service is very courteous. Most staff speaks some English, some are very good at it. And some of them also speak French. As in most resorts like this, everyone welcomes you and is happy to help. At first they were fully booked and we got a room with 2 double beds, which were a bit firm - so this matched with the previous reviews we read here. But the next day we got switched into a room with a king size bed and it was very comfortable. The rooms are clean. pretty basic but they don't feel old or over-used or anything. The room was cleaned daily and we got 2 bottles of water every day in the room. We loved our room and called it home in no time. The pictures and virtual tour on the hotel's website are a pretty good representation of what it really is like. The food was good. Nothing spectacular but everything was very tasty and there was variety. There is a smoothie bar open for breakfast. They also serve ceasars and mimosas for breakfast upon request right at the buffet. (They also have guavas - little yellow fruits- that I fell in love with and miss greatly in Canada now. try them!!!) Our only thing was coffee. If you ask for an americano, you will most likely get just drip coffee. And that's not only at the hotel, that seemed to be the case in most places. So we asked for espresso instead. That worked. And there was hot water at the self-serve coffee table so we just added that to the espresso. Crowd-wise it was mixed - mostly couples and families. And the beach is beautiful! Soft sand, warm water!!! Hard to describe it all.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise”
Reviews.Author: Vacaplease0809
Reviews.Content: The Reef Playacar was one of my favorites so far. We have been fortunate enough to travel to many destinations but none were as beautiful as Playa Del Carmen!! The area surrounding the Reef is BEAUTIFUL!! It's clean and safe and you can walk to town or the local "market" without worry! My sister in law and I couldn't get over how spotless all the public restrooms were. Americans should take a lesson from them! The grounds of the hotel were like a Mayan ruin in the jungle. Just beautiful. Pools were clean and the view at breakfast....well, I could wake up to that ever day!!! The rooms were generous compared to others we have been at. It did get damp but it was 84 degrees and humid some days. The bathrooms were a nice size also. It was nothing fancy....but very very nice! The food was very good. It does get a little repetitve after a while as we were there for 9 days. The Terazza Grill/Botticelli was a nice treat for a change and was included in the all inclusive price. I found the staff to be friendly and eager to please. (We were NEVER harassed by time share people)) I am a New Yorker and we do everything in a hurry so sometimes we couldn't wait for our coffe but that's our problem! ;) Felix at the swim up bar was "Da Man"!! He knew within a day what we liked and had it ready before we even asked! The only negative I have to say is regarding the nightlife and the day time activities. I have two boys 10 and 13 and they felt the staff could have done more to get things "going"! It may be that they are more laid back but I think they could have been a bit more enthusiastic about starting the events. There were plenty of kids but you really couldn't tell what was going on and at what time it was taking place. They didn't always adhere to the activities board. The night time was where we feel it really fell short!! There is so much potential here for more! We weren't looking to "tear it up" BUT something....anything to keep the guests attention would be nice. We went to the upstairs bar every night after dinner and sat talking about the potential it could have. People would come up the stairs, look around, and then go back down again. There are pool tables....Maybe a Karaoke night or music. It wouldn't take much to amp it up!! I have to give a "shout out" to our friend Candido. He had a Mexican Pottery station next to the pool where you could paint your own or buy what he had already painted. He sat for hours patiently painting and helping the kids paint. He's a very talented man!! Over all we had a wonderful time and would recommend it to anyone with families or even a romantic get away. We all were pleasantly surprised! The price was right for what the experience provided!

Reviews.Title: “Definitely a return destination”
Reviews.Author: Dexter99
Reviews.Content: OK.... title aside, we have been to: Cuba (several times), Dominican Republic, Jamaica, Panama... and the Reef Playacar is our favorite so far! I will start with the "negatives"; The food at the buffet is often warm, at best (except for breakfast) The entertainment is "mediocre" at best. OK....now the positives; This resort is small, but GORGEOUS!! The landscaping is amazing, and the layout is different - to say the least. We arrived late on a Monday night (around 9:00 pm) and were the only ones on the bus, so check in was quick and easy. The porter took our luggage and led us through a wonderland of jungle paths to our room. The room was simple, but well appointed. The bathroom was all stone tile, with a walk in shower. In the main room was a flat screen TV and a safe in the closet. We found out the next day that this was a Studio Suite upgrade, and managed to talk management into letting us stay in the room for the rest of the week. ($$) We spent the first night at Papo's bar on the second floor over the lobby, and the bartender Zamudio took care of our every need. As the week progressed we came to know and respect Zamudio as he became our friend. As our second day approached we learned more about the resort layout - including the two pools and the buffet restaurant. Service at the buffet is hit and miss.... depending on your server. Valentine will make sure you have everything you need, but others are not so conciensous.(?) Also, don't wait for cutlery, or napkins, or even coffee, as you may have to get it yourself. The food is good, but not always hot, or even warm. We found one of the "a-la-carte" restaurants by accident, and booked supper the second night there. It was "extra" (get used to it) but worth it. We had an excellent dinner with a personal concert by one of the ex-members of the "Platters" who was amazing. We also ate at the Italian a-la-carte a couple of times, which was good ( and no extra fee) however we never managed to make the Mexican restaurant. If the bufffet is not your style, there is a snack bar by the pools, which serves hot dogs, hamburgers, chicken wings, nacho's, and french fries which will all fill the gap. Make sure to see Felix at the swim up bar, and have a Mango Tango, or a Summer Spirit. We were never pressured to attend the "meetings" (not time share?) but they did ask. The beach was awesome, but don't bring your snorkelling gear unless you take an excursion. As a regular Sunwing customer, this is one of my pet peeves. At the welcome meeting, they tell you that you can do the snorkelling for 1/2 day (nothing included) for $80 per person, however you can arrange it through the hotel dive shop for $33 per person. Sunwing also said that horseback riding on the beach is $80/person per hour!!! I don't think so! Playa del Carmen is a 15 minute walk from the resort, easier on the street than the beach. Or you can take a taxi for $5 (US) one way. Be prepared to be accosted in Playa - the vendors have no problem hounding you relentlessly. Also, be aware of their pricing - one store wanted to charge us $70 for a Mexican flag worth maybe $2!!! The staff here are awesome - for this reason alone I would return. However, the weather, the layout, the afternoon coffees, the beach, the proximity to Playa del Carmen are all factors that would bring me back. If you have any questions, do not hesitate to contact me!

Reviews.Title: “The Beaches' are Back!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: MInneapolisMiki
Reviews.Content: After the hurricane that hit the playa del carmen area, the beaches had dramatically decreased in size and was very disappointing. This year, the Mexican government made a huge investment and loaded the beaches back with sand and it was back to normal, absolutely beautiful... The Reef Playacar is a smaller, more quite hotel experience. If you ask me, a great bang for your buck. The hotel is lush with beautiful plants, trees and flowers, with an overwhelming feeling of being in the jungle. Its very small, and has an easy access to all variables that a vacationer may need, i.e.... room, lobby, food, ocean, pools, and especially the downtown playa del carmen area..... the food at the Reef is just fine.... descent selection for breakfast, a great selection for lunch and just barely above average for the reservation dinners at night. But, with the outstanding location to the downtown area, you have an outstanding access to some great restaurants. We had dinner at the Blue lobster. WoW, the biggest and best lobster in town. La bodeguita del medio (cuban restaurant) was outstanding... great live music, mojitos, great time... La mandala is great dancing place, and right across the street is a great hookah bar with outstanding champagne. The list goes on and on....... This is my 6th time in this area, and for the price, The Reef Playacar is hard to beat. I will go back in the future and will recommend it to anyone. Thanks to all the great staff and their efforts to make us feel welcome.. This is a great part of the world... cant say enough....

Reviews.Title: “Ahhh...so relaxing!”
Reviews.Author: loveplayamore
Reviews.Content: This was our second trip to the Reef Playacar and both times spent during Spring Break. The feel was laid back, very Mexico in hospitality and appearance, wonderful food, small resort (not overcrowded feeling), clean... We are already planning on a return trip. The staff is so helpful, courteous, and multi-lingual. We feel like we found Playacar's best kept secret resort...Although we brag about it to our friends. We went with just our family: my husband and I, sons ages 22 and 20, and daughter 18. They loved it. There's something there for everyone. But most important is the relaxing atmosphere and friendly guests and employees! The price is just right too! Very reasonable! This is not a 5-star place laden with marble, etc.; it's just Mexico-homey. Can't wait to return!

Reviews.Title: “beyond expectations”
Reviews.Author: denis1212
Reviews.Content: Had been to Pacific side ( Puerta Vallarta ) and enjoyed but yearned for better beaches and snorkelling so accomodation wasn't 1st proirity. From arrival at the Reef Club Playacar the friendliness and effort ( although never disappointing on any previous vacation) was an other level above- never any hesitation from all staff to help and at times would sense we needed help and it would be freely offered. From the reception to the beach the grounds/gardens were beautiful.. walking above a waterfall over looking the ice cream parlor, winding through tropical gardens and the 3 storey clusters of room units up to the pools/buffet and finally to the 300ft stretch of white sand beach (no rocks) and beautiful clean blue water. The food was above average but no seafood the a-la-carte is better than a 3 star.The staff from front desk, guest services,ground keepers, animation/activities, hosts/hotess and waiters ( we know all their names but too numerous to mention) were the best ever- fun and friendly yet professional. The Reef Resort is the closest to Playa del Carmen's 5th Ave.- only a 20 min. walk or use the hotel bikes to go through a gated community past a park with ruins and all very safe day or night. The only slight negatives- our 1st room (main floor) had a musty smell but we were moved to the 3rd floor from which you could hear the hum of the roof top A/C so the rooms are due for a renovation nevertheless can't wait to go back. Well suited for romance or families. D.B. Sask. Canada

Reviews.Title: “Beware”
Reviews.Author: garbage1112
Reviews.Content: We spent a week with another couple at the Reef Playa and this resort needs help. The two resturants, mexican/Itailian nees help. I am sure the Filet of Steak was Donkey. The King room we requested turned out to be 2 doubles looking over the back parking lot with lots of construction going on by 6am. Finally got moved to a king ropm late afternoon. They only give you two bottles of water per day after that you must pay for them?????. Buffet is BORING. I did notice that there are to many little kids in diapers in the pool which I think led to my stomach problems and the runs. The bathrooms need updating with step in bathtube showers. Beware of the airconditioner. Our clothes smelled of Mildew it was so strong.

Reviews.Title: “Good value vacation”
Reviews.Author: Eddie1222
Reviews.Content: Good value for the price. Smaller resort, basic rooms, beds are very hard. Tons of options at the buffet (breakfast, lunch & dinner), you can always find something to eat. Lots of fresh cut fruit at breakfast, nice breads. Good fries at day time snack bar, also has late night snack bar. No disco here. Very nice staff, super friendly. Two small pools (chairs fill up fast so if the pool is your thing, better secure a spot before 9am). Large beach, great location... can walk to Senior Frogs on the beach (about 15 min). 5 min & $5 by cab to town. If you're looking for a gourmet experience, select a different resort. But if your looking for somewhere to relax and enjoy the Mexican sun, the Reef will fit the bill. Muy bien.

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant stay with a hiccups.”
Reviews.Author: Skippy_in_Colorado
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Reef for the 6th time and figured to pass along a few thoughts about our stay. Overall, it was a great stay, 9 days of sun and relaxation. The high notes; Size - we really like the smaller resort, intimate feeling and everthing is a short walk Location - 15 minute walk from Playa Del Carmen Beach - It was rebuilt last year and you can now walk to town along the beach Pool bar - great service and separate from the family pool Rooms - a touch dated, but very clean Grounds - the landscaping was imaculate and well maintained Front Desk - always friendly and prompt Low notes: Snorkle trip - booked through onsite water sports shop- waste of money. We where taken to the reef, swam around the reef, 20 minutes adn back to the resort, hardly worth $33. Food - Not bad, but never changes after nine days it was a bite tiresome Food service - It was difficult to get a glass or water or cup of coffee. It seemed like they where short staffed. Italian Resturant - would not recommend, poor service, slow and I'm not sure what part of the cow that was they served Time share agents - because, well, they are time share agents The highs out weighed the lows, but I figured I would pass along my opinions. It's not 5 star, but if you want and pleasant, enjoyable stay in Playa del Carmen at a reasonible price, this is a place to consider. As always, this is just my opinion, I could be wrong Skippy in Colorado

Reviews.Title: “Surprising oasis”
Reviews.Author: Lobo28
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from a five-day stay at the Reef Playacar in Playa del Carmen Qunitana Roo. We wanted a smaller (and less expensive) all-inclusive resort and chose the Reef from a short list. The hotel, sitting next to the massive and ornate Riu Palace looks unimposing. The lobby and bar area were well-kept and small. Check-in was quick and other than a brief attempt to introduce us to time-shares, we headed to our room. Leaving ther lobby, we were on a walkway of native multi-colored woods under a canopy of trees. The rooms are in small buildings, about twenty or so, with twelve rooms to a building. The walkway wove through the trees and plants cool and quiet. Our room, on the second floor, was clean and equipped with a small refrigerator. I had asked for a king-bed but got two full-sized, both of which had very firm matresses. The bath had a tub/shower (high step into the tub)and plenty of towels and soap. A small balcony with two chairs and a table overlooked the grounds. Pathways led to the beach area where the two small pools and the restaurants are. The lot is narrowish and the buildings close, but the feeling is one of more spaciousness as the buildingsg are smaller and not looming over you. We arrived between lunch and supper, so ate at the poolside snackbar and got drinks from the poolside bar next to it. The beach is wide and clean. Wave action is cutting into it, so at the high-water mark there is a drop of about a foot down to the packed sand. Pleny of chairs and umbrellas are provided, as they are at pool-side. Plenty of space to get sun or shade. Meals are good. The selection was plentiful and varied including lots of fresh fruit and salads. Several entrees were served each night and after a few days you'd inevitably recognize some of them. The quality was very high and the service, particularly Carlos, was excellent. Alcoholic drinks were on the weak side, but were free and only a short walk away. We tried Botticelli's Italian restaurant (Upstairs from the main restaurant Chula Vista, no reservation required, dress code that was not being observed) and found the meal great, but the service less than we expected (had to ask twice for napkins, water, and never got our drink order). The shows were fun, energetic, entertaining. Lots of activities for everyone. Town, Playa del CArmen, is about a fifteen minute walk on the beach or on safe, easy sindwalks. Fifth Avenue is the hot spot, about a mile long for the tourist area with some side streets. You can find anything you want (within legal limits I imagine) and the prices match it. For better values go the short distance to Tenth Ave. or beyond. Bring an insulated mug with a closed top for drinks. Bring U.S. one dollar bills for tips. Be able to say no or walk away when shopping. I would reccomend this hotel to anyone but Spring Breakers and I would return in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “good price and good service”
Reviews.Author: fernandaphiladelphia
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in a great area and we got an excellent price for a last minute booking. The room is large and confortable, not many amenities but ok! The best is the beach and the activities including sailing with a teacher.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise in an intimate setting”
Reviews.Author: hjukosky
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went here for our honeymoon and found it very relaxing.The people were very friendly, staff and other vacationers. The beach was fabulous and the views were spectacular. I will definitely be back here again. It is in the center of it all. Playa Del Carmen is within walking distance, and most of the tours are fairly close by. I would recommend this resort to anyone who is looking for a relaxing getaway. It is just the right size to get the best service they offer. Everyone there was great. Hope to be back very, very soon. Tourism could take a few lessons from the resorts in Mexico. They make you feel like you are home there.

Reviews.Title: “WATCH OUT”
Reviews.Author: josadie
Reviews.Content: A few things: first, just take a taxi from airport to hotel and back, it is $20 per person each way by taxi and about half the time as the shuttle. It took us 2.5 hours by shuttle one way to get to our hotel, horrible!! They told us it would only be 45 minutes. Same price as taxi, but half the time. Also, DO NOT LEAVE OUT personal items that you do not want stollen in your room... if your money goes missing, then it's your problem, not theirs as you should have used the safe in your room (which you're charged $2 per day of use). When the hotel staff checks their "lost and found" ... a word to the wise, they dont have one, because it's called their own pocket.... as we found out this morning. The guy behind the desk was wearing our money clip on his shirt pocket after a little girl found it and turned it in where we'd lost it, the guy didn't even bother alerting us that it had been found. We reported it missing a day earlier. If we hadn't continued to hassle the front desk, we wouldn't have got it back (though our wad of money is lost, at least we have our $ clip back)... ALSO, if the entertainment staff says lets go salsa dancing, but charges you $35 each to go to Senior Frogs, it's a SCAM!!! Senior Frogs does not charge you to get in, and it was not even salsa dancing... it was a regular crowded club where the entertainment staff disappeared immediately once we got there. So, just throw away $70 US on maybe 3 drinks... wow, what a scam.Yes, they only disappeared until they wanted a drink and had you flash your braclet to the bartender so they could get a free drink... that's about it. You can go on your own, dont be fooled into thinking they can show you the town, what a scam. You can walk to Senior frogs in only like 15 minutes for free!! You can walk on your own to anywhere downtown, dont have to blow your $$. The beach is great, and that is why we came. Rooms are okay, not horrible, we had to fix our toilet almost daily. Food is decent, the Italian restaurant was the best, the service was great in both the italian & mexican restuarant. I think the front lobby & entertainment staff could use a few tips on being morally decent, and upright...everyone's out to steal a buck regardless of how it effects you.

Reviews.Title: “WOW...What a place!”
Reviews.Author: mcclars
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a wonderful week at Reef Playacar. My wife and I, and two other couples often travel together. This intimate—202 rooms—AI resort in a gated community was a whole lot more than we expected. The hotel’s unique design includes winding paths through jungle-like gardens, waterfalls, and a tropical canopy. The rooms are comfortable. The individual terraces or balconies provide privacy. The restaurants serve a wide variety of foods. The staff was attentive, and eager to please. The desk clerk who checked us in called us by name five days into our stay. The buffet servers were friendly and often remembered our drink preferences. Very Impressive! The beach was part of a major coastal restoration project and was almost 50meters wide. In 2009, we stayed at one of the Cancun resorts, but this year we wanted a little quieter place that was close to shopping, dining, special tours, and lots of beach time. The Reef Playacar was all that. We will return next year.

Reviews.Title: “Blue collar resort for regular folks like me and not the rich and famous.”
Reviews.Author: C0RNUC0PIA
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a 10 day stay at the Reef and I was pleasantly surprised after reading some of the negative reviews. I chose the Reef because it was the least expensive of the resorts in the Playacar area and I wanted to be close to Playa Del Carmen and its shops, bars and restaurants. The Reef isn’t perfect by any means, but was well worth the price in comparison to higher priced resorts. This was my 4th time to the Cancun-Riviera Maya area and each time was with a different resort. I would call this a “Blue Collar” resort and it suited me just fine. I booked my package through Expedia, flew with Delta and used Cancun-Express for airport transfers and would use them all again. Everyone was very professional. I didn’t hear of anyone getting ill and I even drank the water from the tap, although I didn’t like it very well because it was heavily chlorinated. They have bottled water available anyway. We tried most of the food in the buffet and ate at both restaurants as well. I’m not a picky eater, so I thought the food was great. You sometimes have to wait in lines as they don’t take reservations. Just be patient and you will be fed. The grounds were very well maintained, cleaned continuously and landscaped very beautifully. The staff was very friendly, hard working and helpful. I was never asked to buy a time share on the Reef property. The beach goes on forever and is absolutely gorgeous. Playa Del Carmen is a leisurely 20 minute walk down the beach. You can get to town on the sidewalk in front of the resort, but we never did that, although plenty of other people do so and it is very safe. We didn’t try the bicycles. The taxi cabs are $5 each way, which is how we preferred to get to town. There is another small shopping area in Playacar that is only a short walk to the south of the Reef that has nearly everything that Playa Del Carmen has, but no bars or restaurants and fewer pushy salesmen which is an asset. If you take your laptop, there is free wi-fi in the lobby that isn‘t mentioned on the website. I took full advantage of that to keep informed of weather, headlines and to keep in touch with my family. The coffee bar and ice cream bar are open for a short time each day and are well worth a visit if you like ice cream and coffee. At the coffee bar you can get Irish, Mayan, Mexican and Spanish coffees with different liquors in them. They heat it up over a fire which causes most of the alcohol to burn off. It is fun to watch. We had a few issues, some that are mentioned by other reviewers, but we chose not to whine about it; the positive far outweigh the negative. Most of the folks staying at the Reef were friendly and we met people from all over the globe. A few drinks at the bar seem to help people relax and open up. Overall, I would recommend the Reef to anyone looking for an affordable resort that isn’t overly fancy, but has some very nice aspects too.

Reviews.Title: “Heaven on Earth!!!”
Reviews.Author: rphanson
Reviews.Content: From the moment we arrived, the people were extremely friendly and helpful. We were upgraded to a three room suite when we arrived, which was perfect for us and the other two couples we went with. I took a ton of pictures of the room cause I was so impressed. There is always a bar available somewhere. The snack bar has excellent fresh food...tacos were the best. The buffet was awesome...specifically the breakfast. The Italian and Mexican restaurants were good as well. There were activities all day long that you were encouraged to participate in. The grounds are beautiful and very well kept. The beach was clean and there were always plenty of chairs. The ice cream parlor was really neat and very good. The service was great, although they really need beach side/pool side drink service...that was our only complaint. Very nice, safe, 15-minute walk to downtown as well, making the location ideal. Thanks to Candido who helped us paint some of the ceramic figurines that he sells/paints by the pool. He made what I painted look good with his final touches. I even bought some of his ceramics that he painted, as he is extremely talented. We were not ready to come home and can't wait to return!

Reviews.Title: “Relaxation at its best!”
Reviews.Author: Fab60B
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently returned from a weeks vacation at the Reef and are looking to go back as soon as possible. The food at the buffet was very good compared to most all inclusive buffets. Lots of choices for breakfast and great omlettes cooked as you like them while you watch. Lunches were good and you had a choice of a snack bar near the pool or the buffet. The lunch buffet was generally very good and quite tasty with a reasonable selection that varied from day to day. The snack bar had hamburgers, hot dogs, fries and nachos but if you needed more variety, hit the buffet. We did not eat dinner at the buffet since we prefer to go to the specialty restaurants for a sit down dinner in the evening. There are two specialty restaurants, Mexican and Italian. Both had good food, but not what I would call five star. The menu is a bit limited but since you alternate nights that they are open, you can find something good to eat for a week or so. If you are planning a two week vacation, it would get a bit repetitive. Service was generally good. Remember you are in Mexico and the waiter's language skills are limited, but they try hard and will do anything to please if you ask. The beach was just rebuilt after hurricane damage last year. We watched them turn a sliver of beach into a beautiful sandy playgound in two days as we looked on in awe. It was quite a construction project which I am sure is now complete. We were able to use the beach for the last 5 days of our trip although part of it was roped off for construction vehicles. By now, it should be completed. The water of course is a beautiful color and the ocean bottom was mostly sandy. Since its reconstruction, it is as good a beach as anywhere in the Carribbean. Some days the red flags flew because of wind and waves, but you could still get in and play. The rooms were clean and had very firm beds which we like. They are not fancy, but are nice and roomy with a table and two chairs and a vanity. Bathrooms have a tub and shower. Every room has its own balcony which we enjoyed after a day in the sun. The grounds are immaculately cared for and each unit holding twelve rooms is connected by beautifully designed stone pathways through a garden (jungle) setting. Most of the rooms do not face the ocean but overlook the garden setting. Workers are constantly trimming and cleaning up leaves on the walks and throughout the garden. If you want a peaceful relaxing setting that is beautiful, look no further. Since the resort has 204 rooms, it is smaller than most and has a more intimate, relaxing feel. Although The Reef is not noted as an adult only facility there were not a lot of children present. There is a children's pool but no water slides for the kids so if that is your thing, probably you should choose another resort. Couples can relax here because the few children we saw, were very well behaved. It was February and not spring break so maybe things could be different during a holiday season. Other reviews indicated a problem with mosquitoes, but we saw two. Probably depends on the weather and season. Our weather was slightly overcast but was warm and in a week we had only one shower that lasted about a half an hour. All in all a very relaxing vacation with a beatuful beach, pool area and grounds. The resort is located within the community of Playacar about 15 minutes walk to Playa Del Carmen. It was away from the hustle bustle of Cancuun, no traffic and not a single person on the beach trying to sell souveniers. Can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Second time at the Reef, and will definitely return!”
Reviews.Author: G2G2Reef
Reviews.Content: We stayed 10 days at the Reef and will definitely return for the third time! We love the resort for the friendly staff, the location, the tropical feel, the amazing sandy beach (which is now doubled in size - you can take a short walk beach front to Playa del Carmen or go the other direction to view the many Playacar resorts along the way). There is a small Plaza about 5 mins from the resort which has a bank machine, money exchange booth, a drug store and a varitey of small stores. Playa del Carmen is a short 15 walk from the resort or 5 min taxi ride where there is a variety of nightly entertainment, shopping and resturants. We have two children who were kept busy with the variety of daily activities coordinated by the amazing friendly entertainment staff, from water volleyball, to ping pong, beach volleyball, etc. This is a smaller resort, which comes in handy for accessing the buffet, your room, the lobby, snack shack, and awesome ice cream parlor throughout the day. The buffet had a good variety of food choices and we often returned in the evening to the buffet rather than the a la cartes for that reason. We took in most of the evening entertainment which had a variety of well performed shows, enjoyed by all ages. The resort staff were always very friendly, working hard to keep the grounds clean and the restaurant staff very efficient and pleasant. If we had any issues with our room, the staff quickly responded and followed up to ensure it was taken care of. The dive shop is located next to the resort where you can book scuba diving, rent sea doo's, parasailing, etc. Certified divers offer free scuba diving lessons in the pool. You can later schedule a dive at the coral reef, which my husband and son took in and really enjoyed the experience. Our vacation was filled with good memories, fun and relaxation for entire family. It was sad to leave the resort, the people and staff we met, and look forward to our next visit!

Reviews.Title: “I would go back tomorrow if my husband would let me!!!”
Reviews.Author: IowaOst
Reviews.Content: This hotel was awesome! My husband and I went with 2 other couples and we had a blast. The service was great, and of course you can't beat the swim up bar. Everyone was very friendly and spoke good english. The food was excellent, good variety and was cooked fresh in front of you. The omelettes for breakfast were the best. The ocean was the clearest, the water was beautiful. They had several activities that you could do throughout the day, everything fm water aerobics to beach volleyball. The hotel itself and the rooms were very clean. We actually got upgraded when we arrived for no extra cost, it worked out really good for our whole group. All in all it was a great time and an excellent place to vacation at a great cost. We decided on a smaller hotel because I think you get better service and people are friendlier.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous, Awesome”
Reviews.Author: Joane10
Reviews.Content: This had to be one of the best vacations we have taken. The Hotel was fantastic, so clean it was unreal. The staff were extremely friendly and helpful, and most spoke some English. The food was great. We had Lobster one night and it was to die for. The smorg was always hot and a lot of variety. I couldn't get over the beautiful grounds... I felt like I was in the middle of a jungle...just beautiful. The drinks were great to and they were more than happy to make you something special if you requested it. The location couldn't be better, a 20 minute casual walk to Playa del Carma where there are tons of shops and great restaurants. I wouldn't hesitate to go back....Lots of people with children as well so it was quite a family oriented hotel as well.

Reviews.Title: “Disabled Person rates 3 star resort, 5+ star people made up what it lacked in restaurants”
Reviews.Author: statonville
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 9 nights with a 4 and 6 year old child and loved it. The down side first..... it only has two real restaurants and a buffet one. The good side is that I am in a wheel chair and it was great! I had to go down stairs to get to the beach, but they made a wooden ramp to go over the two inch step into the room and everywhere I went, someone was trying to help me. Everyone was smiling and doing their best to ask if you needed anything. They completely strip the beds everyday! I left a dollar on the bed everyday for the cleaning staff. The kids club was amazing! Claudia....WE LOVE YOU....... she took the boys to the zoo and everything. We couldn't figure out how to get her into our suitcase to bring her home. We would go to the buffet and get breakfast and the kids would try to hurry to get the Claudia and the kids club. We would have to get them excited to come with us instead of going there. Ana and Giarmo were great! Giarmo help us with all his hook ups, from renting cars to having other companies come pick me up in my power chair. Giarmo alone made our trip AWESOME! The rooms were normal two bed rooms, kind of small, but we just slept there and charged my chair up. It is a 20 minute, well lit, walk to 5th avenue in Playa and that was great, since there are limited eating options.

Reviews.Title: “Great smaller resort...7th trip to the REEF”
Reviews.Author: PandD52
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from our 7th stay at the Reef. A FABULOUS resort if your seeking smaller, friendly, economical vaction. We have returned there so many times because we enjoy the smaller resort atmosphere. We met and socialized with others from Canada, Germany, France, Holland, etc. this is a direct result of the smaller resort. We have visited other LARGER resorts in Playacar but due to the size of the resort and larger numbers of guests, never experianced the friendships we have at the Reef. Again let me say that the Reef is a smaller resort (203 rooms) It takes less than 5 min to get from the lobby to the beach. The venture is beautiful. The center court pathway landscaping is full of trees, plants and local small animals (eg. sereque, lemur & geckos). This pathway allows many "holas" to be exchanged between guests & staff. The Reef is ALWAYS immaculate. There are always staff cleaning & sweeping the common areas of the resort. The food/bar service is excellent. The Reef has started a no reservation policy for the 2 specialty restaurants. You show up at the time you wish to dine. If they are full, you are given a pager to let you know when your table is ready. The rooms are clean and neat. Yes they are a little dated but everytime we had a need the maintenance staff, they were there within minutes to fix or replace broken items. The beds are harder than most of us are used to but the Reef does offer a varity of pillows in each room to accomidate different pillow wishes. The acitivity staff are a group of hard working indiviuals, who work hard to ensure everyone has a good time. They are especially good when working with the children from the various countries. The BEACH is the best in the area. There are always chairs available during the day. There are 2 pools, which are kept clean daily. The chairs seem to be in shorter supply by the pool areas. Let me finish with this advice. If you are seeking a 5 star resort, full of premium food /liquor, marble hallways, anticeptic surroundings and staff...this is NOT for you. What you will get at the Reef( a 3+ star) is good quality food/liquor, gorgeous atmosphere and friendly staff. The difference between the 5 star and 3+ star for us was about $1000 when we scheduled our visit. Enjoy the REEF..... we are sure you will!!!! We plan on returning next year for 2 full weeks of heaven.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location!”
Reviews.Author: chrisinpa30
Reviews.Content: We traveled to Mexico with our three children ages 15, 18 and 20. We arrived at The Reef Playacar on Christmas Eve just in time for the special Christmas Eve dinner buffet. It was a great start to a great vacation. There were so many things I liked about this hotel. It was smaller than the one we went to last time, and I liked how it wasn't so spread out. The two restaurants were very nice, although they didn't enforce the dress code. The buffet was great for breakfast with made to order omelets. There was a wide variety of food to choose from at every meal. The pools were nice and the swim up bar was great. We never had a problem getting chairs at the pool, but the beach chairs seemed to be more popular. Everyone who worked there was really friendly and no one badgered us to participate in games or activities. The rooms were just okay. They could us a little updating, but were very clean. No elevators, so keep that in mind. The location to Playa Del Carmen was only a ten minute walk. This was a great perk! We loved going into town, but only after the nightly entertainment at the hotel. We took the sailing lessons so we could take out the boat on our own. It was worth the 25$. My husband and son went on a deep sea fishing trip only to find out that it was not good fishing season when they got a mile out. My son did catch a baracuda that the hotel cooks prepared for us that night to eat. I would recommend this hotel to anyone on a bit of a budget who doesn't need luxrury, but wants a great vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing... can't wait to do it again”
Reviews.Author: V_BrownCalgary
Reviews.Content: This is our first trip to mexico and i thought i would pick a nice smaller type hotel. I have nothing but good things to say about the hotel. The food was good, the drinks were amazing, the beach was amazing, the hotel room was nothing special (but really who spends all there time in the room). I can't wait to go to this hotel again. And for the price we paid for it we will return for sure.

Reviews.Title: “A great deal for a smaller budget-just don't go in January”
Reviews.Author: Firesign1129
Reviews.Content: We only had one day of sunshine all week and the temperature didn't get higher than 74F. With that being said we made the best of the week! The area and grounds were unbelievably beautiful; you felt like you were in the middle of the rainforest! The room was simple but very nice and clean. The food was good, but eating there three meals a day got a bit repetitive; but all-inclusive was a good value. Not much to do at night, but there are bars and clubs about 5 minute taxi ride away. Pools and beach were beautiful with a variety of furniture from lounge chairs with and without cushions to canopy beds with linen curtains blowing in the breeze. The tour to Tulum and zipline activity was well worth the money. Snorkeling trip would have been nice if the weather was better, and even after not participating in the second swim of the day due to the rocky waters, they would not give us any sort of refund. Therefore we recommend only going on excursions if the weather is appropriate and cancelling ahead of time if the weather seems questionable. The area was very safe and the staff was generally helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great Relaxing stay and Great Fun in the Sun”
Reviews.Author: macrokr55
Reviews.Content: This was a great place to spend a low key 5 nights in Playa Del Carmen. The food is good, but don't expect authentic Mexican, which I didn't. I ate at the buffet for most meals and ate at the Mexican restaurant once. The snack bar was good, but the cleanliness could be improved. At the snack bar and outdoor bars it appeared that they pretty much only rinsed rather than washed the plastic glasses which are re used. This hotel has a lot of Europeans and Mexicans staying there which I found nice. It is kind of a relief sometimes to not have to stay in places in Mexico with a lot of whiney and paranoid (with emphasis) Americans (particularly Texans, where I am from by the way) expecting to be catered to or expecting it to be like back home. The beach is excellent, much better than anything you get on the so called Riviera Maya, which is mostly time shares with manufactured (man made) beaches. For my purposes which was spending pretty much half of every day on the beach and the rest just wandering around close by in Playa this place was incredible. I go to the carribean for the Ocean 1st and foremost and this place doesn't dissappoint. From many people I heard that the diving and snorkeling tours were fabulous, and I have done some of this in the area on past trips and found it to be excellent. The dive shop at the hotel has a great reputation in this area. Only thing I might warn about is that during the deep winter months you are dealing with a colder current at sea, so the ocean can be cooler than in the summer and the prevailing breezes are coming in off the ocean which can maybe make it feel a bit cooler if it is cloudy. Still great tropical sun when it is even partly clear. The cloudiness can be a bit of a relief sometimes as well. I would recommend to anyone looking for something a little more low key and comfortable rather than pampered luxury. 3 star hotel, with good service and a great beach. Check out authentic Mayan (Yucatecan) cuisine in town at Yaxche restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Had Fun in the Sun”
Reviews.Author: Sunnyinphilly
Reviews.Content: We were unsure after reading some of the reviews. We had a great time a thought this hotel was very enjoyable. We would def consider going back and taking our friends and family. We were early for check in so out lovely hostess should us to the buffet and told us to return after lunch and they would have the room ready, and they did. A king just as we requested. Most of the rooms have lovely jungle views, the grounds are covered with tropical plants and gardens, lovely. Everyone was so helpful and pleasent. If we needed anything extra (towels, TP etc) we just called the front desk and they ran it up. The food was good, we had breakfast at the buffet, They offered a wide varity to choose from (omlettle station, to fresh fruit) For lunch we usually hit up the snack bar for fresh nachos salsa cheese burgers and fries etc. The buffet was also opened. For dinner we went to one of the restaurant, they would take turns opening the Mexican one nite then the Italian the other. The buffet was very nice as well and the service was amazing. Take a travel candle for your room, and some bug spray for the evenigs and your set. Playa is a 10 to 15min walk for shopping :)

Reviews.Title: “Nice enough, but they fell apart under pressure.”
Reviews.Author: aelizbet
Reviews.Content: To provide context, we arrived at The Reef just as swine flu was taking off. When we arrived, the news was saying not to worry about it, and by the time we left they were canceling flights. During our short 5 day stay, the majority of the guests got food poisoning (which was a bit scary, until we knew what it was), and the hotel ran out of bottled water & gatorade over the weekend. So much of the staff disappeared that it was very hard to get served at the buffet (you couldn't serve yourself). To top it all off, the concierge was unbelievably offensive- the moment we arrived he wanted to chat about the hotel's amenities and activities. We tactfully said we'd talk later... we wanted to get our bags to our room and freshen up. He wouldn't take no for an answer, and when we took a firmer tone and walked away from him, he became visibly upset and called us 'sir' and 'ma'am' in a tone of strong sarcasm. At first we almost wondered if he was actually the concierge- he was very young and looked like he'd just walked out of a California fraternity.
