We spent the rest of the vacation avoiding him and making runs into town to pick up bottled drinks for other guests. Honestly, if not for the food poisoning and the terrible concierge it would have been a lovely trip. I'm sure this is a nice hotel most of the time, but the combination of the swine flu panic and bad food left us feeling like we needed a vacation after our vacation.

Reviews.Title: “The REEF became our second home”
Reviews.Author: hvb236
Reviews.Content: Arrived in Cancun on the 25th of November, after a stop-over and delay, due to a tropical storm, at the airport in Cozumel. It was good to see the REEF and all the familiar faces again. Unfortunately we missed some employees due to the H1N1 flu scare. The WHO did a lot of damage to the tourist industry. This was our tenth time at this resort and so far never did regret it. We are planning our next stay in April 2010 already. The food and service in the Chula Vista and Botticelli was very good. Our 14 day stay was very pleasant and we hated to leave the REEF.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty nice place”
Reviews.Author: Nerdygirl21
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel and thought it was nice. We had a few issues with the room; the air conditioner leaked which I knew since I read reviews on this site. The room was smaller than I thought it would be. The shower leaked but this was something that was easily fixed with a few towels on the floor. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The food was ok, not as bad as some of the reviews I read. As long as you know how to ask for what you want then you should be fine. I asked the cooks if they could make me special dishes for breakfast and they did without hesitation. We liked the buffet the best but only because we could pick the food that we liked. The hotel has two "fancy" restaurants that were only ok. Bring dressier clothes if you plan to eat in them. The only thing that I wished they had more of is authentic Mexican food. The beach was amazing, crystal blue water and white sand....nice! The grounds were pretty clean although I would have liked to see the pool cleaner. If you want the bartenders to pay great attention to you then just tip a bit. If you get the chance get a massage it was amazing! Overall I had a good time for a great price thanks to expedia!

Reviews.Title: “Great Water Sports Shop”
Reviews.Author: 3255pine
Reviews.Content: The dive shop at this hotel may be the most professionally run outfit in Mexico. Gilles and his staff are excellent divers. What is most impressive is that the help is actually helpful. I brought three other divers from the neighboring property after talking with them about the quality of the dive experience I had here.

Reviews.Title: “no management visible at food stations.ONE STAR FOOD!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: boatfun4
Reviews.Content: Have been to 20 or so all inclusive resorts.The location is great the food eatable for one meal be careful!the resort lacks management.Entertainment almost non existence.THE grounds beautiful.Rooms maintenance poor.now to the owner sell now!!!!!!!!!!you have run in to the ground for a long time.

Reviews.Title: “Would Not Recommend !!!!”
Reviews.Author: vexated
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Reef Playcar the first week in November. I dont like to complain and usually find Good in something but this was the absolute worst stay we have ever had in the 10 or so times we have been to Mexico!!!! The room smelled badly of mold and mildew to the point that we didnt unpack we just kept everything zipped up in the suitcase. We could not get another room as we were told it was full. The food was the absolute worse and we went into Playa most nights to eat...so much for the all inclusive.... But Great if you are trying to loose weight !!!!! The pools were so cold that you would get a headache if you stayed in over 5 minutes thus they were empty.....One redeeming feature was the beach and the ocean felt like a bath after the pools. The one good thing is the location, it is close to Playa so you can walk in for dinner. I hate going on and on but there are much better places to stay because we all want the same thing......A Great Vacation at the Best Value which this is NOT....

Reviews.Title: “Needs a lot of upgrading”
Reviews.Author: Zarf53
Reviews.Content: The resort is quiet, but the rooms are not very pleasant. There seemed to be a lot of unavailable rooms when we checked in. We arrived after 11:00 PM and were promptly ignored by the night desk staff. The room we were shown to was moldy and the next morning were offered one not much better. We ended up paying an extra $300 for an upgrade for a week, which was very clean, bright and comfortable. We had no complaints about the food selection which was good and the serving staff very friendly. The beach was adequate, but there was a scuba tour boat anchored there, that came and left right from the beach, which made the swimming area a little crowded. The day staff were friendly and helpful, ensuring that we had plenty of drinking water in our rooms. The main pool was located beside the next door hotel's air conditioning area and was noisy all the time. It was in need of repair and was closed the day before we left for hygiene reasons. We ended up with rashes by the time we had left for home. The other pool was in need of repair and was a little aged. The travel guide office is located on site and was reasonable once we had learned to negotiate a fair price for day trips. It is advisable to check out the other tour operators in the area before paying from any one operator We were about a ten minute walk to Playa del Carmen or a 50 pesos ride by taxi.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: DDel29
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a fabulous vacation at the Reef Playacar Resort. My husband and I have been to the resort before and have always found it to be a great get away. The value for your dollar is uncomparable. So it was the 1st thought when planning a Anniversary trip. The staff truly want you to enjoy your vacation and will do anything they can to make it wonderful. I can't understand some of the negative comments I have read. The food was great. The only people I ever heard say they were ill had a bit to much to drink in town the night before. The beach is the best on the strip and it is a mile from town. They have a fabulous repeat visitor program also. Check out their web site for info. It is not just a sales gimmick. It is true. The Reef is a small resort, so you are not just a room number amoung 2000 guests. The waiters, waitresses and bartenders remember you and what your preferences are. Sometimes a five star resort isn't about the fanciness.. just the atmoshpere and service! Can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “It's better than most think!”
Reviews.Author: TweetGavin
Reviews.Content: Just stayed here for a week. It was half the price of a previous all inclusive that we stayed at in February. It was, what it was. The food is not great. The beach and pools were amazing. We met so many great folks from all over the world. You are a $5 cab ride into Playa...where you can go and have one or two meals since you saved so much. I would go back in a heartbeat! This one is all about location, not excellence. Its fun if you make it fun and you cant beat the price! Snorkeling was also great!

Reviews.Title: “Would think about staying elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: ottawa_traveller80
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and my parents and I were disapointed from the minute we walked into the hotel. Our flight / shuttle bus had arrived late, so we were checking into the hotel at about 10pm. We hadn't eaten in hours and asked if it was possible to get food somewhere. We were told no, that dinner was over at 10pm by the man at the front desk. We later discovered that the snack bar is open until 2am. I guess it was too much trouble for him to tell us that. Upon entering our room, my girlfriend and I found that our bed had been slept in, and that the toilet had been used and not flushed / cleaned. My parents complained that their room smelt moldy. It was a very strong smell. The employee at the front desk had told us that the hotel was only at about 40% capacity. Why, then we wondered, were we getting dirty rooms? We went back to the front desk and compained about the state of our rooms. We were told that nothing would be done until the morning. In the morning, the manager didn't seem to be too concerned, even when we said that we were hoping to change hotels. He offered us a small discount on an upgraded room, or a room change, but couldn't tell us why our rooms were dirty to begin with and why we were booked into them if the hotel was less than half full. He didn't seem to apologetic or concerned. This resort seems to suffer from poor management problems. Unfotunately, some of the staff were very friendly and very good, while other employees were either rude, inattentive, or unhelpful. This overshadowed the good service we did receive from a handful of employees. Even getting bottled water from the front desk was a challenge depending on who was there. From speaking to people who stayed at other resorts on the same strip, many of them were happy with their hotels / service. In the future I would look into staying at one of those hotels instead.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointment”
Reviews.Author: madmackAlberta
Reviews.Content: this hotel is far from being a four star it just makes a three star , o yes don't for get your bug spray, basic rooms and you can not up grade not offering it at all. the snacks between meals were hotdogs and hamburgers only. any real four star offers food 2,4,7. And do not fly or buy your trip from SUNWING. AND there is NO AIRCONDITIONING in all the restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible”
Reviews.Author: Millie09Usa
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival we walked in on two employees engaging in sexual activity on our beds. We were upgraded to a room with dirty sheets, no face cloths and was refused bottled water. The food was terrible and lacked options. The beach staff was rude; we were often ignored. The walkways were very dark. I would not recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience at Reef Playacar!”
Reviews.Author: jano18
Reviews.Content: Just got back from our fourth trip to the Cancun area. This time we decided to check out Playacar, a gated community just south of Playa del Carmen that consists of twelve all-inclusive properties right on the beach. Our experience at Reef Playacar proved to be a very positive one; people were very friendly and accommodations comfortable. We enjoyed the food and service in the buffet as well as the Italian Botticelli restaurant and the Mexican restaurant. Angel, the bartender at the swim-up bar, was amazing to watch. He was able to mix margaritas and pina coladas and serve Cokes and mixed drinks and beer at incredible accuracy and speed, always knowing whose turn it was to be served. The food at the snack bar was surprisingly good. The friendly activities crew at the pool kept the kids busy with games like bingo and volleyball, and the snorkeling at the beach gave us a glimpse at the several different kinds of fish surrounding the big artificial reefs recently placed all along the properties to protect the beaches. Our first floor room was clean and comfortable, the grounds were well-kept, and we were never approached about a time-share presentation. Took one of the catamarans out for a morning sail. Very nice. We will return to The Reef Playacar.

Reviews.Title: “Just as great in 2009 as it was in 2005!”
Reviews.Author: AussieLady210
Reviews.Content: We spent a week at the Reef Playacar from August 8 through August 14, 2009, and were not disappointed! Having read many of the reviews on Trip Advisor about people getting sick at this resort, we had some concerns but were willing to take our chances and are so very glad we did. The Reef is unlike any of the other resorts (and we've stayed at quite a few) and this was our second visit. Since our visit in 2005, the resort has added an ice cream parlor set on the edge of the cenote which gives snack time an added garden charm surrounded by the sounds of falling water and the lush greenery. They have also enhanced the "patio" area that is set in the center of the jungle in the middle of the resort by adding sofas, tables and chairs -- at 5 pm they serve designer coffee with your choice of liqueur and tiny dessert nibbles -- it's absolutely charming and quite decadent in a wonderfully indulgent way. The beach is as beautiful as ever. Our room was very clean and pleasant without any of the issues mentioned by previous guests about leaking air conditioners or whatever. Our patio (ground floor) was nestled in the jungle area and we enjoyed watching the Agoutis (small animals) forage for their food. The food was nicely prepared with a reasonable amount of variety, considering that this is an all-inclusive buffet style eating arrangement. It is by no means gourmet, but if a traveler wants 5 star dining, I would suggest they pay the $400 per night at a more expensive resort to get it. The Reef's food is plentiful, varied, some of it is cooked to order, and there is something to suit everybody. We enjoyed the variety of international visitors and socialized with folks from France, Germany, Italy and the USA. The Reef has become very popular with Europeans and provides a much more cosmopolitan atmosphere than our previous visit. Because we have visited Playa Del Carmen quite a few times before and have been to Cozumel, Tulum, Coba, Chichen Itza and various other attractions, this visit we spent most of our time at the resort although we did spend a day/evening at Xcaret which was wonderful and we would highly recommend it. Considering we were able to spend a week at the Reef Playacar, including round trip air, food, alcohol and everything included for around US$700.00, we consider it fantastic value and are now planning to go at least twice a year.

Reviews.Title: “Get what you pay for....”
Reviews.Author: dnr007
Reviews.Content: The look of the hotel on approach it was definitely inviting. We walked up to the hotel at 10PM to the sound of laughter coming from the upstairs bar and a beautiful main lobby. The service from mostly everyone in the hotel was on par with what you would expect, nothing extraordinary, just doing their jobs. Be we were wowed by the pool bar bartender. He makes a mean drink and does his job with ease and friendliness. As for the food, not great, but it keep us from hunger. We did have dinner in the reservation only dining room and it was definitely better than the buffet food we had been eating all week. Overall, it was a good experience. As it isn't an upscale hotel, the wear and tear was obvious in the rooms, equipment, and some other areas of the hotel. Close proximity to 5th Ave beautiful beaches. Overall it wasn't a bad experience, but definitely not the hotel to choose if you are looking for luxury and customer service.

Reviews.Title: “Nice beachfront & atmosphere but terrible food (though none of us got sick).”
Reviews.Author: Hobbit10
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from our stay at the Reef Playacar. We were traveling as a part of a larger group of 9 with the purpose of attending a wedding at the Reef for my brother-in-law. As far as sickness is concerned, no one in our group of 9 people got sick during our stay. My husband and I did not drink the water or have have ice in my drinks; however, the rest of our group did and were just fine. One thing I would suggest is taking 2 tablets of Pepto Bismol every day for 2 weeks before your trip and then before each meal while traveling. Our group did not enjoy the food. I don't know if we were just not used to their food or if it was just subpar. Breakfast was by far the best meal with omelets made to order, french toast, and pancakes. The snack bar served hot dogs and hamburgers which weren't too awful. One night a few of us ended up ordering Domino's pizza which was one of the best meals we had all week. There are fancy Italian and Mexican dinner nights; however, you are required to make reservations for these. Reservations must be made in the lobby between 9 and 11 am. I would suggest getting there right away as there is usually a long line. We only ate at the nicer restaurant twice, and both nights were Italian night. The food here is MUCH better than the normal dinner buffet. Also, a note to guys, long pants and close-toed shoes are required when eating at the Italian & Mexican restaurants. As far as our room was concerned, it was adequate. We did have a few problems with our room (t.v. did not work, faucet leaked, shower leaked). The rooms are not very soundproof and noises seem to be magnified. Our rooms did seem to be clean though. Our airconditioner worked just fine though it did leak water onto the floor (I think all of the rooms have this problem though). The beachfront was one of the nicer ones we saw along the coast. There are some sandbags as a few others have pointed out. While they are not very pleasant to look at, they do serve a pupose and we didn't find them overly distracting to the view. The water and beach were clean and there were always plenty of chairs. The pools were clean and not too crowded most of the time; however, we were kicked out of the pools a couple of times well before they were closed. The pools were not well lit at nght and there was not much for lighting around the pools or down on the beach which made it feel uninviting. No one really seems to use the pools as night. The swim-up bar was a nice feature to to the pool area as well as the canopy beds. The greenery and natural atmosphere at the resort were beautiful. One thing we were surprised by was the lack of Americans at this resort. It seemed as though the majority of the people staying at this resort were Mexican or French. Also, we were shocked by how few of the workers actually spoke decent English. It was very hard to converse at times with the language barrier. In general, the staff was very pleasant and friendly. The staff in the lobby actually helped us order our pizza the one night. We did meet the infamous Brandon that everyone writes about. What they say is true. He will hound you the entire time you are there. Be firm with him and just say "No!". There seemed to be more than enough activities available during our stay. There is volleyball, tennis, pool tables, ping-pong, and various water activities all for free. There is typically a show every night at the Reef. Both shows we ended started well after the scheduled time. I would highly recommend attending the Mexican fiesta night as it was quite impressive and entertaining. Our family also attended the 70's night which was horrible. We should have sat in the back and made a quick exit. The shops and restaurants down on 5th Avenue in Playa Del Carmen are within walking distance of the Reef. We walked into town one evening and it was easy to find our way around. The area seemed to be quite safe for travelers. Overall, I would say that the Reef is just so-so. It is one of the more affordable resorts along the beachfront, but if you go here, don't expect super fancy rooms and good food. If you just want to relax on the beach and swim in the pools you should be just fine as long as you can put up with the food.

Reviews.Title: “Better than my expectations”
Reviews.Author: emassaayala
Reviews.Content: We took the trip after we read all the horrible reviews of other people and we were very frightened, but we had a great time. The rooms are spacious and clean, the hotel surroundings are very nice and clean. The beach clean the only bad thing is that the people that offers sea tours parks the boats on the beach and they reduce the beach area, and also it becomes uncomfortable specialy with young children. The food is not good, breakfast is good, but lunch and dinner is the same thing for all the week and is not so tasty. But on the specialty restaurants is a complete different story, they are very clean and the food is good, but they don´t have that much of allternatives. The drinking is so so.... As I read on anther comment you get what you paid for..

Reviews.Title: “As I sit in the lobby to leave. Nice place, but what everyone says is true.”
Reviews.Author: ttigger52
Reviews.Content: I am sitting in the lobby as I write this review. I, myself, became ill from the food. I can't say what the cause was but I am thinking it was the way the food was prepared. Having said that, the resort is beautiful. The beach is great. I did spend a few afternoons at the swim up bar, not bad. The other bars in the place were also ok. The staff was very friendly, for the most part. What everyone says about Brandon, believe it. He is nothing but a recruiter for the timeshare. ( Oh wait, They say it isnt a time share. It is.) He hounded us right after we checked in, and then everytime he saw us after that. Finally we gave in so he would leave us alone. He promised us things that he didnot deliver. The presentation is over 3 hours long when they said 1.5. Ok so next time I will know. The location is good and within minutes of alot of things. I like the resort but I don't think I will ever come back or reccommend it to anyone, because of the food. Sorry to say. There are other all inclusive places in the area that are within the same price range that I have heard great things of. Internet is only in the lobby, So to summarize, nice looking place, good people working here (mostly), but would reccommend you stay away. Sorry to say.

Reviews.Title: “Do believe sickness at reef club!”
Reviews.Author: Redtony62
Reviews.Content: It seems as though the reef club hasnt learned any lessons in nearly a year. In august 2008, we stayed at the hotel and become violently ill with sickness, diarrheoa and stomach cramps, which lasted for a month when we came home. Yes, a month! After reading these reviews, i am appauled that this is still going on. Upon our return, we had tests at the doctors, and it was proven that we had cryptosporidosis, a type of illness caused by contaminated water. As we never went in the pool the whole trip, we can only assume it was from the water they provided in the resort which they said was safe to drink because it was 'purified'. It is a shame, as the setting of the hotel was beautiful and all the staff in the restaurant were very friendly and pleasant. Overall, i wouldn't recommend you stayed at this hotel unless you fancy following through!

Reviews.Title: “Loved The Reef Club”
Reviews.Author: beachl0verr247
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Reef Club twice. Once in November 2004, and again in Jan 2007. I absolutely loved it. The atmousphere is gorgeous, there are beautiful flowers and vines everywhere, and our hotel room view and balcony were so beautiful. The scenery really made our pictures turn out great. There are also cute little lizards out and about every so often, but they're too fast to catch! I know a lot of people are saying the food is bad, but I didn't think so at all. The snack bar was awesome, my favorite was the guacamole, I ate it all week. :o) The pool was beautiful, no complaints at all. This isn't a huge resort, so there was only one swim up bar. There are three bars total in the whole resort I believe. One on the rooftop, and two down below by the pool. The beach was a lot different the second time we went. I guess the year before the beach really changed because of Hurricane Katrina. The first trip in 2004 the beach was HUGE! We sat in chairs with umbrellas and were served drinks, but when we went in Jan 07 the beach was gone. The sea level was so high that there was no room anymore. There was a small spot that you could still swim in, but overall there was no more beach to walk on. Maybe it's different now, because that was 2.5 years ago, it's worth looking into. Even though it's smaller, we still had an awesome time and were able to enjoy the ocean. If anything there's more room now for water activites! As far as entertainment goes, we booked a catamaran in the lobby, BEST PART OF THE WHOLE VACATION! I highly recommend doing a catamaran if you are going to carribbean. It felt like we were in a dream, and all I did the whole boat ride was think of how lucky I was to be dipping my feet in crystal clear water, and probably wouldn't be doing it again for at least a year! The group I was with also rented the wave runners the third day we were there. It was a blast, there were nine of us cruising around the perfect water. It was just amazing. The rooms themselves are alright. Nothing TOO special, but they were very clean and I didn't really have any complaints other than the poor water pressure in the shower, but that is common with Mexican resorts. We didn't spend a lot of time in our room anyway, there was too much to do all around us! One of my favorite nights was a Friday night at Senor Frogs. It was one big party and was by far our craziest night in the Riviera Maya! We stayed out all night and just had a blast. They walk around in Senor Frogs with a whistle and a bottle of some fruity tequila drink. If they stop and blow the whistle at you, you have to put your head back and they poor it in your mouth. It was hilarious. Even the older people in our group were having the time of their lives. Overall this resort is worth the money and makes for a truly beautiful vacation. I don't know anything about the recent food poisining claims, but when we stayed we didn't experience anything like that.

Reviews.Title: “YOU WILL GET SICK!!”
Reviews.Author: DocRob88
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews you will find a common theme. My wife and I stayed here for a short two day trip and never left the resort. We both became very sick the first night we got there and barely made it back home to receive medical attention. The food was horrible the sanitation was appalling. The concierge ( Brandon ) hounded you from the minute you walked in, the room ( 1023) was full of ants and bed bugs of some sort. The smell of sewage from the bathrooms and water. My advise to anyone wanted to spend time in Mexico is to truly avoid this resort. I spoke with three other couples that were staying at the resort and two of which shared dinner with us and both got food poisoning. It is not a coincidence that several people are getting food poisoning from this resort and the health department or some other sort of department should be inspecting this facility to assure someone doesn't end up seriously affected. Please all I can tell you is avoid this resort!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Sickness awaits you”
Reviews.Author: rob252525
Reviews.Content: We just returned from staying at The Reef Playacar. Where do I start, this is my 6th trip to Playa De Carmen. We arrived at the Reef with a surprise that my Wife and I have to get a room with 2 double beds instead of the king sized bed we had requested. We went to eat some dinner and the food that was left at about 8:30 pm was scary and we settled for some watered down pasta. We had a few drinks and headed to bed and the bed was so hard that we had to put our blow up water floats under the sheet to be able to sleep due to the bed being very hard. The pillows were poor as well. We woke up the next day and went to ask for some bottles of water and were told that we had to go into the shop and purchase bottled water. I couldn't believe we couldn't get bottled water at an All-Inclusive resort. I've never had this come up before. We went to the restaurant and woke up the next day sick and didn't leave the room the entire day along with the rest of our friends. Please stay away from this Resort, all of the people we had spoken to have gotten sick.

Reviews.Title: “Awfull food caused sickness”
Reviews.Author: kevkel5
Reviews.Content: The sickness going around The Reef was a real thing. A previous review mentioned that the staff blamed it on going into town. No way! Our group of 15 family members had 8 of us getting chills, throwing up, having diarrhea, and stuck in bed for a day or two during our 5 days there. None of us went into town until the last day. We went into town for a decent meal. There were several problems with the restaurants at The Reef. It started with having to wait in line for a reservation. If you weren't first or second in line then you couldn't get a reservation for a party of our size. It seems they could only seat 15-20 people per time slot. Also, they say there are 2 restaurants, but it is really one. One night it's Mexican and the next night it's Italian. Of the six items on the menu, two entrees were not available on two different nights. It got boring and that is why we went into town our last night there. The buffet also didn't have eggs one morning. We had to wait 15-20 minutes until more eggs came. The overall quality of the food was poor at best. On a positive note, the lush tropical atmosphere was beautiful and the staff was very friendly, polite and courteous.

Reviews.Title: “THE SICKNESS IS LEGIT-DONT GO PLEASE!!!!”
Reviews.Author: iluvmexDallas
Reviews.Content: Unfortunately we read these reviews after our plans were already set. Upon arriving at the resort, we used hand sanitizers before and after eating, drank bottled water, brushed with it, etc. and like all the other reviews say, our entire group of 6 became violently ill and bed-ridden after two days at the resort. It starts with stomach cramping followed by most certain vomiting and for some, diarrhea. Right now, I am back in Dallas in bed ,home from work ,writing this review on Day 3 of my illness. Some of our party were better after 24 hours, but most of us are still down with it. All of our party seemed to eat different things and drink different things so we really couldn't find anything in common that we even all ate. Another big group that we met from New York seemed to be coming down with the same thing and some of their group were already bed-ridden on our last day there. We told the management that we were sick and they simply said "did you leave the resort at all on your trip? Then that's how you got it". Even though two of the people we were with didn't leave at all. Even if you have to risk a cancellation fee and pay for another hotel, it would be worth it. The food tastes terrible by the way. I mean, how do you screw up breakfast? It just all tastes very bland with no flavor. Maybe the bacteria eats all the flavor out of the food! Pick another hotel!!!

Reviews.Title: “Reef Playacar”
Reviews.Author: beachlady61
Reviews.Content: We came back from the Reef Playacar on Friday nite. This is a nice size resort that's not crowded. The rooms are simple and clean, if you're looking for a luxury resort, this is not for you. The only really bad thing I have to say about this resort is the buffet food, I personally didn't care for it, but that's just my thoughts on it, everything was just fine,for the price. I recommend this resort.

Reviews.Title: “We had a great time, until stomach illness”
Reviews.Author: TexasTraveler58
Reviews.Content: I just want to start off by saying The Reef Playacar is the most beautiful resort I have been to. It is built within a preserved jungle, so walking through the resort you will see a natural cenote, iguanas, geckos, and cute squirrel/rabbit type animals that I can’t remember the name of. The beach is the best in the area from what I saw; it is very deep with soft white sand and crystal clear water and plenty of chairs. There was never a problem finding chairs no matter what time of day we went out there. The rooms were nice and clean, and the air conditioner worked all 8 days and the shower had decent pressure, and the bed had an egg crate pad on it so it was the softest I have slept in while in Mexico. The specialty restaurants and the ice cream parlor were excellent; the ice cream parlor was my favorite because they had a ton of choices which were all good. The buffet was what I expected and on par with the other all inclusive resorts I stayed at, the breakfast was the best but lunch and dinner were good also, but not much changed over 8 days but that is what I expected. The staff was friendly and helpful, the entertainment staff was awesome and made sure everyone enjoyed themselves, and the bar and wait staff were great, especially Hoberto at the rooftop bar. We used Best Day Travel for transportation from the airport to hotel and back, and they were great, very funny drivers, I would definitely recommend using them. The major problem we had was my wife getting extremely sick. I didn’t catch anything over the 8 days, but my wife caught something and was sick and stuck in the room about 3 days vomiting, and has just now started to feel better. All she could keep down was about 5 slices of watermelon over 3 days. It seems she, as well as a couple of other guests that we met during our stay, caught what had been going around and mentioned in previous postings. The resort seems to be on top of everything, they have hand sanitizer in all restrooms and all places that food and beverages are served but she still got sick, so who knows. I would make sure and pack some sort of antibiotic before leaving, because what she caught was bad. Another thing to watch for is Brandon, your “personal concierge.” He is nothing more than a timeshare salesman, and an annoying and rude one at that. We had not even had time to put our bags in the room after a long day of travel before he was trying to sell us club membership, but we said no right off the bat and he gave us a smug comment and whined a little bit about his “points” but he left us alone for the rest of the trip. All in all, we had a great time before my wife got sick. I would definitely return to this resort if I have read about 6-12 months of reviews with no mention of the stomach illness that has been going around at this resort.

Reviews.Title: “resort was wonderful, the grounds were very nice.”
Reviews.Author: jmandichak
Reviews.Content: we went to the reef in july of 2008 and we had a great time even though we both came down with some sort of stomach thing(won't go into details) the food was great and the service was excellent. the nightly shows were very good. the beach was fantastic. we took a tour of chichen itza which was simply awe inspiring to see one of the great wonders of the world. when we went to the ruins it was 112 degrees, there is shade around the perimitter. the drinks were also very good. there is shopping about 2miles away and the taxi was about $4 or $5. well worth it. you could walk it if you feel froggy.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant and enjoyable”
Reviews.Author: Christina2001
Reviews.Content: When we arrived for a one week stay we were promptly put back in a taxi to be sent to a (superior) sister hotel as there was a problem with our room. The sister hotel immediately upgraded us to the Royal across the road, which turned out to be an amazing experience. When we returned we were shown to an ordinary room which was a bit smelly and dark. However, the manager had promised an upgrade on our return for the inconvenience, and the following day (day 3) we were shown to one of the suites overlooking the pool and with a gorgeous view of the sea. It was much nicer, and given the chance again I would pay for the upgrade. Anyway, our experience at the Reef Playacar was a positive one. I really enjoyed the food that came with the all-inclusive package. The buffet is available for breakfast, lunch and dinner, but you can also have ice-cream in the afternoon from the parlour, and burgers and chips (for example) at lunchtime from the snackbar. For dinner there are two nice restaurants to choose from if the buffet doesn't suit: an Italian and a Mexican, though you have to get up relatively early to book them at reception on the day itself. The pool was lovely with a swim-up bar for free cocktails, and you don't have to be up ridiculously early to bagsy a lounger or a palapa. The drawback to staying at this hotel is that it is a 20 minute walk from the town centre, something I did not think I would mind, but it can be a nuisance if you want to go there a couple of times a day. There are similar hotels in town, which I would prefer to stay at in future. Overall, I would recommend this hotel to families. There are activities (like water polo) to get involved in during the day and shows at night for children. The setting is also lovely and jungly with the odd interesting bit of wildlife around. Here's some tips during your stay: 1. If you are staying here a while and thinking about visiting Xel Ha, consider setting aside 2 days if you can afford to. 2. If you want to visit any of the Mayan sites, like Tulum or Coba, do NOT use Odyssey Tours as they abandoned me at Tulum on my own without warning and without leaving me enough money to make my own way back. 3. If you like nightclubs, try and visit the Blue Parrot one night.

Reviews.Title: “A Bit of a Disappointment - Pat From Texas”
Reviews.Author: SonnyBird
Reviews.Content: The hotel was smaller and moving from room to pool or lobby was very nice. The hotel could have been better. Entertainment was cancelled throughout our stay without warning to guests. If you make reservations at one of the specialty restaurants (only one was open during our stay) be on time, we were late by a very few minutes and they would not honor our reservations and seat us even though the restaurant was empty. I think the children, well dressed and behaved, might have had something to do with it. The rooms were clean but maintenance could be improved. Air conditioning in one of the rooms did not work properly but the room was changed. Service was not good at the pool bar. The beach was nice. If this was a case of you get what you pay for I could accept the shortcomings. I have stayed in multiple hotels in Mexico and I would rate the others higher. Focus more on service and you would have a strong hotel competitor.

Reviews.Title: “Great value; the Reef is a beautiful hotel.”
Reviews.Author: soyturistas
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Reef with my girlfriend at the end of May. We were there for 1 week and had nothing bad to say about the hotel. We wanted to make sure that there was at least one good review of the hotel on here; it really does deserve it. First, the hotel is a great value for what you pay for it. The grounds are beautiful, we did not have a single bug in our room the entire week (which for the climate is pretty impressive), and the sandbags that everyone complains about do (as a few others pointed out) create a neat little reef to snorkel around at. The beach really is as beautiful as any other more expensive hotel in the area. Secondly, the food is not that bad. The buffet does have roughly the same things every day but didn't go there for food. For what you pay to stay at the Reef, if you are expecting gourmet, five-star, Ritz-Carlton type food than you are delusional. :o) We ate at the buffet daily for breakfast and lunch, at the snack bar pretty regularly, and the Italian restaurant once and did not get sick in the slightest. We also drank the water every day as well. So, yes, the food is not spectacular but it works. If you want better food, go into town. Pretty simple. The drinks, however, were a little disappointing. The margaritas and beer are all served in plastic cups unless you get a drink in the lobby bar (which was actually the best bar but it wasn't open very much). As far as bottled water, though, they do put two bottles in your room and the replenish them daily if you use them. They are ten pesos per bottle which is 80 cents USD. Otherwise, the tap water is purified and we drank it, saving the bottled water for taking with when we left the hotel. There is also an amazingly lot to do at the hotel and in the area. We did the snorkeling and the Discovery scuba course through the hotel. Both were worth the money we paid. Xavier was very friendly each time we saw him. By and large the staff was very friendly as well. There were a few staff that really exceeded our expectations after reading all the bad reviews. Antonio, Pancho, Franco, and the two girls on the entertainment staff (their names escape me) were great and really made the stay a lot more fun. The one thing I couldn't give the hotel a 5 for was the rooms though. They were clean and cozy but the beds were really hard and the pillows were not the greatest (although I guess you can order different pillows but I didn't notice that until we were getting ready to check out). For how much time you spend in the room it's not that big of a deal though.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful landscaping, beautiful beach, great food, great staff, great resort!”
Reviews.Author: Teufelhunden324
Reviews.Content: I spent 8 days at the Reef with my significant other, from May 15-23. I have only one negative thing to say, and that's Brandon, the cheesy "personal concierge" who tries to befriend you immediately after checking in, only to find out he just wants to sell you a timeshare. Just tell them "no" right off the bat, and hopefully they leave you alone. Everything was absolutely perfect. The landscaping was gorgeous; native trees, plants, animals, all within the confines of the resorts courtyards. It really gives the resort a great ambiance. The sandbags on the beach, which I saw a few reviews complaining about, serve a purpose. They were placed there after Hurricane Wilma tore up the beaches in 2005. They prevent the beaches from eroding away, and they also seem to serve as an artificial reef, attracting fish, eels, rays, etc, all of which make snorkeling much more fun. I also saw many people complain about the food in their reviews. I thought the food was great! The fish was absolutely perfect. There was fresh fruit served at every meal, as well as a variety of fresh vegetables. It's not Ryan's Steakhouse or Old Country Buffet.....the Reef serves a few different choices of quality food at each meal. If these people wanted "more variety", they should have stayed in the states and frequented Applebees or Bonanza, instead. The food is good, and there's enough variety for a normal people. The staff was extermely friendly, outgoing and a pleasure to be around. Regarding people getting sick, I can empathize with them, though I was fortunate enough to stay healthy. Personaly, I thought the Reef was taking every necessary precaution to avoid cross-contamination and the spreading of germs. Hand sanitizer was a requirement to even step foot in the restaurants, the food was served extremely hot, and the water that comes out of the tap is supposedly purified. I drank water, iced tea, and lemonade every single day, I ate their food, and I never became ill. I agree with the resort in that an outside guest brought something in, and it's just rather difficult to erradicate. I would definitely stay at the Reef again; it is an exceptional value and I had a great vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, beautiful resort, would absolutely stay again!”
Reviews.Author: sweep4metro74
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed 8 days at the Reef and we both loved it! We did not spend much time in the room, but it was very clean and comfortable. The landscaping among the buildings was beautiful! There were dozens of different plants and trees along the walk ways which really added to the ambiance of the resort. All of the employees were friendly and helpful. This was at the height of the swine flu scare and it appeared that they took every precaution to prevent illness. I saw a lot of complaints about food, but I had no issues. Breakfast was excellent! We ate lunch at the snack bar most days which was very tasty and had many choices. Dinner at the buffet was also good. The fish was amazing! Every meal had fresh fruit and veggie choices so I was able to have a balanced meal every time. We also ate dinner at the Mexican and Italian restaurants which were both exceptional. The pools were always clean and the beach was gorgeous. The sandbags actually served as a mini coral reef, attracting several different species of fish. We rented snorkel gear (free) and spent a lot of time snorkeling around them. I highly recommend the AllTourNative Mayan encounter tour to Coba. The company donates a significant portion of money to the Mayan people. We rappelled, zip-lined, canoed, hiked, ate a traditional Mayan mean and climbed the highest pyramid in the Yucatan. Plus, it was amazing to see the native people. Also, go to Cozumel, rent a scooter and drive around the island. We ate fresh caught seafood at Chen Rio and it was the BEST seafood I have ever had! Dirt-cheap and OUTSTANDING quality. The scenery in Cozumel is also beautiful, very different from Playa.

Reviews.Title: “Great trip!”
Reviews.Author: Star2197
Reviews.Content: Me and my friends stayed at the reef recently in may 09. We were in a group, we stayed in rooms 1214 and 1213. We had the greates time ever, the hotel is very ecological, i think is one of the few hotels that really care about nature and also the restaurants were good. They have an excellent beach and an excellent service. I totally recomend this hotel for other travelers.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible!! Read the recent reviews: Sickness....”
Reviews.Author: tgood25
Reviews.Content: My spouse and I planned and prepared our trip as our first trip out of the country!!! Ofcourse we were very excited with our arrival until we found out that we had a room with two seperate itty bitty beds in it!!! We specifically requested a room with one king size bed and had to wait three days to get one!!... After about the third day there we got HORRIBLY SICK!! Vomiting constantly, diarrhea, fever etc. that lasted 12 hrs!! We literally layed in bed the whole day and night running to and from the washroom. WE DID NOT DRINK THE WATER NOR DID WE EVEN BRUSH OUR TEETH WITH IT. The resort employees just said we weren't use to the water, food or environment and that is why we were getting sick..I did speak to several other people at the resort and they got sick too and said it was the FOOD. We had to cancel our excursion since we were too sick to go , atleast the staff was very accomodating in doing that. The resort was gorgeous, the jungle like feel, very clean and I felt that the staff was very friendly as well. We just happended to be there when the whole swine flu episode was present. We were suppose to be there for two weeks and got cut short from our airline a week early!!!... I was VERY UPSET TO LEAVE.. but on the other hand I WOULD NOT HAVE been able to handle their food for another week anyways!!!! THE FOOD WAS HORRIBLE.. very bland, pretty much the same thing everyday!! If there was something different to eat that day it looked like they chopped up some stuff from the day before to prepare it cause it was always the same ingredients.. the food looked like it had old mixed in with new... Overall I WOULD NEVER EVER RECOMMEND THIS RESORT TO ANYONE JUST BECAUSE OF THE FOOD.. SERIOUSLY IF YOU WANT TO BE SICK AND THROW UP FOR 12 STRAIGHT HOURS THEN GO TO THIS RESORT. UNFORTANATELY THE VIEW JUST DIDN'T CUT IT ;-(

Reviews.Title: “Management needs to be replaced”
Reviews.Author: masddspc
Reviews.Content: My husband & I, along with 6 other friends, stayed the the Reef 5/22 - 5/29. 7 out of 8 of us came down with the sickness 36 hrs into the trip. 3 of us STILL have diarrhea 9 days later. We had planned this trip for the past 6 months and it was completely ruined by the Reef. My husband never got sick but was completely paranoid he was going to. Even though we all stopped projectile vomiting within 12 hours, we were too nervous to go very far away from the resort because of the diarrhea. My husband and I spent about $80/day on gatorade & bottled water from the sundries store because we wouldn't touch anything the reef had to offer and they sure didn't offer us bottled water. Did Management care? They wouldn't even acknowledge there was a problem at their resort. They even had the nerve to blame it on us drinking too much. I had 3 drinks the day we got there and was fine the next day. It was 1 hour after dinner that most of us got sick - after eating their food. Management did sent a Dr to my friend's room the 2nd time she came down with the sickness. He and his 'translator' did the normal tests and wanted a stool sample and then prescribed cipro and 2 other things. I understood enough of spanish to hear them say 'she has what they all have, just give her antibiotics, she is leaving tomorrow anyway'. The sad thing is that this could be a fabulous resort if management would actually care about the guests. Being americans we always got served last at the 1 bar open during the day and in the buffet lines. We paid more to stay there than the locals did, why did they get preferential treatment? The last day we were there they had the buffet restuarant closed for 'maintenance'. Hopefully that means they finally found the source of the sickness and were fixing it but we have no clue since they wouldn't even admit to us there was a problem. I will be contacting their parent company if I can find out who that is (so far no luck). I will also be contacting travelocity (we booked through). I don't expect to be reimbursed for the worst vacation ever. I would love to be reimbursed for all the water and gatorade I had to purchase but I know that isn't going to happen. Please, Americans, do NOT give this resort money and definitely do not take your children there. A child with 'the sickness' would dehydrate and get MUCH sicker within a few days and I wouldn't want any child to go through what I went through down there. Trust me, spend the extra money and stay at a nicer resort. You will end up paying for it one way or another anyway!

Reviews.Title: “honeymoon!!”
Reviews.Author: Lpartin09
Reviews.Content: The Reef- The beach and the jungle was so pretty and the rooms weren't that bad!! The movie channel saved us while we were sick!!! The help was also good but when it came to the food NO WAY!!!! My husband and I were suppose to be on our honeymoon for 12 days!! We ended our trip a week early!! The reason why we did this is because we were sick from food posioning 4 out of the 7 days we were there!! Yeah SUCKSS!!! My husband ended up going to the store and getting pb and j! It really wasn't the honey moon food we thought we would be eating!! But the food at the resort was HORRIBLE and we had no other choice.Everyone we talked to had gotten sick atleast 2 to 4 times!!! When we spoke to the General Manger she denied any sickness!! Once we started feeling better we ventured out into the city 5th aveune was great! We ate at 3 great places! We had a great time at the beach we also went deep sea fishing and caught a 50 lb Mahi Mahi. If we had not gotten so sick we would have had the time of our lives!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nightmare at the Reef”
Reviews.Author: rrdehart
Reviews.Content: We have been to this resort 2x before and never had a problem. This time after checking in we were met on the walkway to our room by 2 different couples who told us that we would be sick in 2 days with vomiting and diarrhea. Lo and behold in 2 days we both became sick within an hour of each other. Management would not admit to anything wrong in their hotel and yet every one who stepped thru their doors became sick in two days. Several people had to be hospitalized including a bride on her wedding day. The mother of a bride who was planning her wedding for next year also was hospitalized. An entire wedding party of 50 were wiped out with this illness. We lost 2 full days of our vacation and never felt comfortable afterward. We were ignored by the management staff and lied to. The staff tried to tell us that we got sick from eating outside the resort, but we never did. Don't stay there until you are sure that the resort has cleaned up their act. Something is definitely wrong and needs to be rectified. It is not fair to let innocent people make reservations there.

Reviews.Title: “Ahhmaziing Vacation at the REEF Playacar in Play del Carmen”
Reviews.Author: countrygirl49612
Reviews.Content: My mother treated my sister, sister in law, daughter and myself to an awesome trip to Playa del Carmen at the Reef Playacar for mother's day. Our trip was May 8th - 13th right in the middle of the swine flu breakout. We were really hesitant about making this trip to be honest. Once we got to our hotel we were soooo impressed with the grounds, the staff, the food and especially the beach. The entertainment/activites crew were amazing and sooo friendly. What great people who made you feel like family. We miss you Tim, Pancho, Zohina, Franco and Leonardo:) After reading many reviews, people seem to either love this place or hate it. To me, I was looking for sun and fun with good people, good food , good beaches and a place to lay my head. The Reef exceeded my expectations in every area. It was clean, it was safe, and the staff was very helpful and super friendly. I can't wait to take my husband and four children back there some day. If your looking for an all inclusive stay for you or your family that is safe, comfortable and enterntaining, I highly suggest the Reef Playacar. If your are looking for peace and quiet or a place that will spoil you with service to your every need, then maybe the Reef isn't for you. In all honesty the time share people were not very nice and incredibly mean to my mother when she told them she was not interested. So sad:( Don't let them ruin an amazing stay at the Reef. If you have children, this is the place to take them......great activities for kids! Still dreaming of sandy beaches and pina coladas at the Reef.............

Reviews.Title: “Please don't stay here!”
Reviews.Author: letsgo12
Reviews.Content: My new husband and I just got back from our honeymoon to Playa Del Carmen (5/18-5/25). We stayed at Reef Playacar for the first 4 nights. On the second night I woke up very ill at 2am and was sick for about 12 hr. in bed and in the bathroom. Then, I was still nauseated for another couple of days. We had to cancel our snorkel trip to Xel Ha and the trip to Tulum on Wed. It was awful. I am pretty sure if was from eating soup at the mexican rest. It was really the only thing that I ate and my husband didn't. The front desk did send up some toast and sprite for me. But, other than that, they didn't seem to care. I asked if they thought it was H1N1 virus, she said NO. But, really, how would a front desk gal know. Also, on Thur. our water was shut off and my husband went to the front desk to inquire about changing rooms, because from the beginning our bathroom flooded everytime we took a shower. We had to sop up the water w/ all our towels after we were done. We were just going to deal with it, but after the sickness and NO WATER, we had HAD it. I was READY to go HOME. He asked if we can get a disct for the NO WATER?? they said, NO. NOT EVEN FREE Bottled water. geeze. So, he asked to change rooms (which we wanted to do anyway)..they said not until later in the afternoon (it was early morning). Also, when we first turned our shower on, brown/orange water came out for about 1 min. (now that I am thinking, I wonder if that is what made me sick?! who knows) So, eventually, we upgraded to the Riu Palace next door with the help of Juan Pablo from Lomas Travel! he was soooooo amazing and helpful. He also had been helping us book our excursions thru out the week. I highly recommend his service. So, the last 3 nights we were in the Riu. I wish we had done that in the first place, it was worth the extra money! =) I felt bad for C&N wedding party! I hope the wedding was great, we were going to try to sneak and watch it, but we were in Cozamel that day. If any of you know them, tell them Nickole and Larry said HI and good luck! =)

Reviews.Title: “Be cautious when staying at The "Ralph"”
Reviews.Author: DOOGIEKN
Reviews.Content: We visited the Reef from May 11 thru May 21 with friends (aged 50-55). The landscaping is indeed beautiful, I can't imagine the upkeep but they do a nice job keeping it so beautiful. Our rooms were nice - water pressure - good, air worked good. Our TV died at 10:30 one evening, and the maintenance crew brought us a new one right away. We met some very nice folks there, the Love's from Indiana, Randi, Barry and friends from Denver, and the group from Medina. Everyone at one time or another seemed to be sick during their stay - some worse then others. The food was more than just bad - barely edible at times. By days 4 or 5, I would have killed for a Bob Evans or Cracker Barrel - just something to eat! Of course, I didn't starve but avoided the buffett completely the last few days of our 11 day stay. We ate at 5th Ave a few times, but I realize now...I don't really care for authentic Mexican food. I will just eat my US Tex Mex, thank you. ** Note to management at the Reef - A smile goes a long way. If you staff would just smile now and then - I think guests would feel more welcome. Antonio (pool area) and Paulino (buffet waiter) are rays of sunshine on the Reef staff - they are both such happy guys you can't help but enjoy their company. The rest of your staff could learn from them. The first weekend we were there, all of a sudden the resort was packed with people - because they opened up for locals to come on in! For $100.00 they got 2 nights, late check out, all the amenities of the resort including a massage, manicure and pedicure. How many of you got such a deal in your packages? I really didn't mind other than the fact that service went from bad to worse. Americans were not waited on until you were the only ones left standing....if you were in line with locals - you were completely ignored. The beach - BEAUTIFUL, pools were nice. If you can - be sure and take a jet ski out on that beautiful crystal clear water. Make sure you go out on a sunny day - it makes all the difference on the water. We took a taxi to Akumal and spent an entire day there - the cab driver took us straight to the beach. $30.00 each way. We snorkeled with the turtles and it was the highlight of our trip, we are so glad we went. If you like to snorkel, Go to Akumal!! My only regret is that we didn't go back a second time before we left. We did have a good time in Mexico (hard not to have a blast - it's vacation!), but I would not go back to The Reef. I agree with other travelers - spend a little more $$ and enjoy the whole resort - not just parts of it. If you do eat at the resort - be careful, and take plenty of Imodium Advanced - you will need it. I feel bad for the community there - they are all hurting - DO go to Mexico - don't let the Swine Flu stop you.....it is non existent. However, you may want to consider other resort options.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful location, what a shame.....”
Reviews.Author: mihofamily
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Reef for a quick get a way! Well, I have been back in the States 2 days now and I still have whatever "virus/bacteria" I contracted at the hotel. We spent at least 24 hours out of our trip vomitting profusely along with diareah, stil have diareah and had to take a sick day from work. Come to find out that most of the hotel got sick as well. However, the worst part of all is that the hotel did not acknowledge the problem and has taken no responsibility for the illness. Keep in mind that at this point we have only eaten and had drinks at the hotel only! In regards to: Rooms-beds were way too hard. I understand upgrade to better room but give me a break if I need to upgrade and pay more for a descent bed! No details to cleanliness, corners were dirty. Staff- not too friendly, I think mostly embarassed by lack of management interest in guests and the actual outbreak as they had to play it off. Food- Defenitely BELOW average, and getting reservations to one of the other restaurants was like winning the lottery, never happened, we were always too late. Location- Fantastic! Beach was the most beautiful. Spa Services- Spectacular! Should the food quality and options improve, the staff become friendlier, the rooms cleaner and beds softer, I would return.... until then do not plan to return or recommend to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “DON'T GO TO THIS PLACE!!!”
Reviews.Author: mypersonalalternat
Reviews.Content: Went there for a destination wedding, everyone who attended (about 50) guests got very ill within two days of arriving. The hotel sourroundings are beautiful but that's about it, this place is terrible. The hotel denied anything going around until some of us, even guests not associated with this weddng went down to inform management as a group we all got sick, then they called in some doctor and swabbew certian rooms. Even aside from this incident, the food, sanitation, and food service conditions are just awful....SATY AWAY!!!

Reviews.Title: “Warning do not enter!!!”
Reviews.Author: NicoleFae
Reviews.Content: I spend Memorial day weekend (may 22-25th 2009) at the Reef resort with my fiance, mother and uncle. We were hoping for a relaxing vacation and to check out the resort for our destination wedding next year. We were hugely disappointing after the bad service and the fact that we spent 1 night in the hospital and 1 night in our rooms sick. The resort is beautiful, the weather was great, and we had a blast sun bathing and playing in the ocean for 1 day. By 2pm on the 2nd day of our vacation I was uncontrollably vomiting and had a serious case of what I can only describe as butt soup. At 5pm my mother followed with the same symptoms, her condition was worse then myself as she had a surgery a few years ago that does not allow her to throw up. Should she, her stomach would rupture and could be fatal. She was hospitalized and I too as I was very dehydrated. After being rushed to the Cancun Hospitan by ambulance and spending $4000 in medical expenses, my fiance and uncle returned to their rooms to spend the night switching from face to butt on the toilet. They did not go to the hospital because we did not have any more money to put down as a down payment. (In Mexico, insurances are usually accepted, but they do not even call the insurance providers. In stead they make you put down a deposit of -in our case $4000/each- before they would help us. My mother was lucky to have 1. the best credit a person could have 2. worked at a bank for 17 years and asked a friend to go into the bank at midnight and up her credit limit to $15,000. I suggest that anyone going out of the country contact their insurance company and make them aware that you are leaving the country and bring a credit card with a $6000/person limit for emergencies.) To this date, the resort is denying any fault of their own in this situation. They are asking for paper work from the doctors to say that the illness is the result of the resort. During the time that I spent at the resort a wedding party of 50+ people had all gotten sick, all the other couples we met too were sick and the wedding on the Monday that I left, the bride got back from the hospital 1 hour before her ceremony. If this isn't the result of the hotel, I don't know what is. The resort told me that we had brought this illness into the resort, but while we were there, we were only at the resort before we got sick and the 1st wedding party got sick before we ever showed up. If you read on to other reviews, you will find that the illness has been dated back to March. Clearly the resort is not taking precautionary measures.

Reviews.Title: “This is the letter I wrote to the hotel manager...”
Reviews.Author: 1978thetrav
Reviews.Content: Dear Gladis Perez, My recent stay (5/21/2009-5/24/2009) was the worst experience I have had at any resort or hotel anywhere in the world. I travel frequently in Mexico, Central America, South America, Europe, Asia and the United States, and have never experienced such appalling food, service and accommodations. I have done my research and am well aware that you know that there is a gastrointestinal virus that has been infecting a great majority of your guests.I was told by your staff that doctors and scientists have been trying to identify what is causing the illness. I was visiting for a friends wedding with a group of 44 people, all of whom were violently ill for most of the stay. Some of these people were elderly and young children with immune systems that can not support such an illness. Myself and my girlfriend were up all night vomiting profusely with horrific diarrhea and still do not feel normal two days after departing Mexico and returning to the USA. I am a professional chef and a restaurant owner in California, and I am highly educated in food safety, sanitation and preparation. The food served in the main dining hall, the snack bar and at the wedding was the worst quality I have ever seen in any establishment in the world. Serving the same re-heated meat for breakfast that was sitting out the night before at the end of dinner is a major health violation. Rancid cheese on the cold buffet line is unacceptable as well. The air conditioner in our room was barely functioning and dripping water all over the floor. I discovered this as I slipped on my way to the restroom to vomit from the illness that your staff is ignoring. Also, an expensive cell phone was left in our room and is nowhere to be found. The front desk and housekeeping staff were no help in locating the $250 phone. I hope that you take my concerns seriously as this is a matter that should not be overlooked.

Reviews.Title: “Be sue 2 get mexican health insurance b 4 u stay here!”
Reviews.Author: SHOWROOM605
Reviews.Content: We went to The Reef at Play del Carmen to check out "THE REEF" for a my nieces wedding next year. First day was nice although the food was not so great, service was not so great (only 1 person @ each station whom had to place the desired food items on your plate personally while not speaking any english). Rooms were very nice and clean, pool and ocean were beautiful! The first day all we heard about on the grounds was how all the guests were becoming very ill on the 2nd day of your stay. This was very unsettling news after hearing about the swine flu on all the news channels. Then sure enough on the 2nd day my sister and niece were rushed to the hospital with explosive diareah and projectile vomiting. The hospital in Playa del Carmen was great but they do not accept American health insurance in Mexico and wont see you until your credit card authorizes $2,000.00 up front for each person being treated. We had heard from the other sick guests that the hotel was gracious enough to cover all medical expenses but when we asked they said no because we were not with the large wedding party group. After sending off my sister and niece in the ambulance to the second hospital (after charging an additional $8,000.00 to our credit card) I ran to the bathroom and sure enough started s_ _ tting my brains out! Then spent the next 36 hours in bed throwing up and had non stop diareah. We also called for the hotel doctor to come to our room and they pretended to not have any doctors on staff... pretended to not speak english or just did not give a hoot! Hotel Drs finally came after 5 calls and brought us the meds the hospital ordered to help us get well enough to travel back home to the states. The blood work and stool samples from the hospital say it was a "virus" and we never left the hotel grounds or ate any food other than the food & drink offered @ the Reef Hotel (do the math). Once we were able to get out of bed and go back out on the hotel grounds we learned that 48 of the 50 guests in the wedding party all came down with these flu like symptoms as well as the 4 family members in our party. God only knows how many other hotel guests became ill during their stay @ the Reef Playa del Carmen. All in all it was a trip from HELL! Please spend the extra money and stay @ a 4 or 5 star hotel in the same area.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Good Overall”
Reviews.Author: likeafoxx
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Reef from May 20-24th. We're a young couple and love getting away, and the Reef turned out to be a great spot for it. The resort is inside "Playacar" which is a private area. The good thing about that is that the security does a really good job of tracking who comes in and out and which Taxi drivers are taking you where, which made us feel comfortable. The 5th avenue shops are about a 10-15 min walk away, but we later realized we should have rented bikes or a scooter. There is also a small shopping area just a couple of minutes from the hotel. As for the hotel itself, the grounds are gorgeous. We really loved being surrounded by greenery rather than cement and marble. The beds were a little hard, but the rooms were fairly spacious and the bathrooms were nice. The beach is perfect, the water was warm, and there were plenty of chairs and umbrellas for lounging. Come to think of it, we had a lot of space to ourselves, which may have been because so many travelers canceled their vacations due to the swine fu-which we were also worried about. We saw no signs of swine flu, but there was a 1-2 day bug going around where we each had some stomach issues and even a fever for a night. The hotel was looking into it, but we were not offered any compensation for losing a night due to being sick. Some said it may have been the food, but who knows. As for the food, it was good. The buffet was often the same kinds of food, but good quality and variety for the most part. The two resturaunts that need reservations were great, just remember to pack a pair of slacks to wear if you plan to eat there. The staff was nothing but friendly, especially Tim who was an intern working there and was very welcoming. The entertainment staff was fun and had great energy. Note: when you arrive, if you are approached by a "concierge" person, feel free to walk away and say "no." Overall, we had a great time. Assuming we don't hear any bad news about what that bug was, we'll be back for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Dont eat or drink here”
Reviews.Author: kris10515
Reviews.Content: We were staying at a home in Playacar with access to the Reef's beach, we bought the wrist bands our first day and ate and drank on the beach most of the day...there were 11 of us in total and the sickness began about 3 am. by the end of our trip all but 2 were extremely sick. I have never felt so sick in my life I was bed ridden for an entire day of my trip and unable to eat anything for 2 days. I first got sick Saturday morning and I still do not feel well today, Tuesday. This place ruined our 5 day vacation, wouldnt advise eating or drinking anything at this resort. However Antonio was great :)

Reviews.Title: “Never will I go back-please read if you are planning to go”
Reviews.Author: goody2213
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went to The Reef for my brothers wedding. There were about 60 of us that went for this celebration. Of the 60 that went down for the wedding 58 of us got sick and I mean like death bed sick. For those that got down there earlier in the week there sickness came earlier which was nice because they didn't miss the wedding. All of our side of the family got there on Thursday and Friday and we were entirely wiped out on the wedding night. The best man (my other brother, myself my mom and dad) were all sick and missed the wedding. In addition to our party, many other guests were sick. The doctor was called several times. The hotel did not recognize the problem and denied that anything is wrong. My husband and I don't drink and therefore we know the sickness is not caused by alcohol consumption. We drank bottled water and brought our own food and we still got sick. It is very unfortunate that the resort did not inform guests that this was going around. We returned last night and I went to the hospital this morning with heart complications due to the illness and I am only 25 years old. My husband and I have vowed to not ever go back to Mexico. As another review said-Hawaii looks incredible.

Reviews.Title: “Reef Club Playacar for the day”
Reviews.Author: stlmom30
Reviews.Content: I just returned from 4 wonderful days at the Reef Club in Playa. To be clear, my friends and I stayed at her condo nearby, so only visited the Reef Club during the day. For $40 US you can hang out at the hotel from 8 am to 6 pm, enjoy the beach and pools, and all food/drinks included. Really, a great deal. (I'm not sure this is advertised, but if you're staying in Playa, just ask at the front desk.) I thought the place was fantastic. Gorgeous beach, friendly staff, two pools including one with a bar. They have a man-made reef with sand walls (?) that protect the beach from the waves...gentle water there. The drinks were strong and tasty. Even the food was good. I'm really not sure what people are referring to when they complain of unsanitary conditions or poor food. Maybe it was that we travelled in the middle of the swine flu epidemic (!), but purrell was required to enter the restuarants, and the buffett was not self-service, I assumed to avoid lots of people touching the same utensils. I gave the rooms 3 stars because my friend has stayed at this hotel before and told us the rooms are small...but how much time do you spend in your room? Overall, I thought this place was great, and if I return to Playa Del Carmen without my friend, I will definitely stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Happy With Everything....but,”
Reviews.Author: McDaddy46
Reviews.Content: We arrived on May 12th and left on May 15th. Me and my wife had a GREAT time. The only complaint would be the Time Share assault. They do not take no for an answer. They reeled us in, and we were suppose to have breakfast with them on the 13th, but when they called me in my room I told them I knew what it was all about, and was not interested. They kept on, but I insisted AGAIN that I was not intersted. Enough of that. This Resort has taken a lot of flack lately because of the stoumach flu that hit it in April. Enough is enough. We had a great time. We did upgrade to a better room, which I would recommened( softer bed, plasma TV, large shower, FREE SAFE, etc). The grounds were beautiful, the drinks were strong(rum & cokes are GREAT). The service was supurb(Louis at the front desk took care of all our needs)The food was good. Only complaint in that department was the variety of selections. The breakfast was the best. Each morning you had your choice of omlettes made however you want them. One day we had pancakes and bacon,etc. The ocean was beatiful. No complaints. We saw those little rodent looking animals, but they do not swarm the area like other guest have said. We did not see one until our second day. Also took some pictures of the Iguanas that live in the area. This is Mexico. This is there habitat!!!! Have fun

Reviews.Title: “100% you'll find something better than this resort!!!!”
Reviews.Author: MostHonestTraveller
Reviews.Content: It's a nice resort, but unsanitary. You'll notice that utensils and glasses are not so clean. I think that's why most of us got sick. The sand on the beach was clean however the water was rough and not safe for kids. Diving was lousy. It's better to go snorkling somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing we did'nt get what we paid for....”
Reviews.Author: SaltwaterColorado
Reviews.Content: The resort is beautiful but the rest was awful. We were there for 7 nights starting on the 29th of April and ending the 6th of May. The first thing is the concierge.... as they like to call themselves. Not so much they are there to sell you "Vacation Club". Say "NO" and they will try again and again making it so you don't want to go into the lobby for fear of getting ambushed while trying to enjoy your vacation. The resort was having some real problems with people getting sick. Fortunately my Husband and I were able to maintain our Health up to the last day. Then hold on we were both sick. The resort was at 30% occpancy therefore they had closed one bar, merged the Mexican and Itailian resturant and sent alot of there staff home. This meant we did not get what we paid for. We ate the same food for 7 days straight. There was not much of a selection available. The snack bar was out of most of there extensive menu. You could however have Hamburgers, Hotdogs, fries, meican pizza and chips. 5 things from a listed menu of about 20 items. The Buffet had breakfast which was fine but lunch and dinner everyday served Chicken, Steak, or Pasta then you could choose from 6 sides. That was it. Far cry from what is advertised. This was my 5th trip to Playa del Carmen my 2nd and last trip to this resort. the ice cream parlor served ice cream they had 4 flavors to choose from but a menu that listed 15 items. 11 items unavailable because they were not stocking due to the number of guests that had canceled. Not at all the current guests fault but again not what we paid for.

Reviews.Title: “If you get a good deal it is worth it!!!”
Reviews.Author: strablizky
Reviews.Content: We travelled to the Reef from April 24- May1. We really enjoyed our stay. The resort itself was beautiful- A lush jungle environment with a beautiful beach- Some days there were very strong waves and other days very mild- The pool areas were small but nice- There was a great kiddie pool that was about 1.5 feet- Don't be fooled by your "personal" concierge- It is simply a timeshare/vacation club- Avoid the concierge or simply be firm and say "No thanks!!". There was an airborne virus going around when we arrived 3 out of the 4 of us were sick for about 12 hours- pretty mild and it passed quickly-It had nothing to do with the cleanliness or the foiod a tthe resort. The resort was very clean and they were taking precautions such as hand sanitizer everywhere and having only 1 person serving- No self serve- The Italian Ala carte was good-we never made it to the Mexican- I found the food overall to be edible but nothing special and the same things day after day- We were glad they had the snack bar- My husband enjoyed the burgers- I liked the quesadillas with salsa and guac as well as the pizza. The snack bar was quite disorganized but we had fun with it and laughed with the cooks throughout our week- Antonio was the best as well as the female cook (I never knew her name but she was a riot!!!) The drinks were good- I liked the miami vice (1/2 pina colada 1/2 strawberry daquiri) and the frozen Baileys (not the name brand but it was still delicious!) . The rooms were adequate- Clean - no stocked fridge- very firm beds and small- The big weakness to the reort was the food!!
