If they could somehow change the food the resort would have great and we would definiteyl return however I would rather stay at non-all inclusive and eat at McD's everyday- It was kind of annoying to not be able to serve yourself and as a result you got a lot more food than if you would have dished it out yourself- There was always basic grilled chicken and good marinated steak- It would have been great to have a better selection of salads at dinner- Breakfast was quite good - Crepes, pancakes,french toast, cooked to order eggs, smoothies, as well as fresh fruit, yogurt . cereal, and some mexican specialties- When we were at the resort we ate at the snackbar for lunch and visited the ice cream parlor daily- Dinner was the real disappointment- There were cute little critters called agoutis running around-Everday we looked for them- The staff at the resort were all very friendly and helpful- We got a great deal going to the reef and feel we got our moneys worth- We paid $581 per person including flight from Boston and taxes and insurance for 3 adults and one 4 yr old- We loved the area - We did a trip to Hidden Worlds which was FANTASTIC as well as a day trip to Akumal wher ewe did some sonrlkeling and got to swim with a sea turtle. The transportation is so easy- Taxis and Collectivos are readily available and cheap- We were limited on funds so we ate at the resort for all but two lunches- I would say that the food is the biggest weakness for the resort and if they would just make some changes with the food it would be a fabulous small resort!!! I would also recommend they change the mattresses (they were very hard) and stock the fridges in the room and not charge for the bottled water in the room-

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Landscaping, Layout, and Location but Food was a noticeable week spot”
Reviews.Author: mexico2000
Reviews.Content: We loved everything about this resort except the food. Great beach. Our room looked over the inside garden with the cenote and the jungle like view. The air conditioner worked too well that we had to keep turning it off. We had plenty of hot water with all four of us showering. The 2 pools were great and just steps away from the beach that allowed us to switch back and forth throughout the day. There was always a chair in the shade or in the sun both on the beach and by the pool. The number of staff was noticeably less then at other resorts we have been at but I like getting up and getting my own drink when I am lounging by the pool or on the beach. We walked several times into Playa Del Carmen and that was just great and a couple times we took a taxi back for 50 pesos when the kids were tired. There were people from every nation here - all kinds of languages. The kids that went to the kids club seemed to develop a real attachment to the entertainment staff - my kids just wanted to hang with each other this time around. The size, location, and beauty of the resort and price point was the best we've gone to in the area and this is our 4th visit to this area in Mexico. There were a couple "stars" in the staff particularly Antonio who was always smiling and friendly and his job seems just to pick up the dirty dishes around the pool area... not a concierge or bartender or even a waiter.. we noticed that others around the pool area had befriended him and he got people smiling and laughing.... The one point that put a bit of a damper on the stay there was the food. Let me preface this by saying that our family is not a bunch of "foodies" - we eat because we need to live and as long as we have a healthy edible choice we eat all kinds of cooking. We went into this trip knowing about the so-so food comments and the claims of food poisoning... the price was so good to stay here and we weren't going to mexico for the food...so this would help keep our diets on track. To sum up, breakfast and lunch were ok. with acceptable options and quality. The snack bar food was below so-so and not worth the calories (except for the french fries). Dinner was way below so-so to the point where I stopped eating it and had a little lettuce, tomato, and cumcumbers with dressing... Even the fish was "gummy"/"chewy" not light and flaky. Everything was way over cooked which might be a reaction to the food poisoning reports. In the end this all helped my waistline as well as my husbands... but my point is to let you know that even the pasta wasn't good because something was up with the sauce - my daughter we LOVES pasta wouldn't eat it. There were virtually no vegetables and so many meat dishes which if you are having meat every meal with no veggies you will soon find that you don't feel so great and get sick. So what I am praying for is that the resort rethinks its menu options and changes the chef or something because if this resort improves its food, increases selection, and stays at the same price point..we'd actually go and stay there again... but not until I see more positive reviews on the food. NOTE: we ate in Playa Del Carmen at a couple of restaurants and they were pricey and not so great either so my opinion is that you have to have a decent food spread at your resort or rent a house and cook for yourself. Please note that we stayed for 10 nights and it was about the 5th night that we really started to not enjoy eating dinner at the buffet - we didn't try the speciality restaurants because we didn't feel like using our time to make reservations and so if you are going to this resort for less time you probably will be just fine with the food. Also, this resort had tons of precautions in place to avoid illness like hand santizer before walking into any eating or food area and by the bars, etc as well as they did all the serving in the buffet. We did catch the stomach bug that was going around at the very end but it was after we ate in Playa Del Carmen that we got sick for a few hours so I don't think there was food poisoning involved...just a stomach bug that can happen anywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Second Time There”
Reviews.Author: MrHirp
Reviews.Content: My wife and I visited the Reef Playacar from April 29- May 4th, it was our second stay. Our first, last year for our wedding, was definately the better expeirence. The first 2 days were great, and we didn't see any signs of anyone being sick. The new measures for sanitation, including hand sanitizer and guests no longer being able to serve themselves, seem to be working. The staff, although not always fluent in English, are much more understanding than Americans, who often seem to get offended when someone doesn't speak our language. Just saying.. Antonio is amazing to watch in action. He works his butt off, never stops smiling and engaging guests. Friday night, however, my wife became ill. She had to be admitted to the hospital aroundt he corner (the doctors are great there, really nice guys, nurses as well) It was turned out to be food poisoning. She was there 12 hours, and when we got back to the hotel, I became sick. I had some of her chicken, which we believe is what caused us both to get sick as well as the delay between. The hotel was great about helping. They arranged for transportation to the hospital, and are covering our costs. They also let us stay an extra night free, since we had to reschedule our flight back . Sales manager, Marja Hoogendijk, was a joy to deal with. She called and checked on us, and her concern was always sincere. Truth be told, they didn't have to do as much as they did. They easily could have claimed it was just a bug or something we brought with us, or picked up from another guest. Times are hard down there, and I'm not sure if we'd go running back, as there's obviously some sort of issue. But eventually, we'll definately go back.

Reviews.Title: “Hygiene - needs to be improved!”
Reviews.Author: ragCanada
Reviews.Content: The resort, like the ad says, “Lush gardens provide a tropical canopy, offering a cool shaded jungle-like privacy…..”, was quite impressive considering most resorts feel like concrete jungles. This was the best thing for me; I loved the trees and the constant “noise” of the birds. A concern with this resort is that they obviously have a hygiene issue as more than half the guests in the hotel got sick; we called it the 12 hour bug as most people were down that long at least. When we arrived the servers were already wearing gloves, we thought, amazing, they are taking precautions and are hygienic. Obviously not! By the time we left, they were getting more cautious with how the food was being handled by everyone including guests to help stop the spread of the disease. We saw the cleaning lady use the same cloth towel clean the toilet bowl and then the counter and sink in the bathroom. After further research, we find out that this specific resort has had a hygiene problem for quite some time. As for service, we have been to Cuba and Jamaica and have experienced much happier staff and that did not expect any tips and were very grateful when given. Only a few of the staff at the Reef Playacar had a ready smile on their face. A few never smiled even if treated very well. Overall we had a good time but could have been much better without all the vomiting and diarrhea going around. We were just happy to come home not having contracted the H1N1 Flu. I can't recommend this hotel because of the Hygiene problem...until they resolve it and don't get consistent good reviews for a few years, I don't see ourselves returning.

Reviews.Title: “This was fricken' sweet.”
Reviews.Author: apfbf09
Reviews.Content: True, we did get sick and throw up, I almost died of dehydration because of it but the stay was worth it, it only lasted a half a day anyway. The food wasn't great but that just means you should go to Senor Frogs in town because they're great and they dance with you if you're a pretty girl. Actually, there is lots of dancing at the Reef Playacar! Especially with Franco and Pancho who are dancing queens to say the least. There are fun shows every night, Pancho dressed up as an indian for 70's night and that I don't really understand. Another fun employee is Antonio who cleans up around the pools. He is just a big bundle of joy. "Its good to be alive, because when you're alive you can dream. How are you going to dream when you're dead?" just a bit of Antonio's words of wisdom, he also makes great faces. They play great music from their little rock speakers along the paths, I was happily suprised to hear Crystal Castles coming from them. The jungle atmosphere was really nice, sometimes I really thought I had gotten lost in the middle of the rainforest and was going to get eaten by a jaguar. But then I came across the ice cream shed and was like "Oh yeah, I'm at the Reef Playacar and they serve free ice cream" and I'd get some. They have these cute little rat/rabbit things I don't really know how to explain them. They just hop around happily eating nuts. The beach is gorgeous but it has these rocks that I thought would be fun to walk on but I just slipped and fell in :( But the body surfing is great and the sand is nice and soft just like sand should be. I was not allowed to swim in the pool at night though and it was embarassing being kicked out since I was in a dress (it was a spontaneous swimming idea), and you aren't allowed on the beach at night either which is disappointing but you could be up watching Pancho and Franco and the other staff members performing for you on stage up at the bar. The rooms were just fine, I loved the balcony and saying goodnight to people as they headed back to their rooms for the night. The Reef Playacar is very much fun if you don't get caught up in the health risks which is hard not to, but who cares there is a bar in the pool and free ice cream and attractive males dancing around on stage, go to the Reef you'll like it.

Reviews.Title: “Don't ever skimp on a vacation - pay for quality elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: sinisterkitty
Reviews.Content: They say first impression is a lasting impression. This was my first time in Mexico and I stayed at the Reef with my boyfriend. The experience doesn't make me feel like I want to come back to Mexico again. The jungle ambiance is kind of nice and fun, but the roaming tailess rodent family which lives on the grounds and is as big as a large rabbit is disgusting and I think indigenous to this resort. No one knows what it is nor have I seen it anywhere else. The staff must be breeding this animal in one of the vacant huts and must think its cute to have it roaming freely freakin out the guests, but its not cute. The service is inconsisent without explanation. Procedures for reservations and other services changed daily. This was very annoying and unsettling, I never felt the staff knew what was going on or even had the courtesy to explain things. The restaurants opened late on several occassions during our stay - so it just didn't feel reliable. I didn't like that the food had to be served and there was only one person behind the counter in the restaurants attending to the hundreds of people there. That meant longer than necessary waits for food or even to obtain a plate,it had to be given to you. This was unlike any other resort I've been in that normally have self serving buffets. The serving staff that didnt understand english would not say they don't understand. They would take your order, shake their head and your order would not come. The food was the same every single day, with maybe one new item but the service frustrated me to just eat a minimum and get out. The food staff just never seemed prepared when they were supposed to be, so a small crowd would develop waiting to be served. The beach was nice, the sand barges were a bit of an eye sore but it's ok. I didn't like having to be pitched to all the time by the staff for excursions, services, activities etc - the sales pressure turned me off and made me feel like I didnt want to be friendly with the staff to not trigger a slaes pitch. I also lost my phone and it was not returned, so this didn't leave a great impression of the guests or staff. People will be people however so it's all good. Best Day travel that handled our transport and excursions was wonderful. I do wish the resort would have made an attempt to inform us about the Swine Flu outbreak and the precautions they were taking but it was not mentioned anywhere. All food entrances did however make sure everyone disinfected their hands with hand sanitizers. It wasnt until our second to last day there that we heard ofthe flu. We saw some folks around town with masks on. One last thing, if you are looking for a romantic vacation with your partner, maybe go someplace that is adult only. There are lots of kids here and we were stuck with neighbors whose kid cried like clockwork every single day. The walls were paper thin. I tried using theroom phone after losing my cell and it was frustrating because I had to give my credit card info, the operator kept coming on the line after I already put in my info and they'd ask for it again and my calls rarely went thru. Im sure I was charged. No room service, rooms are dimly lit and the water smelled like sanitation. We got the stomach churn and bathroom runs after 4 days. All in all, I would not recommend this to couples or anyone but if you are a large family on a budget Its better than no vacation at all, but know that you get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: “Had a good time, but yeah we were also sick”
Reviews.Author: livinVegas
Reviews.Content: We spent 10 days from 4/14 thru 4/23 at the Reef with family including small children. At some point during the trip all 9 of us were sick with the stomach virus which was lasted about 24 hours. Its a drag to get sick and even a bigger drag to get it during vacation, but such are the perils of travel. I feel that the Reef would have possibly been a little more forward with what was going on, but they hardly ignored the problem. We had bottled water brought to our rooms on several occasions gratis as well as supplying water and medications gratis at front desk. Guests were forced to use the hand sanitizer upon entering the buffet. Buffet was no longer self serve, the employees would serve you. I personally witnessed pool water samples collected by an outside testing agency. Getting sick sucks, but we could have caught the bug from staff, the lady who sneezed & then touched 6 donuts before taking one, or from the guys at the pool bar who drank way to much and long & never left to use the bathroom. Needless to say, I would give them consideration. The location was great, short walk or $5 cab to shopping downtown. Plenty of chairs at beach and pool. Only resort that we saw that had shade (beach umbrellas) on beach. The older teens kept busy with beach volley ball, table tennis, and billards. Very helpful at marina, plenty of kayaks & catamarans. We were reminded more than once by staff to take advantage of all the equipment that was included w/all inclusive. Buffet was ok, always something for everybody. Snack bar food was good-esp nachos & ribs. Mexican & Italian rest. also good, although when we all dined together as a large party of 9, some food was cold. Some very nice wines avaliable to purchase with meals. Not the place for nightlife/spring break. To some up, a nice affordable family resort. Feel free to contact [---]

Reviews.Title: “Got Sick? Still Sick?”
Reviews.Author: bluiistami
Reviews.Content: I thought the setting was nice. The weather was awesome. Too bad we didn't get to enjoy it. When we first got there we were exhausted, our plane was eight hours late. It was the middle of the night when I realized there was sand it our bed. The sheets hadn't been changed. GROSSSS! I went to take a shower in the morning and found that the shampoo was half used. Another nice touch! There were eight people in our group. We all got violently sick within two days. When we asked the front desk about it they told me they had heard about three other people being sick. Sometimes they would suddenly forget how to speak english. When we talked with other people at the resort they all got the same illness or at least 90% of them. Some people needed to be hospitalized. Some guests started getting bottled water in their rooms and some guests didn't. They gave us some then took them back. The bed was hard the pillows were harder. The staff soon started to disappear. They would have one person working in the snack bar after the third day we were there. The buffet had less and less food and not much change in the menu. The tables weren't cleaned after people ate. They just set out new silverware and glasses. I felt from the beginning the sickness was from the food. Not all the bars and restaurants were open at all times. There were two restraurants you had to make reservations for. You were only supposed to eat there one time. We did eat at the Italian restaurant were unable to ever eat at the Mexican Grill. This is not all inclusive. They had a bar in the lobby but they didn't really want you to have more than one drink there. Apparently it was just there for looks. The AC in the lobby broke the first day we were they and it never was fixed while we were there. Everyone there seemed to want some of your hard earned money. The timeshare people were very high pressure and wouldn't leave you alone. They were like talking to very bad used car salesmen. We planned two excursions and were too sick to go on them. If you plan an excursion or anything you better write down the name of the person you dealt with because none of the other staff will help you. They wanted a doctor's note for me to get my money back. I finally did get money back, but I had to talk directly to the person who took my reservations. This was truly the worst vacation I have ever been on.

Reviews.Title: “Great bang for the buck.”
Reviews.Author: 3Stokers
Reviews.Content: I just returned yesterday from the trip to the Reef Playacar. Like many, I was worried after many rough reviews of the place. My wife and I took our first "big" trip with our 3 year old son and were very pleased. See the very end of this review for our "travel history." We were greeted at the Airport by Best Day travel. After making our way through the gauntlet of porters wanting to help, we found our rep. Waited about 15 minutes to get in the shuttle to take us to Playa del Carmen. About 1 hour ride, after dropping other passengers off. Arrived at hotel, greeted with a beer and margarita, sprite for our son. Checked in, spoke with Arica (our "personal concierge for the week," who we never saw again) and checked into our room. The room: Our room had two double beds, a balcony, large bathroom, plenty of closet and drawer space as well. The air conditioner worked very well and quickly, often too cold for my wife and son. The room was very clean and maintained well with everything we needed. We were one towel short the first day and within 10 minutes of calling, we had it. There is a small fridge, which was very nice to keep things cold. You can pay $50 for the week to keep it stocked. The Resort: We liked the size of the resort. We often saw the same people from day to day, especially hanging around the kiddie pool. Other folks we met from Oregon, Ireland, Canada were all very down to earth and friendly. There was no air of pretentiousness as we had experienced at the much more expensive Iberostars. If anything, I would say the clientele are mostly American, working class folks who enjoyed time away. There are some really neat jungle-like areas that we didn't spend a ton of time around. There are two real pool areas - the kid's pool connects to a more adult-oriented pool (with a swim up bar), the other has a lot of activity. The beach front is very nice. It was the only resort on that particular stretch that had umbrellas on the beach - many had them far back from the beach. The sandbags appeared to be down the coastline - we thought they'd be annoying, but you get used to them. It's amazing how much they help with the waves. We found the resort to be clean - and the things that were untidy were the fault of poor guest stewardship - that would be cleaned up by the next morning. If you see cigarette butts, garbage, etc, on the beach, it's not the fault of the staff. The service: We found the service to be good. Try a little, basic spanish and you'll always get a smile and what you're looking for. Drinks were actually a little strong for our taste, but there was always plenty. We waited a few times for drinks to be filled at meal times - which doesn't happen at other resorts. The food: It was adequate. We didn't go hungry and enjoyed most of what we ate, but there is not a ton of variety. If that is your primary reason for traveling, don't go here. You'll be disappointed. There was enough to satisfy a 3 year old (without having chicken nuggets on the menu!!), and we were ok with that was there. We did not eat at either of the two reservation restaurants. They do require slacks for men and closed toe shoes from what I read/heard. Etc: While we were there, many guests came down with a 12 hour bug. My wife and son included. It was unfortunate, but we heard many guests at many resorts caught it. I really don't think it was the food, the water, but poor hygiene of some guests that passed it on. After the sickness, food was served to us instead of "help yourself" at the buffet. We were also given free bottles of water for the duration. Overall: This hotel/resort is great for the budget-conscious traveler. The location, just a short cab ride or 15 minute walk to Playa del Carmen is very nice. The beach was as nice as any other, if not cleaner (less seaweed, etc) than most. We would definitely consider going back here again if we visited that area again. Best-Day tours / Expedia Booking through Expedia was a breeze. I have booked through many companies and found this to be as clear as any other. Best Day Tours worked well for us - and I never felt pressured to do any excursions, etc., with them. They present the info. We did have one hitch with them - our return shuttle left without us!!! After calling from the lobby phone, we were told to take a cab and deal with Expedia when we got home. Apparently, our shuttle driver was there at 10:10 and left at 10:20, knowing the bell captain was going to get our bags! I called Expedia this morning and have a $100 voucher from them, again, satisfying my experience with them. If you're working with Best Day, make sure that they are clear and you are ready early, I guess! It all worked out for us just fine. Our travel history: Iberostar All Inclusives, Playa del Carmen, Punta Cana Norwegian Cruise Hawaii (Waikiki and Maui) Orlando / Disney Cross-Country travel European travel... We do not look for lots of bells and whistles- we appreciate them, but do not need them.

Reviews.Title: “awful”
Reviews.Author: cooper82
Reviews.Content: We arrived to The Reef on April 22nd. When we got there, more than half of our friends were sick. I got sick on the day before I left with vomiting and diarrhea and wasted an entire day. I would have to say at least 90% of the people at the resort were sick. Some people had to be hospitalized and one person went into diabetic shock. The Reef should have warned us that this "virus" was going around when we arrived. they need to close their doors because it is NOT going away.

Reviews.Title: “nice little charming resort”
Reviews.Author: travelissylvie
Reviews.Content: We were a group of 6 in the range of 39 to 67, all from Halifax, Nova Scotia, staying at the Reef Playacar for 2 weeks, from April 5 to April 19. This is my 10th all inclusive hotel. I’ve stayed in resorts ranked from 3 to 5 stars, in locations such as Jamaica, Dominican Republic, Cuba and Mexico. We found this hotel very charming in it’s jungle like setting. This hotel is located in a gated community where condos and seasonal villas are found. So essentially you are in a gated hotel within a gated community. Very safe. We avoid larger resorts as we find them more impersonal. We liked the close proximity to Playa del Carmen (10-15 min walk). The Reef was a perfect size, very easy to meet people, the staff was super friendly. A simple greeting and a tip goes along way to getting great and friendly service. Funny thing happens when you’re friendly with people, they are usually friendly back! We tip at home and get less service, why wouldn’t you do it here?? Property, Beach and Pool: We loved the layout of the resort. Both pools were always clean. Workers are always around cleaning the property and fixing stuff. It’s some of the guests that are inconsiderate & dirty.. we found dirty diapers by the poolside.. come on! Are people that lazy they can’t find a garbage can? Most mornings we walked to Playa or went off the property. After our return we never had a problem rounding up 6 loungers by either poolside or the beach. The bars were very nearby with no waiting time for drinks. We did have one of the nicest beaches; I didn’t find it full of litter. You won’t need water socks here as it’s white sand, no rocks to hurt your feet. Some of the hotels along the way had no beach at all. Restaurants & Bars: Jesus at the beach bar, Victor, Felix & Alejandro at the swim up bar, and Pablo in the lobby bar were the best! We ate at the Italian restaurant once and it was good. Angelica at the buffet restaurant really took care of us. Our table of 6 and our 5 cervezas and 1 cola were always ready when she saw us coming for lunch. Hats off to the others too, Yoni, Gladis, Estelle and Nikko who cracked us up. The buffet had a great breakfast. Sure, the buffet gets tiresome after a few days, but that’s true in every hotel I’ve been to. The food was ok. My advice is to be careful eating the meat. They have trouble cooking the meat and fish all the way through. Take the smaller pieces, they have a tendency to be well done than the bigger pieces or just ask them to re-cook it. Rooms: We stayed in Bldg. 1 and 3 for the first week. After our return from Cozumel we were in Bldgs. 4 & 5. I’m not quite sure what some of the reviews are complaining about. Ours, both times, were very clean, spacious and not dated at all. It’s typical of what you’d find at a 3.5 to 4 star in any of the Caribbean countries. Our first room had a loud AC unit. My boyfriend fixed that with electrical tape he brought with him. Some comments on here gripe about the fee for a safe. Every All Inclusive I’ve been to has charged for a hotel safe. It’s not unusual. My note of caution though is to be careful of getting a bill for water you did not drink! Report it to the reception desk as soon as it happens. It happened to us twice. I think a worker helped themselves to the water. I think this because my watch also went missing when this happened. Hence the importance of the safe!! Excursions: There is so much to do in the Mayan and this area is so rich in culture and history. We took trips to Chichen Itza, Ek Balam, and Tulum ruins. We also went to Xcaret for the night show. Previously I’ve been to Xel Ha, lots of fun. We walked to Playa several times and shopped at the Walmart, Mega and the Maya Centro mall. The hotel offered a 2 night stay to the El Cozumeleno on Cozumel because they were overbooked. We had intended to go there for a snorkelling trip, so it was great to have our ferry fee and accommodations taken care of. The El Cozumeleno is a nice hotel, well laid out. The beach is like an aquarium. You can walk into the water and see beautiful yellow fish. If you snorkel further along the pier there, you can see clown fish and in the middle, halfway to the buoys you’ll spot a statue. The hotel service on the other hand sucked! The food was not good. We were served wine in plastic juice glasses! And the first night we were there, they had a beach party, cut out all the lights and we had to eat in the dark. Not only that, they ran out of glasses at the bar after the show and we couldn’t get drinks!!! It’s also the first hotel I’ve been to where the alcohol was measure when they made the drinks! The rooms were nice, not really different than what you’d find at the Reef. They did not have fridges. The pools were filthy. Any time you looked in the pool you could see an oily film. Even first thing in the morning when you would normally find a pool pristine! I would never go back to the El Cozumeleno but would definitely go back to the Reef Playacar. Return home: None of us got sick during our stay. What made us sick was the food served by Air Transat on the flight back to Halifax. 2 people out of our group ate the dinner served and were violently ill the next day. The others, who didn’t eat, didn’t get sick. Please contact me if you have any questions.

Reviews.Title: “Family trip from Hell”
Reviews.Author: Nashville5
Reviews.Content: We are still suffering the affects from staying at the Reef for one week. All of my family is on medication for a type of bacterial poisining perhaps e-coli from either the food or the unsafe handling of water or food by this resort. We loved the look of it when we arrived and were excited to be able to spend a week there. There are five of us in our family. Every one of us started experiencing vomiting and diarrhea after the 3rd day. My youngest lost 10 pds. by the end of the week. The resort at first denied any problem with illness on the resort until finally one night we were so sick that they sent us up a doctor who wrote us a prescription. We had to find ourselves transportation at midnight and find an all hours drug store to fill it. It did help stop the symptoms but did not treat the problem. We found out that everyone else who was staying there as well were sick. When we returned home our doctor prescribed proper medication to help us fight the effects of the poisioning and told us to stay home for 4 days and away from other people for fear of spreading infection ourselves. What a mess!!!!! The food was horrible in the buffet even if we wanted to eat anything. We were terribly dissapointed. We are now looking into getting some kind of compensation. Stay Away!!!!! If you look back at other reviews in 2008 you will see that this has happened before at this hotel.... wish I had known!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Sickness and bad sanitation get top remarks at the Reef Resort”
Reviews.Author: jojox1
Reviews.Content: I went to the Reef with 3 of my girlfriends for a getaway. The only good at the Reef was Luis...the front desk clerk, who had his hands full the whole week because there was an outbreak of Ecoli , or a "virus". Because of poor sanitary conditions and bad management of the outbreak, it spread quickly to 5 other resorts down Playacar. Luis accomodated our every request...made us reservations at the a' la cart restaurants, because we were too scared to eat at the "barffet", gave us water, etc when we were throwing up. Next good...the grounds were beautiful. If only they put the same effort into training the kitchen/ buffet staff on how to wash their hands or how to sanitize a table for the next patron. 95% of the resort was ill. Some were hospitilized on IV drips! Needless to say we ended up eating out after this and ordering pizza as did a lot of other people. The hotel night life was awful, unless you paid for it??! There were extra charges for theme nights that would never have been charged at any other all-inclusive resort!! They should have been throwing extras at everyone, not charging us! Do yourself a favour...STAY AWAY FROM THE REEF! We are seeking Compensation!

Reviews.Title: “We actually liked the place!”
Reviews.Author: Kahti
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went to this hotel for a week in mid-September 2008. When we returned home we read reviews about people becoming ill (mostly during August) and also being disappointed in the hotel for various reasons. When we arrived, of course we took note of the gloves worn in the dining areas and we'd never before been asked to use hand sanitizer at a restaurant, but it wasn't until coming back home that we learned why. My husband has a cast-iron stomach but I'm sensitive to everything--however, I never once felt sick from the food or even the water (some reviewers have questioned the water in terms of drinkability and bathing). Our shower was fine, the room didn't smell musty at all, and we had absolutely no complaints about the cleanliness. My only complaint was that the wireless connection (unfortunately, I had some work to do) was hit-and-miss. Sometimes we could get a connection from our room and other times we needed to go a small computer room off the lobby; the connection worked just fine in that room and I'd recommend asking about it, because for the first several days that I needed an internet connection we were only advised to try connecting at one of the open tables in the lobby area--I wish we'd been told about the other room right away. True, the food was limited, but I was happy with fresh fish every night (and to-order pancakes in the morning), and the chef sometimes made it for me even when we arrived at the restaurant toward closing time. The beach was gorgeous and we also enjoyed the pools--the pools were very clean when we were there. Though not as fancy as the resort we'd stayed at the previous year, nothing makes me happier than being able to get a dry beach towel all day long; the previous year our five-star resort didn't supply towels outside and only renewed them in the room and only every other day, so we had to live with damp towels. My husband and I love the water and it's hard to find much energy to go into town other than to do a couple evenings of walking about to enjoy the sights and sounds in the streets and look for special crafts (check out La Sirena for these--the wrestler paintings are especially great) . If you're not there for spring-break-like drinking and partying and are happy with a modest meal after a long day of being out at the beach (including snorkeling around the man-made reef right off the beach--good variety of fish and crabs and even an anemone or two--and a few games of volleyball starting at about 4 PM), you'll not be disappointed in this resort. By the way, we arrived in the same shuttle as another Bay Area couple, and with kids, who'd been to the resort several times over the years. They liked it for its friendliness and coziness. We saw them often and they never mentioned a thing about any of them feeling sick or otherwise being disappointed in any changes they'd taken note of since their last trip. I'm giving the Reef high marks in this review. Not really in comparison to more expensive and fancier places I've been to, but for how it is, in itself, a nice place for those who aren't seeking the ultimate partying or pampering (though that's available) vacation experience but want something a little more down-to-earth.

Reviews.Title: “!!!!Reprehensible!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: hasher
Reviews.Content: To begin, this was our second (2) experience with the Reef. The first was in 2005. Very enjoyable. Basic food, but friendly and helpful staff. We had a good time and were pleased with our trip. It seemed obvious to return to a place we were familiar with for our five year anniversary trip. Bad option. Terrible option. I made a terrible lapse in judgment! I requested a room for my wife and I to have a king sized bed; approximately two (2) weeks in advance. (did not happen) So, to start our 5 year anniversary trip, we got two small double beds. The next day, we were able to convince the staff after pleading, to change rooms. But, the room we got did not have an operating AC unit! Therefore, after several trips to the front desk, we were told that the only available room was located in the back of the facility, with construction, and right next to the service entrance with buses, delivery trucks, and more. Great!!! FOOD: food was passable at best. Breakfast was sometimes OK. Most of the food was poor. Sickness: I would say roughly 85% of the occupants contracted diarrhea and/or vomitting. My wife was sick for 5 of our 7 days. No help from the manager Raphael(sp) or any of the staff.!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! No way would I go back to this place that is unhelpful and maintains such poor management. More to come soon! Ralph Hageman [--]

Reviews.Title: “Mixed Feelings”
Reviews.Author: jimbits
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to this side of Mexico. The sea was warm and blue but rough.(Somebody actually drowned on the 13th at the resort) The grounds are absolutely beautiful with lush grounds and nice setting. Two very nice pools with one being a swim up bar (yay!) Service for drinks was go get your own and wait which was a little disappointing. The bar by the snack bar was faster than any other place. Nice beach and lots of chairs to sit in. The food at this resort was absolutely disgusting. The buffet for two days was okay but it soon got tiresome. We ate at El Alux and it was awesome. We were in a group of about 30 people. Of the 18 that came back to B.C., 16 became very sick with vomiting and the runs. (Thank God I was one of the two to escape this but three in my family got it). I would like to try a fancier resort next time. If they improved the food and bar service I would go back but until then, no thanks. By the way go to Coco Bongos for the most fun you'll ever have anywhere.

Reviews.Title: “don't eat the food!!”
Reviews.Author: collegegirlandboy
Reviews.Content: This resort was very impressive from first glance- offered nice clean rooms with balcony, jacuzzi; 3 bars, 2 pools, 2 restaurants and a buffet; very cheap! My boyfriend and I had never been at an all inclusive resort so we were thrilled about getting all the drinks and food you wanted and not have to leave the resort grounds! The big downside was their food- we were unimpressed with the buffet the first night- slimy stinky fish, pasta salads, and dry bread to mention some of the things. I stood in line 20 minutes to make a reservation at one of the two restaurants and it was great! tasty and way better than the buffet..that is until about 12 am when I couldn't stop vomiting and diarrhea! The Reef's food is terrible and preparation methods unsafe- my boyfriend and I both got sick on different days with food poisoning and it seemed to be the talk of the resort that others were experiencing the same thing. i don't know how many people I talked to that were up the night before with diarrhea and vomiting the entire night and feeling very ill the day after (aka not able to do anything but sit in the room near a toilet and wish you could go play). I think I counted about 50 that I talked to alone. I called the front desk and the man assured me it wasn't from the food and that he hadn't received any other complaints and would I like him to call a doctor? Only to find out 3 people went to the hospital with similar symptoms that night! Not impressed....I feel like we wasted 2 days of a 5 day trip!! I really wanted to give a good review- I thought the place was beautiful and I was so looking forward to having a good time, but I would NOT recommend vacationing here unless you want to waste your vacation days on a toilet.

Reviews.Title: “First Time and The Last Time”
Reviews.Author: Foreveryoung1967
Reviews.Content: I was told to say at a 4 Star Resort or better because they take care of you....this resort looks to be a 4 star but its only worth 3 at the best! don't get me wrong as its very well laid out ..private grounds but you can hear every noise made threw the thin walls and doors... the review of the hotel said the water was filtered but once you climb in the shower the smell of the water was horrible... I went to the pool after because of the chlorine it got rid of the smell on my body....the buffet was good as they cook everything in front of you and I would recommend eating at the buffet as I ate at the Italian ala carte and ended up in the hospital for a few days. was told that the bacteria in the food over come me...booked a 7 day trip and enjoyed only 3 days what a waste of money, but I will say this!!...the hospital was beautiful, clean and the people although didn't speak much English with the exception of the doctor was very nice... take the hospital bed out of the rooms and you would have a 5 Star Resort not bad for a hospital...(well done to the hospital staff thanks you ) You would of thought the hotel would of said sorry and invited us back as a way of saying sorry but all I got was ignored! sorry I wont be coming back and if I was you save your money and go to Hawaii !!!

Reviews.Title: “Great smaller hotel setting”
Reviews.Author: lovincerveza
Reviews.Content: My 3 friends and I stayed here in the begining of March, 2009. We had a great time, the hotel staff are amazing I must mention Pablo at the lobby bar he was great, and Antonio was another great staff to have there always made you laugh and feel comfortable there. The resort is such a short distance away from Play del carmen, you could walk but its only a 5.00 cab ride to. The food was ok nothing amazing, but I wasn't running to the bathroom at all!! As for people saying theres a musty smell in the rooms, hello its mexico very humid si thats why there would be a musty smell. The beach was amazing, very well kept, very nice resort small and a comfortable setting.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this Resort !!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Relax12
Reviews.Content: My Husband and I stayed at the Reef Playacar 3/10 thru 3/16 we loved the size of the property and the jungle like feel of the whole resort . The staff was very friendly and helpful! The rooms were ok, but comfortable and clean! The food at the buffet was ok and you could always find something to eat that you liked. The snack bar which was close to the pool and the beach had other options if you didnt like the buffet! The beach was AWESOME!!!!! Very clear water and no trash on the beach. You could always find a chair ! This was our second time to the Riviera Maya last year we stayed at a 5 star resort with over 900 rooms and golf carts everywhere ! yuck!! If you are looking for a very small, romantic, relaxing, quiet, tropical vacation this is the resort for you!!! We plan to return to this resort again with our children next year!!!!!!! I LOVED THIS RESORT!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “My trip was amazing...such a beautiful place”
Reviews.Author: afuller35
Reviews.Content: The weather was amazing as well as the waters and sands….I definitely want to go back sooner than later!! I really like the beach here at this location. The staff at Lomas Travel was wonderful and I really appreciated their friendly and helpful attitudes. I had a beautiful view of the garden off my balcony that was truly amazing. The food was pretty good but the restaurants were really tasty however you have to make reservations right at 9am or you won't be able to get in. In fact, it is best to get there around 10 minutes of 9am. I visited Xel-ha, Xcarret and Maroma. These were all excursions recommended to us by Lomas Travel. I really liked the two water parks and the snorkeling at Maroma was okay but the water was really rough. In fact, that is the roughest I have ever seen the waters. I don’t remember it being like that 7 years ago in Cancun. The water parks were really great and had lots of activities. My sister and husband as well as my daughter loved everything about this trip and I know they will all want to go again.

Reviews.Title: “Small but Cozy”
Reviews.Author: Dtigger216
Reviews.Content: The reef was perfect for my husband and who don't enjoy the big crowd. We a room on the third floor that was a hike after a long day but the room was inviting. The staff was very helpful. We had no trouble with crowds. It seems that our last day was the day all the spring breakers showed up. The food was boring but the snack bar was a welcomed treat. We also tried both resturants which require reservations before 9 am. The food was wonderful. I would recommend trying a tour that includes Xel-Ha a little pricey but well worth it. The town is about a 20 min walk in one direction and a cute shopping plaza was about 7 mins in the other. The beach was the cleanest one along the strip.

Reviews.Title: “the reef you get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: blueandy1601
Reviews.Content: my boyfriend and i stayed at the reef for one week march 21 to the 28th. the grounds were beautiful, the food was just ok - i have had better. the rooms were average - the beds were extremely hard !!! make sure when you check in that you ask for the pillow toppers for the bed - foam bed toppers. we did not realize they existed until the third day when we saw a maid changing someones bed. does not cost you anything and makes the bed a little more comfortable. the front dest staff was great, cant say the same for the resturant staff. we always tip even if we are on an alli nclusive and there was times that we thought the service was so bad that we didnt leave anything. the hotel must have been over sold a couple of days since they offered a free trip to cozumel for 2 nights stay at the wyndham cozumel. we decided to go give cozumel a try and it was a waste of time. the hotel was terrible - we had a much better time at the reef. we went to took a cab to akumal for the day and went snorkeling (cost us $25 us each way) but well worth it! crystal clear blue warm water - i saw a sea turtle which was very exciting and a bunch of fish. we also went to coba and tulum in one day - tons of walking make sure you bring a hat and drink lots of water. we decided we were going to do coba on the cheap the going rate for the bus tour per person was $89 us. we had originally planned to cab it into playa del carmen and take the bus (the cab costs $5us to playa del carmen) then it was going to be another 7 pesos to take the bus to cabo via tulum- the last bus from playa del carmen to tulum is 9:00 or 9:30 and the bus leaves around 3:30pm from coba. just ask at the front desk and they will give the bus schedule. getting into the cab - the driver asked where we were going and we said to the bus station to catch a bus to coba. he shocked us by offering to drive us by cab to coba and tulum for $80us there and back. we thought we had nothing to lose the cab driver waited 2 hours for us at coba and another hour while we toured tulum - let me tell you how nice it was just to get into our air conditioned cab and go home when we tirede - totally worth the money we spent - the price to get into coba i think was 15 pesos each and about the same for tulum. we didnt pay the cabbie and he didnt ask for any payment until we got back to our hotel. wewould definitely stay here again if the price was right. but i think next time we would probably stay in akumal were the snorkeling is the best and the water is warmer

Reviews.Title: “Don't waste your money”
Reviews.Author: markiswhere
Reviews.Content: I was not impressed, other than Antonio I think everyone else could care less if you died in the lobby. The lot size is maybe 300'X 1000' and block walls on both sides, nice. McDonalds changes there menu more often than this place and the buffet and is small and often cool. WHAT no BACON for breakfast? Nope and sausage maybe 4 days no scrambled eggs unless you wanted to stand in line for someone to make them and it's quicker to walk up town to get coffee than have someone bring it. The snack shack had better food than the buffet. The place is old, just look at how many coats of paint dripped on the doorknobs, the walls between the rooms were built by ether kleenex or bounty, not sure but you get my drift. And thanks to the happy couple in room 412, I hope you solve your problems and you might want to work them out when it's DAYLIGHT. And if all this isn't enought to keep you away do not buy any packages in the resort, especially from FISH, we get home to find our credit card numbers had been stolen. I waited to write this review so the resort could answer our email about the cards and they have done nothing, just as we expected so my advise to you stay as far away from there as you can. May I suggest a quite little 68 VW beatle in town sitting on blocks. P.S. Excarete (spelling?) is a ripoff, we bought the all inclusive package at $130.00 and got one meal and two water tickets for an all day deal. It's now buyer beware and ask a lot of questions, don't get the answer you like do not assume they will take care of you, THEY WON'T!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Miss represented by ads.”
Reviews.Author: rbmaine
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a "resort" in a jungle setting with "critters" called agouti running around everywhere, (which look like rats without tails), want a beach that is use as an ashtray and trash bin, enjoy the fumes of jet skies and the excitement of them running right up on to the beach with total disregard of the people on the beach, this is your place. If you like a small space to swim in, pools that lots of guests felt it was OK to put naked children in with everyone else, go and have fun. If you go and feel the need to address any of the above situations, save your breath. Unless you have signed up for a "tour "(really a time share talk) or want to take tours from the hotel, that are overpriced, it will fall on deaf ears and not be addressed at all. Even the pillows in the rooms that are advertised at bedside as "fluffy and soft" were as hard as a rock, probably to match the beds. YIKES! Food was the same everyday and cold most of the time. Two restaurants were however very good upstairs that reservations were needed to enjoy. Italian was the best. The "all inclusive" really isn't. Don't drink the water provided in the rooms. It costs extra. The safe in the room, extra, fined for bringing equipment or towels back late. The "resort" in short, did not deserve the name "resort". Don't waste your time or money.

Reviews.Title: “We'll be back!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Kathy052
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Reef from 3/13 thru 3/19 and had a wonderful time. We went with another couple who had been there before. We found the staff to be friendly, efficient and easy to deal with. The grounds are well maintained, very tropical and very clean. Our room, although facing the next hotel, was clean and more than adequate (how much time do you really spend in the room?) You did have to pay for the bottled water in your room but no one twisted our arm to do so. We were not hit up by any time share people and did not feel pestered by anyone trying to sell us excursions, etc. A simple "no, thank you" was sufficient. The bartenders did a great job considering there was only one at each bar and they did not appear to stop serving people at all during their long shifts. They will make your drink any way you want. They deserve tips!!!!!! The buffet did get a little old after about the third day but there was always fresh fruit, salad and a good selection of meats. You won't go hungry. Lots of beach chairs. Don't expect to sleep until 11:00 a.m. and find a prime chair. Entertainment staff was very upbeat and accommodating and great dancers!!! (despite the long hours they work). They have a fun 70s show. Wish I had taken more pictures. We used the bikes one day to ride into Playa del Carmen (5 min. bike ride) and only a $5.00 cab ride for 4 people. Took the ferry to Cozumel for the day. Great time. Rented a car and drove around the island. We had plenty of fun and relaxation. Just what we wanted and anticipated. Not a 5 star but within our budget and I can't wait to go back again next year!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Anywhere But Here”
Reviews.Author: CatMac7
Reviews.Content: Been visiting Mexico since the '80s but always closer to Cancun (hotel zone). Wanted to try the Riveria Maya - but made the mistake of picking the Reef Plyacar. Oh my God....What a waste of money. It's the first hotel on the strip, very small, filthy beach littered with ciagarette butts and guest trash. we actaully sneaked down to other beaches to swim. We had cock roaches in our room, incredibly noisy at night - all night, God forbid if you aren't a smoker! Cleaning staff and spa staff are wonderful but concierge is a joke. beware of the sales pitches and lack of professional follow-through with regard to complaints. don't drink the bottled water in the rooms - they charge you. Also it's not really ALL INCLUSIVE so make sure you asked before you assume anything. $2/per day to rent the lock for the room safe. Would NEVER go back again. Even tried to book a room at the RIU next door because the experience was so bad at the Reef. Pick another hotel. It's real creepy at the Reef and the worst Mexican vacation I ever had. I felt like my vacation started when the plane left. Ick!!

Reviews.Title: “Barely worth the bargain price...”
Reviews.Author: barndog123
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here from 3/10 to 3/16, and except for the beautiful grounds (their grounds staff is great), and the beach (which they have little control over), it was entirely and utterly forgettable. We knew going in that it was not a luxury resort, at $1200 USD for two people/six nights, but it barely lived up the to mediocrity promised. I'll start with the negatives: The staff is utterly unresponsive or caring. The front desk takes a minimum of 3 requests to get what you asked for (maybe we were trying to hard not to be THOSE Americans), the all-inclusive actually isn't. I'm not so sure you can claim to be all-inclusive when you charge extra for such luxury items as Malibu rum, or cheesy beach entertainment with food that was only edible. Drink service on the beach was, despite assurances to the contrary, nearly non-existent. On multiple days the server came around promptly at 11am, and despite a 50 peso tip from us and various tips from others, he did not return for the next 6 hours. Do not be assured that the room you requested will be the one you are assigned, we booked a king, but received a room with two doubles. To their credit, we were moved the next morning, though we heard similar stories from others. Despite the move to a larger bed, I think the floor may have actually been softer, I was thankful to get home so I could get a full night's sleep without tossing and turning. They were doing some construction in the service alley behind the rooms' buildings. Not bad in and of itself, except the workers would start between 4-6 am with tools, hammering, etc., NOT cool when on vacation. The food was edible, that's the best I can say. The breakfasts were usually good, the lunches were saved only by the pasta bar, and save your time by avoiding the two "reservations-only" restaurants. The buffet was passable for dinner. The other two restaurants actually lied on the menus about their food. An example: My wife's romaine lettuce salad with grapefruit and orange slices drizzled with a light citrus dressing turned out to be anemic iceberg lettuce with grapefruit rind and doused with a frenchy kind of dressing. They argued with you when you notified them that the lettuce was not what the menu said. Either they were ignorant, or thought we were stupid. We don't expect to be pampered. At all. I just wish that the all-inclusive was truly that, and that the service was more prompt and friendly. The positives: Antonio at the pool area (he collects empty plates and cups) was the only employee I recommend tipping. Especially as he will occasionally go above his duties and go get a drink for you in the unserviced pool area. He is friendly, funny, and what all employees at other resorts we've been to were like. The reef should give him a raise and use him as an example for every other employee. The pasta bar at lunch is very good and I recommend it (avoid the rest, though). The grounds are absolutely gorgeous and you will feel like you're in the jungle with all the Agouti, Iguanas, and Geckos running around. The beach was wonderful! It is as turquoise as the pictures promise. It is warm, relatively calm, and the sand is some of the softest I have been on. For the price, this wasn't terrible, but it didn't really live up to even the mediocre reviews we read before booking. Proud and solid regular I could have handled, but consumer promised regular and resort promised luxury made what we got seem all the worse. If you don't need pampering and spoiling and just want a beautiful beach to dip your toes into (as long as you book without the all-inclusive), this resort should work for you. If you want friendly, prompt service, great food soft beds, responsive friendly staff and a truly all-inclusive experience stay as far away as possible. The price was right, but there was definitely no value.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Beach ever, awesome staff, great food”
Reviews.Author: June28
Reviews.Content: I loved the Reef Playacar, this was by far the 2nd most beautiful beach I've ever seen! This resort was always very clean, the staff was always ready for you and very charming! The rooms were good, didn't have problem except for I thought it came with a stocked fridge, but it doesn't it so bring bottles of water. The buffet food I thought was actually pretty good. Their omlets were awesome and the rice-yummy! The 2 reastaraunts were just ok. I recommend the Riveria Mayan drink (with the Pina Colada on top) at the pool bar, it's the best drink ever! Your going to have so much fun, my husband and my friends did!!

Reviews.Title: “Small but nice!”
Reviews.Author: TTTC
Reviews.Content: We just got back from staying at The Reef. I had read a lot of the reviews after booking our trip. I was a little worried about the food ordeal that happened last summer I think it was? The food isn't great but is ediable. Make sure to go to the buffet at a busy time to ensure it will be "hot". I didn't have any expectations so... I would say that the hotel overall is nice. The resort is kind small comapred to the Riu that is next door. We had not booked a room with a king size bed but asked for one when we checked in and got one right by the pool! The rooms smell like any other room I have been in, in Mexico. The pool wasn't over crowded. There were still chairs and cabanas left at like 9am. There isn't any music that gets played by the pool which is kind of a bummer. Althought there was a group who had brought down an iPod docking station one day and that was great! It was also a family friendly resort. lots of families with kids. The upstairs bar is the place to be after 11pm!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and Laid Back”
Reviews.Author: fatso57
Reviews.Content: This hotel was the perfect place to get away from it all, the lush gardens that the property sits on make you feel as if you are even farther away than u are. Very laid back atmosphere, no pushy people on the resort itself. The staff was extremely courteous and helpful in anyway we needed them to be. The entertainment was a lil cheesy but they knew it was which made it fun, entertainment staff is top notch, lots of fun always around to have a drink with you or chat. Beach was gorgeous, water was a lil rough but still was able to go in, never a problem finding a spot on the beach or pool area. Very close to playa del carmen downtown area, which was nice for shopping and a little culture. I recommend going into town to book tours as we got a great deal on a tulum and xel-ha package (AMAZING TOUR!!!!). Drinks and food are always plentiful and available, fantastic mojitos. The only downside to this amazing trip was the food at the resort, if you are going here to enjoy top notch food, you need to book elsewhere. the buffet is palatable at best, the snack bar has no order to it and is very bland and greasy. The italian restaurant is borderline inedible! we didnt finish are food and got up and left......very very gross. all in all the perfect vacation (we werent there for the food we were there for the atmosphere the beach and the drinks). dont listen to the people knocking this resort, they obviously did little research. this is not a luxury resort it is a quiet villa style outdoor style resort.

Reviews.Title: “Would definately stay there again”
Reviews.Author: andreak02
Reviews.Content: We just stayed at The Reef Playacar the last week of Feb 2009. This is a smaller resort which in my opinion makes it really nice. There were visitors from America, Sweden, Germany, Canada and Italy. Young kids, seniors, married couples, life partners, teens, all had a good time. We are a married couple in our forties. We are the outdoorsy type. Police officer and Pet Sitter. We usually stay on Cozumel but we wanted to get away from the crowded Cruise ship scene. We had a wonderful time and here is our review...scale is from 1-10 with 10 the best: STAFF: 10 Probably the friendliest you wil find. I think that the staff really appreciates it if you at least attempt to speak Spanish. This will surely bring a smile to you and everyone else. Say gracias or no gracias when asked if you would like more cafe or vino blanco (white wine). more basic spanish greetings at YouTube http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=FU4uvsKlMr4 Entertainment staff offers yoga, spanish lessons and water aerobics. FOOD/ DRINKS: 8 The buffet food was good and fresh. Victoria makes the best omelettes. By day 4 we were ready to venture out and eat a couple of dinners out on 5th Avenue, but we always ate breakfast at the buffet. Food was good, hot or cold as required. At the juice bar you can have them make you your own designer drink. Bar drinks were a little watered down, that is normal in an all inclusive no matter where you stay, just tip a little and they will make them stronger. Check out the ice cream stand near the lobby. ROOMS: 7.5 Rooms are older but comfortable and clean. Cold A/C, HBO, Tile floors,nice balcony, fairly large bathroom with good water pressure . Lots of closet space. Water is purified. They do charge for the bottled water, so go down to the little store and get your bottled water for 1/4 of the room bottle price. Little refridgerater in room. These rooms are bungalow style. We particularly like the semi rustic feel. You will not find the fancy schmancy shiny marble walls and floors here. We did see 1 waterbug. POOL AREA: 10 Giving it a 10 because the pools were very clean, plenty of loungers for all, and several neat Egyptian beds. Swim up bar, nearby snack bar and another drink bar. Hot tub is not hot, but who cares when the weather is warm! BEACH: 10+ Totally the prettiest I have seen. NO rocks, soft powder white sand. hammocks, plenty of loungers for all, volley ball other activities. We walked down the beach and the other resorts' beaches were dirty. The Reef Playacar reef was gorgeous and clean. GROUNDS: 10+ NATURAL. This resort has at least 2 natural cenotes. The center area is lush with jungle like setting. Large deck for gathering and watching wildlife. You will cross paths with several agouti, large squirrel like creatures without tails and a few large iguanas and small black lizards. The birds will sing for you in the morning, just open the balcony door! Flowers as big as your hand. Beauty at every turn. See pics AREA: 9 You can just walk to town. Lots to buy and eat. We ate at Sushi Itto sushi bar in town. Delicious and fun to watch them prepare your meal. There is a small coffee shop at the ferry station. The ferry cost us 22us for 2 tickets to Cozumel, buy one way at a time. Don't buy round trip tickets. In Cozumel we explored the far side of the island and went on the History of Tequila tour where you get free sips of flavored tequila. Xcaret: a must see, beautiful. They will tell you all restaurants are $29us per person, but we found a snack bar by the theater that had hamburgers for 8us. lockers are 3us, you really don't need fins to snorkle river so save some money there too. Show starts at 6 pm dont miss it! OTHER INFO: Money exchange; pls ck the rates before you go at http://www.oanda.com/convert/cheatsheet and print it out. That helped us alot. Some taxi drivers and other vendors say $5us = 50 pesos. That is not true. We paid 50 pesos for a cab to town which = 3.25us. When we were there, 1us=14 pesos. Taxi to or from airport is 50us. Anything more, they are ripping you off. TIME SHARE people at Reef-politely decline. TIME SHARE people at another resort-Avoid but if you know how to deal with these aggressive people and can cut it off at 90 minutes, you can work it in your favor. Have a signal to each other and wear a watch. Here is how we did it. This one was Tres Rios Resort. They promised 2 Xcaret tickets for total $60. Before getting to their resort,we added that we wanted 2 round trip ferry tickets to Cozumel and transport to and from Xcaret. They agreed and we got it in writing. So after 90 minutes we said NO and we wanted to leave, they sent over the manager to try to salvage the "sale",again we said NO,we are ready to leave. We want our tickets. So they deducted 44us for the RT ferry tickets from the 60us we owed for the Xcaret tickets. We got the 2 Xcarets tickets and transport to and from Xcaret for only 16us. Usually this would have cost about 170us. Although the entire staff was very friendly and accomodating, we would like to especially mention Erika, the Conciere, and Jorge, the Bellman, who helped us with an honest transport company to the airport after we got ripped off by AXIA Transfers which overcharged us $30us for transport to the hotel. FYI the normal rate is $50us to or from Cancun airport to Playa del Carmen. Pablo, lobby bartender, very sweet, always smiling, plays soccer, tell him his amiga from Tejas recommended the "Dirty Monkey" drink.

Reviews.Title: “nice beach”
Reviews.Author: wuzed111
Reviews.Content: this hotel has a nice beach. it is small but very nice sand. the location is close to town, so that is a plus. the food is decent, but tiring after two or three days. the italian restaurant was good, but we saw a cockroach during dinner across from our table. we also switched rooms due to a cockroach, and then saw another in the new room. other than that, and the watery drinks, this place was pretty nice.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay we'd book again”
Reviews.Author: pandorasparkles
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay. It was good value for the money. The staff were very friendly and helpful. Our room was clean and spacious with a balcony. The grounds were attractive and well kept. The food was quite acceptable and varied. As an added touch the beer was Dos XX and the vino tinto was Spanish. The little ice cream place in the garden was a nice touch.

Reviews.Title: “Not Recommended”
Reviews.Author: CanadianTraveller383
Reviews.Content: Not recommended if you are looking for a 4 star resort filled with activities. The grounds are scenic, pretty and quaint, amid a multitude of hacienda-style villas. However, the activities team is pitiful. They had scheduled events but rarely followed the schedule. You would see them run the morning pool-side step aerobics, and then not see them again for hours. When they actually did run an activity, they might, or might not, even announce it. The activity team would even walk by you without making any eye contact or even say hello. To me, the manager of the activities team (whoever that was) needs to be fired, and replaced with someone with experience and a desire to focus on the enjoyment of their guests, rather than their own. The meals were repetitive, but had solid quality and a good taste. The service, however, was sub-standard. The people who worked there tried their best, but they were under-staffed - thereby resulting in overall poor service. In addition, the staff did not speak English well enough - to the point that the server could not tell you what she was serving. The pool and beach area was very nice. It was always easy to get a lounger. The resort had a hot tub near the beach, but it was cold and never worked. The first night we got there they had over-booked and they sent us to the Iberostar Quetzel which made us think we should have booked elsewhere than the Reef. Overall, a smaller resort with nice grounds, beach and pool areas - but definitely not a 4 star resort. It is very poorly run and managed. We would strongly recommend that travellers spend that little bit more (as we will next time) to upgrade to a true 4 star resort like the Riu and Iberostar.

Reviews.Title: “Nice vacation”
Reviews.Author: DaniBulgaria
Reviews.Content: We were 2 weeks from 29.01 to 14.02.2009. Very good food and drinks. Quiet hotel for holidays. The price is great.

Reviews.Title: “Nice atmosphere and good location”
Reviews.Author: Opal_girl77
Reviews.Content: I was there on my honeymoon. It seemed to be more of an older crowd when I was there. The atmosphere was nice, very tropical and more open than a regular hotel. The rooms were nice, clean and have balconies. The regulator on our bathroom tap was broken which made showering awkward. We told the front desk but nobody ever fixed it. The location was great. It was a 15 min walk to Playa del Carmen wich we walked to frequently. It felt like a safe area. It was a good experience staying there except for the food. The buffet was bad quality. The food was tasteless. The only edible meal at the buffet was the breakfast. We went to both the Mexican and Itallian resturants. The Mexican one was great however we nicknamed the Ittallian resturant Botticelli Barficelli! Chef Boyardi makes better ittallian food than that resturant. The evening entertainment was cheesy. It's good for children but kind of dull for adults. The bar was very small and not very happening. It's not a place to go if your their to party. The staff were very friendly and accomodating. We had a great time here but I would try somewhere different if we were to stay in Playa Car again.

Reviews.Title: “Kinda liked it here”
Reviews.Author: dmc214
Reviews.Content: Stayed over x-mas of 2008 - Im a member of RCI so I booked through switching out my timeshare. I have to say that overall it was a good stay. Location in Playa is awesome. Go to the right and walk and you can make it down town to Playa and then go left outside and not to far their is a cute little market place where I ended up doing my gift shopping, plus there is a starbucks. Only issues; you have to get there bright and early to make dinner reseravations and the mexican restaurant was closed 2 days during my stay for a private party/wedding and only found out about it after I waited an hour in line to make reservations, plus you need pants for the guys and of course I packed no pants for my husband or 3 sons and everytime I went to the restaurant with them not wearing pants I had to explain to the manger. Besides the Mexican restaurant the food is not that great but its Mexico so I manage my expectations and don't expect great italian food in mexico. The buffet is ok, my kids loved the non stop french fries and pizza. My husband and I did upgrade to the gold bracelet to get top shelf booze and recommend to do that if you are drinker, cost us an extra $50 for the week and totally worth it. Little trick I learned being in the timeshare world. You get don juilo in your margaritas and malibu etc plus good wine too at dinner. We did ATV's, snorkeling and fishing tours which we found cheaper going through some of the people on the beach versus the hotel. But this was my first time in Playa and I really enjoyed it. i love mexico and playa del carmen is now my favorite spot. check out the beer bucket down town and there were lots of cool things to do or places to see. I totally ditched the timeshare sales mafia and no one was hostile because I didn't want in on it or wouldn't take any of the free stuff they offered to try to suck me into it. Overall this is a good place to stay and would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Travel agent review nice small hotel in Mexico great location”
Reviews.Author: mbouz
Reviews.Content: My boys and I recently stayed at the Reef hotel while on a trip to explore the playacar hotels, as a travel agent who books destination weddings, I was looking at this hotel and a few other for my clients. It is a small hotel in comparison to all the others in the area. I would rate a 3 1/2 star in US standards. A great value for your money . I had no problems with my room average size 2 double beds, clean, a very nice welcome note was in my room. I loved that I did not have to walk too far to get to the resturants, front lobby or the beach . It is not your typical hotel set up which I also thought was very nice. The rooms are in small buildings about 3 stories high. They do have a newer upgraded section also. The grounds were well kept and as I walked around there were cleaning up after the guests. The buffet resturant was also small as compared to other area hotels but they only cater to about 200 rooms , and they had a good variety of foods. The speciality resturants,which you had to make reservations , were excellent and worth the reservation, just make sure they give you a card saying you have a reservation. The front desk staff was friendly. They have a nice open air bar above the main lobby. There is a tour desk but you might get a better price for tours on the 5th street , which is a small walk from the hotel. Just say no to the time share sellers. The hotel is in a nice quite area and we felt very safe walking on the streets. Tip: If you do any tours exchange some of your money for pesos, the exchange rate is better in town than it was in the smaller towns by the ruins. Be sure to carry a paper copy of your flight information and reconfirm your travel transfers before you leave !! I would recommend this hotel if you are looking for inexpensive hotel in playacar or a small destination wedding .

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Layout”
Reviews.Author: BuffaloDave
Reviews.Content: We just returned from this resort after spending one week there. Thought the way the grounds were laid out was wonderful. The feeling of not being confined with the normal lobby & elevator was a nice change of pace. Food at the buffet was not very good. the service at the resort I thought was very poor. The real problem I had with the hotel personnel was that they were very persistent on their guests to make a day & time to do their hotel presentation (time share) that will only take 90 minutes of your vacation. The staff was very friendly until you tell them that your not interested in their presentation, then they didn't want to know your name. I thought for the money I spent that the staff would be more attentive. Beach was beautiful & so was the sun.

Reviews.Title: “Booked at the Reef, Sent Somewhere Else”
Reviews.Author: theamericantraveler
Reviews.Content: We booked to stay at the Reef January 12- 17, but upon arrival we were notified that our room was underwater due to heavy rainfall so we were sent to the Gran Porto Real instead. We met two other couples at the Gran Porto who also were supposed to stay at the Reef. One couple was told that the air conditioner in their room was broken; the other couple was told that they (the Reef) simply overbooked and did not have a room for them. I cannot say for sure which hotel was better since the only part of the Reef that I saw was the lobby, but from what I gathered from speaking with other travelers is that the Gran Porto is better due to its location (just two blocks from 5th Ave), additional amenities, and beach front. I can say that if you are planning a trip to the Reef, you may end up staying somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “It was a decent little place really....”
Reviews.Author: macbeth44
Reviews.Content: There was a group of us that went and it was pretty evenly split in terms of those who liked their rooms and those who had issues. Personally my room was fine. The location was great right across from the lush garden seating area. Others had issues with their air conditioners etc. Absolutely the best thing about the place had to be the beach. We strolled south as far as we could go down the strip and many of the others had tiny little streches of sand or virtually none at all. Food was reasonable. Service was reasonable. Cleanliness was reasonable. Its a 3 1/2 star.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel not recommended”
Reviews.Author: mexicolindoNorway
Reviews.Content: Hotel with bad food and service - this has nothing to do with Mexico and are fare from the standard you normally will find in Mexico. Facilities are more or less ok apart for the beach which you find much better in other hotels in the area.

Reviews.Title: “The reef was OK, better choices available”
Reviews.Author: navycruz
Reviews.Content: The reef at Playacar, is located in a great and safe area. The hotel is exactly located at a private gated beach community which is close to the beautiful downtown area where restaurants and shops are. Highlight: centrally located, clean and decent rooms, nice pool, good food buffet, front beach location, beautiful small private beach Low lights: room was not ready upon arrival late at night, restaurant reservations need to be done before noon otherwise walk ins are not welcome, watch out for the concierges tour offerings, they are the catchers to sell you expensive tours making you believe that are below regular price, they will ask to listen to a two hour sales presentation from the hotel in order to sell you share time, I had a bad experience with the sale person who doing the presentation because I told her I was not interested and she started being rude and impolite. Get your tours and tickets at trusted locations such as government tourist offices or the main entrance of an attraction.
