If you are planning to go to the Yucatan Peninsula and just sit at the hotel and rest your whole time there, an all inclusive will do it, but if you are planning to get out and explore the area, don't do it, my best advice is to look for an apartment for the weekend (http://www.vacationrentaldirect.com/) and buy groceries at the great local supermarket, you'll make your own time, and pace without following any schedules to eat, travel or anything. Playa del Carmen is a beautiful town, but the whole Yucatan Peninsula is worth exploring and visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great grounds and buffet meals, uneven room quality”
Reviews.Author: MNwalker
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a week at this resort, my first visit to an all-inclusive and first visit to Mexico. Friends who had been to the area before selected this resort based on a combination of the number of restaurants, beach, walkable location and low-price for a packaged air/resort deal. The buffet food was well-prepared, varied, and beautifully presented. Cooks at three grill stations were always willing to cook fish, chicken, eggs or pasta toppings to order. Dessert cakes, while good-looking, were not as sweet as those in USA -- we learned to look for the flan (custard) desserts squares which were tasty, and the fresh fruit. The buffet restaurant area has a lovely view of the beach and sea. At the reservation-restaurants, we prefered the Mexican Grill over the Italian, for variety of offered selections and taste of main courses. Heavy rains 2.5 days of the vacation week magnified some of the downsides of this smaller resort. Two outdoor bars and two small outdoor snack restaurant areas weren't comfortable to access in the rain. The small main lobby was the only indoor area for more than 2 people to sit at times other than meals or the late-evening show. The many stairs on the winding walkways and up/down to rooms in the small buildings were tough to walk safely when wet. Water leaked in the restaurant roof and slat windows. Smoke from cigarettes lingered and was unavoidable. Staff worked very hard to sweep and mop water, but those almost-outdoors areas so nice on a sunny day were uncomfortable in the wet conditions. If more than a day of rain is forecast for your visit, consider staying at another place with more public areas and indoor corridors to rooms. If anyone in your group has trouble climbing stairs or walking uneven paths, this is probably not the best resort for you. The lush gardens were a pleasure to walk through, and small animals interesting to watch. Note that except for 1 bug none appeared inside the room. Room quality varied and front desk staff did not always know room condition, so first/second room assignments on arrival needed to be changed. There are no smoke-free rooms or public areas (lobby itself is non-smoking, but smoke blows in from the doorways). Some rooms were recently remodeled, some under construction, some with patio doors that did not lock (used a chair to brace closed). Cleaning service was great but towel quantity and delivery timing varied, so timing a mid-day shower was problematic. It was easy to walk towards town and view several ruins areas, and also to walk outward and enjoy the street-side landscaping of nearby resorts. A very nice small shopping area is a few blocks away, opposite direction from town. Beach walking was OK - nice views of Cozumel island, interesting to see beach facilities of other resorts, no shelling or snorkling sites adjacent to property. Best memory of the trip -- on one of the sunny days, enjoying the view of coconut palms, blue skies and turquoise waters.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing Vacation at an Endearing Resort”
Reviews.Author: LovelyMontana
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a weeks long vacation holiday at the Reef Playacar in Playa del Carmen. Overall it was an absolutely lovely vacation. The activities staff works SO hard to ensure that there are fun things for folks to do all day long. Kudos to them! The beach was extraordinary when I was there. It has sandbags that shore it up and the sandbags look like whales. They keep the beach from eroding. What I loved about the Reef's beach was that it has lovely white sand and there is a constant breeze that keeps you from getting too hot. There are guys that come around and gather up the used plates and glasses on the beach. I would have preferred for folks to have come around and cleaned up the beach area prior to sunrise. I woke up early and lay in the cabana beds and there were always dirty plates and cups strewn around which was a disgusting, but minor, flaw that needs to be remedied. Most of the staff speak some English however some are not fluent. Please remember that this IS Mexico, not America or Canada, so this is to be expected! After all, we are going to their country! The food that I had every day was wonderful at the buffet and the pizzas were also great from the snack shop. I never ate at either the Italian or Mexican restaurants because I was by myself. I was traveling by myself and always felt very safe on the grounds. As far as drinks are concerned, the Mojitos were lovely! Please beware that you cannot use an international calling card from the room itself and to say the least, I would NOT recommend giving your credit card over the phone using their in-room service as the price they quote you on the phone is not the price that you pay. As far as the time share folks go they do have a presence at this hotel but certainly not on the beach or in the walkways and are easily avoided. The grounds of Reef Playacar are absolutely EXQUISITE and immaculate! I did not notice any external room noise and the water is fine to drink on site as it is all purified. After I read some of the other reviews I was terrified of going here because I did not want to get sick. These concerns were completely unfounded so go, relax, and enjoy a marvelous vacation!

Reviews.Title: “Had a wonderful time”
Reviews.Author: sistersDenver_CO
Reviews.Content: We were a bit worried about staying at this hotel due to bad reviews which were written in August and September. We were pleasantly surprised at the appearance of the hotel grounds, the friendliness of staff, and food at the buffet restaurant. The rooms were decent. We traveled with two other families who enjoyed the hotel as well.

Reviews.Title: “returning March 08”
Reviews.Author: mjarema
Reviews.Content: We're headed back this year because the price was right and we're booking a day trip to the Island of Women, which we hope to visit on future trips. All in all, we enjoyed our stay in 2007 -- my husband even built us one of their signature canopy beds on our riverfront in Michigan, and we have been the talk of the town ever since. The food and drink: very passable on all counts but it does get old. Come to think of it, just have fruit and yogurt for breakfast and the rest will fall into place; no need to gorge (which we tended to do at first) Recommend a day trip to 5th Avenue for variety (think lobster tacos). We went to RP's Italian place two nights and wished we had booked a third. We are SERIOUS gourmands and the Italian place was absolutely wonderful. WHAT do they marinate their portobellos in?!?! I guess the mixed drinks are small and not too strong, but ordering more is your best way around that if need be! Entertainment: great for one night. Otherwise, we were in bed most nights by 9, and after an entire day in the sun, with drinks starting at about 10 a.m., that's about right. It;s vacation, after all. Rooms: worked for what we needed. The ceiling fans worked miracles. The water was plentiful and hot when needed. It was fun to watch Mexican TV. Did not hear other rooms. Nice deck. A stocked mini-fridge would have been wonderful, and a low-cost perk for the hotel. Service: very nice. It helps to know a little Spanish. We learned for their sake before we arrived. Ambience: gorgeous grounds. Massages: tres bein. beach-- best in the area given our walking tour of the coastline. pool area -- see above! Get to the pool/beach area early to claim your spot.

Reviews.Title: “Affordable Reef Club Playacar close to town”
Reviews.Author: KWBoston1980
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed at the Reef Club Playacar from December 12 - 16 (the morning, more later on...), and being our first time in Mexico, we didn't know what to expect so we will summarize the experience in pieces: 1) Arrival - Upon arrival you get off the place, and walk out to the exit gate, but get trapped like a herd of cows being moved until there is some clearance to allow us into the the terminal itself. Once you go through customs and immigration (very little hassle) and having to press your luck (lit. green means go, red means no and you get searched). you are welcomed to the country by hoards of timeshares and vacation/tour programs looking to get your business. If you didn't arrange for transportation beforehand, this is where you will find them. 2) Transportation - A van took us along with a few other couples to our respective resorts/hotels, dropping off in order of destination. Not really scenic as you are on the Highway most of the time. It's not until you get to your hotel/resort that you actually see what you paid for. Don't forget to tip a small amount to driver... 3) Reef Club welcome - Some bell boys come out and help lug out your stuff from the van and take you to check in. Even before speaking to the counter desk an information host is already talking to you about arranging a tour of the facilities and such (more later). The check in process is fairly simple and straightforward. Afterwards the bellboy will bring your luggage to your room (tip optional in all-inclusives). The information host would also ask you about joining any tours if you hadn't booked one by then, but there are some guidelines to look for (more below). We were able to get comfortable before hitting the buffet luncheon which offers mostly Mexican staples and some standard favorites along with drinks and fruit. Once you finish you will need to find stuff to do, as there is only so much at the resort. I suggest biking/walking into town (about five/fifteen minutes depending on which mode). Walk around town for that day to get a feel for what they can offer as well as to find the best prices in town for your gifts/souveneir needs. 3b) Amenities - Two pools, work out gym, rinsing shower outside, total access to private beach front, three dining choices (buffet, Mexican or Italian upscale - RESERVATIONS REQUIRED FOR MEXICAN/ITALIAN UPSCALE, guys need slacks and shoes ladies anything goes). Bike rentals (9-5pm, break between 2-3 for staff lunch), pool tables, foozball, five bars all inclusive but watered down drinks, beach beds, snack bar (pizza, burgers fries, sandwiches etc), jewelry/gift shop. Residences: this is an older establishment so things don't look/feel as new as other resorts in the area. Expect occassional bug/ant in bathroom area (my girfriend saw a playing dead roach in the tub) and the paint is cracking a tiny bit with some discoloration/mildew formation. Definitely more rustic and traditional than newer ones. 4) Departure/Check out from Reef Playacar - No one gives a crap about you when you leave. You get there and immediately get pampered to all your whims and desires (within reason), but then when you are dressed like you are getting ready to board a plane (as we were) no one pays any attention to you, it's a totally different vibe you get, like they just want you out of there and it would be a total waste to make you feel welcomed even upon leaving the premises. Airport check-in also was totally different, nobody is looking to sell you any packages anymore, only some stores to offer souveniers at marked up prices (in US DOLLARS even!) 5) Overall - Arrival was nice, just quite hectic imho. I think it was just because it was our first time, but you live you learn. The Reef Club also offered alot of food variety, but only to a point; after three days we were 'Reefed Out' of the choices and decided to try local stuff in town, a welcome change from the same ol' same ol'. Support local business right? I totally suggest you order some mexican breakfast favorites like huevos rancheros and huevos mutolenos (both eggs dishes essentially). The drinks were all complimentary and included in the cost, but mostly watered down and not the best quality. The beach was indeed a nice view, but the waves were very choppy and violent. Make sure you stay within the confines of the sand bars or you run the risk of getting swept away into the Caribbean! The activities at the Reef were pretty standard: bars, live music/dance shows, casino, etc. You definitely get much more of the Mexican flavor wh en in town. Once in a while they have vendors on-site to sell trinkets and cuban cigars (which I was tottally tempted to get). The snack bar offered burgers, fries, ribs and ice cream for the wee hours/between lunch/dinner. Overall okay, the burgers were frisbees (well done plus) and the ribs were a bit cold. Fries were much better quality, and their cheese/milk products taste a bit different than what is in the USA. it's up to your palette to decide. The check out process - Make sure you know your flight time. Ours didn't leave until 1:00pm but the van came to pick us up from the hotel at 9:00am... kinda early, but judging by the drivers (lack of) knowledge of the roads to other resorts, it was a good thing to add in the extra hour. However that meant we were able to enjoy ourself one hour less (no beach, no bike, quick eats). Also the tours that they can book at discounted prices on site... you need to fulfil some certain requirements to be eligible: a) Be between like 30 - 54 years old b) Married (spouses must also participate in tour) c) Must be US/Canada/Mexico residents (all parties involved) d) Submission of credit card number There might have been a few more but that was the gist of it. We got a notice to confirm with the host but never did, and they never even contacted us about participating. That was a good thing for the following reasons: - Tours lasts about 1:30 hours, time I rather spend sunning on beach / biking to town - Alot of emphasis on timeshare selling which we were not interested in - Safer/more reliable tours but rather go find one cheaper in town I have read reviews on here that said they hound people who didn't confirm and actually show displeasure at not appearing. I don't know what they are complaining about, as this is an all-incluside getaway that means we deserve treatment as we wish it, on our time, not on theirs. Don't get sucked into thinking that you NEED to join this tour, you will probably end up wasting your time. Of course maybe that's why we were not treated as well upon our departure, the world may never know. Hope this summary review helps those looking for an all-incluside at the Riviera Maya. Sounds kinda generic but I'm sure that's how they do it at other resorts as well, unless you go to a Riu or Sandos property (more upscale) Ratings (out of 10, 10 is best) Service - 8 definitely want you to feel welcome while you are there but nothing else when you are about to leave Food (buffet/snacks) - 7 gets boring after a while but it's all free Location - 9 one of the closest to town, so walking is s breeze, however Riu Palace is right next door with much better stuff, might want to consider that Amenities - 7 older, more rustic, watch out for small nuisances (ants, lizards, etc nothing poisonous though Overall - 7 3/4 You could always do better, but if the price is right and you know how to work the staff, by all means it's totally worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Had afantastic stay!!!”
Reviews.Author: Yoshi23
Reviews.Content: I have been a hotel manager in Southern California for the last 10 years. As such, I have a pretty fair idea of what to expect from a staff. So it's always fun and enlightening to be on the other side of the desk. This trip was no exception. After doing a ton of research, I booked our stay for the period of December 6th to 13th through LocoGringo, which turned out to be a good idea. They responded rapidly, and helped me narrow down my choices. They really know their stuff! Upon checking into the Reef Playacar, we were informed (as someone below was, I note) that the air conditioning had failed in the entire building that we were staying in. So they put us up at the Sandos Playacar, just down the road for one night. It was nice, but compared to the Reef Playacar, we found it rather lacking in character. Though the room was a bit more upscale than the one we eventually ended up in at the Reef, the grounds were unremarkable and reminded one of staying in Vegas. All stucco and building, without the amazing plant and animal life that's all around you at the Reef lacking. This is not a slam on Sandos, merely a nod toward the amazing gardens at the Reef Playacar. Although we'd read extensively about it, we never tired of the buffet. We found that, quite contrary to the experiences of other guests claiming that the choices were limited, we were offered a variety of tasty meat dishes, cooked right in front of us and served fresh, a big assortment of fruits, and some decent salad mixes. The staff in the buffet room (Chula Vista) were extremely helpful, cheerful and attentive. Our margaritas never had a chance to run dry, nor did the smiles of the employees. The room we had (#822) was on the second floor and overlooked an amazing hanging garden area, with soothing music that was piped through the area the entire time. At night, it's really enchanting to walk their grounds. When we checked in on our second day, we were indeed met by one of the time share people, who offered us discounts on travel packages to Chichen Itza and Xcaret, in exchange for two hours of our time to listen to their time share schpiel. We told the lady that we'd consider it the next day, but just wanted to check into our room. She never pressured us after that, and we still went to Chichen Itza, paid full price ($77 per person and well worth it!) and that was that. There are indeed a lot of time share people there, and they are always wanting to talk to you about their amazing offers, but a simple "no thank you" will put them off. Eventually, they just leave you alone. It's not really that big of a hassle. Also, there are time share people ALL OVER Playa Del Carmen, even at the "Information Centers". It's just a fact of life down there. If they hassle you, just tell them you've already got your tickets for all the places they'll try and pitch you and they'll leave you be. The beach and pool facilities at the Reef Playacar are wonderful. You can check out snorkel equipment, kayaks, and jet ski's for free. Or just lay out at the beach. Women are required to wear tops at the pool area, but we noted that several women were topless at the beach itself and no one seemed to mind. I would caution those who check out beach towels to remember to return them by the end of your stay, or they will charge you $25 per towel. They weren't exactly forthcoming with this fact, but maybe they just forgot. Regardless, we turned our towels in at the end and were not charged. Also, as to the water bottles, we never drank them and were not charged for them, either. All in all, even with the first night's relocation, we had a splendid time at the Reef Playacar. Stephanie, who works the "guest services" desk, was especially helpful! She must speak at least 4 languages, and speaks English perfectly. My Spanish is passable, and that helped in some situations at the Reef, but most of the people who work there speak some English. The property itself is lovely. It's also the closest all inclusive resort to downtown PDC. The short 10 minute walk to town has two separate Maya ruin sites on the way. Advice to people who are staying at the Reef, and also travelling to Mexico in general: RELAX!!! If you can just be patient and remember that it's a 3 diamond, and not a 5 diamond property, and also that you are in Mexico, where things just seem to happen a bit less quickly and efficiently than you're used to, you will have an excellent time of it. We would definitely return and recommend this place to our friends.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely a must miss”
Reviews.Author: barbToronto
Reviews.Content: We were very disappointed in the facility. The beach area and gardens are lovely, however, the food and rooms leave very much to be desired. When we checked in, the smell of tobacco was overwhelming...we had to sleep with the balcony door open and hope that the bats didn't come in. They charge 50 pesos for the bottled water and bill you whether you drink it or not. I was also very disappointed that my travel agent did not warn us about the time share sales pitch... very annoying when all you want to do is have some fun and relax. The railing on our balcony was broken (luckily it dislodged when my husband put his feet up and not when he leaned against it) - we told the front desk about the problem more than once, and it was still not fixed when we checked out. The buffet was average, but it was exactly the same every day...it would have been nice to have a bit of a change once in a while, we ended up eating at restaurants for most of our meals. We tried the "reservation only" restaurant - not worth the time we stood in line to make the reservation....tasteless and cold. On the plus side, the gardens and beach are fantastic... also, the staff outside of the front desk were delightful.. always quick to smile and say hello and very helpfull. This resort was sold to us as a 4.5 star facility, however it is really a 2.5 to 3 star at best.

Reviews.Title: “We loved the reef!”
Reviews.Author: colorado_travel_bug1
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Reef Playacar from Nov. 2nd to Nov. 11th. Overall we had a great time. We made a lot of plans for trips to XCaret and Cozumel, but ended up laying on the beautiful beach every day. The Reef has the best bit of beach in all of Playacar. Most resorts have their private beach fenced off from the ocean to keep it more exclusive. The Reef was very open and club feeling during the day with beach volleyball and morning stretch classes The drink selection wasn't of the highest quality, but we made do. The buffet restaurant, Chula Vista, offered a nicer drink selection than any of the other bars in the hotel. The entire staff was completely friendly and accommodating. We especially liked the entertainment staff. They took care of everything from step aerobics to evening shows. The night life isn't much to brag about at the resort but after a long day at the beach it is nice to just play a game of pool and have a few drinks. However, the party scene in Playa Del Carmen on calle 12 (12th St.) is definitely worth checking out if you like to dance. The food was fine. We weren't too picky. We did go out for dinner in town one night just to mix it up a bit. The only negative was that our shower flooded our bathroom every time we used it. I would recommend asking for a room on the top floor due to the noise of the cleaning staff. We were up and out by 8am every morning but they starting banging around at about 6:30-7am. Also, if you are not a person who likes going in the ocean and wants a really nice pool scene (more vegas style than tropical) I would recommend the RIU Palace next door .

Reviews.Title: “We were very much satisfied”
Reviews.Author: NuoDARound
Reviews.Content: We were very much satisfied with this resort. We were there in mid-November 2008, the weather was gorgeous (they said May - October was a raining season). The beach was clean with fine white sand; the lagune was organized with the wave-breaking dunes. So our 6-yr old daughter could safely splash there most of the day. The resort is compact and very shady, which is a great benefit, given the abundance of sunshine around. Rooms were comfortably spacious, pretty clean. I would recommend to ask for the rooms closer to the waterfront, or away from the main lobby and disco club - at night it might be a problem if you are sensitive to noises. Huge advantage is close proximity of the town - 10 min of walking and you have an access to the outer world. ...what else?...Food. Well, it's not "french cuisine", but tolerable.

Reviews.Title: “Buyer Beware”
Reviews.Author: Honestlytruthful
Reviews.Content: Buyer be "VERY AWARE" of the timeshare sales people from HSI/RCI. The REEF DOES NOT honor agreements made with them even though they agreesively solicit onsite. Overall though the resort was fine, night life on the resort bad, pool and beach area nice.

Reviews.Title: “Great time!”
Reviews.Author: nyma83
Reviews.Content: We just got back last night from a great trip to Mexico! This was our first time visiting the Reef Playacar. It was a no frills place, but very relaxing and friendly. We thought the beach was gorgeous and clean. We also found the staff to be extremely pleasant. There were a few staff members who actually went out of their way to converse with us on a daily basis. The drinks were also delicious and plentiful, quick service too. We were told that the resort was 98% full, but we didn't feel crowded or like we had to wait too long for anything. The room was nothing extraordinary, but clean and comfortable. The shower and air conditioner worked great. We tried the Terrazza Grill and the Boticelli restaurant and really enjoyed our meals at both places. The waitstaff did a great job, too. The Chulavista buffet was alright. I didn't find that there was much variety from day to day, we didn't like the coffee, and the pasta was really bad. We did like the service we received there, though. There was always enough of a selection that you could find something enjoyable at every meal, but I wouldn't call it gourmet by any means. We found that the pool snack bar was disorganized and the pizzas were always served undercooked..The cheese wasn't melted yet. Also, twice when we went at night for a snack (hours before closing time), we discovered that they had decided to close early. Playa del carmen was a short walk away, and we enjoyed walking into town quite a few times. The front desk staff told us a taxi would only cost $5.00, but we chose to walk to and from everytime. It's a nice walk as long as the weather cooperates. We did an excursion to Chichen Itza, and a day in Cozumel. We went a little too late to Cozumel, so I would recommend getting up early to take the ferry over. We had to meet with a rep from a tour agency at the hotel to book our return trip home. He also explained some excursions and gave us quotes. We decided to wait a day or two to decide, and ended up finding the exact excursion organized by someone in downtown playa del carmen for $50 less per person. So, if you're going to go on a sidetrip--shop around for a bargain.

Reviews.Title: “Great Bang for your Buck”
Reviews.Author: donnab14
Reviews.Content: After reading several recent negative reviews, I was a bit skeptical about staying at this resort. In any event, we just returned after a 7 day trip and I am pleased to report that our experience , here, was extremely positive. If you are looking for a five star resort, this is NOT the place for you, but if you are looking for a modest three star resort with good value for your money, you have found the right place. On our arrival, we were immediately assigned a room.The room that was assigned was rather musty smelling. That is actually understandable as it is in the middle of a jungle setting with lots of foliage and shade. Upon return to the front desk to request another room, Pablo was more than responsive to listen to my complaints of must and mold allergies. He escorted me, personally, to a few other rooms that were available. I finally settled for a room with two full size beds, rather than a king size bed, but were pleased with the rooms cleanliness and lack of smell. Overall, the room was cleaned appropriately daily and served its purpose. I do agree with other reviewers in that the walls are rather thin and outside sound can be a disturbance, As a side note, I did not find the beds to be uncomfortable as others have reported but I did have to request other pillows after day one. The water for showering was always hot with fairly reasonable water pressure. The best parts of this resort are the food, restaurants,service and beach. We ate in both of the restaurants,Italian and Mexican and found them very good.The buffet always had a variety of food and the breakfasts were always good. Contrary to what others have said, I found the snack bar to be quite bad. The hamburgers tasted like something other than beef and the hot dogs were still frozen. The alcohol was always plentiful ( not watered down, as some other all inclusive resorts have been known to do)but there were times when a small wait ( 5 - 10 minutes) was neccesary, as the bartender was busy washing/rinsing glasses. When I go back, I would bring my own glass and ask for it to be refilled when needed.Dont forget to try the lobby bar, as that was our favorite! In general the wait staff were always pleasant, most spoke English well and were aiming to please. It seems that the waitstaff has gone out of their way to promote cleanliness since "the OUTBREAK". By the way, it appears that they have eradicated the problem as I heard no one complain of illness and every one on our trip ( 4 of us) remained illness free. The beach was AMAZING. The water was blue green as pictured in the ads and was incredibly warm. Getting a chair was never a problem. The non motorized water sports were always available when we wanted them with very little wait, even for the Hobie sailboat. Overall, this place has everything that you need for a wonderful relaxing mexican vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place To Stay”
Reviews.Author: WashingtonStateJan
Reviews.Content: Despite what others have said, this place is great. Yes, it's a little older and the rooms do smell a little musty, the ceiling fan squeeked, the beds are a little hard, but the overall experience was good. The staff was very friendly, the grounds beautiful, the food in the buffet was well done and tasty, wait staff very helpful and eager to please. The entertainment was put on by the young staff, and they work very hard to please - sure it's not Vegas style, but so what - you're on vacation. This was our first time to this area and the Reef is perfectly situated to town (just a 15 minute walk), and the ferry to Cozumel. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for.”
Reviews.Author: Hermes_8
Reviews.Content: I'm a firm believer that 'you get what you pay for'. The Reef lives up to that expectation. When we have traveled previously to an all inclusive resort, we usually would pay more than what we were charged at The Reef. In this case, we were meeting friends that had already booked the trip. I loved the 'rain forest' look of the grounds and they kept the foliage well trimed and pleasant looking. The rooms were just OK. I was surprised that this'all Inclusive' resort was not ashamed to ask you to pay for a room safe key and did not have a stocked refrigerator in the room, in fact, they charged $5 US for the bottled water in the room. The food was alright but not the best. I did enjoy some of the authentic mexican dishes that were served. One thing that really bothered me was the houskeeping. For example, in front of our building was a sign right by the main walkway with the address of the building. In front of this sign was a little box that was more of a 'catch all' for people's empty glasses and dishes. The first morning we got up, we found that the boxed indeed had empty glasses and a dirty dish in it . I purpously did not say anything to anybody to see how long it took for someone to clean this mess up. It took TWO and a half DAYS for them to clean this. This is UNACCEPTABLE for any resort. My wife wrote down several other minor flaws but nothing out of the ordinary for this class of resort. If the deal was exceptional, I might come back, only because The Reef is right next door to the golf course and near the town. If you book a trip here, do not expect too much.

Reviews.Title: “Find another place to go, the FOOD is awful!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: ryleePa
Reviews.Content: We were a party of 13, all of us enjoyed the grounds and the beautifyl beach, the pool area where the pool bar is was dirty and smelled of urine, the bathroom next to the pool bar was broken the whole 8 days we were there, the food was boring and the same each and every day, hardly any choices of what you could have, the food was also very tuff to eat, the meat was dry and the vegetables were hard and could not be cut, and the food was cold, the restuarants (which you have to make a reservation for is now charging a $3.00 per person charge, one of the pools was closed for repairs and was to open in 3 days which it did not, the rooms smelled of mold and 3 of us had to get new rooms, the air conditioning units were full of mold and dust also, they charge $5.00 per bottle of water, this was our third time in Playacar and we love going there but will never go back to the Reef, there is also a charge for certain drinks, the drinks we not that good either, the best part of our trip was that we were together as a group, going in Oct is not the best time to go either, the nights are very chilly. The only plus was the beach which was a good size.

Reviews.Title: “dont go!!!”
Reviews.Author: mrmrslazy
Reviews.Content: oh my goodness, where do i start? my fiance, daughter (5) and i got advised by a thomas cook agent this hotel was fab! i dont think so. The so called thomas cook aircraft was swapped for a monarch aircraft , it was so old and dirty. we arrived at reef playar car hotel and got showed to our room which was ok, ceilings were mouldy but beds were clean. pools were ok but the pool bar was full of cups by the end of the day and like a sauna. a boy was sick in the other pool and no one cleaned it up even though they were told. food was ok for the first two days but there wasnt any other choices than pastas and childrens meals, there wasnt. no entertainment for kids, the kids club in the day was dreadful, the woman couldnt speak a word of english! the staff were extremely rude, felt like a chore to them whatever you asked for. to get a drink in the day you had the pool bar thats it. final straw, by day 4, the hotel had an outbreak of a virus. doctors were sent and antibiotics. even some admitted to hospital. we all got sickness and diaorrea, and had to have blood tests and samples. this was absolutely horrendous, to say the least especially having a child with us. DONT GO THIS HOTEL, ITS AWFUL !!! We wouldnt go back if it was the last place on earth!

Reviews.Title: “nice and relaxing”
Reviews.Author: tatiana68
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderfull time at The Reef Playacar. The hotel is not so big and directly at a great beach. We enjoyed nice dining in the a la carte restaurants you just have to make sure you book in the morning. No restriction on how many times you want to eat just a reservation is enough. We had fun, staff was nice, food is great, fresh fruits and enough for everyone. It is close to town and you can walk without any problem. Defenitely we can recommend this for couples and families.! We will come back

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: jessiep08
Reviews.Content: A friend and I stayed at the Reef from 9/15-9/19...I admit after reading all the bad reviews I was a little afraid that I made a big mistake in booking. However, I was pleasantly surprised! We were picked up at the airport in a private van, met at registration with drinks and shown to our very comfortable room quickly. On our first night they had an Independence clelebration, the food was great. They are a little limited with the drinks available at the open bar but for someone who really doesn't drink Pina Coladas were fine with me. The staff was very nice, we met a great group of people and went out with them one night. The buffet food selection was the only dissapointing thing, it always seemed to be the same we only ate lunch and breakfast twice and dinner there once. The beach was amazing, beatiful and the graounds were very nice. We went to Xcaret which was also amazing. Wish we would have gone there 2 days because 1 is just not enough. My advise is to purchase the plus package, you get more for your money. We also did the Swim with the Dolphins, another great experience. Our last night there we went to El Aluxe restaurant...WOW this place is beautiful and the food is great. A litle pricey but worth it. It's in a Cave and beautiful...a must see. A taxi to 5th ave from the hotel is just $5, you could walk it but we did it once and figured the $5 was worth it. You could pay outrageous fares to visit Tulum, XeHA or Xcaret but there is a bus depot on 5th ave you can take to these places for $3 each way. We booked the hotel on one of those travel timeshare specials so we only had free transportation to the hotel but not back to the airport...this would have cost $75...we took a bus for only $8 back which droped us at the airport terminal 2. The buses are new with air and very comfortable. OK sorry for being so winded here but we really did have a great time and can't wait to go again...yes we would stay at the Reef again too...loved it! Did not get sick but we spent time in the beach not the pool. Will post pictures soon.

Reviews.Title: “Tourqoise Waters”
Reviews.Author: Taurus066
Reviews.Content: This was out first trip here and we will definately return. Our trip was wonderful except for a couple of hurricane's (Gustov & Ike). The hotel was cozy and the room was comfortable. The maid service was always on time and did a great job. We weren't too happy with the buffet meals. Not a good selection and unless you packed both closed toed shoes and long pants for the guys it really is your only option for meals. My hubby figured it was too humid for long pants. He was right. The 2 other restaurants had this dress code. However only one restauruant was open at a time. Nightly shows....hmmmm as far as I know there was only one during the week we were there and it was cancelled. The Beach was the best one of all the resorts for quite a few miles up. It is very humid, but after a few days it gets better you get used to it. Overall our trip was fabulous and the beautiful clear tourqoise waters were worth any small bumps along the way. We met lots of people who have been alot of different places and each said this was the most beautiful water they had seen.

Reviews.Title: “holiday from hell”
Reviews.Author: 4travel57
Reviews.Content: Our family of 13 stayed at the Reef August 23 thru Sept 30. We had 4 small children and one pregnant woman in our group. On day 2 of our holiday everyone got so sick with fever, vomiting, and diahrea that we could hardly leave our beds. 90% of the hotel was affected with this " bug" and by the time the Doctor got to us, all perscription medicine in the area was given out. He did manage to find some over the counter medicine, but it did nothing. The Doctor wanted to put a few of us in the hospital there,but we chose to wait till we got home to seek another opinion. Upon arriving home we all went in for tests and were found to have e-coli and the parasite , Cryptosporidium. Both of these are transmitted through feces.It is often found in foods that are not cooked and It is also prevelent in some pools. This may explain why the resort tested the pool water one morning and drained it mid-afternoon.I am also quessing the pool is where we got it as many of us did not eat the same food as each other , especially the baby and he was one of the first to get sick.I also noticed the hotel putting out animal traps around the resort. The place is full of " wildlife". It has been a few weeks since we have been home and a few of us are still sick enough with this illness that they cannot return to work yet. As for the food I cannot comment because we never ate much. I will say that if they get this problem solved( They had a similar outbreak end of July beginning of August) this is a beautiful resort with an amazing beach and it could be wonderful place to vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Reef Crypto illness”
Reviews.Author: lemonhead777
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Reef in Aug..2008 Entire hotel came down with mystery illness. The hotel literally couldnt cope. I personally advised 3 young American girls to leave immediately and not check in. They did. When we arrived home and had check-ups Cryptosporidium was found. It is neither virus or bacteria. It is transferred in water, swimming pools and animals amongst other things. It was horrendous, and the hotel apparently is continuing to perpetuate the myth that it was a Roto-virus brought in from the UK. When we were at the hotel there was mutiny, as people clogged the lobby demanding medication. Canadians, Americans, English, Irish, Dutch..everyone. The indifference or denial of the hotel staff was really quite incredible. I could go on and on, but will spare you..you get the picture!! Anyone who suggests they were at The Reef around this time, and had a great time, have a serious reality disconnect. Lovely beach, dangerous watersports/jetski's..recycled food!! Can any one tell me if the staff are still wearing masks?

Reviews.Title: “7 of us came home with food poisioning”
Reviews.Author: Ellie75
Reviews.Content: 7 of us arrived at the Reef Club 10 Aug until 24 Aug 08 - since we have been home we have all been diagonised with food poisoning cryptosporidiosis and one of the children of 4years old also has dysentry. My friend and I also had sickness and bad tummies for one day whilst we were there. The pool was not very clean which we complained to staff about but nothing was done. The food was poor and obviously reading other reviews this and the pool is where the bug has come from (I assume). This was a holiday of a lifetime and we were disapoointed with the non entertainment in the evenings and also there was supposed to be a childrens disco as well!!!!! Bar service was terrible never enough staff they had to serve, collect plastic glasses, and wash them as well when they are on their own. Also getting pressurised into the time share as well which apparently was not a time share ll!!!! Loved Mexico but would not go back to the Reef Club - very disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “Buyer beware !!!!”
Reviews.Author: tom0301
Reviews.Content: have justv returned from a short trip to the reef Playacar and it resmbled the marie celeste ...very very quiet ...!!!!We thought it strange as we booked in and most of the staff were wearing masks and gloves ...We cannot fault the room and the beaches and pools were excellent however as we like to be active ,we were looking for4ward to the entertainment staff putting on events ...they did nothing ...because there were hardly any people on site to partake apparemtly most were moved out due to a virus outbreak by their travel agents the remainder were stuck there ...I have travelled the world and am not a fussy eater but the food here in quality varietry and choice was by a long way the worst that I have ever experiencedc in my life ...you were not allowed to touch any food yourself which in the circumstances was understandable however I am a trained chef and staff constantly picking up the food with the same gloves is not good practice ...at leats if you use your hands thay can be constantly washed ...do yourself a favour and pay a little more money and don't risk your life here !!! Needless to say we avioded eating here and booked out early not even asking ...or being offered a refund of any kind...the funniest thing that happened to us was we were asked to write down why we were leaving early !!!..how sily was that . Dee and Ian Cooper u.k.

Reviews.Title: “" The four of us enjoyed our stay at the Reef "”
Reviews.Author: rgarr
Reviews.Content: The Reef is a beautiful hotel that is very comfortable...rooms are very nice although my wife found one ant in the bathtub the second day we were there but no big deal...hot and cold wated was plentiful...water pressure in shower could have been better. The grounds were kept very clean by the staff who were friendly and helpful. Tipping is appreciated by all the staff. Food in the buffet for breakfast, lunch, and dinner was good and the selection varied. We also tried a couple of restaurants on 5th ave. but found them a little pricey and preferred the food at the Reef's buffet. After all you're paying for the all-inclusive part. We didn't eat at the other two restaurants because the men had to dress- long pants with a collared shirt-and dinner reservations were required to be made between 8:30 and 9AM for those two restaurants - Italian and Mexican. Watch out for the orange bands that they give you that identifies you as a guest of the Reef because all of the scammers recognize this on the main street...5th ave....and the other hotels probably have the same thing only different colors. Scammers recognize the colors and pretend to work at your hotel so you will buy them drinks or worse. Hotels should use something else for their guests. The scammers are all over and pretend to work at hotels, car rentals, and other places you are sure to go. They are selling time shares and anything else that you might be interested in. There was some kind of outbreak at the Reef near the end of our stay and supposedly some other patrons got sick we were told. I do know for certain that my wife got sick first near the end of our stay...followed by the husband of the other couple we met there...and that after we got home I also got sick...so three out of four of us came down with whatever bug was going around. The three of us had Montezuma's Revenge but I don't know what symtoms the others had. You MUST stay hydrated at all times because of the extreme heat and humidity. Finally, the Reef is rated about right at 3 stars. The beach is georgeous. The Caribean side is breathtaking with the azure aqua colors. You will love your stay at the Reef and my wife and I look forward to returning one day.

Reviews.Title: “Didn't get sick & had a blast!”
Reviews.Author: fortunecracky
Reviews.Content: Before departing for my trip, I had read several scary reviews about The Reef Playacar, so I arrived prepared with low expectations. We ended up staying there for 5 fun nights with no real complaints. We met up with friends making us a group of 9. Upon arrival, my boyfriend and I were greeted by very friendly staff and were NOT hassled by timeshare people at all. Other than sleeping, we hardly spent any time in our room which was clean, bug-free, and the A/C worked just fine. The resort's beach was beautiful and there were always available beach chairs. We primarily ate at the buffet where the food was pretty good for an all-inclusive buffet, but after eating there over and over again, the selection gets a little old. The snack bar was full of your typical junk food like pizza, fries and burgers which was in general good, but definitely not excellent. We did make reservations at the Italian restaurant one night. The ambiance was great, but the food wasn't. It tasted like they made the dishes in the buffet and just brought them upstairs. We left the resort a lot on day trips, and we went downtown a few times for dinner so we didn't eat at The Reef as much as we could have. Because of that, we didn't get too tired of the food. No real complaints. We did notice that were was a virus going around during our stay because we heard a lot of guests complaining and we noticed the doctor making his rounds. We were careful of drinking water or cocktails with ice and eating cold foods at first, but nothing happened to us, and by the end of our stay, we were eating & drinking whatever we wanted. I don't know what it could've been, but I'm a vegetarian, so I didn't touch the meat, and I did not get into the swimming pools. One of our friends saw the staff dump a whole load of chemicals into the pools as if they were doing a major disinfecting. Our group basically just stuck with the beach, and all 9 of us did not get sick. Overall we had a blast. The staff was very friendly and the bars didn't seem like they skimped on the booze either. The jungle theme of the resort was also really cool. One of our friends took a walk on the beach along the other neighboring resorts and she said The Reef definitely had the best character. At such a great price, I would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “The Reef Gave Us The Runs”
Reviews.Author: runsontherun
Reviews.Content: Two words...The Runs! Just as the other reviews have been written, this one has the same storyline..First we got there, our bag was rolled in as we were told to go to the reception to check in. So far so good..We had to talk to the "Meet and Greet" individual to show us all the features of the Reef. After we spent 30 minutes and $5 we could now go to our room, but our luggage which was rolled in by a staff member was now missing. It was taken by a driver who was taking people to the airport. After 7 hours it was finally brought back. And honestly, I really don't think the staff was all that concerned with our luggage. The next day, our 1st full day in Playa, we layed out, ate and drank by the poolside. I (the boyfriend) drank plenty of water and ate from the snack bar, while my girlfriend drank coke and water and ate as well. We ventured out by bikes to Wal-Mart to get bottled water and snacks since we know that the prices are usually jacked up at the resort. Come Sunday, we had breakfast, then layed out, but then the problem started to occur...The Runs! I was miserable, I was going to the bathroom every 20-30 minutes for the next 3 days. I skipped breakfast and lunch with a few snacks here and there and usually ate something light for dinner. This is the girlfriend writing now. The food was terrible. I am not a picky eater and I do like exotic foods quite often. The breakfast was the best and safest choice, although I did read that people liked the snack bar food. However, I don't think they cook with safe water, or use clean kitchen utensils or something. At first look, the snack bar food is okay and normal, but the more you stay in the snack bar, you notice things. The cups for icecream fell on the floor and I helped them pick it up. I put it on the counter for them to put in the trash and one guy smiled at me and then put them back in the basket! That was so gross. Dinner was the worst. I couldn't even recognize the food and all I ate was one small piece of chicken that was freshly grilled. One day there was spaghetti, and the sauce was pink, like pink strawberry milk. I think that the staff is really disgruntled, because I notice them throwing dishes, and being pissed about things quite often. After I saw them put those plastic cups back, I knew that it was not the only thing that they would do. By that time, our stomachs were achy and starting to hurt. I read all the reviews before and thought, oh, that won't happen to us, or let's just chance it. We thought, the price is good and it's by the beach. However, we ended up not eating or drinking anything else after we got sick. We ended up going out to breakfast/dinner and eating store bought snack in between. We stuck to only bottled beverages and that was it. I had to go to the pharmacy and buy over $20 in medications for my boyfriend and I to feel better. All in all, we ended up spending much more than we would have just because of the bad food and unsanitary conditions. If you end up going and get it, take the medication for the runs in Spanish. It works. Also, bring pepto and tums, and lots of it. I am still not feeling well and we just got back yesterday (9/5). Good Luck!

Reviews.Title: “Decent enough place”
Reviews.Author: 2CatsMom
Reviews.Content: We stayed here back in 2004 when my husband (my then-fiance) and I came down for my cousin's wedding. I had booked through a local travel agent. The resort was a little out of the way from where the rest of our family and the other wedding guests were staying but other than that it was a pretty decent place. As expected, some of the staff only spoke Spanish but the most vital staff members did have a pretty good handle of English. Taxi service was readily available and the food was pretty good. I liked the tall trees that shaded the hotel area and the grounds were nicely landscaped and clean. Paths led from the hotel area over to the pool/beach area. The beach area had hammocks to lie in and one of the pools had a swim-up bar. We were there for a total of 4 days and our room was kept up with fresh linens and towels after the 2nd day. I see some recent reviews from last month stating there was an illness going around the resort, which makes me curious. Although I was not sick while in Mexico, once we got back home, I had a pretty good case of Montezuma's revenge for about a week. So I am not sure if I caught something from the food eaten at the resort (or any of the other places we ate at) or just from the regular drinking water, although the tap water in the bathroom tasted and smelled normal and complimentary bottled water was provided. Next time I go to Mexico I will just be sure to take an anti-diarrheal antibiotic before leaving!

Reviews.Title: “Beware Of The Sick Reef”
Reviews.Author: frogeta
Reviews.Content: Beware of the Reef Club, We travelled to the Reef Club with a little anticipation after reading the reports of other travellers, but thought it would be ok, how wrong can one be. we got very very sick as did many other people in this hotel, people were checking out , people were moving to other hotels as the tour operators moved them, people were going to hospital and having blood tests and some even having to be admitted, after speaking to many people on the holiday it was hard to find anyone who's family had not been affected by this sickness, my partner has had to go to the doctor for some tests back here in the u.k. The food is repetative the fizzy drinks are flat, the service is bad, there are many who you can tell just do not want you to be there, they just don't have any enthusiasm for a anything. The management after getting everyone a visit from the doctor decieded to get all of the staff to wear masks and gloves in the restaurant, a little bit of too little too late, we hardly ate anything at all and when we did we had to order dominoes pizza and that is around $25.00 per pizza. I noticed a lady called Kristie from Long Island New York said about the surly young lady at the front desk and how right she is, friends we met there had to hand their form of complaint in to their tour operators and they were told by this young women that they were liars and it wasnt true at all what they were saying, and i can honestly say it was true what they were saying, i saw there 4 year old little boy wake up from under the sun umberella around the pool and stand up only for him to soil himself, it just ran down his leg, he was stood there totally bewildered the poor little thing and very distressed and upset, and these guys were on their honeymoon, the hotel never once aknowledeged that they were there on their honeymoon they just didn't care. The Snack bar food is terrible, it is open till 2.00am so you can go and get a late night snack, but remember tip them or they just don't want to know. The plastic glasses around the pool ar chipped, the Coke is totally flat, as is the sprite. The sickness is awfull we spent 8 nights in the hotle room we were not able to eat properly, we felt sick all the time stomach cramps, dioahrea, sick, I had to report to the entertainment team one day that there was a slick of sick floating in the swiming pool, before anyone decieded to get it out, the pool was closed down and sectioned off so that they could completley clean it out, my aedvise is do not go there at all unless you really do feel you could do with loosing a lot of pounds not just a few.

Reviews.Title: “My 3 year old almost died with a virus...dont go to the Reef!”
Reviews.Author: bluewater1223
Reviews.Content: This is the nastiest place I've ever visited. My sister, my 3 year old daughter and myself stayed at the Reef the week of Aug 25th. what a NIGHTMARE! We all got sick with some strange virus that I think we caught from eating there. The symptoms include vomiting, fever and diarrhea. I couldnt eat or sleep two nights in a row from being that sick. My daughter was having 105 degree fevers and I had to urgently fly back to NY before our scheduled return date and bring her to the emergency room of a local hospital. I had brought her to a Doctor there but she was not getting any better and we got really afraid. To this day, she has not recovered 100% yet. Also, the food was scant and very gross-looking. They kept repeating whatever they gave us for lunch during dinner time. We were not the only people sick there, I met a bunch of people who were also complaining about being sick with the same virus, some of them were given medicine at the front desk. Unless you enjoy being sick, dont stay at the Reef.

Reviews.Title: “Reef Playacar Sickness throughout the resort”
Reviews.Author: brianfromwashington
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned home from a weeklong vacation with friends that began at the Reef in Playa del Carmen. We had a terrible time at the Reef due to almost everyone at the hotel getting sick, but there is more. Upon our check-in each guest is pressured to attend a time-share meeting before they will show you to your room. When we did get to our room we found out the lock for the room safe was $2. US per day and the bottled water was $5.US as well. This was supposed to be an all-inclusive resort. The food at the buffet was poor and did not change with very little selection (not even milk was offered) the snack bar was late to open by more than a half hour and the cheap cracked plastic cups used for the free drinks were child sized. Speaking about the plastic cups, I watched them wash them by dunking them in a tub of dirty water with soap then a quick dunk on a cleaner tub of water then put back on the counter for use. Now back to the part about all the people getting sick. We arrived Sunday of last week, after the agonizing sales pitch we went to our rooms and then to the beach. The beach in Playa del Carmen is wonderful by the way. Later that evening I became ill with fever, the runs and throwing up throughout the night. My wife is a nurse and she immediately recognized I had dysentery so she went to the front desk an ordered me the appropriate meds from the local pharmacy. At this point we were unaware of what would soon become an epidemic. The next day after a complete night of toilet use my wife fell ill to the same awful sickness I had. I went to the gift shop to purchase more bottled water since I drank both that were in our room the night before. The lady helping me behind the desk was sick as well and said many others were also sick. I brought the 5 bottles back to our room and checked to see how my wife was doing. My wife called the front desk for yet another order of meds and was told the doctor was at the hotel and for $100 U.S. he would see her if she would like, she declined the visit and ordered the meds. She was told they would be brought to our room (812) in 15 to 20 minutes. After a half hour passed I headed out to see if her medicine was up at the front desk. While on my way to the lobby I noticed we were not alone with this sickness. People on the walkways were asking each other for help and answers to what was happening to everyone, asking if we were sick too. Others that were listening from their balconies added that they had sick people in their rooms. While in the lobby there was a large group of hotel guests surrounding their local travel rep demanding that they be moved to a new location and wanting an answer to what was making them sick. My friend caught up to me and told me he just came from the beach and only a handful of people at the resorts down the way that were full of people out enjoying the sun. I went to the front desk and asked to speak with the manager. With hesitation I was told he was dealing with an emergency, a sick person. I let him know that my wife was in our room sick and I waited to speak with the manager. After a short wait I had a chance to see the manager, he said only 7 people were sick that he knew of and they were looking into the cause, and if the sickness was any fault of the hotel they would be reimbursing the cost of any lost days as well as the cost of medication. He said he was not aware of the people in the lobby outside his glass door or the people in the pathways and I guess not many of the people at the front counter next to his office for that matter. I asked to be moved to a new resort and he said the hotel would not do that unless it was proven they were at fault for the outbreak of illness, but assured me he was doing everything possible and would let me know immediately when they discovered what it was and where it came from. He then said the hotel would pay to have the doctor see anyone that was ill and cover the cost of medicine. I said I did want the doctor to see my wife and the doctor was sent to our room right away and confirmed that she needed medicine and also wrote a prescription for additional meds to stop her from vomiting any more. I called our local travel agent to see if I could get some help and they contacted GOGO travel to let them know what was happening at the Reef. My agent called me back and said they did not have a local rep and they called the resort to see how bad it was and they were told “the pool” caused the illness and it was already taken care of. I let my agent know my wife was never in the pool and the Hotel manager just told me they had no idea what the cause of the illness was. At this point my agent said she was calling them back and would call again shortly. While waiting for the call I ran the prescription up to the front office. On the way back from the office I saw several more small groups of people and each time I passed one they would ask if I knew what it was and what the resort staff was doing about it. I heard from people that had children so small they were only bottle fed and were sick, elderly people, young and old the illness affected almost everyone. An older British gentleman said he did see someone inspecting the food at the buffet and made the staff remove the deserts and some other foods. While back at our room our travel agent called with a plan. We would be staying a few resorts down the road at Sandos Beach Resort. Olympus Tours would pick us up at the lobby but could not provide a time and it would cost an additional $1,100 U.S. for our group but would be reimbursed as soon as I provided a copy of a checkout bill when we returned. We could not pack our belongings fast enough. While checking out I told the manager where we would be staying and provided him with my cell number. We had meds we were waiting on and the manager stood up and said as soon as I know more I will be personally calling you to let you know what we will be doing “you have my word”. I asked him why GOGO travel was told the pool caused the illness and he replied “that is a lie” he said he would be the only person they would have spoken with and they did not call. I asked about the food being pulled out of the Buffett and again he said that was a lie but I could believe what I wanted. We took a Taxi to the new resort and re-started our vacation. Sandos Beach Resort was great. The people were friendly it was clean and the food choices were plentiful. That night the illness caught up to our friends and it took a day to run its course even with proper meds. It was strange that staff from the new hotel as well as the Taxi drivers all seemed to know about the illness from the Reef Resort. Come to find out this is an ongoing event. Two years ago we stayed at the Royal Hideaway and had the time of our lives; we love Playa del Carmen and the local culture. I highly recommend visiting this area, and seeing all the wonderful things it has to offer. I highly It is hard to describe what it felt like to be in such a chaotic health crisis at the Reef in Playa del Carmen. Until the management of that resort begins to take responsibility for the wellbeing of their guests, this is sure to happen again to more unsuspecting vacationers. We never did get a call or the meds we were waiting for from the manager of the Reef Resort. For us, it will be Hawaii next year. Brian & Ragina (Room 812) Olympia WA U.S.A.

Reviews.Title: “everyone got sick here!!!!!!! August 2008”
Reviews.Author: moonique5
Reviews.Content: All I have to say is everyone was sick...EVERYONE the DR was visiting every room. They closed all the pools. There were families and couples in the lobby sick, and there were prescriptions in 100's of peoples hands. people were demanding to be moved to another hotel, and the staff did not care. Playa Del Carmen ran out of the prescriptions that were being written...This was a trip from HELL I am positive more reviews will be written about this..we also heard this same thing just happened three weeks ago at the reef!!!

Reviews.Title: “No Bad Rap From Me”
Reviews.Author: BertDallas_Texas
Reviews.Content: I feel I need to give my comments because I read so many comments before I went that I was really worried. Well, everything I was worried about wasn't true. Here's my assessment. I thoroughly enjoyed my experience. The resort has a beautiful layout. I went to the more expensive Rui next door and I would stay at the Reef before I would there. Theirs is too formal and no trees. The Reef has a jungle look to it. It's a quaint propoerty and not too large. the beach is easy to get to. We had a wonderful airconditioner in our room. The maid kept it clean. Granted, it's not a 5-star resort but I didn't expect it to be. The food was fine. The menu could be varied a little, but it was good to me. The service was great, the staff friendly. We left Manuel and Rudy tips (bartenders) 'cause they were our buds. We avoided the timeshare people, just told them no. Probably the only drawback to me is when a property says it's all-inclusive, it should be all-inclusive. The water bottles in the room that they want to charge $5 for is probably ridiculous. I just went to the store and bought me some and that took care of that. No problem. Also, they had a couple of events with food down at the beach that they wanted to charge for, but I wasn't doing that. It's not a party hotel but I wasn't looking for that. The bar at night was fun to me, meeting people from the UK and Canada and Africa. I've stayed at better places, but I would definitely stay here again. Some of the reviews can be so mean so I wanted to offset some of them by writing this. Great fun!

Reviews.Title: “If you love being sick then this is your place”
Reviews.Author: jettakid
Reviews.Content: I believe I can tolerate a lot but this place really has no class. When my wife and I arrived we met some very nice people on holiday and they told us every one is sick. She explained that many of the guests where sick and some had left. So we checked in and immediately after checking in another guest said every one was sick and then a fourth and a fifth person said the same thing. So my wife and I went to the front desk and asked the people at the front desk what was going on and did we have anything to worry about. They said we had nothing to worry about and the guests that where sick where the people that had been there for a week or more and that none of the new guests had complained. So we took it as the truth and went on our vacation. Well the next afternoon our second day at the resort we where told that about 40 people had left the night before and 20 pulse people where leaving that day. My wife and I decided the best thing to do is to leave before we got sick. On our way to the front desk we ran into another couple that arrived the day before we did and they where sick. So being told that the guests that had been there for a week where the only people that got sick was a lie. On top of that the staff is handing out what would be in the states prescription drugs. A doctor was on site making room calls it was scary to say the least. Also they closed down the pools we where told by one of the guests that the doctor told them not to eat the fruit or drink any of the water at the resort this would include any beverage that has water products such as ice. So much for the all inclusive portion of all inclusive resort (don’t swim, eat or drink). My wife and I decided to ask the staff if they could book us into another resort for the rest of the stay. They told us no and said that they couldn’t even refund us for the rest of our stay if we did leave. So we went into town for dinner because we couldn’t eat or drink there unless we wanted to pay for bottled water. We had a great time in Playa del Carmen the highlight of our stay. Needless to say we went to bed that night and the next morning my wife is sick. I don’t usually complain but if you dont want to get sick then stay away from this place. It’s a beautiful place and the staff is friendly but its not worth getting sick over. I would not recommend this place nor would I ever consider coming back. The Reef is a five star evacuation, both out there lobby door to go home and out every orifice of your body.

Reviews.Title: “Location... amazing, Service... very disappointing”
Reviews.Author: brewgringo
Reviews.Content: When I read some of the reviews for this hotel resort before my wife and I went down, I thought some people were just being a little harsh. I having lived in Mexico for two years of my life thought the complaints were just people being picky, My wife and I learned different. There are some pro's to the con's I will mention the con's first. Con's: Food: I have lived in Mexico for two years (as previously mentioned) so I thought the people who left bad reviews about the food were just being picky because the food was not what they are used to back home (USA, GB, where ever). But the food was not at all impressive, even the Mexican food was a very low quality, and not very authentic. Their selection was not good at all either. The restaurants that are included (the Italian, and the Mexican) are a joke! The Mexican is acceptable, but the Italian restaurant really is not good at all! Lets just say spaghetti and cheap Ragu sauce would have been very welcome compared to their food... The Service: This was perhaps the most disappointing... The service was just not there! There were several employee's who you could tell just really did not care at all... and it appears that the whole organization of the resort feels the same apathy... for example, our last day at the resort we had to catch our plane, so we wanted to eat at the snack bar which opens at 11:00 we were planning on getting a bite to eat before we left... well we went to get some food and the snack bar was not open, the employee told us it would be ten minutes, and then that went by and ten more, and ten more... finally at 11:30 we had to leave... being late was very consistent at The Reef Playacar, and then when we told one of the "sales/service associates" in the lobby area about everything running late and how we were not going to have time to eat until 9:00 at night he said, "oh, I have only been here two weeks, I dont know." There was another morning breakfast was supposed to start at 7:00 but they did not open till 7:25 and we had to go to make our tour so we missed out again... Then you ask what is going on and they all shrug their shoulders. There really were several other instances I will not mention just because I could go on. Sales People: The sales people here reminded me of used car salesman... you know the ones that pat you on the back and call you "buddy." They were not ruthless, nor overbearing, but a little annoying. The Pro's The location is awesome! It is centrally located along the Maya Riviera, everything is pretty close... Go to Playa if you want to relax, and do more activities... if you want to party go to Cancun. The beach is great... and I even think the looks of the resort are pretty cool... Really it is too bad, because we thought the place was great! But it would be very hard for us to go back or to advise others to go back, because the service is just not acceptable... the sad thing is that common courtesy would not even cost the company anything, it is just an attitude, an attitude The Reef Playacar does not have.

Reviews.Title: “Dont waste your money at the Reef”
Reviews.Author: MexicoMama65
Reviews.Content: Please dont waste your money at this resort. I have been to Mexico many many times and I never thought this would happen but whew!! This property is not managed well at all. Here is a recap of my stay: 1. Moved room 3 times before we got one with a working AC. This was an upgraded room after having intense conversations with hotel mgmt and my travel agent. 2. The food was the same over and over and over again. I know it was reused and reheated. Not much variety and almost everyone in our party was sick. 3. It is very understaffed. Could not keep up with towels, cups, etc. The maid service kept turning off our AC everyday when she cleaned. It was 97 degrees outside! 4. The pool was 3 ft low all day one of the days. 5. The resort is very small and very basic. They kept it clean but could not keep up with the demands of a fully booked resort. I could keep listing all the things we went through but you get the drift. Please dont waste your money here. Spend a little more and stay at a nicer resort. They rate this one a 3-31/2 star but it is more like a 2-1/2 star. I am actually returning to Mexico in Oct to redo my vacation. I hope you heed these warnings. I am a frequent traveler to Playa, Cancun and Puerto Vallarta. Dont stay here

Reviews.Title: “Dry the Reef Club Diet, lose half a stone in 6 days”
Reviews.Author: telboy2008
Reviews.Content: We arrived on the 21st of July in the middle of Dolly. We had been up since 5.30 a.m. an hour a half drive to the airport a ten hour flight then standing for 1 and a half hours through customs 3 planes, 4 passport control people, not a good start. Then on bus for 1 and half hours. Got to reef, throwing it down, went to check in, young girl said to leave our cases and then took myself, my wife and son to desk. she started to explain about hotel, we just wanted to get to our room shower and something to eat, at the end of her sales pitch she said you have meeting with me in two days time, to make sure you turn up you give me 100 pesos and you will get it back when I see you. I was too tired to realise what was going on, but next day when I read the slip of paper it was clear I had been conned out of money to force me to attend a time share meeting. This is no way to treat guests at your hotel, you expect that from out in the street, but by people who meet and greet you as soon as you walk in, bang out of order. Kids club, only any good if your kids have a great tan and speak spanish, other wise, your kids are quickly returned to you when the girl takes the others to the beach. We knew kids like ours who went once and never went again, a real real shame. No entertainment for kids during day in pool, geared more towards adults, pool volleyball, water polo, beach volleyball, kids were told to beat it by the entertainment staff at the beach volleyball, I know, I was next to the kid who got to told kids were on later. In the two weeks the kids never got on later. But the entertainment guys and girls were good at what they did, they did do a great show at night for the kids, shame more effort wasnt spent on them during the day, as the entertainment was more for adults, and kids are left round the pool watching the adults play. Location, stunning, beach stunning, staff mostly friendly. Reception, maybe if you pass them a couple of bucks they would get things for you that you need in the room. After 3 days asking for extra coathangers I instead got the maid to get some for me and she did straight away. Sea safe to bath in, snorkel free, go the other side of sandbags and see the fish. amazing. But here come the real bad part, half of the guests came down with sickness, dizzyness and the runs during our second week. Yanks, Brits, Dutch, Hungarians, no one spared. No explanation was ever given to what caused it, no warning, no announcement, no letter to the rooms, but all around you people were not eating, drinking, or even coming out of their rooms. People were dizzy, sick and had no energy. I had this for 6 days, for 35 hours I never ate a single thing, for the rest of the time it was a bit of soup a bit of toast and not much else, I had no stomach for food or desire. At this point you didnt know if it was the food, the water, the pool, the drinks you were served, who knows, it made everyone wary of everything. My son got the runs so did my wife. We ate hardly anything, you felt sick all the time, and then what you did eat came shooting out your backside so fast it nearly broke the land speed record. Trips were cancelled, as you couldnt go anywhere with out being 30 mins from a toilet that you were going to mess up really bad. The doctor was called to most people, 30-40 rooms were affected. At least the Hotel paid for the Doctors fee and tablets, but in my case they didn't even work. Usually when you go on holiday you come back needing to go on a diet, no need at the reef, shed pounds in the sun, the only thing is the toilet basin looks browner than you. The drinks are not cold, they put ice in them to make them cold, is the water they serve really treated, are the plastic cracked glasses they serve the drinks in that clean? Is the food served in the snack bar cooked well enough? One thing is for sure, if you dont finish your snack bar food and just leave it on the table, within 5 secs at least 10 birds like ravens will be all over the plate and the table, the staff do not clear up quickly enough, and the tables are never, ever, wiped clean after the birds have been on them So can I assume that I spent 6 days of my holiday because of bad hygiene, I don't know! Obviously because of the the buffet system we all use the same long spoons to gather the food from tray to plates, so all it takes is one person to be ill, not wash their hands and you can guess the rest. Maybe the above event will never happen again at the reef, but im afraid I couldnt wait to get home, eat some normal food and know where it came from and who made it. This review maybe bitter, but when your son is crying because he didnt make it in time to the toilet and messed up his pants and t-shirt you cant help but feel that someone somewhere should have let people know there was an outbreak and moved us on or something, just anything, we just felt trapped in a sick hotel not knowing what was going on, or how long it would last. Would I come back to the Reef, maybe if I want to lose some weight I will!!! Dont think that going to the Mexican or Italian resteraunts will help, the food in the buffet is better, and the water they serve is warm and cloudy, and I never got to finish my Italian meal, had to leave half way through and then was up at 1 in the morning throwing up, then parking my bum in the toilet seat for an hour. Next year Butlins at Skegness, not really!!!! On the plus , weather was superb!!!!
