Reviews.Title: “The Ins & Outs of the Reef”
Reviews.Author: MergerMania
Reviews.Content: After scouring reviews of several resorts in Cancun and Playa Del Carmen my girlfriend and I settled on “The Reef” for three primary factors. One, it ranked a hotwire 3.5 stars and a “Customer Favorite” rating. Two, price. Three the reviews of this resort, although clearly mixed, seemed to favor pleased travelers vs. perturbed trolls. I am writing this while at the resort in an effort not to forget anything that might be considered relevant. It would be fair to warn all readers of this review that my gal and I are both easy to please. We are forgiving of many things that might horrify others so… if you are relying on our testimony for your decision please keep that relevant fact in mind. I have tried to chronicle the visit with pictures, you know, since they are worth a thousand words (each I might add). Our arrival was a bit confusing but not too difficult to work out if you aren’t bashful and are persistent. Once you clear customs you will be inundated with people, nearly all of whom are trying to get you to visit a time-share although every single one of them will tell you that they are trying to help, and have a multitude of “free” things to give you. They are very, very tenacious and quite glib in their sales pitch. If you’ve never been to a time-share presentation, I cannot advise you to either try it or run away! As for myself, I’ve seen several and don’t care to waste any of my precious vacation time listening to a hard sell just to receive a few vouchers for “free” things that cost me the better part of a full vacation day. You be the judge. As you exit customs, keep an eye out for the ADO booth on the left hand side. There you can purchase tickets for the bus to Playa Del Carmen for about $8 or $9 U.S. per person. A taxi will cost probably $75. You cannot miss your stop in Playa; once you arrive, the bus terminal is quite large and basically everyone exits the bus. From there you can take a taxi to your resort which should cost you $5 for a couple (Later we learned that taxis basically operate on a "flat fee" $4 for pretty much anything in town and $5 if you go south into the resort area) BTW the fee is the same if you travel from one end of the range to the other or 100 yards. Tip: There will be a row of taxis and people telling you to get in line to wait for one. If you simply walk down the street one to one and a half blocks (remember we had luggage at this point) taxi drivers will begin honking and asking if you need a ride, you can circumvent the long line that way if you’re up to it. At the hotel, check-in was smooth and rather un-eventful. We had a verbal orientation at the front desk and our bellboy basically re-stated the orientation pointing out locations along the way to our room. The orientation is where you begin to hear all of the caveats about restaurants, buffets, pools and bars. In a nutshell they all have hours of operation so it’s not as if you have 24/7 access to everything. After a few days we found that the hours of operation were just a tiny bit annoying. You seemed to have somewhere to go get a bite to eat or a drink just about any time of day, but you might do a little trekking to locate which place was servicing the guests. The room was adequate and as many people have mentioned on trip-advisor had nice cold air, which is a big plus! The toilet handle must be held down for the entire flush if you want everything to go down, so it takes a little longer to flush. On our initial orientation, it was explained to us that the bottled water in the bathroom was NOT in the all inclusive package and if used it would be billed to us at $5 U.S. We too found a few tiny ants in the room, but we weren’t offended as we like the company. The television had 4-5 movie channels although a couple of them were Spanish or Spanish sub-titles, kinda helps you learn the language… sort of. I was disappointed to see that we did not have CNBC, I’m a market junkie and it doesn’t matter where I am in the world I like to know what the markets are doing. Wireless Internet access is $10/day or $25 for three days, and only available in the lobby but I figure there is an internet café around somewhere that I can have a drink, catch up on the market and email my friends and family. Neither of us could make the ceiling fan work, we called the front desk last night, they said they would have maintenance come look at it but we haven’t seen anyone. No matter though, like I said… the room had very nice air. A day or two later the cleaning staff showed us how to turn it on.... The grounds are very nice, very tropical and fairly well kept. As for the “beached whales” (the breaker bags positioned on the beach to keep the surf down and minimize sand erosion) some people don’t like them, but we found them to be fun! We climbed on them and challenged ourselves with “king of the mountain” activities. They were somewhat difficult to climb up on but fun just the same! My gal loves ice tea. That proved to be a bit difficult to accomplish. First of all, ice can be challenging to obtain depending upon who you ask. Secondly, as far as I know there is one location where you can get "cold tea" that is at the bar in the buffet. Another tip might be to bring a large insulated mug from home, save you a few trips back and forth and stays cold longer. We did find out that you can actually buy tour packages at Wal-Mart of all things, and as usual "Save Money, Live Better" they were the cheapest. Depending upon your courage and confidence level, renting a car and driving to the ruins is considerably less expensive and more fun. Don't forget long pants for the reservation restaurants. If you don't have them.... they won't accommodate you. We loved the setting, staff, beach, wildlife and guests. Had a good and relaxing time. We aren't night owls so the lack of nightlife at the resort was no problem for us. BTW there is plenty of nightlife downtown if you need to get your fix. The Reef does have a bar on top of the hotel above the reception area that is open until well past my bedtime. We didn't go to any shows so we have no opinion there. Contrary to my earlier statement about time share presentations (they will call it something else to try and convince you it's different) we wound up going on one as a favor to Gus in the lounge. We liked him, he gets paid for it and we got a few benefits, but in the end I left with the same taste in my mouth... I don't like the time share presentation. Lastly, I would say that this would be a good place for children. There was plenty to keep them busy and there seemed to be plenty around. :) I included a couple of pictures of the rodents that live at the resort, they are pretty cute and plentiful.

Reviews.Title: “Would not go back”
Reviews.Author: Stratta311
Reviews.Content: Hotel Rooms – if you’re a light sleeper bring some ear plugs! You can hear every foot step on the stairs and anyone’s conversation in the hallways. There is a ¼ inch gap between door/floor. Bugs (small spiders/ants) will start showing up by your 4th day in the room so bring some repellent. Water pressure and hot water is hit and miss at all times. Beds are very hard. HBO/Cinemax in room so that was nice. Time share people will hound you. Do not do a presentation until your last day if any. Experience the entire place first! On 7/23 our AC stopped working in the afternoon. We called at 2:30pm to the front desk to report the issue. We went out for the evening downtown and returned at 9pm to find a very hot room and that no one serviced our AC unit. Called FD again and they said it could not be fixed until 10am next day. I was battling Montezuma’s revenge and my wife was furious. We went down to the front desk and complained… They said there was nothing they could do and they were 100% occupied so we had to deal with it. I thought this was a huge insult (especially on our honeymoon) but they wanted to move in a roll away bed and for my wife and I to sleep in the sales office next door to the front desk. Are you kidding me…what a slap in the face! We were very upset and the only compensation given was $14 for safe charges. Give me a break. Room was hot/humid/stuffy as can be the entire night with only a squeaky fan to cool us down. The Reef should of paid for us to go to another hotel for the night, but… Nada. Grounds – Very nice and the jungle atmosphere was up kept well. Seemed like there was men working on the plants/grounds all the time. Pools were nice, but loud kids pool was next to the swim up bar… Beach and pools areas were kept clean. Food – Same thing everyday... Blah taste. Italian Restaurant was decent. Snack bar was consistent. We ate out often on 5th Avenue. Drinks – The beer tasted very bubbly (tap only) and the soda/carbonation mixture was off. The reef needs to upgrade their cheap plastic drinking cups at all the bars. Half are chipped/discolored and oftentimes your drink has the sink/soap water on the cup. DO NOT order ice in your drinks. The last 3 days of vacation was dealing with Montezuma’s Revenge! Medical response takes about 27-30 minutes to arrive and none of the staff is trained for CPR or life saving techniques (it seemed as if did not matter to the staff actually). Our thoughts and prayers are with the family that lost their grandfather by the pool on 7/19. Overall… We would not go back.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for, The Reef is a basic resort”
Reviews.Author: TravelDog20
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed at The Reef for 7 days/6 nights. We booked our trip through JetBlue Getaways and could not have been happier with the service recieved by the airline (we also booked the transfers from Cancun Intl Airport to The Reef through JetBlue--great price and reliable, highly recommend booking the trasnfers as you will be haggled by companies to take you to your hotel). After a 45 minute ride, we arrived at The Reef. Immediatley we were stopped by a man named Alex. He was clearly a timeshare salesman, ready to bug us. We had to wait until the normal check in time (3:00pm) as no rooms were available (we arrived at about 1:00). Our luggage went to the hold room and my daughter and I headed to the buffet for lunch. On our way there we looked around at the buildings of the resort. The grounds were nice, but nothing spectacular. I will not go into detail of what we did each and every day, so here is an overview of the various components of The Reef. Beach- The beach is the best part of this place. Absolutely gorgeous! There are sand bags in the water, but they don;t take away from the beautiful blue color. The sand is soft and white and there are several chairs, some with umbrellas/cabanas and some without. Food- The food at The Reef is not good. The Chula Vista buffet is awful. My daughter got sick. I even took pictures of the food for you to see. We ate at the Italian restaurant twice, the first time it was good, the second time not so much. Service is slow, but there is nothing else going on so it doesn't really matter. We did not eat in the Mexican restaurant. The ice cream parlor is good, I recommend the chocolate chip ice cream. However, it is only open from 3-6. So much for an after dinner ice cream. The snack bar is decent, the nachos and burgers there are good. Drinks are decent, but there are NO STRAWS! Strawberry daiquaris melt fast so they are hard to drink (the ice part) without a straw. Bring a box with you if you like straws. Room- Our room was a recently renovated one, yet nothing special. There were ants in the bathroom as people have mentioned. The shower worked fine, only once did it shut off randomly. Service- It is Mexico, what do you expect? The service is average. Our room was made up around 10 each morning. The staff at the front desk knows a little about getting places but other than that they don't do much else. People complain to them, but it takes awhile to get anything fixed (i.e no hot water in bathroom). Entertainment- The pool staff tries, but to no avail. The shows are awfully but made us laugh. Overall, we enjoyed Mexico, just not The Reef. Playa del Carmen is a lively place and there is always something going on. We took a cab there nightly for $5 each way. Babe's Noodles is a great inexpenisve place to eat in Playa del Carmen. Also if you need the internet, go on downtown as it is only like 25 cents for 15 minutes. We went to the ruins at Tulum by bus. It is VERY hot there, hotter than the beach at The Reef. But it is beautiful and I recommend going. A very cool experience. Would I go back to PDC? Most likely. Would I go back to The Reef? Never. Stay elsewhere. We checked out the Riu next door and didn't want to leave. I guess the saying "you get what you pay for" is the perfect description of The Reef Playacar.

Reviews.Title: “Had a great time!!!”
Reviews.Author: scottr73
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent our 20th anniversary at the Reef and had a very positive experience! I did a lot of research trying to find a small but nice place and this was definitely the right place. We flew in during the Tropical Storm Dolly so our first day was kind of a wash out. Although we booked a king size bed, when we arrived they said all they had was a double bed room. We told them that we would wait for a king bed and within an hour we were in a king bed (even in an upgraded room!). We had to move to another room the next morning, but it wasn't so bad because it was on the bottom floor-no stairs to climb. We were one building from the pool and restaurants. The room was quite nice, the bed was comfortable and we had no bugs. The food was very good...after a few days we kind of had our favorites that we kept going back for. We did eat in the Italian restaurant but was not overly impressed with it and we could not get into the Mexican restaurant. Because it was our 20th anniversary we splurged for the romantic dinner on the beach and it was well worth the extra $150 it cost. You would spend that easily on an upscale restaurant anyway! We had our own personal waiter (he only took care of us), a tape player playing Latin love songs, a bottle of Champagne, wine if you wished and a great dinner to go with it. We had the Beef Wellington-it was the best dinner we had all week! The dessert was also fantastic. The staff at the hotel were great although at times it took a little while to get your requests understood but everybody seemed very eager to please. By all means try to avoid the time share sales (unless your interested in this). We were corralled at the airport by some official looking men in white shirts and ties-they made it almost impossible to just pass them by. We were also solicited by the hotel concierge who tried to entice us to take the time share tour (without really telling us it was a time share sales pitch-it was called a welcome tour) promises discounts to a Caribbean dinner, spa treatments and others. We were not interested in this type of offer during our vacation. I did do the additional charge resort scuba dive and was very impressed with the Reef Marina staff. They were knowledgeable and professional, and also remembered my name after one visit to inquire about it. The dive was great with lots of sea life and corals to observe. We would recommend this resort and would definitely go again!

Reviews.Title: “The good and not so good of the Reef”
Reviews.Author: sledpup02
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Reef Playacar over 4th of July weekend. My first piece of advise starts at the airport. Try to ignore the tour people that approach you as you exit the airport building to get a taxi or your reserved shuttle to your hotel. Unless you are interested in time shares. Ok, on with our stay. First off, everyone we came in contact with was incredibly friendly. These residents go out of thier way to make sure you are happy. They deserve tips! We tipped our maid every day and brought some pesos down to the beach to tip the waiters there. Don't forget to tip! You will be happy you did. We found the Reef to be pleasant and clean. Very clean. I can't stress enough how tidy everything was in Playa Del Carmen. Even when it rained a couple times there were people out sweeping the water away. Our room was nice, the bed was a bit hard but it worked for us. We didn't see any bugs in our room, actually, I don't remember seeing any bugs anywhere! I did see a couple snakes and lots of geckos on the property, also a large rodent looking animal that was really cool, can't remember it's name, think rabbit crossed with a deer and that's pretty close. We had a beautiful Iguana that lived above our bathroom window and we could see it from our balcony. We took in a couple attractions. Chichen Itza and Xcarat Both are highly reccommended. Try booking a Cancun rides tour of Chichen Itza, it was perfect! Airconditioning and great drinks and snacks all along the way. You can book tours upstairs above the main lobby. We didn't know this until we were taken upstairs to do a seminar, but we backed out because it was taking too long. The food at the Reef is a hit and miss. The snack bar at the pool is open in the afternoon and then again late at night. Very good quesadillas. The buffet is alright, nothing spectacular. If you miss either of these you better have reservations at one of the restraunts there. You have to make reservations between 9 and 10:30 in the morning of the day you want to eat. Oh, and there is no room service. The beach was great! lots of places to lounge, sand feels great, no errosion to be seen. The sand bags out in the water are a lot of fun to get on top of and make for a nice lagoon to swim around in. Don't forget the drinks. They make the rounds and bring you whatever you like. If you want some starbucks, don't worry, there is one on 5th avenue and also one the opposite way across from the Riu Mexico. We ate on 5th Ave. at Los Rancheros. It was very good. But make sure you don't double tip. The tip will already be on the check, we found that out afterwards. They may "inadvertanly tell you it's tax. It's not. The not so good, not very much :) We were hounded to do a timeshare seminar at the resort. It got to the point that we didn't want to walk through the front lobby anymore. But it didn't ruin our trip :) We had a problem with the A/C in our room. We asked that it be fixed and it never was. We did tell the front desk that we would like another room because of the problem and they upgraded us to an ocean view that became available. That was a plus :) Overall it was a wonderful stay and the adventures we went on were spectacular.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous time at the Reef”
Reviews.Author: mdgirl2
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Reef for 1 week. We had a fabulous time, despite TS Dolly. We took a cab to 5th Avenue in Playa ($5) - It is a safe and easy walk also-20 minutes. There are bikes that you can sign out/and they give you locks. Go to the towel desk and they will take you to the kids club (that's where they store the bikes). The buffet worked for me - I'm not picky. We did not eat at the "specialty resturaunts" - If you want to you go to the front desk at 9 am and get a number and then they asign you a time. We enjoyed all the bars (4- swim up, pool, lobby, and "sports bar") I enjoyed "dirty monkies". We went diving - I got my certification $420 3 days. Leo and Jen and Miguel and Chris will hook you up :-) Stay clear of time share talk..."we can get you <whatever you need> for really cheap if you listen to us talk." We just said that this is not our first time to Mexico and planned our own adventures. The room was clean and comfortable. After reading other reviews I brought ant traps and a candle. I didn't need either. I did burn the candle b/c I liked the scent I brought. You sign towels out and if you don't return them by the end of your stay there is a $25 charge. We kept our towels each night, so we could save a spot at the beach/pool (we liked lounging in the beds). Then, we exchanged them for dry towels. At one time, I think we had 5 towels ou :-) The beach was great. The sand bags help with calming the water. If you like waves, swim out to the sand bags-jump over. We hung out on the sand bags and got some sun. We also took out the sea kayak in te AM. My husband and I enjoyed out vacation away from our children! Wish we were back.

Reviews.Title: “great resort”
Reviews.Author: amafi2
Reviews.Content: My family and I just returned from the Reef last week, and I have to say it was a great trip. The resorts grounds are set back from the beach in a beautiful tropical setting. The beach was wonderful, they have the man made beach barriers out in the ocean, which makes the water nice and calm when you get in. You can always swim out further if you like. No problems with getting a beach chair, they also have a couple of canopy beds around the pool and the beach .(no cost) If you like to take long walks on the beach, you can go a very long way to the right of the resort. The staff was very friendly and always greeted us with a smile. The rooms were average and were kept clean. Food choices were plenty, I always found something I liked. We all enjoyed the food at the snack bar. Getting reservations at the specialty restaurants was never a problem. We did not see the shows, but didn't really go for that. You can walk into the port, a good 15 minute walk. We did and even saw some small Mayan ruins on the way. I got a fantastic deal online for this resort, my expectations were not high, I did not expect 5 star , luxury accommodations. I really wanted a good beach, not to fight over chairs at the beach, a clean room, nice staff, enough food choices, and what I received from this stay was well beyond what I expected.

Reviews.Title: “Mediocre (We called it The WannaReef)”
Reviews.Author: miguelvagalume
Reviews.Content: I'll make it quick. Description: - Well decorated and furnished PUBLIC areas. - Two pools, one with a bar inside. One good for kids, the other great for relax. - Clean blue water on the beach... but the bad thing of no rocks or reef in front of the hotel is that you won't see a single fish. - If you don't mind some crows (or something very very similar) picking up food from the plates left around the pool and restaurants, no prob. Pros: - It's not a macro-hotel, so it's very comfortable to go to the buffet or the cookers to get dishes, instead of hundreds of people rushing to reserve a table placing a glass of water, jacket, book, towel, whatever... - Very close to Playa del Carmen - Rooms not miles away from the entrance, as in many All Inc. Cons: - We got the already notorious ants in the bathroom. Not too many, but there they were. - Poor furniture. Worse than mediocre. (we've got pictures. We'll upload them if we have time). - The worst of all: Male waiters seem to be... somewhere else. Or on something... or plain lazy... They try to keep you off the drinks (to save?) and they tell they will bring your drinks. 9 out of 10 they get it wrong... asking for them in perfect Spanish. Painfully slow service. Worse than the mexican average, we've been in other hotels in the area. - Not much variety on the buffet area. Pasta + grilled fish-meat + typical dishes + the cold stuff. That's it. - No ice cream as dessert. You can only go to the ice cream "restaurant" when the buffet closes. Again... trying to save? - No decaf coffee. The hotel is in the middle of one of the most popular places in Mexico... I don't get it. Difficult to believe in 2008 as it may seem, they don't have either coffee or cocoa. Just something called "chocomilk" (cold milk with very little cocoa) at breakfast. - We had some problems with the internet cards (you pre-pay 10$ for an hour). The day we tried to use it for the second time, it read we had no credit left. Impossible we had run out of credit: internet didn't work the night before. Weird-funny-pathetic to hear the guy at the front desk telling us that "being a particular case, they would charge us for that card". - We had water on the floor of our bathroom nearly everyday. It seems a pipe leaked a little. After the kind of service we found, we didn't bother to call anyone. - THE anecdote: One night we had to go to bed really early. At 1.30 am our neighbours were being VERY noisy and we called to front desk, so they could tell our neighbours to keep it down. At front desk the wrote down our room number.... the security guy came minutes later and told us to keep it quiet!!!! We had to tell him he got it wrong. We won't come back to this all inc. Note: Public areas look much nicer in pictures. That's why we show our room, because that's what you mainly pay for. We think it tries to look like an elegant resort but if fails miserably when looked from a shorter distance. Feel free to contact us if you want any more information about the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “exactly what we expected”
Reviews.Author: MWak5
Reviews.Content: We arrived from england on 21st June for 2 weeks and had a great time. As a family of 4 with boys aged 17 and 14 there was plenty of entertainment. The beach is fantastic and the sand banks made for good fun and keep the jet skis and catamarans away from the bathers. Food is good enough and varied but didnt rate the italian restaurant with a very limited menu. We would go back and definitely preferred it to the commercial Cancun.

Reviews.Title: “Great time at the Reef Playacar”
Reviews.Author: gimamura
Reviews.Content: Our group of 11 stayed at the Reef Playacar from 6/24 through 7/1. My wife and I, our 14 year old daughter, 18 year old son and 7 other 17 and 18 year olds. It was a high school graduation trip for our son and his friends. Our trip started in Los Angeles via Charlotte,NC then down to Cancun via US Airways. A long trip but one that was truly appreciated by all when we finally got to the Reef. I used a shuttle van company called Cancun Express which met us at the Airport and transported us down to the Reef. For a group of 11 we had our own van which only cost us $140 for round tirp transportation. I called ahead of time to get 4 rooms together in the same bldg. for the 8 teenagers, and that worked out great as they had the 1st floor to themselves in Bldg. #7. My wife and I along with our daughter were in a 1st floor bldg. #8 next door. Bldg. #9 is right next to the pool and the restaurants, so being in Bldg. #8 and #7 were great since we were close enough to the pool and restaurants, but not close that any noise would bother us. We ate at the buffet restaurant for morning, lunch and dinner most of the time, and found that the quality of the food and the choices were very good. Everyone in our group really enjoyed the food served at the buffets. The teenage kids also ate a lot at the snack bars, where they enjoyed the cheeseburgers, fries, ribs, and pizzas. They commented on how good the fries were. You could also get them covered with melted cheese. My wife and I really enjoyed the rotisserie chicken that they served there. Just as good a El Pollo Loco here in the states. We also made reservations on 3 separate evening for the Italian and Mexican restaurants that are located upstairs of the buffet restaurant. Once at the Mexican and twice at the Italian restaurants. At the Mexican restaurant I had the beef and shrimp skewers that were okay but not anything special. A few in the group ordered the fajitas, and they said they were excellent. Now the Italian restaurant was were I enjoyed my best meal. On both occasions I ordered the filet of beef covered in some type of delicious sauce, that was absolutely delicious. Others ordered the health conscious salmon fillet, and they really enjoyed it. To make reservations to either of these restaurants, you have to be at the front desk at 9:00am sharp to make reservations. The trick to this is to get there at 8:30am, get a number that they pass out, then sit around or come back at 8:55am and wait until they call your number. Seating is limited and it seems that they only make available only a portion of the restaurant seating for the guests that buy the all inclusive package. I'm thinking that the remaining seats are possibly for timeshare owners. Even with a group of 11 we were able to get reservations at a prime time 7:30 pm on 2 of the 3 nights that we ate in these restaurants. The 1st night that we ate, we could only get a 9:00 reservation, since I didn't get to the reservation desk until 8:50am of that morning, and by that time, the number I was given was 14. Outside of all of the eating that we did, most of our time was spent at the activities pool which is the pool closest to the beach. The activities desk is right next to this pool, and is the spot where you get your pool/beach towels. You sign out for the towels against your room number, and are suppose to return the towels by 5:00pm each day, when the activities desk closes. After 5:00pm you can return the towels to the front desk. We chose to keep our towels in our room each evening with us, then we traded them in for new towels each day thereafter. At the end of our time, we then returned them to the front desk. I've read that there is a $35 US fee if towels are returned. One of the great things about the pools at the Reef is that they are opened until 11:00pm each evening, so you can relax in the pool even after dinner. The snack bar which is close by stays open until 1:30am. A great place to go late in the evenings if your still hungry after the buffet restaurants closes at 9:00pm. Each evening except for Friday evenings the Reef has some type of entertainment show in the upstairs theatre above the front lobby. One night we took our daughter to see the Disney show to see the activities staff dressed up like various Disney characters and perform Disney Movie skits to music. Great to go to if you have little kits. One night they had a 60s and 70s music show where the activities staff did skits based on 60s and 70s music. We went into the town of Playa Del Carmen a couple of times to do some shopping as well as to see the sights. Lots of souvenir shops to choose from, We also rented a van from Hertz, and drove down to Tulum one afternoon to visit the ruins. Make sure that you take bug repellant there, as there are some areas of the ruins where you will get attacked by mosquitos. Also, 1 day we drove down to Yal-Ku lagoon next to Akumal beach to do some snorkeling. Probably not as good as snorkeling in Xel-Ha, but definitely cheaper as the cost to get in is only $9 US dollars per person. You can rent snorkeling eqpt for $10 US. All in all this was a fabulous trip for all of us, nobody wanted to go back home, and were dissapointed when we had to. By the way the whole staff, from the people in the lobby, the people in the restaurant, and the activities staff were excellent. Never experienced a single problem with any of them. The rooms were pleasant and we encountered no problems. Though I had read previously that the beds were hard, I felt that they were quite comfortable. I should mention that though tipping is not required. I made it a habit to tip $1 to $2 dollars fairly frequently to the buffet restaurant, snack bar, and bar staff. At the reservation restaurants since we were a large group I tipped $20 each time. I know from their expressions that they truly appreciated the tips.

Reviews.Title: “Loved The Reef”
Reviews.Author: leon4
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed at The Reef June 30th thru July 4th. This was for her graduation present. At first I was a little hesitant after reading some of the reviews, but after arriving at The Reef, I was relieved. The place is beautiful. It is not a five star resort, however it is very clean and the staff are very friendly. Our room was very nice, we did have a slight problem with tiny ants in the bathroom, however, I was prepared for this after reading a review. I brought ant traps with me. I put a couple in the bathroom and we had an ant free stay!!! My daugther and I had a great stay. Playa Del Carmen is a short walk away and very fun. We went to Xcaret and my daughter swam with the dolphins. It is a little pricey, I would recommend getting the plus package. A meal is included as well as locker, towel and snorkel rentals. You also get a couple of beverages. I cant wait to return!!

Reviews.Title: “tropical paridise”
Reviews.Author: coolesteddy
Reviews.Content: Well to start off, the trip started from San Antonio Tx, onto Mexico City and to Cancun, our trip was from June 12-16. There were 4 adults on this trip. On arrival to the Reef, we were greeted pleasantly, assisted with our bags with smiling faces. The hotel staff were very helpfull! We check in, I was handed a cold beer and my wife received a cool margarita, which was very much appriciated after the long trip, and we were given a quick review of all the amenities on the resort(10min). Just Beautifull! This resorts sits in the middle of a jungle like atmosphere, tall palms, trees, green ivys, free flowing water fall into a large cenote. Very lush with small/cozy pathways that lead to all rooms and to pool/beach areas. Well of coarse, we were all very hungry, and the resort buffet was open(GREAT), (FOOD AVAILABLE FROM 7AM TO 2AM) The food presentation was wonderfull, plenty to pick from with a large range of food types, from Italian, American and yes even Mexican food at your request. Everything was made fresh on the grill right in front of you. The food was very tasty, and same for all the trimmings, and of coarse, they had different types of drinks(juices/milks/bottled water/soda/cold beer/wine, etc.) what ever your taste buds like, seems that they had it. The wait staff was plentifull, and heplfull. If the wait staff was very attentive, a nice tip was received, but not required. The view from the the dinning area, beautiful! Well after our meal, back to the rooms. We found our rooms very well cooled, plenty of hot water, but just an empty mimi frigd. No problem. Beds were comfortable, TV, and a nice balcony, with plenty of views to just soak it all in. We were informed of a nightly show on the grounds, we attended 1 show, which was entertaining. They have a special on Fridays, where you sign up for a quick trip to Senior Frogs in Playa De Carmen, they take you and bring you back after lots of fun and drinks! What a party, maybe 4hrs worth of fun. But if the party scene isn't your bag, thats ok too. There are plenty of lounging areas to just relax and have a cool refreshment. The BEACH, what a place to just hang out. The water was clean, warm, and just beautiful. From an aqua to a deep blue, The picture will stay with you for a long time to remember! 1 thing, there are some man made breakers(large sand bags) about 50-75ft from waters edge, but these breakers are fun to use also. You can snorkle on the deep side and swim on the shallow. The staff has an activity center, which you will need to ask for large blue towels, they will provide you with, they just need your room #, all free, plenty of places to lay your head on, nice cabanas, plenty of umbrillas with small tables, try and get a bed near the beach area (to get 1, you need to be an earlier bird, they go pretty fast, but plenty to pick from, and if your lucky, ahhh) all very close to the beach and water. You will always have multiple bars and snack bar open at your convienence. The pool areas are great, 1 has a swim up bar, the other is where all the activities are done(water polo, water vollyball, water arobics). Very clean! Things to do on the beach? Well, for this resort, they had everything right there for your picking, from a short snorkling tour(private reef), scuba, to para sailing, fishing trips in the early morning, jet ski's, paddle boats, kayaks, lots and lots of fun for your trip. If you decide to go para sailing(50-60US DOLL) or you want to go on a fishing trip, just ask for Charlie at the para sailing booth, this guy will take good care of you. I found out that all of the other resorts near by, they were sending there visitors to our beach for there entertainment. Like I said, we had all the fun stuff right at our finger tips. And if you need alitle pampering, don't miss the massage! All types, and time lengths, where you want it (room/spa/beach), very relaxing, and very reasonably priced. Downtown Playa- lots of shopping available! My wife(the wheeler and dealer) brought home plenty of silver, and misc. items. While we were there, we celebrated our anniversary, our rep. at the resort, made arraingments to eat at a resturant named AJUA in Playa. What a great place to eat, and very reasonably priced (100us doll) for 4 adults, meal/drinks and a special made cake(delicious). They had live music (SALSA), what a blast! Well, I know I have been alittle long, but I hope that you have a better insight to this 4 star resort. This resort is great for singles, couples and families. Would recommend it to anybody who wants alittle relaxation from the hard busy life. Trip was to short, can't wait to get back! Have fun, and enjoy your trip!

Reviews.Title: “Didn't expect the greatest, and still was disappointed”
Reviews.Author: airfoiler
Reviews.Content: We just got back from our stay at the Reef. We were there 6/16/08 thru 6/20/08. We booked our vacation through JetBlue Getaways. JetBlue Getaways listed several hotels in several price ranges. I checked Trip Advisor for the hotels in our price range, and settled on The Reef. I knew I wasn't booking a 5 star resort, but I was still disppointed in the experience. Apart from the hotel, everything else about booking with JetBlue was uneventful. I was worried about the transfers to the hotel and back, but they occured like clockwork. We arrived at the hotel around 5PM. We were hungry so we went to the buffet for dinner. They offered 3 stations with a selection of meats and roasts, pastas, and authentic mexican selections. We stuck with the meats and roasts and found all of them to be disgusting. Each selection was overcooked, covered in inedible sauces, and were as tough as shoe leather. It was our first and last dinner at the hotel. After dinner we opted to check out downtown Playa. When we returned to the hotel we found that the sink in our bathroom was completly infested by thousands of tiny ants. It was off to the front desk to ask for an exterminator. To give the staff time to clear our room of ants, we decided to check out the late night snack bar. The food there was lousy as well. As we waited for our food, 5 huge cockroaches came out to visit us from behind the grill. We were starving from the lousy dinner and horrible snack bar, but the cockroaches solved our appetite problem for the evening. After our disgusting experience at the snack bar we headed back to the room to call it night. When we got back, the ant problem still had not been taken care of, and we were still facing our infestation. It was off to the front desk to switch rooms. We switched rooms for the night without any problems from the front desk. The next morning we awoke to more ants, and now a cockroach in our room. We had only been on the property a little over 12 hours, and we were ready to check out. Our complaints led to an upgraded room. Through the whole experience the staff was very understanding. The upgraded room was much nicer than the first two, but at this point the Reef experience was ruined for us. We were constantly on the look out for the remainder of our trip for bugs in our room. Apart from bugs in all the rooms we had, our only other complaint was the airconditioning. We were greatful that it worked and blew cold air, but not one thermostat worked. The rooms ended up being way too cold every night. We will definetly go back to PDC again. It is a very cool town. 5th Avenue and Playacar reminded us of Coconut Grove in Miami. We eneded up going out to dinner every night. Because of the money we spent on meals, the next time we go back to PDC we will upgrade our budget to stay at a higher rated resort. We suggest the following places for food and/or beverages in PDC. The Jaguar serves great steaks. Go to Viva Margarita for great mango margaritas and good live music. There is a cuban restaurant right near Viva Margarita. Go there for live music and great salsa dancing. Stay away from the Reef, upgrade your budget, and spend alot of time in downtown PDC. I think these are three ways to make your experience better than ours.

Reviews.Title: “Could not ask for more!!!”
Reviews.Author: stillhappyafter10y
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Reef from June 2-10th and had a wonderful time. I did some reading on here before we left and didnt quite know what to think about the hotel, and it was a great price so we could not pass it up how bad could it be right? Well let me tell you it was perfect. The rooms are very cold, with a mini fridge and blackout curitns, bathtub and shower, hair dryer, iron, even a makeup mirror. The beds are a little hard but not that bad and we had a down blanket it was really nice. We did pay extra for the room safe but I really dont think it was needed, but for my peace of mind... the only bad thing about the rooms are that you can hear people through the doors, but if you drink enough and get enough sun you will sleep like a baby. Next is the food. The buffet is great. I miss it. For breakfast you have all different kinds of fresh fruit, with yougret, muffins, toast, little breakfast breads, cereal, And then you move over to the hot food. There is an omlet stand that he makes them to order very good. A pancake, french toast, and creap area that is made right in front of you. My hubby ate this every day. The last area is a mexican breakfast that makes very good food that I have never had before. They take a fried flat tortilla top with beans, over easy egg, peas, ham, and red sauce with cheese it was great. A little heavy for breakfast but great.. Lunch has everything from cold cuts to chicken tacos(all tacos are soft with corn tortilla) with everythin else you could ask for always 3 or 4 different veggies cooked in different ways very interesting but great., always rice and beans, and a few different kinds of meats. Just keep an open mind and try everything and you will be suprised. Dinner is like lunch. You never know what you will get. 1 day they had a big roast iwth mash pots and gravy, other nights grilled steat, chicken, porkchops..... And always some great kind of fish. We ate fish ever night cooked different ways. One day they cooked the entire fish and served it that way it was the best. And at dinner they have a pasta area that makes it right in front of you, very cool but we never tried it. We wanted all the more mexican foods. They always had a huge selection of different foods and we never were disappointed. You can also eat at the snack bar. They have burgers(good), grilled chicked sands, coldcuts, even some bbq(we didnt try). The do have pizzas a little under cooked for us( I like mine crunchy) but still good. And the have nachos that are GREAT. We did eat dinner at both resturants, very nice fine dinning. The food was Very Good at both. The service was super. Anything that you wnat you get. Everyone goes out of thier way to help. Even the people cleaning the grounds which are beautiful. A little tip is nice to give but the service is the same with or without, they do not expect it. But we always tried to tip. The beach is beautiful. We were a little disappointed that there were no fish or anything to see with snorkling gear. But beautiful. All the beaches along our strip were the same we walked a long way down had to go over some sand bags and walk part through the water and one area we walked on a walkway but it made a very fun and interesting walk. We did it a couple fo times. All of the drinks were very good, try the miami vice was my fav. The beer was always cold, and flowing. Nothing was watered down. In the morning they have yoga(FUN), then spanish lessions, step aerobics(good workout) and then water aerobics(didnt do). And then volleyball in the water or on the beach(didnt get a chance to do to) but looked like fun. We also didnt go to any of the nightly shows. To sum it up (this ended up long sorry) Iam ready to go back. I loved the romantic jungle vibe, the small peaceful feel, the relaxing beach with umberalls it was perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Got what we expected”
Reviews.Author: KcCabinfever
Reviews.Content: Our group of 4 stayed at the Reef from the 4-11th of June. Overall I think we all had a nice time. I'll break it down in categories to simplify. Room: Had no water at all upon check in. That was fixed within 10 minutes and we had no further problems with that. The water pressure isn't great, but we always had water and had no problems with water temp as some reviews mentioned. Our sink leaked a little onto the floor, but it wasn't a big deal. The beds had eggcrate mattresses and were pretty comfortable. Fridge in the room stayed cold. (No drinks were provided by the hotel, I stocked up in the gift shop and always had water and soda to drink). Air conditioning: worked very well, kept the room nice and cool. Also a ceiling fan. In room safe at an extra charge of $2 dollar a day (FYI: $100 charge if you loose the keyto the safe) Each room has it's own balcony with a small table and chairs. We had a small issue with what I think were tiny ants on the bathroom sink. But this resort is in a jungle setting, so we weren't surprised by this. Beach: We were very pleasantly surprised at how nice it was, and there were always plenty of chairs and umbrellas or palapas. There are several beds also and on they days we were there by 10:00 some were still available. The large "sand whales" did kind of take away from the view, but I guess it is a trade off. Pools: There are two pools. One with all the activities (a little too active and loud for me). And the swim up pool which is connected to the small kiddie pool. The pools aren't huge, but they never seemed to get really packed full of people. Food: The snack bar seemed to have the best food. Burgers, pizza, nachos,etc. Too bad they close at 6:00 and don't reopen until 10:30 pm. The buffet was average at best. On occasion I found something pretty tasty, most of the time that wasn't the case. But we always found something we could eat. The specialty restuarants (Italian and Mexican) require reservations that must be made daily between 9:00-11:00 am. So if you go on an excursion, or aren't there at that time you can't make a reservation. We only at at the Italian because the Mexican is closed on Sunday and Tues. My meal was completely inedible. Both times I went there I managed to get the same awful sauce on two different meals (? Alfredo sauce and Garlic butter sauce??- same ) I know we meet several people who were very happy with their meals, so maybe it was just that sauce. Service: Very inconsistent (and this didn't change with tipping I tipped very well infact regardless of service). Some people we came in contact with were great and very friendly. Most of the time though, we felt ignored. It was like we had to always say excuse me can you help me with....what ever we needed at the time. It was like we were bothering them. This was from the front desk to the bars to the beach towel shack to the restaurants. I don't know if it is poor training, or if certain ones are trying to make a point or if they truely just don't care. Entertainment: Not good. Only went to a few shows so I can't really speak for what they do on the nights we weren't there. One of the males from our group had an incident with Miguel from the entertainment crew. He was extremely rude at the gym one morning and wouldn't let him come in to lift weights. (He is just a big bully with big ego IMO) Overall: The location is great, nice walk to town (20 min at a leisurely pace) We have stayed at several AI and most of them from this area (Playacar). I knew before I booked here that it was a "budget AI" We got a pretty good deal and we got what we paid for. Our expectations weren't high. Except for the service we weren't really disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Just as good as hotels triple its price on the same beach”
Reviews.Author: iamkasiaNYC
Reviews.Content: We came to PDC for a wedding that was being held at a $600 a night a few doors down from the Reef. As a result, we stayed at the Reef the night preceeding the wedding. We booked it on Expedia and paid $160 total for 2 people all inclusive. Although the pricey hotel was definetly beautiful and exceeded my expectations gastronomically (the food was divine), there was little difference between that hotel and the Reef. I thought the hotel grounds were very similar in terms of how beautiful they were. IThe Reef's pools and the poolbar were beautiful and fun. We played several volleyball games on the beach with other tourists. There were a lot of kids, but there were also a lot of people are our age in their late 20s and early 30s creating a cool ambiance at the resort. Overall, we both thought this was an EXCELLENT value. Gorgeous grounds, fabulous pools and poolbar, snack bar from 8 am to 2 am, fun sporting activities, free kayaks, right on the beautiful beach, big rooms, balconies, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Time”
Reviews.Author: michigan48
Reviews.Content: We just got back form our stay at The Reef. Four of us went and spent seven days. What a great place and priced right. The entire staff was always very friendly. I did write a short note written in Spanish asking the maid to leave extra bath towels and to make sure everything in the room was kept stock all week long. I left a small tip everyday to make sure this happened. They really appreciate the tips, from the maids to the bartenders and wait staff and bus boys in the restaurants. Just a few bucks and they are very happy. They work very hard and don’t make much money. From Breakfast thru dinner...food was very good. No problems with our room at all. Pool bar during the day was a great time as we met people from all over the world. I have no complaints and the time share people did not hassle us at all. What a fantastic beech...looked like The Reef had one of the nicest beeches there. 5th ave is great. The vendors by the main taxi stand have the best tacos, burritos, beef, chicken or whatever kind you want for 10 pesos or 1 US dollar. For a nice Dinner "The Blue Lobster" was very good. Moderately priced. Very large menu of sea food and beef. They also carry Angus Beef. Service was excellent. I had the fillet and lobster, it was fantastic. We spent many nights on 5th Ave hitting the bars and restaurants and shops. Be advised a lot of the shops and restaurants start closing down between 10 and 11PM. Some bars stay open later, but if you want to see everything get down there fairly early. I would go back to The Reef again in a heart beat....

Reviews.Title: “Great time at the Reef”
Reviews.Author: lasvegas11
Reviews.Content: Four of us returned from the Reef yesterday and we had a great time. We have stayed in another all-inclusive in PDC so we have some experience to compare it to. We refused the orientation upon arrival. After traveling all day we just wanted to start enjoying ourselves and not spend hours listening about their timeshare. We had to wait a few hours for our rooms to be ready anyway but we used that time to eat and explore the resort on our own. They put us in two rooms with double beds rather than kings. We asked to be moved and they next day they moved us all. The walls are thin and we were awoken around 2 am almost everynight by a group of loud college aged guests. This was frustrating. This resort seemed to be more of a party place than other places we have stayed. Everything in the rooms worked great. Air conditioning was very cold, water was hot, doors locked, etc... However, several days we returned to our room to find the door wide open and people working in there. Several times we had to wait for them to finish, which was frustrating because we had returned to our room to shower and meet our friends for dinner. One day they cut a hole in our bathroom wall and returned while I was in the shower insisting they look at it again. The next day they returned to patch the hole. Really it was not a big deal, just a little inconvienent. We ate at the buffet, the snack bar and at one of the reservations only restaurants. The buffet food was OK, we enjoyed that they cooked in front of us as we ordered. We wished that we had tried the other reservation restaurant as the Mexican Grill was pretty good (although very slow service- almost 2 hours). We are all a little sick now but I can't say it was definitely the hotel food. We also enjoyed that many of the bars and restaurants were open at the same time and for a variety of hours. A previous AI resort that we staryed at only one restaurant or snack bar was open at a time. We had more to choose from at the Reef. We always got chairs or a daybed near the beach or the pool. There were a lot of people in the pool with the swim up bar, very festive. We enjoyed the beach and made the most out of the bladders. We enjoyed the hotel grounds. The jungle atmosphere was fun and nice to walk around. We walked to town and all around the resort neighborhood. It is a very nice area, better than other places where we have stayed in PDC. My biggest complaint was upon checkout. Each day they put two bottles of water in your room and charge $5 if you drink one. We brought our own bottled water so we didn't drink theirs. But by the end of the week they had left four bottles of water for us anyway. Our friends checked out before we did and the hotel charged them for all of their water. They went back to their room to get the bottles to prove that they had not drank them and all of the bottles were gone. We went to our room to get our bottles before we checked out and found all of our bottles gone as well and they tried to charge us $20 for them. We refused to pay for them and they had us sign something that said we did not drink the water. The whole thing was kind of shady I thought. Overall we had a great time and will probably go back. We have experienced better and worse. For the price, I think it is worth it.

Reviews.Title: “No reef there but still great.”
Reviews.Author: hydrorock
Reviews.Content: We selected this resort based soley on its location and after reviewing the websites, reviews and ratings for all the all-inclusive resorts in the Cancun area. We really were impressed with it all the way around. It is one of the smaller resorts in the area (around 200 rooms) and that is one of the reasons we chose it. There were no long lines at the buffet or shortage of good chairs on the beach. The property is rather narrow but is very long and the buildings (12 rooms in each) are seperated by a "jungle" environment. The grounds were immaculate and the staff were super friendly and helpful. We stayed (6 days) in building 10 near the pool. Here is sort of my breakdown of things by subject: Rooms: Very clean with no real issues. Our air conditioning worked fine. The water temperature in the shower did fluctuate quite a bit. Beds were not hard as reported by other reviewers. No bugs in site. Beach: Someone narrow with huge "sand bags" to break the surf. On the days we were there it was very windy and rough. There would have been no way to swim in the ocean without them breaking the waves. We did not get to use any of the available equipment (masks, windsurfing, sailboats,etc.). I did not find the beach to be all that spectacular compared to other places that I've been to. I was disappointed that the beach is cut off by buildings with seawalls to both the north and past only one resort to the south. If you like long walks on the beach this is not the place for you. There are no shells on these beaches which makes the sand "soft". Staff: Everyone was great. Communication not a problem at all. I do recommend tipping them for even better service. Security was very good with staff walking the grounds and at entrance points. Pools: Could be a little larger but worked out fine for us. Daily water aerobics, pool and beach volleyball and other activities. Food: Overall the food at the buffet was pretty good. Due to the somewhat changing variety we thought one of the nights was fantastic and one fell a little flat. Our one complaint is that the full breakfast buffett wasn't open until after 7:30, which was after the time our tours had departed on 2 of the days. Returned from a tour at 8:30 and buffet selection was very limited at that time. Snack area near pool was very good. Drinks are brand name and not watered down. Entertainment: Save yourself some time and skip the nightly shows. If you are looking to be entertained, this is not the place for you. Location: We picked this resort based on its location away from Cancun and closer to the ruins of Tulum and the water park Xel-Ha. It worked out great in that regard. It is walking distance to downtown Playa del Carmen which we did twice. It is very safe and you shouldnt hesitate to do that. We borrowed the hotels bikes one morning and went through all the nearby streets. There are small ruins in a free public park located less than 3 minutes away from the resort along the sidewalk which you should go see. Overall, we really enjoyed this resort and our visit to Mexico. I would recommend it if you are looking for a smaller less crowded, but also less frills, resort in the middle of everything.

Reviews.Title: “Can't Wait To Go Back”
Reviews.Author: JoshsEsposa
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from celebrating our 2nd anniversary at The Reef Playa car. We chose Playacar after going to Cancun on our Honeymoon and 1st Year Anniversary. We loved Playacar and Playa del Carmen! Exactly what we were hoping for. This is not a luxuary 5 star resort, but it was absolutely fabulous! The grounds were beautiful, and you could tell they take great pride in their tropical setting they have created! The service and personal are extremely friendly and always did all they could to help us when we needed them. Check in was easy and no one bugged us once about time shares. We even mentioned this to one of the concierge ladies and she told us to remember that this is our vacation and to never be bothered with time share offers. When we got to the room we realized the sliding glass door to our deck wouldn't lock. We would not have cared if we were not on the ground level. When we went to call the front desk, the phone did not work. We walked back to the lobby and they had both things fixed in 10 minutes! The service was awesome. We stayed in 3 different rooms during our trip. The first time we asked to be moved after a night of no sleep due to noise. We had a room right by the bar open until 2 am (I can't remember all the names of the bars). They immediately found us another room. The next room we had was because we checked out for 2 nights to stay in Cancun (We went to stay two nights at the Crown Paradise, which was awful! We couldn't wait to get back to the Reef). When we came back to the Reef they put us in one of the "nicer" rooms. It felt like they put a matress pad on the bed and updated the linens, which gave the room that little extra something the other rooms were missing. The AC and hot water worked great in all 3 rooms! The only thing someone might have an issue with is the size of the two pools, they are on the small size. But we didn't care since we loved the ocean there and would swim in the ocean. The buffet food was delicious and satisfying, especially breakfast time. And the little snack bar was good, except at times it seemed understaffed and there would be a huge crowd waiting for food, but they usually got all the orders filled in a short time. We hired a professional photographer for a photo session, and The Reef was very accomodating! They even cut off our wristbands for us so they wouldn't stand ou t in the pics and gave us new ones after the session. I was impressed/grateful for that. We realized this was not a super luxurious resort but it was exactly what we were hoping for. Small and even the activites planned were not loud and annoying like the bigger hotels. We cannot wait to go back to the Reef Playacar!

Reviews.Title: “Laid back, casual, relaxing!”
Reviews.Author: Norwego
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I just got back from a 6 day stay at the Reef Playacar. We had a GREAT time and will definitely be back. This is not a fancy place, if you want fancy, book a 5 star somewhere else. The best part about the Reef Playacar, it is at the end of the hotel boulevard. Therefore, it has the best beach. And it is extremely close to town. During the day, I would recommend renting one of the resort's bikes (free!) and biking into town. So fun! At night you can catch a cab for $5 bucks and go out in town. If you want really wonderful food, go into town for that. The staff are warm and friendly and go out of their way to help you. We tipped generously. If you want a no-frills, laid back vaca, where you can lay on the beach all day and read and swim, and then go out at night, this is the place for you!

Reviews.Title: “Definitely worth the price!”
Reviews.Author: newfy
Reviews.Content: We booked this through JetBlue Vacations. Overall experience was very positive. Check in was very fast. We were directed to the concierge and knew that this may be to book timeshare tour. We told the concierge we were only interested in the details of the resort, locations of things, etc. and she did not mention anything about timeshare. The resort was very well maintained, very clean, in convenient location to town and airport. The beach was great, no problem getting lounge chairs with shade. The pool areas were very pretty with lounge chairs and large beds. Our room (924) was two buildings from the pool and beach. The room was simply decorated, with a small balcony, tiled bathroom. The room was immaculate.You can hear people coming and going if you are a light sleeper may want a room away from this area. I left a note for an extra blanket and the maid took care of this, she also left fresh flowers in the room. Bed was very hard. The food in the buffet was ok to good. The stations had grilled meat, chicken, fish, empanada's, tacos, etc. The breakfast was good, eggs, Mexican food, and fresh fruit smoothies. The two non-buffet restaraunts were also ok. The service was good and the food was cooked(grilled) to order. We didn't have trouble getting a reservation. We did not see any of the entertainment. The staff were all very friendly and polite. This was a bargain, have stayed in more expensive resorts in the DR with much worse food and service. Being close to town was also a bonus if you want to hear some music or try local restaraunts, shopping. Transfers and service from Jet Blue were all very good.

Reviews.Title: “Good Time”
Reviews.Author: cbuck79
Reviews.Content: I read the reviews before checking in so I had some idea of what to expect. I was hoping for the best and, for the most part, I was indeed lucky. The entryway is very nice and the staff quite helpful. A Rain Forest type theme is prevalent throughout. As most others stated, the rooms are modest and very clean. No bugs and the showers had both hot water and strong pressure each time throughout our 5 day trip. The maids kept things very clean and were quite cordial. The beach is one of the larger and nicest beaches of the resorts here. We walked along the beach and none of the other places had a nicer one. The Reef's was not only a littler bigger but it had mroe umbrellas and tiki type huts than the others. The bars and food are right next to the beach and pools so everything is very convenient. In fact from one end of the property to the next takes literally 30 seconds so it's very quaint. The drinks were definitely not the best and the food wasn't anything great either. We only tried the buffett and the Italian restaurant at night. You'll be hard pressed to find anything decent on site during this time of day. I was skeptical of other reviews saying the same but it's definitely true. Just very little flavor for anything but side dishes at this time. The biggest disappointment of the trip. Recommendations-If you want something luxurious this is not the place. If you want something more "authentic" and smaller in scale try this. The breakfasts are great. The lunch is so so and the dinners are horrible. Try the snack bar for pizza, hamburgers, nachos ,etc if the dinners prove the same to you and you're still hungry-it's open almost all times of day, well into the night. I'd suggest going to town at night for dinner. The downtown area is only a 10 minute walk away and has tons of shopping and dining options available. A cab ride costs $5. Even the fancier restaurants have reasonalbe prices and the food was great at all of them that we tried. Don't miss the ice cream parlor each afternoon. It's some of the best ice cream I've had. The best bars are at the pool and by the front desk. Nights can have a bit of a ghost town type feel because most do go to the city.

Reviews.Title: “Nice resort, not high class”
Reviews.Author: rocco00
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a wedding trip, overall a nice resort, not hight class, but nice property. The staff was nice and friendly and the food was just okay. The rooms were not fancy and some of our group had broken air conditioners in their rooms. I would stay here again. The beach and pool areas were great.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice moderate resort”
Reviews.Author: BeachMommy168
Reviews.Content: Our trip was from 4/20 - 4/25/08. I traveled with my spouse and 3 yr old. I read reviews before booking this trip so I knew what to expect. The jungle setting of the resort was very nice and a refreshing change from those large gltizy resorts. I loved the size of this place. It was so convenient to get to everything - food, pool, lobby, etc. Nothing was more than a 2-5 minute walk. The pools were great - nice kiddie pool. The beach was awesome - no rocks and soft sand. This place had lots of beach chairs, canopy beds and shade. The food was average. I preferred the buffet because it was quick and the variety was good. We tried both restaurants - didn't care too much for the Italian but the Mexican Rest. was fine. The snack bar was good - lots to eat for our toddler there. Ice cream was good and drinks were always plenty. Service was fantastic. The staff was friendly and helpful. They always smiled and said Hola to us and we responded with the same. We did tip $1-2 dollars for really good service. We had double beds and the room was kept clean. A/C worked fine and the hot water was plenty. A couple of times the water pressure was low but my spouse likes to use lots of hot water. Surprisingly, there were no bugs. None were found in our room and nobody got bug bites. Stay away from the timeshares. The lobby staff will try to get you to go for this by telling you it only takes 80 mins (it's really 3 hrs). We met some people that told us about their experience. Only go if you are truly interested in learning more. We took a ferry to Cozumel. This 30 min trip only cost $22 round trip. More jewelry selection over there. You can walk 20 mins to the ferry from the resort or take a $5 cab ride. I found the vendors in Cozumel more willing to bargain with you. The nightly entertainment could use some improvement. A couple of dancers kept messing up the steps and it was funny to see. But a few of them were very good. Prepare to go and laugh and have a good time. It's not broadway. The drinks are the best at the show bar. My favs were - Tequila Sunrise and the Riviera Maya. Overall, we had a fabulous time. Keep in mind that this is a family friendly resort. It was very relaxing and clean. Met lots of nice people - about 75% Americans. We would definitely return to the Reef Playacar!

Reviews.Title: “Nice, moderate resort with only several flaws”
Reviews.Author: jayhawks2008
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Reef for a week during the middle of April 2008. The grounds and location are the best on Playa, the beach is huge, and the staff is very hard working and friendly. The food was average at the Buffet but had a very large fruit selection. They even make you fresh fruit smoothies. There was always something to eat. The breakfast was usually the best with made to order omlettes, french toast, pancakes. The dinners were average, but may not meet the needs of a picky eater. (I found it hard to find good meat, the other side dishes were wonderful). The snack bar with pizza, hamburgers, and other more casual food was decent as well. The Quesadillas at the snack bar are the best thing there, I believe. There were several small annoying issues with the Reef, but as long as you are aware that this is NOT a luxury resort then I believe they are easily overlooked. Upon checking into the hotel, we were told that the air conditioning was broken in two buildings 17 and 18. (Not quite sure how this could be, as each room had its own unit..but whatever). They told us that we would have to spend our first night in a five star hotel in Cancun. (After the hour long shuttle ride down here this was NOT an acceptable option) We demanded a room they found us one. I believe that a key to your success at the Reef is the location. If you get a room that is on the ground floor, outside of the maid closet...MOVE. Otherwise they will be in and out of the closet at all hours of the night. Also, if you get a room facing the giant resort next door MOVE.. the alley is very loud and will again keep you up all night. The rooms at the Reef are clean and modest, but noise was definitely an issue throughout our stay. The bed in the room was very hard, and on several occasions we did not have hot water. The repairman was very quick to fix the problem on both days, so if this happens call the front desk. I still, after these issues, would recommend the Reef to travelers on a budget looking for the grounds and the beach of a luxury resort. I knew what to expect when we got to the Reef, so I was not surprised about the hard beds, noise and lack of hot water on several days. If these things bug you, stay elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Quality establishment for the price”
Reviews.Author: bardezbanian
Reviews.Content: This is the second all-inclusive resort that my girlfriend and I have stayed at. The other being in Punta Cana, DR. And as the title says, this was a fabulous establishment for the price we paid. After reading various reviews, I did have some concerns which I will address. Air conditioning - was not a problem in our room. Cold showers - sometimes the water will start off cold, but after running for a few minutes it heated up and we never had to take a cold shower. Soapy drinks - brought our own thermal mugs, but the few times we did use resort plastic cups this was not an issue. Food - good selection and quality, but be warned that fruit flies are in abundance where the fruit is. Italian restaurant - agree that service is slow, but they are severely understaffed. Quality was no better than the buffet. Timeshares - we were not approached at all at the hotel. However, when you exit the airport you will be approached. A simple firm "No thank you" and you are on your way. The resort itself is very well maintained and quaint. The tropical theme is simply gorgeous. Even the furthest room from the beach is only a 5 minute walk if that. The beach at this resort is very nice. The "bags" that were intentionally placed do break the waves and are somewhat of an eyesore, but my girlfriend and I had fun trying to scale them one day. We did not try snorkeling or any other activities at the hotel. We did visit Tulum. Simply amazing from both a historical aspect as well as the beach. We elected to take a "colectivo" there which cost us $3 a person each way. Entrance to Tulum was $5 each. The beach there is amazing and you could probably make a day out of it. However, you would have to walk back to the main entrance to get lunch as you cannot eat at the site. The walk from where the colectivo drops you off to the site is less than a mile. After a couple hours at Tulum, we went to Xel-Ha. This was somewhat of a disappointment for the entrance fee of $75, but I could see how it would be nice for families. One of our other days, we took a ferry to Cozumel which costs $24 round trip. When there we rented a scooter and snorkel equipment for a total cost of $45. We toured the entire coast stopping at various beaches along the way for snorkeling and food. We had an awesome time. Refilling the tank cost an additional $5 prior to returning the scooter. This is a must do for young couples. 5th avenue is within walking distance and has various shops. However, this avenue is commercialized and no different from any other tropical shopping strip. We did not pursue the night life, although, I am sure it is a good time as well. In summary, this resort is as beautiful as it looks in the pictures and a great bargain.

Reviews.Title: “Great Honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: maambone
Reviews.Content: So, I know there are plenty of mixed reviews on the resort. We had a fabulous time. There is a push for a timeshare presentation, but it wasn't a big deal. If you don't mind wasting about 90 minutes, you can get some good free stuff from it. I had hot water for every shower, my husband had 2 cold showers in our full week there. The staff was wonderful, helpful, and friendly. The beach was wonderful. The buffet was average, but what do you really expect? There are tons of FABULOUS restaurants nearby - I suggest Big Lobster. We never had a chance to dine in the on-site restaurants. If you are looking for a super-luxury vacation, this is not the place. If you are looking for an affordable, clean room on a great beach, I would definitely recommend it. We had a great time!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay!!!”
Reviews.Author: kerriann6944
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Reef April 5th through the 11th and had the time of my life!!! It was my first vacation to a tropical place, and it was well worth it. Playacar was beautiful, the beach was blissful, the weather was perect, and our stay at this resort was wonderful. It is a small resort. only about 250 rooms...however it was nice because all the guests were so friendly and we met alot of people. There was a mixture of guests...lots of families but also a good amount of couples. The room was clean, the ac was ice cold, we had a deck area with chairs, the bathroom was nice, the room was cleaned well each day (we left a 2 dpllar tip each day on the pillow) there were no bugs anywhere! We were about half way between the lobby and the pool area. It was so quiet each night. we went to bed around 11 and woke up early. but never had a probelm with late nighters. I went with my boyfriend and we were looking for a nice place with a good beach and a close walk to the down town of playa del carmen 5th avenue. Since the resort was small...if you are looking for a place with a bunch of restaurants and pools then this is not for you. They have 2 pools. the main one has a swim up bar and the one closer to the ocean has activities going on all the time. vollyall, bingo, aerobics, yoga, spanish lessons, etc. The staff was so helpful and most speak english. the mexicans are so friendly they say hola to anyone that walks by them and greats you with a pleasant smile. It is nice to know a few spanish phrases though, that way they will understand you a little better. Especially food phrases!!! My boyfriend is Puerto Rican so he was able to communicate. The snack bar was great...you could get sandwiches, pizza, burgers, fries, quesadillas, ice cream, etc pretty much anytime you want. There were about 4 bars...all very friendly. The buffet was great...you could get fruit and salad anytime. There was a station for pasta, one for meats (steaks, fish, chicken) and obvisously a mexican station. I only ate for breakast (which was delicious. i really liked the french toast) and dinner. there is always fresh bread as well. We went to the al a carte italian restaurant one night which was O.K not as good as the buffet...but i think it depends what you order. I got chicken parm and it is totally different from the dish in the USA. I heard there mexican restaurant was great to (but i did not eat there.) The spa was nice. i got a massage, however it is way more expensive than if you walk down the streat to the downtown. for a 50 min massage it was $70 but if you go downtown it was only $30. It is about a 15 minute (beautiful walk) or a 5 dollar taxi ride to 5th avenue. There are clubs and bars everywhere. At the resort there is an activities area where you can book, snorkling, diving, jet skis, parasailing, etc. at a resonable price. We went on a tour through TNT vacations where we went snorkling to 3 different sites, a laguna, a river like area, and the cenote;s (a cave) that tour was so much fun and lasted all day. The beach at the resort is one of the best we saw. We walked about 30 minutes up the beach and looked for shells which was fun! The water is so blue and clear, and not any shaks, or jellyfish. It was so much fun..i would def. reccommend this resort!. Also...the bottled water is $1 but the evion is $5 so make sure you dont open the evion :)...i brushed my teeth with bottled water but i drank the water at the buffet and bars because they use the bottled water (purified) . You can also get your water bottles filled for free anytime. the ice cubes are fine too and the fruit and veg. are good to eat. No one got sick that we know at the resort. (i was worried because of horror stories i heard about people going to playa del carmen and getting sick from the water at the resorts) but...the Reef was purified and it was a relief to kno! There is entertainment everynight. Although i cannot comment on it because we just went downtown to the clubs. We loved the stay!

Reviews.Title: “Reef..... Good and bad times.....”
Reviews.Author: Anniebanannie1
Reviews.Content: The reef is a beautiful property and the staff was nice but........ We would probably never go back to this resort.... The first day we got in, the air didnt work in our friends room, then the switched rooms which was great. But two days later they never updated the room change and when we got back to the beach guests where in her room, looking around. Then our other friends room flooded and they really didnt do anything about it but cleaned up the water and the air conditioner leaked the whole time, so they were constantly cleaning the water up. Our expirence was not great either, we only had warm water 2 days out of 8, which is ok when you are coming up from being at the beach all day but when you wake up in the morning it sucks. Also, It would take them about 1-2 hours to fix the problems with the water too. The maid did not clean our room for two days which is not a big deal but come to find out they had us checked in to a totally different room. NICE! Then we made reservations for the mexican restaurant and we get ready and go for our 7:30 reservation and the restaurant is closed and nobody told us. They did try and make it better by giving us reservation for the next day so that was fine. Then on the 4th day of our stay our air compressor went out and we slept for 2 nights in a very hot room until they moved us to a suite. Very nice suite but once again no hot water and it sucked sleeping in a hot room for 2 nights. The food was boring, bland and always the same. No varity!
