The best was the snack bar and The mexican restaurant was great.... the soup was fantastic. The italian restaurant was blah, not bad or good. the other thing that would have been great is if they had chips and salsa to snack on it was wierd because all they really had at the snack bar was american food. Its was good but......... Honestly our standards were low going because of all the bad reviews and we are in mexico. On a positive note. The hotel is great, clean, the staff was very friendly, and the beach was very nice. We had a great time considering the problems we had. Remember just say no to the time shares and they will leave you alone. Johanna was awsome... Guest services feliciano at the pool bar is the best bartendar. **also get your drinks and the pool bar(best) or lobby bar.... Beach bar is bad, they dont make good drinks***

Reviews.Title: “Good, old Reef Playaca. . .”
Reviews.Author: DSM-Boston
Reviews.Content: Just returned from The Reef on 4/4. For a small (200+/-), less expensive than most - resorts, I thought they did a very good job. The two on-site restaurants were really quite good. The breakfast, lunch & dinner buffets were good and had decent variety & various multiple food stations. The staff was more than congenial & pleasant. Loved the set-up with the two pools, palm trees, beach, towel shack, snack bar & marina - well planned out. It's the type of place that when you walk in, its 'oh, this is nice', but then you get to your room and it's 'oh'. . . (the rooms are clean, but chair cushions & bedding look rather old & tired) . . but it grows on you. The grounds a truly jungle-like, and very nicely kept. We had a room on the 2nd floor, AC & refrig. worked fine - lost hot water for 2 days, but hey, it's Mexico. The rooms were pretty sound-proof because of the stucco, but our only issue (and with others we talked to) were the doors on the rooms - they need weather stripping badly . . .they slam so loud and when other customers are heading out (we had a pair of earlier risers - 5:45am . . ugh & a pair of young drinkers @ 3 am, in our building) - it got very aggravating - that was a major issue with us.

Reviews.Title: “Fun at the Reef”
Reviews.Author: ejmd
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a week at the Reef, first week in April. It was great. We did do some investigating before so we knew it was not a 5 star place but we were okay with that. We were very happy here, the rooms were clean and fine, we loved to sit out on our terrace in the evenings, the maid service was very good also. We came down with a large group of 8 families with lots and lots of kids. I do not recall being asked about the timeshare thing even ONCE while there, although we were warned about that before so someone in our group might have squelched it right off the bat. We did not waste a second of our time with that. The jungle-like atmosphere was really unique from anything we've seen before and we enjoyed it once we acclamated ourselves. It was a little noisy at night, there were some loud groups there at the beginning of our week but they thankfully departed. The staff did do what they could to quiet these people down. The beach was excellent, the pool area with the tiered system was FABULOUS. We loved it. The tiered system made it really easy to lay in your chair and enjoy the ocean view. Yes - you did have to get up early to get a seat but it has been that way everywhere we've ever traveled to. The food was okay, not the greatest. They didn't have guacamole which was disappointing for us. Everyone was healthy as far as I know until the last night when I myself got a huge dose of the old revenge, but that is common for me in any foreign country. The staff was nice but one bartender was a little crabby when we were in the pool bar one night with our large group and I was getting everyone's drinks, he wasn't the nicest. One of my favorite things was to eat outside (part of their dining room is outside) and you can see the ocean from there and feel the fabulous breeze and it is just delightful! It's pretty easy to keep track of your kids around here too, you can get a good look of the whole place from the upper pool deck. Our kids had a ball. The sand-bag things in the ocean on playa are kind of a bummer. At first I thought they were rocks and they looked really charming but then we realized they were put there intentionally, to protect the beach from errosion we're guessing, which is good I suppose but they are kind of ugly, although our kids enjoyed playing on them.

Reviews.Title: “Time share scam was buged the whole time with fraction ownership !”
Reviews.Author: masonWyoming
Reviews.Content: Resort was nice ,food great staff willing to help with problems but limited to what they could do , hotel over booked , room was falling apart ,beach covered with trash floated up all week guests would put it in piles layed there all week. Not a place for kids . Time share scams pushed on us the whole time would never go back to the Reef club Playacar. . This was my fourth time to the area this trip was worst ever .I am looking elsewere for next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good resort overall”
Reviews.Author: JulySonshine
Reviews.Content: we just got back from our stay at the reef on march 26-april 1 2008, and overall we had a positive experience with the resort. upon check in, we did get suckered into agreeing to the "90 minute" timeshare experience, but it ended up taking just about 2 hours of our time and was not worth it at all. they did give us a voucher for 2 30-minute massages, but we never did use them due to some sunburning on our back and shoulders! oh well, the thought was nice. i will say that the "timeshare manager" aaron was not happy with us at all when we gave the final NO! to the whole business of purchasing a timeshare. FYI: they do not take no for an answer very well. my husband had to say it 5 or 6 times before they let us leave. quite annoying. when we arrived in our room, we were greeted with a "honeymoon package", including two Just Married t-shirts, some champagne, and a nice decoration of flower petals on our bed. very nice, we thought! the room could have used little upgrades here and there (i.e. a little rust on the bathroom faucet, a little stain on the window shade, a few stains on the rugs on either side of bed), but the room was fine overall. no problem with the air conditioning at all. the shower was not always reliable as far as giving you consistent hot water, and you virtually had no water pressure. didn't seem to be a big issue to us though. the doors to the rooms could have been a little more sound-proofed, as you could really hear anything going on in the corridors at all times....a little annoying. the beds are HARD, so be prepared! surprisingly we slept well though, probably wiped out from the sun and alcohol all day! the grounds are absolutely beautiful at the reef! there were always staff members cleaning up the sidewalks and watering the beautiful trees and plants all day long. and everyone always gave you a nice smile and "hola"! the ice cream parlor is wonderful! the ice cream is great, and you sit there eating it feeling like you're in a rainforest! there are cenotes (underground caves leading to rivers) all over the place, which are untouched and beautiful to look at! it's just a very lovely place to walk around and enjoy. the pools are wonderful, and the beach is one of the best you'll find. the upper pool has the swim up bar and scuba diving lessons. the bar never seemed crowded, besides the occasional group of people that would congregate at times. the scuba groups never seemed to interfere with the swimming, and the instructors will strike up a conversation with you if you happen to be sitting in the pool close to them. this pool also had the shallow end for the little kids to play, which was also nice for the adults to sit in. the other really nice feature of this pool is that is has a ledge all the way around to sit on, and on one end it has a good size section that you can sit on also. very nice for cooling off without having to get all the way in. the lower pool was the more active pool, with volleyball, boogie board races and water aerobics, but again never to busy to quick take a dip and cool off. the food was ok. very typical mexican food, more so than american-mexican food. the snack bar offered the typical american fare of hamburgers, hot dogs and french fries. most of the time it was pretty good. the drinks were always plentiful, keeping in mind that they only offer draft beer of corona, and the mixed drinks varied between pretty weak alcohol content or way too much alcohol! the bartenders were always friendly, and even better if you slipped them a tip or two! the service in the buffet was good most of the time. there was one instance when i had to get my own cup of coffee, as our waitress didn't even make eye contact with us for a good 5-6 minutes after we sat down. not too big of a deal though. we never did eat or even attempt to make reservations for the restaurants upstairs, so i don't have an opinion on those. the entertainment was pretty bad most of the time. we really looked forward to some good entertainment, but we were disappointed more times than not. on fridays, the resort loads up their bus with people that want to go to senor frogs in downtown playa, but it costs $35 per person (for an open bar at the restaurant) and you can't leave until everyone else is ready (unless you take a taxi home earlier). so unless you feel like you can drink $35 worth of drinks, it's not worth it, and then there is no entertainment at the resort that night. overall, the resort is nice, keeping in mind that it is one of the first and smallest resorts on the strip. and if you know going into it that it is not a plush, fancy 5 star resort, then you really will enjoy it. would we go back? probably not, especially since it seems to be selling out to the timeshare sharks as we speak. but we would be more likely to spend a little more money next time and upgrade to a higher rated resort.

Reviews.Title: “Glad I went to Mexico but wished I booked a different resort”
Reviews.Author: needingholidays
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews I was worried but I thought the trip would be what you make it and to stay positive...well the time share people are brutal if you get stuck with them. And my goodness they get you the very second you walk into the hotel, not even a welcome drink, just a huge sales pitch. Because I refused to talk to them and after being chewed out by the manager for not talking to them, they wouldn't take our bags to our room so we had to wonder around in the dark after travelling for 7 hours looking for our room, then after figuring out how the Villas work we had to drag our suitcases up 4 flights of stairs. Upon entering our room I was glad to find a clean and ok looking room however our air conditioner was dripping all over the floor and was making very loud banging noises. We then went to the buffet since we were starving, again in the dark having to find everything on your own is not easy. The service was indeed bad in the buffet because of so few staff. The good news was the next morning when I went to the pool and the beach - very nice indeed. The food remained terrible at the buffet so we switched to the a la carte at night, the food wasn't great but the service at least got better there. We tried the snack bar at lunch but it was crazy and not very many places to sit once you managed to get your burger and cold fries. The ice cream parlour that opened at 3pm was good. The front lobby bar the opened late afternoon was good. The time share people called us again in our room and tricked us to come to the lobby because "something of ours was there" and then sales pitching my husband AGAIN. It truly was upsetting. We are early to bed early to rise people, didn't work so well at this resort. The rooms are very loud and the doors sound like they are slamming and shoes slapping because of the marble floors echoing in the villas. So at night mainly 4am after the bars downtown closed our Villa was “alive” with slamming and slapping which meant I was up at 4 am every day - A little too early even for this early riser. When I went to the pool early in the morning to grab a seat (you need to do this by 7am or all the best seats are gone) I found the lovely group of young Mexican boys who had a time share across the street using the pool area as their bedroom – about 10 of them. Each day they would drink themselves silly at the bar, sleep at the pool and beach overnight, wake up and walk directly into the buffet without so much as washing their hands or looking in a mirror. First time was somewhat amusing, second and third…not so much. Security didn’t seem to mind so I guess anything goes at this hotel. Warnings – if it rains there is no place to go. None of the bars during the day offer shelter. They also state there are rainy day activities, but when I went to the suggested area there was nothing and no-one. The upstairs bar over the lobby has shelter but isn’t open until night and the wooden and tiled pathways leading everywhere throughout the resort become a slippery safety hazard not too mention trying to walk up 4 fights of wet stairs to your room. Example – man from Germany fell the first night going up the stairs to his room and broke 3 ribs!! There are too many stairs at the resort, if you have any and I mean any trouble with stairs this resort is NOT for you. Bottled water can get very pricey, suggest going into town for supplies and you will want water as it can go up to 40 during the day. No bottle beer available so it usually comes luke warm when ordered. The wine is not good but the other drinks are fine if you can get service. The pool/swim up bar has the best service out of the three water bars (lunch buffet, swim up bar and beach bar) except that everything happens in that pool, the bar, the kids pool and the scuba lessons. I was grossed out thinking of all that in one place, especially when no one ever left their spot – I guess people do not use the washroom when on vacation if you get my meaning??? Nothing starts on time, ever, including lunch. The shows at night are terrible, the worst we have ever encountered, except the Mr. Reef night and that was due to the fact we watched our own up there instead of the “entertainers”. The performers usually smoked and drank themselves silly before the show… so you can only imagine what the performance was like and then we had to see them the next morning, hung over and giving us our towels - that actually was slightly amusing. In the end we loved Mexico, went on a fabulous trip to Coba, loved going into Playa Del Carmen and the beach and pool were very nice. However I would never go back to the Reef or recommend it to anyone. It looks like that might not even be a problem now, the time share people told us that the hotel was not renewing it’s licence and will be switching to just time shares. Good for them. Oh and the time share people try and force you to sign up for 44 years and leave a $3000 deposit. Ya right!

Reviews.Title: “Even read the review first and still went”
Reviews.Author: spaworker
Reviews.Content: Been to Mexico 3 years in a row. Staying at the Reef turned me off. Bad Food 1 Drinks made of water and soap 2 Birds on tables with table settings in place 3 TIME SHARE OR MEMBERSHIP PRESSURES!!!!!!!! 4 Don't go to the wrong desk to make dinner reservations! They think your rich and want your Dollar$$$$$$$$$$$$ 5 Our upgrade was up ok to the Third floor no stairs 6 NO bottle beer, what they have is hot when you can find it bottle water at a great expense. 7 Remember to get your paid reciept upon checking out or your paid shuttle will not take you to the airport!!!! I have had better vacations and paid less.

Reviews.Title: “should have stayed home!”
Reviews.Author: SCUBA-DUO2
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed at this hotel in February 2008 for a dive trip. We decided to try a hotel in the Mayan Riveria for a change of diving. The highlight of the trip was definitely diving the Cenotes. Some of the restaurants in Playa del Carmen were very good. However the best part of staying at the Reef Playacar was leaving the 'Hotel Hole in the Wall'. What a dump. Here is a list of what I had to live for one week: 1. Cold showers - at least 4 times 2. No water - at least 2 times 3. Soap in drinks too many times 4. Nice warm beer all the time 5. Cockroaches in the bathroom 6. Thin door to next unit - no privacy 7. Condiments (ketchup, mustard, etc) not out for customer; had to ask and wait for the 'chef' to put whatever I needed on my food 8. Same food consistently; not cooked enough 9. Time share pressure I spoke at length with Rafael Laguna (is the supposed manager). I gave him this list and he gave me a lot of lip service. He said he would get back to me. I am still waiting almost 4 weeks later. Basically, they should clean house of staff and managers, then clean the whole place top to bottom. And let Mr. Rafael Laguna hand out towels by the pool. However, Tim, Laura and the staff at the dive shop were professional and did a great job. Tim should hand pick his crew and leave the dump. Hey Rafael, game on!

Reviews.Title: “Great for kids”
Reviews.Author: raybo37
Reviews.Content: Clean rooms, maids cleaned every day,grounds well taken care of, beaches one of the best and close to 5th ave"we walk to town ever night". Restaurants, food was very good but you needed to make a reservation at 9 o'clock in the morning or you were locked out of dinner, forget it if you are with a big group, I think they were afraid of big groups. But that was the way to go because the buffet was just alright you had to pick wisely what you ate.They have a snach bar that is open to 2 o'clock in the morning "excellent food" pizza, burgers, chicken, nachos,ect. My kids loved it. Drinks were plentfully and for a small tip to the bartender, he would make sure you get hammered. Went there for the children" went with 6" at snackbar all the time, plenty for them to do. The water and land sports? Went to get bikes, couldn't find two that were good "flats or broken". The kids wanted to boogie board, they only had 5 boards. They wanted to snorkle and they told them it was to rough or they were being used on there snorkeling trips that they ran for a fee. I complained to management and was told that the water sports was ran by an outside company and they had little control over them. I went to this hotel for the extras but....... Over all we had a great time but don't drink the bottled water in the rooms "5 dollars" Walk to town and buy there "90 cents". would I go there again? YES

Reviews.Title: “Best Vacation Ever”
Reviews.Author: iamlono
Reviews.Content: Reflections on a two week stay at the Reef Playacar: I did my homework before deciding on booking at this resort for two weeks with my family. The reviews on Tripadvisor played a large part in convincing me that this particular place was a good bet. I was not disappointed. First of all, don’t expect a five star hotel if you didn’t pay for one. If it is really important for you to have a luxurious room, the the Reef is not for you. Don’t get me wrong, it’s not a dive, but the rooms are a bit on the small side and the beds - well, let’s just say that they’re a bit softer than the tile floor. Personally, the room is only important as a place to sleep and to keep my stuff while I am out enjoying myself. I don’t go on vacation to sit in a hotel room. One bit of advice - upon arrival, you will be asked to make an appointment to hear about the “Vacation Club”. Basically, this is a sales pitch. It will wipe out an entire day of your holiday. I politely but firmly told them I was not interested in giving up one minute of my vacation to listen to a sales pitch. Been there done that and got the lousy t-shirt. I was not bothered again. The Concierge also tried to lure us in with offers of “deals” on side trips to Xel-Ha and Xcaret. Trust me, you can do it for less than what they are offering. Book Xel-Ha online for $68/ adult and take a collectivo van from Playa for a mere 30 pesos per person. The Reef Playacar is unique in that it is small and located at the end of a long strip of hotels. There is less traffic on the beach out front as a result. The beach is also much nicer than at many other resorts - more sand and better surf conditions for kids to play in. A lot of other hotels are working hard to bring their beaches up to what the Reef is like. The staff is plentiful, helpful, cheerful and polite. It seemed as though there was a much higher staff to guest ratio than at other places I have stayed. The lush rain-forest like setting is meticulously maintained and really beautiful. This place is extremely tidy and clean. The buffet restaurant offered a good selection of food. Generally, the food was of better quality than a five star I visited twice in Puerto Vallarta. The two a la carte restaurants were nice, although I did not find that the food was really any better than what the buffet had to offer. Expect to get your own poolside drinks at this resort. There are some outdoor servers, but most people get their own drinks and since it is never far to go, it’s not really an issue. One annoyance I experienced was that I had to go to the front desk every day to get them to re-program our room keys as they would stop working. On our last night at the Reef I was taking a shower and experienced a mild electric shock when I touched the metal faucet. Same with the bathroom sink faucet. I notified the front desk and it was dealt with and repaired immediately by the maintenance staff. There are pool activities going on all day - yoga, aerobics, volleyball and other less conventional games. It was a lot more lively pool scene than I had experienced at the other resort we have been staying at. If you prefer a quieter atmosphere, you can just step down to the beach area where there are plenty of additional chairs and umbrellas. Incidentally, there are no beach hustlers selling hats, t-shirts etc., which is nice. Speaking with other guests, I found quite a few who were repeat visitors and many who said they liked the small intimate atmosphere and would return. I would definately consider returning to the Reef Playacar in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Been there twice, was good, but will try another all-inclusive”
Reviews.Author: SunseekerfromMpls
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went to the Reef Playacar mid to late February 2008 and had a great time. This was actually our 2nd time visiting this resort. We had been there in November 2003 for a wedding and it was awesome (pre-hurricanes). Look out for the time-share people, I mean the "vacation club" people. I had read about these on Trip Advisor prior to leaving and they were all correct. We checked in after a very long delay and immediately was swept over to the concierge desk so they could tell us about the hotel. I thought they would talk about the restaurants, the bars, when everything opened, etc. No, they proceeded to scam us for $20 US a piece to listen to a 90 min. vacation club talk. We refused and the concierge person was visibly upset with us. Our names went into a 'black binder' and we got up and left feeling akward. We were taken to our room which the AC was broken and was dripping all over the floor. We were placed in 3 different rooms before we finally had one that worked and was a King size bed. We talked to several other vacationers and they had the same issues--broken AC. The funny thing about this hotel is that they actually have a card hanging on the back of your door that is a checklist of "things that need to be repaired" like: toilet, faucet, shower, AC, T.V., etc. which is sort of unsettling. The pool bar is amazing and I loved the bartenders - Feliciano you are the best! The grill guys are also very nice and the food at the grill was way better than the buffett food. We knew the food wasn't always the best, but the restaurants I thought were a vast improvement and would recommend both the Italian and Mexican for eating at night (make sure you make reservations the day of at 9 a.m. near the front desk). Avoid the buffett if you can. Breakfast was alright. Staff seemed annoyed and under-staffed. Asking for a diet coke was like asking them to move mountains. I felt bad for most of the staff as they were working in multiple areas from early a.m. to late at night. Avoid the buffett for lunch as many meats sit out in the heat. The beach is probably still the best in Playa del Carmen at this point. Unfortunately, it was windy every single day we were there so we opted to hang out in the pool bar, which was the best! We ventured out to the ocean twice and the first time I was actually hit by a jellyfish and didn't even know it. Others at our resort had the same mysterious wounds on their stomach, thigh, arms and neck. One of the scuba divers told us it was probably a jelly fish, however none of us ever felt a sting?! So, 5 weeks later I'm still trying to get rid of the ugly bite. We met some fantastic people and liked the variety of bars, closeness to downtown and the pool bar. We had a great time, however we know that we will probably venture out somewhere new next time. Overall, the value was priced about right. Also, look out for the different colored bracelets people are wearing. We had heard that people paid more money, like $100 per bracelet to get top shelf liquor. It really didn't matter b/c we didn't have the fancy wrist band and still managed to get whatever we wanted to drink.

Reviews.Title: “Would NEVER go back!”
Reviews.Author: NF32008
Reviews.Content: Please keep in mind I was in no way expecting a 5 star hotel...My boyfriend and I stayed at the Reef for 5 nights in early March. The resort itself and the grounds are very well kept and lovely to walk around. The beach was one of the best and swimming in the ocean was one of the highlights. However, we checked in around on Thursday evening, and although we requested a king bed, we were stuck with 2 doubles for the whole trip. Apparently, you are supposed to receive some kind of "welcome package" upon check-in where someone tells you where everything is, the times everything is available, about the restaurants, where to get beach towels, etc...We never got it. So, when we went to make reservations at one of the al a carte restaurants, we were told we should have made those upon arrival and they were all booked for the remainder of our trip. This proved to be very inconvenient considering I got FOOD POISONING from the dinner buffet, which we never ate at again. We ended up walking into town every night and eating better and more authentic (and apparently cleaner) food. The breakfast buffet is probably your safest bet. Aside from the food, the hot water was turned off 3 times during our 5 day trip. I'm not just talking for a few minutes at at time, the ENTIRE day. We were forced to take cold showers...which usually are reserved for maniacs. They sent around a letter once warning the guests it would be off...but the other 2 times, we called down to see how long and they would just mumble something that made no sense to get us off the phone. Overall, Playcar was amazing and the downtown is so fun, but next time I'll spend more to stay somewhere that has more modern conveniences, like hot water.

Reviews.Title: “A very nice getaway”
Reviews.Author: markjeff
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I just returned from the Reef Playacar on March 10 after a Wed thru Monday stay. I think you have to keep things in perspective and understand where your at (Mexico) and not expect what you would here. A few of the reviews about this and other hotels I think might not have. This place is everything it promises to be. Its small compared to the Riu Palace next door. Only 18 - 3 story buildings housing a few rooms. These are nestled into a immaculate jungle setting and make walking to and from the beach a nice stroll. When we arrived our room was ready but there was a maintenance guy replacing the thermostat. He was gone in a few minutes. We walked down to the beach around 3pm to see the most gorgeous water and beach. Color of the water undescribable, breathtaking. There is a nice size beach and much deeper then the other two resorts to the west. To the east is a private house built right to the water making it impossible to walk that direct very far. There is no real problem getting the chairs you want if you get down there by 8 am. Breakfast starts at 6:30 so it worked great for us. You can get a tan at 8AM and its better then mid day actually when it can be a little intense. Waitstaff to the beach itself is spotty, Figure on getting up and walking to the bar 50 yds and getting your own so not to be disappointed. The reef marina was great. English speaking staff and we took our first scuba dive. The French instructor Julian was great. All the staff at the Reef was extremely friendly as you came and went around there. But the majority don't know english much at all. Front desk does. Buffet is the way to go and easiest. They really do not do there resturants well. They don't put enough staff there. Its very slow service. We went 1 night to the Italian resturant onsite. Food was very good we thought. But service was sloowwww. All and All we really liked the place because of its small size, jungle setting, friendliness and their beach. It was much cheaper as well.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded all our expectations”
Reviews.Author: gogogo33
Reviews.Content: The staff was awesome, they were so nice to us and our children. The food was better than the other 4 star hotels we had stayed at in the Playa del Carmen area. Our room was lovely and all our needs were met, every request. The grounds were well kept and very beautiful. We would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “NIce Resort for the Money”
Reviews.Author: anonymouscouple
Reviews.Content: We had a great time at the Reef. We stayed there February 23 to March 1 with a group of 11 (five couples and one single). Check in was a breeze. A cold drink from the lobby bar as the concierge explained where our rooms were was just the ticket after a long trip to get there. Our rooms were ready and we were all put in the same building (we had requested this), which was very nice. There were some bags delivered to the wrong room, but several of us had the same last name so perhaps this caused some confusion. The place is very pretty. The buildings are in a jungle setting. The grounds are kept very clean. The beach was very nice. One of the nicest that we saw. Many resorts appeared to have no beach at all. No problems with the water stopping. Our room was immaculate and the maid cleaned it very well every day. We left her a $2 tip every day. There is no evening turndown service. The air conditioning worked great (we could make our room quite cold if we wanted to). The bed was firm, but very comfortable. There is a refrigerator in the room that we filled with water from Walmart our first morning. I never saw an ice machine or pop machine at the resort. Each room has a balcony with a small table and two chairs—great spot to chill out or hang wet bathing suits and towels to dry. The food was not gourmet, but good. It was quite adequate for our group’s needs. Every morning at breakfast there is a nice spread of fruits, cheeses, cold cuts, and cereal. There was also an omelet station, a pancake/French toast station, and a station making Mexican breakfasts. They would also cook eggs to order. In the evening the buffet had a wide variety of food. Steak was good. It also had other selections (chicken, fish, etc…) as well as a pasta bar at least one night. There was also Mexican food every night. The snack bar was open every day at lunch with a wide selection of food. It was a great place to get food while hanging around the pools or beach. It was also open late at night. This is great for those returning from a night on the town needing a bite to eat before bed. We went to both of the ala carte restaurants and both were very nice. Pools were quite nice. No problem getting a bunch of chairs together. The pool bar was great, but maybe a little understaffed on hot days. The resort is a smaller place compared to most of the resorts in Playacar. This was very nice since we had a group. We never had problems finding our group around the pools. It’s not a huge resort that requires lots of walking to get everywhere. The resort location is great. About a half hour walk to Playa Del Carmen or a $5 taxi ride. There was never more than a 5 minute wait for a taxi. Usually there was one already there waiting. There is wireless internet for a small fee. It always worked in the business center, and worked sometimes in our room. There are computers in the business center that you can use for a fee. There is a laundry service, but we did not use it. We did not use the spa, but had another couple with us each got a massage and they said it was excellent. No trouble at the resort with time share pressure. All of the employees were very nice and responsive if you needed something. We booked some excursions through the hotel and were satisfied. Check out was smooth and quick. Overall, this is a very nice resort for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Great winter break!”
Reviews.Author: mfdb
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Reef Feb 23-28 and we really enjoyed our stay. The beach was beautiful and the grounds were immaculate. The staff is very friendly and constantly cleaning to make sure that the resort looked perfect. We felt very safe and well-taken care of. The room was nice - air conditioning worked great. The buffet food was good - always a variety to choose from. There are two restaurants on the resort - italian and mexican. Some days only one of them is open so you have to make sure you go down early to reception to make a reservation. On our first day they told us that we could make reservations starting at 9am - a few times we went there at 9:05am and there was only a 9:30pm dinner time available. We thought that was strange. That was our only complaint about the resort. It is a good idea when you get there to take a taxi to Wal-mart and buy bottled water. Taxi rides to 5th avenue (downtown playa del carmen) is only $5. We definitely felt that we got our monies worth!! We went next door to the RUI and it was definitely beautiful but the beach at the Reef was MUCH nicer!! Overall we had a great experience and would definitely recommend it to our family and friends! We never had any encounter was any timeshare people - although we were warned several times. Playa is a great place to visit and relax and have fun. Very safe and well-organized place.

Reviews.Title: “We found our second home”
Reviews.Author: master_dman
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Reef Feb 11-17 of 2008. We have stayed somewhere different each year so far, but my wife, I'm sure, will insist we stay at the Reef again next year. Check in was fast and easy. Everyone is very professional and friendly. The grounds are fabulous. You get the feeling of actually being in the middle of the jungle. Everything is perfectly manicured. Our room was in the #14 building. Right in the middle of the property. Everything in the room worked just fine. No musty moldy smells, and the A/C made it downright cold. The water pressure was fine, and it never cut off on us. The tap water is purified and safe to drink. The food was your typical AI buffett food, we were always able to find something good. The variety was good, the presentation was good, and the fish was always great. Service was always good as well. We never did try the ala carte places as we never there for dinner. The resort is small and very laid back. The animation staff did a good job with keeping the guests busy with aerobics, stretching, yoga, bingo, water polo and volleyball. There are tons of places to sit, whether it be by the pool, or on the beach. The cabana beds are super comfy and plentiful. The beach is large and rock free. The "whales" or sandbags they have there in the water are doing a great job and the beach grew everyday we were there. I would imagine that soon, the sandbags will be able to be removed. The only bad thing I saw was the bar staff were understaffed and slow.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Upgrade!”
Reviews.Author: lj142
Reviews.Content: After reading the message boards for months, I should have been prepared for the time-share guys but they caught us as we were leaving the airport. They seemed to be drivers and started to give us more information than we needed...we did catch on quickly and then made our way out to wait for our transfer. We waited almost an hour for the car and, although we had read that it was a 45 minute drive, we actually had to drop off other people so it took almost 1 1/2 hours to get to our resort. None of this was the fault of the hotel but we were expecting the worst when we arrived! We had read many poor reviews about the Reef but since it was a quick 3 night trip, we wanted to save money and chose this resort. When we arrived, the people were great. Very friendly and, due to our short stay, we were upgraded (along with our friends) to the ocean view time-share suites. Only two buildings on the property actually face the ocean and the view is really only good from the top floors...which is only 4 rooms. We got two of those rooms and were thrilled! Housekeeping was perfect, the bed was perfectly firm and the temperature was ideal. The water pressure in both of our showers was VERY poor but we didn't really care. We still got clean! Another perk (we still don't know how we got it) was that we got black wristbands which made us VIP's. That meant they actually UNLOCKED a special cabinet with their premium alcohol...Crown Royal, Bailey's, etc. The alcohol choices still were poor...no Southern, Captain Morgan's or any beer other than Dos Equis. I really never had a good drink the entire time I was there (but I'm picky). Pool-side Pina Coladas were fun but so filling and even when you added your own alcohol, it was very weak. The nachos at the pool snack stand were addicting as well as the quesadillas. Breakfast was amazing...eggs and omelets to order...but the dinner buffet was sub-par. We ate at both of the restaurants and had OK dinners at each. The pasta was not bad and we had fajitas at the Mexican restaurant but, all in all, the food is not great. Stick to the nachos. The pools were beautiful and the beach was way better than I anticipated. The shows were horrible but fun to go have a laugh at if you needed something to do. Shows are held in a banquet-type room with a few chairs strewn about and the cast is the same kids you'll see teaching aerobics and serving drinks during the day. Not good. There is one bar with pool tables but most people go into town at night (about a 15 minute walk). Literally no one is at the resort bar at night. All in all, we got everything we wanted out of this resort...decent food, lots of drinks (the Crown drinkers were thrilled), great snorkel trip, beautiful view and wonderful service. Couldn't really ask for more.

Reviews.Title: “Great vacation”
Reviews.Author: DIANEBuffaloNy
Reviews.Content: Feb 2 -11 2008 I'm also a travel agent. I agree with the agent from Vancouver. The Reef rooms and grounds are very clean and never had any proplem with sickness. We travel with one other couple and we all agree we would return. We had a ball. It was wonderful meeting people from all over the world. Dinner buffet is the one thing that needs improvement. The Reef could improve the night life but it is so close to town you can find fun any wherer.

Reviews.Title: “The Reef Playacar”
Reviews.Author: neptune22
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Reef Playacar for a week in mid January 2008. I'd rate this hotel as 3-3.5 stars. Rooms: Average sized; tiled floor and bathroom floor; bed was sleepable, quite firm but not as hard as a rock; small refridgerator; TV; cieling fan; AC; deep bath tub. Room was average sized. Nicely deccorated but not fancy. Not sure if it was from the AC or water, a couple days we had a noise coming from somewhere. At first it was annoying but it didn't bother me after a while. We didn't bother having anyone come to try and fix it because we weren't in the room all that much. We always had hot water however sometimes with water would just die out, then after a few seconds it would come back on. Didn't find this to be a big deal as the water always came back on within a few seconds. There were a few small ants in the bathroom however keet in mind this the hotel is set within a lush jungle setting so there will probably be some ants. Again, not much of a problem for me. Our room had a balcony with a table and chairs and a nice view of the jungle vegetation. Very pretty view. In all I found the rooms not frilly or fancy but it more than met my needs and was charming. Rooms are on 3 floors with steps so if you can't do steps get a 1st floor room. Grounds: Amazing lush jungle setting. Very well taken care of and clean. The unique grounds was one of the main reasons I chose this hotel; I loved walking around the hotel and checking out all the beautiful plants. Big plus! There is a nice sitting area in the center of the grounds that is surrounded by plants. Very lovely and relaxing place to hang out. Pool was clean and well kept, although it was a bit chilly. No hot tub which I would have liked at night. Nice swim up bar, fun! I didn't have a problem finding a good chair. There was another pool for activities that I did not go in but also looked nice. Food, Drink: There are multiple bars. My favorites were the lobby bar and the pool bar of course. It was a bit confusing to find the right one that was open at night though. The lobby bar was always open at night but was a bit of a walk from our room. I wish there would have been somewhere open 24hrs. to get a drink. Roomservice would have also been awesome however I understand that this is not offered in order to keep the cost down. Bring an insulated mug to get your drinks in as they will melt fast here! Mixed drinks were average, nothing fantastic but it was sure nice just to have someone make me my drinks whenever I wanted (except after 2AM). If you ask for your drink a certain way the bartenders will do their best to give you what you want. There is a brakfast, luch, and dinner buffet. The buffet room is not airconditioned. Would have liked some airconditioning because it can get a little steamy in there...not too big of a deal though as there are many fans. The breakfast buffet was good and offered made to order omlets, which is pretty much the only thing I ate for breakfast. You put all the stuff you want in it on a plate and hand it to the chef who whips you up a yummy omlet. Other typical breakfast stuff was served like french toast and pancakes but these items were not made in front of you. Lunch buffet was the best and offered the most variety and served things like grilled chicken, beef, pasta with choice of sauce, pork, rice, beans, fruit, variety of breads, some Mexican foods. Did not care for the dinner buffet. It offered the least variety and the food was never replenished. I suggest making reservations at one of the specialty restaurants instead. Buffet food always runs the chance of getting a bit monotonous and being bland but I fared pretty well. I pretty much stuck to the grilled chicken and pasta type dishes. I tried some beef and pork which were also good too. There is also a Mexican restaurant and an Italian one. I liked the Mexican the best and thought the food was quite good. Beach: Lovely beach here! I was pleasantly surprised. I was very nervous going here because I read about bad beach erosion. The beach is coming back. It's not huge but there was more than enough room to walk around and have many chairs on the beach. The beaches next door were in horrible condition. There are artificial breakers in the water but these didn't pose much of a problem for me as there was enough room to swim and I tried to remember that these breakers are helping to prevent erosion. The water was beautiful and crystal clear, and the beach was very clean. From what I saw the Reef had the best beach in this area which more than made up for any small shortcoming that the hotel may have had. Service: Everyone at the hotel was very nice and generally helpful. Service to our room was generally prompt although one time we requested water and pillows they did not bring them and we had to call back 3 times, the items did not show up till the next afternoon. Not sure what happened there. Otherwise everyone was friendly and helpful. The Reef is a charming hotel with an excellent beach and lovely grounds. If you're not looking for the ultimate in luxury but just want a nice, comfortable place with some great benefits, and is more affordable, this is a great place. Also, there is no nightlife here. The hotel is dead at night...we had the whole place practically to ourselves a couple nights. We went into town for nightlife. I would definitely return to the Reef. Check out my pics of the hotel, there are 10 of them.

Reviews.Title: “Great Times at the Reef”
Reviews.Author: Shawn30
Reviews.Content: Being a travel agent I always take Tripadvisor reviews with a grain of salt. I often wonder if people were even staying at the same hotel that they review. I've seen very negative reviews for hotels and resorts and then had a great time there. You just need to make sure you aware of which country you are travelling to and that standards and cuisine often vary. This was roughly my 15th time to Mexico and my third to the Cancun/Mayan region. I was well aware of what I could expect booking a 3.5-4star All Inclusive Resort there. I would say that while certainly not perfect, The Reef Playacar exceeded my expectaions. Here's why: Firstly, the Reef Playacar is in one of THE BEST LOCATIONS on the entire Mayan Riviera. It's one of the only resorts that is walking distance to Playa Del Carmen. If you prefer a cab it take about 5 minutes and costs 50 pesos. Mexican cabs are safe as can be. The Reef also boasts one of the top beaches in the region. They have large sandbags sunk offshore which keep the beach from eroding. They are also fun to dive off of if you're into that sort of thing. The hotel has a small intimate feel with only about 200 rooms. The grounds are very well kept and the overall feel is quite clean. There were almost always maintanence people cleaning. Other than occasionally in the evening or the pool bar there is barely a wait for anything at the Reef. The service was overall quite good but did show the odd sign of disorganization. This is common in Mexico, even at 5 star resorts. The rooms were on the larger size and all have a patio or balcony. One dissapointmant was the lack of oceanview rooms. These seemed held for time share members and there were very few to begin with. The pools were a little small but well located and nice. Very refreshing on a hot day. The snack bar was tasty but not wonderful. I would recommend the pizzas or ribs. The Reef's biggest weakness was the buffet. I did have trouble finding food I enjoyed after breakfast was over. This is the most common complaint with nearly all all inclusives. The Reef is no different. Even the average 5 star resort serves up only OK food. I would definitely make reservations for the A La Cartes. While not gourmet, they are much better than the buffet. Please do not be put off by this, it's really one of the Reef's only downfalls and like I said, a very common problem with resorts in general. For the average price paid for the Reef it is a great value. Anyone comparing this resort to the others in the area is probably not comparing apples to apples. This is the best part of the Mayan Riviera to stay in for shopping, restaurants, and atmosphere. I would far rather stay at the Reef than one of the extravagant 5+ stars located in the middle of nowhere (and many are). If you are not overly picky, you will probably have a great time here. If you are... spend more or don't complain.

Reviews.Title: “The Reef is great.”
Reviews.Author: philmgmt
Reviews.Content: We were at the Reef Playacar from Feb 1 to Feb 10, 2008. When we booked our JetBlue flights, their web site recommended the Reef Playacar. We were NOT disappointed. It is a beautiful place, within easy and safe walking distance of the lovely town of Playa del Carmen, with its restaurants and shops. Also walking distance to a shopping area in upscale Playacar. The hotel is designed beautifully, with walkways that feel as if you're in the jungle. The Reef is 'all inclusive" and they didn't scrimp on anything. Lovely rooms, fabulous food, open bar, all sorts of activities. The staff is friendly and helpful. we would go there again, and have already recommended it to friends. Phyllis and Pat

Reviews.Title: “Very Cute Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: heatherme007
Reviews.Content: I was a bit weary when booking this hotel based on the reviews. No hotel will ever be "perfect" to everyone so I figured I would give it a try. I'm not horribly picky but I'll give you the good and the bad of it. The Good: The resort looks so exotic and fun. It is built around a rainforest. There are no bugs at night and it was kept very clean. We upgraded to a room right by the pool for $30 more a night which was worth it. The room was clean and well kept. The buffet was good...not much variety which is expected. When you ask for more towels or soap they were very prompt and courteous. The pool was clean and the canopy beds were comfy. We took a cab to 5th ave for 5 bucks and had a great time. My boyfriend and I both said we would stay here again. The Bad: Do NOT EVER use the calling card company in the room. They charge $45 per phone call! I have been on the phone with them every day since I returned trying to get my money back. They did try to sell us stuff very briefly but we just said "No". That's all you have to do! The pool waiters didn't speak any english. The bottled water in the room nis $5 a bottle. The Bottom Line: If you are looking for a beautiful place to stay and not break the bank...The Reef is perfect. Just don't go there expecting a 5 star resort.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Reef”
Reviews.Author: casper946
Reviews.Content: My sister and I came back from the Reef Playacar on Jan. 30/08. We were there for a week and loved it. We arrived before noon on Jan. 22/08 and our room was ready, no wait. This was a surprise especially after some of the reviews I had read before coming. I really don't know what these people were complaining about. I travel every year and usually stay in a 4+. This resort was way above my expectations. The rooms were not fancy but kept very clean. The cleaning staff was great. One day, by mistake, I left money in the bathroom and it was still there when I returned to the room. The service was excellent. We did not have to wait for drinks or service in the restaurants. This was a surprise because it has been my experience that when two women are travelling alone you do not get the service that couples get. The resort was smaller than I normally stay at but the service was exceptional. The only thing I was disappointed in was the beach. The water was great but since the hurricane they have lost alot of the beach. The RUI Palace is next to the Reef and their beach was pathetic. That would be my only complaint because I love to walk along the beach and you could not go very far. Otherwise, everything was great. I would love to go back next year but I don't think this will happen as they were selling this resort as a timeshare. What a shame because I definitely would go back next year otherwise.

Reviews.Title: “2008 Reef Playacar stay”
Reviews.Author: JDKC
Reviews.Content: We just returned from the Reef Playacar on 1-29-08 I would consider this to be a 3 Star Resort and keeping this in mind will rate this with the 3 Star in mind. The resort grounds were beautiful. The beach is recovering from the recent hurricanes and is one of the largest beaches on the Playacar strip. There was plenty of room for any one who wanted to hang out on the beach and plenty of shade on the beach and around the pool. Small resort with a quiet atmosphere. Not much of a night life. The rooms were moderate, nothing fancy, but clean and adequate. The best time to get hot water was either in the morning or later in the evening. Between 3-6pm we only got a slightly warm shower. The tub was extra deep so I did enjoy many hot baths around 9 or 10pm or first thing in the morning. The balcony area was just large enough for four to enjoy and the view from the balcony was of the Jungle type area. Food- We enjoyed the Italian Restraunt the best, the Mexican was not to bad either. The daily buffet was bland which is typical with exception of the Pork Roast which was excellent and the Deserts were always good. We could always count on breakfast being good. There were always someth ing open to get a drink or food, you just had to remember which one was open. This was a little bit of a hassle. But it provided free exercise. There are NO ocean front or ocean view rooms that I could see. No elevators so if you are on the third floor you will be taken the stairs. Sometimes even on the first floor there were stairs going down. Basicly plan on stairs. We had done our research before we went and read many recent reviews here on Trip Advisor before we went. We were not disappointed when we got there. It was just about what everyone had said. My biggest complaints were the entertainment was really below average. The towels were always an ordeal. The towell staff leaves at 5pm so if your at the pool or beach after 5pm. You have to keep your towells and a $38.00us per towell is charged to your room. So then you have to go up to the front desk with your towells to get it taken off your bill. Even if you tried to turn them before 5pm. They would say they could not find your ticket and give you clean towels and you get charged again $38.00us for each towell. Back to the front desk to get it taken off. So at 4 towells per day for 8 days adds up to $1,216.00. That's not an added feature I want to see on my bill. So after having this happen more than once to my husband and friend. I started getting the towels and drawing a little something on the top and putting my room# on the top of the ticket which would help me find it for them. Because they could never find it. I also started taking the ticket after I turned it in the towels just in case. We were not charge when we left. We refused to pay for 4 towells that they said they had taken off the bill the first day and did not. Ok enough about that, I just thought it was improtant for everyone to understand how they try to make some extra money. Other than the towel thing we had a great time, it was so peaceful and relaxing. The beach was good enough for us and the other guest staying at the resort were all pleasant. If the price was right we would go back. JDKC I will try to attach some photos

Reviews.Title: “Loved our stay..coming back”
Reviews.Author: sunlover018
Reviews.Content: Just got back from our 2 week stay at the Reef Playacar. I did the research before we left and checked the the review pages on the hotel. I don't know what all the complaining was all about. Maybe the Negative Nellies should have stayed next door at the Riu Palace or as we called it "the white Elephant". We had a great time, the staff was friendly and very helpful, the rooms were clean and the food was good...nobody got sick. Not like our previous trip to Manzanillo! Beautiful setting and the beach was great. Talked to some people who stayed at some of the brand new resorts and they didn't have a good time. We are already making plans to go back next year with our daughter and her boyfriend. Playa is a nice town...found a great little restaurant called "Babes" which is located right across from "Java Joes" on Calle 10. Java Joes makes great iced capuccinos. All in all it was a good experience and we had 2 great weeks away from the ratrace and the cold and snow! The Olivers, Fort Saskatchewan, Alberta

Reviews.Title: “It Is Mexico....”
Reviews.Author: Adventurous50
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Reef on January 20, 2008. The grounds of the hotel are beautiful. I have been traveling to Cancun\Playa since 1991 and don't expect a lot. However, I have stayed at better all inclusive hotels. The food was okay, you can survive on a few items (breakfast is the best), drinks are your typical cheap liquior, unless you see the better quality on the shelf. And where the bikes are I have no idea. Every time we wanted to get a bike they would tell us the guy with the key was gone. We had a king bedroom on the third floor. The room was a good size for two, however, the sewege smell almost killed us. We would have to keep the patio door open and the window in the bathroom open at all times because of the smell. One day there was no hot water so I couldn't wash my hair and then on three occasions the water would just shut off in the middle of your shower. It would eventually come back on. The resort as a whole is about a 2.5 or 3 rating, not 3.5 to 4. It does have the best beach. There were a few activities at the pool, but never any music playing or any fun games like other hotels have. Bars didn't open until 11:30 pm so you couldn't get a bloody mary in the morning. However, the best bar and bartender is in the lobby in the evening. Can't remember his name, started with an H, but he is the best. The staff in the buffet and spa are very nice and friendly. Would I go back for that price, probably not. But like I said, you are in Mexico.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded Expectations”
Reviews.Author: mbjaworski
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 4-night stay at The Reef and really enjoyed ourselves. I read the reviews prior to booking and realize now that the people who complain about this resort must have extremely high expectations. It's definitely not a 4-5 star hotel, but it is absolutely beautiful and a great, picturesque place to relax and enjoy yourself. Hotel Grounds The path through the hotel is beautifully designed. It's like you're on a nature walk all the way from the lobby, to your room and to the ocean / pools. Rooms Definitely exceeded our expectations and nicer than most hotels we've stayed in Mexico. Each room has a big balcony and comfy chairs. The beds are soft and bedding is nice. It is true...there are a few ants in the bathrooms. They didn't really bother us too much though. The staff comes to clean each morning and does a great job. Pools Two pretty big pools with many places to sit. Both are luke warm. The beds surrounding the pools are amazing. One has a swim-up bar. There is a stretching class and a step aerobics class around the pool each morning - they are fun and the staff is entertaining. Food Breakfast is awesome! Huevos Rancheros or make-your-own omelettes. Tons of fruit, pancakes, crepes, french toast, fruit / veggie smoothie bar. This was our favorite meal. Lunch is sub-par without many options. Dinner in the buffet was a little better, but the food in the Italian restaurant is awesome! Loved, loved, loved the dessert - and all the wine you could drink. Beautiful view from the restaurant. Getting reservations is a little work...just need to get to the lobby and get your name on the list by 9am. So much for sleeping in. We went into Playa del Carmen two nights for dinner. A variety of very nice restaurants to choose from and a 10-15 minute walk. Bars There are enough bars around that you only have to wait 3-5 minutes max for a drink - most times less. They are good drinks and free! Can't beat that. You can order as many as you want at a time.

Reviews.Title: “Total absence of hotel management”
Reviews.Author: Frieder
Reviews.Content: We had a confirmed one week reservation at The Reef. The problem started when we checked in and were told there was no room available and we were shipped off to another, inferior, hotel for the first night. After we did check in we were amazed by the beauty of the complex, the breathtakingly lush landscaping, the charming walkways linking the 20 or so 12-unit buildings. The pools were attractive and the beach was fabulous. All public areas wre free of litter, the landscaping was very well maintained. Rooms were spacious, clean and comfortable. Service poeple were very friendly and helpfull, except for the concierges. The "animation" staff were terrific, upbeat and energetic organzing sports and games. So what's the problem??? There is no management. This resort is a ship without a captain. The whirlpool doesn't whirl and is cold, the hot tub in the spa doesn't work, coffee machine in the grill is permanently out of order, dinner reservations get lost, the "concierges" relentlessly push time share presentations, the Grill is understaffed and unmanaged, the 9:30 stretching class never starts before 10:00, the 9:00 PM show never starts before 9:15PM, the food in the Chula Vista Buffet is acceptable at best but is downright bad in the two dining restaurants, don't order any beef (tough as shoe leather) or salmon (dry as a bone), both restaurants are understaffed, in one instance we had to wait 45 minutes between two courses of the same meal. I was told to relax after waiting 30 minutes with about 25 other guests to make a dinner reservation which were supposed to be accepted at 9:00 AM. This resort is beautiful but staying there is not. The application of some basic hotel and restaurant management principels would have made our stay enjoyable and we would have wanted to come back.

Reviews.Title: “Great time at the Reef!”
Reviews.Author: anonymousNewJersey
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a week stay at The Reef with my boyfriend and we had a great time!! The hotel staff was great and we had no problems with our room. The AC and hot water were working just fine. I'm not sure what everyone is complaining about. The beach was absolutely beautiful and the location of the hotel is just perfect. It's about a 15 minute walk to the downtown area. The one thing we didn't enjoy that much was the food not much of a variety. Tip: I highly recommend visiting ruins in Tulum. I would pass on doing the tour because they are expensive. Take the bus from the downtown area and it cost $8 a person round trip.

Reviews.Title: “There are alot of miserable people that you just make happy!”
Reviews.Author: bsta
Reviews.Content: Before I book any vacation I always look for reviews on the property that I am intending to stay at. I always take the review with a grain of salt and see where the reviewer lives as some people tend to complain more than others. With this in mind my family along with 2 others stayed at The Reef Playacar from Jan 1-9/08. It is a smaller resort which is very quaint and if you have children you can keep an eye on them. The beach is the best as far as the eye can see down the coast. So do not believe the people that say there is no beach. The rooms were clean, and comfortable. The food was fine, the buffet was good they had great breakfasts, the suppers were fine there was always something that appealed to us. The snack bar was great for kids as they served hamburgers, pizza, fries, etc... I talked to one couple from Toronto that were going to take the Reef up on their offer of leaving and going to Cancun and Staying at the Crowne Paradise as the Reef was overbooked. They could not stand the Reef and I asked why....? They stated that since they arrived nothing has gone right. I then asked what was their experience and the first thing they stated was..."Well when we got here there was only 1 face cloth in our room"....we then got interupted by the Bell Boy and I quickly left because I can't stand to hear people complain about the stupidest things. You are in Mexico man not the Ritz Carlton. I talked to some of the other people who went to Cancun for the 3 days and when they returned to the Reef they wish that they had never left. The staff at the Crowne in Cancun were not very accomadating and you had to wait in line for everything. The only thing that happened to us was that for one evening we had no hot water. A pipe burst and they were trying to get it fixed ASAP, which did happen. The people are very nice and will try and do anything for you. Raphael even extended 2 of our rooms for no charge until we left for the Airport at 9:30 pm. I would recommend The Reef to anyone and would not hesitate to return.

Reviews.Title: “more sales tactics then occomadations”
Reviews.Author: carps8280
Reviews.Content: well we stayed my wife and i from the 5th to the 11th of december. loved the look of the place, great beach, nice people, but they would not leave you alone about buying time share so and so. the food seemed ok as this was my first trip ever, the beverages ok as well, not that i remembered most of the nights. we will return every year just probably tryinnot there , but the stay was not bad. just quit trying to pressure people into time share.

Reviews.Title: “Kinda Run Down”
Reviews.Author: poste49
Reviews.Content: stayed at the Reef from Jan.3-Jan10th six of us , we have travelled the carribean every year and stay in 4+ resorts as a rule,most of us have been to Mexico four times and know what to expect as to service standards and prices, FLIGHT - travelled Skyservice thru Sunquest and this had to be the worst flight as far as being squeezed in I have ever been on, I am 5'9 and 160 lbs i could not imagine being any bigger the seats were so close together that when the person reclined in front of you they were in your lap, the transfer from the airport was a good one as we were in a van rather than the bus and it was allot quicker, CHECK-IN - the front desk staff that i delt with were friendly and quick but again we were only six, we were all given our rooms and off we went , and back we came we were all in the same building and all of our rooms stank of sewage gases ,it took us two more rooms till we got one that didn't smell we ended up in 1332 very close to the pool and beach area and on the top floor everything worked in our room but some of the others had problems A/C in one room ran only on high and made allot of noise ceiling fan was falling off , we didn't hear allot of noise thru the walls but thru the door when people came in late at night or early morning but that wasn't an issue , but two days after we got there we had an ant problem in our bathroom which i tried to get fixed four times and when we left the ants were still there , our maid did a super job of cleaning tho , there are fridges in the rooms but empty they don't stock them with anything which is a first at an all inclusive resort usually they have beer or coke in them, they also charge for bottled water $5 for the small bottle and $1 for the larger bottle seems nickle and dime to me, the rooms are old and need some reno soon, they are small and have no drawers to unpack into, the beds are typical hard, pillows small , again these rooms are more 3 star or less quality, POOL BEACH- the pools are on two levels with the upper one being the swim up bar the water is very cold, chairs were'nt a issue as i am an early riser and down to the pool early but if you are late to rise and the resort is busy forget about getting one, the beach is probaly the best one of all the nearby resorts they have placed large bladders out in the water filled with sand to break the wave action and the beach seems to be growing gradually, they need to do a better job of cleaning the beach area as there was allot of garbage in the sand , cigarette butts plastic spoons and stuff not allot but enough, the water is very warm and the bottom is sand so its great for the kids, RESTAURANTS- This is where the resort really fails and fails badly the food in the buffet is terrible lacking imagination and quality there just isn't any choice, i was very dissapointed in the food, saying that i didn't hear of anyone getting sick , there is a beach grill that is next to the upper pool they make a decent cheeseburger so thats where went instead of the buffet but here it also gets very busy so expect some line ups Would i return to the Reef? no as I can get better value for my dollar elsewhere

Reviews.Title: “2 Reviews for the price of one”
Reviews.Author: ashrlm
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a weeks stay in Mexico. This is the second review I have posted. We travelled as a group of 15, including 7 children. As a group, we have travelled extensively on previous all inclusives, so none of us were at an all inclusive for the first time. We stayed at the Reef for our first two nights, and were offered an opportunity, because they had over sold the resort, to move to the Crown Paradise Resort in Cancun for 3 nights, which is considered a 5 star resort, thus the two for one review. I'll start with the Crown Paradise. The reason we decided to go was that from doing a lot of research on various resorts, we knew the Crown had the rep as a fantastic resort for kids. It did have a lot to do for the children, good kids club, water slides etc. However, this resort was extremely busy and there were as expected, a ton of kids. This resort in my opinion, was not a 5 star resort. Cancun, if you have not been there, is much like Daytona Beach, a ton of hotels lined up along an awesome coast, but no feel like you are in a quaint resort. The food was certainly not of 5 star quality that we had experienced elsewhere in Mexico. It was like staying in a Holiday Inn, but with lots for kids to do. If you are a couple with no children, I would not recommend this resort. Whe we got back to the Reff, which is rated a 4 star, all 15 of us were happy to be back. The food,believe me or don't exceeded the Crown. I had a piece of "Prime Rib" at the Crown that was as thin as any piece of beef I have ever eaten. At the Reef, you get what you pay for, decent food a at very decent price. There were not as many ala carte restaurants to choose from, in compariosn to the Crown, but the buffet for dinner and lunch, certainly was better at the Reef. As for the beach, they have started putting huge sand bags out in the water, and you can tell that this is helping to restore some of the beach, but people we were travelling with had been to Playa 10 years ago, and there is a lot of beach that has been lost. From what we saw and observed, the Reef actually has as much beach if not more, than some of the neighbouring properties. To give you an idea, the Reef is located right next door to the Riu and at the prices a RIU will charge, the Reef has as much beach. The rooms, we stayed in two different rooms at the Reef, the first had a bit of a musty smell, not unlike some others we have experienced while travelling south. The second room was much better. The first room was located in the 200 block, the second in the 300 block. Still not sure why the differnce.The one thing all first time travellers want to know......were the rooms clean...yes, they were. As for service, the Reef had excellent service. Maybe this is due to it being a smaller resort, but we never had any issues, including transportation and accomodations at the Crown in Cancun. Rafael the Manager at the Reef, has the staff in good working order. Playa itself is a great little town. Tons of shopping and great restaurants. I was a little hesitant to go into town at first, but after we went in once, we made sure that we went in again and experienced a great restaurant on the last night of our stay. All in all, a very good experience. We all agreed as we returned, we much prefered the Reef to the 5 star located in Cancun.

Reviews.Title: “Our Experience was Horrible”
Reviews.Author: swvatravelers
Reviews.Content: I read one review here that said, "The Reef Playacar is on the downhill slide." I could not have said it better myself. Like you reading these reviews, I had somewhat mixed emotions about going to this site for our 2007 Christmas vacation. I can only tell you my experience: We arrived, checked in, and was assigned a room. My wife and I discovered we had twin beds instead of a single as we had requested, but with the georgous tropical view, we decided to keep it. WRONG! A desk clerk ran into the room and said that we must hurry and leave because they had double booked the room and the occupants were on their way. I thought, "What are we, cockroaches?" We met the occupants of this room on the way out and they seemed to be a nice Indian family. We treked back to the desk and was given the keys to another room. It was in a horrible location overlooking a delapidated roof of a building and it stunk. We complained, and was given another room. In this room the air conditioner did not work and the ceiling fan was about to release itself from its attachment on "low" speed. We complained. The maintence man finally came and got it running. The noise was terrible. The maintence man said he had to get more tools and would be back. I noticed he took with him his current tools. He never came back. We complained. We were given two more rooms that were equally as bad and stunk. Finally, a desk clerk by the name of Pabalo said he would upgrade us to a new room. He did and it was more than satisfactory. We thanked him and told him we would keep this one. WRONG! The next day, (this is after my wife has unpacked everything and is in its proper place), later in the evening, I used the key to open the door and it did not work. I figured the magnetic part was messed up and I again treked to the front desk. The desk clerk, Luis, said that the manager, Rafael, said that we would have to move to another downgraded room (now it is after 5 PM and Rafael is gone). Otherwise we would have to pay an upgrade fee (expensive). Luis said that we would have to move even if we decided to upgrade because the "owners" were on their way. By this time I am angry. Luis, who was very hateful and indifferent to my complaints, reminded me that I was in Mexico. My wife reminded me that we should just suck it up and enjoy what time we have left. I took her advice and we will NEVER go back to this facility. The food: nothing great. The drinks: mine were not watered down. The service: horrible. The Dive shop: I booked a "wall dive" (more expensive) and when I went there was NO wall. It was a reef dive. In summary: you get what you pay for. However, in this case we didn't even get what we paid for. I have been to Mexico several times and it gets worse each time. It also gets more expensive. My next step is to contact my travel agency, Travel by Jen, and complain. If they do this again to me I will look for another agency. Additionally, we are going to look for another country to take our tropical vacations in. Good luck to all who read my review.

Reviews.Title: “"Second time even better than the first!"”
Reviews.Author: peggyarecco
Reviews.Content: This is the second review that I am writing about this resort. We were returning guests & this time we brought our friends & made some new ones. Being a repeat guest, you are entitled to other ammenties that we were unaware of when we arrived. If you are going for a second or third time, they will give you Black braclets which will get you top shelf drinks. The rooms were great, no problems, and the short walk to 5th avenue is worth it! Take the cab for 5 bucks on the way back. The pool bar is great & the "sea" is so warm. Reading alot of these reviews makes me dissappointed b/c people expect way too much! Trust me, the place is amazing. A recommendation would be to book Carlos for a massage...GREAT JOB!! The topdeck bar is great as well. (we went to 5th ave every night) Tequila barrell on 5th ave has the best nachos! we didn't make it to Cozemel this time around, however if you can't make it there, go down by the beach on 5th ave,,,,its breathtaking. We did not bring the kids on this trip, but there were alot of kids, and they seemed to enjoy it..!! Have fun

Reviews.Title: “Good Value Resort”
Reviews.Author: lucylue68
Reviews.Content: This is our first experience with an all inclusive; it was a great trip and a positive experience for our family of 4. Upon arrival we were immediately greeted, offered beverages, our bags handled and told our vacation begins now. Our room requests were accomodated as ordered. 1. We chose this resort because it is a smaller, family friendly environment. The resort is beautiful with windng paths throughout with lots of vegetation. Rooms are not fancy, but clean with everything functioning. We had no problems with either of the 2 rooms we had. 2. Staff is very friendly, outgoing, and helpful. Anytime we had any kind of request they were more than happy to accomodate us. Can only say positive things for the staff. We did not feel any pressure regarding timeshare with this resort. If you are not interested in timeshare just say no thank you and it will not be brought up again. 3. Food-Buffet, 2 restaurants, snack shack and ice cream bar. Service and food are good in all. If you are expecting a 5 star restaurant experience you will likely be disappointed.. However, we felt the food was good, the selection varied, and service good. No one in our family got sick and we did not limit any of our choices in any of the restaurants. 4. Beach-Awesome, we enjoyed the size of the beach and direct access to the water that the neighbouring resorts did not have. 5. Pools, marina etc. The pools were great, a great place to cool off and were never busy, the swim up bar is great. We took advantage of what the marina had to offer. We used the kayaks, katamarans, and snorkeled, all were great fun. 7. Playa Del Carmen is only a 10 - 15 minute walk from this resort. This was a very convenient bonus for us. We walked into town almost daily for shopping and other fun. The Reef Playacar is located in the gated, secured area of Playacar, we felt safe and secure at all times. All in all we had a great vacation and would return to this resort.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel for Low $$$”
Reviews.Author: sharper123
Reviews.Content: 1. Pool : 2 pools...both small...but never to crowded. Swim up bar was fantastic 2. Rooms: Rooms were very plain. You get what you pay for...bed was very uncomfortable....bathroom was old. Rooms could definatly use a reno. 3. Staff: Friendly and happy. Great experiences 4. Food: Buffet was way better than any of the special restaurants...(ate at both and the food was always just luke warm) 5. Beach: BAD. There was NO BEACH! There was so much damage from the beach from the storms....they had sandbags all around the beach area to keep the sand from falling into the sea...We went for the beach....and didn't find one. :(

Reviews.Title: “Funjet Vacations Is Terrible.”
Reviews.Author: manny1234
Reviews.Content: WE DID NOT STAY AT THIS HOTEL, BUT I AGREE THAT fun jet vacations is terrible. I booked 2 vacations with them--1 to cancun and 1 to las vegas. Both were at very expensive hotels. 1st, although they claim that with their "penalty waiver" (insurance) you can cancel for ANY REASON.. this is a lie!!!! Even though you may have northwest airline tickets, for example, if they were booked through funjet, you are stuck with them!! Or, if you want to change your hotel, you also have to cancel your airline tickets, and lose that money..you must re-book your airlines even if you want the same exact flights!! 2nd....They completely overcharge.
