We booked at the Wynn las vegas and were told that our total rate was $$1151...yet Funjet charged us $1600, claiming a discounted rate!! When asked for a credit, they said...oh well,,,,you can cancel if you want, but you will lose your airline tickets too!! NEVER BOOK YOUR AIR WITH FUNJET...YOU'LL GET SCREWED!! yOU ARE BETTER OFF BOOKING THE TRIP YOURSELF, BY GOING DIRECTLY TO THE AIRLINES AND THE HOTEL..don't make the mistake that we did...twice!!

Reviews.Title: “The Reef Playacar was great!”
Reviews.Author: marciad531
Reviews.Content: 15 members of my family from ages 71 to 11 went to the Reef Playacar for a 50th wedding celebration. We had read the good and bad reviews and were a little nervous. The Reef was beautiful and and the town of Playa del Carmen was so much fun. There was a great beach out in front of the hotel and we swam in the waters every day, snorkeled, sailed, boogie boarded, etc. The staff was very helpful and 8 of us signed up with Simon for scuba lessons and had a great experience. We did a side trip to the Mayan pyramid of Coba, a mayan village, and a cenote stop. It was all amazing and well worth the money. There was a nice variety of foods to choose from at resort, and ice cream shop, snack bar, pool tables, etc. We had perfect weather, it never rained once. If you are wanting a relaxing, family friendly vacation, where the grounds are beautiful and the people are "average joes" then the Reef is for you. The only areas for improvement would be that the swimming pool are chilly(we swam in the Gulf) and the Hot tub wasn't hot. Other than that, we had a great trip and would return to the Reef anytime.

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort!”
Reviews.Author: farrant1002
Reviews.Content: I didn;t look through the trip reviews before my wife and 2 kids left for our vacation but like others have stated here I would give the same advice as they have. Ignore the negative reviews. This is a great resort and very good value for the money. Apparantly they are turning the Reef into a time share next year from what I heard and that's too bad because I would definitely go back there next year. I hope what I heard is not true. Everything was top notch. Large comfortable rooms with beds that are not rock hard. Service was excellent. We had a problem with the AC on arrival and it was dealt with in less than 10 minutes. My wife decided she wanted to move to a ground floor room to be closer to the pool and it was taken care of the next day by noon. This is a smaller resort so everything is close by which we liked a lot. The resort is very clean and well maintained. The beach was excellent. The 2 pools are close to the beach which is nice as you get the ocean breeze to lessen the the heat of the mid day sun. The food was more than adequate and quite good though if you are extremely fussy about selection and variety you may find a problem with the variety at the daily buffet. For me it was not an issue whatsoever. The 2 reserved restaurants, one Mexican, the other Italian were both excellent. I was somewhat concerned about security being so close to Playa Del Carmen but the hotel district where this resort is has 24 hour security so It was not an issue whatsoever. The nightly entertainment was very good and we attended and enjoyed every show we attended. All in all a very nice resort and I would highly recommend it. The only real negative I can share and I did not experience it personally was they are trying to sell time shares to the resort and from what I heard from other guests they were quite aggressive in their presentation. We did not attend the presentation so I am speaking from the perspective of others. It's optional so if you want to skip the hard sell to save a few bucks on a tour package then do so. Other than that I have nothing bad to say about my stay at the Reef.

Reviews.Title: “Returned to the Reef”
Reviews.Author: MarkFromBuffalo
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our vacation at the Reef (Nov 30-Dec 8). This was our second stay at the Reef after our visit Dec 07. They have done a pretty good job reparing the beach with giant sandbags to keep it from eroding. We had a wonderful time with our three kids (12,9,7) and inlaws. My only complaint is that after I lost our safe key (which is just a regular key) they charged us $ 100.00 to replace it which I thought was a scam.

Reviews.Title: “Great Family Vacation”
Reviews.Author: Coloradotravellers
Reviews.Content: We had an excellent trip - even with a toddler. The food was great, the room was fine and the staff was excellent. Everything was very relaxed and reasonable. This is a pleasant hotel with great features for the price.

Reviews.Title: “brilliant honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: gringomexico
Reviews.Content: we stayed at the reef playacar from 24 th of oct to the 5 th of nov 2007 and after reading some of these reviews was a bit worried about going but once we got their we found that these reviews did not do the resot justice it was absolutely brilliant the staff were so friendly and helpful,the food was top notch cuisine but i must say if you only want to eat english food then please go to butlins and dont go abroad and winge the whole time you are out their the rooms were very spacious and constantly keep clean by the maids everyday the general complex was absolutely superb and in a prime location for getting around and seeing the sights will go back again time after time

Reviews.Title: “Great place, pay no attention to negative reviews”
Reviews.Author: Frozone
Reviews.Content: We stayed here one night in October , our only negative was it went by way too fast, as we had such a great time. The service was great, and the staff helpful and friendly. The rooms while nothing fancy, were clean and quiet at night, the jungle like setting was really nice. The food was great, the 6 of us had no complaints, had good variety, and at breakfast, the fresh prepared juice bar was great, and also there is a snack bar for a mid day lunch if you like. The beach while a bit small, was clean and great to swim in, the pools were nice, and the swim up bar was fun. the drinks a bit weak, but is normal for most A/I resorts, and if you want a bit stronger one, a friendly request to the bartender will do the trick. Now one thing to mention, we were there during the slow season so naturally the staff can provide more attention than during the crowded high season, plus the rates were great, $365 for 2 rooms, 6 adults, 1 child. You could find a more expensive place, but I see no reason why one would want to. One thing for sure is the next time we go there, we will be sure to have 2 or 3 nights at least. None of us are employed by, or have any financial interest in this place so our review is honest.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to relax”
Reviews.Author: connecticut-elaine
Reviews.Content: The hotel is great for families. We had our two year old grandchild with us. The hotel is small so it is very easy to get around. The staff was great. The food was as good as any all inclusive or cruise buffet. We did need to change rooms as we had a sewer like smell in the first room but they were very gracious about the change. They are a little tight with the washclothes and towels but I able to find the storage area in my building and was able to get my own. Service is much better if you complain to the front desk. No, it is not a 5 star hotel (although my daughter was at Dreams Tulum at the same time and had no hot water) but is is nice and worth the price. The beach is starting to recover from the hurricaine and the Reef has a much better beach than any of the hotels in Playacar. Don't go if you want the Ritz but if you are a laid back kind of person who who can put up with a few minor inconviences it's a great place. It is not high intensity so it makes it a great place to RELAX. I will go back. And this is my tenth time in the Cancun area, first in Playacar. I travel quite often and found the Reef a great place to kick back.

Reviews.Title: “would not recommend”
Reviews.Author: jarvisgirls
Reviews.Content: The pictures make it much nicer then it was for us. The beach was terrible due to the hurricane in 2005, so there wasn't really any activities we could do. We never had hot water in our room. Their water system is heated by the sun, so if there is little or no sun don't even expect a warm shower. I do have to say the staff was outstanding, they were very kind and helpful. Unfortunately I would not recommend this hotel. I was also disappointed with the lack of evening activities.

Reviews.Title: “Great Atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: Shalay
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from Playa del Carmen. We stayed at the Reef and really enjoyed it. We both thought the service was friendly and helpful - the people were very accomodating. The food was great too - variety and decent quality. Not outstanding but good. It was hit and miss with the drink quality depending on the bartender I think, but it certainly didn't bother us any. Very helpful people at the activities centre too. Another real plus about the Reef that we didn't see at nearby resorts was the location design - a few buildings spread out with lots of trees and bushes surrounding. The place really gave the sense of being in a tropical forest and it allowed for privacy and some break from the sun. Being right on the water we had a wonderful breeze constantly. The room was everything we needed - air conditioning, comfy bed, lots of pillows and a deck that was semi-private. I really can't say enough about how perfect that resort was to visit. When you go into town though, you'll definately be wasting your time if you stop and talk to anyone that says they have information for you, or asks are you planning any tours or have you been to Cozumel or such. They'll offer cheaper tickets for these things but they want you to visit an hotel they are representing for a 2hr sales pitch. That does not include travel time to get to and from that hotel. We got sucked into this and I tell you it's not worth the savings to loose your vacation time. What my husband and I realized really sent them running was telling them we were leaving tomorrow. And right now, you'll get a better exchange rate getting money from your debit card than exchaning inside the bank at the teller or at the street exchange vendors. At least that was the case for my husband who used the Scotiabank machine (with a credit union card). We were sent to HSBC but the line-ups in there are terrible and they do not honour travelers cheques if you don't have a passport. At the Scotiabank they changed the travelers cheques with the same ID we entered the country with. I'm not a Scotiabank user but it was close and it worked. We took the boat across to Cozumel - it's really more of the same as Playa del Carmen. We made it fun by taking a scooter ride across the Island. We also went to Chetzen Itza. That's a long trip but I actually enjoyed the ride, the scenery and the air conditioning. The Mayan Ruins was interesting but the big detractor was the guide - nice man but he took both a spanish group and us so we had to wait around while he told them the same things and it really made for short descriptions. The cenotas we visited on the way back was well worth the heat and long trip. It was awe-inspiring to be in a cool pool of water where people thousands of years ago must have been. I heard that the ruins on the coast, at Tulum I believe, were smaller but no vendors and more scenic. Have a great trip if you're going. We are looking forward to our next trip to Mexico.

Reviews.Title: “Great Entertainment Team! but...”
Reviews.Author: trip00
Reviews.Content: We think the place had a great charm. It was lovely jungle all over, and the rooms and food were good enough, it had what we needed BUT it´s not 5-star quality!!! Even the staffmembers confirmed that Reef are less exclusive than other 4-star (!) hotels in Mexico. The Entertainment team though, they did a great job! It was not that much guests in Aug/Sept, but they smiled and made sure you had fun. They are the reason we would think of returning ;) The trips that are sold you everywere are just a turisttrap. Its better to rent your own car and just follow a group with a guide when youre there... And cheque around for prices! (A idea I had on the trip was to wear a sign called "No gracias" on my chest because the souvenir-sellers are everywere, and they are really annoying!!!) We would actually recommend renting an appartment or house if you like Mexico and what it can give you of adventures when youre more independant.. or another hotel if you want to be pampered... PS! The hotel serve the drinks watered out!!

Reviews.Title: “All-Disappointment”
Reviews.Author: AZ_Desert_Rats
Reviews.Content: My husband is an airline pilot, so, we're no strangers to hotels. We had 2 adjoining rooms. The grounds and rooms were very nice to look at, but, it all ended there. It took us 3 room changes to find ones with air conditioning. Even then, it leaked so badly that the room was flooded each day. 3 calls to the front desk didn't resolve the problem. I had to go there and complain to the manager. Both our rooms had about 1/2 of the lights non-working. My room had a steady line of ants in the bathroom. We had warm water only once in a while. One day we had only air when we turned on the faucet. Don't bother with 'do not bother me' sign for the maid. She ignores it. One time I came back to the room to find her watching TV while making the bed. I pointed to the sign and told her we asked for no service today. She didn't seem to have any idea what the sign meant. The TV only worked part of the time and the sink in the ant infested bathroom didn't drain. The food..... The buffet was 'ok'. But the choices didn't change, the quality was pretty low, and the service was terrible. When the buffet was supposed to open at 11:30....it would open at 11:40 something. However, the grills were still unmanned and food was not ready for 15 minutes later. Acutally, all food, bars, and stores would open late and close early. The worst was the store closing early when I needed medicine. The girl was still there, but, just gave the big 'tough crap' smile that they do whenever they are agreeing to do something that they don't intend to actually do. The food at the 'snack bar' by the pool was horrible. The pizza was almost raw. The cheeseburgers arrived 10 minutes before the fries. If there were more than 4 people in there, expect a 45 minute wait. The Italian restaurant was good, but, the Mexican one was non-edible food that arrived a full hour after ordering. Service at the restaurants, buffet, and snack bar was generally slow. The drinks were watered down. The marina.... THE SHINING STAR. These guys and gal (Laura) were really great. The catamaran lessons with Luis were fun and informative. The kayaks were awesome. The scuba demo was very worth doing. The boogie boards were always there. Simon (in the marina) booked us on a snorkeling trip that wasn't offered by the tour operator in the hotel. The trip by Emilo was unforgetable. We snorkeled in a lagoon, a cenote, and a cavern. They are small groups and go to out-of-the-way places that big tours couldn't get to. We would never go back to this hotel. With the exception of the marina, they need a total overhaul from the management down to the maids.

Reviews.Title: “Great Until My Sis Got Sick!”
Reviews.Author: NBarrett
Reviews.Content: I read the reviews for weeks on this site before taking my trip. I was a little nervous, but it seemed like the good outweighed the bad. The grounds were beautiful. I really liked how tropical the 'villas' were , it wasn't some huge concrete castle like the Riu next door. It had a very cozy feel. My sister and I really enjoyed ourselves until she got sick. Here are my comparisons to what I read on here. ROOMS- Very nice, no funky smell and our air conditioning worked great in the night it was actually too cold. House keeping was great! I left 2 bucks everyday and not only did we get the normal housekeeping service, but they folded our clothes we left around and organized the toiletries we had scattered about. All the staff I came in contact with were more than polite and accommodating. POOLS/BEACH - the pools were always clean and we never had a problem getting beach chairs(and we didn't have to get up at 7am to do so) The beach was small, but not tiny plenty of room to enjoy yourself. The ocean is a bit rocky though. FOOD - With the exception of breakfast it was Very bland! we ate at the snack bar mostly. The drinks were iffy. Sometimes you'd get a good pina colada sometimes not. Don't bother with the reservation restaurants the portions were tiny and the food was ugh. ACTIVITIES- We took diving lessons in the pool with Z (totally HOT) We also went snorkeling out at the coral reef. We wanted to go to Tulum so instead of booking with a tour group for way too much money. We took a cab for 40 or 45 US each way and paid $4 to get in to see the ruins. Do yourself a favor and wear your bathing suit and go to the beach there it is soo gorgeous! THE BAD: So the night before we are supposed to leave my sister got violently ill. Diarrhea, vomiting the entire night. I was unsure if she'd be able to make the trip to the airport., but a fellow traveler gave her a Dramamine and she made it through the 45 min ride. She even threw up in the airport. I'm not sure of the exact cause, but it seems like a lot of people who stay here get very ill. If the Reef gets it's food service prep situation together it would be an awesome vacation spot.

Reviews.Title: “So many people got sick...”
Reviews.Author: squirrelklk
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Reef Playacar at the beginning of July. The hotel was okay. It is a very pretty walk to our room and our room was fine other than the paper thin walls. This wasn't too much of a problem though...we were just really aware of what we were doing and our neighbors were doing. Six of us went and all six of us got very sick! Everyone we talked to had at least one member of their group sick...it was no good! The dr. was at our hotel a lot during our trip. It was ridiculous the amount of people who got sick while we were there. It put us out of commission for about 2 days. When we got back to the states, one of the girls with us went to the dr. who said he thought it was a virus instead of a bacteria. It took about a week to get totally over it. It was UGLY! The swim up bar is nice, but there were entirely too many children in the pool with the bar. They were sitting on the barstools and splashing in our drinks. I would understand more if there wasn't another pool without a bar on the premises. Overall, if we all hadn't gotten sick, I would have liked this hotel a lot more. I think they need to make some changes...from reading the reviews on here, lots of people get sick often there.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful location”
Reviews.Author: sf_traveler
Reviews.Content: I probably wouldn't stay here again but it wasn't the worst hotel experience I've ever had. For starters, it is in Mexico, on a gorgeous beach, so they have that going for them. The rooms are organized into small villas, about 6 or so rooms per villa. Since we were 2 females travelling together I requested a second floor room with 2 beds. They got the first part right but not the second. The room was very nice, it seemed new and very clean. Unfortunately, the AC broke down on the first day and I could only get a room change after offering a cash gift to a staff member. Still, we had to share a bed. The buffet food was not good, only to be outdone by the VERY poor service. The staff was extremely surly, except the bartenders working the swim-up bar who seemed to really enjoy their work. Breakfast was fairly good though and every meal included fresh fruit. It was so hot it would have been hard to eat a heavy meal anyway. The drinks were not premium and were definitely watered down. Also, there is NO nightlife at this hotel. Alot of families were staying, mostly European. However, it's only a short cab ride to Playa where the nightlife is great. Oh, and be sure to remember the name of where you are staying as there are many hotels in the area and they all start to look alike at 2AM. Not the hotels fault but be sure to bring bugspray. All in all, there were several things I would change but the price was great and I still managed to have a great time here.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for your money”
Reviews.Author: Chief1965
Reviews.Content: Good value for your money. My family stayed at Reef Playacar July 28-Aug 4 and had an amazing time. The beach although small was great. The pools were great, 1 with swim up bar and 1 for kids and activities. They were kept clean and were open until 11:00 p.m. which is great to keep cool. Food - although edible it was lacking variety. The a la carte dinners were fantastic and the food quality was superior to buffet. Snack and Ice Cream Bar was fantastic!!!! The grounds of the hotel were beautiful, you felt like you were in a rain forest. The grounds were kept very clean. Rooms - small and needs a face lift.

Reviews.Title: “Don't expect much”
Reviews.Author: zmann67
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 days and it was average at best. If you are a vetern Mexico traveler, I would recommend you find another location. Food was fair, and the time share people were always walking around trying to talk to you. Beach was good compared to other resorts in the area. Pool was always full and chairs are limited. Room was fine and clean, and AC was great. I would not stay here again, but it was worth a try.

Reviews.Title: “Not that great”
Reviews.Author: TreesyJ
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for 3 nights in July as a last minute trip with my cousin. When we arrived the telephone did not work in the first room we had, so after going back to the front desk and complaining they sent the maintenance man. He came and said sorry it won't work until tomorrow. So being two young women by ourselves in a first floor room, we requested to be moved, which they did but only had a king size bed available instead of two queens. This room was better but the cable tv went out after the first night and everytime we would call for them to fix it we got a different answer. Needless to say it was never fixed. The water also only got to lukewarm during showers. We only ate at the buffet since you have to wake up at the crack of dawn to get a reservation at one of the restaurants. Reservations start at 9, we went one morning at 9:15 and both were completely booked already. Buffet food was ok, sometimes cold and the waiting service was terrible. We had to ask several times for drinks, silverware etc. Only on the last day did someone actually come by to get our drink orders at the beach/pool. Entertainment was cheesy and poorly put together. Not even worth the time to watch it. Bar service was ok, though we always had to ask for more liquor in our drinks. We swear it is watered down. This is not a hotel for 20 somethings, it was dead at night even on Friday and Saturday, and at least at this time of the year full of families and couples, no one remotely close to our age male or female. I would definitely not stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “would go back over and over”
Reviews.Author: loveyraven
Reviews.Content: i don't know what all the other fuss was about. I got married at this resort and had 16 guests stay with us there. We loved the resort. We like that it's smaller then others andbecause there are sprawling jungles throughout the grounds, you hardly every feel crowded. I never waited more then 5 minutes for a drink. There were a few instances where someone who spoke spanish was served in the buffet before me but I just butt in and gave them my order. The one thing I did do it tip and often. These people work around the clock and they aren't paid much. I got to know several of the entertainers and they explained that in Mexico it's normal to work 16 hour days. So I tiped the maids, the bartenders, busboys, bellman and everyone. I just made sure to take $50 in one dollar bills and they know you by name. By the end of the 8 days they knew us all by name and we had a blast. My cable worked, some only got a few channels. My AC was REALLY good and sometimes TOO good. But my room was cleaned everyday and the first night they put hearts made of flowers on our bed. The night of our wedding they did the same thing but made swans out of towels and provided us compleentry robes. The Reef marina was great too. we did the dive demo and were sold. So my husband and I along with one other friend went diving. They even checked with the hyperbaric doctor to see if my mother could dive with her blood pressure medication. She could't but down there you never know what scuba place would have just let her go. That meant alot to me. They even let us dive 30 minutes longer then most resorts do. Piece of advise, if you want reservations for the resturant be at the guest service desk right at 9:00am, as they fill up super fast. While the food isn't the best, i did gain 4lbs while we were there. The beach is very private and we did all the activites. We were snorkeling in front of the beach and my husband found a diamond ring...believe it..it's true. But you can see cool things just snorkeling. We used the boogie boards, snorkels, and catamaran. I got a massage in the spa, it's more expensive then the US but it was very good. The gift shop is over priced (like they always are) so if you need something like a gift walk from the hotel to the 5th ave (20mins max) and shop. Super fun. As far as the wedding, I did pay for addtional services in a package through cancun wedding planners but that really covered the photographer, cake, videographer and minister. It was 20Xs better then I ever imagined. It was incredible, showing people at work, I got more gasps then I ever imagined. Guests even gathered in the back to watch. One couple on their honeymoon was so moved they asked them to do a vow renewal. All and all it was a great experience. For the price I couldn't imagine getting anything better. The only negative i have to say is that when my mother checked out she was charged for 4 divers when one canceled and we were assured he wouldn't owe as they had a full boat. But they told her that she had to pay and because it was early and the dive shop wasn't open she just had to and worry about it later. So that was a bit upsetting, so just be sure that if you are doing something that you commit to it. Because technicallyif you cancel less than 24 hours then you will still owe for it.

Reviews.Title: “Don't get discouraged!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: kendrickaleshia
Reviews.Content: I was scared out of my pants when I first read the reviews AFTER I booked my family's trip. I didn't want to tell my wife some of the "other" complaints. To the contrary, this hotel was fabulous. Yes the room was small for 4 but the space was manageable. The room was always clean and very cold. When we arrive, I checked the A/C immediately and it did need services but I got on it right away and it was never a problem after that. The service was excellent. The workers are extremely nice and are there to serve. The food, well, my family is very, very, picky, but each buffet meal, we all found something we liked. I cook often for parties at my home and I learned alot from their chefs. I, being from the Islands, loved going after the grouper, and fresh snapper. We travel about 4 times per year and usually only stay at 4 or 5 star hotels and resorts so I thought we were taking a risk. It paid off. We actually visited some friends at one of the 5 star hotels to attend a wedding and spent the day at this resort. It had an excellent presentation but we all agreed that we would return to the Reef. Who are we? I work in the medical field and own a business. My wife works in corp as a leading manager and our daughter is on a full academic scholarship. So we are not blue collar. This is a wonderful place to stay!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Setting”
Reviews.Author: scotclan
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for two weeks and was a little nervous after seeing the reviews. The Reef is in a fabulous jungle setting and the grounds are kept immaculately at all times. We usually stay in a 5* but wanted something a little less stuffy and we found this at the Reef. The rooms where clean and the a/c worked perfectly, we had abundant fresh towels left each day. Our son has coeliac and is on a strict gluten free diet, this was not a problem. We had breakfast at the buffet, lunch at the snack bar, and had no problem booking the mexican or italian in the evening, (the mexican is better that the italian), service was again fine and they couldn't be more helpful, constantly asking if we required more drinks. The pools where cleaned every morning, a smile and "hola" to the pool bar tender worked and we never waited to be served, always with a smile. The beach is small but the sea is safe and great fun to swim in, we took the hobie cat out each day, this is well worth doing. The animation team are fantastic, they keep the entertainment going all day, the evening shows are not Broadway, but are great fun and do what you are meant to do on holiday "have a laugh", they all speak numerous languages and are keen for you to enjoy your holiday. It is a short walk or a $5 taxi ride into Playa, you can get a ferry over to Cozumel from here, the main square is time share city, everyone offering you free trips if you see their hotel complex. We also went to Xcaret but booked online and got a taxi from the hotel for $12. All in all we had a great time the only disappointment was the hotel wanted you to look at their "vacation club" - time share!!! they hounded us until we whent along, this was the biggest waste of time on our holiday tell them you do not have a credit card with you and you are not in full time employment, this means you will not meet their criteria and will leave you alone.

Reviews.Title: “Where's the Beach?”
Reviews.Author: Dalfitz
Reviews.Content: We love to travel to Mexico and do so as often as possible. We love to spend lazy days laying on the beach and playing in the water. Well, when we got there, we realized that we had been duped by all of the pictures in the literature and on the internet. They all showed a beautiful white sandy beach with clear blue water. They didn't tell you that these pictures were taken prior to the hurricane a couple of years ago! There is virtually no beach at The Reef or at Playacar as a whole. There are retaining walls and large rocks! I am attaching pictures to this review of the beach like it is now. Maybe there won't be others as disappointed as we were. Also, my husband and I depend on internet access when we travel in order to take care of our businesses. The Reef advertises WiFi in your room. We were in one of the very first bldgs near the lobby, and the signal was so weak, I had to go to the lobby for it to work. I could have dealt with that, but a couple of hours after we arrived, their network went down and I had NO ACCESS. It was not repaired until the day before we left and we were there for a week. Our room was modest, but clean. The AC worked VERY WELL! The food was pretty good and the drinks ok. Pretty watered down and don't ask for anything but beer or fruity drinks, they are probably out of whatever it is you want. We will continue to return to Mexico, but we will never return to The Reef. As bad as it was, we believe that if you want to have a good time in Mexico, you can, and we did.

Reviews.Title: “Will not stay again.....”
Reviews.Author: tksmith20
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 4 nights from July 14-18. We had an okay time, at best. We made the best of it and still had fun, but because we ventured elsewhere and just laid on the beach..... I will try to be as candid as possible in this review, as I relied on TripAdvisor heavily during our planning process. The main thought I have regarding our vacation is "You get what you pay for". Don't go for the cheap rate, pay a little more and stay somewhere else!! The Food Was absolutely terrible. Lunch was recycled into dinner and then dinner into breakfast. There was hardly any variety and they didn't keep the raw meats that you can get cooked to order cold at all, it was just sitting next to a hot grill. Everything was a mystery item and just scary looking. The only good part about the food was the breakfast, I suppose. Very simple breakfast choices such as pancakes, eggs, omelettes cooked to order and fresh fruit. There was always lots of fruit available. The snack bar was okay, they had burgers, rotisserie chicken and the like.... we ate at the reservatoin only place one night for dinner and it was just a joke.... we left before the desert was even served. The Service The service was hit-or-miss.... when we sat down in the restaurant no one would ever come up to us to take our drink order, so my husband went up to the bar to get our drinks after 10 minutes or so and that apparently irritated them beyond belief. As an American, I really feel as if we were the minority here and were treated unfairly in regards to service. The first day we tipped everyone we came in contact with and it didn't help at all, they wouldn't remember you and eventually we just stopped tipping The Grounds The grounds are absolutely beautiful. This resort is very tropical, with lush vegitation and animals/reptiles everywhere. I really enjoyed the "feel" of the place. The room Was okay. It was fairly clean, except for a few stray unmentionable hairs in the bathtub and some mold on the wall. We reserved a king room but since we checked in later in the evening, there were none available. We were given a "junior suite" but it had 2 double beds. This class of room has a separate balcony with 4 lounge chairs and a jacuzzi. The two major problems that I had with the room is that the jacuzzi was filled with old, moldy, leafy water and was not cleaned until I asked twice. Once it was cleaned, we realized that there was no hot water line, the drain plug didn't work (and you couldn't rig it up, either) and the jets didn't turn on either. What a waste. I asked the front desk (including the last time when I spoke with the manager) to look at it 4 separate times, and it never got fixed. The other problem was that upon arrival, there was no phone in the room!! When we requested one, they brought one that had no pre-programmed buttons on it and we had no guide to even know how to call the front desk. Housekeeping They were okay, nothing great. Didn't do anything extra even after being tipped 5 bucks. No towel swans/animals, etc. On our last full day, we arrived back to the room ready to take our showers and there was one towel!! OMG I was so mad I couldn't see straight. I personally walked up to the front desk and politely asked for at least 1 more towel, they said they would send it, but it never did appear. So we had to share the same little thin towel between the two of us. Construction Yes, it's true. This place has recently begun a major renovatioin of their rooms. And of course, the building they were working on was right across from ours. So we awoke every morning at 8 am to a loud tile cutter. Nice. Maybe that is why we got such a cheap rate. Location The location is good in relation to playa del carmen. a nice 10-15 minute walk with mayan ruins on the way that you can explore, or a 5 dollar cab ride. We walked once and then took the cab the rest of the times. Beach Was beautiful! Yes it is small, but there is tons of room for swimminig and such, and bring your own snorkeling equipment and see lots of angel fish and other sea life right off the beach. It is a nice walk up the beach, although you do have to navigate through some retaining walls, etc. Entertainment Was awful. We watched the "70's" show one night and it was terrible. We also watched about half of the "mayan" show and just went to the bar. The entertainment staff did do a good job keeping activities going in the activity pool throughout the day. Pools There are two pools, one larger that they use for water polo, games, etc. and one smaller that has the swim-up bar. They were very warm, but fairly clean and nice to take a dip in. Plenty of lounge chairs available. No towel games go on here, so don't worry, sleep in (if you can handle the tile cutter 100 feet away) Drinks Were good. They did have some mid grade alcohol such as smirnoff, jose cuervo and tanquerray. The only beer available was Dos Equis. The strawberry margaritas were good. If you want premium alcohol in your drink, you have to ask otherwise you will get whatever junk they had. And when you are ordering, if you want a strong, decent drink just ask for a double. They were happy to oblige most of the time. The drinks saved my vacation, as sad as that is. It was about an hour ride to/from the airport, and wasn't that bad. All in all, I was not very satisfied with the place, but the main complaint I have is regarding the service and the food. This place needs to step up. And it didn't help being right next door to the Riu Palace.... that place was beautiful, however I would have been ticked to have gotten one of the many many rooms there that overlooked the Reef Playacar. My advice: Don't stay here. I won't return. Feel free to email me with any questions.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Property - Food & Service need major help”
Reviews.Author: houstngrl
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this all-inclusive property for 4 days, and the first day we arrived we were very impressed. The grounds are gorgeous! Lots of lush, jungle-like, native landscaping, even a cenote! We went to the pool right away, also nice. They have a swim-up bar, and getting drinks the 1st day was quick. However, the next 3 days we waited up to 25 minutes to get a drink. The bartender wouldn't even acknowledge us. Very understaffed - one bartender for the entire pool & beach area, serving at least 100 patrons. The snack bar had a great menu, but each day the cook would announce that they only had burgers, nachos, and quessadillas. One day they had pizza. Food quality was pretty poor. The buffet was also poor, no matter if we went brkfst, lunch, or dinner. Just boring selections, no flavor, poor quality. The servers would often forget to bring our drinks, and sometimes we had to wait for a table to be cleared b/c there were many dirty ones. When we went to the "nice" reservation-only restaurant on the property, same experience. Food was horrible, service was ok. We did better just buying meals on 5th street where all the restaurants were. The rooms were nice, we didn't have any problems with a musty smell, as other reviewers noted. Overall, good for the budget-minded, but expect poor food and poor service. Next time we are skipping the all-inclusive and going for a property with closer proximity to 5th street and doing the European Plan.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, Bad Food!!”
Reviews.Author: kpulp79
Reviews.Content: We went to The Reef July 8th. Overall the hotel was nice and staff was GREAT! Apparently this hotel used to have the best beach in that area, but after the hurricane a couple of years ago, the beach has diminshed in size. Which was fine for us, we didn't need a huge beach, what they had was perfect. The 1st couple of days there, we had a blast and everything was great. We had dinner the 1st night, breakfast buffet and the snack bar the next day. We did not eat anywhere else. Now, I have been to Mexico 8 times before and have never gotten sick. I could never understand how people were always so hesitant to go to Mexico, I had always LOVED it!! After this experience, I understand why. On the 2nd night we were there, we got REALLY sick. Throughout the night, I had to run to the bathroom every 45 min. to an hour to be sick, (I lost 11lbs in 2 1/2 days). My husband got sick as well, although not as bad as me. It ruined the rest of our trip as we could not get out of bed. I met another group there that had 18 in the group and 16 of them had gotten sick, and out of a group of 9 divers, 6 had gotten sick and could not go on the dive. I heard many stories like this after talking to some of the guests. Another guests was telling us not to eat any of the dairy products, who knows what food caused everyone to get sick. We are just now ( over a week later) finally starting to feel better. Again, the hotel was nice and the staff was awesome!! If you are planning to stay here, I would just be weary of the food and ask around to other guests to see if the issue has been resolved. It might have been only been something for those few days.

Reviews.Title: “The food made me sick”
Reviews.Author: misssandy
Reviews.Content: Everything was fine until our 3rd day of our stay. My guest and I became very ill. We were told it was dehydration, but when we checked out on the 5th day of our stay we found out that several of the other guest checking out were also experiencing the same symptoms we were feeling (diarrhia, vomitting, nausiousness, etc). There were over 50 people who left the hotel sick. To make matters worse, hotel staff knew of the danger we were in in eating the food, but did not take any measures to warn us. I've been back home for 3 days and I am still feeling sick with the same symptoms. PLEASE DO NOT RISK YOUR HEALTH BY STAYING AT THIS HOTEL.

Reviews.Title: “Would Not Recommend”
Reviews.Author: howergm
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just spent our honeymoon in Playa at the Reef. It was definitely a lacking experience. The good: The waitstaff was generally nice and courteous. We were almost always greeting with a friendly "Hola," from staff members. The beach was small, but not too incredibly crowded, granted it was off-travel season. The grounds itself are very pretty with small buildings built around a winding garden path. We always found plenty of seating inside and out. The Mexicana show we attended was also very enjoyable. The Funjet Reps (Julio and Monserrat) were incredibly nice and helpful. The bad: Do not use the "concierge" or the "travel agency" for anything. You will be forced to attend a "rewards club" breakfast meeting, which is essentially a time share scam. If you book through Funjet, stick with the Funjet Reps. The rooms are okay, but just that: okay. The food is sub-average. My wife and I both had digestive problems, and after talking with a few other guests, we discovered we weren't the only ones. On one evening, my wife was incredibly ill from dehydration. I called the front desk, and they said the doctor on sight would be $80 just for a consultation. We decided to go into town to the Cruz Roja because we knew all she needed was a saline IV. I had accidentally left my cell phone sitting out, and when we returned 4 hours later it was gone. We had locked everything inside our bags every time we left, but it had slipped my mind this one time in the rush to get to the doctor. I reported my missing phone to Monserrat, and she did everything she could with the hotel, but they wanted me to fill out a missing property report. After this, they did their "investigation." The investigation partially consisted of a search of our room, which would make sense to see if the phone actually was there or if there were any security breaches in the room. However, this also included a search of all of our luggage and personal belongings, including some very sensitive items (hey, we were honeymooners) while we sat nervously by. 24 hours later, they told me that the room locks revealed no one else had entered the room, and rehashed that they could not be held liable for anything lost/stolen/missing from the room. They said I could do a report with the Policia, but since I was leaving the next day I found little point in that. In closing, I would not recommend this resort. It is not worthy of the Four Star rating. You're better off spending a few extra dollars and staying at a higher quality resort.

Reviews.Title: “Don't book with FUNJET VACATIONS”
Reviews.Author: latinarica
Reviews.Content: We booked this through FUNJET vacations,be forewarned they have only one Charter jet RYAN International airlines from DFW to Cancun airport, if some mechanical problem happens you are stuck, the plane had a flat tire, we waited as they changed it.. Upon our arrival to Cancun we were hit with the resort tour people as we came through the depature door, they act as if they are helping you, but it's a sales pitch. We finally found our shuttle to The REEF resort. I had personal issues, I need to get to my room ASAP, we were told we must see the conciege first, she's there to sell you tours and try to get you to sit through a time share presentation, I wasn't willing to do that, I wanted to freshen up first and get some dinner. We were taken to an assigned room which had other guest in bed resting, we had to go right back to the front desk to get another room. I tried to reserve a dinner in the italian restaurant for my birthday dinner, and was told I had to come to the lobby the day before by 9am to reserve a spot. We came here to rest and relax, not run up to the lobby each day to reserve a spot in the restaurant. We decided to eat at the "CHULA VISTA "buffet , it was alright nothing to write home about. I did get sick after eating the Salmon, later I found that another guest got sick after eating the Salmon. They leave the meat and fish out before cooking it, I didn't see how they kept it cold. The worst day was our last, after checking out by noon we waited for our shuttle back to the airport it was due to pick us up at 2:30 pm, for our 6 pm flight. I was informed by another guest our flight was delayed till the next day 3:00 am, I went to the front desk to get more information and was handed a note from a FunJet representative, that we would be picked up at 11:45 pm.how was I to know of our delay? We asked if we can get our back room while we waited, we were denied unless we paid $200. US dollars per person, we only need a place to rest till 11:pm, my husband need to be at work at 4 am., soon as we arrive to DFW he need to go directly to work. We needed a room to rest, they only gave us a hospitality room for one hour, to shower and freshen up. This resort wasn't full to capacity, we had a sick guest with us they showed no compassion, we offered to help pay for a room for her to lay down if the cost was reasonable, but ended up we sitting in lobby chairs till 11pm. No explination or apology for the delay. The resort blamed FunJet, Funjet blamed Ryan International airline, but no one helped us out We arrved to DFW at 5:45am the following morning, but had to wait on the plane till 6am when imigration opened up. Over all the resort was beautiful, but once they got your money, and your visit is over, they kick you to the curb. I won't return from after this experiance, That last day could have made a big difference in my review.

Reviews.Title: “Nice little hotel”
Reviews.Author: Blizzy4
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Reef for four nights in May and had a great time. After reading other reviews I wasn't expecting too much, but was pleasantly surprised. The Reef is smaller than the other resorts, but I think that is a bonus. It makes it easier to get around. The pools were very nice. We had no trouble finding chairs. The beach was small, but plenty of room for swimming. We took advantage of the free boogie boards, sail boats, kayaks and bikes. The food was OK, nothing great, but nothing too bad either. The snack bar was very good, lots to choose from. We didn't have any trouble getting good drinks form any of the bars. The sports bar was fun, it was nice to have a place to go watch the game, or in our case the fight, w/o having to leave the hotel. We only went to 1 of the shows, but it was very good. I've been to other resorts where the shows are cheesy, but this one was actually well done. The rooms were fine. The beds were comfortable but the AC wasn't that great. We were on the 3rd floor w/a cute balcony overlooking the pedestrian path, nice to sit and watch the people walking by. The room did have a fridge, but it was never stocked. Water is not included in the "all inclusive" price, which is strange, but you can buy the local brand for $1 or pay $5 for fancy name brand. You could also walk up the street to the store and buy a big bottle there for even less. The timeshare people were a little pushy, but they were easy enough to avoid. Overall, for the price, I think the Reef is a nice place to stay and I would have no problem staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad, not great either”
Reviews.Author: Dugg
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had a nice stay. Resort - I liked the decor and the look of the grounds. We had no issues finding places at the pool or on the chairs near the beach. The beach area may have been small-ish ( at least as compared to other big resorts) but honestly it was big enough and I'm not really sure what we would have done with more room. The layout was good and I like the jungle theme. Food - OK. Had some good and had some mediocre. More mediocre than good. We never bothered with anything besides the buffet or the snack area so I can't speak to the 'main' restraurants. The snack food was pretty good and I did enjoy the burgers. I had no issues with the bar service. Room - The room looked good and I like the frig but our AC absolutely sucked. While it was never hot, it was never cool either. I'd give the resort 4 stars if not for this. I did complain and a service guy looked at it but it was still bad. All in all, it was on us too as we didn't ask for a room change. On the last day, I popped into an open room to compare the temp and yeah, the other room felt just fine. Staff - OK, I guess. We dodged the host and the time share pitch (by the way they offered us 100 resort dollars) and so we never used him to help with anything. We had no issues with any of the other staff. We used Funjet and were satisfied with him and the tours that he booked. We also had no issue with airport transfers.

Reviews.Title: “Bad experience with Funjet”
Reviews.Author: forneytravelers
Reviews.Content: We just returned from Playa del Carmen, Mexico. Our trip was from June 9-16, 2007. Our group consisted of 12 adults. If you want to pay over $1,000 and stay at a resort that is less than Motel 6 quality, please go to this resort. For anyone who has any type of disability, back problems, etc. this resort is NOT for you! I have had back surgery. My husband has bad knees. Another traveler also has trouble with ankles and knees. Everything at this resort is steep stairs. The resort put us up on the 3rd floor. The steps are not gradual but very steep. By the 3rd day, I was begging the front desk to move us. I was in such pain that I wanted to go back home. The Funjet people were not helpful at all. Each time one of us complained, all we got was promises. The Funjet man, Victor, told us that he would move all of us to another resort if we would wait a day. Our waiting lasted four days. We kept going back to talk to him and he was never there. Finally, we found him and then he told us we would have to pay $65 per person per day to go to another resort. As you can see, for a group of 12 people, the money would add up fast. Our room was broken into twice through the patio doors. Our clothes and luggage had been gone through. I reported to both the FUNJET people and the front desk. A very expensive camera was stolen out of one of the other rooms. You have to pay $1/day for water and $2/day for a lock to the safe in your room. Actually, the safe lock is nothing more than a key to a magnet. Anyone could use the same key to get into any room. We kept our money and passports with us at all times. This resort is shown in the FUNJET book as a 4 star resort. Don't believe it. The most would be a 2 star. I have been to many resorts in the area and by far this is the worst. The food is the same every day. They had a big roach on the cantaloupe one day. The only decent food was at the snack bar. Four people in our group got food poisoning. Several days we got burned out dried meat. We only got bacon two out of the seven days we were there. We landed in Cancun before 5:00 PM. After getting on the bus around 5:20 PM, we did not get to Playa del Carmen until after 9:00 PM... at the most it is 45 minutes from the airport. The bus never got out of third gear. The Funjet bus stopped at a restroom not far from the airport. You had to pay a $1 to use the restroom and a woman stood out front and gave you approx. 5 tissue square. Then, the bus would not back up. It seemed as though the transmission was out on the old bus. Some of our luggage was left at another resort. We did not get it until 2:00 AM in the morning. And we only got it then because we argued with them. I paid the front desk $40 to hurry up and give us a room. My husband had just gotten out of the hospital the day before and was exhausted. The room was on the 3rd floor. All of the people other than our group that had booked their stay at the Reef from Funjet complained as well. There were several couples from Louisiana who had a bad time as well. Don't be fooled by pictures of the resort and the beach. Those pictures must have been taken when the hotel opened several years ago. Even the Funjet representatives said that the resort was old and run down. The activities staff were rude. The place was totally depressing. I even called the Funjet corporate office from Mexico to the states to no avail. We had to wait until we got back. I am waiting to hear back from our travel agent. There was only one bartender at one bar at one time. In other words, when the pool bar was open, the other bars were closed. At night, the snack bar at the pool was open, but you had to walk all the way to the front to get anything to drink. I have stayed at many nice resorts in the area, but the Reef is really bad. I am not one to complain much because Mexico is not as advanced as the U.S. and their ratings are different. However, Funjet totally misrepresented this trip. I will definitely not go back to this resort. Some of the smaller hotels around 5th Avenue were basic and clean. I would recommend staying in one of them. Some of the places I would recommend are the Riu resorts (Palace, Playacar [great beach], Tequila, Lupita), the Viva Maya (has a great beach!! and lots of activities), the Allegro resort, the Palace Resorts, and the Gran Porto Real. The resort was full of small children. I thought I was at a daycare. I can go on with the complaints, but it won't solve anything. If you want to go to an inexpensive resort and pay the price for a nice resort, please go to the Reef. If you don't expect much, then you won't be dissappointed. The people at the Dive Shop are extremely nice and helpful. While you are in Playa del Carmen, go see the Fire Show at the Blue Parrot. It is fantastic!! It is a nice outdoor club. We really enjoyed it. Senor Frogs is great as always.

Reviews.Title: “Had a great stay”
Reviews.Author: vfattz52
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Reef from June 4 thru June 11. We were a group of about 55 divers and non divers. No one had a bad thing to say about the place and all are willing to go back next year. The grounds are full of plant life and you feel like your in a tropical forest and very well maintained. Everyone on staff were very helpful and polite. The rooms were clean and comfy and all have balconies. And yes the beds were firm not concrete. But I like a firm bed anyway and had no trouble sleeping. There were one or two incidents with A/C but were rectified. No leaky pipes or any of the other complaints that I had read about. Our trip was already booked by the group and read the reviews after and was a bit concerned about the place. I dont know what the other people were complaining about but we didn't see it. As for the food book the resturants for dinner. Breakfasts were good and lunch at the buffet was better than dinner. The pools are very clean with plenty of lounges. As far as the beach goes it's small but the sand terraces make up for it. If you like to walk it's about 20mins to 5th Ave where the shopping area and the clubs are but it's only a $5.00 cab ride and that's for up to four people. We took the cab. The area surrounding the hotel is beautiful. As far as the wife and I fell this was a very nice place to stay and would have no problem booking the Reef to go back. We are hopong that the group goes back next year as we all had the same felling about the Reef, nice people, great service, and plenty of drinks. For the money you can't beat it.

Reviews.Title: “The worst place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Geena_67
Reviews.Content: The resort was very pretty, BUT PLEASE do not eat the food. We went on vacation with 2 other couples and it was the worst vacation we ever had. The food is awful including the fruit. By the 2nd night we were there we all were in the rooms very sick, there were over 50 people at the resort complaining at the front desk the next morning, we were told to come back an speak to the manager when he arrived. They were going to charge us all to see the doctor. Why should we have to pay when it is the fault we were sick. I was so glad to be back home in Wisconsin. I had to go to the doctor and get put on medication for ecoli. My boyfriend ended up geting very sick also and it is not something that just goes away with out mecication. we complained to The reef playacar and they offered us 2 free nights back there. WHAT Why would I go back to a place that got us so sick.

Reviews.Title: “Best vacation I've ever been on.”
Reviews.Author: erin_mcc
Reviews.Content: I was worried before my boyfriend and I went to the Reef Playacar because of some of the bad reviews I'd read, but it turned out to be amazing. We stayed for a week back in August. The hotel itself is absolutely beautiful, the staff were incredibly helpful and friendly, and the food was fantastic (careful though, we both gained about 10 pounds!) There was plenty of activities to keep you busy. I read many people complaining that they had to buy bottled water, but there were always big bottles of water you could fill your cups with by the bar. You just had to bring a cup back to your room each night, problem solved. Neither of us wanted to go home, and I would recommend this resort in a second.

Reviews.Title: “Was not impressed”
Reviews.Author: AmieG
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from our trip to the Reef Playacar and was not impressed with our stay. The grounds are nice and the food was okay. I was very disappointed in the fact that this was an all inclusive resort and you would think that all-inclusive would include all of your food and "drinks", drinks, meaning water-NO! You can't drink the water in Mexico yet you have to purchase your botteled water at this resort for a whopping $5 for a bottle of water.... I was very disappointed this was not included in an all-inclusive resort. We also had problems for the first 4 days getting clean towels in our rooms. The airconditioner was not working correctly, the coil was so froze that during the night when the ice would start cracking, it sounded like firecrackers going off in your room, needless to say we did not get much sleep! I would not return to this resort for the frustration I dealt with during our stay!

Reviews.Title: “Better than the reviews!”
Reviews.Author: Brad98155
Reviews.Content: After reading many of the reviews here, I was a bit worried about staying at this resort. Now I'm not a blue collar worker like one of the reviewers said before and I still enjoyed this resort. By the way what's wrong with blue collar workers? Anyway, let's get some of the negatives out of the way. Yes the beds were a bit hard but we had no problems sleeping. The food was a bit predictable and there was nothing too exciting, except the ceviche that they had at the Mexican restaraunt, that was really good. They alternate having the Mexican restaraunt open one night and then the Italian the next. As a result the buffet would have the leftovers from whatever restaraunt was open the night before. The beach was a bit small but there were plenty of chairs either on the mid level tier in front of the pool or on the lower beach on the north side by the towel cabana. There are some stones in the water but not enough to keep us from swimming. Also I'm not sure why there are mini fridges in the room because they were never stocked with anything. I guess they were there in case you wanted to put something in them. The positives definitely outweighed the negatives. We booked two rooms through Expedia and the only requests we put down were one room with a king bed and one room with two queens. When we checked in we were pleased to find out that not only were those requests taken to heart but that the rooms were adjoining and that way were able to keep an eye on the kids easier. The rooms were also on the top floor and I think that helped keep the noise down. The staff was always there to please and went out of their way to make sure we were enjoying ourselves. This was across the board from housekeeping to the bartenders at the swimup bar. The only time I tipped extra was at the restaraunts at night and that was because our waiter was extremely friendly and made sure we were taken care of. Like I mentioned before the food was not exciting but it was a big enough variety to keep us happy for the week. Breakfast always provided an omelet bar and fresh pastries. Plus they have an esspresso machine where you can get shots, add a bit of hot water and you have an Americano. Even my wife, the pickey coffee drinker was happy with it. We didn't eat much lunch since we were either on the beach or by the pool drinking our weight in cerveza but the kids enjoyed the snack bar with a choice of hamburgers, pizza, nachos, or enchiladas. I covered dinner earlier, either Italian or Mexican on alternating nights or the always open buffet. There's the old saying that you get what you pay for and the Reef is exactly that. It was a lower cost hotel with higher cost service and it provided a way for a family on a budget to experience Playa del Carmen.

Reviews.Title: “Family Fun at the Reef Club”
Reviews.Author: auntienana
Reviews.Content: My family, 18 of us, spent May 12th until May 19th at the Reef Club. It is an incredible value for the $$. We had a great time and wish we could return tomorrow. The staff were all very friendly. The food was in abundance, and the children ate their weight in ice cream. The jungle setting is so unique and beautiful. A few events to share: Kaycee drove to Cancun to purchase batteries for Grandpa's hearing aide. An item he really needed, and was unable to find in Playa. I lost a favorite earring in the ocean on my first dive.....and the assistant dive master found it!!! My diamond ring, purchased at another resort, from an earlier Mexico vacation, had loose stones. The jewler at the Reef Club had it repaired and polished, at no charge. Kids Club.....loved it. If you need a family AI resort, book The Reef Club. You will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Hotel”
Reviews.Author: aesbensh
Reviews.Content: Playa Car is a great area ,but this hotel has to be one of the worst in the complex. There were a lot of blue collar type people who stayed at this hotel, and if that is you, it might be ok for your standards. I think you would have to drink a lot of margaritas to think that this hotel is great. When we arrived we booked a room with a king bed but they gave us a room with 2 double beds, no air conditioning, and in font of a construction site that woke us up very early in the morning. Thankfully that let us change rooms, but the upgrade was not much of an improvement. In our new room the walls were so thin that you could hear the kids in the next room crying and screaming in the morning. Also. there was some type of sewer line break that caused a continuous flow of sewage to flow dowside of our building and onto our balcony the entire time. Our bathroom smelled like sewer gas the whole vacation. The food was horrible, I became sick as did some of the other guests we spoke to becuase of poor management. This hotel also has the smallest beach in the playacar complex, so good luck trying to find a chair in the morning. If you are thinking of staying at this hotel, dont!! THere are many other quality hotels in the Playa Car Complex to choose from but this one is not it.

Reviews.Title: “The Reef is great!”
Reviews.Author: chlotam
Reviews.Content: The Reef is great. I was so nervous after reading all the negative reviews- even though the rate is very cheap, I thought our vacation would be horrible! We loved the Reef! The location is great, a quick walk or bike ride to Playa del Carmen. The property is a beautiful jungle that is so well maintained. The staff is so friendly and helpful and fun! Yeah, the beds are a little hard, the food is not gourmet (though the variety is fantastic), and the beach is very small , but this place is superb. We looked at all the properties close by and were amazed that people want to stay at places like the neighboring Rui Palace. Those places are so huge! Anyway we loved the Reef and would go back in a heartbeat. Don't worry if you read the bad reviews. The Reef is a great resort and you will love it!

Reviews.Title: “Nice time at the Reef”
Reviews.Author: FGMB
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Reef in mid April. The resort was smaller than I expected but didnt bother us. Our luggage was mistakenly sent to the wrong room and took a couple of hours to find but that was the only problem we had. The main staff were very friendly. Food got a little tiresome towards the end of our stay, not much variety. Loved that this was within walking distance to Playa del Carmen, gave us something to do and a short ferry ride to Cozumel. For the money it was good and I would stay there again. Kids loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly suprised-we loved the Reef”
Reviews.Author: amyandrobertr
Reviews.Content: I was very nervous about our upcoming trip, but we had a great time! The rooms were clean and for the most part all of the staff was courteous and helpful. I liked this particular all inclusive, because it only had 200 rooms. We have stayed at others that our huge! We had no problems ever getting food or drinks. My kids loved the ice cream parlor! They also loved the shows at night. I cannot say enough about the activities staff. They were so nice to my kids. My kids wanted to go to kids club everyday and the staff also sat and ate with us one day. My kids ran around with them all day. They were always energetic and had a "happy face". My husband and I went diving through the Reef Marina on the resort site. They were great! Tim was very helpful and reassuring. The best dive instructor that I have ever had! Most importantly, they took all safety precautions necessary. We felt like we had such personalized service through their shop verses other places we have gone through in the past. Simon was very helpful in booking snorkeling trips for our kids as well. He was very patient with the many questions that an 8 and 9 year old have. If I had a complaint, it would be that the beds were a bit hard. The food was fairly good. I felt it was as good as any other all-inclusive I have stayed at. I don't think you can expect to have 5 star dining at an all inclusive. They are also selling time shares at this resort, so be prepared if you don't want to hear the sales pitch. Once we firmly turned down the slaesman, he did not ask us again. He was still friendly and helpful with things in the hotel even though we chose not to sit through the pitch. I would return again- and so would our kids!!

Reviews.Title: “the paradise”
Reviews.Author: ninny7
Reviews.Content: the reef palycar is wonderfull place,we had spend a very great time,the people are so nice and the palce with the wonderfull beach is a paradise. is great for all the age...honeymoon and not.....

Reviews.Title: “Reef has Tanked”
Reviews.Author: westshore4
Reviews.Content: Kids loved it last year so we go back again this year. What happened to the sweet Reef as our daughter called it? Our terrace was adjacent to an open sewer and there were rats going in and out of it. I got very ill and the manager did not help at all. It is not as clean as it used to be. Heard of a few other people who were very ill. A lot of high school spring breakers there, screaming all night and the staff did nothing. Seems like the Reef just wants your $ and doesn't care. Things didn't work and they didn't care. Too bad; we used to like it. Go somewhere else!

Reviews.Title: “Do not waste your time in this resort”
Reviews.Author: Traveller_Raven
Reviews.Content: I have stayed few resorts in this area and REEF is being the worst one. Although I booked a king bed room, they put in a double bed room and they refused to change my room. The beds were very comfortable, it was very noisy during the night, the customer service respresentatives in the front desk were very helpful. Food was average. You can definitely get a better service for your money. Stay away from this resort.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but just ok”
Reviews.Author: greenjeans818
Reviews.Content: We have a friend who had stayed at Reef Club before the hurricanes, and she had raved about the beaches. Of course we read the reviews about how all the beaches had shrunk in size and that the food was not that great, but based on our friend's experience, we thought we would give it a shot. The beach was small, but adequate. The pools were fine and we especially liked the swim up bar. The chairs were all very accessible, with lots of opportunity for either sun or shade. Very nice and relaxing. Some pool games, but no pressure to join in. We loved the look of the property, especially the garden path from the lobby building to the pool area. Created a very tropical feeling - beautiful landscaping and flowers. Very peaceful. The convenient location of this hotel to town was especially nice - just a $5 cabride. The service was great and everyone was very friendly and attentive. However the drawbacks to this resort were such that while we were not sorry we came, we will come back to visit this area, just not stay at this resort. We had a little problem checking in, as we had requested a king bed, and they kept telling us one was not available and we would have to take the double bed room. We pitched a fight and they finally "found" a room with a king bed. The food was just marginal - often not hot, and often poor selection and not very tasty. Our room was fairly clean, but the bed was very hard and one of the most uncomfortable beds we have ever slept on. Finally, while it is obvious they are starting to renovate the rooms, the noise from the renovation work was annoying. So all in all, a 3 star experience.

Reviews.Title: “Left feeling it was the worst part of our vacation”
Reviews.Author: CDAEnjoyLife
Reviews.Content: We just got home late last night. We are a family of 5 (boys 18, 16, & 6). We're an average middle-class family & to go on a vacation like this is a real treat. We read the reviews on Trip Advisor, but unfortunately our trip was already booked. My husband & I have been to Los Cabos, Mexico, stayed in two different 5 star hotels & had a fabulous time, so that was our benchmark for comparison. Our experience at the Reef.... we checked in April 2, we changed rooms 3 times in the first 3 days of our vacation! When you're anxious to get started with your vacation & can't unpack, it's not fun! We experienced a pipe that leaked in the closet, A/C that leaked down the wall or didn't work at all, musty smelling or dark/dingy rooms and beds hard as CONCRETE! No one seemed overly anxious to help us. Their service & maintenance really needs work. The room doors don't shut well & you can hear everything outside your room. Our 6 year old slept with us because he didn't have a bed until day 3. After 2 calls, I gave up asking to have the adjoining door to our boys' room unlocked, apparently no one could find the key. We didn't know about the dress code for the other two restaurants so we were only able to eat at the buffet or snack hut. The food was okay but by the 4th day we were all experiencing intestinal issues from gas to diarrhea. (We didn't drink the tap water.) The natural surroundings of lush green plants, water fall, ceynote, and "tree house" like area were neat. The pool areas & water activities were enjoyable. The beach area was small, but nice enough to relax & play in the sand & sea. The evening shows were family-friendly, fun but not spectacular. BEWARE! The worst part was the time share pitch your'e tricked into with the lure of good deals on excursions. It was high pressure, uncomfortable & stole another day of our vacation 8:30am-2:30pm! Between this and the pricey excursions, we felt taken advantage of and ripped off. If the Reef paid more attention to customer service & maintaining their facility they wouldn't have to work so hard to sell it to you! All we wanted was to relax & enjoy, we made the best of it, but we couldn't wait to get home!

Reviews.Title: “Mixed review”
Reviews.Author: Minnesotamon
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 5 night trip. The jungle property is unique, beautiful, and certainly a highlight. I also thought the tiering of the pool and beach areas was lovely, a great use of space and worked well on the property. Lots of areas for sunning/relaxing...not overcrowded. Property (including pools and restaurants) kept clean. It's nice to be in walking distance from Playa Del Carmen. We had two rooms (one for my husband, 6 year old and I and one for our two older daughters). One of the rooms was in excellent condition, the other had problems with the air conditioner, a leaking sink, lights that were out, tub that did not work properly and overall seemed more dated than the other. Great views from the third floor balconies. Also, I liked the drinks. Thought they were well made. On the down side: restaurants average at best (a few people in our party did get sick, and we did hear reports of others that were ill as well...can't blame it on the hotel for certain). Limited beach. Pools too small...were usually quite crowded. kids program very limited...seemed like an energetic enough staff, and that they could have done much more with this program.

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay at the REEF!”
Reviews.Author: SdDakota
Reviews.Content: This was the worst vacation experience I have ever had! At the time of check-in, the staff at the front desk were very unfriendly. The staff at the front desk gave us no information about anything that this hotel has to offer. Not even that you have to get the lock and key for your safe and pay $8 a day, not $2 like their website said for the use of the safe. After we walked about 1/2 mile to our room, and I asked about the safe, we were told this from the bell hop who helped us with our luggage. The rooms smell! and the food and drink at this resort is aweful! For the cost of this trip, it was a waste of money staying here. Other than a couple of people that work at this resort, most of the staff does not speak English, so you can ask the same question twice and get two differnt answers! I have never been so disappointed in a vacation as we were on this one! We did check out other places to stay and if I ever go to Mexico again, I would either stay on 5th Ave or at the RIU. When we walked around and checked out other hotels, the staff at other hotels/resorts were so friendly . This is not the experience we had at the Reef. When you walk into this resort, all of the lights are off in the lobby and your first impression is what your experience is, "not the place you would want to stay." It was then that I realized that your vacation really does start with your first experience of the hotel you are staying at and I should have gone with my first instinct at check in that I did not want to stay here and call up my travel agent! I would never recommend this place to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Hated the Reef”
Reviews.Author: KJM2647
Reviews.Content: Don't waste your money on the reef Playacar. Hotel looks nice on the internet. Pictures show a crowded huge beach. Wrong!!! There is no beach it washed away. We booked a room witha king bed, when we arrived room had two tiny twin beds. We changed rooms the next day and had to carry our luggage across the resort. Because of the room change we got no messages from friends staying at another resort. Food stunk!! When it rained the air conditioner leaked a huge puddle in the room. Walls and doors are paper thin. If you are staying in the 300 thru 700 buildings the resort is doing construction and they start at 7:00 A.M. Not a great way to wakeup after a long nite. I will never go back to mexico again because of my experience here. When our travel agent tried to contact hte reef to complain it took them over a month to respond and then the response was too bad.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Resort - Great Value!”
Reviews.Author: bob250
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for a week in late November 2006 (our fourth trip to the Cancun/Riviera Maya area). I rate the Reef Playacar 5 circles (Excellent) for executing and delivering on what they are, a value priced 3 to 3.5 star resort by American standards. The Reef Playacar is an All Inclusive resort; however, it is not a mega resort (only 210 rooms), it's on the beach, and it's very quiet and secluded (yet only a 10-15 minute leisurely stroll to the heart of Playa del Carmen). In addition, it's a fantastic value (approx. $150-$175 per night for two people). Consider booking through VacationExpress, even if you only book the hotel through them and not the flight (they were cheaper than any other source I could find). This isn't a five star luxury resort and I guarantee this resort isn't for everyone traveling to the area, but the price/value equation is one of the best in the area. The resort was very clean, had nice amenities, and a friendly staff (and you lay on the same beach and swim in the same beautiful ocean as the people next door that are paying 3-4 times as much as you are). I do agree with some other reviewers that the dinner choices in the main buffet restaurant were limited; however, The Reef Playacar is inexpensive enough to get away from the resort and go into Playa del Carmen for a few dinners during the week and not feel like you're paying twice.

Reviews.Title: “Do NOT book this resort!!”
Reviews.Author: cdnflygirl
Reviews.Content: We've travelled quite a bit since both my husband and I are in the travel industry. This place really doesn't deserve a rating. We were all very disgusted with the food and service. Short staffed to say the least! About 40 people that we knew of got sick (food poisening)most likely,since the guy at the buffet uses the same utensils to serve and put raw meat and fish on the grill! The rooms although clean were so poorly insulated I had to wear earplugs every night. Even my kids say"" Mexico, never again.""

Reviews.Title: “Would not go back to the Reef”
Reviews.Author: Juleen
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at many resorts in Mexico, and this resort is a 3 star at best. The lush, tropical grounds are very attractive. We enjoyed our view from the balcony of our 3rd floor room. The maid service was very good.
