Our rooms (we had an adjoining room for the kids) were well cleaned and we always had clean towels and washcloths. The kids enjoyed the two pools, even though they were much smaller than the other resorts we have stayed at. As stated in other reviews, there is not a beach! It has been washed away by the hurricane. The service in the buffet is terrible! They do not have enough staff to handle the volume of people eating there. We had to flag down a waiter to get coffee, water, or soft drinks. We were frequently almost finished with a meal before we got the drinks we ordered. I went to the bar myself a few times to get our drinks, but was told I had to order them from the table. Good luck! While my husband was satisfied drinking beer, I prefer the strawberry margaritas/daquiries, pina coladas, miami vice, dirty monkey, etc. The drinks here are awful. I stuck with my diet Coke the entire week. What a waste of our all inclusive money! Our mini-fridge was stocked the day we arrived and only one other day during our week-long stay. Our biggest problem was not having any air conditioning in the kids' adjoining room. I reported it immediately upon arrival to the room and was told they would send someone right up to fix it. The repair man did not speak any English, and it was not fixed. We had to leave our adjoining doors open in order to keep the kids' room at a bearable temperature. Days 2 & 3, it was reported again. Again, I was told the same thing..."we'll send someone to fix it." I insisted that the kids be moved to another room in the same villa, but that could not be accomodated. I was told they would have to move to another area of the resort, and that we all could move and still have adjoining rooms. We opted to stay where we were and leave our adjoining doors open (we were going to be gone doing excursions the next two days). We were very disappointed in the Reef. We will not stay here again. Go to an Iberostar or Barcelo resort. You'll be much happier!

Reviews.Title: “Spend a little extra money elsewhere...”
Reviews.Author: DEMexicoTraveler
Reviews.Content: My family and I just returned from a five night/six day stay at the Reef from March 22, 2007 until March 27, 2007. Our party included six members renting three rooms. I am amazed to find there are actually good reviews for this particular hotel. I am assuming some may have not stayed at another resort in the area to use as a reference point. The food was terrible. My husband can pretty much eat anything, but was totally turned off by the available choices. The highlight seemed to be the pasta served everynight. And, the selection at the buffet was pretty much the same every night. Thank goodness for rolls and fresh fruit. All inclusive does not include bottled water??? The hotel claims the water is filtered, however, throughout the compound, you watch the servers pouring water out of very large water containers. So who is willing to take a chance with the tap water??? You are also charged for the lock for the safe in your room. I think the lock may be the phototype for the very first one made, ever! My daughter's room was a disaster. The sink pipe leaked and she almost slipped and fell on several occasions from the water on the wet slick marble floor. Her phone did not work, nor did the remote for the TV. This was all reported on the first day, and nothing was ever fixed. We also dealt with faulty pumping in another room. No coffee machines in the rooms. You have to walk, quite a distance, depending on the location of your room, to get a cup of coffee in the morning. The walls are paper thin; You can hear EVERY thing! The ocean front and beach is so small, I have seen private homes with more. And if you want to swim, I hope you like a the pool. Bring a day planner with you to coordinate when the various bars are actually open. If you are not in the area of the open bar, prepare for a hike across the hotel grounds. These bars are not only for alcoholic beverages, but for ANY and ALL drinks. There are not any self serve beverage dispensers available. The ice cream parlor is open from 3PM until 5PM, so highlight those hours. Having stayed at various other hotels in the area, I am very much used to being pampered. This was not the case at the Reef. Not until our last night, did a waiter ask us what we wanted to drink with our dinner. We hardly saw a waiter. The entire hotel seems to be understaffed. Believe me, if you have stayed at any other resort in this area, you would not give this one a good review. This was my daugher's first trip to Mexico, and it was not a good experience for her. That, I find very sad, since this is such a beautiful country!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Fun Vacation”
Reviews.Author: MinocquaWI
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Reef March 17-24, 2007. Really enjoyed our stay very friendly staff, beautiful quiet location. We would return. Beach: There was enough to body surf, sand bottom, water equipment available. Pool: Very clean, swim up bar, huge towels, plenty of places to lounge. Food: Poolside snackbar with burgers, pizza, chicken, chips..... Buffet was good, service was good. Especially liked some of the fish entrees and the soups. The food is not real fancy, but everything was good. We went to the Italian resturant once. It was very good, you will need dress clothes and make reservations the a.m. you want to eat. Room: Our room faced the center. It was great! Beds were not too hard, pillows were fine. The room was immaculate, the tile floors were washed everyday. Could hear doors closing and occasional noise from neighbors coming home at bar time. We had a good laugh, wondered how they will be feeling in the morning, and went back to sleep. The water is safe to drink. Several English speaking channels. I brought movies to watch on the laptop. Services: We did use the on-site services to book day trips. Highly recommend the snorkle trip, intro to scuba, trip to Xel- Ha, and especially Tulum Extreme. For free fun we played pool, ping pong, used the giant chess set, walked to Playa. Internet: There are computers, service was out. I had my laptop, I could get service from the room at times, from the billards terrace other times. I did not need to purchase the login password. Suggest: If you are a coffee drinker...We brought our own travel cups with lids, just those cheap ones a gas station, and a cup holder from McDonalds with us. This was great when my husband went for our morning coffee to bring back to the room.

Reviews.Title: “Beware!”
Reviews.Author: donnovack
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Reef on March 1, 2007. Because I am handicapped, I called them on Feb 26 to confirm our rooms and was assured they were ready for us. When we arrived they told us they did not have rooms for us but had made arrangements for us to stay at the Windham Mayan and that it was a comparable resort. Well, the Windham Mayan is far from a comparable resort. Infact, I would not suggest staying here! The beach was closed, the main restaraunt is on the second floor of a building and very, very hot! The food quality was poor as well. The following day we went back to the Reef to complain. Because I am in a wheelchair I am very recognizable. The same receptionist was there when we arrived. It was obvious he recognized us when we came through the door! We told him we were far from satisfied with the accomodations at the Windham Mayan. He told us he was only a receptionist and could not help us. I asked to speak with his supervisor who told us the same thing. I asked to see the Managing Dirrector who's name was posted behind the receptionists desk. We waited quite some time but were able to speak to him. After some "arm-twisting" he arranged for us to stay at the Windham Azteca but told us we would have to pay an additional charge. I argued this with him and eventually we were moved there at no charge. The Windham Azteca is a comparable resort and we were satisfied with the accomdations there. The second week of our vacation we stayed at the RIU Yucatan ( we have stayed at RIU Playacar many times in the past). We were very satisfied with the RIU Yacatan. The food, service and accomdations were excellent. The RIU's are slightly more expensive than some of the others resorts but well, well worth the extra money. A couple hundred bucks will make a huge difference in how satisfied you are. The moral of this story is we will only stay at RIU in the future as we have never been disappointed there. As a note, we met a travel agant while on vacation who told us she knew the Reef was sold out and continued to take reservations. We concluded that they continued to book people at a certain price and them moved them to less expensive resorts as a way to make money. DN St,Paul/ Minneapolis area

Reviews.Title: “Beware”
Reviews.Author: nealmc1219
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very nice as you felt you were in a jungle. The people there are vey nice. There is no beach to talk about so if that is what you are looking for this is not the place. The food is okay it nothing to write home about. Our stay was for 8 days and there were some problems. To start with the beds are rock hard and the pillow are not better. The walls a paper thin you can hear everything going on around you inside and out. We had a room with a hot tub and it was dirty. We had to clean it ourselves. We asked the lady who cleaned our room for extra beer and diet soda and we only got it one day. Went to dinner one night by myself and not one time did anyone ask me what I would like to drink with dinner. At breakfast my boyfriend would get coffee and they never asked what I wanted and finally my boyfriend asked them to get a a diet coke and they brought me a 7up. When we were at the bar one day they ran out of white soda and the next day they told us they were out of the hard liquor my boyfriend was drinking. After that I told them they better find and bottle after all when I payed for the trip never once did anyone say it was all inclusive only if they did not run out of something. They are a resort and should not run out of anything. We only drank bottled water but bot of us when we got home have been told by our doctor's that we have "MONTEZUMA REVENGE". This is something you get from MEXICO when you have water (ice in this case for the drinks they prepare) and food that is not cooked right. This is an intestinal infection that needs medical attention. We were told that the resort water was purified. We will not be back to MEXICO.

Reviews.Title: “Not satisfied”
Reviews.Author: JaneKelownaB.C.
Reviews.Content: The rooms smell very musty, the beds and pillows very hard. Our patio overlooked an area being developed and it was very noisy not enjoyable to sit on the patio on a evening or morning.The walls are paper thin you hear everything next door. No beach to speak of. On the positive side the staff was excellent food was good. All areas are clean. I would rate this at no more than a 3*

Reviews.Title: “one week wasn't enough”
Reviews.Author: viricktonet
Reviews.Content: We just returned from the Reef yesterday and I wanted to write a review immedialtely because this place is heaven and hopefully anyone who has booked will read this positive review and relax. This place is so relaxed and laid back and we really left all of ours worries behind for the week. Me, my husband, mother and two children ages 5 and 11found this resort beautiful and impeccably clean. All of the staff seem to work long hours to make sure the grounds are lush and well maintained. You feel like you are in a small jungle. The noises of the waterfalls and birds really make you feel as though you are in a tropical paradise. The rooms are clean and have everything you need and yes, we were approached for time shares but after the scond time, the staff left us alone. The food at the buffet was great and there was alot of selection even for a picky 5 year old. The pools were unbelievably clean and there was always a pool chair available and clean towels. We loved the small size of this resort and it had a cozy, multi cultural feeling. The entertainment staff was always at work encouraging people to particiapte but not pushy and you were left to relax if you wanted. Our kids wanted a front row table at the show every night they enjoyed it so much. This staff has an incredile amount of energy and Leonardo was too funny. I can't wait to return to the Reef. I can't imagine a resort with more character and such beachy feel. I don't think I have been this sad to leave a place ( the Reef and Playa Del Carmen) and the next time, we will stay two weeks. My only complaint about this trip was the tour operator. I would not recommend Sunquest to anyone and will not book a trip through them again. We missed our first day entirely as our plane was 13 hours delayed and there was no representative to speak with anywhere. There was a direct phone to Sunquest at the resort but there was never an answer. Be aware of the combination of Sunquest and Canjet. Thye do not believe in customer service. Again, I can't think of anything to say about the Reef. Thanks to Cen for the great service and we hope to see all of you again!

Reviews.Title: “If you don't like the Reef, stay home.”
Reviews.Author: Travel_FanMontana
Reviews.Content: Hey there, We just got back from a seven day stay at the Reef and it was awesome!!! I've been reading reviews on the Reef since November when we first started planning our honeymoon and as I suspected, most of the reviews must have been submitted by stuck up gringos. People like that should just stay home!!! The beaches were small. We all read that before we got there. Did you expect them to suddenly be big? The staff at the marina worked hard to please and they do a great job for what they had available to them. The food was great for a buffet style all inclusive. There was never a time where we couldn't find something that we were interested in. Both the Mexican and Italian restaurants were great. If you weren't happy with the food you could always take the walk or ride to town. The rooms are something that many of the reviews that I read complained about. The "musty smell" that people reffered to is called humidity with a hint of ocean. The loud rooms, well it's an all inclusive and some folks come to blow off steam. The Reef is not to blame if the drunken gringos don't have enough respect for other folks to be quiet. Our room was always clean, our airconditioner worked great and the room was far from loud. And finally the most annoying review I read was in regards to the staff at the Reef. If you didn't like these hard working, always polite and smiling, jovial folks, then there is something wrong with YOU, not them. They work thier butts off to clean up after ungrateful tourists and to run a tight ship. Many of the employees work two and three shifts in a day. Humberto in the lobby bar (great guy and bartender) works six days a week. They were all fun and they realize that there is a ton of competition in the area from other resorts so they do all they can to keep you happy. If you go to the Reef, please bring some cash for tips as they really don't get paid squat. Also, no matter how bad or non-existant your Spanish skills are, try to use them. You will find that it is greatly appreciated and a quite humorous for both parties creating a generally happy atmosphere. I meant what I said, if you don't like this quaint little slice of heaven then stay home as there is clearly something wrong with YOU!!!

Reviews.Title: “Total waste of money... do NOT go here!”
Reviews.Author: titanrook
Reviews.Content: They should have named this "resort" the Thief Playacar as I had my passport, wallet, and cell phone stolen the first night of my stay. I went for an evening dip in one of their pools and ten minutes later got out only to find everything gone! Keep in mind; the only people I saw around the pool were groundskeepers. Aside from the thievery, for over $400 a night, you get a room that has no sound insulation (we heard every door slam within a 30 ft. radius), average food, and 10 ft. of beach. That's right... no beach! Don't get me wrong, Playa Del Carmen is a fantastic place but my advice would be to book something in town. The rooms are much cheaper and are within walking distance of a number of great restaurants. Don't go to the Reef, it's a complete joint!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Resort - Amazing staff!”
Reviews.Author: Ljbh1974
Reviews.Content: Tons of Candians (being from Toronto we loved it)!!!!!!!! We stayed at the resort from March 3 - March 10 with two other couple from New Brunswick and we really had a great time. The rooms are clean and the beds are very comfortable. We had hot water every morning. I would suggest that you asked for a garden view.......we got a room on the third floor overlooking the garden and it was absolutley beautiful! The resort iteself is probably the prettiest on the strip. All the other ones around it are concrete jungles........this one has character and class and it is well cared for. The pools are amazing and the swim up bar is really cozy. The food was amazing.........we loved the buffet better than the restaurants.......more selection and you did not have to wait. The staff was amazing and they were always there to serve us. The ice cream bar was excellent and the snack bar was open up until 2 AM..........great for when you are done up at the bar!!! We did two excusrions off of the resort. I would recommend Tulum Extreme and book it through Simon down at the boat shop........he has the best prices around and he is very knowledgeable. As for the shopping....barter, barter, barter!!!!!!!!!! 5th Avenue is great but the prices can vary...........it gets cheaper as you move down the street! The evening shows are worth going too..........Leonardo is a hoot and will keep you entertained! We looked forward to this every night. And the beach..............it was there...not very big but they are working on fixing that...........all the beaches are the same but the resorts are not to blame.........

Reviews.Title: “loved it!”
Reviews.Author: girlstripchic
Reviews.Content: lets start out with the down side...they did send us to a 5 star hotel down the rd for the first night because they were overbooked. we agreed because they also offered us 3 lobster dinners and 2 snorkeling trips for out troubles. (we were 5 women on a girls trip) well, the 5 star hotel was not all that good. It was 5 times the size of the Reef, but it was kind of icky. When we told the Reef we were satified, they threw in a few more snorkles, and free 60 minute massages...DEAL! well, we were very very pleased with The Reef. It is gorgeous, beautiful, clean, For the money you really couldnt ask for more! The food was actually pretty darn good, and they had a pillow menu! yep, you can order 3 different kinds of pillows for the week. It has a very multi-cultural feel, not just a bunch of americans, so it was fun. I really recomend this hotel, especially for those traveling on a budget. If I had a million dollars, I may stay somewhere else, but In two years, I plan on going back with my husband for our anniversary!

Reviews.Title: “great time-small beach”
Reviews.Author: pictoinions
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this resort from feb27 to march6 and had a great time with two other couples. This resort is very jungle like and has lots of trees and a very nice layout. the pools are very nice and clean. The staff are very pleasent and always had a smile on their faces. The resort is small and a great place to meet people, which we did (hello Buckey, maureen)and everyone else that we had the pleasure of meeting. I would have to say the food was good most of the time, the buffet could have had more selection. The snack bar was great with lot to choose from,. The beach was the only bad thing about the trip, it is gone, the tide has taken it away but a little further up the beach is better. From what we were told they are going to start working on the beach march 10 and should have it back soon. Go to playadcarmen is awsome and you could shop all day long and still not see all of it. All in all we had a great trip and look forward to going back to mexico again some time. So long for now from Pictou, Nova scotia (Robbie, Pauline, Kathey, Eric, Cherl and Benoit)

Reviews.Title: “Great time at the Reef Playacar!”
Reviews.Author: SheilaB1229
Reviews.Content: My family of 4 just got back from the Reef Playacar. We were there from Feb 24th to Mar 3rd/07. We all thought the hotel was just beautiful. Lot's of charm, very cozy....not like the concrete jungle of the RIU next door. Staff was great, always hard working and always saying Hola! We did leave a little tip on our pillow every morning for our maid, she worked really hard at cleaning the rooms. We were suprised at how much she does each day, per room!! Check in was quick, we asked for our room to be central, on the top floor and to be facing the garden. We got exactly what we wanted. Loved the tropical feel of the garden between the buildings. Lot's of geckos, large geckos, birds and even this other little animal that my boys just loved seeing. The rooms were very nice, all with balcony's. What we didn't care for was that majority of the channels on the tv were in Spanish. More English channels would have been better. The person that commented below on the rooms being noisy was correct. We could alway hear our neighbours coming to their rooms in the evenings or leaving early in the morning, seems like the doors like to slam shut on their own. The food was great....definitely NO complaints! We never ate at the Mexican restaurant, I saw the menu and I knew that my boys wouldn't like anything on it, but I would have! We ate at the Italian restaurant twice and the food was excellent!!! I never had any problems making reservations and I always got the times that I was hoping for. The buffet restaurant was really good as well. Plenty of fruit, cold salads, hot foods prepared in front of you. The snack bar had yummy food. Great pizza's, good burgers and quesidilla's. I already miss the guacemole and salsa!! I do have to say though the service at the snack bar was horrible at times. We loved the ice cream parlor, it's open from 3 pm to 6 pm!! Lot's of bars to get drinks and the drinks were really great. I never felt the need to tip the bartenders, I always got great service. Loved the swim up bar, always lots of action there and a great place to mingle and meet new people. The beach was by far the biggest disappointment, but that's not the hotel's fault. There are two sections of the beach to access, one of the left and then to the right with the terrace in-between. The terrace is now repaired, no more sink holes like some of the pictures posted above. The beach to the left was small, but there was more then enough room to put a lounge chair and enjoy the ocean view. My sons has fun playing there every day. We did try and go for a walk along the beach, but could only walk on the right side of the hotel. We could walk past the RIU hotel, their beach is very rocky, and then up to the hotel next to the RIU, but that's it. I knew this before booking so I won't be complaining. For what we used the beach for, it was more then adequate. I cannot comment on any of the excursions, we never did any. We felt that our sons wouldn't appreciate them for the price that we would have to pay to do them. We also did not take the ferry to Cozmel. We did take a taxi into Playa Del Carmen three times. I would have liked to have walked, about a 20 minute walk from the Reef, but the kids would have been tired by the time we got to 5th Avenue, we just paid the $5 cab fare. Definitely go to 5th Avenue. Lots of night life, lots of shopping and definitely bargain with the street vendors. The actual stores, you cannot bargain with them, I tried and their prices are set prices. Beautiful Mexican ceramics, I wish that I had brought home more. My sons used the Kids Club twice, had fun doing crafts and watching some movies. The animation team at the Reef is excellent. We only went to one show....Mr. Reef and we laughed and laughed. The show was hilairous!! The pools were wonderful. Two big pools and the pool with the swim up bar had an attached kiddie pool. We never had any problems finding spots on the beach or by the pool. Maybe because of the time of year that we went. Overall, I would recommend this hotel to everyone, young, old, married, families....loved it!! Not sure that I would go back though, there are SO many hotels in the Mayan Riviera that I think that I would like to try somewhere new next time.

Reviews.Title: “We had a great time here.”
Reviews.Author: askwersky
Reviews.Content: I took my wife and two kids here for a Feb 15-22 trip. We booked through TNT vacations. We were pleasantly surprised. The first room we had was on the first floor (building 6) and the view was blocked by construction and the room was a bit musty. We asked for a different room and was given one the next day (we had checked in late that day so nothing else was available). The next room had a great garden view and no musty smell but only had 1 bed (we were two adults and two kids...) so we asked again to be moved. The desk-man apologized for moving us from 2 beds to 1 bed and right away were given a very nice 3rd floor room with two beds facing the ocean and VERY close to the pools and restaurants. I was polite in dealing with the desk staff and they were friendly in helping me switch rooms (including the poor bell-man who helped move my bags a total of 3 times). We loved this room and it was kept very neat and clean by the staff. At one point my son contracted the flu and was sick for two days. We asked for all the sheets to be changed and they happily did this for us. Since my son was sick on the day we scheduled our Xcaret excursion, I had to find some way to make a last minute postponement to later in our trip. The desk staff helped me to make this postponement since I am deaf and could not use the phones myself. They made the calls themselves and they waited for the tour company to call back and confirm it. I was GREATLY relieved by this. We ate two times at the Botticelli (the Italian restaurant). The food is excellent there. The maître d' was very friendly, asked about our trip and even our childrens age. Off hand we mentioned our son would be turning 6 soon and he told us if we came back he would sing happy birthday (at this point in time our son had fallen asleep so they couldn't do it then). We did come back and he did remember us. We did not remind him of his promise but sure enough, the lights dimmed and out came the wait staff and maître d' singing happy birthday to our very surprised son. It was one of the highlights of our trip. We did not get a chance to eat at the Terrazi Grille because it booked up too quickly. If you want to go there I suggest you start waiting 30 minutes before reservations open up (around 9:30 am). Yes, its open now. We ate our breakfasts at Chulavista and it was interesting to try the different Mexican breakfasts (I liked Heuvos Rancheros). You can also ask for made-to-order omelets. Just pick out your fillings and hand it to the chef. Seating and service is fast. We ate lunches at the deli/grille. Sometimes the line appears to move a bit slow. I think this is because people keep moving around and it confuses the staff. But the service is friendly and the food tastes good. My family and I made use of the water sports. I found the staff to be friendly and helpful. They offered boogie boards to our kids before we even thought they would want them (they did). I took the hobie cats out twice and found them to be in good sailable condition. I caught some nice breezes offshore and zipped around. You want to stay in front of the dropoff. The staff let me use the free scuba 'demo' time (10am every day) to practice my scuba (I was certified in 2001 but haven't dived since). My wife did outdoor aerobics several times. She enjoyed the workout and it was fun to do it outdoors. I played in the water volleyball games but I must warn you, some of the staff cheats in a completely funny way that basically made everbody feel comfortable doing the same. I only went to a couple of the nightshows. The first one had the staff performing song and dance routines in a mostly humorous way. There is a Mexican fiesta night where they serve traditional Mexican faire and then you're treated to some historical and cultural songs and dances. You should try to make this if you are not going to places like Xcaret where they already have these dinner shows. We booked through TNT vacations and we found the representative there to be very helpful. He helped us find the right excursions for our family, made sure we made it to the buses, and also saw us off on our last day. We booked all our excursions through our TNT rep (avoiding the time-share spiel).

Reviews.Title: “A great little resort!!!!”
Reviews.Author: LeeBrown
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Reef February 4 - 18, 2007. There was a group of 8 for the first week and 6 of us for the second week. We were a little aprehensive about staying at the Reef after reading some of the reviews. We were pleasantly surprised during our trip though. The hotel is wonderful, the rooms were just average but they served the purpose. How much time do you spend in your room anyway. The staff were always pleasant to deal with. We left our maid $2.00 U.S. plus a little gift every morning. A little courtesy goes along way, we always had extra water and beer in the fridge and a cute little animal folded from the bath towels. Rooms were always spotless and well kept. The food was average in the buffet but we always found something to fill out stomachs. We went to the Italian restaurant twice and it was very good. We did not do the Mexican as we ate Mexican most everday anyway. The bar staff were more than pleasant if you tried to use a little spanish and a small tip went a long ways too. Salvador and Theresa were always great and remembered us and went out of their way to please us. The pools were great and even the small beach on the ocean was delightful. We had a few green flag days and took full advantage of them. We had fun playing in the waves. They fixed the terrace area where there was a big sink hole in the sand. They filled it all in and it was good for go. We walked into Playa Del Carmen several times (about a 15 minute walk to 5th Avenue) and always fun there. An afternoon at Senor Frogs was just a blast and Carlos and Charlies kept us hopping too!! We took the ferry to Cozumel on a raining windy day and it was a very interesting ride for sure...thought we were in the movie "The Perfect Storm" for awhile. We snorkeled in Cozumel but was not that great due to the damage from the hurricanes. We took the tour to Coba and had a great time, no complaints there. We also took the Jungle Crossing tour and it was just amazing, great great snorkeling in a bay, kayaking and swimming in the cenotes and a cavern swim that was just amazing!! Helen our guide, was just fantastic. We also went to Xcaret and Xel Ha. Saw the night show at Xcaret and it was very good. Snorkeled again at Xel Ha and it was pretty good too. These two places were very busy indeed. The weather was not great while we were there. Alot of rain, but usually cleared up to a decent afternoon. We still came home with good tans. Overall, it was a very pleasant experience. We are all from Canada, and they just love the Canadians there. Again the resort was awesome, clean and a great jungle setting when walking to and from rooms. The RIU Palace was right next door and it looked like a big marble prison. We much preferred the laid back, Mexican feel to this resort. Lots of kids there the second week, so it is definitely a family resort. We probably would never go back to that area of Mexico as it is very busy and very touristy. There is about 15 resorts all in a row. We were spoiled by the peace and quiet at the Barcelo in Costa Rica and would go back there for sure. Hope this helps alleviate alot of fears that people might have about staying at the Reef.

Reviews.Title: “Review of the Reef Resort”
Reviews.Author: Geaser
Reviews.Content: Very nice staff and service. Food above average. Resturants are small and hard to get into early in evening. Buffet is very good though. Rooms are clean and adequate space but the noise is intolerable. The room was noisy from every aspect. We could hear all noises outside, on the sidewalk, next door, below and above us. Sleeping was next to impossible for the noise. Many children are there and they add to the noise. If you are couple looking for a peaceful place to relax, enjoy the beach and get some sleep at night, this isn't the place. We will not return because of the very very very noisy rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific Hotel”
Reviews.Author: VanValGal
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Reef Playacar in January. We were most impressed by the staff and their accomodations; also we asked to change rooms as my husband uses a leg brace and a top floor room would have been difficult for the week. They gave us the best and closest room to all the restaurants and activities. We were thrilled. The staff were terrific, the food was so so, but that's what you get at buffets. However both ala carte restaurants were superb. It is a smaller hotel and an older one, but it is charming. The beach is very small, but it is the same in the whole area, due to previous hurricanes. We felt like we were in Mexico and not the US which was a nice change. Not everyone spoke English well, either, so that made things more fun as we all tried to understand each other. We also did a day trip to Coba with AllTourNative.com. They were pretty good, but they push that you purchase their special cameras (for when you are in a sinkhole) and they pushed their special mayan insect repellant. We never saw a bug and were glad we saved the $10US, and as for the camera, the sink hole (ceynote) is the only place you would NOT bring a regular camera, the rest of the time whatever you had worked fine. The guide was friendly and informative so it was a good day. They didn't feed us lunch, though, until 3:30 so if you are hypoglacimic or something BRING YOUR OWN FOOD!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “a fairly good stay”
Reviews.Author: conniedc
Reviews.Content: The Reef is a beautiful resort with very nice swimming pools, plenty of food and drinks, and a lush tropical setting. The room was plenty big and had a nice balcony. We had a nice time but thought potential guests might want to know the following: The beach is quite small, with some rocks. But b/c it's not crowded you can always find a spot to lounge. You may have to ask multiple times for something. We didn't have a remote for our TV for two full days, despite repeated requests. The room fridge doesn't always get restocked. We only had one working electrical outlet in the room. The internet doesn't work in the room--don't pay for it! You're better off checking email in the lobby or in Playa Del Carmen at a storefront internet center. When you arrive in Mexico, EVERYONE will be trying to get you to a timeshare seminar...we were almost duped twice, once at the airport and once by the concierge at the hotel. Just b/c someone is in a uniform doesn't mean they're not selling! Xcaret is a beautiful park, well worth the money. Tons of shops in Playa. Restaurants at the hotel are very good. Water in shower never got very warm and hot tub was definitely a warm tub. Our linens also had a peculiar smell, as if not dried thoroughly. All in all, for our first trip to Mexico, we had a good time and will return. Perhaps all these small inconveniences are true of all Mexican resorts; we just would have liked to have known about them ahead of time. Hope this helps future travellers!

Reviews.Title: “Nice for adults, not as good for children”
Reviews.Author: celesteann
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a trip to the reef playacar for a 4 day weekend with my 16 year old daughter. We had a very good time. The hotel was very beautiful, the grounds well kept, and the pool area was very nice. As mentioned many times, the beach has been eroded by the storms from a few years ago but they still had a beach entrance which is nice and there were plenty of chairs and sandy terraces with chairs for sunbathing. I wasn't as happy with the food. I have traveled a fair amount (Germany, France, England, Ireland, Jamaica, Hawaii, Curacao, etc) but have only been two one all inclusive resort (Beaches in Jamaica) and one cruise where the food was included. I thought the food at the reef playacar was edible but I felt that it was sub par. I'm not a picky eater and my daughter and I found things to eat each night but they weren't what I would call enjoyable meals. The room was clean and the bathrooms nice. I personally thought the beds were very comfortable, although I sleep on a hard bed at home and prefer that over soft beds. The room smelled like mildew but that is expected in a warm climate. I didn't think this was a good place to bring children. The pool was nice and they do have a kids club but my 7 year old son would have been bored at this resort and it would have been difficult to find things for him to eat since he is a picky eater. My 16 year old daughter commented that everyone was older and just wanted to sit around the pool or bar and drink. This is great for couples or groups of people (and expected on vacations) but it's not the best for small children. If I go back with my son we would probably pick a larger family resort. The location was excellent as we could walk to town. It was a healthy walk and we felt safe enough walking in for shopping or dinner, etc. We visited Xcaret one day and I highly recommend it. You can set up a trip with one of the hotel tour groups. We spent the whole day there. I don't think there is anything in the U.S. that compares. It had underground caves and rivers that you can snorkel in, a butterfly farm, various animals including monkeys and jaguars, an aquarium with sea turtles in various stages of life, swimming with the dolphins, beautiful coves and inlets for sun bathing, nice restaurants and a wonderful show in the evening that depicted the history of Mexico. There was a lot of shade and places to relax . Which were nice after walking around to see the sights. There were a lot of nice touches throughout the park including an exhibit that contained more than a hundred small birds hatching. My duaghter was absorbed in everything that she saw. It was amazing and was the highlight of our trip. We will go back with the whole family to see Xcaret and to see the other sites and Mayan ruins that we missed. Good luck.

Reviews.Title: “Another Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: FamSchneider
Reviews.Content: Let me start by saying that this Resort deserves recognition for its comfort, cleanliness and amazing staff. Those who have commented differently need to travel more extensively and stay longer that "2 days". My family travels a fair bit and to a variety of different places and I believe that if you are going to a Resort in a country outside of "your own" you must expect some differences. No, not everyone spoke English. That is why we went there. If you were treated rudely, maybe consider the way you approach them. We were a family of three, traveling with another couple and our experience with this Resort was terrific. The majority of staff were fabulous and I say this without hesitation. Rene, Cristian, Oliver.....many, many more....made every effort to make our stay memorable. They do this after 10+ hours per day, six days a week. Need I say more. The food for the most part was very good and plentiful. We happen to be somewhat picky as to the standard of food and really aside from a few things, this Resort provides a good variety and decent quality. If something did not agree with "your tastes", there was always plenty of other things to choose from. The snack bar is quick and handy if you don't feel like doing the Buffet. The wings, ribs and rotissiere Chicken were all great. It's a snack bar. They also serve great coffee AND ice cream at the snack bar.....so there is no reason to be without either....you just have to "look" a little harder. The Rooms are VERY clean and although many complain about the beds, the beds really are not that bad. They are firm, but not hard as concrete as has been mentioned. The entertainment....we only went to a few things, and they were all very good. The bars are fine too. If you don't first get what you were expecting, ask them for what you are looking for and they will do their best to accomodate. The downstairs lobby bar carries many of the International Brands we are all use to and there is no shortage......we tried (lol). But be adventurous....they make some fun domestic drinks too. Overall, this Resort really is great. It is not too big, but offering much of what the other bigger resorts would. It is small enough that they recognize you and remember the little things that you prefer. The Beach, unfortunately, is not hugh, but that is out of their hands and they work hard daily to ensure that they maintain what is left. You definately can access the water with little or no worry of rocks, unlike the Riu Palace next door that does have a sandy beach for your lawnchair and absolutely no access to the water. Choices. This was our second trip to this Resort. We are somewhat picky and our expectations are met at this Resort. We would come again for sure. Our friends that traveled together with us had a great experience as well and would return. If you are looking for beauty in surroundings AND people and a cozy, comfortable place to enjoy your stay, I truly recommend this place. Enjoy!!

Reviews.Title: “Beach is GONE... Photos are false advertisement !!!”
Reviews.Author: Erik-VI
Reviews.Content: Don't be mislead by the old photos of the beach! Believing that the hotel web site beach photos were true, my girlfriend & I booked a last minute vacation to The Reef Playacar. We were on vacation from Jan 6 -13, 2007. When we arrived: The Reef beach was approx 5 feet wide (nothing close to the wide pristine beach photographs on their web site). The day we left, the beach was completely gone and the lower terrace that we sunbathed on the day before, was closed due to dangerous sink holes caused by beach erosion. From what i witnessed, i can guess by now the lower terrace has collapsed into the sea. BEWARE: The all-inclusive activities: "Nonmotorized water sports including sailboats, kayaks, windsurfing, boogie boards and snorkel equipment" were NOT available because the beach is gone! NO Beach = No Beach Water Activities! Our room was clean and ok, but the Beds & Pillows were hard as a brick. Thankfully we travel with an Aerobed! Compared to our past Caribbean vacations, the overall service in The Reef was lacking! Unless one flashes US dollar tips, don't expect much/any service from food waiters or bar staff. Although costly, our frequent $ tips aquired service that other people around the pool & buffet envied. We enjoyed our vacation, because we met a few others who were willing to make the best of it... THANK YOU Windsor Canada, eh! & Suzy from Great Britain! And Kimberly, hope all is well! This resort is small and low key, geared towards family & kids or older folks. Anyone in between looking for a fun filled vaca... AVOID The Reef, Playacar! PS - on Rainy days there are ZERO activities, and the pool/beach bars (although empty) are kept open. While the other bars in the resort were fully occupied by visitors, the management refused to open service. Good Luck... review our photos BEFORE booking a Reef Vaca!

Reviews.Title: “Great, relaxing, friendly, ambience”
Reviews.Author: bellacat1970
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Reef Playacar well aware of the issues they were having with the beach. ITS NOT THAT BIG A DEAL. There is plenty of access to the warm, clean, blue Caribbean Sea. In fact, 100% better than the Riu next door. The only thing you won't get is a lounge chair on the actual beach. Didn't bother me much although I'm a die-hard beach fan. They had several levels of beach lounging available, some with sand, some without. The mix of people staying during my trip were fantastic. Friendly, warm and equally happy to be there. No one of the staff left a lasting impression with me (except our waiter at the Italian Restaurant). They were not rude, just not overly friendly or accomomdating unless you asked. The food was well prepared and well presented. Mexican was excellent. The grounds were awesome!!! Felt like you were in a rain forest. Loved the set-up, with individual villas and winding paths through the property. We were lucky enough to get a villa right next to the pool/restaurant area which made getting to everything a cinch. I would and will return to the Reef Playacar

Reviews.Title: “Best deal ever”
Reviews.Author: haehnelk
Reviews.Content: This resort was much more than we expected. Booked 7 nights all inclusive/air/transportation to the Reef for $699 from Detroit! Just returned on Jan 20th. It is beautiful there, with the tropical rainforest setting. Exceptional service, clean and friendly. The beach is back, though not much, it was still enough to lounge or swim. The food is good with exceptional rating in the Italian resteraunt. We were surprised by the quality of wine. The drinks are of any type, not just the cheap stuff. So much to do, walking or riding the free bikes to town, or renting taxi's to cenotes, snorkeling adventures or beaches. We really enjoyed the zipline tour. Fabulous trip, from someone who has been to Mexico many times.

Reviews.Title: “Grrrrrrreat!”
Reviews.Author: jdkmom
Reviews.Content: I used this site to determine where we wanted to stay in Playa. The Reef was terrific! We totally loved it! The beach is kinda small, but there was no shortage of beach chairs and room to enjoy the sun. The rooms are simple, but extremely clean. (The housekeeping staff is fantastic!) And like other hotels, the beds were hard, but not THAT hard. I certainly didn't lose any sleep because of them. The food was excellent, too. The buffet always had a big selection to choose from and was nicely displayed. We ate at the two "reservations only" restaurants on the site, too, and they were good as well. You MUST try the ice cream! It is so creamy and delicious. Yum! The entire staff was friendly and really helpful. I feel like we made some friends while we were there. The people who complained about the staff and the food must be very finicky. The entertainment was super fun. They always had something going on if you wanted to participate. And they did awesome night shows and games. All in all, The Reef isn't a Sandals resort, (we've stayed in one of those, too), but it's darn close. I'd definitely recommend it! Make sure you go to 5th Avenue -- only a 15 minute walk from the hotel -- and go to Excaret to enjoy the Mexican history and experience. Oh, yeah, and if you choose to go on a snorkeling/cenote adventure, use Sacred Blue. They were awesome!

Reviews.Title: “Big Disappointment”
Reviews.Author: UnoMidwest_Girl
Reviews.Content: This place was a big disappointment! My friend and I went to spend time, laying out on the beach, counting on the picture that was given on the Website. It was very different in real life! There was not beach. In fact, the longer we stayed, the more the ocean swept the beach away. I do feel for the future of the workers/staff whose livehood depends on this resort. The Hotel Lobby staff seemed helpful with our stay there, only until they learned we did not want to partake in their time-share offers. Then it seemed we were on our own. Also, it was an all inclusive stay but staff wanted tips. Our travel rep. was helpful. The rooms weren't that clean and the showers were not hot enough. Getting a clean towel was quite a feat. The first day, we were given one towel between us until we asked for another. It was the same for wash rags. Must be a shortage of clean towels in Playa. The water in the hot tub was simply not warm. It was a lukewarm which in the evening, with the ocean breeze, seemed rather cool. The pool was not heat regulated so it was very cold to us, since the weather was not that hot. The food was ok, but we got tired of the same stuff after a while. There was very little variation in what was presented. The Mexican restaurant was good. The drinks were average and the liquor was watered down unless it was tequila. The staff at the bars were not that friendly nor did they seem that interested in serving. The staff at the restaurants were friendly and helpful and did work hard to clear tables, etc. The 5th Street Market was really cool as was the Playa Plaza. The people there were friendly and it was a neat atmosphere. Overall, I would never, ever go back to that place.

Reviews.Title: “A great week at the Reef”
Reviews.Author: martinishaker
Reviews.Content: This was our first tropical vacation so I have no other experience to measure against. I have stayed in numerous resorts in Forida and Las Vegas (which I always find too big and impersonal) and what I was looking for this trip was exactly what I got. A small, qaint, villa on the beach environment. A quiet peaceful place to refresh and relax. We upgraded our room on arrival (not expensive to do) and we had the second building from the pool area with 2 decks, one with a jacuzzi tub which was wonderful in the evenings. The staff were great, very friendly and always helpful even though we didn't speak spanish at all, which at times made it difficult for both parties. (learn the basics) Room and public areas were very clean. Seemed like they were a little overwhelmed at times in the buffet dining room (keeping up with clearing and resetting tables as waves of people came through) had no problem getting assistance with a table, when we asked they responded immediately. Food was great, good variety every day, lots of fresh, healthly choices. It's unfortunate they are loosing their beach, for the first 4 days we were able to sit on the sand and swim in the ocean. By the 5th day the winds had picked up and there was no beach left. This was not just at the resort, the entire coast line of Playa was shut down and all water sports cancelled. We moved to the top pool and enjoyed the rest of our days there. I recommed this resort for people who are looking for a quiet, peaceful vacation. We are 2 adults, 40 yrs no kids and it was great for us.

Reviews.Title: “Overall good experience”
Reviews.Author: USAJim
Reviews.Content: We just returned from Playa del Carmen, staying at the Reef Playacar for a week with our two daughters. Overall, it was worth the cost since it was not too expensive. We liked this smaller size all-inclusive. The hotel personnel were terrific. Rooms were average and overall the facility kept clean. The food in the dining room is not that good. We ate at the reservation-only restaurants every night (we all preferred the Mexican). The drinks were fairly good quality. Our only major complaint was that they did not rinse out the soap/sanitizer from the drink cups. We bought our own plastic cups from town (expensive for the quality). Suggest you bring your own plastic cups if you are going to stay there. Although there is no beach, the seating area is in tiers and overlooks the ocean. The dive facility at the hotel was average to below average.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed at the playcar Reef good 3 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: Vladivotok
Reviews.Content: We are two mid 30' to 40 women with one 6 YO daughter who were booked into the Reef on 12-26 when Morris Travel in SLC fired our agent and then by neglect cancielled prior booking at the 5 star Riu Cancun from Christmas through the new year - where we had stayed the prior two years. Thus, this report may be tempered by prior experiences at the Riu Cancun and Maya hotels with their suberb beaches. I rate those Riu - as 5 star establishments Our desire was to lay on a protected beech and have kids programs available, escellent food and entertainment. The Playacar had good food but often we had to clean off tables to get a place to sit. Staff just didn't clean things up, and left dirty tables and us waiting. The room door had an open space between the top door frame and the top of the door through which one could hear noise from the outside. The beech was terrible. Its only ocean access had a wall through most of the middle where some could lay on beech chairs if it were reserved early enough, but was not helpful for ocean access with ski-do's roaring on the south side and the sun area on the other. We had been accustomed to superior kid play and superrvised programs offered by the Cancun Riu's where their stage presentations were very well done. By contrast the Playa Reef was so-so.The year end play was OK but hotel guests were seated wwy off to the sides where reliatives and non guests got all the Center seats. Also there was way way too many mosquetos and we had bites. In the U.S. we have control spray treatment which keeps these pests at bay and was not fun to have to keep covered - We simply never have had these pests in 3 prior Cancun vacatopms/ We also did not like the roaches which were in trash cans and occasional running across floors. Roaches are common in some Hotels like the Krystal, and at this one - but I've never seen one at the two Cancun Riu properties. Hotel staff were good. My husband called daily and reported that at times he got no answer - but when the hotel did answer, his call was transferred quickly and professionally. As am aside we were housed in the International for two nigts which is NOT all inclusive., and they have zero kids programs and is way overpriced. . Thie Reef hotel tried but just is not a good value for us and we'd not stay here again. Our flight was from Salt Lake non-stop on Delta which was satisfactory. In prrior years we have routed through Denver on Frontier and were very happy we did not this time cause of the blizzard that shut down DEN for a few days. When we did Fun Jet direct we also had no problems with travel but they only had 7 day packages which was too short for our desires as those days are when everyone seems to clog up airports and hotels in the area.

Reviews.Title: “An Objective Review”
Reviews.Author: SarahLindeau
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from our delayed honeymoon to the Reef Playacar, (December 18-25). I have read a lot of exaggerated reviews and have tried my best to keep my review as objective as possible so that people can get a fair picture of what this hotel is all about. Arrival: We arrived at the Reef late in the afternoon on December 18, and check-in was a breeze. The hotel's reception/lobby area is tastefully decorated and open, with a nice lobby bar open in the evenings. (Try Humberto's mojito and the Xabentun -a Mayan liquor made from honey). There is wireless internet available in the lobby area to those who bring their laptops (and safes in the rooms to safely store them for 10 dollars a day). However, our laptop has a 12.1" screen and it fit on its side inside the safe. Anything much bigger than probably 13.3" is not likely to fit in the safe. But don't worry; there is also a 'business center' off the lobby with stationary computers to use for a fee. So if you don’t need your lap top, don’t bring it. An unlimited 7 day access card for laptops cost us 300 pesos (approx. 30 dollars) and if you're lucky, you can get connection in your room, although it may be weak. Although we had asked for a king room, there were none available since they were fully-booked. The staff did their best to find us the best possible king room, but that would mean we had to move to a room without an ocean view, so we opted out. The grounds and rooms: The hotel is situated in between private property to the north and the Riu to the south. If you're booking a trip to this hotel and the photo of the hotel shows jungle on either side of the Reef (and more importantly, a beach –see the paragraph on the beach), you should be aware that that is no longer the case. Playacar is in the midst of a construction boom, and there are buildings being erected everywhere. Don't be worried, though--- there is no construction going on within hearing distance from the Reef. We loved the layout of the hotel--- small villas, each with 11 or 12 rooms over 3 floors, and a jungle in the middle of the complex. (Very beautiful). We stayed in a room in building 10, a queen/queen with an ocean view, in the complex closest to the ocean and pool areas. If you're looking for a quieter room, ask for one near the jungle, as we could hear much of the noise from the pool area. Bring earplugs if you are a light sleeper as doors and walls are paper-thin. Of course, there were certain things we didn't like about our room. It wouldn't have hurt if the beds were softer, and our toilet didn't require a 5 hour repair on day 6, but we tried to remember, we were in Mexico. (Most public Mexican stores/restaurants ask that you not flush paper down the toilet, as the plumbing is a bit weak, so be grateful that the Reef allows you to do so, and be aware that it is a privilege!). Our air conditioner worked perfectly, but the thermostat did not. We found that if we left it on during the day, and turned it off at night, we were fine. The overhead fan is enough at night. If we left the AC on all night, we’d get too cold. Some would say the rooms are "tackily" decorated, but I would say they had Mexican flare. NOTE: Watch out for the tile floors when they're wet though, as they can be VERY slippery (as is the wooden walkway/bridge between the lobby and the rest of the hotel grounds, so hold onto the railing when crossing). The food: The food at the Reef was what we expected it to be for an all-inclusive. Remember that you are eating food that is cooked for average tastes, even though nearly everything is made-to-order while you watch the chef cook it. That means that if you like things spicy or salty, you'll have to add it when you go back to your table. The service was a bit inconsistent, but do not hesitate stop any of the waiters to ask for what you need. They were all very helpful when asked. Do be aware that English is a second language for nearly all of them. The hotel’s snack bar was a great substitute for lunch, as my husband and I ended up eating most of our lunches poolside with a drink in hand. The bartenders kept the drinks coming, and were very good at that! There are two ala carte restaurants that are worth trying that are included in the all-inclusive rate, but you have to pre-book your reservation on the morning of the day you want to eat there. The reservation book is at the entrance of the main buffet building, and they start taking reservations at 10 am. The line forms fast, so be on time if you have a large group. The beach: I would be repeating what everyone else has already said by saying there is no beach at the Reef. It is true, though. But it is a problem that many Playacar and Playa del Carmen resorts are facing. It is not unique to the Reef. That said, swimming was still an option, (although not incredibly enjoyable) because they have two small beach-entry points left. Bring water shoes though, if you want to swim at the hotel, since the sand gets sharper as you walk in. All is not lost, though, as there are nice beaches in Playa del Carmen (a five minute taxi ride away), and an EXCELLENT beach at Tulum (make it a day trip!). We did not let the lack of a beach get to us, though, since there are many daily pool activities (volleyball and water polo in the lower pool, and even scuba diving in the upper pool). There is also the pool bar. Enough said. :) Since there is no beach, the competition for the beach chairs is stiff. If you want the beach chair of your choice, set your alarm clock for 7 am and get out there with your blue Reef beach towels to reserve them. Then go back to bed. Of course, on day one, you won’t have you blue beach towel yet, so you’ll have to reserve your pick with a book or a magazine. You can get the towels by the desk by the lower pool, next to the jacuzzi at 8:30 am (take two for each person and keep the extra dry ones in your hotel room, as it may rain on your other towels). Overall experience: Whether you will like the Reef or not depends almost entirely on what you expect your Riviera Mayan vacation to be. My husband and I are 29 and 27 years old, and wanted a laid-back hotel where we could truly unwind and forget what day it was. We wanted to be able to meet people on day one and then be able to see those familiar faces again on day two or four, for example. The smaller size of the Reef enabled that. We preferred the Reef to the Riu for example, because it offered a more personal experience, on a smaller scale. (The Riu is HUGE!!!!) The Riu is really a "concrete jungle," as we heard fellow Reef patrons say. The difference between the Reef and the Riu can only be truly appreciated by those who can see these two entirely different hotels side-by-side. The Reef was much quainter. The grounds were absolutely beautiful and impeccably kept. There are hibiscus plants everywhere and amazing jungle vegetation. After every rain shower, there would be a guy out there with a broom, sweeping off the walkways, or cleaning up what is left of the beach. For the price, I would say that the Reef was not bad. The Riu next door has a much steeper rate, and I don’t think that their guests were that much happier than us over at the Reef. Other outings and day trips worth the effort: Playacar is a very nice (and exclusive) area. It is loaded with other all-inclusives, and lots of private beach property (a lot of it for sale!). If you go left outside of the hotel, there is a small shopping area about a five minute walk away, called Plaza Playacar. They have lots of small shops and a drug store. If you want more action, go into Playa del Carmen, either by walking or by taxi (5 dollars). Ask for 5th Avenue and you’ll be in tourist city! Lots of great stores and restaurants, but lots of people selling the same stuff over and over again. Try some places off-5th too, since you can often find better deals there. As far as day-trips are concerned, we wholeheartedly recommend the Tulum and Xel-Ha trips. Tulum is an archeological site with one heck of a beach (we heard it is one of the top-ten in the world), and Xel-Ha is a snorkeling paradise (“natural aquarium”). We did both trips on the same day on a dual-trip with all-inclusive meals and drinks, and it was worth it. If we were to do it again, we would do each separately and go for an all-day Xel-Ha trip, since the park is in a lagoon area, there were no big waves to navigate. There is so much to see there.

Reviews.Title: “Christmas at the Reef 12/18-12/27”
Reviews.Author: miamezcua
Reviews.Content: I was amazed about the reviews that I read. When we got there, my self, my husband and our 2 kids (12 & 9) we were surprised about the hotel, it was very nice and kept clean at all times, food was great and the best of all, the service from every body there; all the waitresses’, bar tenders, I mean every body. Every body knew our names and they were very friendly. If you go there don't complaint about them not speaking English, you are going to a foreign country wish their first language isn't Spanish either, it is Mayan. Besides, most of them speak Spanish and try English, Dutch, Italian, French, German, etc., but all of them do their best to speak it and understand you...do you? We found out that they have a proposal to make English mandatory in all elementary schools. We went to a presentation for the time shares that they offer and got treated to a day in a five star hotel, the installations were pretty nice but the service is what it makes the difference. The reef has a lot more to offer. The beach deal when we got there it was a very small, but we were told that they are planning on bringing sand & try to make it the way it was. We also saw pictures of how it was before last year’s hurricane. You have to go with a positive attitude and will get the same treatment, don't expect to treat people bad and get great service, they are humans not servants; and remember to “Treat people the same way you like to be treated”. On our next trip, we will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “For the most part the Reef is pretty good”
Reviews.Author: Jbdescent
Reviews.Content: The rooms were quite comfortable. Had no trouble with mold or the air conditioner. However, I'm not sure exactly why, but the room and building was REALLY noisy - we could hear the occupants coming and going and talking like we were standing right next to them! The grounds were GORGEOUS - with carefully arranged plants and caves and features - it was like being in a botanical garden! As mentioned in the previous reviews, there is KIND OF a beach - the Reef has a seawall, with two small beaches on either side of it. The Riu is next door and there is a beach, but it enters the ocean on a rocky shore. I much prefer the way the Reef is arranged personally. There were several people from the Riu sneaking over to get into the ocean on our beach - which makes sense, as they didn't want to get dashed to bits on the rocks. The lady running the snack bar was an unhappy camper, that's for sure. But we had no problems with anyone else at the resort. The rest of the staff were pleasant and helpful. The scuba "store" on the beach had really great and helpful staff. They helped me pick an appropriate scuba trip for my experience level. Overall, a good trip and a good experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great time!”
Reviews.Author: Kose
Reviews.Content: My first piece of advice: don't be fooled by the Reef Playacar website. It is actually much nicer than it looks on the website! We were really impressed with the hotel grounds: beautiful gardens and nice pools. The hotel rooms didn't look as cheesy as on the website. They were quite nice and always very clean. The food was good but got repetitive, which is normal at an all inclusive buffet style hotel. The staff was always friendly---TIPS are VERY appreciated. The hotel is not far at all from Playa del Carmen. It just takes 15 min. on foot or a $5 taxi ride. The only disappointment was the size of the beach. It is quite small. During our stay (Nov.13-Nov. 20th) the water was quite rough anyway, so we spent most of our time in the pool and doing excursions. We did a day trip to Chichen Itza but didn't book it through the hotel. It was much cheaper booking through one of the agents you can find downtown. The name of the travel agent is Segio's tours. We got a great deal and saw a lot that day. Be prepared to spend a long, hot day sight-seeing and wear comfortable shoes. Tulum was a short bus ride away. We didn't book a tour, but just took the local bus from the bus station downtown Playacar. There's a ferry boat to Cozumel which is also a lovely day trip. We rented a car once we got to Cozumel and drove to the beaches on the other side of the island. The beaches were BEAUTIFUL! Downtown Playa recommendations: if you want to go salsa dancing, try Mambo Cafe. On 5th Avenue downtown Playa you can find lots of great restaurants. We ate amazing steak and seafood cocktails at Mare y Tierra and checked out the Blue Parrot night club on the beach. It's ladies night on Thursdays! Free drinks for women but VERY expensive drinks for men. Atmosphere is cool though. The food stands downtown selling 'fast food' such as tacos and sandwiches are delicious. All in all, it was a great vacation and we got a super last minute deal 2 days before we went. We were pleasantly surprised by the hotel and the food and we'd go back because we got excellent value and great service.

Reviews.Title: “great value, but no beach”
Reviews.Author: mikim-okc
Reviews.Content: We just returned on the 24th after four great nights in Playa Del Carmen. For the most part we were very happy with our stay at the Reef Playacar. Our family, early 30's with two kids 7 & 3, found the resort to be very relaxing and a great value. At first we were a little leery because there is not a grand lobby or reception area and the first impression is not that impressive. However, the more time we spent there the more we appreciated the secluded feel of the rain forest courtyard and the cottage style rooms. Each cottage has four rooms on each of the three floors, so there were no loud drunks stumbling to their rooms at 3 a.m., or at least that we had to hear. Also, who wants to be around 400 rooms of people like at the larger resorts? The service was also good with the exception of the lady running the grill by the pool. She didn't always act very happy to serve. I would say as a whole the staff did not understand or speak English as well as in Cancun, as other reviews had mentioned. We didn't have a problem with this and communicated just fine. I don't understand why some people complained about this, after all we are in their country, however, I am sure our 20 word Spanish vocabulary was impressive to them. The food exceeded our expectations. The buffet always had a good variety of entrees, fresh fruit, and bread. The nightly, reservation only restaurants were great. I recommend the grilled salmon at Botticelli's. It is the best! But reserve early as they fill up quickly starting at 10 a.m. daily for that night. There were only a couple of negative things we experienced with this resort. The main thing, and it was big, is that the beach is pretty much nonexistent at this resort. If you are also looking at the Riu Palace beware. It is right beside the Reef and its beach is primarily rock. It is not just the beach here. Other resorts are having similar problems. The positive note was that the Reef is only about a 10 minute walk (15 holding a 3 yr old) to the 5th Ave district where there is a good public beach by shopping and the ferry to Cozumel. We love the ocean and the beach so we did this each day we were there. A taxi ride is only $5 one way, but it is a nice walk. Walking back and forth to eat at the hotel does become an inconvenience. The only other negative was since there is no beach, wake up early as the lounge chairs by the pool get "reserved" with towels and other personal belongings by 7:30. We have always stayed in Cancun, without the kids, but found Playa's laid back pace more welcoming with the entire family. We would have no problem staying at the Reef again except we love hanging out at the beach and they simply don't have one. One of the locals said that since the Tsunami the ocean has risen about 1 meter each of the last two years consuming about 75-100 meters of beach. If you see a picture of this resort with large beaches, trust me the picture must be older than two years ago. Know this going in or you will be very upset and dissappointed when you arrive. We love this area of the world and wish we were still there. I am a type A CPA and this is one of the few places that I can go and do a 180 degree turn and completely relax. We are already planning next years trip.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Vacation Ever”
Reviews.Author: mrsbu
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a week at the Reef and not only we will never go back to the hotel but we probably will never go back to Mexico. First of all the weather was terrible rain all week, they can't control that. HOwever we had to change rooms 3 times to get an A/C that worked and didn;t flood the room. The room we ended up in the bathroom walls were covered in black mold. Food was terrrible, Mexican rest had no Mexican Food on menu. Wait staff and servers were surley, rude and would just walk away when you asked them for something. I speak spanish so it wasn't a communication problem they were just rude. Waiter dropped a tray of drinks on person nears us and not an apology. Also never replaced drinks he spilled. Many of the staff assume that because you are american you don't understand them and yes they are insulting you. When of our numerous room changes they wanted to put us on the third floor I am slightly handicapped and can't go upstairs well, when I said no tot he 3rd floor the bellman said to his companion that I was too fat to go up and down staires and referred to me as gorda(fat girl basically) The beach also washed completely away while we were there here one night next morning red caution tape and a 15 fot drop to the ocean. Also every time we went to lobby we were attacked by the timeshare people. This hotel sits them behind desks and calls them concierges, but they are there to haunt you and try to get you to go to a timeshare called the hacienda. All in all we should have gone back to the Wyndham Azteca were we were last year

Reviews.Title: “Where's the beach?”
Reviews.Author: Flyhalf10
Reviews.Content: Our stay was Dec 3-10 and, aside from the rain, we had a pretty good time. We found all the staff to be friendly and helpful and didn't have any problem with the food. The only negative is that the beach area is continuing to erode away at an alarming rate. We were aware in advance that the beach area did not look like the brochures due to the hurricane last year and so were not surprised. We got quite a shock, however, Saturday morning when we went out and discovered that overnight over half of the remaining beach had disappeared, just like that! The main concrete steps down undermined and broke up, seperating from the main retaining wall and crumbling in a heap. One of the thatched roof beach shelters crashed down right beside us as we sat on the beach as the waves took out the sand supporting it. There is virtually no beach area at the waters edge to lay and sun on now, particularly on the dive shop side of the resort. The main centre retaining wall is undermined with serious structural cracks. I'd be surprised if it survives despite valiant attempts by one young worker trying to repair it. One step forward and two steps back.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant vacation”
Reviews.Author: ranclan
Reviews.Content: We were looking for a pleasant, reasonably priced all-inclusive hotel near Playa. We were very happy with the Reef- we were warmly greeted, shown to a nicely appointed, but not overly decorated room, offered a tour of the facilities, etc. The food was good with variety and lots of fresh fruit. When the restaurant wasn't open, you could always find something else to eat- snack bar, ice cream, bar area. We aren't big drinkers, but the ones we had were good- not too much alcohol to dilute the flavor. We ate dinner at the Italian restaurant which was excellent. The Reef is the closest Playacar hotel to Playa. It is an easy 10-12 minute walk, which we took several times. The beach isn't very big, drops off fairly quickly, and tended to be rocky along the breakwater, but that didn't stop us from enjoying it. What we liked best were the gardens, which are exquisite!, the constant attention to cleanliness, and the pre-Hispanic show of Mayan dance, which was as good as some we have seen done professionally. If the show is offered when you are there, be sure to see it ! ! ! ! Would we stay there again ? Yes. I would take a second floor room so we could leave the windows and doors open all day and night, which was not prudent on the ground floor. Go, have fun. It isn't the Ritz, but it's clean, easy going, small enough to be welcoming and fun for all.

Reviews.Title: “Despite effort - poor results”
Reviews.Author: 100oo001
Reviews.Content: There is NO room for personal space around the pools or beach. The “beach” area was crammed with people with no personal space anywhere. The plastic low quality beach lounge chairs have stinky old mats on the top, and these get “reserved” with personal items early in the morning. There is no real BEACH. It is a swimming access point which is crammed between sharp rocks and a wall and another section which is partitioned for boat use. So, while one is swimming, large scuba boats with roaring engines pull in an out less than 20 meters away from where you are swimming and fill the area up with 2 stroke exhaust fumes. There is no other area to swim. The reef is at the end of a washed out strip of beach and all the resorts have limited water access, but the reef has the least. So, if you like chilling out with a little personal space around you on the beach, forget it. You will be jammed in a line up of beach lounges on dirty sand. The pool has an obnoxious PA system that frequently has someone yelling over it to motivate people to play pool volleyball or polo. Say goodbye to relaxation as the whole resort is forced to listen to this inane babble. The food. Simply put. Terrible. The worst. I have done all inclusive before, and this was the worst. Slow, rude, bad tasting, lack of variety, bland, yuck. We dreaded eating every meal. We booked one night at the “Italian restaurant” on the resort. The quality was worse than your average canned pasta meal bought at a supermarket. To top off this whole experience, we experienced 24 hours of sick time with a stomach flu. We found out others had similar experiences after talking with other guests. I have been back now for a few weeks from vacation and I may have Guardia (undergoing tests). The room we had had a faulty and loud AC system. Every night the AC it would warm up leaving us hot and sweating. Concierge. - These people help you, and then try to sell you timeshares. This was by far my worst vacation ever. I would highly advise against going here (or the Mayan Riviera) unless you like over crowded, loud, low quality experiences. I wish I could get my money back. TNT vacations should be ashamed for misrepresenting this vacation package.

Reviews.Title: “Stay at the Riu!!!”
Reviews.Author: TravelingGirl79
Reviews.Content: This resort is the furthest thing from a 4.5 star that you could possibly imagine! It’s a 3 star at best. The rooms are tiny and damp; turn the air conditioner on and it’s too cold, turn it off and it’s too HOT! The beach is non-existent – there was one before the hurricane but it’s now buried. Staff at the Reef neither speak nor understand English; most are rude and unhelpful (except for the girl behind the customer care desk). Good luck getting help from your Sunquest advisor, as she is never anywhere to be found. Our initial room at the Reef was flooded, (with toilet water) and the second had no hot water. Thank goodness for the hairdryer which warmed us up! We called and visited the front desk FIVE times to have the hot water issue resolved, all to no avail. Whether they didn’t understand us, or simply didn’t care, is still a mystery. When it comes to eating at this resort you had better enjoy rice because this is the only thing they cook well. We literally ate rice for each of the few meals we had at this resort. The rest of the time we spent unplanned cash on meals in Playa Del Carmen (thank g-d for the short walk into town). It took us only a matter of hours to begin phoning the Playa Del Carmen Sunquest office to transfer resorts, and two days for them to move us to the Riu Palace Riviera Maya next door. While we had to pay to move over, we can’t stress enough how incredible it was to finally be at a resort that has been properly rated. Our advice: Pay the extra few hundred dollars upfront and stay at the Riu!

Reviews.Title: “Review From Gay Point of View”
Reviews.Author: BrazMex
