Reviews.Content: My stay at the Reef was fabolous! Exquisitly wonderful, I have fully enjoyed my visit to Playa del Carmen and all the attractions I went. The pool was a fun , the drinks were ok, I loved "Monaco" the bartender recommended me and I had few, gave me a good buzz. The buffet was very good indeed, always something good, sometimes I didn't know what I was eating but I felt good and right and I had it anyways, never, never got sick. I even lost a few pounds, I realised that the Coke there has less calories than in the US and so everything else!!! Is my country trying to kill me? I ate a lot in Mexico and nothing made me feel stuffed like a walking whale, I really started thinking about crossing the border and doing the reverse, immigration in Mexico please let me stay so I can look tan, beautifulll and skinny, my "girlfriends" were quite happy as well about the low fattening and low calories food down there, gorgeous! As I read the review below, the guy gave some tips on Bars and Clubs in Playa and he was right, I did have lots of fun at Wana Bana, Playa 69 and Voga. Cuties arounds, watch out "gueros" hehehehe. All the Staff at the Reef was great, thank you all. Excaret was very nice, try snorkling, the location is just beautiful. Chichen Itza was the hottest place I've been to in my whole gay life and I thought Rio de Janeiro was hottest. Chichen was unbelievably captivating, all the history, mayans and toltecs, our tour guide was very accurate since I saw a few documentaries before I got there. All in all I loved it all.... I must be back again so I can lose a few more pounds, look fresh and beautiful and have lots of great moments with the nicest people in the whole Mexico. Yes, take some Spanish lessons, it can help you a lot. Good luck babies!

Reviews.Title: “No speak Espanol”
Reviews.Author: sasq
Reviews.Content: I've just returned from a weeks vacation in Mexico, and just have to share my enthusiasm regarding Playa Del Carmen and The Reef Playacar all-inclusive resort. The grounds alone set it apart. I have yet to find a photo on the internet that does justice to the beautiful inner courtyard of this hotel. Its like a well manicured piece of the jungle (beautifully lit at night). Despite the fact that one of the al a carte restaurants were closed while we were there, I never tired of the food, as there was a different theme in the Buffet restaurant evey night. The selection even then was vast enough to leave me feeling that I just hadn't experienced all there was to offer. Boticelli's was as exquisite a fine dining experience as one could ask for. The service as excellent as the food (I'm unsure how they managed to serve melt-in-your mouth fresh Atlantic Salmon in the Carribean). I rarely had difficulty making myself understood by staff members, though I don't speak Spanish. And they never made an issue of it (though an American tourist quite haughtily told me she'd never dream of coming to Mexico without knowing the language). I could, however, speak it quite fluently after 4 shots of tequila. And - speaking of tequila, the drinks were strong and plentiful. The Mexican staff encourage you to have a great time, but don't worry, thier security people aren't about to let you drown yourself skinny dipping in the wee hours of the morning. That being said, there were few singles at this resort. Mostly small families and couples. The Europeans vastly outnumbered the colonials, and there wasn't a lot of revelry at the resort itself. There were a number of clubs in Playa del Carmen that played horrible techno trash music and served watered down drinks. The Blue Parrot being the worst of them (as they had 2 DJ's playing different songs at the same time from opposite ends of the bar) Pure cacaphony. Thier $6.00 USD Margaritas tasted like 7/11 slushies and thier Cuba Libres were nothing more than diet Coke. Senior Frog's was a little better, I was especially amused by thier method of clearing the bar after last call - just turn the fire extinguisher on the crowd and let them have it. The Mayan ruins were breathtaking - especially Coba, which boasts the Yucatan's tallest pyramid - still accessable to those who want to climb them and see the jungle canopy from the top. My suggestion is to go in the late afternoon when the sun is low and shining on the face of the pyramid. A sight I won't soon forget. The last 20k of road to Coba is under construction and no fun to drive in the dark. So don't tarry too long in the shops after seeing the ruins.

Reviews.Title: “We stayed at the Reef Playa Car for the third time”
Reviews.Author: Teenieone
Reviews.Content: My husband and I first found this gem of a resort in 2003 when we went there for our Honeymoon (10 days in paraduse). It was absolutely awesome. The room was decorated up with flowers on our arrival and we had the most awesome honeymoon. So much to see and do in this area of Mexico. We returned again in September of 2004 for another 10 days at The Reef Playa Car. The resort and the beaches were awesome as usual and what is exceptionally nice about this resort is that it's smaller so it offers you more of a quaint ambiance rather than the hustle and bustle of a larger resort. And they retain their help. We saw alot of the same faces that we saw when we were there for our honeymoon in 2003 and some even remembered us................now that's really a nice feeling. We had planned to go again in 2004 but two days before we were to fly to Mexico, Hurricane Wilma hit and dashed our plans. We ended up in the Dominican Republic which was nice but not as lively as Mexico. We returned for our Third stay at the Reef Playa Car from October 28th thru November 8th (12 days). The resort has done some renovating and has added a wonderful new ice cream parlor which serves the most delicious Carmel & Cream Ice Cream....delicious!!! If you go there, try it as you'll never taste anything like it in the USA. They also added a lounge/lobby bar which offers some upscale drinks like martinis and others. They also upgraded their Snack Bar whick offers a variety of fast food items, pizza, hot dogs, hamburgers, nachos, chicken etc... This is nice but you have to wait and the line can be long at times. It use to be Self Serve and I liked that much better. Perhaps they could make Nachos and some of the lighter items self serve, it would be more convenient. Often times we ate at chula vista for lunch as it was buffet style and you didn't have to wait. We had several meals in Borticelli's (upstairs at the Reef Playa Car). It's an excellent Italian Restaurant and the food is out of this world. Don't miss this gem!!!! Our Room was lovely and was always cleaned promptly in the morning by the same friendly gal. We were in room 833 and it was the perfect location for the pool, restaurants etc........Not one complaint on that. We saw many familiar faces, alot of the staff from 2003 was still there which goes to show that it's a nice place to work. The staff is awesome,,,,friendly, knowledgeable about the area and very helpful. I want to mention a few of the staff that really shine and deserve to be mentioned, "Herman" who always had a smile on his face and went above and beyond to deliver drinks to us at our lounge chair and to offer any assistance he could during our stay. Pedro from the pool bar who suggested so many delicious drinks "riveria maya", "Monaco", "mojito" and "Louis" who has worked his way up to be a supervisor. These folks helped to make our stay so enjoyable. The only drawback about going in Oct/Nov is that it's the rainy season and we had an awful lot of rain which was very disappointing to us as we're real "beach people". I wouldn't go in November again as it's their rainy season. I have been there in June/July and Aug/Sept and it was sunny all the time...........this time it was more rain than sun. so if thinking of going to the Reef Playa Car try to plan your tirp when it's not their rainy season. I also was disappinted with the beach this time. In the past we saw a gorgeous, pristine white, powdered sugar beach that was very expansive. With Hurricane Wilma and other tropical storms the beach has basically been washed away. The beach area is now quite rocky and the surf is rather rough due to erosion. The best swimming area is where the boat launches and we had an issue with the Marina guy as he wouldn't allow anyone to swim in that area even when the boats were out for hours on end. Personally I feel that is unfair to the guests who so badly want to enjoy the Caribbean Sea. Something needs to be done about the beach as there just isn't one anymore and it really shouldn't be an issue for "guests" to swim in the boat launch area when the boats our out on scuba expeditions. We were put out about that as the BEST swimming area is where the boats launch. I would definately go back to The Reef Playa Car as the resort itself is absolutely Wonderful. The food is delicious, the shows and entertainment are great and the staff is awesome. My only complaint is the Beach as right now there really isn't one. Hopefully they'll be able to bring in sand and build the beach up to what it use to be...in one word, it use to be AWESOME but the hurricane can really do a number on the shoreline. In all honestly the resort is a GEM!!!! Only a couple of issues.

Reviews.Title: “Unforgettable!”
Reviews.Author: Miami-Agent
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Reef Playacar from Oct 16 through the 24 and had a great stay there. First I went completely alone, flew to Cancun and took the ADO bus to Playa del Carmen. it only cost me $8.00 . When I got there I took a taxi to the hotel. ( $5.00). Check in was easy and I stayed on a room facing the beautiful tropical garden, just what I wanted. The first 3 days I tried to keep myself busy and went to Cozumel ( a little disappointing) next day I took a trip to Chichen Itza, don't buy this trip online or unfortunately at the Hotel, they will rip you off, I went to Playa del Carmen and started shopping around, I found first for 89usd then 69usd then 59usd and finally for only $45.00 !!!! They picked me up at the hotel at 7:30am, went straight to Chichen Itza with a stop to the restroom and shopping. All the other tours I preferred to go to Playa, much better and the service is the same all over! The hotel is gay friendly, I saw several couples, guys and girls but I was little lost on where to go, not so sure if I should ask the guy at the front desk I decided to check the internet! I strongly recommend you to go first to WannaBanna on the 5 Avenue in between 30and 32 street, its was great, Mario the owner told me about the other two clubs to go afterwards, I made friends with the nicest people ever.... Vega is right on 10 street, where you see the light house, awesome club, very trendy and spacious, great ambience very Playa. The other club is called Playa 69.... there you find the more daring locals, flirting is in your face and they're not shy, tequila shots is mandatory!!! Club 69 is on 5th Avenue in between 6 and 8 streets, going north bound, pay attention to your left, the sign is kinda hidden and the club entrance is located almost inside and gallery. The shows at the Reef were quite nice, Monday night they have 70's night, it was they gayest show I've seen in a hotel ever!!! I guess they don't know YMCA is quite gay! it was fun anyways, the guy from Congo was hilarious, they all did a great job. Saturday night they had Mexican night, it was simply beautiful, their folklore is just one of the most colorful and beautiful there is. They were professionals dancers and it was as cute as it can be, don't miss it. The staff is extremely helpful although they seemed to be short staffed, Neri was a gentlemen, he recognized me every day, all the others knew me and complimented me often. Pedro from the pool bar was great, I speak French but he understood the French guest better than I did and he only speaks Spanish and limited English. Just to remind all American guests! it's not that they don't speak English, it's you that don't speak Spanish! Advice: Take some Spanish lessons before going there and just relax, you;re in Mexico... The staff is very nice and ready to help, they deserve to be respected on their own country, LEARN SPANISH PEOPLE! YOU'RE NOT THE STATES!!!! The hotel had a very international staff as well, Italians, French, Dutch ( cute girl), Venezuelan one guy from Chile ( silly boy! hehehe) and off course Mexicans, the girl with long hair was a great hostess, thank you, sorry didn't get your name. The majority of the guests were from Europe a very few Americans and Canadians. Being single wasn't very easy to approach people, still I made a bunch of friends in Playa. Go to Xcaret the show at night is simply one of the most touching and interesting events and it can never be missed by any visitor, also a must. My stay was perfect, the housekeepers were great, they knew what time I left the room and never bothered me once, I always found my room clean and nice. Since I was alone I never went to Boticelli, I ate at the buffet almost all the time, it was hit on Mexican night and a miss on a night I can't think of.... overall the breakfast was good, the fruits were delicious, the crab salad was amazing! I loved most of it, grilled fish, calamari, shrimp, some dark salsa they used on seafood was DELICIOUS! I was open to new tastes and tried it all, never got sick. In Playa del Carmen (PDC) you can eat at the finest restaurants , amazingly there are several fine dinning, Casa Del Agua was simply exquisite, if you feel like going to where the locals go, check 10 Avenue, there you find the most cheap restaurants and they're very good. Plaza Pelicanos has the best natural food I've tried in my whole life, try their exotic natural juice drinks, they're amazing and you will never find that in any part of the world. Going to Playa del Carmen is for those who are looking for peace, fun, relaxation, adventure and much more.( you can even fall in love, just like me), Playa has an atmosphere that you'll never find any place else. I loved it and I WILL BE BACK FOR MORE!!! Mexico certainly exceeded my expectations, I could not stop crying the day I left, I did not want to leave Mexico, they changed my life, they purified my soul and made me realize that there are places and people in this world worth to see and experience. The Mexicans in PDC were the best, they really make you feel like you belong there, they treat you with a smile and if you speak the language it will be an unforgettable experience. I MISS YOU ALL, I LOVE YOU PLAYA DEL CARMEN AND I HOPE TO RETURN SOON. if you have any questions about the places I've been, specially to the gay oriented public, please e-mail me : roger_lyra@yahoo.com PS: Be happy and relax. Playa will take care of the rest PS2: VIVA MEXICO EN LA PIEL....WILL NEVER FORGET IT.

Reviews.Title: “Good Deal”
Reviews.Author: jsfines
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Reef from Sept 23 to Oct 7/06 and found the hotel fairly decent with one exception. When you check in, after the signing in formalities, the desk clerk advises you to talk to the concierge who was standing right behind me, and who is suppose to describe what is available at the hotel but is actually a timeshare salesman. I brushed him off, but another couple who came in the same group as me ended up going to a presentation. The hotel is a twenty minute walk to the outskirts of Playa del Carmen or 50 peso cab ride. They also have free bicycles to use and you can use the sidewalk to bicycle into town. Note when you use the sidewalk, go across the street from the hotel as that sidewalk is designated for cycling and when you get near the traffic circle you switch sides.. The food at the buffet is 3 stars, but the Italian restaurant was 4 stars. The one problem is that they won't let you make a reservation until 10 am, even though the girl who is responsible for the reservations is on duty much earlier on. The staff while most of them have limited English try hard and I give them 4 stars. The rooms are four stars and have a small refreigerator in them which I found handy. The grounds are four stars.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay...”
Reviews.Author: twon75
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Playacar for 1 week. We enjoyed our stay as we came down with another couple to vacation. I rated this hotel as average due to the fact that the snack bar was under renovations and construction beside the hotel was ongoing all day long. Our first room given to us was facing the construction so we asked to be moved into the middle of the resort. The hotel was very kind in doing so without any problems. The buffet restaurant was average and the Italian restaurant was very good. Unfortunately, there was a language barrier as the help did not speak very good english at all. Overall, the resort was cleaned and maintained very well.

Reviews.Title: “absolutely perfect”
Reviews.Author: miller-duvall
Reviews.Content: i have just returned from a week at the reef playacar. the hotel exceeded my expectations and i couldnt have wished for anything better. the service was outstanding, everyone was so friendly and helpful. drinks would be brought to you on the beach. nothing was too much for the staff. at mealtimes, as soon as you finished your drink, a member of staff would bring you another drink without you having to ask. the food was amazing, freshly cooked omelettes or fried eggs for breakfast. so many different choices for lunch and dinner. there was also a snackbar that was open 11-6 and then 10.30 - 2 am, which also had a lot of choice. the food was always cooked freshly in front of you. the swimming pools were cleaned everynight and the swim up bar was very convenient. there was also an ice cream parlour that opened in the afternoon which was nice as it was surrounded by a waterfall, it was nice to get away and was very relaxing. my boyfriend had a massage on the beach, and said it was so relaxing, as all you could hear was the sea in the background. the hotel was so clean. there was people sweeping the paths all the time, there was always gardners on sight making sure the surroundings were kept nice. people were constantly cleaning. i would reccommend this hotel to everyone and will definately be going back in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Worth the price”
Reviews.Author: Bostonreview
Reviews.Content: we just returned from from the Reef (8/26-9/2/06). It was a family vacation with my wife and two children. The resort is clean and the rooms are comfortable, though a bit small. The AC can be a bit loud but overall, the facilities are quite nice. The staff is very friendly and the service was fantastic. We ate at the buffet 70% of the time and made reservations at the Mexico restaurant for dinner three days. I would say the breakfast and lunch buffets are better than the dinner. The reservation-required mexican restaurant was quite good and I highly recommend it. There were quite a few guests that smoked and this did bother us during meal time as there is no smoking zone in the buffet restaurant. The snack bar had its usual (and fatty) goodies such as burgers, fries, pizzas, etc. The pool was fine and the beach area is small but pleasant. My kids loved the boggie boards to ride on the ocean waves. We did not attend any of the evening shows. As for activities, we did quite a bit. We booked the snorkeling trip with the Reef (Laura is quite helpful at booking trips) and found it enjoyable. We also went to Isla Mujeres and did some snorkeling off this island as well. My kids swam with the dolphins and they found it exciting while I found the place to be a bit too commercia. The last and best activity was the "Tulum Extreme". The "extreme" is for "extremely fun" . It is not dangerous and my 10 year old had no problems with any of the adventures. We thoroughly enjoyes snorkeing in a cave, zip-lining into water and learning about the history and culture of City of Tulum. I would strongly recommend this to anyone who likes the outdoor and want to do something besides the usual sightseeing and water sports. Overall, for the money we paid, the Reef is a good deal and I would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great 1st year anniversary trip!”
Reviews.Author: GTRIP
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just got back from staying at this resort, it was for our 1year anniversary and we stayed 4 nights and 5 days. We loved it, we had a wonderful time. This was our first experience with an all-inclusive resort and for the money we spent, we could not have gotten any better. -After landing we checked in with our travel rep and waited about five minutes before we loaded into the van and headed down to Playa del Carmen. The driver even asked if we wanted to stop at 7-11 for a drink for the trip. The drive down only took about 35-40 min. which was not bad at all. -When we arrived in Playacar, it is this gated community with a bunch of residences and vacation homes (all very nice looking), we drove down a nicely paved street with side walks for walking into town. Our resort was the first resort on the strip, then numerous other resorts continued on down the road. This was great because our resort was the closest in walking distance to the town (we rented bikes once and walked into town a few times). -At our resort we checked in (it was very simple and quick) and then we were on our way. We went to our room which was located in the middle of the resort and checked it out, it was very clean and nice and cold (we had fun with the a/c, but all you really need is the fan and you can turn the a/c on occasionally if you are sweating). The grounds were just as nice as everyone has said they would be, very well kept, there were people working on them everyday. -Then we went to the buffet for lunch, it was definitely not the greatest lunch but they did have some good things like, quesadillas, fresh guacamole and salsa, and my husband got good pesto ravioli, but after that we pretty much just ate at the snack bar for lunch. The first night you will not be able to get reservations for the restaurants, but after that you can get them every night and we never had a problem cause we were normally at breakfast when it was the time you can get on the list (which is 10am). Dinner at the restaurants was great (get ideas from other guests, we got the salmon, that was pretty good) especially when compared to the dinner buffet (which was not very good, not very many choices). Breakfast was very good (selections you would get from any breakfast buffet – omelets, French toast, pancakes, scrambled eggs, bacon or sausage, fruit, yogurt, cereal) breakfast quesadillas and other Mexican breakfast items. -The bars were great, always fast, and always friendly. The drinks were almost always strong, definitely try the mojitos they were very good, pina colodas, bahama mamas, all very good. Don’t go for the frozen margaritas or daiquiris cause those were too watered down. -The beach was small but fun, there were however a lot of big rocks in the ocean so be careful, we tripped over a bunch of them. I found that you have to wake up at or before 7 to get a beach chair in the middle section of the beach (which was the best area, because of the ocean breezes and this area has the most shade and it is away form the loud speaker that is by the lower pool) but really there are tons of open spots that are covered and beautiful and there seemed to always be spots up and around the pools. -Tulum, we rented a car for one day and drove it down to Tulum. A few issues: We rented it from Alamo which was only $16 dollars but we had to buy liability which brought it to $24. (The only problem with renting it from them is that they said in the agreement that they would only authorize $1000 but instead they authorized $4000, which is fine but it has been 5 days and the money has still not come off hold from our card so we are getting upset, so be careful) But anyway, they gave it to us with ¼ tank of gas which would not get us very far so we went to the gas station, we figured they would take credit but they did not (or at least that is what they said) so we had to pay for the gas in cash which pretty much wiped us clean out of cash. So anyway, we made it to tulum and you need to pay $4 to park there and $4.50 a person and then $2 if you want to take the train thing or you can just walk (add it is not that far), the money was a little had for us since we were wiped out of our cash, but we figured it out. But I would have to say it was worth it, it was beautiful. They don’t let you on to the ruins which really upset me but I understand, although the pictures on postcards have people all over them so they must have changed it recently. There is a nice place to go down and jump into the ocean and the breezes are very nice when you are out on a hot day. Defiantly go to Tulum, I also heard Xel-ha was a lot of fun but we did not get a chance this trip. -The catamarans were a lot of fun and I think defiantly worth it to get out into the water and look up and down the beach. -We both got a massage on the beach and it was awesome. We made reservations (which we did not really need to cause no one else really seemed to be doing it) and they gave us a free five minutes which was really more like 15 and it was a great warm up of what to expect. Then we got our massage on the last day we were there right on the beach, we were side by side getting a wonderful 30 min massage which really lasted 45 min and just enjoyed the ocean breezes, it was so tranquil and they really did a great job. -We brought all in all like 30 dollars in ones and we gave them out here and there as tips, like to the bartenders and servers for a few of our meals, the bell boy, the driver, the rep at the airport, and so on, and I think it is something you don’t have to do, but I think it is good to help them out a little especially when they make so little but work so hard. Go, it is great for your money!

Reviews.Title: “Great experience”
Reviews.Author: joanna72
Reviews.Content: my boyfriend and i booked a trip to playa del carmen for 6 days and 5 nights at the reef playacar. i was online and saw a great deal and booked it. being that this our first experience with an all-inclusive, i must say that we are pleasantly happy with this first experience. we got there and had a smooth check-in. reading from past reviews, i had aniticipated someone coming up to us and wanting to talk to us about timeshares and lo and behold, after checking in, there she was. the "concierge" approached us and immediately, i politely told her we had just graduated from college (i lied) and had no money if this was about a timeshare. she smiled, asked our ages, and politely go on with getting into our rooms. so....no problem there. like everyone else had written, the grounds were amazing - always clean and kept very nicely. we got into our room and they had given us a double, rather than a king sized bed. when i had mentioned the mistake, they told us they ran out of king sized beds and that we could check with the front desk the next morning. it wasn't a big deal to us so we accepted the room. the room was a nice size, nothing too big - had an ac in which you can change the temp from lo-med-or hi and even on lo, it is absolutely freezing but nice when you are coming back from someplace. water pressure was somewhat weak, beds were a little uncomfortable, but in the end, the maids had always done a great job with cleaning the room. sometimes they were a little too ambitious - we kept forgetting to leave the do not disturb sign at the door and for the most part, they would be knocking at the door at 8am, wanting to clean. they politely went away once they heard that we were still in the room and weren't ready for them. once, the toilet had problems and immediately someone came to the room and fixed the problem. okay, food... you MUST make reservations for the mexican restaurant. AMAZING. they take reservations at about 9:50am (they say 10) and they do fill up quickly. only about 7 slots are filled for the hour time slots starting at 6:30 and ending at 9:30. we got the last time slot at 9:30 one night and i wasn't sure if it was worth eating so late but it is. the clam and crab meat appetizer is superb. we also ate at the italian restaurant and it was so-so. better than the buffet restauarant but was a little disappointed since we enjoyed the mexican restuarant so much. when we went, the italalian and mexican restuarants weren't both opened at the same time - the restuarants alternated - mexican open on tues, italian on wed, mexican on thurs, etc. as for the buffet, it was alright. breakfast - make your own omelet, crepes, french toast, pancakes, fresh fruit drinks and/or smoothie, cereal, fruit, asst of breads. lunch and dinner, they alternated diff foods and had lots of desserts to finish it off. it was somewhat of a hit or miss. snack bar was good too - pizzas, ribs (mmmm), fries, waffle fries, sandwiches, burgers, hotdogs, ice cream, etc. make sure you make it to the ice cream parlor (they have more flavors than the snack bar had and are open from 4-6 i think) and get chocolate chip - best my bf and i ever had. beach/pool... beach is small but never had a problem finding chairs. beach is where the europeans hung out (many of the women were topless) and the poolside were also filled with ppl but never had a problem with chairs as well. yes, swim up bar was always crowded but never had a problem getting drinks. owh - they make killer frozen drinks - pina coladas, "miami vice", bahama mamas, mmmmmm....couldn't get enough shows at night: we saw 70's night and it was pretty corny. casino night wasn't even casino night - more like kiddy casino night because money wasn't real and all the casino things were toy like...if you are bored, then go see the shows but my suggestion is that you do other nightly things elsewhere... staff of hotel... ALWAYS ALWAYS so polite and kind. they work really hard to serve and please you. i noticed almost everyone didn't tip the staff but they get paid so little that i found it nice to give them a dollar here and there. one guy, was there till about 11 (when i left the buffet - he was still there cleaning and was probably there till later) and then i saw him in the next morning at 8 busting his butt. when i went to get a soda and water at the bar, he insisted i sit and that he'd bring it to me. i kept saying no, that i was able to do it, that he didn't have to, but still, he insisted further, that he would do it. at many of the bars, you can see the waiters are working quickly to get what you want and it's obvious that they aren't expecting a tip. they have amazing work ethics. all in all - the hotel and experience was great. don't expect a five star hotel but it's definately worth your money to stay here. i loved my experience here. owh! if you go to playa del carmen, make sure you do the tulum xtreme trip. you zipline in a jungle and into a cenote (cave) with water. you snorkel inside the cenote and then have lunch (the best lunch ever!). last, you experience the tulum ruins and for about 30 minutes, you can swim on their beach. best excursion!!! other excursions we did were xcaret (didn't really like it) and atv and speedboating (was alright [i had done it before] but boyfriend loved it [his first with both]). make sure you go shopping and walk along the 5th ave area at night. it's a 5 minute walk from the hotel and from what i was told from the locals, shopping at the intersections is cheaper than on 5th ave. always bargain bargain bargain - but pls note that the ppl there are very pushy... last but not least, use insect repellent - i got bit about 8 times and they still itch. if i ever visit playa del carmen again, i will def return here again. had a wonderful trip....

Reviews.Title: “One week at the reef. Complete review.”
Reviews.Author: SuperMonkeys
Reviews.Content: Travel Dates: July 28th - August 3rd. 2006 My wife and I went to Mexico for the very first time, our 5th wedding anniversary. We're 24 and 25. We've done a lot of research on this site, and then shopped for prices. Ended up booking our trip through Funjet, and are happy we've done so. Day after arrival travel rep met with us to ensure everything is going good, and also to give us introdution into the area, and areas attractions, and their recommendations. We eneded up booking 2 days tips - Chichen Itza Mayan site, and the reef snorkeling just south of Cancun. Aeromexico flight/crew/in flight services are superb. Complimentary alcohol and lunch was a pleasant surprise. You will be solicited for timeshares, etc until you get outside the airport. We just kept walking. We arrived at 6 pm, checking in was quick and easy. Hotel staff was very nice. Luggage was carried for us. Hotel grounds are absolutely beautiful!!! It's desinged with a jungle theme in mind. While from the street resort looks old and unattractive, it's quite nice and beatuful on the inside! Other resorts nearby looked stunning, however grounds, beach, and amenities were quite poor (we've walked few of them, and also from speaking with other couples we've met). 1st night we got a room with 2 twins, and asked for a different room, and closer to the ocean. Next morning we've moved to king, much closer to the ocean. There was no charge, and it was quick and easy transition. ROOMS: Super clean!!!! Beds are very comfortable, and AC was freeeeeezing!! Water pressure was ok. Safe inside the room (ask for lock at the fron desk, don't loose the key either, $100 charge), and there was no extra charge. Mini-fridge in the room, with 2 bottles of water ($1 per). We brought our own water (like 16 small bottles) to drink while in the room, and excursions, and it was more than enough to last a week. Iron and mini ironing board in the room. Large tv and remote. Vanity with mirror. Balcony with 2 chairs and a table. 2 chairs and a table inside the room. End table on each side of the bed. Hairdryer in the bathroom. BEACH: Best part of the hotel. Reserve your seating earlier in the morning, by 10 am best spots were pretty much taken, but even then, it wouldn't take us long to find somewhere to lay! A lot of seating shaded, unlike many other resorts on the same strip. Beach was constantly cleaned for seaweed and cups left behind. It was pretty clean. FOOD: Main buffet was pretty good. Main entrees were rotated daily. Fresh fruits, vegetables, and freshly baked breads (quite a few varieties) were avail for b-fast, lunch and dinner. In the mornings, they had a juice bar - they would blend any tropical fruits with water/juices/yogurt of your liking to create yamee beverages. Omlets and eggs availiable to your liking in the morning. Reservations required for Italian and Mexcian restraunts. We went to both. Italian was great, until we got main entrees, we were disappoitnted with Alfredo. Smoked salmon on buffer at the Italian rest. Mexican was way better. Revervations started at 10 am. We were there 10 till and were the first ones to get in (they refused to take reservations prior to 10 am). Once we came in at 11 and they were full. Snak bar was the best - ice cream, french fries, waffle fries, chicken wings, baked chicken, bbq ribs, fajitas, brick oven baked pizzas to order, nachos, hot dogs, burgers, etc. Bars were great. BRING YOUR OWN BIG CUPS!!! We were the only ones to have them, and got a jelauos stare from EVERYONE!! Cups they give you are very small. Thermal would be good also. Shows were fun. There was daily activities in one of the two pools for kids and adults. Playa Del Carmen 15 minutes walking distance. We walked at night few times - super safe. Residential district. $5 cab to PDC. Charlos and Charlies great restraunt we went to - highly recommended. Walked south on the beach, about 30-45 minutes will get you to stunning beach and untouched and undeveloped land by the beach. It was worth it. Marina at the hotel was great, and Catamarans, kayaks and boogie boards were included. They will even teach you how to use cats in the wind. We enjoyed the reef. Staff is nice. Grounds are manicured. Bring big/thermal cups, $1 bills for tips, and underwater cameras (if you plan to go snorkeling, etc). Please email us with any questions. vladislavm@hotmail.com Dallas, TX

Reviews.Title: “Paradise found at the Reef”
Reviews.Author: Panther06
Reviews.Content: We just returned from the Reef Playacar on Saturday. I couldn't wait to write my review on this resort since some of the reviews I read after we booked our vacation caused much apprehension about our choice of properties. What were you people thinking ? If you weren't happy with this place, then stay at the uppity, sterile Riu Palace next door ! There was nothing wrong with the Reef, it was a beautiful resort ! The tropical gardens throughout the resort are absolutely amazing, I am a big fan of Palm Trees and all things tropical, so this was my paradise found. I loved the mexican rustic feel of the grounds and the villas. The pools were not huge, but plenty space for spending the day and always chairs available anywhere you wanted to relax with a margarita ! Beach, beautiful tropical blue water and soft white sand. Neat canopy beds around pools and beach. Very elegant. The drinks, FABULOUS. Not one we didn't enjoy. Hats off to Santos, our fave bartender ! The buffet, not fancy, but very good food always. The snack bar food AMAZING and always available, long hours during the day and then again late night snacks- Guacamole and chips, yummy burgers and fries, wings, roasted chicken, brick oven pizzas made to order...what more can I say ! We ate from the snack bar for lunch every day by the pool instead of going into the buffet. Our kids loved the ice cream parlour as we enjoyed an afternoon cappucino ! The rooms, a little small, but impeccable and clean, clean, clean. Any easy access from anywhere as the size of the resort was not huge like the Riu's or Bahia Principes. WE loved it for that reason, so very comfortable right from the time we arrived. Staff, always friendly. Gotta love the Mexican people. Needless to say, Playa del Carmen (15 min walk from the resort to 5th Ave.) is our new favourite destination. 5th Avenue was so much fun and a night out at the Blue Parrot (go there if you love dancing on the beach !) We will be returning in 2007 and wouldn't hesitate to stay again at the Reef. WE LOVED IT !

Reviews.Title: “We got MORE than what we paid for!”
Reviews.Author: dovrun
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a one week stay at the Reef Playacar. We took into consideration some of the things people before us mentioned on TripAdvisor...we were pleasantly surprised to find that we found almost no correlations between complaints others had, and our own stay. First off - know this...the resort IS small. There are maybe only a few hundred rooms and it's not very big. This was not a big deal to us. The lush greenery of the resort was gorgeous, and worth a daily walk through the grounds (even if it took only a few minutes!). Despite the size of the resort, we found the service to be superb. We were welcomed by Mike at the front desk, who did everything in his power to make our check in go smoothly. Pedro at the beach bar is an awesome guy. The waiters at the restaurants and the buffet were sooooo courteous and polite! The shows were a bit cheesy - but it is a small resort. The sport/entertainment club people were super nice and worked hard to make sure people were having a good time. Many people have commented on not being able to make reservations for the Mexican/Italian restaurants - we did not find this as a problem at all. The lady who took reservations while we were there for a week, was adament about waiting until 10 to start taking them. So - if you were around at 10 (or we even got reservations at 11:30 one day) you had no problem getting in. The exception that they do make, is if you take an excursion, and leave at 7:45 - they will let you make reservations early. We LOVED the Italian restaurant. The food there was incredible. My fiance loved the Mexican restaurant, too. For dessert, you must try the Italian Chocolate, or the Canoli's! The breakfast buffet was great. The lunch/dinner buffets were a little hit and miss. But not to worry...the snack bar has UNBELIEVABLE food! The snack bar even opens again at 10:30 at night, until 2 in the morning for any late night snackers. The beach is small - but we had no troubles ever getting chairs, or even palapas if we wanted it. Plan on getting up around 8 or 9 to reserve some seats, and you will be good to go. The pools were small, too - but again the resort itself it small, so we never felt terribly crowded b/c there weren't a ton of people staying there. Biggest disappointment we had, was that they don't have a minibar in the rooms. People have mentioned you have to pay for bottled water in your room, which I suppose is probably true since they don't give you any drinks in your room to begin with. We solved this small problem with buying a few bottles of water, and having the bartenders fill them up as we needed. We simply loved staying in Playacar, and will most certainly go back. You are only about a fifteen minute walk from Playa del Carmen, and only about a five minute walk from the plaza shops in Playacar. If you're not expecting the Four Seasons, I think you'll be pleasantly surprised with the friendliness of the staff, and their willingness to help you out. You really can't beat what the Reef offers and with the price you pay!

Reviews.Title: “Cute weekend getaway”
Reviews.Author: B.G._Chicago
Reviews.Content: My friend and I just returned from a four-day last-minute trip to the Reef Playacar. Overall, we had a nice experience... much better than we expected after reading some of the reviews. First, the grounds are absolutely beautiful. The hotel does an excellent job of keeping up the property, and there are beautiful trees and water themes throughout the hotel. Also, the hotel is in an excellent location. We walked into town each day to shop and eat on Fifth Avenue. The pools are somewhat smaller, but we never had a problem finding pool chairs. After a late night out on the town, we were able to stumble into the pool area around 10 a.m. and we still found chairs. We really did not have a difficult time getting drinks at the swim-up bar. The bartenders are extremely busy at times, so while we were waiting for a drink we used the time to meet other guests. The Reef Playacar has a wonderful mix of guests from all over the world. The room was fine. Although our air conditioner made some odd noises when we first arrived, the maintenance staff arrived in five minutes to fix it. We had no complaints about the beds. We also took a $30 snorkeling trip with the hotel that was fantastic. We saw some beautiful coral and fish. Now for the bad part - we thought the food was pretty bad. Please take this with a grain of salt, as we might just be "uppity city folk" when it comes to food, but we thought the food quality was poor. We tried the buffet and the Italian restaurant, and everything was not very appetizing. Our best meals were at the snack bar. However, we found some great restaurants for dinner on Fifth Avenue - Ula Gula, Blue Parrot Hotel, and an Italian/Mediterranean wine bar on Tenth Avenue. Also, if you're looking for fun nightlife, look no further than the Blue Parrot Beach Club. It's a great time! Overall, we had a great time here, and would probably return for another quick weekend trip. The staff takes pride in their work, and it was a cute place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed The Reef”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My daughter and take a vacation together every year and we were recommended to the Reef Playacar by our travel agent. I must admit I was a little nervous after reading the previous reviews but decided to go with an open mind. We really had a wonderful time. We experienced none of the negative things others wrote. The front desk were awesome - the bartenders were also excellent. We were really impressed with the restaurant there was something for everyone - as a matter of fact the food was so good we never even bothered to go to the reservation restaurants. The smoothies we chose from all the fresh fruit choices were delicious. Every afternoon we went to the little garden hut for cappucinos and ice-cream - I wish I were back there right now. The rooms were just fine and the cleaning staff were very good the room was spotless. My daughter and I had a great relaxing time and I would definitely recommend you go and see for yourself. If you are looking for a fun relaxed week in the sun go to the Reef - it is not for you if you want to party all day and night but great if you just want to mellow.

Reviews.Title: “Great resort for the low price”
Reviews.Author: Mari6625
Reviews.Content: After reading all the reviews I was a little scared, but I have stayed at many all inclusives in Mexico before. We were there for four days with another couple. I have to say, for the price of this hotel it really is AWESOME. The grounds are so well mantained and you feel you are in some kind of beautiful jungle with great vegetation. It is very clean. Check in was a breeze. We got there at 11am and our room was ready. So lets get started... Room: Large and comfy. Like another reader said, they are set up as bungalows and this gives it a great feel. The beds are a little hard but I actually got a great night sleep everynight.There is a fridge in the room that you can stock up with things you like. YES... you do have to pay for water. But for goodness sake, it is only a DOLLAR, actually it is 10 pesos which is the equivilant of 80-90 cents. If this causes a problem for some people then just go to the store and stock up on your own. You only have to pay for bottled water in your room. Dining: You have to make reservations for one of the restaurants at 8am. This really was not a problem for us since we were up and having breakfast at that time anyway. The food at the restaurants where you do make reservations is excellent! Try there beef filet, it is great. The buffet during breakfast and lunch was good, not the greatest but good enough. There is a snack bar that you can eat from as well. They have guacamole and quesadillas and what not. They are really great to have and munch by the pool. Overall: This resort was great. The staff was excellent and pleasant to deal with. Always willing to help. What we were most impressed by was how clean the grounds were. There were always people cleaning and making sure everything looked nice. The beach is nice with a lot of lounge chairs to hang out on. The pool area was really nice too. We never had a problem getting a lounge chair at anytime of the day nor did we have a problem getting drinks. All in all, this resort was excellant. I don't understand why people complain. If you are expecting the Ritz then you should make reservations at the Ritz. This was a great hotel and I would go there again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Had a great time and enjoy the stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Hi everyone, Here is my review of this Hotel ...and let me tell you....It's not a bad deal considering the price you have to pay compare to other Playa del carmen resorts. Specially the ones in the private area of Playacar. So her is goes... I arrive at the Reef on June 26 and my departure was Yesterday or July 2, 2006 The place was very clean. We check in and got our luggage to our room in no time. then we decide to have something to eat the the Chula Vista Restaurant. The food was good no complaints and after we got some drinks we walk aroun the area to check out other places. I tought the room was kind of small but it was kept clean and was nice and cool. This was good becuase after walking in the heat then coming back ...you need a nice cool place to stay. I notice that the grounds were kept very clean and seems that the staff work extra hard. it's true...they seem under staff at times but it's not like you're at work and only have 30 minutes to eat anyway. You're in MExico....Relax...you're there to take it easy and not be rushing you know. anyway... Dinner reservation was not a problem. you have to get there at 8:00am to make the reservation. there is not a lot of room at both the italian restaurant (boticceli) and the mexican restaurant. It's very romantic. I book both times at 8:00am and had no problems. I play pool at the upstair bar and it was fun. Got some drinks took some pictures ..what some TV..they have some nice Flat HDTV Tv there. 3 actually sos there is plenty to do and see. You can walk down the street and will get to the Playacar Plaza were you will find lots of things to buy ...but we prefer to by at other places since they tend to be a big higher in prices sometimes. But still nice to check and see what they got. This is my third time in playa del carmen. and everytime..I learn something new. I got a rental car for only $35 a day...if you try this at your resort...probably will be twice that more maybe even more...that's why you have to go to the main street or 5th avenue on playa del carmen to get a good deal. You'll save a lot more and have a lot more fun exploring yourself without waiting for a taxi or bus or minivan to do tours and other places of interest. I found that the far away you are from the resort the better prices you get. a bottle of water cost you $2 dollar but if you go to a convenience store...you pay 70 cents. The Reef was very accodating to us. we never saw a timeshare salesperson there so maybe it's a timing thing with some people that have seem them there at the reef. Tip is not necessary but we did tip the bell hop and the cleaning lady. they sure appreciate you doing that since they only get $5 a day over there. which is about 61 pesos. not very much.... the Reef in my opinion was a good place to stay. don't be nick picking on everything. this is not a 6 star hotel but you will enjoy regarless becuase they try to make your stay as happy and enjoyable as possible. With that I hope you have a great time when you visit cancun. We sure did. Happy traveler Houston, TX

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a week long stay at the Reef. I was disappointed in our stay and would not recommend this place. This having been our fifth trip to Mexico, we had higher expectations. The resort itself was nice and the beach was nice. Making resturant reservations was an issue, but to overcome that, you just need to be there between 7-7:30am to make reservations. Both the Mexican and Italian resturants were good. The buffet did lack much variety and the service wasn't the best. The biggest problem we had was the staff at the front desk, which was rude. This is something we had not experienced in our previous vactaions to Mexico. It had always be the opposite. When the rooms were cleaned, they would continuously leave two towels, knowing that we had three people and that we had asked for additional towels. This became a joke with the front desk and I had to go to the desk and request additional towels daily. It got to the point that I didn't have to even give them our room number. When you check out, they will try to charge you for the bottled water, even if you didn't drink it. So, be aware of this when you check out and don't hesitate to tell them that you didn't use any of their water. They know you didn't use it, but they will try to squeeze a few extra pesos out of you. The one bright spot is Luis, who works in the dining area and resturants. Luis was great. If you do go to the Reef, be sure to meet Luis. Had this been my first time and had nothing to compare it to, I would think it was OK. However, that is not the case. This is definately not a 4 star resort, but as they say, you get what you pay for. For us, we will not be going back to the Reef. I will spend the extra money and go to a better resort.

Reviews.Title: “Not as horrible as some make it out tobe”
Reviews.Author: nate8uc
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a long weekend at the Reef, and being an All-Inclusive and Playa del Carmen newbie, I really didn't have any grand expectations. My expectations were also limited by the old adage "you get what you pay for," and considering that the Reef was on the lower end of the price spectrum, I wasn't expecting the Ritz. Apparently a few people did, and also had experiences that I didn't have, as well. I would rate it about a 3 star hotel, but they had the sun, beach, and pools that every other place else has, which is what I went to Mexico for. First, check in was simple, it took two seconds, and I wasn't sassed by any of the hotel staff and I was off to my room in no time. I also did not see a single timshare person the entire time I was there, but that is also a matter of timing, and I apparently missed them all. My girlfriend and I loved the way the Reef was set up, it felt more like a bunch of bungalows than a hotel, which was somewhat refreshing. The room was great, large bed, and considering that I can sleep anywhere, I didn't notice the firmness of the matress at all (some have said it is too hard). The only minor problems that I can forsee people having with the room is the air conditioner, which is really only on or off, but it was very refreshing to come home to that after being outside all day. Also, be careful in the showers and close the curtain all the way, or some water may seep out on the tile into the main room, but after the first shower we made sure to do so. But overall, the rooms were clean (great housekeeping staff), and were nice to come back to at night. The stories about restaurant reservations are true, you have to get there at 8 to get one. My gf went (while I slept) at 8:30 and it was already booked. And to the person who went at 7:30, was told to come back, and was angry that they couldn't call: to walk anywhere in the resort takes two minutes, and a half hour wait isn't the worst thing in the world; also, since it gets booked up so quickly, in-person reservations are the only sane way to do things. Anyways, the buffet food is not 5 star, and it tends to get old after a few days, but the snack bar was a good changeup for lunch and a late snack. Service at the buffet at dinner was slow (fine all the other times), and really was hit or miss. One night, you can't track anyone down, and the other your waiter was around all the time. The pools and beach were great, we never had a problem finding chairs before 11 AM, and all were never that crowded. We kayaked in the ocean twice, and saw a lot of other people using windsurfers, etc, which were no problem in getting your hands on. Now to the important stuff: Bars. It DID NOT take 15 minutes to get a drink at the pool bar. The longest it took was 5 minutes once, and on average I would say about 3 minutes, but after throwing a few $1's the bartenders way, he always noticed when you walked back and had your preferred drinks in hand. The other bar on the second floor in the lobby has a great setup, outside under a huge teepee like roof. That tended to get a bit crowded at times and took longer to get a drink, but never to the point of complaining. Also, if you got a table (if they were full, just wait 5 minutes), you had a waitress who was very responsive. But I found that of the actual bars, tipping made a bigger difference at the pool bar. The drinks were relatively weak, but with a few tips and some directions, you would get them as strong as you want. At night the resort definitely has a laid back feel, and there is no music or dancing at all. For me that was fine, as I just wanted to relax, but some of the people we met there wished there had been more going on. To each their own. All in all, we had a great time, and would stay at the Reef again if the price was right. It was a great first All-Inclusive experience, and would recommend it to other first timers, but to those who have stayed at other All-Inclusives that they actually consider as 4-stars, I would not recommend staying here, as you may be slightly disappointed. But on the other hand, if you are just looking for a place to relax and go with the flow, this is a great place. But if you expect to be waited on hand and foot, look somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Never Again”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Do not, I repeat, Do not stay at this resort! I had the most horrible experience! It was a complete waste of money & not to mention the stress it caused me. The only thing that went smoothly was the arrival at the airport (through FunJets Vacations) and the shuttle to the hotel. Very organized, However, from the time we arrived everything went down hill! The front desk & hotel staff ( except for the housekeeping staff) were so unfriendly I could not believe it. They acted like we were a big inconvience to them. As soon as you arrive you are boombarded with timeshare reps & tour reps that will harrase the @#$% out of you. They advertise 4****, Please!! 2 ** at best !!! The rooms, Well, small, OK, 4Star, NO!! They advertise 4 bars, 3 rest., However, fail to mention that 1 opens at 12 (by snack bar), the pool bar opens at 4 and closes at 8pm thats it! lobby bar opens at 6pm and closes at 8pm.(Although they say in the brouchere it opens at 12.00) The bar upstairs opens at 6pm closes at 11pm, no music, only sports blarring on the tv. Could be a great bar but no atmosphere! Had to go into town everynight for something to do. Not a party person, but this was so boring!!! Buffet, ok for breakfast, snack bar for lunch, TRYING TO MAKE DINNER RESERVATIONS, AT THE ITALIAN REST. WHAT A JOKE!! Since when can't you call on the phone ?? NO!!! You have to go to the buffet @8am to do that and if you get there at 7:30, they will tell you to come back at 8, because they don't have the reservation book!!!! So, you say "can I call you"? NO!!! "You must come back at 8am. What a joke! So many inconsistancies. Complained to management(Rafael) very unconcerned, no one really seemed to care. Even if you tip the staff it doesn't seem to make a difference. (always seem to be understaffed to me) especially at the pool bar (be prepared to wait at least 15min. for a drink) and in buffet (be prepared to wait until you are finished with your meal before you receive your beverage) HORRIBLE SERVICE!! Oh! Almost forgot, the last straw, the night before I left, called the front desk for a wake-up call @8:15am, GUESS WHAT?? NEVER HAPPENED!!! Good thing I woke up at 7:45 am or I would have missed my shuttle to the airport. The smallest request can not be accomidated!! The worst service I have ever received!! Would have received better service @Motel 6, and alot cheaper!! Would I ever stay there again? What do you think?????? NO!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Oh My!!”
Reviews.Author: ed755
Reviews.Content: I don't know where to start. I read all the reviews before we arrived at the Reef and thought nothing could be that bad. Well, let me tell you, everything in the reviews we experienanced maybe not to the extent that others did, but i can understand the reviews, except that the staff is wonderful !!! Room: average, could not control the AirConditioner, it was on or off. Tub was slow, slow, slow to drain. Bed was hard as a rock, i enjoy a firm bed but this bed was so hard it hurt! Pool and Beach: Small pools, Small beach. No wait saff for drinks while lying out by the pool or beach. If you want a drink you must get your own! Not enough employees tending bar, if you want a drink you must wait and wait to be served and the hotel was not full. Food: catered toward Europeans, it was hard to find something to eat on some days(salsa and bread were good) Both of us got sick our second day, don't know what it was. We have both been to cancun 3 times before and have had any problems. Shows: we both thought they were good, Staff was always helpful and friendly. The other hotels we have stayed at in the passed were a lot better. This hotel has cut every corner to save money, food not good, not enough help, small weak drinks. On sunday, no help for arriving passengers, new arrivials were asking my wife how to get to their rooms and they had to carry their own bags. There are better hotels in Cancun and surrounding areas, do your reasearch. This is the first bad reviw i have ever written and hope it's my last. If you have other questions let me know. I'll shoot straight!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Reef”
Reviews.Author: patriciagonz27
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at The Reef for 4 days, and all we have to said is that we LOVED it. I couldn't wait to seat in my computer to write about this nice resort. He had a very good time. I really can't understand how could people write bad reviews about this resort. it's awesome. The Italian Rest is Excellent, The Buffet Exquisito ! The service is Excellent they make us feel like home ! Coming from two Carribean Island Puerto Rico and Dominican Republic we loved it going to Playa Del Carmen. Luis the waitress "el capitan" from the Italian and Buffet Restaurant was very nice. Annel from the Entretaiment and Julio from the Marina at the Reef, were very nice, and everybody else. The only little thing was the bed, a little hard. But we enjoyed anyways. We are hoping to go back soon with our entire family !! Thank You The Reef +.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Time at Reef Playacar!”
Reviews.Author: dancingvix
Reviews.Content: Well I researched and researched before I found a hotel that I wanted to be at. i was looking for an all-inclusive (husbands idea...id prefer a boutique hotel...we are both 29) that wasnt like an amuzement park where it would take me 20 minutes to walk from my room to the restaurant, to the pool/beach etc. Unfortunately the yucatan peninsula is filled with these HUGE resorts so my search wasnt easy. Fortunately for tripadvisor, some people helped with the decision. However, I was sceptic because of some horrible reviews. As soon as I arrived (May 19th) I realized that the people that wrote those aweful reviews are very stuck up and look for the negative in everything! The hotel is beautiful. The beachs are small...but you cant blame that on the hotel..call mother nature and complain to her! But considering the damage that they suffered, really not that bad! I thought it to be plenty big! Plus i saw the beach of the other gargantuan resorts and they had the beach chairs lined up in rows one right next to another like a theater! Reef wasnt like that!! As you will see in the pictures! there are many 3 floor little building situated what seems to be a rainforest or jungle. Gorgeous!!! you enjoy your walk to anywhere. The one negative thing I can say is that this definitly isnt a 4 star...its like a great 3 star. Ive stayed at 5 stars in many places, 4 and 3 likewise...this is definitly a great 3 star. The rooms can be improved, but lets face it...how much time are you spending in there anyways. It was clean...thats all I ask for. There are only 2 restaurants...the buffet and an italian restaurant. Theres a mexican but it was closed because the hotel was only 60% full. The food was good...not increadible, but good. We were there for 5 days...and I think if we were there for one more day we would of went out to eat. I got a little tiered of it even though they did change it up everyday sort of. Theres also a snack bar open most of the day except during dinner with yummy stuff. Quesedillas, pizza, burgers, frys, ice cream and sandwiches. Everything very fresh! Some people compained that you couldnt get service on the beach...and personally i was happy that no one was bothering me every 5 minutes. They just let you be. if you are looking for a relaxing vacation, no one to bother you, beautiful surroundings, at a great price Reef is for you. BTW found a great deal on american express travel. I would definitly go back. Oh, I found it nice for families, however no screaming kids all over the place (one thing I was worried about...dont have kids, so i dont want to experience that yet). And like another person said in their review, this isnt a party type hotel either. However Playa del carmen is a 15 min walk, $5 taxi ride away. plenty of stuff to do there. AH one GENERAL critique of Playcar/Playa del carmen...not many ATMS! My huband and I arent used to carry much cash in us and just rely on ATMS or using creditcards! i recomend taking some dollars over (you can change it there) or once you find the ATM (non in ANY hotel) take out more than what you need, you can always change it back before you leave in the hotel or at the airport. But we definitly lacked cash in more than one time! We took a tour called the "Sacred Blue: tour! FREAKIN awesome! We went to a Cenote (natural pool) with crystal I mean crystal clear water, and underground caves like no other (not good if you are claustophobic) and then snorkeling where the underground rivers meet the ocean so its half salty half sweet water! GREAT! Well I think thats about it! All I kept on thinking when I was at Reef is how wrong the negative people were about the hotel. You just have to look at the positive...no point in ruining your vacation!!! Go Relax, have a margarita, Piña colada, or some Sex on the beach, the drink too! Id be glad to answer any questions. email me!! if you want tosee more pics, id be happy to send some more!

Reviews.Title: “It's a great escape - The Reef Playacar”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just returned yesterday from the Reef and had a really great time. No complaints, other than it would have been nice to have an oceanview room, but this resort doesn't really have any and we knew that when we booked this hotel. The grounds were meticulously kept and felt as though you were in a jungle. Yes, the beach wasn't huge, but there was still plenty of sand to walk in and build sand castles. The water was breathtaking. Check-in was easy, room was nice (on the small side for a family of four) and very clean, we stayed in building 12 which was great because we were near the pool, beach, restaurants, and kids club. We traveled with two children, ages 4 and 7 and the kiddie pool was PERFECT for both of them. Plus, it was attached to the swim up bar! The snack bar was awesome and had a nice selection of foods to choose from. The buffets were good too. The drinks always plentiful and the service was good as well. There was a show each night at 9pm that was actually pretty good. It ended around 10 - 10:30. If you wanted to continue the night with partying, it wasn't happening at this resort. Fine with us because we were traveling with kids, but for people traveling with friends, etc., I think the fun in the late evening would need to be found in Playa del Carmen. Needless to say, I was thrilled when we found everything to be totally acceptable to us. After reading some of the reviews I was not sure what to expect, but definitely was pleasantly surprised! I guess some people have higher expectations than others. We are simple people that enjoy the little things in life. With this being our first family vacation, our experience couldn't have been better. Thank you Reef Club!!! We will return again.

Reviews.Title: “I enjoyed my stay!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Our stay the Reef Playacar was from April 24-May 2nd and I must say overall I really enjoyed my stay. What some people write in these reviews I think are definitly personal overexaggerated opinions, and they might have had all those things go wrong but that doesnt mean everyones trip is going to be like that and the resort is like that. The resort itself is beautiful I thought, very well maintained, the trees and vegitation in the resort was beautiful and clean kept. The resort is a smaller one and if this doesnt bother you its great, it was nice not having hundreds and hundreds of people around all the time. The rooms were smaller but a good size for two people. The service of the staff was excellent, they brought you what you wanted and when you wanted it. The only two things I didnt particullarly enjoy was the food, which I know a few people have mentioned, there isnt that big of a selection of food everyday but the taste was good. And the public washrooms throughout the resort were a bit smelly so to say, at the beginning of the day they werent bad but once more people had used them they did smell a bit weird and looked like no one really cleaned them until the end of the day. The entertainment is great at the resort, definitly keep you active throughout the day and the evening shows are great too, although it would have been really great to have a disco at the resort, which they didnt although they had plenty of room to have one. There is no beach really because of the hurricane, most resorts along this part of the mayan riviera have lost a lot of their beach, if you want a lot of beach this resort is definitly not for you. They were trying to make more though but I think it will take a while to do so. There is a little bit of sand closer and to the side of the resort which is nice. The lawnchairs are not very close to eachother and you have your own space around the pool and "beach" area. Overall I had a great vacation and would visit the Reef Playacar again!

Reviews.Title: “Never Again!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stay away from this resort! This was my third trip to Mexico. I usually stay at a Riu complex (not the Palace). I thought I would go for something cheaper this time. Couldn't be that bad, could it? What a mistake! This place was definitely NOT a 4 star resort. I don't give a hoot about most things but there were some REAL problems at this complex. First, the food was dreadful. I have an iron gut but this --- left my stomache upset the entire time I was there. There were teenagers for as far as the eye could see. Combine this with free alcohol and I think you'll get the picture. Actually, I had one puking in front of my balcony in the middle of the afternoon. When I wasn't dodging their footballs in the pool, I was stepping over them in the morning after they had passed out on the lounge chairs the night before. The teenagers weren't the only individuals unable to handle their intake. Several adults started a fight around the pool area in the middle of the day and security needed to be called in to diffuse the situation. The pools were very, very tiny and the lounge chairs were cramped together in a small area. There was no where to find any privacy. The beach is about an inch wide with no real “beach” to speak of . As I sat on my balcony, I had the pleasure of smelling and watching the sewage drain from our unit into the septic below. I also had to pay for any water I consumed in my room. Also, the guide on the bus (which brings you into the resort) will ask for tips, too. I felt like I was “tipping to death” for decent service. Good grief! What a terrible week! NEVER again! I’ll pay the extra cash and go to a complex I KNOW delivers excellent service. It’s the RIU for me, folks.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointed”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I went to the reef playacar for our anniversary week. We paid about 1800.00 for the all inclusive 7 night package. I went diving for 3 of the 8 days with an independent dive operator. The diving prices from the resort are exorbiant so go online and book with an independent. We went to Excoret one day and had the best time on the whole trip. There is a Wal-Mart in Playa del Carmen, and is worth the trip. The Reef is an average hotel-the beds were hard-My wife and I like firm matresses, but this one was rock hard. The toilet in the room ran constantly, and the refigerator was never restocked despite us asking several times. The staff were very friendly and courteous, but were obviously wanting to be given tips (we didn't tip figuring that all inclusive meant exactly that) The food ranged from mediocre to very poor and the drinks were watered. The al a carte restaraunts were okay, but not worth getting up early to make a reservation (ye we tried both of them). Service was slow for all patrons except those who tipped. If you go remember to bring sunscreen. One thing to be aware of parents-although this is a family oriented resort (very safe for children) there are many european females that go topless on the beach (as is their custom) just be prepared for your children to see this and possibly ask questions. Although we travel extensively this was a first all inclusive for my wife and myself and we can only say-Never Again!-Particularly not in Mexico

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful time at the Reef”
Reviews.Author: Beenallover
Reviews.Content: We had an outstanding time. The staff is really the highlight of the Reef, excellent manners, very helpful, wonderful service. The grounds are very well kept, and the food was well prepared and had a lot of variety. The rooms were quite cozy and because the resort is small there is not a lot of walking to get to the pools, beach, dining rooms and other activities. The entertainment staff can keep you busy with many pool side activities and nightly entertainment, or you can just lounge around and enjoy all the food and drink you can muster.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Resort”
Reviews.Author: LoveSun2
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this resort March 31 - April 8, 2006. We have also stayed at the Sandos Gala, Riu Yucatan and Barcelo Maya. What we liked most about this resort was that it is a smaller resort so it was easy to get from point A to point B quickly and everything was easy to find. The grounds are very well kept with jungle vegetation. The service here was absolutely outstanding and we rarely had to wait long for drinks, food etc. All of the staff that we encountered were very pleasant, courteous and accommodating, and when they recognized you, would go out of their way to serve you better. We found the food at the buffet to be very good, but lacking in selection and variety. We really loved the snack bar and the a la carte restaurants. There is also a very nice bar over the lobby bar that overlooks the little street that runs through Playacar, as well as a nice air-conditioned Ocean Lounge that opened (re-opened?) while we were there. The beach is nice, but a bit small and sometimes crowded. Apparently, people who rent vacation property in the Playacar area are allowed to use this beach and facilities ie., towels, restrooms in addition to being able to purchase day passes for meals/drinks. Maybe that happens at other resorts too, but we've never encountered that before. As well, most days you had to get down to the beach or pool early as people would drape chair after chair with towels (and alot of times didn't show up til noon). There is an exercise room that is located in one of the rooms, as the original location is still undergoing repairs from hurricane damage. There are two treadmills, an elliptical and a recumbent bike which are all brand new and Precor. However, there are no weights at all, which I believe is a temporary thing. Our only real complaint was that there were a group of high school seniors from Michigan who completely took over the place. They were very rude, inconsiderate of other people and demanding. Not to mention drunk. We found ourselves frequently relocating to get away from the obnoxiousness. As well, every night around 2 or 3, we'd hear them coming back from the bar hooting and hollering, slamming doors, glasses being dropped etc. Just something to keep in mind if you are booking here that the hotel doesn't discourage Spring Breaker type behaviour and a lot of people with teenagers seem to come here. We didn’t really see many smaller children at all. This really is a nice resort and was a good value for what we paid, but definitely not as high-end as some of the other resorts in this area. As it is a smaller resort, there seems to be a more personal feel about it.

Reviews.Title: “Had Fun!”
Reviews.Author: ker44
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Reef Club Apr 2 to Apr 9. The hotel is very nice and clean. There were always workers around cleaning. The staff were very nice and helpful.Our room was nice too, always clean except our AC didn't work for a couple of days but they eventually fixed it for us. We think they were busy with the students that were there. The first morning that we were there they sent up room service for us. Which surprised us because we didn't order room service. That was nice! The pools were great but you had to put your towels on the chairs quite early to get a good spot. Some people would leave their towels on the chairs all day with out using them. That was annoying. The food at the buffet was good sometimes, but you could always find something to eat. The snack bar was good but stay away from the pizza. We have been sick for 5 days since we got back. We had the pizza just before we left for the plane. The last two days that we were there, there was no beach. One night we went to the International show and it was fantastic! I would recommend seeing that show. We drove scooters around Cozumel and went to Xcaret to go snorkeling and to the show, these were very fun. Next time we will go when the US Spring Break is over. The students and their parents were very rude and annoying!

Reviews.Title: “had fun”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: WE stayed at the reef for the third time and had a lot of fun aside from the group of grad students that posted above What a rude bunch of trouble makers Then they have the nerve to blame others for there stupidty, teach your children some respect and you will have a lot less problems aside from that the hotel is very nice a little over priced but they go out off there way to help you any way they can. these hotels are very busy and sometimes it can be hard to satisfy everyone at once

Reviews.Title: “THINK TWICE ABOUT THIS ONE”
Reviews.Author: malt14
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 1 week stay at the Reef. We chose this resort based on the 4.5 Star Rating from the tour operator (SUNQUEST), the generally positive reviews from this web site and the fact that the smaller size of the resort should have afforded more quiet and privacy. We were extremely disappointed. With out going into great detail here is a list of some things you may want to keep in mind about this resort. 1. The food was just horrible. It lacked variety, imagination, was always overcooked and the limited salad bar continually had empty dishes. To sum up...when one of the local furry creatures ran by someone would ask "What is it?" ...the reply came back as "Breakfast, lunch and dinner". The most frequent visitor to the resort was the Dominos Pizza delivery van. In fairness..the 2 specialty restaurants were pretty good and there were no restrictions as to the number of times you could eat at each one. Be prepared to be in line at 7:30 AM to get a reservation by 6:30 PM. 2. The only pool bar in the resort did not have any beer until 3:00 pm one day. 3. It was cheaper to book any excursions at the resort next door. 4. The bartenders at the pool bar poured drinks to anyone over the age of 13. You get the picture waht the result was. 5. When we checked in a customer was yelling at the front desk manager and when we left another customer was yelling at the front desk manager. (I mean yelling) 6.
