They advised us to drink bottled water and then THEY CHARGED FOR IT. 7. The lounge chairs were so crammed in together around the pool that you became really close to the person next to you. Oh ya...you better reserve you loung chair by 7:30 AM or you won't be lating next to anyone you recognize. We have been to several 4, 4.5 and 5 star resorts. This wasn't comparable to any. The weather was beautiful and so was the property. Beauty is only skin deep.

Reviews.Title: “Never again”
Reviews.Author: brendaseguin
Reviews.Content: We took a group of graduating seniors to the resort over spring break. The security at this hotel is terrible. The kids were at the pool bar and an older gentleman tried to pick a fight with them, then proceded to urinate in the corner of the pool bar. After this, he started to hit on the teen age girls and actually punched one of the fathers in the face. This was unacceptable to us and we complained to security and they thought that it was funny. Then we complained to management and nothing was done. The food on the buffet is terrible. There were many times that we just went to the snack bar to eat. The specialty restraunts were excellent. If you eat there every night, you will be safisfied. Because of the difficulties that we had with security, we will never stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed Traveler”
Reviews.Author: Explorer2003
Reviews.Content: The Reef Playacar was average, OKAY. For the inexperienced traveler, you might think the Reef was awesome. But for those that like class you will want to stay elsewhere. We only stayed at the Reef overnight and that was because we had accommodations at the Mayan Palace for the remainder of our stay. Might I add that the Mayan Palace was AWESOME. Getting back to the Reef, when we first checked in we received a welcoming beverage which was impressive. We were then taken to our musty, mold-smelling room adjacent from the construction site which was very noisy. After trying to endure the situation for some time, we requested to change rooms, and our request was granted. The pools were small. There was a group of college students in the main pool and it appeared that they thought they had ownership over the pool, which was frustrating. The pool snack bar was DISGUSTING and dirty. It tasted as if the hamburgers were not made of real beef. Even after that experience we still ventured out and made reservations for dinner (TIP: Make reservations for dinner in the morning). We had dinner at an Italian restaurant which was surprisingly tasty. The guests at the Reef were rude and cold. Overall, I would not stay at the Reef again. There are too many other options to consider.

Reviews.Title: “Great time at the Reef Playacar”
Reviews.Author: sandweggie
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a weeks stay at the Reef Playacar. We enjoyed every minute of it. We loved the jungle atmosphere. There was 14 of us total and everyone had a wonderful time...no complaints. Cancun airport is a whole other story! Be patient and allow yourself plenty of time. But back to the Reef...wonderful resort. We did have some issues with the rooms...one not having good air conditioning, in another one the phone didn't work and in ours the toilet ran constantly. But very small issues compared to other things that can/have happened at other resorts and the hotel was quick to respond to our issues. One thing that was very sad was the beach. There is none. When I heard people say this in other reviews, I thought they were being dramatic but they were right...there is no beach. While we were there, it looked like the workers were making more beach by pulling up more sand so hopefully that will help. There is a beach a few feet away North of the resort. As much as I love a very long stretch of beach, this didn't ruin our vacation at all. Everything is in walking distance at the hotel. We were in the furthest villa from the pool/beach and it still only took a minute and a half walk to get to the pool. The staff is great and very friendly. The food was also very good. The snack bar had great chicken wings, nachos, roasted chicken, ice cream and there was always something to eat at the buffet. We only did the Italian restaurant once and although I expected it to be better, it was still good. Overall this was a wonderful resort and I would go back in a second.

Reviews.Title: “Over priced at 450.00”
Reviews.Author: Fflygirl
Reviews.Content: I can't believe they just jacked up the price of this place to 450-600 dollars per night. This is a pleasant resort but not in that league--not even close. It has always been priced lower when we have stayed there before--and that is the reason we stayed there --it was more affordable. But at these prices, the other resorts are newer and have much better amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Reef Playacar - Good experience”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a short visit to the Reef Playacar and recommend the hotel. It is a great value, good service, and very good food and location. The staff was very friendly and accomodating. The resort has a Mexican feel, a nice change from large, megaresorts. The feel is casual and relaxed. The property was very nice and we enjoyed the jungle view, friendly staff. If you are looking for a change from the very large chain hotels the Reef Playacar is a good option and great value. I am considering a return visit.

Reviews.Title: “Reef Playacar A+”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We so enjoyed our stay at the Reef in December that we are returning in May. We always go to Cancun, but due to Hurricane Wilma, our travel agent booked us to Playa. I was very skeptical, but we were so thrilled with her choice. Our check in was very quick, room was ready--everything was perfect. The staff could not have been more gracious, friendly or attentive. I was awed by the tropical beauty and the cleanliness of our hotel. I thought the buffet and the snack bar had enough choices for anyone--wonderful fresh fruit--and the Italian Rest. upstairs was very nice. We arrived at the Reef on their first day of opening after "Wilma", and though there was still much to repair around the grounds and hotel, it did not interfere with our stay at all. The beds are a little hard, but I didn't mind. I thought the service was great--from the front desk (Luis)to the maid service and beyond. The staff did eveything possible to make our stay enjoyable and memorable, and employees like this ensure repeat guests like myself. The Funjet/Lomas staff could not be any more helpful or pleasant. I have recommended this fine hotel to several of my friends, and I am counting the days until May. I'm not sure if it is okay to write this, but I want to express my views on tipping the staff, because I noticed many people did not do this, and I was appalled. I even expressed my opinion to Funjet. "All-inclusive" should state that that does not include gratuity. I have "served" the public for thirty-five years, and though I love my work and I love people, these people put us to shame when it comes to hard work, friendly service and patience. I look so forward to my visit to Mexico every year, and I always make sure the staff realizes that the efforts they make to ensure that my stay is enjoyable are well rewarded. I appreciate all that they do, and that is why I keep going back. I give The Reef Playacar an A+ when it comes to cleanliness, beauty and service that is gracious and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “We Loved this Resort”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We were at the Reef Feb.16-23/06 and would go back in a heartbeat! The staff are excellent and went out of their way to make guests happy, comfortable and feel special. The staff, from the bartenders, who would remember your favourite drink and bring it to you before you even ordered it (pool bar) to the friendly bartenders at the Mango bar (Ola Jesus, the girls are still missing you)to the very friendly staff (we can't remember your name, but you made lovely origami hearts and flowers for the girls, they also miss you). To the restaurant staff who made a point of remembering our names, to the housekeeping and groundskeeping staff, who always made sure things were clean and in order. To the animation staff, you did an excellent job of entertaining. To the reception desk staff, thank you for looking after us, we had asked for adjoining rooms with our travel agent and that is exactly what we got! To the icecream bar staff, delicious ! We send you all a big THANK YOU !!!!! We agree with the previous recent emails and don't need to repeat the comments regarding the beach and food, it didn't bother us at all. We ate well and spent time on the beach and by the pool. It was great! It's not a 5 star resort, but it will always be a 5 star in our hearts !!!!!

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME RESORT-WOULD DEFINITELY GO BACK ! !”
Reviews.Author: debbieHamilton
Reviews.Content: We are from HAMILTON, ONTARIO(CANADA) & just returned February 24, 2006 from a weeks vacation at Reef Playacar (VERY, VERY HOT & SUNNY every day) after booking 2 days prior on I Travel 2000. Without a doubt, the best bang for our buck. For a 4.5* hotel, taxes in $1170.00 flew out of Kitchener, ONTARIO. This was a savings of about $1000 per person from the Sunquest brochure prices. Absolutely beautiful. The hotel rooms (VILLAS) are surrounded by the 'JUNGLE' if I may put it & the gardens are absolutely beautiful. The rooms are very clean & well kept. We took our '19' year old daughters with us & wouldn't recommend this resort for the party type gals (luvin the tequila)! They ventured out into the town of Playa del Carmen to a few of their discos. They took a taxi into town that cost $5.00 US one way which isn't too bad but is really only a 15 minute walk to town. This resort has 2 al a carte restaurants - MEXICAN & ITALIAN. The menu is wide open with many entrees to choose from. The buffet was excellent also & was always very fresh & being replenished frequently. This resort is on a smaller scale comparing to the RIU resorts that I have only travelled to & did prefer this hotel much better. Overall, we have nothing negative to say about this resort & the area. Would definitely recommend the area if you like to do a bit of shopping & get away for a break. I have travelled to the Dominican Republic also & would defintely choose Mexico overall including Puerto Vallarta staying @ the RIU JALISCO last year - EXCELLENT !!! The entertainment here is pretty much the same as all others, no doubt! The animation teams at these resorts have always been lots of fun & our girls enjoyed their company. The beaches were destroyed a bit from the storms supposedly loosing 300 feet of beach - WOW !! Was still very nice & NO complaints. You had to be up early (6:30am) if you wanted a decent lounge chair on the beach. Overall, I would defintely recommend this resort to families with younger children (KIDS CLUB) & to couples wanting just to relax & ENJOY !!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable Week”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just returned from Reef Playacar and we had an enjoyable vacation. I think most of the reviews are fair - it's not a luxury hotel, but it has some great things about it. Cons: 1) the beach is almost gone - it seemed to erode on a daily basis, but you can walk next door and have plenty of sand. 2) the food was average - breakfast and lunch were good, dinner was fair - not enough choices at the buffet, but the restaraunts are good, 3) rooms are a bit small - not a big concern as we didn't spend much time, but there were 4 of us - we travelled with 2 young children and it was a bit tight. Pros: 1) the resort is small and quaint - you don't ever feel crowded - no problem getting chairs, or reservations for dinner. 2) the grounds are beautiful - it is very peaceful - the foiliage is really nice and everything is well maintained - the rooms are clean, the grounds are kept up, 3) staff is great - very friendly, will know you after a day or two, they all work very hard and the service was pretty good, 4) the entertainment was surprisingly good - we enjoyed it. Overall - we would go back to the resort, it's a 3 1/2 star rating - it was a great value for the price - depends on what is important - if it's food and spacious accomadations - might want to look around - looking for something other than mega resort that is peaceful - this is perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: mrmcclur
Reviews.Content: This hotel was everything I thought I would get out of it and more. The service was fantastic, friendly staff, a very clean hotel, even after the hurricane went through, they were basically up and running, and it hardly looked like a Category 5 hurricane went through there 2 months previous. If you are looking to get pampered and want your high class stuff, this hotel isn't for you. If you are looking for a fun atmosphere, laid back, and to really have a great time with your group, and even with the staff, this hotel is perfect. I thoroughly enjoyed my stay, and WILL return another day! PS...if any of you go down...be sure and meet the bartender/waiter Carlos, he is one of the friendliest, nicest people I've ever met.

Reviews.Title: “a mixed bag”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just got back from the Reef Playacar on Christmas Day. This was my second trip to the Playacar complex (stayed at the Allegro last time), and I have mixed feelings about whether to return. Aside from the fact that Playa has grown exponentionally since I was there a few years ago and now feels VERY VERY touristy, the area certainly took a beating from Wilma, and while they are doing amazing work to get the resorts back in shape, the Reef still had some problems. The beach is TINY now, which makes a very cramped sun bathing experience. The vegetation and buildings and pools are generally in good shape, and were improving daily with workers swarming the resort. My main concerns lay with the management. Lots of empty promises. We had not a drop of hot water for 5 of our 7 days, despite assurances that it would be fixed immediately. Our room was missing towels and bottled water for 2 days. There were long lines in the dining room to be seated for meals because of a lack of hostessing organization and overcrowding. And the dining experience in general was a disappointment. The list really goes on and on. I would never visit a place like this expecting everything to be perfect, but I was surprised by the amount of kinks in the system. Hopefully as the resort continues to recover from the storm and finishes their renovations, things will smooth out, but as is, it's still pretty rocky going. On the up-side, the water is still a breathtaking blue and it's hard to beat a week of relaxation anywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Reef Playacar excels during Hurricane Wilma”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed at The Reef Playacar during Hurricane Wilma and have nothing but praise for the management and staff. The planning and attention to detail leading to and throughout the storm were phenomenal. Despite being sheltered in the resort's theatre for 36 hours and with restricted use of its generator, we were provided with three full hot and cold buffets a day, which was not the case in the majority of hotels. The staff remained calm, upbeat and completely committed to making us as comfortable as possible, even though they had their own personal concerns about the safety of their families. Being caught in a hurricane is not a pleasant experience, but we were most fortunate to be in the care of The Reef Playacar at that time.

Reviews.Title: “The first hotel I've wanted to return to in Playa.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I went October 11th through the 19th.(We left the day before Wilma hit so you'll have to take this review with a grain of salt ). We almost changed our hotel after reading all the negative reviews here and we're glad we didn't. I have to assume most of those were part of the "Ugly American" symdrome because we loved the place.It was drop dead gorgeous with all the greenery throughout the place. It's a small complex so it's not crowded but it is beautiful. Winding paths through a jungle setting with a vine covered waterfall of sorts on one side of the entrance and a cenote on the other.It's kept emaculant and the setting is the best we've seen in 4 visits to other resorts. The employees are friendly and helpful,just remember that a lot of them speak a minimal amount of English so you may have trouble comnunicating but if you make the effort to speak some rudimentary Spanish and remember that you're in THEIR country, you won't have the problem some here have reported. Yes the food is not gormet. You're in Mexico folks, their food may not be the quality you'd expect on a Carnival cruise but it was good food and the menu at the buffet place varied each day and if you left hungry it's because you didn't eat.Don't expect their menu to mirror the one you visit every Friday night back in your home town. They don't use Black Angus beef and it's not the Sizzler, the Golden Corral or any other chain buffet you usually visit,it's in Mexico.If you want gormet food, take that Carnival cruise.The Italian restaurant was good and the view from it at sunset will take your breath awayThe food was very good and the service was great. The grounds are terraced at the pool/beach area and very well done.The rooms are very nice and yes the mattresses are a bit hard but they're worse at the Best Western in Manchester New Hampshire that I stay in for the morning flights out.This is the first hotel in Playa my wife and I agree that we want to come back to instead of our usual "well it was nice but let's try a different one next time". If you want to find something wrong and you think you deserve to be waited on hand and foot, you should probably consider the Ritz Carton and stay out of Mexico.On second thought,ignore what I said. The fewer Ugly American types that show up, the better chance I have to get the reservations I want for my next visit.

Reviews.Title: “nice place to visit”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After reading reviews on this hotel, my wife and I decided to give it a shot. We were there from Oct. 4 thru Oct. 11, 2005. In general it was a good value for the money. Specifically we found the following: The setting was authentic, the weather hot and very humid, the staff friendly. There is definatly a language barrier with the housekeeping personnel although our room was kept extremely neat and clean. The activities staff was great, they work long hours for short pay and are very good at what they do. The servers are all very competant and it is well worth tipping a few bucks here and there. Heres a hint---tip your drink maker and drink server 2 bucks a day and they will be your friend forever. DO'S AND DONT'S DO be friendly and learn a few words of the language this will go a long way. DO Take the dinner cruise. It's extra but well worth it. You get everything that is promised and plenty of it. DO tip. It does make a huge difference and they sincerly appreciate it.DO not eat the fish ANY FISH. if you want the answer to this one feel free to email me. Lets just say that I was in severe distress for 5 out of 8 days.. All in all it was worth it. Would we go back again? It would not be my first choice but yes we would it was worth the money. P.S. Always ask the price before hiring a cab. the same exact trip that costs 3 dollars one way can cost 5 dollars the other way. Feel free to e-mail me if you have any questions.

Reviews.Title: “Jungle Tree House”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We spent a week from Sept 24-Oct 1/05 at this resort and had an excellent time. The resort is set in a wonderful calming jungle environment where one feels like the resort designers tried to fit the three storied buildings into the existing setting rather than the other way around. It was not uncommon to see the agoutis munching on the forest floor on the way to the restaurants. The staff where very friendly and always made an effort to say hello. If you made the effort to speak a few words of Spanish they were most appreciative. Rooms were basic but well looked after. The cleaning staff did a great job. No complaints other than with some of the lower rooms voices would travel if people were chatting on the landings. The third floor rooms with the double balconies were great and bird watchers would have a hayday up there. The food was plentiful but standard resort buffet fare. No complaints but I imagine those who come to the resorts to only eat and relax might be disappointed with the buffet. We were fortunate during our week to have little noise from the resort being constructed next door, a monstrosity with 450 rooms which looks largely out of place. If the Reef Playcar architects tried to fit the resort into the existing property with a minimum of disruption to the setting and did a wonderful job this new resort on the south side is just the opposite. On our last day though the jack hammers were out by 7 am making lots of noise. We were on the north side of the resort which minimized the noise, however it would have been intolerable on the south side. We overhead others complaining and trying to move away from the racket. Unfortunately this new resort has a ways to go so I suspect the noise issues will persist for another 3 to 6 months. All in all we had an excellent vacation and would go back once all the construction next door is finished. If you want a peaceful jungle setting, beautiful beach, and walking distance (15 minutes) to Playa del Carmen this is a great place to be.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Resort in Paradise”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from our 7 night stay (Sept 19-26, 2005) at the Reef. After reading the reviews we didn't expect much and we were pleasantly surprised! We were greeted by friendly staff at the front desk and they never asked to see our credit card ( the trip was pre-paid). We asked for a room opposite of the construction and we were granted our request. Our room had a lovely balcony view of thier waterfall. As for the construction, a hotel is being built next door and the Reef has no control over them. We did find a bottle of wine in our room and a letter of apology for any inconveinence that the construction may pose on us. ALL of the staff were friendly and that was important because many of the guests were not. There were many different cultures and most did not make eye contact and attempt to greet you when you walked right next to them. Again, that was nothing that the Reef had control over. The grounds are beautiful and well maintained. There is always staff picking up garbage or trimming the hedges. The rooms are average but it is Mexico and you go for the beach which is breathtaking! The pool area is great. It is directly on the beach so there is always a nice breeze. As far as the food, it's not so great but okay. Don't go expecting to get fat! There is plenty available though. You can get a cheesburger at midnight if you please. The restuarant is pretty good and has A/C! As far as the drinks, you can not ask for them any quicker. If you are friendly and get to know the bartenders they will even bring you what you like. The key is respect, yes it is all inclusive but they don't OWE you good service. You don't have to tip them or hang out with them, just say please and thank you. If you even go so far as to learn a few simple words in Spanish they appreciate your effort. You get your money's worth in the drinks, not the food. The rooms and food are the only reason I did not rate as excellent. The A/C in our room broke but they immediately offered to switch rooms because they could not fix it in a timely manner. There are plenty of free activites, although older children would be bored and the shows are free entertainment. The conceirge, Patty is nice and just trying to make a living. If you don't want to go to a time share just tell her no. The check out process was easy and no hassle, again never asked for our credit card. Bottom Line-- Go for the view and have a few drinks, don't expect 5 stars when you pay for 3! And remember, tourism is their livelyhood they want, try and NEED your business. We were never fearful and always respectful.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but a 2 or 3 star at best.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Reef Playacar Resort September 2005. This resort is simply ok. I have been to Cancun several times but this was my time in Playa del Carmen. I can say without reservation that you get what you pay for at this resort. We only stayed 4 nights and then ventured to Cancun for the remainder of our vacation. The food is very average at best and we found it usually cold. I understand it is hard to keep a buffet hot for hours but...... Reservations have to be made for one of the resturants very early in the morning but is the only part of the resort that was above average. We tipped the bar staff and wait staff and for the most part they were wonderful during our stay. The maids were friendly and very fast. The front desk staff was neither. We were continually harassed by a time share rep although we were not interested in purchasing anything. Very annoying woman. The bar pool always had leaves and such but was okay. There is construction next door which could also be the reason for the state of the pool but does not hinder your enjoyment of the water and was not a concern. Our room was okay but without the extras we were told we would have (i.e. mini fridge, ironing board). We decided there would be no point in contacting the front desk about this. Unfortunately the noise from the hallway carried in sometimes as though the door was open. I think the pictures and description on the internet are decieving, the resort is very small and in my opinion not very well appointed. On the positive side, the beach was excellent. The grounds are beautiful and lush. You can get something to eat until the wee hours of the morning. It is a good place to stay if money is your main concern. When we return in Feb we will spend the extra $ to stay at a different resort in Playacar.

Reviews.Title: “May be good one day/ Not Now”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I called the Reef Playacar and funjet vacations ahead of time to get an update on the construction and the areas that were still closed due to Emily. Both agents told me that everything in the hotel was open and that while there was construction going on next store it was very quiet. I asked for a room on the opposing side of the construction and they said no problem. When we arrived I asked about the construction again as I was hearing lots of jack hammers in the background. At the front desk they said there's no problem with noise and it's minimal throughout the day. The guy at the front desk told us he had put us into a wonderful, part ocean view room. We thought this was nice so we proceeded. We walked into our room opened the curtains and had a wonderful view of a cement tower with four construction wokers waiving at us. No ocean to be seen anywhere. The noise was so loud that I couldn't even hear the guy on the phone from the front desk. Another couple we were traveling with had the same view only there was a large amount of water from a burst pipe in their room. We went down to have a drink and found that there was a single pool bar open with two bartenders (nothing else) surrounded by about 50 people waiting for drinks. We packed our stuff and insisted they move us to the Reef Coco Beach. Much nicer property. Had a great trip from that time forth. You get what you pay for. We weren't expecting 4-5 star hotel, but with the construction, the food and the service I'd rate it a 1-2star much worse than what we payed for as our orginal hotel was closed from Emily. The only good thing was that the beach and parts of the property were decent.

Reviews.Title: “A 4 Star Resort - A Decent Stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend & I stayed over Memorial Day weekend, we weren't looking for anything too fancy, just reasonable and close to town. We had friendly service, the food was ok (if you plan to eat at the Italian Restaurant, make your reservations at the front desk during breakfast time). If your looking for a 5 or 6 star resort...this is not the place, if your looking for something average, this is your place. I rated it above average for the quality of everything... it was clean, the grounds were kept nice, the air conditioning in the room was great, friendly staff, and a short walk to downtown. There were activities during the day (volleyball, water aerobics, scuba lessons, etc.) and activities at night as well. There are 3 hammocks right on the beach that were relaxing both during the day and at night. We spent time at the bar on our first night - the waiter couldn't refill our drinks fast enough! We were practically walking out of the place and kept getting served drinks! **Tip** - even though it's all-inclusive bring plenty of dollar bills (American Money) we tipped our cleaning staff every day w/ a few dollars - we got refills on bottled water and our room cleaned like the first day we walked in it. We also got quick service on drinks at the buffet - we tipped a dollar or two at breakfast/lunch/dinner - the staff remembers you!

Reviews.Title: “Not picky, but...............”
Reviews.Author: danigrl
Reviews.Content: My husband & I arrived at the Reef Playacar Aug. 8- 13th. The grounds were really nice and well kept up by the employees. The resort was very small. We expectected it going into this, so that was not a problem at all. My husband & I are not picky traveleres, as we've traveled to Playa Del Carmen several times before, and have stayed anywhere from 2-6 star resorts. My few complaints about this resort is the food, organization from the staff, and being hunted down by the promotions lady. My biggest complaint was the FOOD. And again, I'm not a picky eater, but this resort had next to nothing. I could barely find anything for breakfast, lunch was ok but very marginal, and dinner was extremely marginal to poor. My best advice is if your going to a resort for food, then isn't the place for you. You will be very disappointed. We wanted to make reservations for the one restuarant that they have, which is the Botaccoli (italian) and we had no idea where to make the reservations, so we assumed in the restaurant would be where to go. When we got there they said go to the lobby they can help you, so we walked upto the lobby, then the lobby people said, no go down to the buffet. To say the least, nobody at the hotel had any idea where we should go (not very organized.) AND BEWARE!!! WHEN YOU CHECK IN AT THE REEF PLAYACAR YOU WILL BE HUNTED DOWN BY A NICE LADY (IT'S A FACADE) SHE WILL PRETEND TO HELP YOU CHECK-IN, BUT WHAT SHE REALLY IS A PROMOTIONAL SALES PERSON. SHE WILL SUCK YOU INTO THIS 20 MIN. SALES PITCH, AND TELL YOU A BUNCH OF BULL ABOUT TIME SHARES, ETC........STAY AWAY!!! IT'S A WASTE OF $$$$ & TIME. UNLESS YOUR INTO THAT KIND OF THING. When we arrived at the hotel we knew all about this lady, and made up a lie that we had to rush to meet some friends in town, because she is very persistant. Also, the next day at the beach another lady came upto us trying to sell us the same thing. Again, we had to lie to her (it's like they have your pic and are trying to hunt you down. pretty annoying) she said to us that she would remove our name off the list..........THANK GOD!!!!!!!!!!!! FINALLY!!!!!!!!!!! Other than that, we had a great time. The staff was friendly, the beach was AWESOME, and always plenty of room on the beach. If you want a spot reserved next to the pool, you must get up by 7am to reserve a good spot. I hope this helps any of you who are considering this resort. Also, this resort is very family friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Good, but not great”
Reviews.Author: YucatanMan
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Reef about noon. We had written ahead asking for a ground floor room for our son and his 2 friends (since he had a sprained ankle) and a top floor room for my wife and me. We were assigned side by side rooms on the second floor, but they would not be ready until 3PM sharp. We went to the buffet to eat and wait for 3 o'clock. The buffet consisted of 2 buffet tables, a grill, and a dessert fridge. There was not much selection the whole time we were there. The wait staff was very friendly and helpful. We finally went to the desk to get checked in. I asked for matches-they had none. We were told to go see the time share guy who would explain the Reef to us. Since they were out of color maps, he gave us a tiny copied map to take with us. He was not as persistant as most salesmen, so it only took us about 15 minutes. We got to our rooms, which were better than we expected. They were very clean, cool, and had a TV that received many English stations that came in well. The water pressure was fine and we had plenty of hot water. There was no mini fridge, which we have come to really like over the years. The beds were hard, but comfortable-we slept well. The large closet has sliding mirror doors which seemed to increase the size of the room. The balcony railing is constructed of logs, so there is no privacy, especially since they all face a walkway. The pools are vey nice and clean and well placed. You can sit by either pool and see the ocean. The daily activities around them are well attended and fun. One pool has a swim up bar. This bar is way understaffed and undersupplied. The bartender had to quit serving drinks and go collect cups from the pool area to have enough to serve people. The stools in the water were occupied by children a lot, preventing the adults from sitting there. There were only a few brand name liquors, but the drinks tasted fine to me. The beach is fairly narrow with many chairs on it. There were always plenty of chairs available. We noticed only 3 topless ladies while we were there. You can only walk the beach a short distance to the north, as someone has built a patio that extends out into the water. On the south end, a new resort is being built, but the beach is very walkable. The construction workers kept as constant vigil on the Reef's guests, peering over the short fence and taking pictures. The boys took a trip to Sr Frog's that was sponsored by the Reef animation team. It was $23 for transportation and open bar. After being there a while, a waitress came by with a tray of drinks. All the boys took one, then she told them that would be $11 each! They had no money, so she was going to call the police. The chaperone supposedly paid her. Almost sounds like a scam. Overall, this resort is neat, clean, and friendly, but many details that we have come to expect on vacations were not attended to here. I probably will not go back unless my favorite resorts are not available again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Time”
Reviews.Author: christy35
Reviews.Content: Well, this was the first time for my husband and I to come to Mexico for a vacation, also with Funjet, we went with 2 of our friends and had a pretty good time, we got there july 30th-aug.3rd, the food first of all was just okay, the breakfast was the best of all the buffets they had, we ate at the Italian restaurant once and it was just okay too, not alot of variety but was a very nice setting. The beach was nice we got the boogie boards and rode the waves it was pretty fun. Our room was okay every other day I would find either a spider or some kind of insect crawling around but the maids did a good job with cleaning I would leave them a tip everyday and one day they made some swans out of the towels, it was the neatest and most creative thing I have ever seen. The drinks were also good thanks to Isidro the waiter, he was just the best and so friendly, everyone was friendly and the service was good overall.

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon - not so great!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Starting w/a positive, the Reef Playacar was beautiful, tropical and everything we hoped for w/one exception to our honeymoon detriment! The cleaning staff were the most friendly and helpful of the staff. Frnt desk, not so friendly or helpful. Negative is the Chula Vista restaurant! Our first night we ate the a la carte at this place. There are only 2 restaurants and the other you must make a reservation by 7:30am or it'll be full! You have many choices of food at the Chula Vista to choose from, all of which are horrible tasting! We spoke to other guests who couldn't find anything to eat that was good either! We never drank the water and by timing, we know that we rec'd food poisoning from this eaterie. We spent the 4 out of our 5 days suffering from diarrhea! Nice honeymoon! Thanks Chula Vista! If you're brave enough to try this place, look around the room first, you will see no smiles. You will see people going for 2nd's and 3rd's ONLY b/c they are trying to find something that tastes edible!!!

Reviews.Title: “Do not let the reviews on this website sway you”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After reading so many reviews on this website I wonder if we were all staying at the same resort. We almost changed our trip after reading all of the negative opinions on here. I'm so glad we decided to just go for it. We loved the Reef Playacar. We traveled as a family of four with two young ones (4 and 8). Hands down this one one of our best vacations ever. Not to say that there wasn't a little room for improvement in the food area but that's about it. The staff was excellent and they really made my family not only feel welcome but catered to. This is no five star resort and if that is what your after this is probably not the location for you. If you are looking for a laid back family friendly location than the Reef Playacar is a good bet. It is small enough that you have the chance to really get to know some of the other guests. We met some of the most fun people we have ever had the pleasure of knowing. The grounds of the resort are some of the most beautiful we have ever encountered and we've stayed all over the world. All in all the reef was a great choice for our money. With as much as we saved by staying here we were able to go all out in our excursions without feeling like we were breaking the bank. If you are already booked here do not panic, ask for a room away from the construction and you should be fine. The benefits of this small cozy resort far outweigh any minor inconveniences that the construction may present. Oh and I can't forget to mention how perfect the beach was. Hope you have the chance to enjoy this resort!!!

Reviews.Title: “nice at a reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: TBR
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at the Reef twice, once with our family and once we vacationed with another couple. This hotel is fairly small and doesn't have a huge grounds to get lost on trying to find the pool, lobby or restaurants. The lush garden/ jungle paths are fairly short walks to wherever you want to go. The Swim up pool bar is nice and the kiddie pool is attached so the kids are always in sight. The restaurants, menu, and food was good overall. Of course the 5 min cab ride to Playa Del Carmen is a great convience and the beach is beautiful. We thought the rooms seemed to need some work, not luxurious, but comfortable enough. We have stayed at several other hotels in the area and although we would like to try other resorts we WOULD consider staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “extremely disappointing”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a 6 nt stay at the Reef Playacar July 18,2005 and we were very disappointed with the food and the service staff they were very unfriendly and uncaring not at all what we have encountered in other resorts. The rooms were small but adequate, housekeeping did not leave towels half the time, we had mold on our shower curtain for the first 3 days we were there. Water placed in your room is charged to your room if you drink it although it is all inclusive. The shows at night were cheesy to say the least. We went through hurricane Emily while we were there and the staff did a good job during the storm.

Reviews.Title: “Had a great time!”
Reviews.Author: iammags
Reviews.Content: After reading what some other reviewers wrote about the Reef I almost upgraded my hotel. I am so glad that I didn't. I did research, asked for a room away from the construction (didn't hear any noise from my room), and expected bad food. I was actually dreading arriving at the hotel due to all of the bad reviews but we we arrived I was so pleasantly pleased! The grounds are gorgeous. Lush and tropical. The staff are so nice. I found that just smiling and saying hola and buenos dias did a world of good. The rooms are small, but nice. Ours had a tub. The maid service was very good. These people work very hard for such little money. The food was not very good. It was okay. But I didn't go there for the food and I realise that "buffet" food has to be cooked for the masses. I met a lot of people who agreed with me about the food but it just didn't matter. We had so much fun. The staff outside were nothing but gracious to us and nice. Our two kids had a wonderful time in the pools and at the swim up bar. All in all I have to wonder how people can have such different experiences at the same hotel. I believe that you have to make your own experience worthwhile. I found this hotel to be what we paid for. For the money this was an excellent choice. We had a blast.

Reviews.Title: “Definitly not a 5 star”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My fiancee and a few of our friends stayed here over New Years. We are all in our late 20's to early 30's. When we first entered we were greeted nicely and were told that our rooms were overlooking the ocean. Well that was a lie...Although we did admit the hotel grounds are very nice and well kept. This hotel is not really a hotel...it is a bunch of little three story huts and few of them have a view of the ocean. When we entered our rooms, we noticed how thin the walls were. My fiancee and I had kids on both side of us and we could hear them screaming the whole time. Another couple had a view of what could only be described as the construction dump. However, we arrived on New Year's Eve and intended to enjoy it! When we arrived to the restaurant for the NY eve party we were very surprised with the entertainment. They had beautiful dance shows going on, which unfortunately we could not see because they seated us in the corner with no view from the stage. The food was set up in a buffet style. There was not much variety at all...at least not what I would expect from a 5-star restaurant. Here are some details on the hotel: FOOD: Definitly not good! Poor variety! Even the breakfast, which usually has the most variety had extremely poor choices. The speciality restaurants were awful BEACH: THe beach is very small. The waves come into where the lounge chairs are and carry them into the ocean. Also, the beach is on an incline. SERVICE: The service we recieved other than at the front desk was poor. Most of the employees did not speak Spanish..luckily for us I did. By the 2nd day we decided that we were so dissappointed with this hotel that we had to switch. We ended up switching to the sister hotel Reef Coco Beach and LOVED IT!!! That is definitly a 5 star resort! So if you are not too picky and do not care about the service, then feel free to go...however for $100 more per person go to Reef Coco Beach for a much better stay.

Reviews.Title: “Best Vacation Ever”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Mexico with our 2 girls (6 and 10). We booked through FunJet and stayed 7 nights. We loved the Reef and will definately return! Advise to make the most out of your stay: Take plenty of $1, $5, $10, and $20 for shopping and tipping. You will only get peso's back for change. We packed a collapsable cooler and the restaurant filled it each day with ice for us. Although the resort charges for bottled water you can refill them for free at the restaurant. Rent a lock at the front desk for your safe deposit box in your room (just gives you an added peace of mind for $2 a day). Avoid the "concierge" when you check in. It is a timeshare pitch. Just politely tell them no thank you and walk out. Although gratuities are stated as "included" you will get far better service by tipping your waiters, bartenders, house cleaners, etc. early in your trip (understand they only make about $1.50 USD a day). The grounds are absolutely spectacular. But due to the 2 cenotes on the property the mosquito's come out in the late afternoon. We packed 2 bottles of bug repellant and were fine. We did have an issue with our air conditioner the first 2 days not blowing cold air. Within 10 minutes of our call to the front desk, maintenance was at our door. Upon the second call to the front desk letting them know it still was not working, within 10 minutes maintenance was pumping freon into the ac and we had no problems after that. The food was wonderful, especially the pizza's. Our girls loved trying all of the non-alchoholic drinks! Beware adults, this resort does not skimp on the alchohol. The drinks are strong! I definately recommend the massage on the beach. Shopping - If you enjoy bargaining, avoid the plaza and the 5th street shopping mall. Go past the ferry to the flea market. That is where we found the best deals. Our thanks to staff that really went the distance: Florencio at the pool bar, Jesus and Luis at Chula Vista, Henry and Lara at Mango's, Lucas and Rick and Laura at the Reef Marina, and Justin with Animacion.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to go back!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I with our four kids were at the Reef for 7 nights. And I must say after reading all of the reviews I was terrified at what it was going to be like. Thank goodness the resort proved them all wrong. We had such a great time. The staff was extra friendly. They even had nick names for all of us. The construction was going on but not at all annoying in any way. The food was excellent. I was really surprised at how good it was. Always a good selection. Our rooms were always very clean. The all inclusive snorkel gear and boogie boards...etc. were no extra charge! As long as you sign them out and back in. I don't have one complaint about the reef except I wish I was still there! Please feel free to email me with any questions. And don't be scared. Unless you are Prince Charles this place is great!

Reviews.Title: “Nice place! Great vacation & value!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This resort is a great value! We have stayed in many tropical locations and this place really turned out to be nice. My family of four just got back today...if only we could have stayed longer! This was the first time we booked a Funjet vacation and we were a little skeptical hoping everything would fall into place. Well, it did and then some. We were pleasantly suprised @ how nice the Reef really was. The kids (7 yrs & 11 yrs) loved the beach and pools and could not get enough Pina Colladas @ the bar pool. The buffet was very nice. Food and fruit always looked fresh and we enjoyed getting what we wanted when we wanted. Very convenient. (especially with children). We've never done an all inclusive before and this was a great experience. You will get great service if you bring a little extra to tip. We gave our maid about $3 a day. Our room was always clean after a day at the beach. With as little as they make a day, why not make their day and give them a few bucks? Do keep in mind that the walls are very thin and with the cinderblock construction and tile, things echo and sound loud sometimes. This has been a common experience in Mexico and not necessarily in this one particular location. We had ear plugs and that helped a lot if things got a little loud. We did hear the construction but our room was facing away from it so it didn't seem that bad. I suppose if your balcony faced where things were happening it could be a little bothersome. There seemed to always be someone cleaning, sweeping or working the grounds. This was nice to see things being taken care of and maintained. The guys at the dinner buffet were nice. We found that tipping a few bucks here also helped get our drinks faster. They were nice to everyone (tips or not) but it seemed that those who tipped got their drinks first and they returned to you afterwards to see if you wanted another or if you needed anything else. Most of our time was spent on the beach and pool area. Some days were were at the beach all day! There are many women (of all shapes & sizes) that choose to go topless. Just keep that in mind when you bring the kids. We told ours beforehand and they didn't make a big deal of it because we didn't. We did not experience anything bad (i.e. very drunk people), we felt very safe, and would definitely come back here again. I think the thing to remember is that you are in Mexico, you are experiencing a different culture, and that you need to sit back and take it all in. There were many people visiting from all over the world here and all types (familes with several children, some with none). I think you make the most of your vacation by how you choose to experience it and not expecting 'all the comforts of home' in somewhere that is clearly not like home or what you are used to. Thanks for a great stay Reef. We'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “Mr.A and Victor!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: holla como estas? My girlfriend and i came their on june 25th -july 3rd. We had so much fun every night we would go out and party. And all you people complaining about the construction you cant evn hear it. The rooms were gourgeous we loved them espesiolly we stayed at the big room were you have your own balcony were no one could see you and its realy pretty at night. And the room is 331 the best room ever. The food was great we liked it espesioly the watermellon it was so good and so red. The entertainement was great espesiolly when MR.A AND VICTOR are in it. And if you ever go their dont take them cuz their ours and they are our boyfriends. And we are coming back to see our pretty babys this winter. So all of you people out there LEAVE THEM ALONE cuz they wont want you cuz there ours!!! These are all the staff and entertainement people that we wanna mention. * MR. A* * VICTOR* DASTIN JUSUS VICTOR FROM THE BUFFET LOOK OUT FOR HIM HES AWSOME. DIEGO AND MANY MORE Also they have alot of activities during the day so dont be lazy go on every single one. And when you go upstairs to the show go even more up and youll see a tenis court. We loved this place we wanna go back there so bad. And we will we like cry every night its so sad that were home... AALIYAH AND BEYONCE

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay - but perhaps not right now..”
Reviews.Author: erinjh
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Reef Club twice now, our last trip there was 2 months ago in May. The construction IS bad, and they do start hammering away loudly at 7 am sharp. They don't work on Sundays though, so it's nice and quiet then! We didn't mind so much, we were up by then anyway! The pool area was still being re-tiled when we were there, but only at night. However the area is roped off during the day. Personally, I thought the food was pretty good. I read alot of complaints about it but we found it very delicious for an all inclusive. I definitely recommend getting a safe in your room, I read alot of reviews talked about theft, and sure enough when we arrived there was a lady at the desk complaining that her purse had been stolen. And let me tell you - the staff did not seem to care one bit and in fact seemed very annoyed they even had to deal with it. When we got to our room our safe wouldn't open but I called the front desk and they had someone there in 10 min to fix it. FYI - When you arrive you will be told you have a "welcome package" and if I were you I would just say no and leave it there. Basically all it is is a chance for someone to pitch a time share to you. They hounded us for days about this, and I really didn't appreciate that they acted for all intents and purposes to be real employees of the hotel - which they are NOT. HOWEVER, you will come across these folks everywhere, not just your hotel. They are in the airport, the street, etc. They all have the same pitch and they all want you to come look at their resort and if you do so you get a bottle of tequila and a discount on the activity of your choice (snorkelling, dolphins, etc). We finally got one of them to explain what was really going on and apparently they make $150 in commission if they get you to show up to the resort. They are very persistent and we found it almost intolerable how many times we were approached about it! I think they target couples only because their qualifying questions start with how old you are, are you married, etc. I think they have to find married couples over 30 to get their money. Anyway, I recommend telling them you are not married and run!

Reviews.Title: “***Beware!!!***”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Americans are not like here!!! We were treated with the Mexican Police if we did not play $40 that was not justified. They told us we owed $40 the night we were getting ready to leave for snorkeling equipment that was suppose to be "All-Inclusive". We were told according to the manger of the Hotel the Marina is NOT a part of the hotel EVEN though you pay the FEE to the hotel. ALSO- The construction is horrendous!!!! Lots of trucks from 7AM to dark. Worker STAIRING AT YOU!!! YUCK!!!! If you choose this resort please be careful. The hotel is beautiful. The walls are really thin...so don't think you will sleep in. :(

Reviews.Title: “Reef Playacar was great!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We spent 8 days at the Reef, our first time at an all-inclusive so we really don't have anything to compare it to, but, we really, really enjoyed ourselves. I read reviews prior to going and was very apprehensive but, all I can say is that the service we received was wonderful, the food was actually good (we always enjoyed our meals and ate too much and believe me - there is no one more picky than my husband, the location was great for shopping and browsing, going to cozumel, and the beach was so terrific and our room was spotless. Yes, they are doing some renovation at the hotel and I'm sure there are some people who would let that just 'ruin' their trip - but hey, there is so much beauty and fun going on you can very easily bypass the noise! We have travelled to many beach resorts around the U.S. & out of the country - with all honesty we would go back to the Reef without hesitation, we had great customer service - Isidro at the beach bar was the best, we never went thirsty! "Thank you" to all the hardworking staff at the Reef Playacar.

Reviews.Title: “Never again!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My family & I just returned from our vacation to Reef Playacar in Playa Del Carmen. This is the 5th trip I have booked to this area. In the past we have stayed at other resorts and all of these trips have been quite enjoyable and well worth the cost of the vacation. Reef Playacar was a major disappointment. It was presented as a 4 star resort but the quality and service was deplorable. I would rate it no more than a 1 star simply for misrepresentation. After spending more than 6 hours in transit the concierge would not allow us to go to our rooms when we had checked in until she had made a sales pitch for another type of resort. There were 12 people in our party, 4 of which were small children, and the last thing any of us wanted was to spend another 20 minutes listening to a sales pitch. After turning her down then she called our rooms and hounded us for two more days about this. We had to avoid the front lobby just to stay out of her way. The rooms were somewhat small and the beds had to the hardest mattresses I have ever slept on. The lighting that worked in the rooms was poor. The only electrical outlet in the entire room was in the bathroom. This resort advertised internet service but every time we went down to try and access the internet the front desk told us they were out of prepaid internet cards until the next day; this happened 3 out of 5 days. The staff in general was rude and unhelpful. They seemed to consider the guests an inconvenience rather than the source of their employment. Not one time in our 5 day trip did a staff member offer services to me. Instead I had to seek someone out and ask for services. The bartenders were the worst of all; at one point I had to stand at the bar for more than 5 minutes just to get the bartender to acknowledge I was standing there and there was no line of people, just me. To top it all off they were under some sort of construction so we received a wake up call of hammers, drills, etc. every morning at 7:00 a.m. In addition, painting the stairways in our building seemed to be a bigger priority than any kind of service. Not to mention that this painting created quite a safety hazard for my small grandchildren. The quality of the food was mediocre at best and they charged for bottled water. We were told that we would have access to a hospitality suite on our last day because checkout was at noon and our flight didn’t leave until 7:30 p.m. The suite we were given was a room that had been previously used by someone else and was not cleaned prior to us getting the room. There were dirty linens left in the room as well as trash everywhere. In hindsight I believe my money would have been better spent at a Motel 6 rather than this resort. At least then I would have known what to expect.

Reviews.Title: “Relief When we left the Reef”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The rooms are great, the buffet is great, the beach is great BUT, BE CAUTIOUS! Here's why: Although the majority of our vacation was wonderful, we have some major hotel issues that need to be reviewed by anyone planning on staying here. Upon our arrival to the Reef Playacar we were immediately seized upon by the “Concierge” by the name of Angie. She was quite the actress. She welcomed us like no other. She explained that she was there to help us if we needed ANYTHING. Then she proceeded to tell us that we were VIP and that we were invited to attend their neighboring hotel just for a look. We asked why we were VIP and she said because we are with Funjet. She said they wanted to impress us and share with us their sales presentation. If we went, we’d receive breakfast and a $60 gift certificate good towards any tour and a $50 gift certificate good toward the Reef marina. She showed us some of the marina water sports we could use the certificate on and the one we were excited about was parasailing. She said it was $50 for one person and $70 for two people. What a deal, we thought. We also thought it would be nice to see their time-share facilities. We agreed to attend knowing it was a sales presentation. Two days later we tried to redeem our Reef Marina certificate for parasailing. The gentleman at the Reef Marina booth told us it would be $50 for one person and $70 for tandem. We were strongly cautioned not to take a digital camera up while parasailing so we went to buy a water camera. After we purchased the camera, the weather went bad and a storm came in not allowing us to sail. We decided we’d try the next day. We returned the next day and a different older man was tending the Reef Marina and told us the cost was $50 for one person and $90 for tandem. WHAT? A $20 increase from the day before? No way! We explained our story that Angie the “Concierge” told us it was $70 for tandem and that the younger gentleman a the marina the day before told us $70 also. So why the increase? It didn’t make sense. We argued back and forth about it and the Reef Marina employee said that we were told wrong and they weren’t going to pay the difference. So we marched up to the hotel “lobby” to find a manager who conveniently wasn’t there and was “walking around the property somewhere”. Doesn’t he have a cell phone or two-way radio on him so that the front lobby could communicate with him for any reason? No, no he doesn’t we were told. How foolish and unprofessional! A hotel manager with no way to communicate with him no matter what emergency took place. We are by now thinking this is joke of a hotel. Totally ridiculous and downright absurd. We asked for our “concierge” Angie but the “concierge” on duty said she wasn’t there that day. She asked us of our story and we explained. Then, (sit down for this one), the “concierge” tells us that they are not related to the hotel. WHAT? Did we hear that right?…. You have “concierge” desks, “concierge” names tags but you aren’t associated with the hotel. What kind of hokey fraud is this? She then proceeds to explain that they are really officiated with the time-share company, Fisherman’s Village, next door. Oh, OK. So we were deceived when we first got there and were told by Angie the “concierge” that if we need anything just call her?! And now that we needed the “concierge” they aren’t willing to help. Amazing isn’t it? Now that there is a problem, no one wants to help. So finally we were able to meet with the hotel manager, Angle. We told him our story about the marina employee and Angie. We wanted the parasailing for $70 just like we were told by two separate people, one who is the “concierge” who also told us to see her if we need anything. (We guess she lost her manners and forgot to tell us that if there happens to be a problem not to contact her because she won’t do anything about it). Kind of funny, huh! After explaining the story, AGAIN to Angle, the manager, he calls Angie and Angie did agree that she told us $70 for two people to parasail. So the manager said, there’s nothing he can do about it. We asked if he could pay the difference and he said “No, I cannot give you cash”. (Are you getting the big picture here?) So now that there is a problem, nobody wants to take responsibility and nobody wants to help their paying customers get what they were told. (How would you feel by now? Lied to? Deceived? Being taking advantage of? HA! To say the least!) So Angle, after seeing our persistence on getting this resolved he (out of the kindness of his little heart, he offered to take the room safe charges off our bill) Oh goody, a $13 refun. Yippee! We were shocked at how badly we were treated. In addition to this oh so lovely experience one of the days at the hotel we had no hot water for 24 hours and during those 24 hours some of the time we had no water at all. We had to wash our hands with the bottled water that we had paid for. The manager didn't care about that either and said, that just happens. (A transfer to a different section of hotel would have been nice.) We are extremely disappointed in the lack of professionalism and customer service at the Reef Playacar. Bottom line, it's a great hotel/motel if you don't mind being lied to and if you don't have any problems.

Reviews.Title: “A great vacation in spite of the resort”
Reviews.Author: AuntNynah
Reviews.Content: I really really wanted to like this resort. The grounds are lush and beautiful, the size is small and intimate, the rooms are adequate, the food is adequate, the pool, beach, dining facilities, all just fine..........but a few things made my stay there not so great. The staff, I met ONE waiter who was nice. The other staff I interacted with had a demeanor of boredom and even underlying hostility, they obviously did not want to be there and certainly didn't want to be serving me. Other staff would ignore me for long periods of time while I stood in front of them to get snorkel equipment or a drink. We had a room right next to the construction next door. I know some folks have reported that they hardly noticed the construction. But let me tell you, if you had a room on that side of the resort, you noticed it and it was LOUD. We're talking jackhammering and other cement work down LOUDLY! Our balcony overlooked the construction, and was roughly 30 yards from it. Without fail, 7:00 a.m. every morning it started and there was no sleeping once it started. I realize there is another half of the resort that "hardly noticed", but that leaves the other half of the buildings that was innundated with the noise. The noise was also audible at the pool and on the beach, but there it was more muted and easier to ignore. The buildings to avoid: 1, 11, 12, 13, 14, 15, 16, 17 and 18. If you are told you are going to be in one of those buildings, make all efforts to get a different building! It will change your vacation dramatically. Overall, I had an excellent vacation. I laid on the beach more hours than I can count, I played in the ocean, I ate way too much, and enjoyed trips into town. But I feel like I had an excellent vacation IN SPITE OF the Reef Playacar accomodations.

Reviews.Title: “Little to be desired”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My family recently returned from our 7 day stay at the Reef Club Playacar and were extremely disappointed. We have been to many, many, many, All-inclusive resorts in Mexico and found this hotel to be very disappointing. The food, the service, and the grounds are nothing like what we have experienced in Mexico. Even the Animacion staff were boring and lacked any lively entertainment during the day - the shows in the evening were painlessly choreographed. Most reviews that you read about this resort complain about the food which is hardly something that you can understand until you get there. Sure everyone is full of advice to watch what you eat.... Everyone on the beach had at least one person in their group laying sick under their cabana. The buffet lacks kid friendly foods and any sort of variety for adults. The only decent meal that we had was upstairs at the Italian restaurant. Most hotels in Meixco are lively with friendly staff who are helpful who work longs shifts with smiles on thier faces. The staff here at the Reef Club either ignored us or told us to go to the pool bar for drinks. Trying to pin a waiter down to order food from the "Snack Bar" was impossible not to mention the time it took to get your order - rediculous!! The only plus to this hotel is the beatiful sandy beach and the amazing blue water peering out towards Cozumel. The grounds of the hotel in this rain forest environment are extremely muggy and really disgusting with the critters living in the cave. Good luck if you choose to stay here!!

Reviews.Title: “Did not Care about US Citizens”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Myself and my family just returned to Texas on Friday June 10th 2005. The front desk at The Reef Playacar Hotel was terrible. Mr. Raul Martinez who ran the front desk told me to my face that they the hotel and himself did not care about US Citizens. Because I was making a complaint about a charge on my bill. They refused to get the manager for me, so we could get this misunderstanding cleared up. I had to pay the unjustly charge for a laundry service for $120.00 US dollars, when I was told it was 3-4 dollars per bag. I told Mr. Raul Martinez that this hotel was screwing us, and he "stated" So what!!! you are in a foreign country. The only thing postive I can say about the hotel is the workers by the pool area, beach, resturant and beach rental were great. Eric from Candan, and Laura at the beach rental were so sweet. I would not recommend this hotel to anyone in the US, because of the comments Mr. Raul Martinez stated to me about US citizens. Sincerely, Laura W. Baytown, TX

Reviews.Title: “Loved It! Will Go Again!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went here for our honeymoon. We absolutly loved it. The room we were in was very clean and didn't smell of mildew either. The maids do a good job of keeping it clean. The staff was very nice and helpful. They had fun activities at the hotel that we participated in that were a blast. The night show we went to was cute, but you could tell it was mostly for the kids. I thought the food was good, not great but good. The Italian restuarant wasn't all that people made it out to be. Jose at the swim up bar is the best. I will say the drinks are good, but be sure you have a straw because it will taste like soap if you don't. I wouldn't recommend drinking beer without a straw or you can bring your own cups and they will fill them up. The beach was very clean. We spent one whole day at Xcaret. I recommend going to this especially if you have kids. We had a blast. You have to swim with the dolphins. The best time of my life....besides my wedding day!! Overall we had a great honeymoon! I would recommend this place. One more thing....when you check in and someone sits you down explaining the layout of the resort and asks you if you would like to go visit another resort and maybe upgrade.......say NO. It's a members only resort and they want you to buy one for like $60,000 USD. Don't waste your time. If you have any other questions or concerns, feel free to email me.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Reef Playacar”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I just cannot say enough good things about the Reef Playacar. Call me crazy – but I was totally impressed with the resort itself and the grounds. These reviews had me scared to death! Yes there is construction going on but we were barely even aware of it and to be honest, may not have even noticed it if it weren’t for the reviews we read here. The grounds are BEAUTIFUL! Lush and green with a jungle feel, and very VERY clean. The beach was wonderful and the pools are fabulous. The food is a cross between American and European and not what you’d expect (I was expecting Mexican food) but good none the less. You definitely will not go hungry. If nothing on the buffet pleases your eye there is always the snack bar with burgers, hotdogs, pizzas, etc. The rooms were great – very clean, cool and well kept. I do recommend renting the safe for $2 a day. One traveler with us said she had a cover up and necklace missing, and oddly enough my roommate came up with tampons missing – but other than that we had no trouble – and one of the couple’s traveling with us didn’t use the safe and had money and jewelry laying about with no problems. All the staff were very friendly – from the waiters in the restaurant to the guys on the beach bringing you drinks (be sure and tip them though, they deserve it). Isidro on the beach was especially friendly. Make sure if you book parasailing or anything that it’s definitely running that day (some days it doesn’t if the winds are too high), because my friend booked it early one morning but was told later that it was cancelled due to weather. When she went back to make sure she wouldn’t have the charges on her room bill the lady there told her that she’d still have to pay for it, that there is a cancellation notice on the back of the receipt. My friend was able to argue that SHE didn’t cancel – the parasailing people did because of the weather – so she was able to get a refund but she did have to argue. We thought Bodacelli’s was fabulous – very elegant atmosphere. Be aware that if you’re taking your children that some of the women do go topless – we saw none the first day but several every other day, even in the pools. I think this place is fabulous and will definitely go back – I think for the money you get what you pay for, and more. I got the impression that they really strive for good customer service. Not every person going there is going to be pleased because unfortunately sometimes bad stuff happens – but I do believe after reading the reviews, and then going there myself – that most people will be perfectly happy there. Oh – and be aware of the time share people – they are EVERYWHERE – at the airport, in the hotel when you check in, and on the beach. Feel free to e-mail me with questions or concerns!

Reviews.Title: “Could be great, but with managment like that.....”
Reviews.Author: roseHouston
Reviews.Content: I am so sad to write this because I found the setting and the location of the resort to be ideal. The size is perfect, the beach is beautiful, and the grounds are great. So, if you can handle the worst service and terrible business practices, it's not so bad. (Except the wedding coordinators were incredible). Let's start with the rooms. Motel 6 comes to mind, but then again, I don't go to Mexico for the rooms, so I can deal. The beds are hard as a rock and don't even bother asking about the pillows. The worst part is that the managment does not seem to have any problems with making people pay for rooms where the area around the rooms is under rennovation and there is constant terrible noise and inconvience. And I don't mean the huge construction going on at the property next door...I mean replacing tile right OUTSIDE your door and still thinking you should spend your vacation there. The food. The snack bar was good and the omlettes were good. The drinks. Weak, small, and slow in the making. At least the pool bar is open late. The service, or shall I say, lack thereof: I can't imagine running a business with a staff like that. Rude, misleading, unhelpful, you name it. I really dislike being treated like that, especially when I am paying for it. The staff did not even try to help. For instance, when my sister wanted to call her kids at home, they said your room phone does not work. When she asked where a pay phone was, they said there were none, you have to go into town. (THERE WAS ONE 25 FEET AWAY FROM THE FRONT DESK). When we went to the lobby and asked them to dial a room, the did. When we got back to our room and asked them to dial it again, they said there was nobody staying there by that name. We repeated it, spelled it, etc. "Nobody staying here by that name" they tell us. Even though they just dialed the magically disappearing guests 7 minutes ago. And they were not nice about it either. The business practices: Let me share my story on how unethical the managment can be. We booked almost 60 people with this resort for my wedding, and had 3 of them stay at the sister resort (parents) because of the transfer privelages. That way we can visit them, they can visit us, and we can all keep our budget in tact. Well, 3 days before we leave, they call the parents, (even though it is my wedding and I made all the arrangements) and tell them the transfer privelages no longer apply. (Apparently the resorts split their affiliations ro ties to one another, but remainded under the same owner) This news came AFTER they had our money of course. We spent 1.5 days there fighting this, and while they finally made a minor concession to let the parents transfer for 2 days, 4 of the kids + spouses, 1 aunt + husband and kids, all spent a lot of extra money because of the lack of transfer privelages. I felt like they pulled a bait and switch and were very unwilling to accomodate us and it personally cost me almost 500 US dollars. I wish they were better, because of the beach and size, but other than the wedding coordinators (who thankfully, were amazing, wonderful, etc.), It was awful.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect, i love it!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: People have been complainning quite a bit too much about the noise in this hotel because of the construction going on next door. I understand it's a bit disturbing if you find yourself in your honeymoon and want something quiet and romantic, but then don't go to Mexico cause it's so hot you'll be sweating all day and that's not really romantic, try the Azores instead, or maybe the Balear Islands before they get too crowded in the summer. I could complain as much about the construction noise as about many many tourists with no manners (i rather not name nationalities), like old married couples shouting all day long at the pool, laughing their ... off cause they spilled the drinks in the pool (who cares, they're free!!... nice attitude) or the groups of teenagers trying to find out who can splash more water out of the pool or who can speak spanish the worst. No, saying "Dos, please" is not spainsh, next time try harder. The food wasn't good, it was great, there was lots of it and the only reason why it was cold was because i eat really slow, cause when i put it in my plate my plate was burning. I only had the problem of having the waiters bring me the drinks a bit late once (in 8 days) but if it had happen twice the solution would have been easy, I would have waved my hand the next time. I ate out of the hotel 2 or 3 times, but only cause I was desperate to eat real mexican food. And if you get tired of the buffet you always have the option of the italian restaurant. The annoying thing is that you were supposed to book at 7 in the morning and there was no way i was going to get up at that time on my hoildays, but you can always go to the restaurant at around 18:00 and ask if they have any tables left, no big deal. The drinks great, my favourite was the fresh red (non-alcohol), i enjoyed a lot having my drinks at the pool until 23:00, when it's nice and very quiet. If I was gonna go back to Playa del Carmen I wouldn't mind going to the reef again, it's very nice, the staff is very friendly (like all mexicans) and it's within walking distance to the center of Playa and its harbor.

Reviews.Title: “Had our Wedding on the beach”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We fall in love with Playa del Carmen on a trip there before we married and decided to have our wedding on the beach at the Reef Club. The water is the most spectacular I have ever seen.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed.....”
Reviews.Author: Shiann01
Reviews.Content: We took a mother daughter trip to the Reef Playacar and just returned. I, too, had read the negative reviews, and was a little concerned, but we are not picky travelers, so I thought we'd be okay. We've stayed at the Gran Porto Real several times, but this was a last minute deal so we chose The Reef Playacar. Thank goodness we got a good deal on the package. The construction is very disturbing, ( the jackhammer everyone talks about is a HUGE jackhammer attached to a bulldozer that literally rattles your teeth when you're in your room or by the pool) but they really don't have any control over that, because it's happening next door. What I felt like was really poor was the fact that they have workers working late into the night hammering and chiseling removing pieces of the tile flooring outside of your room. We called 3 times to complain about the worker at the base of our stairs until he finally stopped about 11:30pm. Each time we were told they would send someone to check on it. They obviosly told us that just to get us off the phone. Our next door neighbors said they too had called several times. In addition, at almost every meal we had to go to the bar area ourselves to ask for water or soda, because a waiter never came to ask what we'd like.
