We'd be almost finished with our meal, and still nothing to drink. The grounds are very pretty and the food was good, it's just too bad that their employees all over the resort just kind of have an attitude that you're a pain in the butt and they wish you weren't there at all. We are friendly and polite, but never got that back in response. We are planning a large group trip back to Playa Del Carmen in the fall and we will not be returning to The Reef.

Reviews.Title: “Poor Quality/Choice of food”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We were disappointed in this hotel not just because of the construction but also because of the 4 star rating in the brochure for food and amenities which it clearly is not. Food was not always hot or cold as should be. Food not great in quality or choice or variety. So basically it's great that it's close to Playa Del Carmen, so you can spend extra money to eat well (for those who go on an all inclusive)

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Reef once again!!”
Reviews.Author: summer77
Reviews.Content: My hubby and I just returned from the Reef for the 2nd time. April 18-28th. We had our 1st yr Anniversary there. What a awesome time we had! We ate&drank our selfs from morning till night! We mostly stayed at the resort the whole time, because we did everything the last time that we were there. We visited Xel-ha again, and shopped at 5th ave lots. That was about the only things that we did outside of the resort. The Reef has really improved since we were there last ( more so the food). WAY better! The snack bar has really improved! Loved the snack bar! The buffet was good! Really have no complaints at all about it. My husband and i ate lots of the salad bar, and the fruits. One week they had a mexican night, and it was pretty good. The next night they had a chineese night, and i thought it was really good! A lot of the same staff still there. Maybe a few new ones. My husband found some of the staff that weren't so friendly last yr, to be more friendlyr this time! Botticelli's was really good this time! Better then last time (my opinion). The service at Botticelli's was absolutelyawesome! They are always right there when ur drink is empty, and very polite! It felt so nice to be treated so good!I forgot to mention that we went on a snorkling tour through our resort. They took us to the coral reefs by coco beach. It was awesome, but tones and tones of tiny brown jelly fish floating on the surface everywhere!! You couldn't get away from then. I was a little freaked, because this guy beside me said that they can sting u, and i have never been around jelly fish before. So, i couldn't enjoy myself knowing that they were everywhere, and thinking that they are going to sting. Well, for those who have never been around them before, be careful. About 12 hrs later i developed a allergic reaction from them ( hives). It was soo aweful! I only got them on my upper body, arms, neck, chest , half of my lower face. I think that i got them worse because i have sensitive skin. My husband was fine. I guess i was the unlucky one. The workers were always so concerned, and always ask me how i am doing, do i need anything. I thought that it was really nice of them! They are making the Reef into a 5 star. Adding a Mexican restaurant on the beach. Redoing the lobby, making it more fancy. Remodling the rooms, by putting big screens, and mini bars. There are a few other things, but can't remember. They have already started the work. They are just doing it bit by bit right now. It's going to be done Nov.1st. Anyone that is going, expect to be around construction. It didn't bother us. they were mostly working around the pool, and we were never around there. The beach has changed drastically, since last year. I couldn't believe what mother nature could do to a beautiful beach. They lost quite a bit of the beach, and about 6 palipas from Ivan. the reef's beach is in much better condition then a couple resorts to the right of the reef. The other resorts next door, have huge sand bags all over, and a green tube running from the beach into the ocean. Not sure what that's used for. We think either for the sand or water. We sat at the beach everyday for 8hrs, and it didn't bother us one bit that the beach has changed so much. It's still so beautiful! We were just thankful that we were in paradise, and were able to go back to the resort for a 2nd time. We only had 2 days that were really windy, and noticed that some of the beach was taken away from the big waves and wind. I was a little amazed how that happened in just 1 day. The construction never bothered us at all. It woke us up at 7am almost every morning, but we wanted to be up early. Who wants to sleep in while on Vacation?! Some days the workers were on the other part of the resort, so u would never hear them at all. Sunday is their only day off, and they work for 12hr a day. I couldn't believe all the building going on in Playacar!! There is 2 resorts being built that i seen in playacar, and one right by senor frogs (ocean front), with NO beach. I have read a few bad reviews about the resort. My husband and I do not agree one bit about what others have said , then again, we are not picky people and don't have high expectations. The reef is a great place! and we are already planning our 3rd trip in a couple yrs!!

Reviews.Title: “It is a great place!! ”
Reviews.Author: dearydog
Reviews.Content: Hello all , i was reading the reviews here nearly every day in front of my vacation .... so sometimes i was really happy about the reviews sometimes i felt really worse ;-) especially abot the contruction site !!! so my story i arrived there on 30th of april for a two week stay and it was my third time in the reef . I knew that the food is not good as it should be but you will find something to eat ... but the snackbar it is fantastic ... for example you can order hot dogs or burgers or every kind of pizza it is all very tasty and they do all the things fresh .... the drinks are average some r good (you should try the toasted almond mmhhhh ) some like the 100 % natural drink not sooooo ... in the town off playadelcarmen there are great restaurants like the la parilla or blue lobster ..... i thin if you are going to a vacation you have to eat somedays outside it very good ... and you see something different thats my oppinion;-)) so now construction .... YES there is a construction going on and it is right that you can hear the construction in your room and at the poolbar . i was very senitive before because i said i want to have a relaxing vacation without any nois ... so when i was there it didn´t bother me at all . IF you go to the second pool or you to the beach you can hear NOTHING!!!!! now beach : the beach was bad in the beginning of my vacation there was a smal beach and rough water but day to day there was more beach comming back and the ocean was calm then so it was perfect !!!!!! the hotel grounds they r very clean and they r lovely the whole place is GREAT SO I WANT TO COME BACK TO THIS PLACE I LIKE IT VERY MUCH MUCHOS GRACIAS (thank you very much) ADIOS and do not hesitate to contact me if you have any questions ;-)

Reviews.Title: “Would wait for construction to be over!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Resort is clean, rooms are nice. No entertainment onsite except a couple of shows and a few pool games. Most people choose this resort so they can walk into PDC. Have had better food at the same class of all inclusives. The good- the pool and pool bar are open until 11pm. The construction next door IS as bad as they say. We took the chance because we wanted to be by PDC and have some beach. I would NOT do it again until construction is done, could not relax by the pool bar or in your room.

Reviews.Title: “Had a great time!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We, too read the reviews of the Reef Club Playacar and my boyfriend and I were a little worried about our vacation HOWEVER we decided that the good reviews were excellent and the bad reviews were things we could get over easily. First off you will notice the construction so I took the advice of one of the reviewers here and when checking in asked for building 2 or 3 -- great help -- we were in building 2 and heard almost nothing of the construction next door. I recommend anyone doing the same. While we were there we talked to quite a few people who's main gripe with the hotel was the construction. In my opinion, I think they were doing their best to accomodate people, but there is only so much a hotel can do. Second of all, we weren't going there for gourmet food and didn't expect it. I think a lot of people expect 4 star cuisine like many of the "resorts" here in the States. Please keep in mind you are traveling to a foreign country and just cannot expect things to go as they go in the States. I think if you keep that in mind your vacation and stay here will go a lot better. The hotel was incredible -- we had a very good time! We would definitely go back to this resort. And thank you to all the people that told us to bring plenty of $1s for the tipping, it really does go a long way!!! The pools were great, the beach was awesome, the scuba/diving center was great -- we didn't want to come back!

Reviews.Title: “TERRIBLE...stay at the other resort - Reef Coco Beach.”
Reviews.Author: amysuema
Reviews.Content: Just got back from what could have been a TERRIBLE vacation. The Reef Playacar could be a decent resort, were it not for the MAJOR construction going on from 7am to 8pm every day. We were woken up each morning at 7am by the sounds of jackhammers. I am not exaggerating when I tell you that our windows were shaking. Unfortunately the staff doesn't seem to feel they need to apologize for the inconvenience. We decided to make the best of it, and laugh it off. However, as I was laying by the pool and found myself covered in a layer of dust from all the construction....we'd decided we'd had enough. After two days of arguing, and 3 hours on the phone with our travel agent, the manager agreed to move us to their sister-club (The Reef Coco Beach). This hotel was wonderful, and our vacation ended on a sweet note.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Reef”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I along with 3 other couples plus 1 stayed at the Reef Playacar during the last week of April 2005. We are all from the Midwest, USA. I believe all our expectation were either met or exceeded. Please don't let the bad reviews on this site deter you!! The Reef, IMO, is a great place to stay for the price!! Our room was clean, but a tad musty smelling (you are in the tropics by the ocean). From reading the reviews on this website, my wife threw in some small aromatic candles that provided a fresh smell to the air. The bed was very comfortable. Usually, my wife's lower back will ache after several days in a hotel. Not here! Bathroom was clean and we always had hot water. Room service was nice and quick. We didn't bother tipping and still received a clean room every day (as expected in an all-inclusive place). BTW, be sure to get the safety deposit box. Well worth the $2/day rate for peace of mind. I also read about all the construction going on next door. It didn't bother us one iota. But, we were not in the rooms that border the construction site. The hotel grounds were very clean, nicely manicured, with a canopy of trees keeping it cool. A great atmosphere to be in! We played a lot in the main pool. The games varied, but volleyball was our main game. The swim-up bar in the adult pool is great. The drawback, however, is the fact that the kiddy pool next to it was being worked on (new tiles). That resulted in all the kids playing in the adult pool. Not too bad, but more an annoyance. Staff was always friendly and would greet us no matter the time of day. We thought the food at the restaurants was very good. We always found something to fill us up. The morning omelet was always our main course for breakfast. Lunch was usually the Mexican pizza at the grill by the beach. We ate dinner one night at the Italian restaurant on the grounds (need reservations). The food there was very good, and nicely portioned, unlike American restaurants that bring way too much food. We left there feeling full, not bloated. Our only gripe is there was never any Mexican-style food served in the other restaurant. No chips or salsa for lunch or dinner, although the wives did manage to get some for lunch by asking. If you are a scuba diver, you must go Cenote (cavern) diving! Cozumel diving is excellent, but Cenote diving is an experience you don't want to miss. We went with Phantom Divers located in downtown Playacar. At $80 per person (gear included), it was the best price we could find for a 2-tank dive. Good hole-in-the-wall but safe dive shop. Check-in and out was quick and simple. No surprise charges. The tips on this site that we used are highly recommended: -take plenty of $1.00's for tipping and taxi rides ($4-$6 bucks/taxi to go into town) -take candles/room freshener (although we were hardly in our room) -take large cups with lids for your drinks -get the safety deposit box -reserve your beach-side seat early -go there with medium expectations and you will have a great time This place is well worth the little money we paid and we would go back without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Stay Away!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Reef Playacar is an unfortunate joke: 1. Massive construction on all sides of the hotel = noise, disruption, lack of serenity. 2. Severely eroded beach. The distance from the hotel to the water is only 20 yards, and that width of the entire hotel beach os probably only 50-60 yards. 3. Due to the erosion, the beach, restaurant, pool, and common areas were severely overcrowded. 4. The food is awful too. Result: No privacy, loud, crowded, and generally overwhelming. If you come from the city and want to be around people, kids, and music ALL day long, this is your best bet. However, if you came to Mexico for a relaxing vacation with privacy, peace of mind, and space from others, look elsewhere. Forget walking down the beach to find space from others. There are people as far as you can see, and Playacar has been spoiled. Reef Playacar was so bad, we checked out after one day. The pictures and service descriptions are NOT indicative of the accomodations. Do yourself a favor and go elsewhere. If you want to be drastic, don't even come to Playacar.

Reviews.Title: “Objective review”
Reviews.Author: kcinpdx
Reviews.Content: I've been reading these reviews for the past few months and was pretty worried about things. I thought that a good objective review would be helpful to folks after getting back so here goes: My wife and I stayed 5 days - Apr 25-29th. Rooms - Our first room had a double bed so we immediately changed to a Queen. Unfortunately it was on the South side of the resort next to the construction. There were no other rooms available until Wednesday at which time we moved to a room on the other side. All three rooms were comfortable but they all had a faint moist/stuffy smell and feel. It is the jungle though so it didn't really bother me too much. Construction - it is going on everywhere - I mean all over the coast but specifically right next door. It is pretty obnoxious and I'd highly recommend getting a room on the North side of the resort. When we were on that side we could barely hear the construction noise. When were on the otehr side though you could hear them banging away as early as 6:30 am. There was also construction at the Reef - there were some guys working on a small section of the pool everyday. It wasn't bothersome for the most part but one section of the bar pool remained closed the whole time. Service - most of the staff were friendly but no one was going out of their way to help you unless you were tipping. Most of these folks work pretty hard and I don't mind tipping (even at an all-inclusive) but there is a noticeable decrease in service if you don't. So if you don't mind walking to the bar it shouldn't really affect you. If you expect to be waited on hand and foot I suggest bringing some small bills. Beach - the beach was small but nice esp compared to the other resort close by. Good swimming, snorkelling etc. Forget boogie boarding - the waves aren't near big enough. Food/alcohol - adequate but certainly not top notch. We ate at the "fancy" restaurant 1 night. It was decent but will probably not compare to you favorite local Italian place. The Lunch buffets were also decent - I don't eat chicken, beef or pork but never went hungry. The wine is pretty bad and the beer, well I happen to like Dos Equis, but I live in the microbrew capital of the US and am very picky. So I hope you like Dos Equis. The mixed drinks were fun and plentiful. We ate in town 2 nights and enjoyed both restaurants. Entertainment - We saw one show - the 70's show thing and found it to be pretty darn funny. If you are into kitschy entertainment you'll love it although I'm not sure this is what they intended. The day stuff was fun to watch but we never really got into it. The young staff that puts this stuff on seem to work all day every day. It can't be easy to try and get everyone to have fun all day long. Misc - EVERYONE seems to smoke but that is not exclusive to the Reef. EVERYONE wants to give you something for checking out their resort. Ignore them. People will also ask you to book your side trips through them. We did a tour through Best Day and did Telum/Xel Ha combo but did Xcaret on our own. Both places are expensive but worth it in my opinion. The cerviche at Xel Ha is great. Overall - We had a great time. We spent only 2 days at the resort during the day b/c we really wanted to see the other stuff - ecoparks, ruins, the town, etc. I guess if you are the type to stay at the resort this might not be the best but I'll bet not the worst, either. If you need a decent place in a great location look no further. We probably would not stay here again but only b/c I'm the type to want to try out different places and I'm not 100% sure I'd do another all-inclusive. I did like the landscape jungle setting and the fact that this is not a 900 room place. Its close proximity to town and Xcaret make it pretty nice. If you have already booked here don't worry - unless you are a big downer to begin with or you expect to dine like a king you'll have a great time.

Reviews.Title: “Worst all-inclusive Ive been to..”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We go to all inclusive hotels in Mexico every year, I lived in Mexico for 18 years. I know what to expect, avoid this place. Food -this was the first time we had the urge to leave the resort to eat. The food was edible, not good. The beans tasted like instant beans and were very runny, I never saw any management-employees eating there as I have seen in other resorts. The restaurant ran out of ice cream and beer at least twice during our week long stay , we ate out three days. Kids Club-The kid's club is 15 yards from the ocean and there is really no control in place to ensure the children stay safe, our 6 year old would leave through the door in the small playgound. Theft- We we were cheking in this 11 year old kid was complaining about something being stolen from his room, I thought nothing of it. It seems Management lets constuction workers into the rooms without supervision, as a result we got robbed. After the incident I asked the manager to please have the workers not work in front of my room, he said no problem, the next day they were woking unsupervised inside the room below us. More than getting robbed this lack of concern and respect really ticked me off. It was the peak season and work was going on with little regard for guests. Why you schedule work inside occupied while hotel is at 100% is beyond comprehension. I walked by somebody who was talking to hotel folks, seems like he had gotten some kind of electrical shock while in the pool, he seemed fine. They were fixing the problem. There are so many better places to go in PlayaCar, avoid this one.

Reviews.Title: “3 star hotel at most - okay”
Reviews.Author: kapev
Reviews.Content: Poor service all around. Seat yourself, get your own drinks, highchair, get your own drinks at pool. Smoking everywhere, including almost all hotel rooms. Place stunk like smoke, including pillows. They recently remodelled the room that we were in, but bugs still managed to find there way in. Food was okay, lots of flies and rat like creatures around resort. Resort looks pretty at night with a jungle like quality. Construction taking place next door. They start work at about 7:00 a.m. Room was nice, but very damp. Pool was not as clean as I expected. Bring your own bottled water, as they will charge you for the water in the room (even though it's an all-inclusive resort). No fridge in room. Booked through HOTELS, which overcharged us and wouldn't refund the difference. They charged us for the kids (age 3 and infant), but the resort doesn't charge for kids of that age. No safe in room (although advertised). No clock or alarm clock either. This resort is not a 4 star, maybe a 2.5 star- 3 star. X caret is close by and worth the trip. We spent the entire day there and still didn't see it all!

Reviews.Title: “Had a great time at the Reef Playacar”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Reef Playacar from April 16th to April 23rd 2005. The beach was great, not that wide but long so you could go for walks on it during the day. The water was a little rough some days but it was a great color and very warm and nice to swim in. The food was good, the lunch and breakfast in the buffet restaurant were better than dinners. The Botticelli restaurant was very nice, althoguh the menu was limited. There was always activities going on during the day by the pool, although i did not take part in any. The construction next door was a little noisy if you were in your room, but could not be heard at the restaurants, beach, or pool. Would go back again if i had the chance and would suggest the hotel to others.

Reviews.Title: “Where's the Beach?”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Spent the Easter week at the Reef and it was our second time so I know what the beach used to look like! This is an important point about erosion because a lot of people pay a lot more money to go to the Maya Riviera rather than the west side of Mexico ie: Puerto Vallarta, Manzanillo etc. The locals tell me that its climate is really changing for the worse and don't know why. The water was rough and I almost drowned beneath a kayak by pummelling waves. However the quick thinking staff were there to help us so my hat goes off to them. Also, beware of going off away from the hotel zone past the last hotel on the beach. Your safety is not guaranteed there and there had been some issues. Its posted so please don't go off on your own, ladies. Also, the snorkelling costs beaucoup bucks and there again for safety reasons, you must book through the hotel in US bucks. Nothing to snorkel for in the hotel beach area. Budget people who don't want US$ taxi rides into town - no public busses can walk it from this hotel - bring good walking shoes becuase this walk is good exercise. One of the things we really appreciated was the Mango Bar - early evening service just watching the contruction guys go by after a hard day's work. It made us feel grateful with the cool gin and tonics and sprite for the daughter knowing that we're not working as hard as those guys! I speak Spanish and got a good second floor room but could not get a third floor room with patio like we had last time. It was great last time but this time no dice - I tried! Just a word of warning, avoid the ground floor rooms - they're dark and have that musty smell. Actually compared to our first visit, the rooms are small and we had 3 in the one room- all paying full price. I had a great dinner at the Italian restaurant for my birthday and was pleased to see the same head maitre d' from last holiday overseeing everyone. What a professional he is.

Reviews.Title: “Had an awesome time!”
Reviews.Author: berd
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a week at the Reef Playacar, and we had a great time. As others have stated, we were also nervous with everything we had read in regard to the construction. Our rooms were in building 2 & 3 (away from the construction) and we never heard the construction noise in our rooms. Not sure if I would have felt the same if our balcony faced the construction! The hotel grounds are beautiful with the cenotes and lush foliage. I prefer that over a concrete jungle any day! I went with my husband and 5 other people, and we all agreed we'd go back to the Reef again if the opportunity came up. Yes, we've had better food at other resorts, but you could always find something that you liked. We ate at Boticelli's twice... first time was good, second time, not so much. Although the tomato basil soup and salad bar is very good at Boticelli's. Yes, the beach is small, but there's still room for chairs and beach volleyball! And the water is beautiful! We had about 3 days where the red flag went up in the p.m. because of rough waters. There were plenty of resorts to the south that had beach worse off than the Reef. The shows put on by the Reef staff were nice. One night they bring in professionals (I think it was Thursday) and they were awesome! One night is audience participation. My brother earned the title of "King Reef" for the week. It was fun. The staff was very courteous. The rooms are basic, but clean & nice, and they did a great job keeping them clean and replacing towels.

Reviews.Title: “Had a Great Time”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our long anticipated vacation to Playacar. After booking our trip in November of last year, I started to get concerned after reading some of the comments about the Reef. I should not have worried. We had a wonderful time. The construction that everyone complained about was not bothersome at all. I had a room on the second floor that overlooked the construction site and it was actually very interesting to watch them work. They usually started around 6:30-7:00 AM, but did not use any heavy equipment until 8:00 AM. By the time I returned to my room in the evening there was no noise at all. I suppose if you were spending the afternoon in your room that it might be bothersome, but if you aren't out enjoying the beautiful setting here I guess you deserve to be unhappy. The Reef is built over a cenote, and the setting is beautiful. They've done a nice job of blending the resort with the jungle. I found the food to be good, especially the omolettes in the morning. There was plenty of fruits. There were some days that the selection was better, but I certainly never went hungry. You could always find something enjoyable to eat. The food in the Italian restaurant was decent, nothing spectacular. We enjoyed the change of pace of the "formal" dinner. The Reef is a smaller resort that what we have stayed in before, but I found that to be a good thing. We always found chairs available whether it was on the beach, in the sun at the pools, or under the shade trees between pools. We took a walk along the beach back toward all the other resorts and I was amazed at the amount of beach erosion that has occurred. We had stayed at the Allegro in 2001, and their beach was less than half the size as before. The Reef actually had one of the better beaches along this stretch. We were with a fairly large group of friends so we made our own entertainment in the evening in the outdoor bar above the lobby, but it would have been nice if there was some evening entertainment geared more for the adults. The staff was very helpful and courteous. They were very accomodating in getting our group in rooms that were fairly close to each other. The check in and check out process here was not as busy as the other resorts we have stayed at, probably because of the smaller size. Overall, I would definitely recommend this resort. As with any of the resorts here, it is Mexico, and you do have to be prepared for the fact that everything may not go exactly as you anticipated. But it is Mexico, and that's part of the charm.

Reviews.Title: “Don't believe everything you Read!!”
Reviews.Author: Patticcs
Reviews.Content: I just returned two days ago after spending a week at the Reef. Like most of the others that have written reviews, I too was concerned by the many negative comments. To my delight none were true, other than so-so food. I have stayed in 4 different locations in Playacar and consider this stay one of the best. I stayed at the Gala, which is much more expensive, and I can honestly say only the food is better. The rooms are great at the Reef, much better than at the Gala or Allegro. True, there is construction going on, but the staff will do all they can to move you if you request. I had a construction/oceanview room and was not bothered one bit. The construction begins around 7:30 AM, the machinery around 8:00 AM and all ends between 5:30-6:30 PM. I'm an early riser so it didn't bother my sleeping. The food is fine, I have never been to any resort that pleased me every single day, but there is always something good to eat. Truth is, all these resorts have free flowing food and nearly everyone over eats. When you eat and you're not that hungry food doesn't taste as good! Regarding the last person that wrote in stating they charge you for the water and don't mention that at the time of check in, that's true. However I find the large tag on the bottle that states, "if you chose to drink this water instead of the tap, which is 100% purified, you will be charged $1.00 per bottle", that's enough information for me! The entertainment is pretty amateurish, but these kids work their tails off all day long and then have to prance around the stage for a hand full of folks with little appreciation. Frankly if I were in their shoes I wouldn't work any harder than they already are. This resort is laid out very nicely with the restaurant having a full ocean view. Again this was a welcomed bonus since none of the other resorts I've stayed at had this. Due to the resorts smaller size, if you have children or teens with you it's much much easier to keep track of them. But don't ask my friend Jeri about that!! (inside joke!) The check in at the Reef was easy, swift and accomodating, something I did not find at the other properties. The Reef Club is the first in the string of resorts in Playacar and is within walking distance to Playa Del Carmen. At the other resorts generally speaking a cab was necessary. If I was put in charge of club management and had the ability to make changes I would see if food could be a little more inventive, especially the speciality restaurant that you make reservations for; I would get some additional staff for the shows at night since those poor kids must be exhausted; and I would get some sort of a late night club/dancing available for the adults. The upstairs bar is nice that's open till 2:00 AM, but there's nothing to do but drink. Give me a dance floor and some music and I'm a happy camper! Would I return, absolutely... bring your friends and have a great vacation. Oh, I almost forgot. All the beaches are smaller than they once were due to hurricanes and errosion, the Reef actually has one of the nicest beaches left!

Reviews.Title: “Don't Break The Lamp”
Reviews.Author: suesue
Reviews.Content: Just returned from our one-week stay at the Reef Playacar. I had read all of the reviews posted, and was slightly worried, but decided to keep an open mind. This is our third time visiting this area. Previously we have stayed at the Riu Yucatan, and the Viva Maya. We arrived at the hotel a little early, around 1:30pm. At that time, we asked for a room away from the construction that was taking place next door (it’ll be another Riu hotel) At 3:00, which is check in time, we were given a room that looked directly AT the construction site. I guess he didn’t hear us earlier! We asked for another room, and asked the desk person to show us on a map where the room was in relation to the construction. It was actually on the same side of the grounds as the construction, but looked toward the garden side of the Reef Club Hotel. He gave us the key to the room, so we could look at it before we agreed to take it. The noise from the construction was not disruptive at all. The rooms are pretty basic, with no frig or mini bar. There are 2 double beds, basic satellite tv, bathroom includes a shower/bath tub and a hair dryer. There is not a lot of water pressure in the shower, and the hot comes and goes. Our bathroom light switch was hanging off the wall. BE CAREFUL of the large lamp that sits on the night table between the beds. There are 4 switches BEHIND the lamp that works the overhead lights and the ceiling fan in the room. We broke the lamp trying to turn off the lights, and were asked for 700 pesos from the front desk manager (Rafael). Maybe we should not have been so honest! Rafael did cut the price down to 500 pesos (woo!) because we complained that the lamp was in a bad spot. We told him not to put another lamp in the room. As a nice gesture (?) he agreed to give us 2 t-shirts. We never saw him again, and we didn’t get the t-shirts. The maid will leave 2 bottles of water in your room every day. YOU WILL BE CHARGED FOR THESE when you check out!! They say that you CAN drink the tap water –ewww. We were not informed about the charge when we were checking in. We had a cracked glass in our room that wasn’t changed for 2 days. When the maid finally took it away, she did not replace it. We left tips and candy for the maid. The only day we left nothing for the maid was the only day that she made swans out of our bath towels. There is a good size safety deposit box in the room which will cost you 2USD upon checkout. The air conditioner was quiet, but the remote for it didn’t work. The remote for the TV was fine. After the lamp incident, we were not complaining about anything. After all, we were only there for one week. The hotel grounds are lovely – well manicured and jungle like. Small rodent-like (capybara) mammals can be seen on the grounds. If you're watching, you will see bats flying around at dusk. This is a small hotel, (200 rooms) which makes it very easy to get to know ALL of the other guests. Our new friendships made our trip to this hotel absolutely AWESOME! The food at the buffet restaurant was ample -- the soups were delicious, plenty of fresh fruit, and veggies, and usually a variety of dishes with chicken, pork and beef. (Remember this is NOT a 5-star hotel.) You can get chocolate or vanilla ice cream cones too. The staff will ask that you wear shoes in the restaurant at lunch time. A cover up would be nice as well. No dress code for the evening meal at the a la carte restaurant. (I was thankful that there was no one trying to sell me a time share at this property.) I consider this hotel comparable to any property in this area, and would probably NOT choose to stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “To each their own ...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Mexico and the Reef. After a quick round of the grounds on our first day, it was clear that if one enjoys a tightly packed, noisy, screetchy, squacky hen house, this place would be heaven. Unfortunately, this was not our scene. The staff is mostly friendly - the less English they speak, the nicer they are. Our clearning lady created different animals from fresh towels every day to the sheer delight of the kids. There was some strange weirdness in service, like completely refusing to serve ice-cream in a cup/dish instead of a cone. After several attempts at trying to understand why it is so problematic, I took it in a cone and immediately dumped it into a cup for my 3 year old. Also, the tables at the restaurant would have the oddest assortment of silverwear - some had several forks and no spoons, some had many knives and spoons, but no forks. I guess the staff just plopped down whatever happened to be in their hand at the time they were passing by. Food is passable - there was enough fresh fruit and veggies to survive, and soups were mostly interesting, but we were not expecting anything close to gourmet anyway. Drinks are mostly slop, watered down, including beer, but they are plentiful - so if your goal is to get sloshed, it is certainly possible. Grounds are nice, pools are decently clean, beach is fine, activities are tepid, we never made to any of the shows. "Reservation only" restaurant has nice atmosphere, but the food quality is at best the same as downstairs, or even worse! Some days the food was noticeably better than others - they must have different chefs, or maybe the chef partied too much before the bad days. But our big fear - upset stomacs, did not materialize! The bad thing is having to guard your towel - you are allowed one towel per person, which you can change as many times during the day as needed. But if you lose a towel, you pay $35. More than once we saw people staring at the empty chaise lounges were they placed their towels a few hours back - not a pleasant feeling on your vacation. Rooms are small, but clean, if tiny little critters don't bother you (tiny ants that love damp)- but you have to expect some life forms - there is a jungle out there. Kids claim they saw a groundhog on the grounds, but somehow I think it was some other critter. And to answer someones question - yes, there is a hair dryer in the bathroom. It's right above the electric plug where you would plug in your own hair dryer, quite difficult to miss. But, maybe our room was better equipped than others - we did have a remote for the TV.

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: BigNasty
Reviews.Content: Stayed there from March 21-28. Was worried after reading some of the reviews. However, the place is clean, beautiful and everyone is nice. We never had to wait or felt compelled to tip (other than for excellent service, which was frequent and I encourage tipping especially to the maids. They do such a good job for so little). No complaints. The food was great, the beach was sweet, they've got name brand liquor, its safe, etc. Everything was excellent. I was right next to the new construction and was never woken up early by any sounds. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Comparing Allegro to Reef Playacar”
Reviews.Author: JJGordon54
Reviews.Content: Last year stayed at the Allegro, this year March Break at the Reef. Although all Mexicans we have encountered have a pleasant manner the system of management at the Allegro allowed for the guests to get to know their staff and this seemed to make a big difference in the way we were serviced. We booked for the Reef in November 04 and for months followed the reviews basically to the same conclusion. If the staff at Allegro did not know the answer they would find out because they knew they would see you again. At Reef this was not the case and that part of the caring was not there. The food was much better at the Allegro although not to North American standards. For months the food review at Reef has been poor overall and you would think someone should be listening to monitor this, however no one was. The breakfast buffet presented trays of slop with no change to the fruit table. The poor Omelet lady was overwhelmed becuase the selection lacked otherwise. Lunch was very average and dinner we were forced to try elsewhere . We ate at the Italian twice and the service was better but the food was poor quality. so we went to town which is a marvellous retreat for shopping, dining and partying. To email the staff at the Allegro your response was immediate. The Reef lacked in any response. The Golf is inclusive which makes no sense other than to gouge for the 180 usd it cost. Unfortunately there was not much choice for golfers. The beach being our main reason to revisit was all but gone for Allegro this year while the Reef was smaller but as you walked further south the beach fronts became larger and were as colourful and clean as last year. We would not return to either for reasons stated and feel for your vacation the few extra dollars for the five star along the Playa Hotel zone to be your best bet. You want to be close to Playa for fun and experiencing the great people watching . Tulems too far and Cancun is too Americanized with all the chains. The rooms at the Reef were much larger in the bathrooms and the allegro were smaller but this didn't seem to make a big difference overall to us.

Reviews.Title: “Fun Time. Great Staff . . . not so great food”
Reviews.Author: j212oy
Reviews.Content: We just returned from the Reef Playacar. We had a really nice time. The hotel grounds are really pretty and even though the beach is small, it is enough room to do most things. Our rooms were very clean and had all the amenities we needed (no clocks, no ironing boards, though). It's strange to me that some people did not find the staff friendly. I found them to be kind and hard working even though most often they did not receive tips from guests. Most of the staff spoke enough English to understand and they were appreciative at my poor attempts at speaking Spanish. My only complaint is the food. The fresh fruit and guacamole were great, but I found that most of the food was not great. The selections were in strange combinations and often overcooked. This is an all inclusive resort and unless you're paying ridiculous amounts of money, you aren't going to get gourmet food. We supplemented with a few dinners out and the snack bar has great cheeseburgers. I would definitely go again when traveling with a large group, but this would not be a romantic destination . . .

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort, had a great time!”
Reviews.Author: Lakeside
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this resort March 2nd-12th and had a great time. The beach is smaller this year, we were there last year also in March. But---you can walk from the resort to the ocean, and no problem getting a lounge chair. The food was better this year, lots of variety and the drinks were better also. We noticed top shelf brands at the bar, but you are only served them if you ask. The staff is wonderful, so friendly. The rooms are clean, hot & cold water, towels, hair dryer in the bathroom, they provide soap, shampoo and conditioner. We were on the 3rd floor right next to the construction of a new resort next door. They worked 7am to 6pm Mon-Fri., half day Sat and no working on Sunday. When the noise started we got up out of bed and enjoyed the day. If you like to sleep in bring ear plugs. We never heard the noise while we were on the beach or in our lougne chairs, but you are right next to it again at the swim up bar pool. It didn't seem to bother anyone and you can carry on a normal conversation. We ate 3 times at the Italian rest. , it was awesome, they changed the menu once so you don't get the same old things all the time. As far as the food--it was great. Desserts are awesome, the BBQ ribs for lunch and the roasted turkey for dinner at the buffet were excellent. Guess what? You are in Mexico and won't see an American cook. Please don't let the bad reviews stop you from trying this resort, I'm telling you it's a great place. Yes, the pool bar rest. only has a few things on the menu, great hamburgers and hot dogs, great french fries, and pizza. You can get whatever you want on the pizza and they are the size of a dinner plate. They also make tuna, ham & cheese, Buffalo wings, and a few other items. They have a popcorn machine and excellent chips and guacomole. You can walk to PDC in about 15 minutes, nice sidewalks and very safe. Or it's a $4 USD cab ride from the lobby. Go to the El Oasis for lunch in PDC and order a shrimp taco (to die for) and a beer. Take the ferry to Cozemul, and take a cab from the ferry to Corona Beach to snorkel on your own. The cab ride is $10 for 4 people, the Corona has food, drinks, free snorkeling/diving from the beach, clean restrooms, changing room and showers to rinse off the salt water. Cozemul is beautiful. If you walk left from the resort lobby you will find a shopping center about two blocks down on the other side of the street. I have attached a few pictures of the resort, enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: glitter43
Reviews.Content: My review is to say my Husband and I had a ball there. It's our 3rd time to the same resort and we were very happy. The Italian restruant was terrific, I do have one question if anyone remembers. Do they have blow dryers in the bathrooms, I cant seem to remember. I always brought my own. If you would like to know more about Playa Del Carmen just ask. We are heading back on May 7th 2005. Cant wait !! Thanks Cheri <><

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Currently the hotel is under construction, although it didn't bother me too much. The staff is not very friendly, which is unusual in the Mexican resorts. Most of the staff didn't speak English, which was ok, but they didn't seem to want to converse with me in Spanish either. The service was erratic, usually fair service, once in a while it was good. The food was not good. Although the hotel claims 3 restaurants, there is really 1 buffet restaurant, 1 poolside snack bar (with only 4-5 menu items) and 1 Italian restaurant (only open for dinner, reservations required, VERY limited seating). No fridge in the room, no minibar in the room. Oddly, no clock in the room, none at all. But a reliable morning wake-up service. The beach was great, the pools were lovely. Plenty of shade and sun, plenty of padded, adjustable lounge chairs.

Reviews.Title: “this resort sucks!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Woke up at 7am to jackhammers. Got some discontent when trying to change rooms, yet succesfull. Food Sucked, made us both sick. Pools were to small and NOT heated. 3 bars available, only one open at a time. You have to pay 50$ american for the Fine Dineing dinner, in this "All inclusive". Couldnt walk down paths, contruction going on. Rooms do not have clocks/alarm clocks...TV's, dont have remots. Some anemnities were only available when it didnt inconvience staff. No-one speaks english. Paid for 7 Nights, were told to leave at 6, when asked about this problems, they refused to look into it. Charges us LD to call our travel agent. While staying in hotel rooms, Charge you Money to make local calls. Kicked out of room at 10am, Transportation to airport did not arrive until 11pm. Treated really unfairly. I do NOT recommend going to this resort.

Reviews.Title: “Very Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After viewing photos of the resort and reading other reviews, we were very excited to go the the Reef Playacar. We had a total of 6 adults and 4 childeren. We stayed at the hotel Feb. 16 through Feb 23. After checking in and finding out that my reservations were wrong (it didn't matter what my paperwork said, I was wrong) we ended up getting a rollaway bed for my daughter. The toilet in the room did not work, and it took 2 days for it to get repaired. The first meal that we had was dinner at the main buffett, the tortilla chips were the only highlight of the meal. The meals during the week did not get better. The food did not look good, and the taste was not any better. The Italian resturaunt was good, but you can only have so much pasta. Don't waste the extra $25 for the lobster. At 7:30 every morning, the construction crews started working on the path that winds through the resort, by 8:00 the jackhammers were working at the property right next door. Walking down to the ocean we expected a long expansive beach, no such luck! The beach was much smaller than the photos show, some said it was the time of year, others said it was damage from the hurricanes last year. Regardless of the reason, the actual beach looked nothing like the photos. It was not all bad!! The pools were great, the staff kept them very clean and there were always open chairs. The staff that helped with the sailboats, snorkels and boogie boards were helpful and friendly. Overall, if you can spend a little more money and go to a different resort, I would recommend it. This was the first vacation that I have ever taken that I felt relieved to be coming home!

Reviews.Title: “Overall Disappointment”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My family and I (six of us and a baby) stayed at the Reef Club Playacar hotel from Feb 12-19, 2005. We were all excited to take a trip and really relax and unwind. We did manage to have a good time together, but there were lots of disappointments on this trip, most related to the hotel. I am generally very easy to please, but due to the let-down we experienced, I felt compelled to share with others who may be considering this hotel. First, there was loud jack-hammer construction going on next door all week, 8 a.m. to 6 p.m. I mean loud like vibrate the buildings that the rooms were in loud. Of course the RC couldn't really help this, but if you want peace and quiet, now is not the time for that here. The service was at times great but at times borderline rude! Our digital camera was stolen, we needed a flashlight to look for it because we thought we dropped it in the sand by the pool. The guy at the front desk said "yes he had a flashlight, but no we couldn't use it". Don't expect good service unless you tip the staff FIRST. This seemed a little backward to us. . .once we realized that that's why we seemed invisible (in the restaraunt and at the bars), we tipped them and suddenly the service improved 100%. The food was horrible, very greasy and mostly tasteless. Again I am not a picky eater, and could usually find something to fill up on, but I gained 5 lbs in a week because the only things that had taste were fattening. All of the meat seemed to be the cheapest the resort could find, as it was so tough you couldn't even cut it. Boticelli was okay but nothing to write home about. I've been to Mexico 2x before and stayed at 4 star resorts (Bahia Principe, Tulum and Melia Azul in Ixtapa), and this one is not even in the ballpark. On the plane home, my fiance set next to a couple who told him that the only reason to go to Reef Playacar is to party, everything else -----. So I'm sharing what I wish we knew beforehand. The highlights of our trip were the excursions we chose. . .Puerto Aventuras swimming with dolphins and the Mayan Ruins in Tulum/snorkeling at Akumal were awesome! We went with Olympus, a new company, and they were timely, informative and entertaining on the ruins/snorkeling trip. Oh and the lunch we ate at Puerto Aventuras (burritos) was the best food we had all week. It is nice that the hotel is 20 min walk from Playa del Carmen, but if we had it to do over, I think we'd stay in Playa del Carmen or at a different resort in Playacar. Oh one last word of caution for smokers. The other times I stayed in Mexico, you could buy a pack of Marlboro Lights at the hotels for about $2.00 us. Well everywhere we went this was still true, but you pay $4.00 us at this hotel for some reason? The housekeepers did an excellent job, we agreed that was the best service of the whole place, and we didn't even tip her until the end. Biggest point I'd make is that it seems to be well worth it to save some extra $$ and stay somewhere else, unless all you care about is drinking!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, Affordable, Excellent Service!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I had our first trip to Playa Del Carmen in September 2004. We absolutely had a wonderful time, partly because of where we stayed. The best part of our stay at the Reef Club Playacar is the warm, inviting atmosphere. The workers are very friendly and down-to-earth. There is a rain forest in the middle of the hotel, which makes the place quite unique. Our room was far from luxurious, but it had everything we needed. The food was not gourmet, but they had enough variety each day. I would suggest seeing the nightly shows (which is sometimes cheesy, but it's a great way to meet other vacationers). We highly recommend this place, especially if you're on a tight budget. We would definitely come back again!

Reviews.Title: “Okay for a Quick Weekend”
Reviews.Author: squeaky_toy
Reviews.Content: Spur of the moment, I called up one of my friends to meet me for a quick 4-day weekend in Playa del Carmen. Having stayed at other hotels in the area, I knew where I wanted to go and the only prerequisite was that we stay right on the beach. We booked a 3 night stay at the Reef Coco Beach, at about $300/night. Upon arrival at Coco Beach, we were informed that the hotel was booked and we would have to stay at Playacar. I was quite disappointed, knowing that hurricane Ivan had eroded much of the beach in that area. The staff tried to tell me that I was "getting a deal" because Playacar was more expensive. Don't think so. That being said, we got some free massages and asked for transportation to be arranged back to the airport for our departure (which ended up being some guy driving us in a borrowed car). Reef Playacar was perfectly adequate for 3 nights. We ate in PdC for dinner the first 2 nights, so did not experience the horror that was the buffet for dinner. Breakfast and Lunch were acceptable, nothing to write home about. If they had actual salsa and guacamole at each meal, I would have had no compliants. One can live on salsa and margaritas alone. . . The activities were hilarious, though we did not take part. We were there to soak up some quick sun, which is all we did. The activities staff were so energetic and nice, I felt bad for them working in such a crappy hotel. Would I go back? Never. Was it okay for 3 days of sun? Of course.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff, Clean Room, but Food...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The location of this resort is great. It is $4 US to take a cab to Playa del Carmen, or a nice stroll. The staff was GREAT and the rooms were clean. The only downfall is the food. For five days we lived on the Guacamole and pizzas from the snack bar. We ended up eating dinner in town (some wonderful food), but not too much from the endless buffet was worth eating. If they could improve this they would have a super resort.

Reviews.Title: “Great vacation spot”
Reviews.Author: WarningU2
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just got back from 2 weeks at this resort. I was apprehensive reading some of the bad write ups here so was expecting very little. But we need not have worried. We had an excellent stay and a great vacation. Ok it's not the Ritz. It does not compare with the mega size grandiose resorts father down the beach like the Riu's. We walked past the other resorts and they are line upon line of chairs numbering in the 100's. Not for me. Ok to be fair to the critics I can understand if they have higher expectations for this hotel – they might have been happier at the larger 5 star resorts. Some observations: The rooms are dark, especially on the ground floor where we were due to all the foliage. Be sure to keep your door closed at night to keep out the wild life. To me being dark was a blessing allowing for some late sleep ins. There is a slight musty smell but if you keep the side window open it soon cleared. The air conditioning works extremely well and blasts out because the thermostat has not been wired properly to control the fan. That was a bit annoying. I ended up with a cold so recommend you turn off the air conditioning. Truth be told though we spent very little time in the room so who cares. Housekeeping was tardy until I tipped them $2.00 a day. Then we had prompt service a wonderful smile and towel origami on the bed each day. Isidro and Wilbert were fantastic and Isidro knows he is world famous. Some of the others are surly but most are friendly and eager to please with or without a tip. I noted the activities centre staff playing with the kids and looking like they thoroughly enjoy it. It’s a great family place. The whole hotel is spotless and well maintained. Staff are constantly sweeping the grounds, cleaning and keeping the landscaping in check. The walkways weave through a jungle like setting. There was some annoying resurfacing of the walkways ongoing that made it difficult to get to your room on occasions. One security guard blocked our stumble home from the Mango bar one night but we ignored him. The food was fair to good in the main dining room but I found it cooled quickly. The Bottechelli upstairs restaurant was excellent. My only true complaint about this place and really its out of the hands of the management is the ongoing construction next door of another Riu hotel megalopolis – the beep beep and drilling starts promptly at 8am and ends at 6pm. That coupled with the insidious Mexican music that plays constantly starts to grate on your nerves. The construction is slated to end in August. I was also surprised at the lack of beach when compared to some of the photos. There has been severe erosion all along the coast. Many hotels are actively fighting with break walls of sand bags. The locals say it’s the worst its ever been. The Reef is not too effected due to the reef that is on the shore in places protecting it. They have lost about 50 feet of beach but at least the buildings are not threatened like further down at other resorts. Some recommendations Take a thermal travel mug as the bar supplied cups are very small. Take a sweater for the evening its cool. The winds can be strong during the day and the undertow can be strong with pounding waves. Use caution when swimming. Ask that you pizza is done “crispy” (Mexican Pizza is very good with the ample peppers). Relax and don’t let things get you bent out of shape. If anyone wants to see some pictures of this place let me know.

Reviews.Title: “Construction”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We were at the Reef the 1st week of Feb. Two couples looking for a good time. For the most part things went well, I just have a few problems. First there is a major construction project next to the complex. I'm talking jack hammers thirty feet from your room. They just started building new condos next door and thats the veiw for half the guess for the next year. Construction starts at 7am and end at 7pm Monday thru saturday. You get one day to sleep in so enjoy. The hotel also gave the entire staff off for two days so there was no events all day so we had to pay to go some where else to have some activities. The only other problem was the booze, they had some which I enjoyed but once it was empty they would serve the worst or cheapest stuff they could get. You had to watch the bar tender because he would try to switch to the garbage brand when you where not looking. I wouldn't go back because I like going to different places every year. If I were you and your thinking of going make sure construction next door is almost complete

Reviews.Title: “Don't Believe Everything You Read”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from spending two weeks Jan. 13-27, 2005 at the Reef Playacar. Three couples went and we had all read the reviews about the resort, we were all apprenhensive about going for two weeks we weren't sure what we were getting ourselves into. Arriving at 9:00PM at night did not allivate our fears any. The next morning after a great breakfast with good service we felt we could survive this experience. A few days into our stay not only were we surviving we were thriving. Maybe according to our clothes a little to well. The rooms there are very clean and appropriatly decorated with a Mexican theme. A bonus was the bathroom. It had a large, deep full tub, hairdryer, and make-up mirror and lights. Because of the lush vegetation on the property the rooms stayed cool all the time and we never felt the need to run the AC. Windows open with a cool breeze is a welcome treat in January. The staff there are extremely friendly and always have a Hola for you, even when they a busy. The entertainment staff is exceptional. This is the first resort where I have ever been so welcomed by this staff. They made it their business to get to know you. They always had a smile and even chatted with you when time allowed. If you were setting at the table alone at breakfast or lunch they would even join you. They always kept something going around the pool, so you had plenty to do if you chose to join. Cudos to Christine, Gabby, Maria Isabel and Xjhouljia what a joy to be around and what talented girls, they were dynamite dancers in the nightly shows. The Mango Bar is the domain of Yara, a more pleasant young lady you'll never meet. Ask her about the drink Xtaubentun or as members of our group call it the "Nectar of the Mayan Gods" The food was above average for a Mexican resort of this calibre, it was seasoned well unusual for most resorts, I am a picky eater and I always found something to eat. Botacelli's (the Italian restaurant) was not only good it was outstanding. I am married to an Italian who is a very good cook, and the food served there rivalled some of his. He thought they had a real Italian chef and was surprised to find out the chef was Mexican. The service there was on a parallel to much of what I have recieved in any North American establishment. The servers really seemed to like their job. I have worked in the tourist industry for 23 years, so I know something about restaruant service. If you are looking for 7 speciality restaruants and 5 buffet restraunts, acres of land, a whirlpool in your room and Las Vegas entertainment,all the commericalism of a large hotel this is not the place for you, however: if you are looking for a small resort with a real Mexican feel where you can get to know other guests and highly recommend the Reef. A short walk into Playa del Carmen one way or Plaza Playacar the other. I would vacation again at the Reef and in trun would recommend it to my friends. Don't believe everything you read!

Reviews.Title: “wonderful staff and beautiful beach”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: after reading some reviews my best friend and i took a chance anyway and we don't regret it. the staff at the reef is the best! ISIDRO on the beach was friendly helpful and made sure we always had a nice refreshing beverage in our hand,ROBERTO in water sport activites is awsome and always remebered our names he was great,GABY and MELEN were 2 nicest girls this TEXAS girl ever met.I told them I'D GIVE THEM props when I RETURNED TO SAN ANTONIO.I felt that many of the reviews were unfair.EVERTHING was clean smelled great.there was a bit of construction but if you are like us you wouldnt even notice since you'd either be on the beach sipping a coctail which were the best or a nice cold DOS XXX OR off on some excursian which CARLOS from FUNJET will assist you with!The staff alone is worth going back for!Hey guys from the reef club playacar I told you I wouldnt forget! you are the best! the 2 tejanas from san antonio, Deanna y Felicitas

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful grounds, and great staff!!”
Reviews.Author: Icensnow
Reviews.Content: January 18-25th 2005 The Reef Playacar does need to update their picture, but other than that it is a very nice resort. The Italian restaurant is great, and the deserts are top notch. The serving staff and bartenders are very friendly and work very hard. They are very appreciative of tipping, and really deserved them for that matter. The entertainment staff also worked hard, and their nightly show was worth attending. One thing that surprised us was the lack of beach, but a walk down the beach will make you realize how lucky you are to be at the Reef. For some reason the ocean has eaten away 80-100 feet of beach all the way down all of the all inclusive resorts. The reef has one of the best beaches of what is left of them. The buffet food does get a little old after 5 days, but if you mix in the italian restaurant you will not go hungry. As for the food at the snack bar, it may not be the best, but it is far from bad too. One thing to complain about is the milk and juice selection. Stick to bloody mary's and beer and you will be much happier!! We really enjoyed our vacation, the Reef was a nice place, and Playa Del Carmen in general is a great place to visit. Get up early and get a beach chair and lastly ---> Have fun!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Two Weeks”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a very pleasant two weeks Jan. 13-27, 2005 at this resort. I read the bad reviews before we left and I thought what did I get myself into especially for two weeks!!! Well I must thank the bad review authors as all their negative items were not there and they must have fixed them before my arrival. The rooms were clean and the grounds kept extremely well. The grounds are a jungle in the area of the rooms but are kept beautifully. I even saw one groundkeeper cleaning leaves on some of the greenery. The food was great and if do not go to the Italian restaurant as much as you can, you would be missing excellent food. I travelled with a Canadian Italian who in his own right is an excellent cook and he was amazed at the quality of the authentic Italian food prepared by an Mexica chef. The staff was always pleasant and we did tip at the end but it was not necessary to get good service. The bar girl at the Mango bar (Ara) was exceptional and we appreciated attending our needs. Felicino also was a positive staff member as well. The pools were clean, bars well stocked with everything from Ballantine Scotch to Tequila. There were minor items that probably would improve things and I will mail my constructive criticism to them directly and I feel confident they will endeavour to improve these items. I would go back and intend to in the future

Reviews.Title: “Reef Playacar only 2 Stars”
Reviews.Author: Ayuda1993
Reviews.Content: We were at the Reef Playacar from Dec. 29 through Jan. 5. We would not go back, nor would we recommend this hotel to anyone. For $350.00 (USD) per night one would not expect to be charged a $2.00 per night fee for the safe deposit box nor $1.00 per bottle for water. The room was clean but spartan. The lighting is terrible. The fluorescent lights in the ceiling do not work when you are trying to read or put on make-up. The only available electrical outlet was in the bathroom. The food at the buffet was edible but repetitive. The bar and restaurant staff were very friendly, especially after we tipped them; but their level of expertise left a lot to be desired. The food at the snack bar was without a doubt the worst we have ever seen. I became very ill after eating a hamburger and again 2 days later after eating a hot dog. They don't seem to understand the concept of hot food. Everything was undercooked and cold. We have traveled extensively throughout Mexico and Central America, so we're not looking for USA standards. This resort is advertised as a 4-Star. Not more than 2.

Reviews.Title: “Isidro is the MAN!!”
Reviews.Author: woodley
Reviews.Content: We spent Jan. 2nd thru the 8th at the Reef Club and upon our arrival, checked in at the lobby. People not that friendly or helpful in the reception area, they never gave any instructions regarding towel cards, etc. Our room was not yet ready, it was only 11:00 in the a.m. We were given our bracelets and allowed to use the grounds till our room was ready. We, being from the Washington, DC area, were in our long pants and the day was beautiful. So we headed for the beach and the bar! Upon our arrival at the beach bar we were greeted by the nicest, most courteous, fun loving young man named Isidro. He answered all our questions, which the reception area did not offer or even care to waste their time with!! Isidro gave my family the most relaxing, stress free vacation we have had in many years. He went over and beyond the call of a staff member. You have questions, ask and he will accomodate you. His english was very good and he was a pleasure to meet and greet each and every morning. The resort is Beautiful! The grounds were very clean and well maintained. The rain forest area where the rooms are, was Beautiful and calming, the beach area, Beautiful and invigorating! The beach snack bar had delicious food and they were always there with a friendly smile to assist you with your snacking needs. The best guacamole we have had! The drinks were never ending, one excellent tip, TIP the staff, they work soooo hard to make your stay enjoyable and they definently deserve the appreciation from the guests. Again, say "Hola" to Isidro, make a new friend and tell him that the DC people said "Hola, Amigo!" We do miss him!

Reviews.Title: “Reef Club Playacar: Great place!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just came back from Reef Club Playacar and I have to say that this is a beautiful place with a great service and nice staff. The rooms are very clean and all the common areas are always clean and welcoming. The animation staff is great, they really make a difference. They are always smiling and putting together great activities for all the guests. I have to highly recommend the massage by the beach is so relaxing and the guy who does it is great. All I can say is THANK YOU VERY MUCH Reef Club Playacar!!! you all made our stay in Playa del Carmen and unforgettable experience. Zu

Reviews.Title: “Would go back in a second”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My girlfriends and I stayed at the Reef for our spring break in 2003. It was fantastic!!! The only problem I had the whole time was when we first arrived in the room, there was a cockroach. But what is Mexico without a cucaracha? The warm climate and dark bathroom must have been a good place for him to hang out. And he was the only one I saw the entire time. The food was excellent, especially the guacamole and salsa. The drinks that are included are a little small and watered down but you can get as many as you like. The entertainment staff was phenomenal. They kept us entertained the entire week, and would even eat meals with us. There was really no reason to leave the resort area, as the beach is beautiful and there is plenty to keep yourself occupied with thanks to the entertaiment staff who had activities during the day and shows at night. But if you felt the need to leave the resort, downtown Playa del Carmen was maybe a twenty minute walk - and we always felt safe because the neighborhood the resort is in is very nice. There were also excursions to Mayan ruins and other places available for an extra fee. Well worth it I thought - we went to Chichen Itza (sp??). It was beautiful! Lots to do!! Although, be warned, we ate dinner outside of the resort and I got a case of Montezuma's revenge. Playa del Carmen is beautiful, and I would go back to the Reef in a second!!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable/Cozy”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Recently, my boyfriend and I returned from a week stay at this hotel. It is a very small, intimate resort, giving it a romantic feel. The beach was beautiful, though small. Natives said that the hurricanes destroyed a great deal of beach, as was the case for many other beaches along the strip. This was evident when we compared a brochure of the hotel and the actual beach. I would agree with some of the other reviews as far as the hotel rating is concerned. Some websites consider it to be a 3 star, while others call it a 4. I would say it is a 3+. As far as the food goes, it is not that great. There is not much to choose from. If you are not a picky eater, which we are not, you can find something, but for those who are fussy this would have been a difficult stay. The rooms very very clean and nice. The service was great. Everyone was extremely helpful and friendly. We had a terrific stay here. We probably wouldn't stay here again given the option of staying at a Riu or Iberostar, like we normally do. Nevertheless it was a beautiful resort.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Family Vacation!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We recently returned from a family vacation at the Reef. We had a large group of 15 with 8 kids. We had a hassle-free holiday and experienced friendly staff. This smaller resort is perfect for families - the pools are located very close to the beach which makes for easy supervision of kids who are playing back and forth between the ocean and the pool. The snack bar was a big hit with the kids as the pizzas and burgers were excellent. The rooms were comfortable and clean and the maid service was excellent. This resort is in an excellent location - 5 minutes from a shopping plaza and a 15 minute walk to Playa Del Carmen. We feel this resort was of excellent value compared to the surrounding resorts and we would definitely go back!

Reviews.Title: “You Get What You Pay For”
Reviews.Author: Wynne77
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at the Reef from December 12-26. One of the reasons we stayed there was because of the price and although it is rated a 4-star by Sunquest vacations, it should be rated a 3 or maybe 3+. Our arrival was uneventful as we were the only group on the bus staying at the Reef. The check-in staff were friendly and were able to give us three rooms right next to each other in building 14. Although all the rooms were ground floor rooms, they were not musty and smelled just fine. Our air-conditioning worked fine, but we never used it. The celing fan on with both windows open was perfect. The rooms themselves are on the small side, but the beds are comfortable and the bathroom is a good size. We never had problems with not getting enough hot water or towels. The weather was beautiful the entire time were were there, but the nights are cold so bring pants and a few sweaters. The hotel grounds were really beautiful; a jungle-like setting. I did look around a few of the other hotels on the strip and the atmosphere at the Reef was much nicer. There are two pools. One with the swim-up bar and shallow area for the kids and a second pool where they do the water aerobics and play water polo. For the most part the pools were clean at the beginning of the day, but people track sand and leaves and other debris into the pool and I never saw anyone cleaning the pool after early morning. The beach was beautiful the first few days of our trip, but whether it was due to strong winds or ocean currents, most of the beach had disappeared over a day or two, leaving exposed rocks and fallen palapas. Apparently they've lost about 20 meters of beach in the last year. I didn't recognize the beach from the pictures on the internet. It was quite busy the second week we were there and most of the chairs at both the beach and the pool were taken by mid-morning, but we were up about 8 am and never had a problem getting six chairs together. The people do get up early to reserve chairs, but hey, if you can't beat them, join them. I have to commend the animation staff who were always very friendly and worked long hours. The organized activities thoughout the day were okay, nothing great. It was the usual aerobics, volleyball, stretching classes. It the day activities were okay, the night ones were non-existant. This is not a place to stay if nightlife at the resort is important to you. The lobby bar, Mangos, opens around 6 pm, with a guy playing a keyboard and singing. When I first heard him I thought it was kareoke night. He was horrible. Thank goodness he only played for a couple of hours. The animation staff then hold a nightly show in the theatre at 9:30. Although the audience participation show and casino night were fun, the other shows were about the calibre of a junior high Christmas concert. Not good. After the show is done at about 10:30 people have a drink or two at the very quiet lobby bar and either head to bed or to Playa del Carmen. If you want nightlife you have to go into town. We went into town a couple of times and really enjoyed the Blue Parrot, which is about a $6.00 cab ride from the Reef. Now the food. I had read a lot of reviews about the food before I went, so I was not surprised by it. I am not a picky eater and always found enough to eat, but the buffet is small and doesn't have a lot of options. Most of the food is really greasy and either undercooked, overcooked, or cold when it's supposed to be hot. Breakfast was probably the worst meal. Thank God they cooked pancakes on the grill. We had bacon only one day. Other days they either fried up strips of ham or little mini-wieners. The omllett and egg bar looked good, depending on who was cooking. One cook basically boiled the eggs in oil, while others made great eggs. Hit and miss on that one. The bread and fruit was always good. Lunch was always much better. The grilled white fish was awesome and there was definetly more selection. The desserts were okay, nothing special, but their soft serve ice cream was really good. Another option during the day was the snack bar by the beach. They served pizzas, burgers, hotdogs, fries, wings and sandwiches. The Mexican pizza was great and were the burgers and hotdogs. They are open until 2 am so there was always somewhere to get a snack. We only ate at the buffet for dinner once and then decided to stick to Botticelli. We made reservations there almost every night and thoughoutly enjoyed it. The service was great and the food was good. We also went into Playa del Carmen a few times for dinner. The day we checked out, our bags were kept in a locked room and they offered us the use of a courtesy room for 30 minutes to shower and change before our bus came to take us to the airport. Check out was no problem. Overall, our vacation at the Reef was good and what I expected. Although I would have liked more nightly entertainment or a disco on the resort, everything else met my expectations. I loved the area of Playa del Carmen and will certainly be back, but will stay at a different hotel. Please feel free to email me with any questions.

Reviews.Title: “Ok for the price we paid”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: 12/18-12/25. Where did the beach go? It was there when we got there, then slowly disappeared. Does anyone know what happened? The food was not very good. But we weren't there for the food! The weather was great! Some bartenders were great, others were very slow, or they didn't have enough bartenders (especially by the pool area). The drinks were ok if you told them how you liked them. Isodoro was great at getting us drinks from the poolside or beach. Some of these people work very hard and deserve tips. They were very courtious to their guests. The room smelled a little, I sprayed it with air freshener (2nd floor). It was just ok. But this resort is in a jungle and it is very humid. It was cleaned daily, the maids did an excellent job! The resort was probably built in the 70s, and it shows it. This resort is smaller than what we are used to staying at. We met a lot of nice people from the USA, Canada, and Europe. Go into town at night, there isn't much to do there. For the price we paid, it was ok. But we would would stay at a different place next time.

Reviews.Title: “It was OK”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
