Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stayed at the Reef Playacar, and thought it was just ok. The place is beautiful and there is a lot to do, but the rooms smell really musty and there is no way to air it out... The food was NOT good!! My husband is not a picky eater at all, and could rarely find something good to eat... The Italian restaurant was pretty good but you have to make reservations for it and there is a dress code. There is a snack bar that is open most of the day, but it is not buffet... it use to be but they changed it. Now you have to go put in an order and wait about 10 minutes, they offer about 5 different things. And the buffett restaurant is open for main meals. The breakfast is pretty good, but dinner was terrible. I am sort of a picker eater so I couldn't find anything I liked, I ended up eating rolls for dinner, but on the 2nd night there we found out they had an ice cream machine so I ate that along with my rolls. During our stay they ended up running out of ice cream all together, and that was only the 4th day!! And there pizza is really bad... The weather was great while we were there but it gets dark really fast and pretty cold. Overall we thought the vacation was ok for the price we paid, but would not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “A three star rated hotel. Not four star”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I spent a lot of holidays in the west indies, and therefore I think i can compare quality - prices. I had a nice holiday, but the food was not really good. Most of the time I left the hotel and went to Playa del Carmen. While staying in my room, I could hear everything, literally everything what was happening in the other three rooms next to mine. Really extremely noisy. I had to use plugs. Surroundings were fantastic, staff very friendly. I was there in February 2004 and I was a bit annoyed with the American people. Extremely noisy and did not have a lot of respect for the other guests and for the staff. Secondly they did not follow the dresscode and it was very untasteful to have lunch next to people in their swimwear. It is definitely not a four star hotel. Three star I would say. If they would rate it three star, I would say, good price. My advice to the hotel: the quality of the food shoudl improve and secondly please use some isolation material in the rooms, it was really really noisy. Thirdly I understand you need to use products to avoid insects etc, but upon arrival it was like a room full of chemicals. Though I had a good time at the hotel, I would not recommend it, unfortunately.

Reviews.Title: “Hated It!”
Reviews.Author: cdarche
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently vacationed to Playa for our first all-inclusive resort vacation and were sorely disappointed with the Reef Playacar. It was dark, smelled of mildew and urine, the food was horrible, the ammenities were lacking and service was not to be found. We ventured into a few neighboring resorts and were amazed at their cleanliness, ammenities, the fantasic pools, and their open feel. We asked to switch to their sister property, the Reef Coco Beach the next morning. The Reef Playacar was very accomodating and let us swith without extra fees. We spent the remainder of our vacation at The Reef Coco Beach. This property was everything we expceted. Great food, beautiful beach and rooms, great pool with activities throughout the day. I would highly recommend staying at The Reef Coco Beach to anyone going to Playa Del Carmen. Stay away from The Reef Playacar as you will be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Lower Your Expectations”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Reef Playacar and were immediately disappointed. Our room and our friends' room were mildewed and smelled of mold; the pool smelled of urine (sorry to the faint of heart, but true); large vampire bats were dive-bombing guests as they sat around the pool at dusk; the dinner buffet was dismal; and the "jungle" theme of the grounds makes them dark and depressing. My husband and I talked of going home from vacation early--we disliked it that much. Fortunately, we were able to transfer to the sister property, Reef Coco Beach, the next morning; and were much happier there. We have stayed at several hotels in the Mayan Riviera area, and the Reef Playacar is the only one we have found where we would never go back, no matter how good the deal may be. We would, however, return to Reef Coco Beach, especially if the price were right.

Reviews.Title: “Please read this review”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful vacation. One thing; We were sorry to see they use wild animals for commercial use (parrots / lizzards). Please don't take pictures of wild animals on a beach !!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Quiet atmosphere???”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Spent a week in the Reef Club hotel with my wife after having travelled the Yucatan peninsula for a week. Compared to the hotels we stayed in during our trip through the peninsula, this hotel was well above the average. Nice and clean room, A/C worked well, the hotel garden was unusual. The music played from the "stone speakers" in the garden was a little bit annoying - we were glad to have the room facing the abandoned lot next to the hotel. Food and drinks were excellent - there was more than enough of everything. The only thing we missed were fresh tomatoes. The pools and beach were OK, however the pools were a little bit dirty after the showers. The beach size (in our opinion) was not sufficient (too narrow - restricted possibilities for swimming). The other thing was the return time for towels. 5.00 PM is too early. :-( The activites carried out by the team of animators were sometimes funny, but generally too LOUD. Try to get sunbeds on the beach. It´s quiet there! Our leaflet said "beautiful hotel with quiet atmosphere". Well, this was not our idea of a quiet atmosphere. Overall, we have thoroughly enjoyed our stay in the Reef Club Playacar. Would go back. The only "real" problem came the very last morning. Our taxi was scheduled to pick us up in the hotel at 7:45 AM. We have asked the reception to give us a wake up call at 6:15 AM. Surprise, surprise - WE NEVER GOT THE WAKE UP CALL !!!!! Thanks good my wife had set up her watch alarm clock!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We travelled from Newcastle, England to the Reef Club not really knowing what to expect. Cancun was not nice, tacky, and the bus ride to Playacar did not bode well, not very pretty, so we were pleasantly surprised when we reached the hotel itself. The rooms were tasteful. we never spent that much time there (!) and kept spotlessly clean by the maids who worked so hard in all that heat, well deserved tips at the end of holiday! The environment is so relaxing, jungle theme with lots of greenery and calming music piped through as you meandered along the paths to restaurant/ beach/ pool. We took 3 kids and they were well entertained everyday (& night) with a load of activities & fun staff. The pools were fine, adequate for the 300 rooms that make up the hotel, and never unpleasantly crowded, the pool bar was a nice touch. The beach was absolutely BEAUTIFUL, stunning turquoise water and safe for kids to try snorkelling, cute fish, snorkels/ boogie boards etc free to use. Recommend a scuba diving trip (booked at the beach shack) to the coral and a trip to Xcerat, cheaper to get in a taxi and pay in when you get there, the evening show is spectacular! Food was wonderful- so much variety & quality- snack bar open until late at night! Beats any European hotel we've ever stayed in. Staff were lovely on the whole, lots of character! Would visit again were the world not such an interesting place with so much to see! Have a marguerita on us when you get there- and ENJOY!

Reviews.Title: “Would go back!”
Reviews.Author: twinmom1292
Reviews.Content: 19 of us went, ranging from 6yo to 62yo, everyone had great time. Have been to better and worse. Only reason I did not mark excellent was one more restraunt would have been nice, but hey we did not go hungry. Always something on buffet, went to italian two times and enjoyed it. great pizzas and burgers at snack bar. Beach was awesome and pools were clean and just the right temp. Room was good, bed was better than alot of 5 star places we have stayed, some on our group said their bed was not as good as mine, but I was happy. Maid did a great job and the wait staff was friendly. I am a firm believer that if you are nice and outgoing they will be too! Isedro (drink waiter at the snack bar) was awesome! He would even hunt us down if we were at the pool and bring us drinks. And believe me he made plenty of trips! If you have this placed booked don't worry, it is fine. I was really worried after reading past post.

Reviews.Title: “great week at the reef”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: had a wonderfull week at the reef club,will probably go back next year. food is good,rooms were good,how much time do you spend in them,beach was about the best i ahve seen in mexico. very nice hotel not as crowded as some,staff was ok.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, cozy resort”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Visited the Reef Playacar for 1 week - Sept 18 to Sept 25. First of all.... DON'T use TNT Vacations!!!! They are a huge rip off, we were charged $50 per person for fuel as soon as we got to the airport (not a nice way to start your vacation) and get you to your destination 3 hours late with no compensation! All inclusive means ALL INCLUSIVE and you should not have to be surprised with a $50 fuel charge and what is supposed to be a straight flight to Cancun should not turn into a flight that stops in florida for an hour! Anyway on to the resort....After reading a lot of the reviews before going, my boyfriend and I were a little worried but once we got to the Reef, saw the resort, the room, the beach, the atmosphere, we knew that these people who complained just had a bad experience or wanted to stay at Donald Trumps Suite!!! The Reef is a 200 room resort and is very cozy, romantic and beautiful. It is set in a jungle theme, so in between the buildings as you walk, it's just beautiful greenery. Our room was on the 2nd floor closer to the beach/pool, there was NO musty smell so I didn't have to spray the room etc. The room is very clean, once in a while we saw little ants but it's Mexico and you're in a jungle... helllooo!!! the bed is a little firm but it comes in handy for your back after all of the day's activities! The maids cleaned the room everyday, we did tip a $1/$2 every other day... they work very hard and deserve it! they cleaned the rooms and outside the rooms so thoroughly in that hot weather!! The pools aren't that great, that would be my huge complaint but my boyfriend and I are "beach people" and didn't go in the pool more than 2 times and the beach more than makes up for it. IT IS BEAUTIFUL!!!! clear aquamarine warm water, just wonderful. A couple of days the waves got big and we got boogie boards and had so much fun riding the waves!! and there are fish that swim by which is so nice!! they don't bother anyone, if you are like my boyfriend and i and love to snorkel and see the fish, swim out to the bags in the beach to the left and take some bread with you and you will see the prettiest fish!! it's just amazing. Walk along the beach, it's nice. There are nasty women on the beach who decide to expose their breasts to everyone - they have no respect for themselves, their husband/significant other has no respect for them and they especially don't have respect for the kids around... i mean come on... any way, to each it's own! and the men next to the resort working on houses/condos have a ball gazing at them.. ha! Yes there are rude, loud and drunk Europeans and Italians. We dare not try to attempt to go into the pool bar, was very small and filled of drunk people of course. The food isn't that great but we never went hungry as a lot of people say. There is always something for you to eat at the buffet, the food at the italian restaurant is okay. On Wednesday night, the buffet had "Mexican night" and the food was great. We had our favorite waiter who took care of us at breakfast and lunch - his name is NERY, he is very nice, very humble and attended to us as soon as he saw us... there was also Sergio who was nice. we tipped them because we wanted to and because they deserved it. Definitely go into town, it's about a 20 mins walk or 5 min ride in a cab which cost $4. the resort also had bikes, so we used them one day and it was a nice ride into town and back to the resort. Bargain bargain bargain your life away in town. Never accept the first price. We bought tours to Tulum and Xel-ha in town which was cheaper than buying it at the resort. But next time, we will hire a cab to take us there, Tulum was only $3 per person to get in and I'm not sure how much Xel-ha was but i'm sure it would work out cheaper if you do it on your own. Xel-ha is beautiful, it's all inclusive, take money to leave as deposits for snorkel gear, towels, tube etc. they give the $ back to you when you return it. Great restaurants, it's an "all day" thing. Well email if you have any questions. Marja at the Reef Playacar is wonderful. Everyone there is very friendly. The beach is gorgeous, the weather is beautiful, it only rained at night and when we were leaving which made us feel better :o)

Reviews.Title: “No expectations, no regrets.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I always go on vacation with no expectations at all so that we won't be dissapointed. If you go to the Reef Club with high expectations, you will be dissapointed. We had a wonderful time. The food was not so great and we ended up eating in town for dinner, which suited us because we like to walk. I have mixed feelings about the staff. Some were nice, and some seemed a bit put off by questions. The beach was great. We took walks down the rest of the beach and noticed that the waves were much higher further down. The rooms were clean and comfortable. We stayed on the last floor and didn't have as much of the musty smell that most of the reviews share. The entertainment left a lot to be desired, so that is another reason to go to town in the evening. Also, don't waste your money on any of the excursions provided by the hotel. You can find more affordable trips at private travel agencies in town.

Reviews.Title: “The Great Escape”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have been vacationing at the Reef Playacar for five (5) years now. We have gotten to know the staff very well and they are all wonderful. The things I read about Jesus the bartender are all true. He is a great bartender, and very accommodating. I cannot believe the bad reviews I have read about the food. Those people must be the pickiest eaters ever. There is always something on the buffet that someone likes. If you go away hungry, it's your own fault. As far as the italian restaurant is concerned, we think it is excellent. The service is great and so is ALL of the staff. Also as far as the desserts go, at the buffet they are pretty good. You have to remember, they are not American desserts!!! At the italian restaurant, I have my favorites that I order on different nights that we eat upstairs. We think that the Reef Playacar is awesome! I doubt that we would keep returning (along with a couple from Chicago, Florida and Scotland) every year for five consecutive years. If you want gourmet, and more American type food, either stay home, or go to one of the more expensive, crowded resorts.

Reviews.Title: “JUNGLE PARADISE”
Reviews.Author: rxlexie
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed 1 night at the reef playacar as we were originally booked for their sister property at reef coco beach...however since coco beach was over booked we spent 1 night at the reef playacar. I have no negative complaints to make about the resort except for the fact that there are no mini refrigerators in the room which was important for us to keep our daughters milk in there. Also, the snack bar was not all that wonderful as the one at coco beach! But after being to both properties I would recommend the reef coco beach... they were both equally nice just depends on what your looking for and what your needs are. The Reef Playacar was more of a JUNGLE setting and the BELL BOY told us to watch for the ANACONDA on the way to our room and my son looked at us with this frightened look on his face because it does look like an anaconda type of setting. WATCH out for all the europeans they are truly abnoxious and I thought the americans were bad after going to Cancun but they ain't got nothing on the ITALIANS!! However, the staff is wonderful. Keep some dollar bills and give out as tips they surely appreciate it. If anyone needs any other info do not hesitate to e-mail me. Maria

Reviews.Title: “Must Read Before Booking”
Reviews.Author: mwhesq
Reviews.Content: Visited the Reef Playacar from 9/6/04-9/10/04. I generally enjoyed my stay at the Reef with my wife and two children (ages 4 and 2). The beach is beautiful, although the surf was rough, probably b/c of nearby Hurricanes Frances and Ivan. The property itself is beautifully maintained. You will always see employees cleaning, manicuring the gardens, sweeping the beach areas, pool areas, etc. So you don't have to worry about cleanliness or resort appeal. However, the rooms left a little to be desired, though they were perfectly utilitarian. They are smaller than they appeared in the online pictures; and the quality of the furnishings/fixtures as, at best, average. Nonetheless, the rooms were clean, notwithstanding our housekeeping service, which came only twice in 5 days. Also, if you are looking for a soft cushy bed, go somewhere else. The beds are extra firm as many others have commented and my back remains a little sore 3 days after my return to the U.S. The one or two barely noticeable ants that I saw the entire week could not bother even the most squeemish traveler. The geckos greating you every night OUTSIDE of your room, however, might shock or annoy some; although they are terrified of humans and would squander out of sight at the first hand clap. Really not a big deal and you definately get used to it after the first night. As for the food.........TERRIBLE. While it is true that you won't starve, it is equally true that you cannot (and will not) enjoy any meal from start to finish. For breakfast, I stuck with having some miniature croissants and jelly; lunch was a burger from the poolside bar and dinner was whatever was edible, like the rice. Any cheese I tried (even the cheese on the pizza) was ATROCIOUS. I stayed away from the "ethnic" dishes entirely as they were not good at all (I'm not suggesting Mexican food is bad; in fact, it's quite delicious if you go to a restaurant like I did when I went to Cancun 6 years ago....great food!). As for Botticelli's (the non-buffet "classy restaurant" at the resort), it is no great shakes, but the atmosphere is beautiful and the food marginally better than the buffet. Nightly entertainment was offered for children and adults alike at the "Jolla". I found it pleasant and a nice end to a relaxing day at the beach and pool. Do NOT expect Las Vegas-type entertainment. Keep your expectations reasonable! The tourists at the resort were wonderful, and I was pleasantly surprised that the Europeans were very friendly to everyone, even the Americans (I had encountered incredible anti-American sentiment in my previous travels to Europe). Some women do go to the beach and pools topless, so stay in the U.S. if that bothers you. If you keep your expectations reasonable, you will enjoy yourself. If you're looking for Ritz Carlton-type luxury, go elsewhere. P.S. I didn't find the employees to be "wonderful" as many have said. They were, however, generally courteous and very hard-working; but there were a couple of times where even a polite request for a soft drink or a refill was made to seem like an imposition (but I must emphasize that this happened once or twice out of the hundred or so requests).

Reviews.Title: “We'll be back”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: 8-29-2004 to 9-4-2004 Room was great (3rd floor), beach was beautiful, staff went above and beyond, loved all of the guests especially the international ones that were not afraid to discuss the world/politics and the food well .... We did talk to the chefs and for a couple of days the food was good. They actually love the feed back and are more than willing to change the menu and make it more eatable for the americans. (it is european cuisine). Isodor the beach waiter (tip him at the begining of the week and trade off english for spanish words and he will treat you right), Herme & Nery in the dining room were very attentive to our needs and always there with whatever we needed before we had to ask. Avoid the 1st floor rooms they are moldy (especially rm 814), watch that first step getting into the ocean (it slops and big drop off). You must go to 5th Avenue and walk the whole street. If you do not you will miss some fantastics shops at the bottom of the street. For great dining go to Freda's and try a Mohita at the cuban bar. It's like a mint julip but without bourban and made with cuban rum-delicious! The best advise we can give you about the reef club is don't be afraid to approach the management staff or chefs with suggestions or changes - Because if you don't ask, all you will here is a bunch of negative comments. The other thing to remember is that Americans are the minority of travelers to Playacar about 93% are Europeans. Keep your mind open and enjoy the beauty of the surroundings :)

Reviews.Title: “Awesome”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This was some cool ****, but a little boring in de nighttime. Go to the Mambo Club in Playa del Carmen. Only one bad comment; The guys at the lobby will post your postcard 3 weeks after you arrived at home

Reviews.Title: “Great Time Hope to Be Back”
Reviews.Author: TX5428
Reviews.Content: We arrived(June 5 2004) at our Hotel, to be greeted by a friendly staff, taken immediately to our room. Six of us girls went and all rooms were plain, but clean. (Read the notices left in your room, the bottled water left there has a charge). The beach and pool areas are some of the best I have been to, everything is laid out well, bars are open at various times, so is the food. You can eat from about 6 am til after midnight somewhere in the complex, and drink from about 11 am til 2 am. We all felt like we got more than our moneys worth on this deal. Plan to go back next year and stay longer. To other females who travel alone, we felt safe here,never had a moment of worry. I used several of the suggestions that I read and they made my trip. Take a small solid air refresher for musty smell (you are in the jungle) Pay the money and rent the safe in your room Take an insulated mug with lid for your drinks We had a worry free, sun and fun filled vacation for a small price, in a lovely resort, with a friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Nice beach, horrible food”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Reef Club for our honeymoon. We were debating between Mexico and Hawaii. I think I'll go to Hawaii next time. The beaches were absolutely gorgeous as was the scenery. The food was awful! (I recommend Boticelli's restaraunt that you need to make reservations for.) The staff wasn't very helpful and there aren't many who speak english. It was a romantic setting, but I would suggest going to another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A Good Value”
Reviews.Author: tcrb04a
Reviews.Content: We stayed a week at the Reef Playacar, July 3rd thru 10th. I thought the hotel was a very good value. The only thing I would have changed is to go in March or April, not July. Summer in Playa is Hot and Humid - heat index of 110 - 115. April is warm but with much lower humidity. Last year, we went to Cancun in April but not all-inclusive. This was our first stay at an all-inclusive. I will never go any other way. The Italian restaurant was excellent. We ate there 4 times. You just have to get up before 8 to make a reservation. The buffet was good, not great, but there was a always a very wide variety of selections. The grounds and beach are beautiful. Rooms are great. I brought a mug but the glasses are big enough. You just ask for 2 drinks at a time. We went to Xal Ha and Tulum, Coba and Mayan Village, Xceret. Enjoyed all of them. If you book your trip to Xceret at the hotel, they pick you up at 8:30 or so, and you return after the night show at 9:30. But, they bring you back to the hotel in the afternoon so you can eat. Xel Ha is all-inclusive, excellent meals, excellent scuba. One day we walked to town, took the ferry to Cozumel, rented a car and drove around the island. When you get off the ferry, there are guys offering deals on cars ($40) and mo-peds($25). We stopped at the Reef Club Cozumel for a free lunch at the snack bar. It is set up very simular to the Reef Playacar. Just go in and get a pizza or order a hamburger or hot dog. Some of their wrist-bands are also blue so don't worry about it. Have a great time, just don't go in the summer unless you are from Phoenix!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Reef Aug. 4-7. Since I'd read the reviews my expectations were not super high, therefore we were not let down. It was crowded, the pool with swim up bar tended to be louder and more crowded in the early evening due to the bar being the only one available at that time. The buffet restaurant was also crowded, it was difficult to find a table that was clean and ready at certain times, and the service was hit and miss, we did not tip as we did not feel we received service that went above and beyond what was included. Food was plentiful, but did seem to be repetitous- no one in our family got sick. We did enjoy the Italian restaurant "Boticelli's", it was quieter, the service was attentive and food was pretty good. The kicker is that you must make your reservation at 7:00 a.m. the day you would like to have dinner, we liked it so much better that we ate there twice and enjoyed it very much. The beach was beautiful, despite those wearing speedos who shouldn't have (all of them), and the topless women. We would have skipped the trip to Xel-Ha to snorkel as it was very crowded and there were few fish to be found, more like a theme park, wish we'd spent the whole day at Tulum on the beach. We did do the snorkel tour from the Reef dive shop for $30, you go to the reef and it is worth it! My 17 year old son was disappointed to find that you cannot do the wind surfing unless you take a lesson, my 3 teenagers did enjoy the kayaks, but the waves were not big enough for decent boogie boarding because they break when they are already on shore. The rooms were fine, baths were nice, and they were cleaned well despite the fact that we did not leave a tip until the end of our stay (because we felt they had earned a little extra). Do put the do not disturb sign out if you plan to sleep past 8 a.m. All in all we had a good trip, we would like to try another place, but would not be opposed to staying at the Reef again if the price is right!

Reviews.Title: “Won't Be Back!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Well, I will have to start with; that a bad day on the beaches of Mexico beats a great day at work. However! I was not overly impressed with the Reef Club. Prior to my stay at the Reef Club I had only stayed in 5 star resorts in Mexico. As far as the rooms are concerned, I believe Mexico's 5 star resorts to be equivalent to America's Motel 6. To start out, our air conditioner would not cool our room off. To top that it was leaking all night. We had a trash can and several glasses collecting water. I will have to admit that when I called maintenance, they were very prompt in repairing the leak. It still didn't cool very well. The walls and doors are paper thin and the four nights we were there I was never able to sleep through the night without being woke up several times. Talk about irritating. The staff was hit and miss. Some were very pleasant and helpful but more seemed to be indifferent to our presence there. The bar literally SUCKED!!! If you like to drink, this is not the place for you!!! There was very little assortment in choices of beverages. I know we were in Mexico but you would think the amount of Americans through there they would stock their bars a little better. If you are a Crown drinker like myself, you are out of luck at this place. I could count the number of bottles at the bar on both of my hands. It was not easy getting drinks either. The bars were understaffed 98% of the time. The food was typical Mexico. It seemed the same to me as the five star foods. Mexico foods seem very bland to me. With the exception of the Italian restraunt, my wife hated the food. She did like the Italian though. The beach was very nice. It was clean and I have to concur on the number of topless women there. I was kinda suprised at a family hotel that they would allow it. I know myself and my boys didn't mind though! All in all, it wasn't a horrible experience but I think I will stick with the 5 star resorts in the future. If you get the chance while in Playa, go to the ALUX restruant. It is in a cavern and I was very impressed with the food. If you wish to correspond for more info, drop me an email. nuriman@aol.com WR

Reviews.Title: “Better than we expected except for...”
Reviews.Author: eeewelch
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Reef Club for our honeymoon and had a blast. We had only a couple problems but other than that I didn't see any of the terrible things people wrote about this hotel. The staff was very friendly, they gave us free t-shirts, the rooms we very clean and the food was great. The Italian resturant was excellent with the best tomato soup in the world!! The swim up bar was awesome, Orlando was our favorite waiter. My husband was very impressed that many women laid out topless too. All the staff was great even before we tipped them. My only problem with the hotel was when we checked out they tried to charge us for the 4 bottes water the maids put in our room that we didn't drink!! Also the people running the excursions were very deceptive. We said we just wanted to go to the closest ruin and come back, no long trips. Well they put us on a trip to Chiceniza (misspelled), 4 hours just to get there and it was one of the most expensive excursions. It wasn't until the next day we learned about the ruins only 45 mins away. Other than that we had a great time and met many great people from all over the world. We are even talking about going back for our 1 year anniversary, just avoiding the excursion booth.

Reviews.Title: “Happy Times”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Reef Club July 26-31, 2004. Overall very happy with the trip. Numerous pluses and a few negatives. Staff- Very courteous and helpful. Our phone died and before we even got back from the front desk, the repair man was already there. the maid service was very good and unassuming when it came to tips, even though they got them. Everytime I turned around there was somebody there if you needed any help, such as finding your room. Food- Only ate at the buffet and i thought it was very good. I'm a very picky eater and had no problems filling up. Did not get sick at all. Room- We were on the first floor close to the pool and there was a strong mold/mildew odor the entire time. Otherwise nice room, no problems with plumbing. Hollow doors let a lot of noise through. Entertainment- Its not world class but the "animation team" works there behinds off every day and night trying to make it fun and they do it with little in return. I applaud them all. The grounds were beutiful and every time you looked someone was scrubbing the walks to keep them clean. A couple pieces of advice...Bring deoderizer for your room. If your like me and don't wear a watch, bring a clock of some sort with you. No clocks to be found anywhere (which is not all that bad). The biggest problem I had was the swim up bar, overcrowded with unsupervised kids who would dump their drinks into the pool. Also lots of Bees by that bar and the one by the snack stand. All in all had a great time, I reccomend it especially to people not wanting a huge party scene but not wanting a stuffy, snobby type place.

Reviews.Title: “The best !”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I along ,with 2 other couples, were guests at the Reef from July 12-16th. I was just a little worried after reading some of the negative reviews. However, we were quickly reassured that we had made a wonderful choice. The beach was breathtaking the water was refreshing but not cold. The rooms were clean, cleaner than most hotels in the US. The buffet food wasn't bad, I certainly didn't go hungry. Breakfast was definitly the best, the omelets are out of this world ! The Italian restauraunt was great (make your reservations early in the morning) the service was a little slow, but they kept our drinks refilled without asking (a little to re-filled !!). Do bring your own insulated mug for the beach. We had a wonderful guy named Isodora (sp) who delivered drinks to us while we lounged on the beach. We always tipped him well, and didn't have to make the trek to the bar at all ! We have absolutely no complaints and would go back in a heart beat !

Reviews.Title: “Avoid”
Reviews.Author: pal90
Reviews.Content: Had the misfortune to be placed here for one night after the Coco Beach was overbooked. The room was basically shabby (the shower head was a very interesting shade of green), something that reflected much of the rest of the hotel. Food in the buffet was poor and the fitness equipment completely broken and rusted. Sure the beach is nice but this doesn't compensate for the rest. One to avoid in my book.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Beach”
Reviews.Author: islandblues
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Reef Club July 14th to the 21st. The grounds are very pretty. The beach is awesome, Some of the pictures we took look like postcards.. Rooms are nice we tipped everyday and never had any towel art :( We tipped all over and it did not improve the service. The staff was ok, Jesus was the best bartender very nice guy, they all worked very hard, but he was the best !! Food was ok after-all your in Mexico, If you can't find something to eat you have a real problem. This hotel has alot of family's with small children the pool with the swim-up bar should be for adults only because the small kids were a pain. They also need a disco or something more for teenagers to do. All in all we had a good time but probally would not return.

Reviews.Title: “Reef Club Staff was very impressive”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just returned from staying at the Reef from July 11th to July 17th. The grounds are lovely, the cenote and paths above and around it create a sense of jungle seclusion. The beach is magnificent, large, clean...wonderful. The two pools were never crowded, although I must say the poor bartendars at the swim up bar are kept very busy and could use some more help. I was dissappointed with the water activities staff. SOME of them were less than interested in helping and more concerned with getting their stuff returned in an hour (or they'll charge you $$$). I liked the Italian restaurant, but service is very slow. It took us nearly two hours to complete a meal. Mostly waiting for the next course...while surviving on a few crusts of bread. But, the food was excellent. One does have to reserve early for the restaurant as it is the only TRUE restaurant at the resort...and it books up fast. The buffet was decent but the food was pretty much the same thing every night. Not one of the eight of us ever felt ill. Our room was acceptable, and was always cleaned well. We found towel animals on our bed everyday, but most were wild and would run before we could pet them. The shows....forget it. Seriously, they were BAD, only a Texan could find entertainment value at all (joking, friend). I'm giving the place four stars due to the efforts of most of the staff. The people at the bottom are doing their jobs well, and were friendly and seemed genuinely interested in making our stay a nice one (other than the water activities shack). Management, I'd suggest, should look at the shows they put on, the people getting turned away from the Itialian restaurant while others sit too long for a meal, and make some changes. I'm giving the troops in the trenches, and the resort grounds and beach, four stars...not the management. By the way, bring your own towels and lock the "towel cards" away...it's $35.00 US if you lose a towel OR a towel card.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Returned from the property on July 14th. We went with 27 other friends and all in all had a good time for what we paid. Pluses: beautiful beach/water, bar close to the beach, lots of chairs/shade covers, adequate equipment to use (kayaks, sailboats, etc). Both pools were decent sized, grounds were very jungle like and well kept, the buildings seemed to be just an extension of the jungle although the property is only about 60 yards wide. Bar service was usually quick. Staff was friendly and tolerant of kids. Minuses: food was very average, Italian restaurant was not good at all and it took over 2 1/2 hours! The buffet food area & seating area is not airconditioned and always hot. Rooms are small & beds are full size (not queen), Talent shows were so corny/cheesy they were funny! In the evening the pool bar was usually full of loud drunks. I got the stomach bug the 2nd day and I think it was from drinking the tap water in the room. All other water (at restaurants/bars) is poured from large purified water bottles so it's supposedly safe. They give you bottled water (10 pesos) in your room for a reason...

Reviews.Title: “Awesome. June 23-30, 2004”
Reviews.Author: berenator
Reviews.Content: First time going and after reading a lot of 'bad' reviews, I was a bit worried. However, I have nothing but great things to say about the hotel. Food: Great buffet restaurant. Okay Italian food. I thought the buffett was much better than the italian restaurant. Service was great all the time at both places. Good variety every time. However, if you want to try Mayan food, try "el pez velez" i think it's named. It's on 5th avenue. Drinks: Bring your own mug unless you want to refill every 3rd sip. Hotel: Beautiful, beautiful. Always had hot water. Clean sheets (although I returned with a rash) and great personnel. We left a tip every day. We also tipped the waiting staff every now and then. They work so hard and are so great about it. Especially Feliciano at the pool bar. Guests: Around the pool area some guests, especially those with little kids, seemed to think they were the only guests in the hotel and tended to be loud and obnoxious. But there was always the beach to go to if you wanted some quiet time. Beautiful beach, great food and drinks and excellent service. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “The Reef Club is family and friend reccomended!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Reef Club in playacar this past June and I had the most amazing time of my life. I went with three girl friends of mine all of us under the age of 21. We felt safe and we had 7 full days of non stop fun thanks to the unbelievable waitstaff and entertainment staff. I'll be back there next June!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Reef Club”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have to admit that all those negative reviews did worry me a bit.....but happy to report that I had the best experience at the Reef. We were a group of 16 with 8 children from ages 9 mos to 15 years of age.....and they all had a great time. The kids did not want to leave the pool area at all, so it was hard pulling them away to do the sightseeing stuff. I stayed at the Fiesta Americana Grand Coral Beach in Cancun last year, which is a 5 diamond hotel....it is a beautiful place but I have to say that we enjoyed and had way more fun at the Reef then we did at this super expensive resort last year. We had the same waiters at the restaurant everyday and they were extremely nice and accomodating people, imagine having a table ready for 16 people all the time?? which they did in a matter of seconds....we were sad that we didn't say our goodbyes to Neri, one of our waiters in the evenings......we hope that he did get our thank you envelope??? he always had a smile on his face....Martin in the mornings was great too. They really go out of their way for you!!!! We went to the Italian restaurant once and that was good too, but like many people have noted, we had no problem finding good stuff to eat at the buffet restaurant. They have themed nights so their menu does change.....Mexican Fiesta night, with Mariachi and all sorts of Mexican dishes, Caribbean night , Gala night...etc. Our room was close to the pool, the higher the number the closer you are to the beach/pool. We had no problem with anything negative that has been written about the rooms.....there was definitely no bad smell, the water did smell weird the first day but it went away, we always had hot water, which I think I'm the only one that used it in my group, everybody wanted cool water. We were in room 0922 and it seemed to be slightly bigger than the other rooms our friends had, but they had no complaints either..... The people at the reception desk were very helpful to us. I called them the morning of the day were checking in and requested a room close to the beach and on the second floor and when we got there....everything was ready for all of us with rooms in the first and second villas close to the pool.....Thank you Vianey!!!. The pictures on their website are not an exageration of the beauty of the hotel, I actually think it was more beautiful than it is portrayed..... For those of you going there.....don't worry, you will have a great time, have an open mind and just relax and like other people have said, treat the people that work there with respect and they will give you more in return. As for places to visit, this was my third vacation to the Cancun area and I will definittely return to that area soon. I had seen most of the tourist attractions already but Isla Mujeres was our most enjoyable trip..... We also spent a few days in Merida, which I highly highly recommend. We went swimming to a Cenote and my 8 year old son says that is was the highlight of his trip along with the Captain Hook cruise that they have in Cancun..... SO....ENJOY!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great budget all-inclusive”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Reef Club from June 21st thru June 28th and for the most part enjoyed our stay very much. The grounds are very unique with lots of lush vegitation and beautiful night lighting. We were very impressed by how hard the staff worked at keeping the resort clean and well maintained, and by how pleasant and curtious all of the staff members were. The pool bartenders worked extremely hard (Feliciano & Herme) and did a great job getting our drinks to us quickly (uno mas Rum Runner por favor!). Definitely bring your own mugs. The only negatives were: 1.) For the first 4 nights we were unfortunate enough to be staying in the same building as a group of young 20 somethings from the Boston area who were extremely loud and disrespectful at night (early mornings) on their way back to their rooms from nights out on the town. 2.) A foul, sulphur smell from the water out of our shower and sink on at least half the days we were there. 3.) A disappointing night at the Italian restaurant where they were obviously short handed and we waited quite a long time just to get our order taken. The food was good (better than the buffet) but not extraordinary. The other nights we ate there the service was much better. Other than those minor issues we had a great time and would recommend this resort to anybody who wants to have a wonderful time at an inexpensive all-inclusive, who's not expecting luxury accomodations or gourmet food. One last note in rebuttal to the review from Boulder CO on June 30th. My wife and I are experienced divers as well (my wife being a PADI Divemaster) and although we witnessed the morning SCUBA demos, we could never actually hear everything the instructor was saying but I find it very hard to believe that Van (the morning dive instructor) would try to "entice novices out on the water" without proper training and supervision strictly for money's sake. And to say he is "very clearly not a safe instructor" is outrageous (bordering on defamation of character). Those comments could only come from someone who never actually dove with Van. Because if they did (as we did on 2 wonderful dives, Mama Vina wreck & Tortugas) they would quickly realize that although Van is a very "gung-ho" & enthusiastic instructor who loves his job, he is also extremely safety conscious, well prepared, and provided us a very in-depth and detailed pre-dive briefing before we left. I would have no problems recommending the very knowledgeable and professional staff at the Reef Club dive shop. (thanks for all your help Van, Alex, and Margaret!) P.S. Don't miss the incredibly beautiful Cenote dives either. They were fantastic!

Reviews.Title: “What a terrific vacation and anniversary!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Were we sceptical? Yes. After reading all of those bad reviews, I had nightmares for weeks prior to our stay. Did any of them come true? No! We were there the week of the June 27th thru July 1. Not long enough. From the moment we arrived at the hotel, things were top notch. We were greeted nicely. We got a wonderful room. We were in room 1013, right next to the pool area and food places. Great view. The entire resort was placed amongst a jungle atmosphere. Everywhere you walked, you were surrounded by jungle plants and animals. If anyone sees that funny looking little creature that's a cross between a rat, rabbit or whatever, let us know what it is. Iguanas too. We got our picture made with them. Don't miss out on that! The beds were firm, but not too hard. We had taken our own pillows, but found no real need for them. We actually left one behind. Room freshener, we took it too, not needed. Always had hot water for the shower. We took two per day. We never wanted for anything in the room. We did leave a couple of dollars on the bed for the maid a couple of times. We got a towel animal made by one of the guys. It was our anniversary and we got a nice note left in our room also. Even though it was only our 3rd anniversay, the note stated we had been married for 10. So what. It was comical. Truly, the thought is what mattered. The food was adequate. You must let Rori fix you an omelet for breakfast. Yum! We ate at Bonicelli's once. It was nice. The snack bar had good food too. The drinks? Well, let me put it to you this way, some were heavy on the alcohol, some weren't. Nevertheless, I believe there are times during the past few days, I still can't remember things. What does that tell you? Believe me, take a nice big insulated mug! They WILL fill it and do it kindly. They seemed to like them. We got a lot of comments about them. We were surprised though to not see others with this idea. Their glasses are about 6 ounces. That's ok if you don't drink much. We had 32 oz. mugs. There were 4 of us. None of us went thirsty, for anything! These guys work very hard day and night. You see them taking care of the grounds from dawn till dusk. When you see all of the jungle greens, you'll know why. They scrub the walkway down too. You've always got a great view as you walk around. You definitely know you're in Mexico. It's the real "enchilada". Bugs? Oh we saw a few itty bitty ants in the room, but hey, I felt at home. Nothing else. Be prepared for not getting american money back in change. They say they don't have it. So you end up with a lot of pesos. This was practically everywhere we went, even off the resort property. We made sure towards the end of the trip to pay as much as possible with pesos, and exact change. It's ok to come home with a small bit for a souvenier, but not a lot. We met many people from all over. Nice people. Never had any issues with loud, obnoxious guests. The beach is the most beautiful ever. You get great views from the top of the bar and restaurant. Take advantage of the moon at night. The weather was perfect the entire week. Warm, sunny and clear skies. If you don't know how to sail, you need to take a lesson and go out. It is awesome. That's part of what you're paying for anyway. I'm aware that resorts have their moments. There may be problems at times with things, but that's life. Believe me, I was looking for all of those bad things I'd read about. I was waiting for "bad" to happen, it just didn't. I'm not the most picky person in the world, but I did expect the necessities and got way more. You'll have a great time at the Reef. We would go back and would for sure recommend this highly!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Reef Club!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful time at the Reef Club. We were there for 10 days, June 17-27. Strictly speaking, this is a 4 star hotel, but we marked 5 stars because we had a 5 star experience. We’ve traveled to places such as the Maui Four Seasons and the Maui Fairmont Kea Lani, where we vacationed like rock stars, but we had every bit as much a good time at the Reef Club at a fraction of the price. The all-inclusive feature removed a lot of stress from our vacation. We are a family of four, with 2 children, ages 4 and 9. The rooms were basic, but clean and nice. The staff was responsive…we only had 2 towels in our room at first, but after we asked for 4, we got what we asked for. Our room didn’t smell musty at all; in fact housekeeping had placed a room deodorizer in the room, and we asked for them to stop leaving it in. I suspect that the management had read the reviews, and was trying to be responsive to the Internet complaints about smell. The beds are very firm, even with the foam “egg-crate” on top of the mattress. The staff worked so hard, and I thought that they were very nice. Feliciano was great at the pool bar and Pedro also at the bar next to the snack area. The entertainment staff members at the pool (step- and water-aerobics, water volleyball and polo, etc.) were excellent, fun, and enthusiastic. We liked the food. It was very typical of the food you might get in a nice upper class Mexican household, but for those who expect tacos, burritos and enchiladas, it might not have been as expected. As you can imagine, in Mexico families don’t eat burritos and enchiladas every night. The salsas at the snack bar and main restaurant were excellent. The snack bar was great for those hanging out at the pool. Boticelli’s should be experienced for the change of pace from the dinner buffet fare. The first few days we were there, a group of young men from Merida (about 4 hours inland from Playa) were at the hotel, celebrating their high school graduation. They were nice boys, and it was fun to see them celebrate. We found them to be perfect gentlemen who made a genuine friendship with our son. Although some had rooms adjacent to ours, we did not begrudge them their good time. One of the reviewers mentioned that the upper pool might have been warmer because of the people at the bar. The truth is that the pool is overall shallower than the sports pool, which is why it was warmer (heats up faster). Two broad areas of the upper pool were only a few inches deep (for sunning while in the water) and the upper pool was connected to the “hot tub” (by shape only) and kids pool section. It was a pleasure to see such a diverse cultural mixture. I would say that greater than 50% of the guests were European and Mexican, and we heard so many languages spoken. What is vacation for but to meet new people with diverse experiences and cultures. We made friendships with folks from Holland and the UK. If you don’t want to be exposed to different cultures and customs, then you shouldn’t travel internationally. Even as a US mom, I wasn’t offended by any of the European topless sunbathers. It was nice to have the opportunity to talk with my children about the practices of different cultures. On a serious note, we caution against anyone trying scuba diving without a fully sanctioned course (NAUI or PADI). As a common practice at many beach resorts, the morning scuba demonstrations at the pool are safe, but are being used to entice novices out on the water for underwater experiences and “resort certifications” (at cost) for their first time. As VERY experienced divers (my husband is a research diver of over 20 years), this is an extremely dangerous practice and the gung-ho instructor is very clearly not a safe instructor. If you want to dive, do yourself a favor and earn your certification through a PADI or NAUI course in your area before hitting the tropics. Your check-out dives can be done safely in Mexico, but I would not recommend the dive shop at the Reef Club (by affiliation only). We loved the Reef Club, and will always remember the wonderful family time that we had.

Reviews.Title: “Great anniversary trip!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the reef June 17-21. We had a great time during our stay. We were concerned with the mixed reviews we had read on this site until we arrived. The only reason I did not rate the reef as excellent was that the food was not great. It was adequate and I did not starve. I like my food to be seasoned more, but hey, it was Mexico. Maybe their culture does not season their food as much as Americans do. The Italian restaurant was great. Everything else outweighs the food. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful. The people are such hard workers. They were constantly working. I did not see one person taking a break or standing around. The grounds were spectacular. Damian and the entire activity staff kept us entertained the whole time. The shows were good and the games were fun. We played beach volleyball two days. The competition was fierce. The beach was beautiful. I have never seen water that beautiful. I took pictures that could be used as postcards. Jorge and Tony arranged our snorkeling trip and kept us up to date on pickup times. They both were very nice and helpful. Tony even arranged a limo ride back to the airport. This trip was well worth the money. After talking to others who had stayed at other resorts, we agreed that this resort is a great value. We want to take our kids next time.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome time, when can I go back?”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: What a awesome trip we had. The 4 of us, 2 adults and 2 kids ages 15 and 11 all had a blast. Everyone working there was very nice especially Jesus @ the swim up bar!!! The food was great even for the picky eater of our family! The service could not have been better except maybe at breakfast. Do try to take insulated mugs for drinks, at the bars they are very small glasses, but we did not have trouble getting served especially when we tipped. We were not ready to come home after 5 days we would have stayed another few days if we could have arranged it. I would definetly like to go back there. Lots of others we knew at different hotels had a terrible time and paid a lot more for their hotel stays. While we were the the money exchange was 11 to 1 and don't take big bills, all money you get back at the hotel desk is in pesos. No American money is available at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A mixed bag”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Spent the week of June 12-19 at the Reef with my husband, 12 yr old daughter and 8 yr old son. VERY HOT AND HUMID. This was our first "all inclusive" experience. Overall, we enjoyed ourselves but would not return. Nice grounds, facilities, and rooms, pleasant and hard working staff, ...beautiful beach. The drawbacks are the mediocre food (you get what you pay for) and unfortunately the GUESTS. In response to earlier reviews: 1) the smell is that of mexico and you get used to it, so leave the air freshener home; 2) no you don't need to bring your own pillow, the beds and pillows are quite comfortable; 3) there were no bugs (not even mosquitoes); leave home the thermal mug...unless you are one of those who "supersizes it"; and 4)You get what you pay for... or...spend a little more somewhere else. In hindsight, I now interpret this to mean that a good value, particularly one with unlimited drinks, attracts undesireable guests. The swim up (or belly up) bar and pool was full of lowlife drunks who drank all day and never left pool (It's no surprise that this pool was significantly "warmer" than the sports pool). The europeans smoked liked chimneys and exposed their sagging breasts and bums. And if only the parents of the highschool graduates knew what their kids were up to! If I were to do it over again, I think I would take my family to Xpu Ha Palace.

Reviews.Title: “Reef blub not bad”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Reef Club I'd have to say was a pretty hotel. A rather small hotel but sometimes that can be good. Everything such as the main restaurant, the pool and the beach. Speaking of the main reataurant I'd have to say the buffet was pretty bad. I am picky so some may think its fine. There was not every enough variety but I did stay a week and if i had stayed a shorter amount of time it would have been fine. Breakfast was good though and so was the snack bar. Another thing that was not that great was the entertainment. I saw one show where they got different to do differnt things and play funny games. That was very funny I wish they had done taht more often. The thing that was dreadful was the dance. Pretty cheesy actually though it was kind of funny it was so bad, heh. All and all though it was a fine hotel. Oh yes I forget to mention go to the nice restaurant it starts with a b, it was nice. So, not a bad hotel but maybe stay a shorter amount of time or bring snacks!

Reviews.Title: “All over worth the money”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: May 2004. This hotel was worth the money. I read some of these reviews after booking and was really scared of what my trip would turn out like. THOSE NEGATIVE REVIEWS ARE SOOOOO WRONG! The hotel is above average if your not picky. On the other hand if you want a hotel that is upscale and ritzy looking by american standards, this isn't the place to go. The bathroom was really pretty and the floors are elegant tiles. This is my second ALL Inclusive and it was the best out of the two. The food was good although it doesn't taste like gourmet unless you go to the Italian restaurant. The drinks were good but like on some other reviews I recommend taking a large glass with you, so refills won't have to be soo frequent. Now for the thing that was GREAT. THE BEACH IS AWESOME. The sand is white the water is blue and if you are thinking tropical paradise this hotel is the place to go. This hotel has cool looking hut roofs that really blends with the beachy paradise atmosphere. The room units are beautiful looking from the outside and nice on the inside. There were only 3 ants I saw in the bathroom. Big deal, they were sugar ants and not worth mentioning, except to alieviate your fears of bugs. We had no problem with the beds, pillows, covers, or water. All were up to my standards. And I can be picky!!!. Something you should expect though is the smell of must or like a damp smell. Its not nasty, its just there and you stop smelling it after the intial day of being there. Plus turning on your wondefully cold and fully working airconditioner stops any dampness. My advice to you...... Go to Mexico for beautiful fun in the sun and all the beer/liquor you dare. We did it and it was a good experience. I recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Reef Club Playacar May 28, 2004 through June 2 and had a great time. The resort is not perfect, but we felt it was a great value. We had dinner at Botticelli's (Hi Cesar and Luis!) 4 of the 5 nights we were there and found it to be very good. The buffet was adequate for breakfast and lunch, about what you'd expect at any buffet. Thanks for all of the tips from others who have written. We did take our own cups which was very beneficial since it seemed that the guys (Hi Feliciano!) at the pool bar often ran out of cups. The room was clean and we always had hot water for showering. We signed out bicycles 3 days and used them to get to town. They did try and charge us for bottled water ($2/day) which we did not use, but we simply told them that we didn't use it and the charge was removed from our bill. All-in-all, if you expect royal treatment, you probably should go elsewhere. For the price, we felt the Reef Club was great!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Time at the Reef”
Reviews.Author: Divingrose
Reviews.Content: We stated at the Reef from June 3-June 9. I had read the reviews from the week before we left and was a little apprehensive, but those fears were foundless. The Reef is a beautiful resort with tropical vegetation everywhere, but very manicured. They are working constantly to maintain the scenery. The resort is small, which is nice because you get to meet a lot of the other visitors. The pools were beautiful and the ocean was gorgeous! Our room was always clean and never had a musty smell and didn't see one bug the whole time. The food was fine and plentiful. The fruit was wonderful-so fresh! It wasn't five star dining, but what do you expect. The staff was friendly and helpful. Check in and out took only 2 minutes! We would definately stay here again. We did the Xel-Ha trip and Xcaret trip on our own (we had a rental car). Xcaret was a rip-off. They charged $49 to get in and then EVERYTHING was extra. The lockers were so small you could barely get a backpack in, and they charged you $2 for it. We left after 2 hours because we couldn't get our snorkeling gear into the locker. The place looks wonderful from the brochures, but it isn't once you get there. SAVE your money and go to XEL-HA instead. It was $56 and it includes EVERYTHING!!! Free lockers, towels, snorkeling equipment, FOOD and DRINKS. They had many different restaruants there each with a different menu, and it was ALL FREE! This place is worth your money. The snorkeling was so much better, the whole place is made for snorkeling. At Xcaret the snorkeling place was a little strip that took only 5 minutes to snorkel-that was it. We did a cenote dive with Hidden Worlds and were very pleased with their safety procedures. The guide had double everything and they only took 4 people at a time. I wouldn't do the cenotes with any other company. Didn't see anyone else that had redunant equipment like they did in case of an emergency. It was beautiful. Dove with Playa Scuba in Playa del Carmen. Unless you are experienced, like we are, they are not very concerned about safety. They had some girls on our dive that had only made one other ocean dive. The divemaster never said to indicate when you were down to so much air and even told us that we didn't have to make a safety stop if we didn't want to when the dive was 55-60 feet. It was a drift dive and two of the girls got carried away and the divemaster didn't notice for about 4 minutes and then wanted them to swim against the current to him. Needless to say he had to go after them and bring them back. Very unsafe!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Reef!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I and our 11 and 12 year old daughter and son stayed at the Reef from 5-29 to 6-2. We had an awesome time. When we arrived, our room was warm but we called the office and they quickly came and adjusted the air. Our room was cleaned everyday and our kids especially liked the towel figures they left for us on our beds! There was a good selection of food and none of us went hungry. We felt very comfortable letting our kids run from pool to pool out of our sight for short periods of time. The gulf was red flagged the entire time we were there, but was gorgeous and we still spent a lot of time in it! We visited Xel-Ha and Tulum and thoroughly enjoyed both. We met some incredibly nice people from all over and the staff was wonderful! They were courteous and on the ball. The grounds were beautiful and impecably clean. We will definitely visit The Reef again - only next time we will stay longer!

Reviews.Title: “Very Relaxing- May 30th-June 3rd”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I can't believe I let any of the reviews posted scare me. I did take 1 recommendation seriously- Bring a thermal mug! My brother and I both had one and were the envy of everyone at the bar. They will fill your mug with Dos Equis or any drink of your choice. Everyone at this resort is super friendly and always cleaning. The beach is better than any I have seen and I lived in Florida for half of my life and have been to the Caymans. Very clean and clear blue waters. I highly recommend taking some tours- specifically snorkeling the reef. My only complaints would be the buffet-no seafood or mexican food, and the bars were understaffed-especially the wet bar. Also, the staff keeps away most of the peddlers, they are always on the watch for them and will run them away. I was not approached by one time-share salesperson. If you go into Playa- go to La Parilla. Very good Mexican. I only tipped the bartender occasionally-did not help the slow service, but helped to strengthen the drinks. All of the other people bellyaching about this place are obviously way too high maintenance and should stick to only 5 star hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed the Reef Club. We were there from May 13 thru May 20. The buffet is a buffet. What do you expect? I would go with the omelettes. The salads are all good. I would like to have seen some variety, but on vacation as long as the place is clean; that is what matters. We enjoyed the staff and tipped them for all their hard work. We would go back and next time would use more of the water sports, which are free. I would recommend this place if you and your family are looking for a nice, restful vacation with quality staff and quality food. Don't expect this to be Club-Med.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised by the Reef Club Playacar”
Reviews.Author: terryVDR
Reviews.Content: We had ten days in Mexico and stayed the first four at this resort. It was only listed as two stars by Liberty Travel but since we had other family with us we wanted a not so expensive facility. It is a lovely resort and not too large which was good since we had two older people with us who couldn't walk far. The pool was wonderful and there was shade there and plenty of beach chairs as well as a swim up bar. The beach area was nice as well with plenty of chairs and little nooks with shade. All of the buildings share a center court which you walk down to get to the pool and the restuarant; lovely and shaded. Food was OK with plenty of variety and some Mexican dishes which was nice since the Mexican buffets tend to be Americanized. Their one nice resstuarant was Italian. The food was OK but since we were a table of six with a baby it took a long time for us to be served. Entertainment was enthusiastic but we only went to one show in the four days. There is a very nice bird santuary within walking distance that we enjoyed. There is a little shopping center also within walking distance. I stated that this was above average because it was so much better than what I expected. I would definitely recommend the Reef Club for those on a budget. Terry

Reviews.Title: “Noisy!”
Reviews.Author: FTVS
Reviews.Content: Take heed, if you are European you are going to be substantially outnumbered - this resort caters for the american market. Resort was ok but the volume of the pool activities was intrusive, we were getting up at 6am to grab a sun bed as far away from teh pool noise at poss. Yep it's an early rise here if you want any sunbed action - enjoy walking past all the sunbeds occupied for hours by a solitary towel... The staff were surly at best, but in my opinion the guests generally treated them abomnibably so I suspect it was more a reaction to that. The food was good in my view however this won't get me visiting again.

Reviews.Title: “Was good for the price”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with a friend from May 21-24th. The overall experience was good in my opinion. From the time our plane landed in Cancun we were treated very nice by airport workers as well as the Funjet van drivers. They were always smiling and always made sure we were ok for the 45 minute van ride to the resort. We had to wait around at the van for about an hour before we left the airport though- waiting for other vacation-goers to get there. The hotel staff - at the front desk - called us by name when we approached the desk around 10pm- which was comforting. The resort staff members were so delightful to be around. Two male employees- one from Mexico City and a cute blonde from Canada asked if they could join us for breakfast one morning. My friend and I were not into the activities , but just to relax in the shaded hammocks and swim in the ocean. The swim up bar was great. The bartenders were the best I have encounterd (Feliciano) and kept the refills (frozen amaretto sours) coming without asking!! Now there was the man that fell from the 2nd floor balcony... We saw the railing the next day, and in MY opinion, the staff should have removed the yellow CAUTION tape from the area. It looked more like a crime scene for several days - than just an unfortunate accident. The resort itself was nice- looked like a rainforest inside. I just loved the 'kissing chairs' throughout the walkways. The rooms were comfortable and the bathroom was roomy- big tub. The housekeeping kept the bottled water stocked for us- ours did not have a price on them- and we drank all 10 that were supplied. They did try to stick us with that $10- but we refused since they weren't marked. I don't recommend the Italian restraunt though. The atmosphere was great- like a 5star place- all fancy - but the food was drab. All the pasta sauce on the menu was tomato based- no alfredo or garlic butter sauce. Was more like a tv dinner to me. The buffet was ok. Not enough to choose from I think. But what was there was nice. Their drinking glasses are the size of juice glasses though. All the desserts were very"moist". Like almost wet. They tasted ok though. Overall stay was good- but we'll do it differently I think next year.

Reviews.Title: “It's not that bad!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed there for 6 days for our honeymoon and had a blast. For those who complaint about bugs, like the other lady said, there is a tropical jungle right outside. The grounds are beautiful, the rooms are clean but, we do have to tip do get it perfect! The rooms dont smell bad, and the food is good, lunch and dinner selections could be better. My husband did get sick off the food as well but, its mexico, everything is different tasting than america! We did miss our mcdonalds though! The staff is friendly and the crew has something going on all the time!!! We did not have to spend any money but, on the tipping. There is so much to do there thats included that you dont have to go on cruises and snorkling trips, etc.... I give this a 3 1/2 star only cause the food and drinks can be better!! Other than that its awesome!!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Wev'e just returned at the reef 5/23-5/27, the beach was absolutely breath taking!! The staff is nice, however do tip the maid service or your room wont be 100%, like no trash bags in the trash cans, etc...other than that she does a great job! There is so much to do there, beach volley, pool games, cayak, etc....Out of six of us that went, all of us had stomach problems from either the food or water??? The buffet would be my only complaint, the breakfast and restaraunt was the best out of all the foods! The coffee taste great!Lunch buffet and snacks are okay, just make sure everything is cooked all the way! The only beer they have is Dos XX's, the liquor drinks are okay, but, hey there free! There may be a bug or two but, hello there is a rainforest outside!! The water may smell a little, but, you are in MEXICO!! The showers only were cold on us once. Take a candle to make your room smell good and be romantic! The hammocks are awesome, very relaxing!! Its hot in Mexico but, if your'e on the beach, there is a great breeze! Although I was sick, I enjoyed the reef, it was extremely relaxing for my husband and I which is what we wanted! The ocean view is the best, landscape of the hotel is very nice, pools are wonderful, and friendly staff. Would I stay at the reef again? Of course but, who would not want to try something different? There are so many nice hotel resorts to choose from! I look forward to going back to Playa in a year or two!

Reviews.Title: “Great time at the Reef!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a week at the Reef Club and had a wonderful time. I did witness the balcony accident referenced in the other review and agree that is an absolutely inappriopriate safety issue. However, we thought the employees at the Reef were extremally polite and helpful. There was constantly things to do and the all inclusive plan is wonderful. We thought the food at the buffet was great, snacks and the Italian resturant too. The grounds are beautiful, resembling a rainforest. I have to say the rooms smell rather musty, but what do you expect from a rainforest atmosphere. Just bring a plug-in air refreshner or something. Location is great as the Playacar hotel area is very nice and just short walking distance from Playa that has good day and nightlife. We both agreed, we would go there again! Oh, go to Tulum/Xel-Ha a must but Cozumel was rather dirty, and I would never go there again.

Reviews.Title: “Not Recommended”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I'm not sure how this resort was rated a "4" star. I had a couple of incidents. 1) Be aware of the " acitivities shack". You might not get what you pay for. I paid $30 US for a 1 hour snorkel trip but only got 35 minutes at most. The attitude was "too bad" and there was no one to complain to. Keep in mind that although the shack says "Reef" on it, it does not belong to the hotel. 2)When requesting a receipt for a taxi trip to Cancun for medical reimbursement reasons, the management at the front desk told me that the driver would be back the next day (the driver would need to go to the 'office' and return)only to find out from another management staff that this would be impossible as there is no such 'office'. I'm not sure why someone in that position would lie to me. 3)Articles of clothing along with shoes were missing from my son's room. 4)The railing on the second floor of a person in our group broke resulting in him falling. I'm not aware of the extent of his injuries at this point. We found the management staff at the front desk and well as the 'Customer Service' person lazy and not helpful. Customer Service does not exist at this resort. Aside from these problems the rooms were clean and comfortable. The pool & bar staff were great as well as the location of the resort.

Reviews.Title: “It was nice but...”
Reviews.Author: mexicangirl
Reviews.Content: My husband & I stayed at the Reef May 15 thru the 22nd to celebrate our wedding anniversary & we had a nice time but there were some small problems. We checked into our room right way, 2nd floor, which was nice but it did face the back of the resort, which was ok. The room was always clean so not much problems there. The pools were nice and the beach was awesome! We did eat at the Italian restaurant twice because the food was better there than in the buffet. The pool snack bar food wasn't all that great, not much variety, but we didn't go hungry either. The day of our anniversary we had booked a sunset cruise and beach dinner so when we went back to our room to shower we found out that some water pipe had broken so there was no water for about an hour. On the day we were leaving when we woke to shower the water smelled like rotten eggs. The second day we were there when we came back to our room we had found out that the maids had left two bottles of water with a tag on them stating that they were a $1.00 each. We didn't drink them & we had bottles of water with us and the staff will fill them up at the bars & restaurants for you free of charge. They did try to charge us for the water at check out so be careful. Some nights the guests seemed to be a little loud (and thank you to whom ever was yelling for an hour at 6 am on Tuesday while they were checking out) but this is in no way the fault of the hotel and staff. Yes, some one did fall off the 2nd floor balcony but who was at fault I can not say because we saw the broken railing afterwards and not how it happened. Everyone there was very friendly especially Marilyn in activties and Herma in the buffet and bar. We did have a nice time and the grounds are beautiful, but the food and the size of the buffet need some work, which seems to be the most common complaint in the reviews that I had read before we left and while we were there. But we never got sick off the food. Would we stay there again?? It's not bad but my husband says no. We met so many other people when we went out and always asked about their hotels, so next year will probably be some where different.

Reviews.Title: “Poisoned in Mexico”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We visited the week of 4-17 through 4-24. Many families became seriously ill during the week. My guess is the resort still does not know how they made so many people ill. Our two year old daughter became sick like the Somerset review posted earlier. Two great families from Somerset by the way were forced to leave because they were so sick. The lines on the soda, beer, wine, and water were not cleaned properly and the glasses are washed in dirty water. The buffet is terrible, but we don't like them much anyway. The resort is clean enough and you only get what you pay for. We spent the first two nights at the Iberostar because the Reef was overbooked. That resort is fantastic! The management was helpful (Sabrina and Rafeal). The rest of the front desk staff is rude and clueless. The resort provided reparations for our illness but my guess is many families did not.

Reviews.Title: “Very enjoyable vacation”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
