Reviews.Content: Well let me just say I was there from May 9th - May 18th. I was not sick from anything. The only time I got sick was when I ate on Cozumel. I liked my room, the 2nd room. The first night they had nothing in their records of what kind of room I requested, but corrected the issue the next day. No big deal. My only issue is the beds are hard, nice pillows, my A/C worked great, the room was cleaned very well. The food was more than enough, and NOT the same thing everyday. And there was a nice restuarant to eat if you make reservations in the morning for dinner that night. Basically you can eat any time from 6:30am till 2am, there was always someplace you could eat at. You could drink ADULT beverages from 10am till 2am. The beach was a bit on the ruff side, but I enjoyed it, just check out a boogie board and float around on that if nothing else. And I am not saying it wasn't swimable, because it was. The manager I delt with in a very serious situation bent over backwards to help me the best way possible. That had nothing to do with the hotel it was a personal issue, but they still went far and beyond to help. The staff was always very nice, I had no problems with anyone being rude, not even guest. I will go back, but maybe take an extra luggage with a bed pillow, or a foam topper. I had a great time.

Reviews.Title: “it was beautiful”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just came back from the reef playcar, we were there from the 5th-12th May. I have been to many, many resorts and this one visually is beautiful. The villas are set amoung lush, tropical jungles with nice pathways and bridges that wide around. Front desk agents are nice but the guest service rep is fantastic. Our first night our room's a/c was broken and the patio door wouldn't lock and we were on the ground floor but within a half hr the door was fixed but we had to wait till the next morning to change rooms. The next morning our new room was so much better and we were very pleased. the grounds are great and the pools are fabulous however they collect big bugs really fast. the food is pretty good. the main buffet restaurant has different meals every day and the Italian a la carte restaurant is great (do not eat the salad bar, it got me sick the last night). the beach is amazing and the water perfect. I would defeintly recommend this property.

Reviews.Title: “Worst vacation ever award”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I will keep it brief so I can minimize the pain of living it over again. We arrived April 17th and were told they had mechanical issues with the building our room was in. We were shipped to a very nice hotel with some hungry children that were in need of lunch that the Reef Club would not supply. We finally got food in our starved children an hour latter (six hour without food). Finally, we got back to the Reef Club and two days latter. My entire family and the family we were traveling with became very sick. Diarrhea and vomiting for days. We were not the only ones. I counted twenty five people that I spoke with directly that were sick. The hotel doctor provided shots at a cost, to make the vomiting and diarrhea go away. The strange thing is, the doctor could not tell me why all of these people were sick. They were investigating the problem and still allowing people into the hotel without making them aware of the issue. I witnessed the front desk staff still checking people in at the front desk with small infants. The sickness started on Tuesday and we finally got a room at another hotel on Thursday with a resturaunt my kids could eat at. We returned home and my wife was still sick until Monday. It was living hell and the staff was very rude and lazy through the entire "vacation". You could not pay me enough to return to the Reef Club and be subjected to the rudest place on earth.

Reviews.Title: “What's all the moaning about????”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We've just returned from two weeks at the Reef Club and have had a fab time. For all those people who've been complaining - if you want 5 star treatment then pay 5 star money!!! Our hotel room was cleaned every day and was always spotless with no sign whatsoever of bugs. The staff really can not do enough for you and considering their pay and the amount of whinges they must get from certain people they are always helpful, pleasant and cheerful! The food was fine with always something to chose from and Bottecellis is definately worth a visit or two! The sea and the beach are to die for with plenty of sun loungers available - even if you get up late. The hotel is ideally located within a short walk of Playa Del Carmen. All in all a fantastic holiday that I would recommend to other people.

Reviews.Title: “Great Vacation”
Reviews.Author: KBear1118
Reviews.Content: We just returned from the Reef club (May 2-6). First of all, hats off to everyone that works there. We never encountered a single rude person employed by the resort. I did notice that if you were rude to them you did not get that above average treatment. Second, the food was not that bad. We ate the Botticelis one night and that was enough for us. We were there for over two hours. It had nothing to do with bad service, just that our waiter was over worked, busing his own tables and taking care of half the resturant himself. The buffett changed their theme every night. We were never served the same food two nights in a row. Third, the grounds are beautiful. They spend a lot of time keep everything clean, from picking up dead leaves to anything else that might clutter the grounds. The beach was beautifl. The salsa at the snack bar was the best salsa I have ever had. I went snorkling and it was wonderful. Everyone on the boat was great. Our room was nice, no bugs, but it did smell musty. I had taken an air freshner with me and left it in the room with no problem. If you need an ironing board, call the front desk, or walk up there and get one. The shows were cute, the like audience participation. I took water arerobics classes and played beach volleyball. What a blast. The drinks were great. Make sure to bring an insulated cup, because there glasses are small. If you are nice to the bartenders and that does not mean tipping, your drinks are not watered down. At one point, I felt they had a little too much rum, but hey, I was on vacation. We took our 10 month old godson and it was great. He was the hit of the resort. It rained every day, but it always got sunny and we spent alot of time in the pool. I recommend getting up to watch the sunrise. It was beautiful. The only thing we didn't like was going through immigration, that took too long. I would go back and next time I will take my teenage daughter and her friend.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: Tru-Bee
Reviews.Content: My friend and I just spent 4 days at the REEF CLUB. (May 7-11, 2004) Here are a few of my comments. 1. BUFFET - The buffet was small and unchanging. Stick with the fruit and bread to be safe. Also, the snack bar by the pool was messy, and consisted of the same fatty, unhealthy foods every day. 2. BOTTICELLI - This one restaurant is fantastic. If you wake up at 7 AM and make your reservations for that day you will be pleased. The staff is kind and hospitable. Make sure you have the chocolate cake. Also, you can eat here every night if you choose. I recommend this since the buffet is, well, awful... 3. FRONT DESK STAFF - Very rude. Unhelpful. Lazy. You can check out later than NOON for $10 an hour although I am convinced that the staff just pockets the cash. Also, some with advise you of this option and other staff members don't. 4. DRINKS - Stick to beer. Everything else is just drink mix and water. 5. TIPPING - Although an all inclusive, I noticed that tipping is acceptable. 6. BEACH STAFF - The waiter, Isidro, is excellent. 7. BUGS - We had 3 bugs in our room the first night. One was a roach. We called housekeeping for bug spray. They showed up 45 minutes later - after two followup calls. 8. PROXIMITY TO TOWN - Excellent. Be sure to take a walk if it's not too hot. 9. WEATHER - Be sure to pack an umbrella as the front desk staff would NEVER loan you one. 10. ROOMS/SHOWERS - Pack your own ammenities. No iron, board are provided. The water was often turned off during the day. One of my showers pour sand and dirt out for 15 minutes. OVERALL RECOMMENDATION - Spend a little bit more and stay someplace nicer like ALLEGRO RESORTS.

Reviews.Title: “Great family hotel....”
Reviews.Author: dolphinlkf
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at the Reef Club April 23rd through April 30th. The rooms were very clean and the grounds were well kept up. The service was wonderful and very friendly, but the food was not that good. The snack bar was the best place to eat and that is not saying much. I would recommend going into town for a nice steak dinner at La Casa, just ask the front desk. The resturant was awsome. The beach was nice, but I think they could have kept it alot cleaner, there was seaweed everywhere. To those people that smoke and put there cigaretts in the sand, get a life and pick up after yourself. Would you do that at home? The entertainment was okay, and I have seen better at other hotels. My 5 year old daughter loved the kids club, and Valeria she is awsome and thank you for everything you have done. You are one GREAT person, and I would highley recommend the kids club. They also have a snorkeling tour at the Marina at the hotel that is wonderful and I would also recommend that also. Overall the staff, the grounds, workers, everyone at The Reef Club I give a 10, and the food 6. The people that complained about this hotel, you must love to complain because it was a great hotel and we never had one problem. Oh and one more thing, for those of you with small children the kids pool is right there were you can sit out and enjoy some sun and watch them play. Most hotels the kids pool is with the kids club and thats even if they have a kids pool. Great place for the little ones, and I know you will enjoy the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good time, great beach!”
Reviews.Author: lgreen
Reviews.Content: This was our second time at the Reef Club and knew what to expect. What we did not expect was to get sent to another hotel for our first night. They were overbooked and sent us to the Porto Real. I had stayed there before and knew what the rooms, pool, (lack of) beach, and food were like. I insisted on a Jr. Suite which we got but it faced the constuction across the street. Since we were on a fairly short trip (4 nights, 5 days) we basically lost a day getting shuttled to/from a different hotel. Now to the Reef Club...if you can get a room on the third floor of certain bulidings that have the large balcony and hot tub and a great view, lucky you and lucky us because one of our 2 rooms were these. The inside of all rooms are fairly standard but very clean and well maintained. The grounds at the Reef Club are awesome! It's a jungle like setting very peaceful and beautiful to look at and walk through. The food at the buffet was fairly standard but good none the less. The Italian restuarant is also good and I have found that you do not need to get up at 7am to make reservations you can do it any time of the day. The beach area is what sets this place apart from other places. It is uncrowded, clean, plenty of loungers (no getting up early to stake your claim!) drink service is very prompt on the beach and the activities crew are always doing something but they are not pushy and there is no loud music blaring. The Reef club has 2 pools one with a swim up pool bar. Both pools are very clean and uncrowded and again plenty of loungers, go ahead, sleep in there will be plenty of chairs when you get out there! The service is up there with any 5 star hotel! The employees work 12 hour days for minimal pay. Even though this is an all-inclusive resort, please tip accordingly, these people deserve it! Would I go back again? You bet, hopefully in about 6 months!

Reviews.Title: “Very Pleased”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We visited the Reef Club April 21-28. We were pleased with resort. We felt the service was very good both at the resturants and the bars. The rooms were adaquate. Not in them much. They were clean. The grounds were very well taken care of. We heard complaints about the food at the buffet but found it to be good. The snack bar was very good also. The Italian resturant was OK but not as great as we had heard. If you go and get up town at all try a place called Frida"s very good.

Reviews.Title: “it was OK!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from the Reef Club. We had a good time. The hotel was nice. The grounds are well kept. We had a nice room on the third floor. The service was good. The staff was very nice and helpful. There was a lot of families with kids. If you're a couple and is looking for a peaceful and romantic getaway, don't go there. Try an adult resort. The most disappointing part of the resort was the buffet. It was not good and we got tired of it very fast. The Italian restaurant had good food but it was a hassle making reservations because you had to get up at 7 am to do it. We met a lot of great people. You don't need to take taxis to go to town. It's a nice 10 minute walk. Transportation is very easy there. Bring comfortable walking shoes. Ignore the annoying time share people trying to lure you into it on every street corner in town. They even try to get you at the airport. Just block them out. Have fun!

Reviews.Title: “We loved the Reef!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just returned from the Reef two days ago. We were there from April 3-10. We had an absolutely wonderful time! Mind you, we are not picky people and do not have high expectations. Our main concern is a good beach, good service, average food, and cleanliness. We picked the Reef because it was a small resort and we were not disappointed. We landed in Cancun at 12:30 and we were in our room by 2:00. You will probably get in a long line for customs that seems to go on forever. Don't be discouraged because it goes very fast. Beware of people trying to sell you time shares and so on when you get off the plane. They are everywhere. We were immediatley approached by a women who had a shirt on that said Tourist Information. So, we thought she was working for the government tourism agency. WRONG! She led us over to a desk and began to give us some good info., but within 5 mins. she was talking about a time share. We immediately walked away, and were approached by at least 10 more people. So, when you get through customs, ignore everyone and get your own luggage. They have carts for $3.00 if you need them. We were hooked up w/ Lomas Travel to get a shuttle to the resort and were told to look for people that had tourquoise shirts that had the Lomas loggo on them. Once you leave the airport and walk outside to get the shuttle, you will see the travel representatives and desks. ONLY TALK TO THEM. COMPLETELY IGNORE THE OTHERS, DO NOT EVEN SAY HOLA. It is extremely difficult to get away from them even if you give them eye contact. Once in the air conditioned van it was a 45 minute ride to the Reef. We had no trouble at the front desk and were in our room within 10 minutes of arriving. We stayed in 8 12. It was in an excellent location because it was a 2-3 minute walk to the food, pools, and beach. I had requested a oceanview room over a month ago, but because there are so few of them, there weren't any available. Initially I was disappointed, but I was pleasantly surprised with the patio that faced the beautiful jungle setting. Also it was covered which was nice the couple of nights it rained. The room had a king sized bed and was very spacious. I don't know how anyone can complain about the rooms. They have nice tile floors, a spacious marble and tile bathroom with big tub, blow dryer, magnified makeup mirror attached to the wall and ample shelf space. Playacar area was working on the power system that week and the electric went out 3 times for a few hours. It affected all the resorts in the area. Candles came in handy. After the power came back on, the water ran murky for a short period, but cleared up right away. Actually, we found the water to have no smell and was soft. Once in awhile it ran cool, but that felt good after being on the beach all day. There is a huge mirrored closet with a shelving unit, desk and chair, small table and two chairs, two end tables with lamps, lights over the bed and a decent sized t.v. with CNN, HBO and other channels in English. The room was on the first floor and was musty smelling when we first arrived, but we cranked up the air conditioning and the smell got better. Here's a tip, bring a couple of fragrant candles with you. Whenever you are in the room, light them. It helps with the smell and gives the room a romantic glow. The room was dark because it is shady all around the area, but we didn't mind that. We were rarely in the room. It was SPOTLESS everyday. I'm a clean freak and I was impressed with the cleanliness. Even the corners were clean. Yes, the bed was hard, but I slept fine and I'm used to a feather bed. Another tip, if you have down pillows at home, roll them up to get the air out and shove in a ziplock bag. I carried mine in my carry on bag and was glad I did. The pillows are hard. My husband said he didn't want to bring his pillow and he regretted it. No bugs anywhere except a few on the patio. Believe me, I checked my bed every night and never found one. I tipped the maid $2.00 everyday and she did a good job. Bottled water is availbale from the maid and is $1.00. We asked for two a day and the cost was added to our bill at the end. Just leave your empty bottles by your tip and the maid will replace them. I called the front desk for an iron and ironing board and w/in 10 minutes a maid brought one which I kept in the room all week. There is a safe deposit box in the closet. To use, go to the front desk to get the lock. It's $2.00 a day. The resort is beautiful. The ground are immaculate and gorgeous. Whoever designed the place did a wonderful job. Lighted pathways meander through the tropical settings. Birds are singing in the trees, Mexican music is constantly played in faux stone speakers along the pathway. Very romantic. The pools are nice and well maintainenced. The pool bar is heavenly. Nothing like sitting in the water, having a frozen drink (try the Conga, Blue Logoon, Mudslide) and looking at the gorgeous water. I have never seen water with so many shades of blue! The beach is lovely, and there are a lot of comfortable loungers. It is a good idea to reserve a chair in the morning if you are going during a busy season. Good activities for the younger set. I'm 44 and just like to relax by the beach, but younger people were having a great time with the activity staff. It was breezy while we were there and the waves were terrific. So much fun!! There was nothing like being in a clear blue warm ocean with rolling waves washing over you. Heavenly!!! The food at the snack bar was good. Always had fries, hot dogs, hamburgs, desserts, tortilla chips and the best guacamolie and salsa I've ever had. Sometimes roast chickens and chicken fingers. Every afternoon I had a big plate of guacamolie with salsa and jalepenos on top with chips. MMMM. The buffet was good. We never had a problem finding something to eat. Try their poached eggs in a greenish and reddish sauce. They don't look too appetizing, but are very good. Their cheesecake is excellent, but not always available. Their mango was great and the rest of the fruit was good too. The Italian rest. was excellent. We ate there 3 times. Each time was delicious. The drinks were fine, be sure to bring an insulated cup because the cups they provide don't appear to be washed well. Drinks seemed good to me. But I wasn't there to get wasted. Service everywhere was great and it was a busy week. Try laying in the hammocks in the morining or early evening when it's not too hot. It is so relaxing. There is entertainment every night. We went twice. The Mayan dancers are not to be missed - they were so good. We took a tour to Xal-Ha/Talum. It was excellent We booked it at the resort. For $98. you go to Xal-Ha (lagoon water park w/ great snorkeling) from 9:30-2:00. There you get free snorkeling rental (the snorkel is new and you keep it), all you can eat and drink at 5 restaurants which are all good. We ate at a Mexican rest. that was terrific. What a beautiful place Xal-Ha is. We did a diving thing where you put this 55 lb. helmet over your head and go 11 ft. under the water. At first we tried to get out of it cause we paid $80.00 and had already seen so many fish while snorkeling, but they wouldn't let us cancel. Well, we're glad we did it. It was a blast!!! The helmet lets you breathe regularly and is almost weightless in the water. They have guides who walk you along this railing underwater and you see these huge fish. They hold a stingray so you can pet it; that was cool. Then the stingray kept swimming by my legs. It liked me. Defiinitley worth the money. I could have spent all day at Xal-Ha, but felt I should see the ruins. The ruins were interesting. Our tour guide was Mayan and was a wealth of information. We also took the ferry over to Cozumel. All the ferries are $18. round trip. We rented a jeep and toured the island. Bring snorkeling equipment if you have it. There are national parks to snorkel at around the island. I suggest renting a vehicle from a reputable international co. As soon as you get off the ferry men will accost you to rent a vehicle. We went w/ the first guy who had pictures of the vehicles. He said he had a Jeep. Well, 5 blocks later we went to the parking lot and the jeep was a beat-up Tracker. And they would only took cash. We left that place and found Avis, Hertz, and Executive all on the same street. We felt most comfortable w/ Executive and rented a nice Jeep for 75.00 including insurance. When you get off the ferry walk straight down the road, go 2 blocks and you will see Avis, Hertz, and Executive. Go to a restaurant on the other side of the Island. It is called something Rios and is an authentic restaurant right on the beach. It was excellent. Great margaritas and seafood. Playa del Carmen is a short walk or taxi ride into town ($4.00) one way. Terrific shopping, atmosphere and food. Try La Karen's at night for good atmosphere and free entertainment. Shopping off the side streets of 5th Ave. is more reasonable than on 5th. You can haggle better. Try turning LEFT out of the resort and walking five mins. to a shopping center. Nice shops, but not as good of prices as in town. They don't haggle much. Go to the small jewelry store inside the courtyard with all the cultured pearls in the window. I got a beautuifu pink cultured pearl necklace/earring set for $20. and another set of pink, white, black pearls for $40. The price of gold and diamonds is ridiculous everywhere, though silver is a bargain. The airport departure was a breeze for USAir. We were checked through everything within 1/2 hour. I highly recommend the Reef if you are upbeat, go with the flow people who are not there to find every little thing wrong with the place. We went to Aruba last year and thought that was wonderful, but Playacar area beats Aruba hands down.

Reviews.Title: “SORRY TO HAVE TO RETURN HOME!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a week stay at the reef club on april 10th. celebrated my 40th birthday there with my husband, sister and friends I could not ask for a better way to celebrate the big one! the reef club was absolutely a piece of heaven. the beach was fantastic...the surf was never dull. just right for an exciting dip into the turquoise blue waters..what a sight to see. have been to other islands in the carribean and this by far has the most beautiful water...not to mention perfect weather. the only downside to the reef club as you have heard is the dinner buffet. breakfast and lunch were adequate, but dinner left sonething to be desired. we all like something a little more elegant. so we ate at the italian restaurant, Boticelli's, four times. it is definiitely worth getting up a little early for. the wait staff there is tremendous (say hello to Cesar). All the waitstaff is wonderful. they work very hard to make your stay there relaxing and wonderfu. so be sure to treat them with the respect thay they so dearly deserve. our favorite wait person was a young man named HERME. he works hard with a smile on from morning til night. always there for you. ask him to make you a tequila boom boom. a great little fun cocktail...beware! tell him his american friends say hello and we miss him and the reef club already and can't wait to return. you won't regret a trip to the Reef Club!

Reviews.Title: “Great time at Reef Club!”
Reviews.Author: parkan
Reviews.Content: We just got back after spending a week at the Reef Club. At first we were a little apprehensive after reading some of the negative reviews but we need not have worried. The rooms are average but I didn't notice any weird smells. The food is average but always found something to eat. We mostly drink beer so I don't know about the weak drinks. Definitly bring travel mugs because they are constantly washing those little glasses and I don't know how thoroughly. We ate at Botticelli's several times which I highly recommend! They keep the grounds immaculate, always painting the walls or grooming the foliage. It was also fun seeing iguanas crawling around either on the walls or in the grounds. The beach was gorgeous compared to the other beaches close by. Unfortunately on our first full day there we were in need of a Dr. for our young son. The hotel made the call and he was there for us within a half an hour. The Dr. came to our room, examined our son, (swollen tonsils & ear infection) and gave us antibiotics all in one visit. He wrote us out a detailed description of the doses and a receipt for our insurance company. It was a little unnerving having to rely on a doctor in a foreign country but he was very professional and made us feel at ease. All in all it was a great resort with a very friendly staff and we would definitely return!

Reviews.Title: “Loved everything”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I know this is a late review.... we stayed for four days last year in March for spring break. It was absolutely beautiful!! I never read any of the reviews before we went, and I am thankful now, cause I would have had reservations about going there after reading reviews when we came back. I was thinking----did we stay at the same place?I oculd not agree more with the people who loved it. I know I did. The pool was always empty, so I could relax while my fiance was guzzling down drinks at the swim up bar. Very friendly staff all around. The food was excellent! I am such a picky eater, so I stuck to what I liked, but my fiance tried a bit of everything and he thought it was great. Not a lot of entertainement at night, but that is not what we were there for. We stayed on the beach for hours at night and would go and get our drinks at the bar.Perfect place to relax and enjoy, my only regret is that we had so many day things planned, we didnt get to enjoy the beach during the day.One more regret.....we were not there long enough!

Reviews.Title: “Redoubtable Reef Club”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: A week at the Reef Playacar was just what my wife and I needed after a cold Canadian winter. Like others who have posted on this site, we were somewhat concerned about what we would find at the Reef. We need not have worried. Our shuttle bus from the airport dropped us off at the front lobby area of the Reef around 2:00 pm, and our room was ready and waiting for us. Check in was a breeze, and the gal at the front desk looked like a Spanish version of Janis Joplin, friendly and smiling, but with a gravelly voice and hair everywhere. Our room looked exactly like the one pictured on the Reef website, and was well appointed, clean and tidy. Yes, there is an odour that you'll notice each time you enter your room, an earthy, feculent aroma. My wife said it smelled like one of my windys, but I was reminded of the way my uncle's shoes smell on a rainy day. He's 82. The grounds of the Reef maintain the Mexican jungle theme, with exotic vegetation bordering the walkways. Be sure to keep an eye out for the little agoutis that live in the underbrush. You'll see them scampering around, looking for seeds and berries. I almost got a photo of one of them engaging in the peculiar practice of coprophagy, a practice common to most rodents, but I just wasn't quick enough with my camera. Paved pathways lead from the rooms down to what surely is one of the most beautiful beaches in the whole area. The Reef is truly a little slice of paradise. During the week we were there (March 21 to 28), the Reef was booked solid. At times it felt a bit crowded. And it was necessary to get down to the beach no later than 8:00 am to drape a towel over a beach chair and stake a claim, otherwise we wouldn't have any place to sit. One strange experience we had - each morning a large red headed man would shuffle onto the beach, toss his flipflops by his already claimed beach chair, and then wade out into the warm waters of the Caribbean ocean. He'd wade out to about waist level, then squat down so the water was at his neck. Then, for 15 or 20 minutes he'd just sit there, often times frowning and gritting his teeth. He looked like he might have been in pain. Then, suddenly, he'd get a big, satisfied grin on his face, stand up and wade back up onto the beach and plop down in his beach chair. I guess he was doing some type of aquatic Deepak Chopra meditation. The strange thing is that he would yell at his 3 kids for the rest of the morning, telling them to stay the hell out of the water until the tide went out. Weird. Food is always a topic of contention at an all inclusive resort. I know it wouldn't satisfy the French, but I thought the food was not bad. There was a decent selection at the buffet, with wonderful fresh fruit and breads. During our one week stay, I gained 6 pounds. And be sure to go for at least one meal at Boticellis, the Italian a la carte restaurant. We ate there twice, and enjoyed the food. But stay away from the garlic shrimp. I ordered this dish the day before we left, and I came down with the "thin dirties". I lost 4 of the 6 pounds that I had gained. Not a fun experience. One of the strong features of the Reef Club is its proximity to the delightful town of Playa del Carmen. You can walk there in about 15 minutes. Take a stroll along 5th Avenue. It's a pedestrian friendly open air shopping venue, loaded with restaurants and stores and sidewalk cafes. In front of Senior Frog's there's this charming Mexican fellow who has a chair you can sit in, and he'll take a Q-tip dipped in mineral oil and swab out your ears for you. He charges $3.00 per ear, or $5.00 for both ears - a heck of a deal. After splashing around in the ocean, it sure feels good to have your ears cleaned out, believe me. My wife and I did find the drinks at the Reef to be watered down. Back in Canada, I can knock back 7 or 8 drinks before I start seeing double. One night at the Reef I guzzled 14 margaritas (my wife was keeping track, damn her), and was still able to smoke a cheap Mexican cigar without setting my hairpiece on fire. So, definately, the drinks are watered. Mind you, I was blind in my left eye the next day until almost noon, but I think that was due to the cheap cigar rather than the 14 margaritas. Like others have recommended, do bring your own mugs to the reef. If you like to drink a lot, you'll save time and frustation by having your own mug. In conclusion, the Reef is a good, economical resort. Nothing super fancy, but if you don't have real high expectations, you won't be disappointed. My wife and I plan to return next year.

Reviews.Title: “We Miss Armando , Paulino and other staff”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: L, G, and T stayed at the Reef from March 01 to March 08. In between we did the 2 night stay at the Iberostar in Cozumel. Obviously, Iberostar being a 5 star and Reef being a 4 star we did see differences in quality and variety of food, rooms and enviroment. But , while in Cozumel, what all 3 of us girls really noticed was how much more personable and comfortable it felt at the Reef. Armando was absolutely fantastic, and we really would like to hear from him, so, Armando, if you read this, feel free to keep in touch. We never had a problem with our room, for the amount of time that is spent in a room , it was fine. The Italian restuarant was very satisfying, and yea, the buffet did get a tad boring from time to time. But, like some of the reviews I've read from other Canadians, all and all I was there for the fun, sun ocean and relaxation. I would definately return back some day, sooner that later I hope. Thanks to all the staff who made our holiday very worth while. L.

Reviews.Title: “Another 'Just OK'”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We found the grounds and buildings to be clean and well maintained. Overall, the staff was courteous and helpful. The beach is small, but there is plenty of "sun room" with the two large pools and their decks. One of the pools is often unusable when the staff is blasting boom box music for entertainment. Previous comments about the booze are so true. There are virtually no name brands, and the drink glasses are slightly larger than shot glasses. Bring your own beer mug or you'll be headed to the bar every few minutes to refill your shot glass. White wine? Comes out of a spigot and is marginal The bars are understaffed and there is virtually no drink service on the beach or at the pools. Food is tolerable, but with annoyances like watered down orange juice. The Italian restuarant (which no one mentioned to us, we just happened to find out about it) is good. Best downtown eatery we found was Frida's--great food, ambiance, prices; the worst: The Blue Lobster, lousy sevice, mediocre food, overpriced. Playa is great, but we'd do another resort next time.

Reviews.Title: “Back home, refreshed!”
Reviews.Author: Lakeside
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Reef Club in March and had a great time. It rained a few days in the early morning, but the sun quickly dried it up. It was windy, but made for fun playing in the waves. The food was good, enough variety that you will find something. The yogurt, fresh fruit, made to order eggs (omelets), bread, & rolls made breakfast choices great. The service was excellent and friendly. We painted pottery with Graciella almost daily (additional charge) on the beach. There was a group of vacationers who were having a great time with candid camera type stunts, mouse traps (fake), wigs, fake ugly teeth, etc. We were entertained watching them having a great time. Your vacation is what you make of it, the Reef is clean, well maintained and the staff is exceptional. The location is paradise, and we enjoyed getting away from the city and relaxing on this goureous beach...

Reviews.Title: “great vacation”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned last night, we were there from 3/24-3/31. Our room was great- 623, it was very clean, comfortable, etc. The beach and grounds are truly breath taking- a beautifully landscaped resort, and the beach has got to be one of the best. This was a very affordable trip, and we were not expecting a 5 star hotel (including air fare) for 2 for $1700-1800, so yes, the lines for drinks can be a drag, and most of the food was pretty bad, but we did not go there for that. We had a fantastic time. if you are looking for superior food and entertainment, spend more $ and go elsewhere. It is a great value, and again, VERY beautiful. Boticelli's was good and you will be foolish not to make the reservation at 7 am. Xel Ha was amazing, and I cannot recommend it enough-swimming with dolphins is a tremendous experience. Do make that trip. We read these reviews and all the "tips" were helpful, and all points valid. Definitely buy or bring a big mug, because you can wait on line for 2 cokes for a while- liquids are a bit tough to get (and frusterating when the food is spicy :)) If you are looking for an affordable and relaxing vacation in a visual paradise, I highly recommend Reef Club. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “LOVED THE REEF”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Reef Club PlayacarMy husband and I arrived at the Reef Club in Playa Del Carmen on Saturday, March 6, 2004 for a week?s stay. This would be our sixth visit to the Cancun/Playa Del Carmen/Tulum section of Mexico ? our first visit to the Reef Club.Check-in was a breeze. We were shown to our room and were pleasantly surprised at its spaciousness and cleanliness. I did have a problem with a stain on the inside of the bedspread, but, the next morning when I notified the front desk, and also saw the maid, the problem was resolved. They stripped the bed and put on all new bedding.The grounds of the hotel are very impressive. The hotel, while not a five star is a strong four. Everywhere you turn you see people working, cleaning. Our room was on the third floor. It seemed like every day someone was washing the (I think it looked like concrete) stairs and landings at the top and bottom of the stairs. Walkways were swept every day. I jokingly told my husband that the hotel must be trying to impress me because they now how much I appreciate cleanliness.The food was excellent. There was just enough variety and the quality was very good. It was a joyous experience to be able to sit in the buffet restaurant eating delicious food, all the while looking out of a wall of windows at the turquoise Caribbean Sea. Or, if you desire, you can sit outside on the other side of the wall of windows, in either shade or sun. The wait staff at the buffet restaurant couldn?t do enough for you. Once you got your food and sat down, they come and ask what they can get you to drink.Botticelli?s is an Italian Restaurant at the hotel. You need to make reservations to eat there, but, to my knowledge, there is no rule saying how many times you can eat there. We ate there on three evenings. The food there was exceptionally good. The salad bar was excellent. One evening I had pasta with shrimp, another evening I had stuffed shells. You get to select an appetizer, soup, your main entr?e and dessert ? the salad bar is also included.The beach was wonderful. Each day hubby and I would walk a couple of miles one way on the beach and the same later on in the other direction. If you turn left when facing the ocean, you can walk to Playa Del Carmens? beach bars (Senior Frog?s is one of the first you come to) in approximately ten minutes or so.The walk to Playa Del Carmen is also very pleasurable when you walk on the main road. The houses in the area are very beautiful.This is the first vacation that we have gone into a swimming pool (why bother with such a beautiful beach?). We wanted to experience a drink at the beach bar ? a delightful experience.Everywhere we went within the confines of the hotel we got to meet and talk with delightful people. Overall, our experience at the Reef Club was excellent ? we will definitely be staying there again sometime in the future.

Reviews.Title: “hotel okay-but beach BEAUTIFUL”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the reef club march 10-14. the first day/night was bad. we had bugs in our room which i could have delt with until i found them in the bed and we were told we couldn't get a room switch till the next day. That night glass was found in my boyfriend's burger. the next morning when we tried to shower, the water was dark brown. BUT they did switch our room and that room was good, just didn't have hot water all the time which i heard other people saying they didn't have hot water either. I did notice the egg smell other reviewers wrote about but that really didn't bother me. bugs in the bed is what got me, but the second room was clean (in the 1400 block). The food at the buffet was okay, but definitely make reservations at the Italian restaurant! The snack bar was pretty good and the guacamolie was excellent! The best part about the Reef club is by far the Beautiful beach and clear blue water. The area is amazing and we definately want to return to the area, but maybe stay in a different hotel. Overall the reef club is okay and we had a lot of fun.

Reviews.Title: “The Reef was great! (Long review!)”
Reviews.Author: jx2
Reviews.Content: :P Hola', We started out in Cancun for 3 nights then went on to Playa. Cancun was fun, but way too many people etc. for us. We'd been there once with our daughther, but wanted to try it on our own. Anyway, we got to the Reef Club about 1:30 pm, they told us we couldn't check in yet so right away I'm thinking "Oh great, they overbooked and are going to send us somewhere else." I decided I wasn't going anywhere! About 3 minutes later they came and got us and checked us in (sigh of relief) but our room wasn't ready. So we went down to the pool area and got a drink, went back to the room after about 1/2 an hour and it was ready. There were flowers all over the bed, swans (towels) with flowers, flowers in the bathroom! It was like whoa, this is cool! About 5 minutes after we got into our room, someone knocks on the door, it was room service with a bottle of champagne on ice with glasses. The server congratulated us on our honeymoon. Well, we've been married almost 18 years, so we were not sure what the deal was. I kept thinking "Oh no we got someone else's room. About 5 more minutes pass, and I'm out on the deck looking at the beautiful jungle that is in the center of the grounds, and another knock at the door. I let Jeff get it. It was one of the hostessess with 2 t shirts for us, and to enjoy our honeymoon. That was very cool. It turns out that our travel agent ( who happens to be my closest friend) put on our itinerary that it was a second honeymoon for us. So either that's what they do for second honeymoons, or they misunderstood. The Reef club has beautiful grounds, well kept. The jungle path that you walk to get to the pool beach etc. is sooooo gorgeous!! The staff are all (most all ) very friendly. Yara in the Mango Lounge is so sweet! She was teaching us Spanish, very patiently! And Olegario at the pool bar is GREAT! We nicknamed him Smiley cuz of the huge grin he always has on his face. Yes we tipped, but that's how we are. Boticelli's Italian Restaurant was VERY good. It has a slightly different menu everynight. But the service there was fabulous and the food was great! Yes, you have to get down there by about 7:15 to get a reservation, but get up and watch the sunrise, have some coffee then go back to bed if you want! The food in the buffet was fine. It's buffet food, not meant to be fine cuisine. And of course you'll get tired of it, but go out and eat a couple times. El Chino on 4th & 15th is awesome! Garlic shrimp, 65 pesos!!! The beach is really nice, plenty big enough, and you can walk for a long way in either direction. It does tend to feel like a freeway sometimes with all the people out walking, but it was really nice. The rooms were very nice, used the safe and had no problems. We did discover (no discrimination intended here) that the rooms were done Much better when we had a female housekeeper vs a male. The pools were nice. (Except the people who's kids wouldn't quit splashing at the pool bar - control your children, people.) We had a really great time at the Reef. I wouldn't hesitate to recommend the Reef. As for us, we discovered another little area that is much less populated, so we will be going there next time, but if I were going back to PDC I would stay at the Reef again!

Reviews.Title: “Just ok”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Loved Playa will go back again but it will be a different resort.The food and service need help!The Italian resturant is very good and so is the service.Take your own insulated mugs and it will save you some frustration at the bars waitng on drinks again and again.The drink glasses are small and so is the selection of good booze.It's Mexico for cryin out loud and they serve a genaric Kaluha.I've been at all inclusives before and it was always leave your wallet at home as it's all paid for and if someone gets caught accepting a tip they get fired.At the Reef it's expected or service is poor.Our room was nice the bed was hard but I like it that way,we did hear alot of complaints on rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Time!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just got home from the Reef Club (March1-8)and will definately return to the area. We met a lot of super nice people from all over the place. Lots of them there Canadians-eh. Great People! Where to start..When we arrived at the Reef Club Playacar, we were told that they had a problem and wanted to take us over to another hotel for two days and then bring us back for the remainder of the week..(overbooked). At first, I was not happy but went along with the program. They took us to the Reef Club Cocoa Beach which they said was a five star. On the way there we were driving through some pretty rough areas and old dirt roads and I was thinking.."5star??", But when we got there it was very nice. Still not quite a five star but very nice. We tried to stay there for the rest of the trip so as to not have to up and move but they too were overbooked. Ended back up at the Reef Playacar and had a blast. Boticelli's is worth getting up in the morning for reservations. The Buffet was good but it did get old after a week. We did go out to eat a couple of times. The grounds were beautiful and the employees were great too. If your looking for a nice place to go and enjoy the beautiful sand and water, good food, lots of drinks and great people, this is a must. If you're a picky person who likes to complain about everything..stay home. I thought it was definately worth the money and thought we could have done alot worse after looking around. We went snorkeling in Xel-Ha, Scuba Diving, Parasailing, Deep Sea Fishing(1-amberjack, 1- grouper and 1 red snapper), had massages and met wonderful people. (Hey Larry, Kelly, Chevy, Kathryn, Darren, Darlene)..ENJOY your vacation, dont let little things ruin your entire trip.

Reviews.Title: “OK, just OK”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: First, I would go back to Playa tomorrow (I was there from Feb. 16-23), but only if I could stay at a different resort. The Reef Club is OK, but travelers there shouldn't be surprised if they experience the following: 1. Haphazard room maintenance. The knob on my air conditioner in my room broke on day one, and the only way to use it was to either plug it in, or pull the plug. It took four days of going to the front desk before it was fixed. I also had a light bulb burn out that blew all the lights in my room, and luckily I had seen the breaker box on my way in. However, it took two days to get a new light bulb. I also had to go ask for a TV remote control, but that only took one day. I tried to get a different room, but was told each day to come back tomorrow. Since I was on vacation, I just stuck it out because I wanted to be on the beach, not in the manager's office. 2. Stinky water in the bathroom. When you turn on the shower, don't be surprised if the odor gags you. I was traveling with a large group, and we were spread throughout the resort. Everyone had this problem. It didn't help to run the water hoping it would improve. And don't be surprised if you don't have hot water once in a while. 3. Rock hard beds and pillows. 4. Tiny red ants in the bathroom. I just sprayed hair spray on them, and that either killed them or just glued them in place, but one of my friends had them get into her prescription medication, and they ate it! She had to find a pharmacy and luckily found a Mexican equivalent. The hotel did have an exterminator spray several buildings, but from what I heard, it didn't help. 5. The fitness room is really in need of an update, or at least new machines. The ones there are pretty rusty, and don't appear to be too safe. Luckily walking on the beach and swimming don't require any fancy equipment. All of that said, the beach is beautiful and the water was much less rough than Cancun. My friends and I swam or played in the water daily and had a blast. We never had problems getting chairs on the beach. The pools are also very nice and clean. Depending on your maid, you may find clever towel sculptures in your room each day (elephants, flowers, swans, etc.) And we found the quality of service by the bartenders, food servers, etc. to be outstanding. All were very pleasant, hardworking and personable. The jungle setting is nice, but for a landlocked midwesterner, I really like having an ocean view and going to sleep at night hearing the surf. If you want that, you won't like the Reef. I've read a lot of reviews that focus on the food. It did get pretty repetitious after a week, but the Italian restaurant was great (that chocolate cake is wonderful), and the grill had great burgers and fries. The chocolate ice cream in the restaurant was also very good, but sometimes the beef left a lot to be desired. I would have liked more local cuisine, but an all-inclusive needs to cater more to the masses. The town itself is a fun visit, and you can find some good shopping bargains and excellent, inexpensive food if you know where to look. I'd pass on the mall - the town has a lot more to offer. It's an easy walk or there are lots of cabs for $4 one-way.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful grounds, average rooms, bad food”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Reef Club 2/25 -3/2. Overall our vacation was great, but we were not overlly impressed with the Reef Club itself. The grounds are beautiful - very clean with the landscaping hand trimmed every day! The pool area is nice and the beach is great. The location to Playa is great as well - only a 15 minute walk away. It's all these things that might have given it a 4-star rating, but there were some obvious places they cut corners and it's more realisitc to consider it a 3-star resort. We arrived late our first night and the grounds are very confusing when you first get there - it would be helpful if we could have gotten a 5 minute tour at the very least. Many reviews state that the food was ok, but I think the food could be considered 'bad' - 'ok' is an understatement. We tried to find something we liked, but everything was extremely bland. Also, items that were supposed to be hot were room temperature at best sometimes. My husband had an omlette every morning, but the line was extremely long. They only have one cook at the omlette grill and I was usually done eating my breakfast before he even sat down. Dinner and lunch was just as bland. The italian resturant is much better, but just like everyone says, you must wake up very early to make reservations (but worth the early wake-up). I overheard many other guests saying the same thing about the food so I know it wasn't just us. When you pay for all-inclusive, you expect the food to be better. I found the snack bar to be ok, but the bartenders were not very friendly and again, the grill line took a long time given they only had one person working it. It was apparent they cut back on serving staff right along with the quality of their food to save costs. I also have to agree that the beds & pillows were extremely hard -much worse than any motel I've ever stayed at. I too got a rash that was similar to what was described in another review. I think it might be heat rash, but we'll see how it progresses now that I'm home - hopefully it wasn't bed or beach bugs!!! We recommend you walk into town rather than riding the bikes. The bikes are very rickety and we found ourselves concentrating on riding them safetly rather than enjoying our trip to downtown. The rooms are very musty, but what can you expect given you're in a very humid climate. There was some sewer smells that came and went, but it wasn't constant and it was typically always in the same area. The good news is we never got sick (always a fear when you go to Mexico). We drank the water from the bars & resturants and were fine. We also brushed our teeth with the water in the room and never had a problem, however we don't recommend drinking it straight from the tap. Overall we enjoyed our vacation, but will probably not return to the Reef Club. Its fine if you're going to Mexico for the beach and don't care about your room or food given your budget. However, the food was the deal breaker for us! We'd rather pay the extra money to get better food next time.

Reviews.Title: “cozy little resort”
Reviews.Author: mixer360
Reviews.Content: we stayed at the reef for 3 nights, a sort of winter break from the weather and kids.we had read all the reviews before we came down here and much to my pleasure most of them we true. the food was average but the italian resturant was excellent. the beach was fantastic and we had no problem in keeping our drinks full, remember if you like a lot of drinks like us (party of six) its a good to tip the bartender often. overall we had a good time just what the doctor ordered. oh by the way, check out senor frogs on the weekends. bring ear plugsadios amigos

Reviews.Title: “Best Value”
Reviews.Author: WDinsmore
Reviews.Content: Great Value. We have been to the area perhaps 20 times over the last twenty five years. This is a good small hotel and a great value. We have visited twenty properties in the area and more in other parts of Mexico. Although this is not the grandest hotel I have visited, the food was as good as most all inclusives, which in my opinion is rarely great. I found this hotel proximity to the town and its activities to make to be one of its greatest values in the area. The beach area was as great, and not too crowded. The services were very good. Unlike some other hotels in the area, you can walk to town and with the money you save on the cost of the package, eat in the best resturants in Playa or take other activities. One of the problems I have with all inclusives, is you sometimes are so isolated or pay so much you feel you have to remain there. I do not believe you can find a better value in the area.

Reviews.Title: “After a 'shaky' start, thoroughly enjoyed The Reef Club . . .”
Reviews.Author: Margie R.
Reviews.Content: After checking in, we found that air conditioner, phone and light over tub did not work in our friends' room. Our room was somewhat better -- doorwall would not open, as well as one side of our closet door, but not quite as bad as a room with air conditioner that only had one speed - FREEZING! Finally after two nights in our assigned rooms and several conversations with Front Desk staff and our travel company representative, we were moved to rooms where everything worked. Rooms are nothing ultra fancy, but perfecly fine when you consider the Reef Club is rated a 4-star resort. Did not notice the strong musty smell that many have mentioned, nor did we see any bugs. And yes, pillows and beds are hard! But nothing we couldn't live with. After room change, we then began to see the delightful side to a smaller, more personal resort. No waiting in line to eat, get a drink, or enjoy evening entertainment. Pools aren't huge, but plenty big enough and sparkling clean. There were always plenty of chairs around the pool. No need to run out at 7:00 a.m. to put towels on chairs to save! The beach and water are terrific. Grounds are very pretty and so well kept. Drinks good and plenty big enough. Only reason I did not give Reef Club a 5-star rating is because of the food. As many of you have said, it is just OK. Not terrible, but certainly not in the excellent category. But we always managed to find something we liked and had more than enough to eat. Botecelli Restaurant is very nice and worth at least a couple of nights for dinner there. And we didn't find that we had to be in line at 7:00 a.m. to get a reservation. Around 8:00 a.m. was plenty of time. Met a lot of very nice people from all over the world and thoroughly enjoyed our week at the Reef Club. Would go back again. By the way, do buy a phone card after arriving if you have to make calls. It will save you a lot of aggravation. It's about a 10 minute walk to the nice shopping plaza in Playacar where there are quite a few phones available for use. (Upon leaving hotel, turn left instead of right.) If you're on your way to the Reef Club, ENJOY YOUR STAY! We did . . .

Reviews.Title: “Best Place For The Money”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Spent 7 days in early February at the Reef Club. Planning a return trip for December. I read a lot of reviews before I left and was a little concerned at times. I found the Reef Club to be a very nice resort. Yes the beds were hard, but I talked to a lot of people that stayed in so called 5 star resorts and the beds were hard there also. Drinks were good and always available. If you don't think they are big enough, order 2 at a time or simply bring a insulated mug with you. They had no problem filling them up. If you think the drink is weak, order a shot to pour in it. I found that most of the time, I had to tell them to slow down on the amount of alcohol they were putting in. Yes they use plastic cups around the pool and beach, but think about all the broken glass. Drinks are served in glasses at the restaurants and the lobby bar. Snack bar was good, always plenty of food, and the bar there stays open until 2:00. Pools were never crowded. If you showed up on the beach at 1:00, there were not enough beach chairs for everyone but if you think about it, with 200 rooms, you are looking at a minimum of 400 guests. If they put 400 chairs on the beach, people would complain about their being too many chairs on the beach. Try going to a resort with 1,000+ rooms and see what you find. Beach was great, the rooms were clean, always found something good to eat. The Italian place is a must. The tropical jungle feel was really nice. Someone was always cleaning something. . Playa Del Carmen is a great little town. About a 10-15 minute walk through a very nice neighborhood. 4 dollar cab if you choose. Another nice shopping district is up about 5 minutes on the left. I never felt crowded at any time. If you are looking for a quiet resort where you can go and relax, this is the place. You can still get the nightlife in town, but when you come back, it is nice and quiet. I learned a lot of things about going to Mexico in general on this trip. Feel free to e-mail if you have any questions.

Reviews.Title: “Best week of my life!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Going to Mexico and staying at the Reef Club was the best time of my life! Being a teenage girl from the Midwest, I wanted to experience excitement and relax at the same time, and I did that. The water is the most beautiful thing I've ever seen and the temperature of it was perfect! Walking up and down the beach was fun and watching the people from all over the world is always interesting. Comparing the Reef Club to the rest of the resorts nearby I would say that it has the best beach of all. Perfect white sand, very clean, and it is also the closest to basically everything! The food was good enough for me to eat, as I'm not picky, the servers are so freindly! I would advise anybody who is going there to bring pants though it gets a bit chilly somethimes at night. The Reef is only a short walk or drive to Playcar. One night we ate at Senior Frog's mucho fun for everybody. Even though the Reef seems a bit small for me at times, I always felt very safe and never felt in danger which is a good thing for everybody to feel when in Mexico! Point blank, stay at the Reef Club, it's the best time and you will be very satisfied there. No need to go to Cancun. Everything is in Playcar that you could want!

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: Jeannegirl
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Reef Club 4* for 5 nights and had a wonderful time. It is the smallest of the all inclusives in the beach area and a short walk or bike ride to the town of Play del Carmen We found it as a great value. The food was wonderful, especially the evening dinners in the Italian Restaurant and the buffets were always something different. We were concerned about the water and found out they have a water perfication system. We ate everything and drank drinks with ice. The water in the rooms was not drinkable. The grounds were very clean and the help was great. There are nicer resorts but the price is much higher. I would not hesitate to stay again. The size was perfect for us. The rooms are set in a jungle setting.

Reviews.Title: “Worth a return visit”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We returned this week from a 7 day stay at The Reef Club. We read the reviews before our trip, so our expectations weren't high. We had a fantastic time. I left the maid a buck each morning. We had a clean, cool and well stocked room upon our return each evening (I even left my purse behind several times and all contents including money was untouched). Food was great, couldn't get enough of the pineapple. The margaritas at the pool bar where better if you top it off with Cuervo and a lime. We missed orientation the day we arrived, so stopped in the next day to get info. David and Alma were so informative with any question we had it was nice to just chat with each of them. We booked all our day trips with them. I highly recommend this hotel if you don't want to be lost in the big mega resorts...great for the price!

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to go back ..”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I took my boyfriend for his 50th birthday celebration. This was exactly the type of resort we were looking for ... small (only 200 rooms), surrounded by lush jungle, situated on an incredibly gorgeous beach. I had heard the 3rd floor rooms were nice, so I asked for one. I was pleasantly surprised to find the room had a private outdoor jacuzzi for two, surrounded by hanging bamboo beads. Sooooo romantic. The room was beautiful and had no musty odor at all. We overlooked the pool and had an ocean view. This was definately a slice of heaven. The staff was nice and very informative. Taking your own mugs is a good idea, but we didn't use them for the drinks, we filled them with coffee every morning and sat out on the beach. Doesn't get any better. I would have given this review 5 stars, but I do have to agree that the buffet needs quite a bit of improvement. They only serve American cuisine (except for the Italian Rest), but what we wanted most was ........MEXICAN FOOD !!!! Here's an important tip for all ... do not get maid service. The people below us were robbed of everything they had and had to return home immediately. We hung our "do not disturb sign" the entire time. Also a good idea to pay the $2 a day safe located in each room. We will be back next year and probably bring the kids. There is plenty to do for all.

Reviews.Title: “enjoyed it”
Reviews.Author: traveleyesok
Reviews.Content: I've read many review of the reef club, both before we went and after we returned. I think people go with too large of an expectations. Yes, there is an odor, hello, you're surrounding by a jungle setting, it's going to be musty!!! However, the grounds were very clean, and they were constantly sweeping, picking up, etc. The staff was very friendly. The pools are nice and there are plenty of beach chairs. I'll admit, the food wasn't always what I wanted, but there was always something I could eat and get full on. The rooms aren't the greatest, but they are clean. We enjoyed our trip and would go back. I think people don't understand the whole star rating system. 4 stars in the states isn't going to be the same as 4 stars in Mexico!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Will definitely return”
Reviews.Author: Dogpanther
Reviews.Content: We were at the Reef Club from January 8-12 and it was fantastic. I echo what many feel in that if you want perfection you won't be happy here or anywhere in the area. But for the money we thought it was great. The food at all meals is plentiful and varied, made to order eggs or omelets to start off the day, great salad bars at lunch and dinner, and plenty of fruits, veggies, entrees and side dishes to keep you full. Drinks begin around 10 am if you are so inclined, and the staff is always there to get your order. The staff truly goes out of their way to make you feel welcome and work extremely hard. Take plenty of singles and tip the waiters, bartenders, and maids every day and you will make them and yourself a lot happier. If you are into birds, there is an aviary about a 5 minute walk away towards the town of Playa del Carmen. You can walk to town in 15 minutes, or take a $4 cab in the evening. We purchased a snorkel trip to Cozomel in Playa del Carmen that went to 3 reefs and included the ferry to and from the island for $40. It is a 4 hour trip including the ferry ride, and the way to go as opposed to paying for it at the hotel. At the hotel it was $50 for a one reef trip. For shopping, we didn't discover this until our last night, but if you walk in the direction away from the town of Playa del Carmen (go out of the front of the resort and turn right to go to Playa, left to go away), there is a small shopping center only half the distance it is to walk to Playa. But the trip to Playa is a must, especially if you enjoy bartering. Back to the resort, the rooms are probably the thing I would rate lower than the food and grounds, but they were certainly clean and functional. We didn't come to Mexico to sit in the room and watch Sports Center anyway. We didn't bring our kids, but I think especially for younger kids it would be great. I don't think young teens would enjoy it as much unless they are the type to enjoy just relaxing or if seeing a few topless women are enough excitement to make up for no Playcenter, basketball hoop, or endless cable channels. But if you want a very relaxing vacation in a beautiful resort on immaculate grounds with a great beach, very good food, good and plentiful drinks, unbelievably nice staff, and a few topless babes walking around (just for something different if nothing else), I highly recommend this resort.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable trip...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have been on two vacations prior to this as a couple - both were cruises - and we have to say All Inclusive resorting is definitley a different beast...however that's neither here nor there - this is a review of Reef Club Playacar. We chose this resort because of the reviews on TripAdvisor and we were not disappointed; now we only have cruises to compare this too - no other all inclusives. Food was good - got boring by thursday though...Rooms were nice and clean fairly up to date...glad they had HBO to come down off the tequila and beer prior to sleep. Great staff - make sure to tip...does seem that if you slip them a tip prior to service they treat you a little bit better...great maid service! Don't pay $80 for the trip to Chichen Itza. Go into town - I believe it's called Cinco Ave. - the main strip - and walk all the way to the end - we went for $30 per person USD. And if you're interested in Tuluum and don't care to visit Xelha - get yourself into town and grab one of the coaches - cost us $3 one way...we actually snuck into a van @ our hotel that was already going to Tuluum - made a deal with the driver and he took us for $10 - now we paid to get in ourselves - but we weren't rushed to leave to move on to the next items...Cruises spoiled us - the huge sense of adventure everyday...but you can accomplish the same thing anywere I guess - just got to get off your arse. My wife and I will always have fond memories of sipping drinks into the late evening chilling out @ "La Chiquita"...oh - the beach is nice - water's fairly decent - good pool - entertainment's fun - and I actually found the drinks to be quite decent...margarita anyone? oh - almost forget - i could kick myself now for not slipping the front desk $$$ to give me one of the rooms facing inside - the jungle setting they have setup is so nice to sit in and chill for a bit.

Reviews.Title: “Loved It!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I just don't know where to start! From the moment we arrived, to the moment we left, our every need was met. We were there from 1/19-1/26. The entire staff, from front desk to grounds and maintenence, was very friendly and helpful. I've never seen more beautiful surroundings. The beach is spectacular and the water is as blue as you could ever imagine! We thought the food was delicious and never walked away from the table hungry. There is something there for everyone, trust me. And, if not, the snack bar offers a variety of foods too! The Italian restaurant is worth getting up early and making reservations for! It does kind of suck that you can't make reservations for dinner in advance...their policy is same day reservations, but oh well. The drinks? While it's true they do come in smaller glasses, so what? Do what we did....walk into town and buy the larger insulated mugs that holds more. The bartenders certainly don't mind filling up larger mugs! Also, I have to specifically mention Lucas in the dive shop! I've never scuba dived before and was more than nervous! He was very kind and patient and gave me positive reinforcement the whole way through. It was an incredible experience I'll never forget. He pointed out all sorts of interesting underwater creatures, but the coolest thing of all was seeing an eel that had to be at least 6 feet long! I've read the other comments that are posted about the Reef Club, and as a matter of fact, I work with the people from MN who had a negative experience on their vacation. I booked through the same travel agent and had a WONDERFUL time! It's almost like we went to two different places! I HIGHLY recommend the Reef Club, and would definatly go again. The rooms do have a musty odor to them, but it goes away after you run the air conditioner for a while, and yes, there are certain sewer smells in the air from time to time, but if you are going to let little things like this ruin your trip, then that's your bust! I give the Reef Club two thumbs up! No doubt about it. And, by the way, they DO NOT have bed bugs at this hotel! The trip was well worth the money spent! We have great tans and a lifetime of memories!

Reviews.Title: “This IS the great escape - to paradise”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have been reading the other reviews and had to post mine. I think it's safe to assume that we can all find something to complain about regarding ANY resort. What sets the Reef Club apart from other vacation settings I've enjoyed with my family is one word - STAFF. We visited a 'higher rating' resort in the Dominican last year, but there were no Spanish lessons, organized sports events, or much exhuberance from the staff at all, unfortunately. When we were at the Reef, Leslie, Sergio, Ed and all the staff went out of their way to ensure that we had a fantastic time - and we did. T

Reviews.Title: “I loved it!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Reef Club a couple of years ago and I had a wonderful time! The people were so welcoming and were very polite. The food was excellent and we had different varities of foods. The lunch bars we wonderful to go to and have a snack. The pools werent crowded so you could acually swim around and not bump into people. The rooms were very comfortable and had a lot of space and were cleaned well everyday. The night-time live performences were excellent and very entertaining. I had to see them everynight. The tropical drinks were great. the beaches were clean. And overall I had a wonderful stay and I am going back there this year.

Reviews.Title: “Beware - Listen to the Reviews(I didn't) - Horrible Place”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: BEWARE! I have traveled extensively throughout the world and this place is the WORST. I stayed in Paris at a 2 star hotel and that was 1o times nicer than this place. I read the reviews, but my travel agent said she sends people here all the time and they simply love it, so we went, needless to say I won't be using that travel agent again either. We actually tried to get flights home on the 2nd day and we were willing to pay for them - whatever it took to get out of there. Needless to say everything was fully booked. The Reef Club is considered 4 Stars - I would rate it a 2, possibly a 3, but NEVER a 4. The grounds and the beach are beatiful, and the Italian restuarant is okay - if you want to get up at 6:30am, walk down to the restaurant and make reservations - weren't we suppose to be on vacation? The service and the food is horrible - THE WORST. One day my husband went to get us drinks (very small) and he waited for 15 minutes and nobody waited him - it was like he was invisible. I developed a rash, as did others, but everybody thought it was heat rash. Mine continued to get worse, so we got home I went to see my doctor - he said it was one of two things - sand mites or bed bugs. We were only on the beach for 1 day, the first and it continued to get worse, our conclusion was we had 'bed bugs'. My husband didn't develop the rash until day 3. We left the resort most of the time and did enjoy ourselves. The city (20 minute) walk is a great place to enojoy the day or an evening. We went scuba diving in Cozmel - the diving place was called 'Staff Divers' - they were EXCELLENT. We paid $252 total for my husband and I to each have 2 tanks (beach and boat dive) - I would have paid double that - it was so UNBELIEVABLE. We saw an eagle ray, lobsters, and an eel(plus lots of cool fish). Anyway, I would NOT recommend the Reef to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful Vacation”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I went to Reef Club with my brother. It was our first time staying at a resort and our first time in Mexico, and we had a terrfic time. The club itself was a very pleasent place to stay, and the staff was fantastic!!! The recreation staff were enthusiastic and nice, and the waiters and bartenders were absolutley top notch. While tipping was not required, I recommend occassional tips. If you tip you will receive service even above the normal high standards. Moreover, Mexican salaries are sufficiently low that small tips make a big difference. The drinks were good and had plenty of liquor in them, and good brands of liquor were used. The glasses were small, but when it's all inclsuive, that is relatively unimportant, besides one can get two at a time. The beach was wonderful and clean and their were nice chairs and umbrellas. They did not seem as vigilant about changing the surf condidtion flag as often as other resorts, but you can see the flag from other hotels by peeking down the beach. The food was mediocre. I think of it as being classic buffet. Everything is fine, but nothing is great. The Italian restauraunt is decent but unspectacular. The rooms were nice, comfortable and colorful, though they did do insect extermination once while we were there. We had no bug problems, but they are always vigilant, so if you have problems with chemicals, it is probably not the best place to go. The best thing about Reef Club is its proximity to town. One can walk there in less than 20 minutes, so if you are someone who would like to leave the resort, it is perfect. Even though it's all inclusive, I recommend eating in the City of Playa del Carmen which is a real Mexican town where locals clearly outnumber tourists. If one leaves the crowded tourist street, 5th avenue, there are many very inexpensive and excellent Taquerias. There is also an unbelievably good fish restauraunt right on the waterfront. I can;t remember the name, but the Octopus Ceviche was wonderful. If you want to book a tour, I recommend going into town and booking throught one of the many tourist agencies there. They charge about half of the in-hotel cost. We went to Chichen Itza, which is a long day trip, but well worth it. It is the quintisential Mayan ruins, and if you visit no other archeological sites, go there. We also went to Tullum, though I strongly recommed taking the public bus rather than wasting money on a tour. The 2nd class public bus goes every hour or half hour and costs on ly 2USD. Tullum is an easy and pleasant 45 minute ride. All in all I give Reef Club Playacar a very good rating, particularly given its more reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We (2 couples, 1 inlaw and 5 children ages 3-11) just came back (Jan. 13, 2004) from The Reef Club . I must say that I did not read the reviews on this resort until after I booked my trip. Once I had a chance to review them, I immediately felf apprehensive about my choice, but, I thought that the reviews were probably overblown. Let me say that the grounds and people working at of the resort ( pools, walkways, beach , ocean) are very nice. However, We were extremely disappointed with the rooms and the selection of food at the buffets. The rooms, or at least the 3 rooms we had were unacceptable for a 4 star all Inclusive resort. Let me clarify that this was not a cheap trip. We booked it months in advance in order to try and take advantage of the 1 child free deal. The adult fare worked out to $1450/person, $900 for the 11 yr old and the 3 year old payed taxes only. this is not cheap. I have payed less for a 5 star in the DR and Cuba. The reef is not a 4 star resort, 3+ maybe. And I would not classify it as all inclusive, as you have to pay for bottled water, $1 u.s. for a small bottle. Of course, they might use the argument that you can drink the water at the bar and the restaurants for free, they sat that it is "filtered". I suppose you could do that , but I wouldn't recommend it as the water has a funny smell to it, and, none of us were comfortable drinking it. . The bed was as hard as a piece of plywood. The pillows were about 1" thick and just as hard as the bed. Our air conditioner was held together by "masking tape", the phone was not working, our mirror in the washroom had deteriated to the point that the silver backing had faded away and it looked like blood drops were on the mirror. Oh yes, lets not forget the smell of the rooms. Actually, there were two separate odors, one from the room itself and the other from the sewer smell that was continually around our rooms. I am not sure if it was just our rooms, but, itwas gross. Bring an air freshener with you, you will need it. Our rooms were fairly close to the front lobby located in the 500 series. The view was terrible. Ourbalcony looked onto a chain linked fence that was interwooven with green plastic. Most tropical. The fence separated our rooms from one of the main roads coming into the resort. That was special. Needles to say we did not spend any time out their.
