The food was Ok, there just wasn't enough selection, especially for dinner. They had two hot plat stations, both had the same items in them. The grill wasn't too bad, but, I think they need some tips on how to cook meat, especially chicken, they should now that medium rare is not an option. We actually tried to switch hotels, but our Alba rep told us that there was no availability. Alba is another story unto itself. Anyway, I think by now you are getting the picture. Unfortunately , We will not be returning to the Reef. "Buyer beware"

Reviews.Title: “Just Okay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a week long vacation Jan 9-16 at the Reef Club. We have stayed at the Viva Maya and Viva Azteca in previous years and looked forward with much anticipation to our trip this year. The Reef Club is a beautiful resort. The grounds are kept immaculate, the rooms clean. I do have to agree with some of the other reviews as far as lack of towels and other toiletries. The second day we had a hard time getting more towels and we were completely out of toilet paper (the room had just been cleaned). Not a big deal, just thought it odd that it was missed. The beach is completely the BEST and it is why we keep returning to the area. I got a massage on the beach and it was heaven. The one thing that we were completely disappointed with was the food and the lack of help at the various bars. Breakfast was fairly good with the omlette bar and other choices, it was easy to find something. Dinner however, a much different story. We ended up going to town 4 nights to eat and we ate one night at the Italian resturant, which was by far the best food we had at the resort. Well worth getting up and standing in line at 7am. There was only 1 bartender at the pool bar and snack bar, which meant you could wait a long time before getting what you ordered. All in all I would say it was a good trip, just not as good as we have experienced in the past. I would give the Reef a 3 star, not a 4 star. We will definitely go back to Playa del Carmen, just not to the Reef Club. Just a side point, if you need to call home there is a place in town that charges only 50 cents a minute. It is on 5th Avenue and is called "Phone Home". Also, make it a point to check out Karens resturant. Good fajitas and pizza with "real" cheese, almost like home:-) and not to forget the 2 for 1's!!

Reviews.Title: “paradise”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I loved the reef club. We were there in March 2003. My husband and I were married there. The staff was great. Both of our parents and siblings went. We could not of had a better time. The view was breath taking. Beach is great. Pools are nice. Food is okay. A great location. Just a 5 min cab ride to shops, dining. The mixed drinks were a little weak but still got the job done. We will be returning

Reviews.Title: “Not a 4 Star”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The resort was OK but I wouldn't rate it a 4 star. I would say it's a 3 star at best and that's due mainly to the food which was no better than your average cafeteria variety. It wasn't even close compared to the selection and quality of food offered at other 4 star resorts. The grounds of the resort are very nice and the room was comfortable but the walls are paper thin and you could hear every bit of noise outside. I had read some reviews that the beds were too hard. They are firm, but for me, that made for a good night's rest. They do charge extra for bottled water and for a room safe (which were included at other resorts I've stayed at). The staff was friendly, service was fine, but the drinks were just so-so and watered down. My wife and I were there at Christmas time and you'd think they would have had the resort nicely decked out but you wouldn't have even known it was Christmas except for the tree in the main lobby. The beach was the best thing about the place but even so they didn't have enought lounge chairs for all the guests. We had a great time only because it was Mexico and the weather was great, but I wouldn't stay at this resort again and I'd recommend anyone wishing to stay in the Playacar area to explore other options.

Reviews.Title: “Great value - perfect budget vacation”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I visited the Reef Club in March 2003 and had a wonderful time. The beach was amazing, the water was warm, the staff were friendly, everything was clean and the other guests were fun. There was a good mix of families, older couples and younger couples. We ate at the "fancy" Italian restaurant (the only one requiring reservations) every night except one because the food was great and the service was even better, plus it was fun to dress up for dinner! (Note: you do have to get up early to make reservations on the same day--you can't make them in advance, and if you wait too long they fill up and you're stuck with the buffet, which really wasn't bad either.) The room was fine--we didn't spend much time in it anyway--and the staff cleaned every day. We were in a room a few steps below ground level, but still had windows and a deck, which was really nice to relax on between coming in from the beach and eating dinner. We did have a few small ants in the bathroom, but they were definitely not a problem, and what do you expect in a tropical area? The rainforest-type gardens between the buildings were amazing and beautiful! We were not expecting top of the line luxury for the money we spent. The Reef Club exceeded our expectations and was absolutely a great value. We definitely hope to go back. Our only complaint was that we requested a king sized bed and ended up in a room with two doubles. We asked to be moved but it never happened. Oh well! It wasn't a huge deal and everything else about the resort definitely made up for it.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely incredible - would go back in a minute!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just got home 2 days ago from the Reef. Absolutely perfect trip. Food was good (different, but everything tasted good), staff was attentive and personable. Travel assistance on site were great - knew so much about the options available. Can't say enough good things - room was neat, clean, and didn't smell musty at all. No bugs or any other critters for that matter, and we were looking. Service at the bars was good - drinks weren't watered down, and service was good. No Corona, but other options available. Deep sea fishing was incredible at Marona, and Tulum was gorgeous. Went on a Unimog tour w/Jorge as our guide and snorkeled in the cenotes as well as attempting to do the same at the reef (wound up @ Akumal). Jorge was a great guide. I will be contacting our travel agent this week to book us back at the Reef for next year! Don't believe all the negative things that you read! This place is gorgeous, clean, and well serviced. Email me if you have any questions, and I'll help if I can. Have a FANTASTIC time - we did!

Reviews.Title: “It was okay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in Sept. 2003 and thought is was okay. The grounds are nice, it like being in a jungle with lots of lush tropical vegetation. The pool and the beach are nice and the rooms are bright and clean. The only down side was the food, with only 1 buffet restaurant and one a la carte, there wasn't much variety. I'm not picky, so I manage okay, but I could see were some people would be really disappointed. I would only stay here again if the price was right, otherwise I would pick a place with more dining options. Oh, yeah the location is good as well, its within walking distance to Playa del Carmen (about a 20 minute walk).

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Vacation”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I thoroughly enjoyed our vacation at the Reef Club from 12/3 to 12/10. We had no problems with our room, staff or other guests. Everyone we met was friendly and the mix of all the other guests from so many different countries was a pleasant suprise. The buffet restaurant " Chula Vista" always had a nice variety of food available with made to order omelettes in the morning or fresh fish being grilled in the evening. We were always able to get a dinner reservation in the Italian restaurant upstairs "Boticelli's" which we found to be excellent. The menu remained the same each day but wide selection of entree's made it easy to try something new each night. The beach was wonderful, we would position our beach chairs where we wanted them in morning before breakfast leaving our towels on them along with any other beach articles (lotion, books, magazines) and return to them later to soak up the beautiful morning sun. The Sports and Entertainment Team was always active in getting guests who wanted to participate in activites(aerobics, volleyball, pool olympics) involved. The team also does the evening show in the entertainment hall, although they are not truly professional entertainers the shows were more than entertaining and we found ourselves watching every night. After spending a week at the Reef Club I would not hesitate to book my vacation there again.

Reviews.Title: “best rate, fun resort”
Reviews.Author: biljodtyzachary
Reviews.Content: we just returned from our 4th vacation to the reef club. i will not stay anywhere else. my daughter, who is 23, and my 12 year old son accompanied me on the trip. the beach is unbelievable, and the price is great!! a lot of the entertainment staff were new since our last trip, but we became very comfortable with them quickly. they were absolutely wonderful. damien, leo, daniella, fernando, valeria, and lesley and miguel, put on a great show every night. and with lalo taking care of the lights and other extras it was first class all the way. beds were a bit hard but we did not go to sleep!!!

Reviews.Title: “best vacation ever”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: we stayed at the reef between nov16 and nov27. this was our fourth time in playa del carmen and our second time at the reef. we had stayed previously at viva azteca. we had the most fabulous vacation ever. we have travelled the caribean, europe, south america and elsewhere in mexico and nothing beats the reef. the setting of this hotel is cozy and comfortable with alot of lush vegetation that is constantly cared for by the staff. front desk staff was very friendly and easygoing. our room was very nice and had everything we needed. no loud air conditioner or bugs as i read in previous reviews. maids did great job! this hotel has a buffet restaurant which overlooks the pool and further, the ocean. the food is excellent with plenty of variety to choose from as well as different themes each night. there is also a chef to serve everything from omelettes, meat, fish, pasta and much more, cooked as you like. delicious! there is also a snack bar between the pool and the beach. there again the food was so good with good variety such as hamburgers, hot dogs, fries, pizza (the best!) different kinds of salads etc.. mr nicholas leads a team of the greatest waiters and waitresses i have ever met. these people work long hard hours and yet always have a smile on their face for you and the service they render is nothing short of impeccable. even though they say no tipping is required, we've left tips. they deserved it. there is also the a la carte restaurant il botticelli. this restaurant has a much more varied menu than last year and the food and the service are out of this world. we ate so well! then there is the animation/entertainment team lead by leslie. these people are unbelievable; they work 16 hour days, 6 days a week. they are constantly entertaining guests with sports and activities and they put on a great show at night. they are truly talented and good at what they do. the only drawback we found was that this year the animation team divided their time between another hotel and the reef so you usually did not get the same people at night that you spent time with during the day or vice versa. sometimes, animators that you spent time with one day and got to know them would not be there for days. we much prefferred it last year, in that regard, whereas we always saw the same people virtually every day and it was much more personal. this is not to say that some were better than others because all of them were fantastic. the reef is also perfectly located; easily within walking distance of playa del carmen or a $4 taxi ride away. it sits on a very long stretch of beautiful beach and the water is simply undescribable. congratulations reef club!!! you really are the best! if anyone wants any more info, please don't hesitate to email me. this place is so worth that we've already booked another stay there in 6 months and we're counting the days. laura, jose and jake we love

Reviews.Title: “Good holiday, good value!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Reef Club for 1 week (18 - 26 November 03) and overall found it very comfortable and welcoming. The location is fantastic - the beach is gorgeous, and the resort is a pleasant 1 km walk into Playa del Carmen (whereas some of the other resorts on the Playacar estate are not in walking distance from the town). I thought the room was clean and spatious with a nice balcony. The grounds were pretty, and looked quite magical at night with little fairy lights. Breakfast was good, and lunch and dinner, while not exactly gourmet, was perfectly edible. Halfway through the week, we started going to eat dinner in town, though, just because we wanted more Mexican food (the resort mainly features "international" food). The bartenders in all the bars are rushed off their feet, but still manage to refill drinks with remarkable speed. My only complaints would be: 1. the fact that there's a loud DJ by the pool and that even if you're on the beach you can still hear the stupid poolside games and activities 2. our TV started smoking, and despite telling reception 5 times over the next 2 days and being assured that "someone was on the way" nothing was ever done. My only other advice would be to avoid booking tours through the hotel or your travel company - you can book a tour to Chichen Itza for half the price through one of the many touts on Fifth Avenue in Playa. Also, we took the bus from Playa to Tulum which cost about $2 instead of paying for an expensive organized tour.

Reviews.Title: “Not at the Reef Club again....”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I went to the reef club last year in March and was not impressed. I thought the rooms were run down and we had ants to the point that they were crawling on me in the night. My girlfriend moved in the middle of the night after she was face to face with a large cock roach. I have never seen one yet while in Mexico. The food was pretty bad except if you could get in the the restaurant upstairs. Reservations were required as was a dress code. I did not feel I was at the same place when I was there. The service was incredible as was the food. I thought that the staff at the front desk were quite rude when I was not happy with my room. I did end up getting a 200.00 credit in the end but that was through my travel agent. The hotel at one pint had overbooked and they wanted us to go to Cozumel to stay at another hotel- we did not do this per advice from our Travel guide. I have stayed at the continental and was much happier there. We went there for drinks and my girlfriend said she liked just the atmosphere better. I do not think all inclusive is for us and I also think they should change the rating of this hotel. I love Playa and will go back again next year. Consider flying out of Cozumel also- we had a nine hour delay from Can Cun- I have never had such a horrible day and was never delayed in Cozumel.

Reviews.Title: “excellent setting”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I returned from the reef playacar Nov 16, 2003 and really enjoyed myself. I am a travel agent in Canada and was quite surprised with the resort. The setting of the resort is beautiful. Small 200 unit property in a jungle setting with walkways. My room was spacious (king size bed), good a/c and always clean. Any situation encounter was just a quick phone call away to the front desk and the problem was solved immediately. This is a good 3 1/2 star resort. I was surprised however at the lack of food options in the buffet, they don't have alot of options (food stations) that other resorts have but i sort of had a feeling about this from other reviews i have read. However my family of 7 was always able to find something to suit everybody's needs whether it was rice, pasta, fresh fruit, cereal yogurt, roast beef, chicken, fish, etc. Bottelli's Italian restaurant was very good, definetly worth the 630am wake up to make reservations by 7am or chances are you will not get in. We ate there twice and thoroughly enjoyed it. The staff is excellent with children. The bicycles are included but definetly need new ones and were advised they are supposed to be on their way. 15 minute walk to Playa del Carmen or $4.00 usd taxi ride. The beach is beautiful. Recommend trying to get a room in the middle of the property so you are not hearing evening noise from the swim up pool bar open late or the evening show located near the front of the property near reception. Property was always clean and staff was always working hard to keep the grounds clean and guests happy. Even though it's all inclusive we did tip based on service received. A few didn't get anything but some received more than they expected but definetly deserved it. Only one caution is that if the walkways are wet due to rain i would take your time walking as they can get slippery. I hope this helps and if you have any questions let me know i will be more than willing to help out. Remember you are on holidays in a different country and things will not be the way they are at home. If you go with an open mind you will have an excellent vacation. Adios

Reviews.Title: “Lovely stay at the Reef”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My recent stay at the Reef Club was very enjoyable. All the comments Id read prior to arriving left me a little apprehensive but I was pleasantly surprised. [I think some people are just never satisfied.] I had spent 3 days prior in Cancun and also had a very nice experience despite being told it was a crazy tourist trap. There were hardly any people at my hotel there and I had the whole pool to myself. When I arrived in Playa at the Reef I was a little surprised there were so many people. Cancun had spoiled me. Once Id adjusted to the large attendance (and I heard that during peak season its VERY crowded) I really enjoyed myself. I chatted with lovely people from all over Germans (many), Italians, Americans, British, South Americans, Mexicans and more...The beaches were clean and with turquoise water. There were snorkeling trips you could take for $25US that lasted 1 ½ hours that left from the beach at the Reef and you didnt have to spend all day doing an organized tour. You still had the rest of the day to do your own thing. I went twice because Id had such a lovely time.The staff was great. I found if you tip them a small amount for the all inclusive drinks, you get very attentive service. The room was clean and spacious. Mine was on the 3rd level. It had a small balcony on one side with two chairs overlooking the jungled walkways and a patio with two reclining lounge chairs that was very private. The air conditioner was a small wall unit which was rather loud and needed to be turned on and off as it would be too hot or too cold at times, but it wasnt that much bother to me. There was a safe deposit box in the room for an extra fee of $2US a day more you need to get the lock and key from the reception desk. The key has a $100US lost key fee so be careful. My room also had a resident iguana that lived in the lamp outside on the balcony. I rather enjoyed his company. We would respect each others space and this arrangement worked well. The food was OK. Nothing too memorable but I always found something from the assortment. Even the Italian restaurant was average. I heard the chocolate cake was very good there but I never tried it. I didnt go there for the food so I was not too disappointed. The drinks were best from the Mango Bar. The ones from the pool bars tasted a bit funky. We could not figure out why. They tasted a bit like pool water if you stick with the beer youll be OK. Beer tasted fine.As for all the American bashing I read in other reviews, I did encounter a few loud Americans but I also encountered a few loud/rude Germans, Italians, etc. But some of the most helpful and friendliest people were the Americans. I found a few of the Europeans were a bit too self superior. One good example is when we placed our towels on chairs on the beach to reserve them and returned (not long later) to find an Italian couple had moved them and taken the spots. We had been there a few days and knew this was what other people did to reserve a chair. Somehow this couple felt justified being so rude. We made them move! Later, we noticed towels in THEIR chairs and no people around. Need I say what we were tempted to do? What nerve some people have. I was very impressed with the continuous maintenance of the place. Workers were constantly cleaning walkways, painting chairs, repairing fences and attending to small details that make the place very comfortable. I have a hard time figuring out why some people complain about the place. But some of the most enjoyable parts of the trip were the chance to meet lovely people from all over the world, to take in the sights and sun of this beautiful location and to not have to go anywhere if we didnt want to as everything was provided. It was a fantastic trip and I would go gladly again.

Reviews.Title: “review the reviewers”
Reviews.Author: BournemouthBluebell
Reviews.Content: Having read the reviews of Reef Club over the past months, we had some anxieties about our stay from 7-22nd October, 2003 but took some of the advice from previous reviewers and also went with an open mind. The Reef Club is not one of the opulent and rather ostentacious hotels situated nearby. Its main charm for us was its uniqueness with accommodation in smaller, rustic buildings rather than a faceless, brick and glass showcase. The facts we found were rather different from many of the reviews. The room was fine, this "musty" smell that people complain of is that of trees and tropical vegetation to be found everywhere in such climates. We have experienced this in Cuba, India, Sri Lanka and Thailand and several other places. To us it seemed logical to expect this and took the advice of previous reviewers and took a small air freshener result = no problems. Similarly with insects/bugs this IS the jungle, we took precautions and were fine, we saw nothing at all in our room, only outside. The beds are firm but not too hard, similarly the pillows, if you want more you just ask, no problems. The room was cleaned very well daily, one day I lost an earing which rolled under a bed and I couldn't reach, that evening after cleaning it was back on the side table= shows thorough cleaning to me. The grounds are beautiful and the walkways/seating condusive to a relaxed and pleasant atmosphere. The beach is absolutely beautiful, sand fine and pristine and the water clear and safe. The food was fine, there was massive choices, quite a lot not to our tastes as we are non-meat eaters and not over-fond of very spicy food but there was never a time when we could not find something. The drinks were plentiful and varied, we found no evidence of watering down and the sizes were fine. The complaints re size are odd anyway as you just get another one!! The pools are not olympic sized and not really geared to swimming as one has mainly games in it and the other, the pool bar but they were ok and we saw no evidence of missing tiles etc apart from two tiny 1" squares, if previous complaints meant this then it beggars beleief. The staff were exceptional, everyone was friendly and courteous and worked so hard. Rooms and grounds constantly being cleaned, the waiters/waitresses polite and attentive and the bar staff so calm when being given complex orders for several cocktails at once. The front desk staff too were very helful, we saw no evidence of rudeness as cited by some previous reviewers, at least not by the staff! The entertainment team were brilliant, worked tirelessly to keep guests entertained by day and at the nightly shows. The shows were not professional standard but fine for holiday entertainment and top notch for effort. The guests were a wide mixture of nationalities which was lovely, the Italians with their excited chatter and infectious laughter were lovely, we met polite and charming groups of Dutch, Swiss and Scandanavian guests and warm, friendly Canadians. Nearly everyone seemed to gel well and it was lovely to see children of different nationalities playing together, regardless of language. However, the only negative thing for us was not the hotel, food, beds,rooms, staff or entertainment but SOME guests from a certain country. We felt it ironic that most of the negative comments from reviewers had come from America but now we know why. Some of the American guests were lovely but quite a large proportion showed the most appalling behaviours. They were rude and dismissive to staff who were trying their best, complained loudly and often about food and drink sizes, kept comparing everything to "home" and how much better service was in America, how beds were bigger/softer/nicer etc, one wondered why they travelled! We were concerned how many seemed to have a hearing problem and needed to shout at the top of their voices to people a few feet away, completely unconcerned that other guests were reading/snoozing etc. At one point we gave up trying to get a drink at the pool bar as it was often commandeered by a loud group who propped it up for hours, voicing their views on evrything. The behaviour of SOME of the American children was appalling, their table manners abysmal and whinging "I want" non-stop. One small boy was constantly climbing precariously near huge pottery ornaments, moving tables and chairs just as waiters were approaching with laden trays or wandering around near the hot food. One of our memories will be of "Chriiiiiiiiis...........as his parents yelled for him periodically!!! The reef club is a good place to holiday with many facilities, not 5* but a good 4*, out tip, take ear-plugs but not for swimming!!!

Reviews.Title: “It's a rip off!”
Reviews.Author: Eiffel_Tower
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel through a travelling agency in France for our honeymoon. It was an all-inclusive deal and was horrendously expensive for what we got. The room was old and had strange smell. Air conditioner was noisy. We asked for a double bed but got two twin beds instead. So much for the honeymoon! Buffet was just OK, not all that great. We ate all the time just to make our deal worth. The only good thing about it was that alcohol was inluded in the deal, so i ended up drinking most of the time. And they organized lots of activties in the pool and on the beach, which was fun. But for that price, you can do much better. So my advice is to go and stay somewhere else!

Reviews.Title: “Worth the trip”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Spent a week at the Reef Club. Oct. 4 / 11th 2003. Beach was great, food was very good, "lots of fruit and veggies, meat, you name it". The swimming pools we're great. The bed was hard, the room was a bit trashed but clean, water pressure was low in the shower. Overall great value for your dollar. Close to town $4.00 usd cab ride or 10 min. walk. ENJOY!!

Reviews.Title: “Quaint little resort- great for family vacation”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I took my daughter to The Reef Club for her 10th birthday and have a particularly neutral feeling about this resort. I read all the reviews and became a bit paranoid about the negative things related by other travelers. If bad things do happen, they do happen to me. = ) We were picked up at the hotel in a limo, much to our surprise (thru Lomas/FunJet) and to more of our surprise- it had an exhaust leak that we thought wed pass out from!! We arrived at the hotel about noon or so and had no problem what-so-ever getting in. Our room was ready and a eager staff member dragged our horrendously heavy bags to our room. We were given the choice of floor levels and were put in a bldg. right by the pools. He even dragged our bags upstairs! I read a lot about the A/C units and musty smells- luckily we did not have that problem. It was *plenty* cold, not noisy at all, and no musty smell. They did forget to mention, however, that you had to check out the remote to the unit at the front desk and it took us a while to get that information from them. 3 phone calls later, after being told someone would bring it right to me, we went and got it ourselves. We did have a pretty persistent ant problem. Housekeeping came in a sprayed (although what Im not sure- I didnt see any signs of what shed been making all that noise in the bathroom about) and it did no good. They werent vicious little fire ants, they were just a nuisance. Everyone is correct in saying that the grounds were kept IMMACULATELY. I thought the jungle, rainforest theme was charming- but I noticed only person mentioned the little slippery tiles. Holy Moses! One of us almost fell everytime we walked around. Barefoot wasnt too bad, but with shoes on- they were slick. The staff was very energetic and really seemed to take their jobs seriously. I got a big kick of just watching them and the way they interacted with everyone else. We were very surprised at how lingual they all seemed to be. There really werent very many other people from the States that we found although my daughter did find the only other people from Texas! It seemed that the entire country of Holland up and decided to take a vacation and come together. The drink glasses were small, but as long as you wanted- they would refill it. Sometimes it was a bit slow, but the backlog would pile up; seemingly due to the glasses being so small. I personally thought the food was horrible, but I am the 2nd pickiest eater on the continent- so dont lend much weight to my opinion of the food. My boyfriend ate just about everything they served. We did agree on the desserts- many people have noted they seemed to be filled with some liquid which rendered them soggy. My daughter and I managed to survive at the snack bar on the hot dogs and hamburgers. Of course the breads were all kind of stale and hard- but it was edible. Botticelli was a treat. We were told that you absolutely HAD to wear long pants (went into town and bought an outfit- who brings anything but shorts and sandals to Mexcio?) but discovered that it didnt have to be anything fancy, as long as you didnt show up in your shorts and sandals. I enjoyed the food, as did my daughter- who is the pickiest eater in America. The buffet restaurant service varied from day to day although it was the same staff. ??? One afternoon, we left never having gotten anything to drink. Other times, they were on us before we sat down. When we tried to approach the bat ourselves- we were told it would be brought to us, although we had to inquire again before it was. The beach *was* beautiful. Very unpopulated. We saw a handful of topless women. The first one took my daughter by surprise, then she didnt seem to notice again. We enjoyed all the night shows they offered. My daughter would get up and join the final song and dance every night and it seemed to last an eternity- but it was fun. We visited Xcaret (ish-kuh-rot) while there and although we had a good time- the website made it seem much more glorious than it was. The people in town on 5th Ave. were like little flea market guys. They would yell out, Hey family! Hey honeymooners! Hey Americans! Hey.. whatever they thought would catch your eye. They were generally able to be waved off with a no thank-you or ignoring them altogether, but if you happened to stop at one of the shops by them.look out! Especially if you went into one store- when you came out, shop owners for the next 3 blocks would say, Its my turn now! You went in there, now come in here! and the time share people would clobber you. We were able to get some waterproof sunblock from Target that was 50 SPF and some aloe vera gel made by Mossimo that really, really worked great. Id suggest taking stock in this tip! We used the $2/day safes, just to ease our minds. Nothing seemed to have been rifled thru during our outings though. All in all, Id say our trip was a success and we all had a good time. For the price we paid we were pleased. My daughter was able to stay for free and the staff really took an interest in making her stay a good one as well. I wouldnt stay here again merely because I would want to try something different and experience a new resort- but for laid back, easy-going travelers, this a hotel that does just fine. Keep an eye out for Miguel- hes a character! Please e-mail me if you have any questions or concerns- I'd be happy to help!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect family vacation on a budget”
Reviews.Author: meegaman
Reviews.Content: My family (two sons 12 and 8) and I really enjoyed the Reef Club. My husband and I have stayed at all-inclusives before, and were pleasantly surprised by the variety of different foods available at the buffets. No, not everything was to our liking, but this is another country, and you have to realize that folks generally like what they've grown up eating. The fact that there is much to choose from makes it just fine. The centerpieces were something to behold; the staff carved fancy shapes out of different fruits and vegetables. Every night there was a different selection of main courses, and a different featured meat made or carved before your eyes. The desserts were plentiful, varied and decorated beautifully, but they were probably the least enjoyable part of the meal for me. Hard to guess what the flavor would be, and their cakes were always soaked in some sort of liquid, but not liquor. The pies were really hard to identify. The rest of my family liked them. Oh well, I don't normally order them at home very often either. The wait staff was usually right there to take your drink order, except in the mornings, when it seemed like we couldn't get anyone's attention for coffee. Can't speak for lunch, as we never made it in. There was a grill with burgers, hot dogs, pizza, etc. I pigged out on the nachos every day, and loaded the chips with hot cheese, quacamole and salsa. In the restaurant we tried tipping, but weren't sure how much, or if anyone else was doing it, or if it was even effective. There is a nice Italian restaurant (Botticelli's) upstairs for which you must make reservations the morning of. I loved it, but my husband's lasagna tasted like Chef Boyardee. Have the Italian Chocolate dessert if you like hot brownie sundaes. Mmmm! The boys really enjoyed the pool (they have two, both only 4ft deep, and one is a swim up bar where all the single drinkers hung out, so we avoided that one with the kids). Why kids will swim endlessly in a pool when there's a whole beautiful ocean and powdery beach nearby is beyond me, but we were just glad they were having a good time. Don't let your kids pick up the big chlorine tablets at the bottom of the pool. The kids club was kind of cheesy with a very small swingset. But we didn't care because our boys are older. But if you expect to have your kids entertained, you might inquire further. I really couldn't speak on behalf of the kids activities, because there were only a couple other kids at the resort besides our own. There are raucous and fun activities put on by the peppy entertainment staff at various times during the day, including volleyball, water and regular aerobics, silly games, etc. and of course, the nightly "drama club" stuff they do. We were there to relax, and are a bit antisocial we admit, so we didn't do much besides enjoy watching others make fools of themselves. Hey, to each his own, right? One suggestion: bring large insulated mugs, and you will always have enough cold libations to keep you hydrated and happy. We hooked up with a wonderful waiter (Isidro) who filled them up with whatever we requested. We definitely tipped him for his efforts, and had his attention the entire week. The employees were for the most part very nice, loved the boys, and appreciated my humble efforts at speaking their language. Believe me, a little attempt to fit into their culture goes a long way. Yes, there is alot of topless activity going on. We were concerned about how the boys would take it, but after sighting the first three "pairs," they couldn't have cared less. And isn't it always the case, that the ones with the strangest bodies are the most eager to show them off. We Just explained that to many places in the world, being topless is the norm at the beach. Our room was fine, a little musty until you get the a/c going, the beds were a little firm (I didn't mind it, but my husband was sort of sore) and the pillows sort of flat. The only thing I didn't like about the room was that the pillows smelled sour. I put a handtowel over it and slept like that. Bring something to freshen the room like air freshener, incense, candle. The bathroom was very nice, roomy with lots of H2O pressure. The maids did a good job of cleaning the rooms, but we had a bad time with being short on stuff (not enough towels, no soap bars, shampoo instead of soap bars, no toilet paper, ran out of kleenex). This happened several times during the week. Twice I had to go to the front desk to request the needed items. Both times the things were brought quickly. I wonder if it was because we didn't tip the maid until the end, but by then, we were sort of ticked off about the incomplete job they did, and did not end up tipping them at all. Vicious circle, I guess. There was a room safe, which costs about $2 a day to use, and it is well worth it. We had no other problems with security. About reserving your beach chair: get up early (at least 7:30) and put them on your favorite chairs. No one will move or steal the towels. It was worth it to me to have our spot for the day. We chose a palapa (palm umbrella thing) far from the activities. Farther to walk back and forth to the bathrooms and food, but after all, it was about all the exercise I got all week. The facility itself was really beautiful in a jungle-Swiss Family Robinson sort of way. There was a wood walkway over a small ravine and a rock wall with water trickling over it. Then you meander down this cement path through lush groundcover and under the canopy of twisting trees and vines to your room, which is one of 12 in a brightly-colored three-story stucco "townhouse." At night, the path is illuminated so it takes on a magical feeling. I absolutely loved the whole set up and ambiance of the resort. The best thing about this place is that it only has 200 rooms, versus double or triple that for surrounding resorts. We were there off-peak season, and liked the fact that we didn't have to compete with other guests for anything. Lots of different nationalities represented. I thought we'd be among Americans, but was pleasantly surprised to share in the cosmopolitan air of an international destination. Although the beach was wide, had very white sand, and the water clear and warm, I was a little disappointed in that there were very few shells or fish to see. I'm a bit of a beachcomber. I found the water and sand to my liking in Cozumel, where for some reason, there were plenty of fish and shells. Even sea glass. So I was surprised that there could be such a difference only a few miles away. And the smokers have a nasty habit of dropping their butts in the sand and leaving them. Beware, you may come back from that romantic walk down the beach with cigarette butts in between your toes! Perhaps my sons and I should have made our sandcastle and decorated the top with butts instead of seaweed. Do you think they'd have gotten the hint? Second suggestion: you can never have enough 30 block, and put it on more than once a day. The stuff in the hotel boutique is about double what it is in the States, so avoid sticker shock and load up at Walmart. Okay, I think I covered it all. For a family vacation, it was great. We would definitely go back, even just the two of us, but the world is a huge place with other places to visit in our short lifetimes.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay, Good Price”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently returned from a 6 day stay at the Reef Club. We booked through Travelocity and our room was ready when we arrived around 1:30 p.m. Our room was located near in the complex near the pool and beach. I was afraid that it would be too loud, but that was never a problem. As other travelers have noted, our room was musty smelling. I came prepared with room "stick up" deodorizers and that helped the problem significantly. The resort has sort of a rain forest theme. The grounds are very well kept and it is clear that the resort staff works hard to do so. I never noticed stacks of used cups (as one might expect) or other trash on the premises. In fact, we felt that the staff worked very hard to accommodate everyone's needs and found them to be very courteous. The buffet food was average for an all-inclusive resort. We highly recommend the italian restaurant on the premises, which requires a reservation made early in the morning. However, it is worth it. There were several European guests at the resort, which we found to be a pleasant surprise. All in all, it made for a good mix of people. There are travel group representatives available on the premises to book tours to Xel-Ha, Tulum, Chichen-Itza, and other places of interest. This was very convenient. The Reef Club is certainly not as luxurious as some of the other resorts in the Playacar area. We would recommend Reef Club to those who are looking for a low-stress, safe, clean, and relaxing beach vacation.

Reviews.Title: “The Hotel was fine”
Reviews.Author: ccassese
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from the Reef Club in Playacar which we booked through Travelocity. No problem with the flight, however, when we arrived in Cancun there was no transportation to the hotel waiting for us. The taxi drivers swarmed us as did the hotel agents trying to get us to visit competing hotels. Nevertheless, we did hook up with a driver who called the hotel and the hotel said we didn't have an airport transfer, which I had paid for. Once we finally got to the hotel we worked things out with the travel agent. The hotel accomodations and food itself were fine and the employees were exceptional. This is not a high end resort but it's a very good value for the money. There seemed to be more European tourist then American to my husbands delight because the women go topless. The sad thing was how poorly the drunk, loud mouth, rude Texans acted at the pool bar.

Reviews.Title: “Sombrero's Off to Reef Club”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just got back from the Reef Club in Playa Del Carmen and had an excellent time. I read all of the bad reviews and just wanted to let everyone know what a great time we had. We spent 5 days 4 nights at the resort. I believe that a vacation is what you make it. We spent our honeymoon at a 5 star all inclusive in Cancun and I feel that Reef Club was better. The service was good, the drinks were in small cups, and the buffet was good. We ate at the Italian Restaurant and had a great meal. (We did not get the lobster which was an additional $25.00 but had excellent food) The grounds were excellent and the rooms were nice. (Who goes to Mexico to sit around and watch t.v. in there room?) We had dinner with one of the people from the show and she explained so much about the Mexican culture and customs. It was pretty neat. We were there for the Mexican Independance Day and saw all of the pride that the people have in there country. The beach was awesome. We requested a king size bed and received that with no problem and also got our room by 2:00. I will definantely go back to Reef Club it was great.

Reviews.Title: “Great Time - cheap Vacation”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay - Reef Club - really close to the Ferry for Cozmel - already planning to go again next year for a week in lieu of the three nights.Best food in Mexico!!

Reviews.Title: “4-Star... What a Great Resort”
Reviews.Author: Sandeebeach
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I just returned from our 7-day stay at the Reef Club Aug 30-Sept 6th 2003. This is our first all inclusive resort we've ever been to so we went with an open mind and knowledge that this was definitely not going to be like Toronto! We travelled via Sunquest Tours & we picked up immediately from the airport to our resort. There were no lines at check-in, our rooms were ready, and the front desk & bell-boy was quick with our luggage and getting us settled in. There definitely was a musty smell in the air (don't forget you're in a tropical & damp environment), but nothing a little bit of air-freshner and some time with the a/c turned on couldn't fix. Overall, we had a great time... sports & entertainment team were energetic and always trying to get the guests involved in the activities, the Botecelli Restaurant was delicious & the service was great. Everyone working at the resort was friendly and made a huge effort in keeping guests happy (even at smoldering temperatures of 40 degrees Celsius!)... well derserved of the tips they earned from us! The evening shows are also worth watching... great costumes and fun for people of all ages! Also, the jungle like ground decoration made the walk between buffet really enjoyable. There was always people keeping the place tidy or trimming the hedges. Finally... the beach. Definitely the jewel of the whole place! White sandy beaches, & aqua blue/green water. The resort had big huge soft towels and it was perfect for lying on it or drying yourself off... so relaxing! Resort was filled with 70% Europeans, 15% Americans & Canadians, 15% Mexicans. It wasn't very packed .. probably 'cuz everyone was back at work/school. We did ask for a room change (because our telephone line was broken for three days in a row, after they came in each day to fix it), and ended up with a room on the third floor that had its own roof-top balcony. Very romantic! The front desk was very accomodating and gave us no problems when we requested a room change. :) Some tips: - do bring your own air-freshner - book Botecelli restaurant early in the morning (worth waking up for) - buy a set of snorkelling mask & tube from Canadian Tire/Walmart - bring a reuseable underwater camera (we borrowed one from a friend) - buy Pesos in your own country from your bank (cheaper than the exchange rates offered in Mexico ), and -don't buy day trip packages from the hotel (buy it in town where it's much cheaper and equally safe). Our day trip package of Tulum/Xel-ha was offered for $96 US all inclusive/person at the hotel, and we bought it in Playa Del Carmen for $62 US all inclusive/person from an lcoal agency that had a store front establishment. We also rented a 125 CC red new scooter once we got onto Cozumel for $20 US for the day, zipped down to Chakanaab Eco-Park (20 min scooter ride), paid $10 US entrance fee each, brought our own snorkelling stuff, and went snorkelling for free. The Reefs & fish were so nice there and i couldn't believe it was so cheap! :) Bon Voyage & enjoy your vacation! We sure did... :) Thanks Reef Club!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Budget Resort”
Reviews.Author: TNTIII
Reviews.Content: Returned Sept. 3rd from a six night stay at the Reef Club. The resort is very lovely, set around a cenote and a spectacular, uncrowded beach. The rooms are very adequate, and we were lucky to have a third floor room with a balcony facing in towards the grounds of the resort. When we arrived we were assigned a second floor room with a balcony that faced the street, but the next day my husband went to reception and nicely asked if it were at all possible to change rooms, and without any hesitation, the manager moved us! We did not find either of the rooms to smell musty, although the rooms on the ground floor near the cenoto might, as that area does have a musty odor. The grounds and atmosphere surrounding the rooms are very tropical and extremely pretty, and beautifully lighted at night. The kissing chairs scattered throughout the property are very charming! The entire resort is extremely clean and well cared for thanks to the hard work of the staff. We did not avail ourselves of all the activities the resort has to offer as we were off property several days exploring the area on our own, but when there found the beach staff, maids, and especially the wait staff all very friendly, helpfull and extremely hard working. Even though this is "all inclusive" it is nice to tip the workers a few dollars here and there. They make very little money, and are so appreciative of anything you give them. We tip the maid as soon as we see her upon arrival, and then again at the end of our stay. We would leave a dollar at breakfast, and a couple at dinner, and more in the sit down restaurant. This was our third trip to the Playacar area and we have always found the people here to be warm, kind and very friendly. There are only two areas for improvement which would make this a better resort. The first is the pools which are very small and not inviting for swimming (but then there is that beautiful ocean!), and for us this did not matter, but it might for others. The second is the food. We never went hungry, but having stayed at other all inclusives where the food was much better both in variety and preparation, we feel there is room for improvement, especially since this is a smaller resort. We had no problem getting reservations at Boticelli's and had three meals here. The food was much better than at the buffet, but not what we would call outstanding. They only change the menu once a week--every Monday, and the choices are limited. The service and the setting however were wonderful. Despite almost three full days of rain, we had a lovely time and are already planning to return to Playacar again, but in June as we have in the past and when the weather is usually better! However, we will pay the extra money and stay at either the Allegro or the Gala where we know the food is better.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for our family”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Reef Club was perfect for our family of five. The front desk was polite when we were advised we could not get adjoining rooms so they upgraded us to a suite with an ocean view. The food was not perfect all the time, but I appreciated the fact that they seemed to try and appease all nationalilties. I was always amazed at what a great job the waiters and waitress were at every meal, It was as if they were watching you to see when and where you were going to sit so they could be right there to take your beverage order, regardless of how crowded the resturant was. The food in the Italian resturant was fabulous as was the service. It was most definetly a $300 meal for my family of 5 which we paid $15 for and that was for the bottle of excellent wine we purchased. It really is worth getting up a little early one day to make the reservations for this meal. The bartenders in the pool bar can be a little crabbey and slow sometimes but they work very hard and have to put up with some pretty rude guests, it helps to give them a few pesos every once in while. I did experience some very rude guests at the hotel, and they were always Americans! Very embarassing. The price was definitly right for what we got. There was only one thing I found disappointing about our stay in Playcar and that was the timeshare folks. They actually grabbed us as soon as we picked up our luggage at the airport. They are very slick and make you believe they are with the airport and are there to help you. When we went in to town we were accosted every ten feet by these guys. They really need to do something about that. It got to the point where we did not want to go to town because we didn't want to put up with them. The Reef Club is great about keeping people away from you that are trying to sell things. The beach was beautiful and very clean. The only little complaint I have and I realize the hotel has no control over this, but they really do stress a family atmosphere, and there are hotels all over that cater to individuals who want to sunbath European style but there they were, right on the Reef Club beach. I'm sure my sixteen year old had lots to tell his friends, and it wasn't about the fish!

Reviews.Title: “Four or Five Stars? Where did they stay?”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed the week of August 24th, 2003. We are active, physically fit, middle-aged Californians, well traveled in Mexico, especially the dive-resort vacation spots. We go for the scuba diving primarily, and have always enjoyed Mexican Resorts and diving even under less than ideal conditions (think La Ceiba back in the day!). We love Mexico, and feel that the Mexican people in general are wonderful, honest, and very hard working.Reef Club and Sun Trips booked us on the Red Eye flight from Oakland, and when we arrived after being up for over 30 hours, we were informed that our room would not available for hours. Dead tired, hot, sweaty, and still in the same clothes Get me to my room! Outrageous. The front desk staff should ALL be fired. They were rude, condescending, arrogant, untruthful, and not at all helpful.When we finally did get to our room in the mid-afternoon, we were very disappointed with the condition of the room itself. Everything was second-class. A hard but clean bed, fraying at all edges of the box spring, was adequate. Pitiful decorations hung on the wall. The bathroom mirror was in poor condition, and a very noticeable rust stain took up the middle of the floor. Towels were clean, big and fluffy. To any of the ladies who might read this, there was not a single power outlet in the bathroom. To dry her hair, my wife had to use the outlet next to the bed, and stretch over to the mirrored closet door to see herself. Very annoying. The cheapest 19 TV sat on the desk, and very loud A/C unit that mostly worked kept the room fairly cool.My wife was very happy that they did have a bathtub, but when she ran the tap, it filled the tub with a brownish-yellowish colored liquid, that was not noticeable when you took a shower.The overall condition of the property presents well, with a lush Polynesian thatched roof décor. Beware, however, of the extremely dangerous conditions of the super-slippery tiles that are everywhere. I had several serious near-falls, and saw one elderly gentleman take a very hard spill at the entrance to the upstairs bar and pool table area. The restaurant was especially dangerous, although they always put up Wet Floor signs.The pools were OK (tiles missing all along the edges), and the beach was one of the best weve seen. The guests that we met were varied, but the all-inclusive policy may have a flaw. All the booze you can drink. A group of particularly expressive Germans assaulted the pool area every day from dawn to dusk, mostly loud and drunken partiers. In the right frame of mind, they could be fun. Otherwise, they could be annoying.The worst case by far was the two young studs from either New York or New Jersey (judging by their accents). From the pencil thin goatee/beards, the dangling gold chains, the pair of earrings, tattoos, they were a sight to see.Unfortunately for everyone else, they had no understanding of how to behave in a public place, and were a source of endlessly spewing profanity and vulgarity. Every other word was proceeded by ******* this and mother ****** that. If you had the misfortune to sit anywhere near them in the restaurant, you were offended and embarrassed at being an American. The last straw was the disgustingly loud belch that ripped at breakfast on the last day. They just laughed at their own rudeness. No lifeguards at the pools and no one in charge to keep these clowns in line.The staff were all very nice, but seriously inexperienced. You had to routinely flag down a waiter/waitress for service. The food was simply horrible. Few choices, and almost always the same food, often repeated from lunch to dinner. The only way they know how to cook eggs is to burn them.I read another review about the Buticeelli Restaurant, and made and cancelled reservations there. I would have been very upset if they had charged me for eating there, but $200 for a lobster dinner at an All Inclusive is just too much. Yes, the power went out, the TV cable went out, but I expect that in Mexico, no big deal.As for the diving, the Dive Staff on the premises is good. Some good personalities and a real effort to make things go right. To be honest, the diving was not that good, especially compared to Cozumel, just 40 minutes away. The weather was stormy, and the visibility was about 50 feet. The dive boat was crappy, but they did not overfill it. The ladder was broken, so you had to take off all equipment in the water every time you got back onto the boat. Service on the boat was non-existent except for the help you got checking your equipment. I asked the Captain if he would hand me my camera after I rolled into the water. He looked at me with disgust, grunted out loud, and pointed to the back of the boat, whatever the heck that meant. Sorry, my mistake. One of the non-diver guests helped me out.In all of our dive experiences, they always provided plenty of liquid refreshment, including water, juice, and soda, as well as an assortment of breads, croissants, cheeses, and cold cuts, for between dives. Here, you were lucky to get warm bottled water, and they always ran out before the trip was over. They even ran out of air tanks, and the photographer could not go on the last dive. Organization not a strong suit.Dive masters were good, with Van leading the pack. He has a real good touch with the kids so he is the guy if you want you son or daughter to take up diving. Manuel was good, but was so laid back I could swear he actually fell asleep underwater during our drift diving, hands folded across his chest, eyes closed, floating exactly two or three feet off the bottom, with perfect buoyancy control. Ricardo took pictures, and did a good job for a very reasonable price.We took several trips into town and were routinely accosted by the locals plying us with free this and cheap that, always sounding too good to be true, but when you asked a question or two, you found that sure, you would get the deal, but had to sit thru a time-share presentation. As if. One particularly suave gentleman stopped us on the beach and had us fully engaged, and was teaching my wife to speak to me in Spanish in a fun and very romantic manner.He liked us so much that he invited us to breakfast the next morning, and he would comp us at any event, whether excursion to the ruins, and full dive trips. WOW! Really, youll pay for us to go diving in Cozumel? Sure will, be here in the morning and after the presentation presentation? What presentation? Oh, didnt I mention, you get the freebie AFTER the presentation. No thanks. Ive heard that this presentation can be very forceful, and stressful, trying to get you to sign up for a time-share.Well, enough already, if youve read this far you must really want to go, so go and try and have a good time. My suggestion, save a few more bucks and go to Columbus Isle in San Salvador to relax and dive, or try Cozumel if you really want Mexico and diving.

Reviews.Title: “Reef club great for open minded people”
Reviews.Author: JeremyF
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from celebrating our 3rd anniversary at the Reef Club in Playa del Carmen in August and we had a fantastic time. We have done our fair share of traveling around the world and have lived abroad twice, and after reading the negative reviews some people posted on this site, they couldnt be further from the truth and I have a strong suspicion many of those were from people who are too picky and perhaps have no sense of what it means to appreciate different countries and cultures. First of all, you are traveling to another country, Mexico, and although a lot of people do speak English, this is not America so for those who complained about the language, next time go to Orlando. Yes, the food is different, but remember you did not pay for a Ritz Carlton vacation, so why should you expect that type of food. We ate with people from Mexico, USA, Canada and many Europeans and everyone we met was able to find something they liked at the buffet which basically had everything, its normal all-inclusive resort food, nothing better, nothing worse. The great thing about the hotel is its a 10 minute walk or 4 dollar cab ride to town, which has tons of delicious, cheap restaurants so try them out a couple of nights for dinner, you wont be disappointed. The rooms are great for the price (we got upgraded) and had no bugs, A/C was working almost too well, we had to turn it off at night, we brought an air freshner but really did not experience anything about the musty smell. Also, it seemed that many complaints came from people who think all-inclusive means all-me or leave your manners at home, the workers at the Reef club work their butts off, every one of them, to make your vacation enjoyable, so enjoy it and respect them and the culture that you are visiting. Although it might not make a huge difference, dont be afraid to give these guys a couple of bucks in tips, they certainly deserve it. Much has been said about the Reef Club in these reviews, so all I want to add is that this hotel is a great deal, very charming with spectacular views and one of the better beaches on the strip (certainly the least crowded!) if you show the same respect and kindness to the people at the hotel that you expect, you will have a great time. We walked into several other hotels and felt the most comfortable at the Reef (it is also smaller and more charming), we saw two weddings, several anniversaries (including ours) , honeymoons and many family vacationers at the Reef Club, so it has something for everyone, unless you are the type to complain about everything that is different from what your are used to, in which case I suggest you go to Disney or stay home.

Reviews.Title: “...Reef Club is very nice..”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just came back for a 7 days vacation and stayed at the Reef. We loved it there. The workers are all nice and polite. We had all inclusive which i think was great. The food was alright. The Italian food was supposed to be good but we didn't have the chance to go because you have to call at 7:30 am to make a reservation which was too early for us to wake up. Facility was awesome..its clean and huge. My boyfriend and I liked it there a lot...for couples its very romantic. There a lot of things for kids to do too. They cater for all ages. For the money we paid, its well worth it. I will definetely recommend this to friends and families. Our over all trip was excellent except for people that were trying to sell time shares..PLS AVOID THESE PEOPLE. The reef club is very good trying to protect you from those people but when you're outside the hotel, they can sweet talk you so just watch out. You should see the REEF CLUB for yourself. We will definetely come back. THANKS REEF CLUB!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Wedding at the Reef on Aug 12 2003”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We got married in beautiful Playa del Carmen and it was perfect. This is the place to go if you have a group since the place is beautiful and small. The hotel was nice enough to upgrade us so we were close to the pool and beach. We had a fabulous time. The people were friendly and always served us with a smile - special thanks to Yara and Fernando(Papacito). The Reef Club entertainers are awesome! Make sure to check them out. There were a few unexpected surprises but for the most part, the Reef was great. FYI - most of us got sick, make sure you get antibiotics from your doctor before you go since it works like a miracle.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible Beach”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went on our honeymoon at the Reef Club Aug17-24. Our room had flower petals all over the bed and on the floor in a shape of a heart with 2 swan towels on the bed. It was very nice. The room was extremmly clean as well as the grounds. The bed was hard but really it didn't bother me and the A/C worked a little to well, the room was a little musty but its so humid and right in the jungle I don't think much could be done to prevent this The workers at the hotel were very friendly. WE never had any problems with anything or anyone. Never had a bug in the room never even saw or got bit by a mosquito! The beach is the best one along the shore line there, Crystal blue water soft white sand. Never had a problem finding a lounge chair at anytime of the day. We never bothered with the towel thing as we just brought our own. The food was good, lots of fresh fruit and a good selection if you want to try something new. The drinks are in normal bar sizes and I never had a problem with weak drinks, if anything some were a little strong, but whos complaining! The Italine resturant was great we had excelent service and great food, you can have lobster for a $230 peso or $23 US surcharge. The Reef Club isn't the Ritz Carlton but it's a friendly little place to relax and have fun. We did a tour to Coba which including going in the jungle to look for monkeys and also to visit a mayan Village. Coba was amazing climbing the tallest pyramid in mexico and seeing the veiw was spectacular. Do wear runners with socks as I wore sandles and i got bit by some kind of ant and it felt like a bee sting for about 5 hours. Also I would pack some kind of snack even though lunch is included If your a picky eater like me you maybe starving after lunch. The town of Playa del carmen is bustling with tourists and has a carefree atmosphere. The only complaint I have about my trip was having to leave. If you Go to to the reef club go with a carefree attitude and you'll have a wonderful amazing experiance with a lifetime of special memories.

Reviews.Title: “Great cheap get-away”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: (Stay: Aug. 21-24, 2003) If you're looking for the perfect, lavish, honeymoon-type hotel in Playacar, this is not it. However, if you're looking to get away from it all for a few days with family or friends for a low price, the Reef Club is a good bet. The beach was beautiful and the hotel is only a 15 minute walk (or $5 cab ride) to 5th Avenue in Playa del Carmen for great shopping. Fun Jet took great care of us and overall, the trip was awesome. The Italian restaurant at the Reef Club was absolutely delicious, however, only about half of the hotel's buffet looked appetizing. Not one single staff member treated us rudely. They were always friendly and helpful. The beds were hard, but I'm under the impression that this is the standard in Mexico. (I visited the Riu Palace for a wedding and their beds were hard too!) For the low all-inclusive price we paid, I was happy with the Reef Club. It is the perfect place if your main reason for going to Mexico is to relax on the beach without blowing your wallet!

Reviews.Title: “We loved the Reef Club Playacar”
Reviews.Author: swimmer1
Reviews.Content: We loved the Reef Club Playacar. We stayed there 10 days, 9 nights, through Apple Vacations May 10 -May 19, 2003. We got an outstanding deal - $1,022 each, all-inclusive, including all taxes, fees, and trip insurance, Indianapolis, IN to Cancun, with a l-hr. layover in Charlotte, NC, via US Airways. When we checked in around noon, we did not even have to wait for our room, as is usually the case. We requested a room on the 2nd or 3rd floor; we had read about the occasional ant problems at this site. They gave us a room on the 3rd floor about half way between the front lobby and the beach. It was only about a 2 minute walk to either one. The room was quite spacious and had 2 double beds, which we did not find too hard. The air conditioner was truly wonderful - never too warm! There was plenty of closet and drawer space and a wonderful, spacious bathroom and shower. The beach was the Reef's crown jewel, broad and uncrowded. The beautiful Caribbean Sea was various wonderful shades of turquoise. The 1st day of the trip we had huge waves - I loved it! I had been a little worried about never having any waves due to Cozumel being offshore. We have always loved the Cancun waves for body surfing. We have been to Cancun 7 times, visiting Playa only on day trips. We first saw Playa del Carmen in 1986, on our first trip to Mexico. The changes that have occured over the years are unbelievable! Playa is totally different than it was back in the 80's and 90's. The beaches in Playacar are still magnificant, but we were a little disappointed in some of the beaches downtown, compared to how they used to be. There seemed to be a lot more seaweed and a lot more boats. Also, they seemed much more crowded. On this trip, the ocean varied by the day. Some days there were fantastic body surfing waves; other days were great for just swimming. The whole time we were there, though, we had the wonderful swells. Each morning we went out to put our towells on the chairs with palapas around 7:00 A.M. By doing this, we always had shade. We would never be gone for long periods and still reserve the palapas. To us, that seemed unfair. All of the Reef Club's employees were very helpful and friendly. They all work so hard and appreciate any tips so much. Definitely take insulated mugs for the beach. They will not only refill them for you, but will rinse them out if needed. The buffet at the Reef Club was OK, not outstanding; there was always a good variety of food. We would have liked more Mexican dishes. Some of the chicken and fish dishes were OK. Breakfast was probably the best of all the meals. The made to order omelettes were outstanding. The chocolate ice cream available at the bar was also great. Botticelli's, the Italian restaurant that you made reservations for at 7:00-7:30 A.M. on the morning that you wanted to eat there for that night, had excellent Italian food but poor and very slow service. The snack bar by the pool had good burgers, hotdogs, pizza and nachos. We have done a lot of side trips and excursions on our other 7 trips to the Mexican Yucatan, including Cozumel, Chichen Itza, Coba, Tulum, Xcaret, Xel-ha, the jungle tour, and various snorkeling tours. This time we just wanted to enjoy things on our own. We used the Reef Club's bikes 1 day, took a bus shopping trip to Cancun another day, explored the other hotels' beaches via walking the beach, and walked into Playa nearly every day. We thoroughly enjoyed the beautiful Caribbean and magnificent beach every day and the pool a few times. We took the free scuba lesson in the pool and plan on doing more scuba on a future trip. The pool was a great place to meet people from all over the world, but it got quite warm in the afternoon. I much preferred the refreshing Caribbean to swim in. The one thing we did outside the resort that cost more than a few dollars was to hire a taxi to take us to Paamul to snorkel. He could either wait on us or pick us up 3 hours later. The Reef Club found us an English speaking driver for $10 per hour. We thought this was a really good price because we paid that on Cozumel 5 years ago. Paamul was wonderful - we saw lots of various kinds of fish and beautiful living coral. The day we went, we were the only people snorkeling. We swam out to where the waves were breaking, but there were fish and living coral even before we got there. We also met some American RV's here - Tom & Susan, who showed us the wonderful palapa they had attached to their RV. We also met several other nice people there. Tom & Susan and the others were all extremely friendly and helpful. We really enjoyed chatting with them. We plan on returning to Playa del Carmen next April or May, hopefully staying at the Reef Club again, and definitely returning to Paamul. We would also like to use the Collectivos to go there and other places, Akumal, etc. We have checked out the prices of some reasonable downtown hotels, and don't really see how a person can beat an all-inclusive deal. We usually go through Apple or Funjet out of Chicago or Indianapolis. Even if you get a nice air-conditioned hotel for $35-$40 per night, by the time you add on airfare, taxes, fees, meals, drinks, and all the other things that are included in an all-inclusive package, it has always came to a lot more. Plus, we saw no downtown beaches that even came close to being as nice as the Reef Club Playacar's beach. We did eat downtown once; it was OK, not spectacular. But we will do that again on future trips occasionally as a change of pace. We cannot wait to return to the Reef Club Playacar and Playa del Carmen.

Reviews.Title: “National Lampoon Honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We spent our honeymoon at the Reef Club in late July. Neither of us had ever been to Mexico before. I read all the reveiws on this site and thought the Reef Club sounded nice. The whole jungle setting of the Reef Club is beautiful. Remember, jungle means bugs! We were eaten alive by mosquitos. We saw a baby scorpion, lots of lizards and a cock roach that was big enough to saddle up and ride. Our room was located in the first building closest to the pool. We liked the location, but our room had two double beds instead of one king. We asked about switching, but we were told that our building had the "best" rooms and they all had two beds instead of one. We found this hard to believe, but went along with it. The first day we were there, the room across the hall was robbed. I was warning another guy at the swim up bar about the robery and he said that his son's room had been robbed earlier in the week. The first day we were there, you couldn't have pried us away from the gorgeous, soft sandy beach. The water really is that blue!! It's absolutely breathtaking and was worth the trip. However, my husband got sun burned and we had to stay in our room the next day. There were people constantly knocking on the door and barging in. (They only knock once and then the door swings wide open - Use the chain on the door when you are in your room.) Anyway, they have people with towels, people with plants, people cleaning, the exterminator, etc. After all that, I wasn't surprised at all that the rooms get robbed. I will say that the rooms were very clean and the grounds were very well kept. People were contantly working.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The vacation of a lifetime! The reef club was great, it has a beautiful atmosphere. The beach was incredible. I think that some people are just too picky. The beds were fine, a little firm. The drink servings are small, just bring your own mug and they'll fill it up. The marina staff are great. The people at the front desk were very helpful. The rooms were very pretty. The noise level of the air conditioners were not a problem. Some of the food was not so good, but you have to remember you're in a different country. Food is prepared different and they have stuff you may not be used to eating. I always found something to eat. The Italian restuarant is worth getting up early to make reservations. We will definantly stay at the Reef Club again!

Reviews.Title: “Great week, 7/27-8/4”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful week at the Reef Club. Twenty-four of us - 17 adults and 7 young adults ages 17 to 21 - had a memorable time. The Reef Club offers so much to make your stay happy that it was like being on a cruise ship! The location is excellent, the food was great, water is drinkable though bottled water is offered for those who wish to be extra careful, great activities are available, the kids loved being independent and we loved know they were very safe. (Security personnel are all over but very discreet.) The hotel workers really try hard to make you comfortable. They are so warm and welcoming. Throughout the week, we saw other resorts, etc., but none looked as good as the Reef Club Playacar. Our young adults had the oppurtunity to meet other people their own ages from Canada, France, Germany, England, Spain, etc., we had no idea that this is such an international destination! They'd meet around the upper pool in the evening, enjoy pizza, hotdogs, nachos, hamburgers and any kind of drink available til 2am, talk and walk on the beach till dawn. My memories will be of carribean blue water, soft white sand, laughter, abundant food, warmth and relaxation. And lots and lots of smiles!! I will recommend the Reef Club Playacar to anyone who wishes to enjoy the best of the Yucatan.

Reviews.Title: “Just our opinion”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We returned from Reef Club on 8/3/03 and overall enjoyed our vacation. The beach was absolutely beautiful and we will definitely return to the area. However, we will most likely try a different resort. Keep in mind that we were a group of young married couples with no children. Positive: Beach absolutely beautiful Friendly staff Entertainment Kids there seemed to be having a blast (most activities geared towards them) Italian restaurant (but needed to get up by 7 am to make reservations) Snack bar Many water sports (most of them free) Had adjoining rooms, but were supposed to have two kings and got one room with two doubles Grounds are nice and well kept Close to Playa del Carmen, can walk, but we took cab for $4-5 Negative: Front Desk (rude, practically forced you out by 12 pm, but rooms never ready when you get there AFTER the 3 pm checkin time) Cleaning (hit & miss probably overworked bathtub was dirty from day 1 and took towels in the morning and didn't bring back until late afternoon) No indoor bar or place to cool off A/C ran continuously, never got cool Musty rooms even w/air freshener Mixed drinks not good Served drinks in small glasses at pool and reluctant to fill your insulated mugs Food (could find good things, but got sick of eating them all week) All of us felt ill at some point, one guy all week long Don't do boat tour to Isla Mujeres, not worth it There is no 'quiet pool' like their website says Safe deposit box costs $2 a day No mini fridge which we knew going in, but it is definitely something we want next time We were looking for an affordable vacation which is what we got. You never know for sure until you try it and once you have some experience, you can choose what amenities are most important to you! Have fun!

Reviews.Title: “Playa Del Carmen is a great Place”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
