Reviews.Content: My Husband and I stayed at the Reef Club and had a fabulous time in Playa del Carmen, I will definately return to the area but don't think I will stay at the reef club again, The staff is friendly however with the beautiful setting of villas, each rrom has individual window type air conditioners and they are loud. Access to our room was given to maintenance personnel without our permission or notice and our room was left with the door wide open with no one in the room we had some belongings stolen and when we went to the front desk they assumed no responsibility for the stolen items even though it was their staff who left our door open. - - Not a warm & fuzzy feeling. I don't think we will return to the Reef Club but I will definately return to the village of Playa Del Carmen!

Reviews.Title: “Ok resort but nothing special”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just returned from the reef club. The resort is fairly nice, the food is marginal except at he Italian restaraunt. That food was excellent but they make it tough to get a reservation. The pool with the swim up bar was kinda gross...people eatingin the pool and it was very dirty by the end of the day. Don't rent a car at the front desk rental agency...you can get the same car delivered by Hertz for less than half. The people at the front desk are not very helpful..they will give you any answer to make you go away. WE asked several people if the ferry o cozumel was running and they told us no but it actually was. We also had luggage that didn't arrive and it was difficult to get their help in getting it back to us. The beach was nice though and the rooms were fine. Wouldn't do back though.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Beach, BAD hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: starbucks_mommy
Reviews.Content: THIS HOTEL IS THE PITS!!!! My husband and I and 3 kids stayed for 8 days July 16-23. The food was horrible! Not many choices and not very good at all. This was the very LEAST of our problems! To begin with, the running water in the hotel sink and shower both had a very foul smell - we brushed our teeth with bottled water it was so disgusting. Maintenance came on 2 occasions because of shower problems and again to fix the toilet. It never did get fixed, it ran the whole time producing a running water sound. The 5th day into our vacation the ELECTRICITY went OUT!!!! It was out for over 3 hours. We called the front desk who said a power line blew throughout the island. This was not true, the a/c units and lights across the way were on the whole time, also the lit up walkway and pool outside our room was lit. It was apparently our wing. (3 hours can seem like an eternity in the dark with no a/c and 3 frightened children under 6 yrs old at bedtime) The next morning the hot water wasn't working - we began to lose our patience at this point and called the front desk manager but were brushed off. Lastly, there were bugs, so many the exterminator came. With all that said, I will mention the one good thing - the staff. They were all very kind and friendly and really helped us try and enjoy ourselves inspite of the poor conditions. The beach was beautiful and the pools were nice, but I still wouldn't recommend this place unless you first knew that you were getting a super value hotel, not a 5 star property as it was listed with our agent!

Reviews.Title: “Great Family Get-Away”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Our family of four just returned from a 5 day stay at the Reef Club. We had a great time. The rooms were quite clean and adequate space for a family of four. I do suggest you take a bag of swimsuits etc. if arriving prior to the 3:00 p.m. check-in time-- they will store your luggage, but it is very hot so you'll want to enjoy the pool and beach. The beach is beautiful and very close to the pool and your room. There is even a great place to snorkel just a short swim away from shore. I was pleased with the food and service. The food is all prepared well and is very fresh. I was, however, disappointed in the lack of seafood choices. The carving and omelette stations were good. We constantly drank iced tea and water and all remained well! The bartenders do a good job. We did tip some, but it didn't particularly change the quality of the drinks. The entertainment staff works hard and does an awesome job! If you elect to do side trips-- our family highly recommends the Xel-ha/Tulum Combination trip. Xel-ha is magnificent. We also went to Xcaret-- I'm glad we've been, but it was extremely crowded! It is very hot and humid so we recommend keeping the air on continuously-- take several changes of clothes each day as nothing ever seems to totally dry. There are no alarm clocks so if you plan an early excursion, take a travel clock. We would definitely stay at the Reef Club again--it's small villa atmosphere makes it very attractive.

Reviews.Title: “Do not eat the lobster”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We (9 girls) stayed at the Reef Club July 17-20. We enjoyed the hotel, food, drinks, staff, pool, beach and even the damp rooms. What we did not enjoy is that at check out time we were told that we had a $200 bill for the lobster dinner we had on our second night at the Buticelli restaurant. We were never told that there would be an extra charge. The waiter never said a word. We specifically asked what the special was and he said steak and lobster, great that's what we all had . We enjoyed our meal, skipped desert and left the waiter an unusually large tip. This is an all inclusive hotel, who would have ever thought they would charge you for the lobster. Unfortunately, this was a very bad end to our trip. None of us will be returning. Bad news for them. We have alot of friends that travel.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed the week”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently came back from a one week stay at the Reef Club and for the most part enjoyed the time there. Initially we were assigned a room with 2-full size beds but were able to get a king size bed the 2nd night without a hassle. The room was fairly clean although the bedroom curtain was a little scummy and the beds were hard. The room smelled musty at first but a little Lysol and airing out took care of it. We found it necessary to keep the AC on all the time to reduce the humidity and it worked very well (although it was a bit too cool). Housekeeping was very good as we were always promptly provided fresh towels. There were even a couple of days when we returned to the room to find the towels folded into swans. Bottled water was $1 but you can refill with purified water at the dining room and bars but the taste wasn't the best. We liked the fact that the resort was small since it did not seem to be overly crowded. The folks there seemed pleasant, not especially friendly, but generally helpful and polite. The resort staff seemed to be laid back with the service but didn't mind letting us know when it was time to leave. The hotel grounds were very clean (constantly being groomed by the workers) and the beach was definitely a plus. The location was conveniently 15min walk from Playa Del Carmen through the beautiful streets of Playacar. It's worth the walk vs the $4 cab ride and you can catch the ferry to Cozumel or bus (and onboard movie) to Tulum for a few bucks. The total trip to the Mayan ruins will set you back about $9 per person vs the $40 the tour folks wanted. Of course you don't get the guided tour but for us it's more fun to explore on our own. Watch out for the mosquitoes in the shade at Tulum - they'll feast on you - stay in the open sunlight. If you can, take a dive excursion with the onsite dive service ($85) to Tortugas reef to see the turtles and the tarpon. Be sure to pay when you sign up vs billing to your room or the exchange rate will almost work against you when you settle up at checkout - funny how that works. The food was typical buffet style menu - good but nothing special. The best part of lunch/dinner was that at the carving table there was a better option - roast beef, grilled chicken/beef, pork, pasta. The rest of the meal usually was bland for our taste but adequate; usuallya few meat dishes plus veggies, salad fixings (but the dressings were tasteless) and fruit, but little Mexican food. Usually there were ice cream cones (grainy but a nice treat) at lunch time. Dessert was not that appealing and breakfast buffet got monotonous. The snack bar had burgers and the like, but we didn't sample too much of that. For the most part the food was a little oily and bland so we were ready for home cooking and good ol' American style food toward the end; don't expect too much chocolate there. Bars were okay but the bartenders' skills limited drink choices and the quality of the drinks seemed to vary with every trip to the bar. The servers and bartenders seemed to appreciate the occasional tip but didn't seem to have any real influence as we, for the most part, received slow (hey it's a resort) but reasonable service. Judging from the experience by other folks at different resorts on our way home, we were glad that we were at the Reef Club. Still we'd probably try a different resort in Playacar next time just for a different experience. If you need more details send me an email and I'll be happy to tell more.

Reviews.Title: “Great Time, Great Resort!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just got back from the Reef Club in Playacar (Playa del Carmen). We went on our honeymoon and stayed there from 7/6 till 7/12. First, the Staff was fantastic. They catered to every need we had. The grounds are beautiful. The room was small and had a musty smell, but that is from the lush foliage around the area, however the rooms were kept very clean. The food is what is expected from a buffet and all inclusive. Lets understand they are trying to cook for over 200 people. The beach was clean and beautiful. The walk to Playa del Carmen was short, about 15 minutes. Either on the beach or streets you can see some nice sites. I just read a review were the person said they were hassled to view the resorts time shares. This is very true, BUT NOT FROM the staff of the Reef Club. When in town or on the beach, beware, many, many people will ask you to come view their resort and they'll give you something in return. We went to the Fishermans village. It is a very nice resort, but very expensive. They did however give us what we asked for, for the time we had spent there ( Which was $100 US cash, two T-shirts and two bottles of tequilla). Yes we did get that for an hour and a half of time. The hawkers are very pushy and cutthroat. Learn to say "NO" and keep walking or they will follow you all over town. We even got clipped by Tropical Storm Claudette and still the vacation was great. We will definately go back, and we will bring our kids the next time we go.

Reviews.Title: “Great small resort”
Reviews.Author: dumb_rabbit
Reviews.Content: We stayed there from June 23-July 3rd. Stay was pleasant except for the 3 consecutive days of rain. There is almost NOTHING to do when it rains and there are very few covered spaces in this resort.Staff is friendly and helpful. Food was okay and typical of all-inclusives. Could have offered somewhat more variety. The Italian restaurant was excellent and well worth the hassle of reserving early. The salad bar there was particularly good at Botticellis.Though the resort is on the small side, it had a friendlier atmosphere than the bigger places and most of the same amenities except on a smaller scale. Staff at the water sports area was great (particularly Vance). Went scuba diving for the first time and the instructors were great and very,very patient. I had problems descending because my ears hurt, and he stayed with me and helped me get down VERY slowly. I wouldn't have completed it without him. Most watersports are available directly from there rather than having to go into town which was nice.Its a nice walk to town, about 15 minutes along a street with pretty houses. Its also pleasant to walk along the path with all of the other hotels, or can ride a bike or jog. Location was great. Beach was big and beautiful and nicer than that of many of the other hotels.Grounds and rooms were kept very clean. Only downside is that the rooms are pretty small, and the air conditioner is a window unit that blows onto the bed and can get pretty loud.Hotel management was very helpful, particularly Rafael who was great and very accommodating.Overall, it was a very nice hotel for the money and had a great location.

Reviews.Title: “scam”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I took our 6 year old son to Playa del Carmen and stayed at the Reef Club Playacar. We rented our own car and when we arrived at the hotel at 8:30am, after a LONG and exhausting red-eye flight, we were told that they had double booked the hotel and that they didn't have a room available for us, BUT they would gladly ship us over to their other hotel for a couple of nights, which was not anywhere near the beach and was on top of a hill. We had booked our trip over 6 months previous to our arrival. My husband was so pissed off, tired and frustrated that he threatened the manager with bodily harm - we got our room eventually, but the other poor travelers that were on our same flight and took the Reef Club bus to the hotel, ended up thinking that they had nowhere else to stay so took them up on the other hotel on the hill. We talked to some of these people later who were from Arkansas, had never seen the ocean before, and had saved and saved for their first vacation away from the US - they were scammed by the hotel into staying on top of a hill away from the beach. As if that wasn't bad enough, we were harrassed the entire trip by the staff to participate in some important "meeting" which was actually a time share sell by the staff and owners of the hotel. We were not about to spend three hours of our expensive vacation at some time share meeting. They were so upset that we refused to go to the "meeting" that they told us that we would not be able to return to the US unless we attended the meeting. We told them to "screw off". We had other family members staying at another hotel nearby, which is where we spent most of our time to get away from the pushy staff who were irritated that we would not conform to their scamming ways. We did, however, like our room. The food was okay, but they didnt serve any MEXICAN food, which we love and would have loved to have had some authentic Mexican food in Mexico. We had to go out to restaurants in town to get authentic Mexican food. They did have a nice breakfast buffet. All in all, we would never go back to that hotel - it is nothing but a SCAM.

Reviews.Title: “Had a GREAT time at the Reef Club”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My cousin, her 9 year old son , my 7 year old daughter and myself returned from Mexico May 28th ,2003. We stayed at the Reef Club. We had a fantastic time. They were about 80% full so it wasn't too crowded. The food was excellent especially at the speciallty restaurant. There was plenty to do, we really enjoyed the snorkelling trip.The rooms were nothing spectacular but they were very clean and quite sufficent. I would recommend this place to anyone, it is smaller than most resorts but that has its advantages as well. The resort itself is kept very clean and the beach was excellent. I would go back tomorrow. The entertainment staff were great and they were really good with kids. Keep up the good work.

Reviews.Title: “Good Vacation for the price”
Reviews.Author: inishak
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Reef Club the week of July 16, 2002. We stayed for 7 nights. We were travelling with three kids ages 2, 5, 7. We were also travelling with six other couples most with kids. Overall we had a good time. The really bad things about the hotel are the rooms and the food. As far as the rooms, they are extremely small and dark. I think that there are only 4 ocean view rooms, and they are all suites. The food at the buffet was only good during breakfast. Lunch and dinner were pretty bad, same items on the menu pretty much every day. The meat was never cooked right, always undercooked or overcooked. The only good thing was the pasta bar where they made pasta to order. The deserets were good. The snack bar by the pool was alright. The restaurant upstairs, the one you had to make a reservation for was ok. Overall, we always were able to find something to eat, we did eat out once, just for a change. Afterall this is Mexico, the food in all inculusive resorts is never that great. The great thing about this hotel in my opinion was the entertainment staff and the kids club. The kids were kept busy during the day with games on the beach and pool and at night they had a mini disco for them, which they loved. The shows at night were pretty good, better than any we have seen anywere else in Mexico. The beach was gorgeous, you did have to get up pretty early to reserve a shaded seat, same for the pool. Watch out for the toplesss women, if you are travelling with children. There are alot of Europeans vacationing at this resort and many of them chose to do so topless. Overall, it was a good vacation for the price. I will probably go back to Playa del carmen but I would try a different hotel.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: martininblack63
Reviews.Content: Just spent 5 days here. The staff are excellent and go out of their way to make you feel welcome. Yes, the beds are hard and the rooms smell a bit musty,we brought a couple of air fresheners and had no problem after that. beautiful beach and only minutes from town. Kids club is more of a babysitting service than a club. Marina from the entertainment staff made our trip a great experience with her enthusiasm and willingness to be a part of our vacation. We went to the crown paradise in Cancun at the end of this trip for a couple of days and found none of the warmth that we felt from this resort (just a big hotel....the less i say about that place, the better). Save your money and go to the reef club!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Five of us (2 couples and a friend) stayed at the R.C. Playacar in April 2003 - we had an amazing time! The staff was friendly, the rooms a little old but very clean, the grounds made you feel like you were in the middle of a jungle. The two pools and the beach were fantastic! The food and drinks we're pretty good for an all inclusive. The location is great - about a 20 minute walk to town. There are a couple of things that didn't bother us but should be pointed out so you're not surprised: the bathroom towels are in dire need of replacement (the beach towels however are good) and our tv stopped working and it took 3 days and 4 trips to the front desk to have it fixed (of course, we weren't there to watch tv). Oh and the entertainment? Not that good but just walk or take a $4 cab ride into town where you can shop, sit at open air bars, hear live music, etc. All in all it was a great trip and beacuse the resort catered to all types (young couples, singles, families, older folks) I would recommend the R.C. Playacar to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great Vacation”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Reef Club Playacar for four days and had a wonderful time. The rooms were great with extremely cold A/C, large bathrooms and satellite television. The staff was courteous and helpful. The food was very good - always fresh with plenty of variety. The hotel is located right on the beach, which was clean. The hotel was just a short taxi ride from town - you probably could even walk. The hotel seemed to be in a very safe area. Great value for the price. We would definitely go back to this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice.”
Reviews.Author: rockyroad
Reviews.Content: I read every review here before giving this place a shot. I was pleasantly surprised. The food isn't great, the pillows are as hard as people say, but the rooms are spotless, and they make them up even if you sleep past noon. Pool towels were available all the time. The location is PERFECT. You can walk to town in 15 minutes, filled with shopping, music, and many good restaurants, as well as picking up the ferry to Cozumel. If you don't want to walk, take a taxi, it's only 4 bucks. Tours to nearby parks like Xcaret and Xel-Ha are available, and only a short trip at that. The resorts two pools overlook the ocean, with a swim up bar in one. Avoid the hotel gift shop, you'll save 50% by shopping in town. For the price, I had a great time and recommend this place to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Will be back”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: June 4-12We are back and had a great time. I'll give my impressions of th Reef Club and just the Reef Club, because I only left the grounds once during the whole stay!Let me start by saying that we had our young boys with us on this trip and if it weren't for them, we would have gone the non-AI route as we have every time in the past. That being said, we enjoyed the R.C. so much and it was so cheap, and so close to town, that in the future, even if it is just my wife and I, we might stay there again. (I can't believe I'm saying that! :o ) We'll eat breakfast and lunch there, lounge and drink at the pool and beach, and then go into PDC for dinner and revelry.It is not "fancy." It is tatsteful, super clean, small, well-laid out, and has nice planted areas all over. The rooms were nicer than I was expecting (ask for a room in one of the first 4 buildings next to the pool, I don't think the level would matter much. I think any further might have been slightly less convenient.) Our rooms were cleaned every single day by the same woman. She was wonderful.Water...I didn't drink out of the tap in the bathroom, but probably could have. They leave bottled water every day at $1/bottle. I drank plenty out of the tap at the restaraunt and the bar.There is no minifridge in the room, but I didn't miss it.There are two pools, one with a bar, one without. The pool with the bar is where most of the families and couples hung out. It was GREAT!!! Tip the bartenders and they will return the favor. Watered down drinks? I didn't notice, and I like my Cuba Libres. We never had a problem finding lounges with umbrellas at the pool or beach, albeit we were out by 8 each a.m.Food. Was much better than I had expected. It was downright good with plenty of choices and lots of daily variety. (gotta try the frejoles at breakfast!) I was very satisfied in this regard.I have been to PDC several times and have always stayed around 10th street. The beach at the R.C. is at least on par with the nicest in town and I think nic.Dive shop. Very professional and friendly. I went on three dives and I think the prices were reasonable. They will give you a free refresher in the pool, if you want. They are there everyday to let curious adults and kids get their first taste of a regulator.The staff was unbelievable. They were very friendly and outgoing. If you want to participate in silly games in the pool or the beach, you can. It is a good way to meet new friends, who, by the way will probably be on vacation from Europe.A few :( topless sunbathers.Bottom line, we will be back. I was anti-AI, but am now pro-Reef Club.If you have any questions, let me know.James A.

Reviews.Title: “O.K.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I returned to Playa Del Carmen in June after staying at the Copacabana in eary April. We choose the Reef Club because the price was right and the food was supposedly better. While the food was moderately better and the location in the Playacar was certainly better, the place was not as ideal for family with two kids-ages 6 and 2. The Copacabana's children staff and shows were superior. The large number of smokers and heavy drinkers at the pool gave the place a cheap feel. The rooms were noisy with window type AC and no refrigarator. We checked out one day early and moved to the Gala which was much better.

Reviews.Title: “very relaxing...”
Reviews.Author: tn_mary
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just got back from the Reef Club this week (went from 5/30-6/3). We normally go to Cancun but since I'm pregnant, we wanted a more low key vacation. First of all, we loved the Playa Del Carmen area. It exceeded our expectations being not overly commercial and crowded (like Cancun). The town was so charming and a great place to stroll at night. The hotel was great too. Our room wasn't ready for a few hours which was kinda miserable being that it was raining and we had nowhere to go... but after we got in, we forgot about that fiasco. The maids left flowers petals all over the floor, bed, pillows and even in the bathroom. There was a large swan made out of towels on the bed as well. I don't know if they thought we were honeymooners, or just felt sorry for us since we waited on the room a long time (or maybe everyone's welcomed with this). But anyway, we enjoyed the room. It wasn't facing the garden area, but seemed quiet all tucked away. The food was decent. Even though it was buffet style, there was a grill option for every meal... meaning one night they were grilling fish which you could choose for your main entree, another night it was grilled chicken... mornings it was personalized omelettes... so you weren't stuck eating JUST from the buffet. You could get something cooked fresh each meal. We didn't get to fully check out Boticelli's (long story) but heard it was nice. To break up the buffet monotany, we did eat out twice in town. That was wonderful. This is a great place for families and honeymooners (we saw 2 weddings while we were there). We were pleased to not see a bunch of drunk teenagers running around. The topless women didn't bother me... heck, I woulda joined them if I wasn't pregnant. My only advice is: bring a small clock alarm for your room, bring your own shampoo and soap, bring lots of 1's for tips, don't do all the expensive tours when you can take a cab to the same places and do it for a lot less money... and make sure you're chain locked in every night since t (caught us off guard at 8 am one morning). The best part of this hotel is the size (only 200 rooms). It never feels crowded like the some of the hotels just down the beach. Also, if you want, you can hear a "sales pitch" a few doors down at the Fisherman's Village (fancy hotel). My husband were walking down the beach one early morning, and got "talked into" a sales tour of that hotel. The only reason we went was to get the $100 cash promised at the end. It didn't last long. We said our "no"s... and walked out with $100 cash, a hammock, 2 t-shirts and a $100 certificate good for their beauty spa. We're not the fancy hotel types... so it was easy to say no when you can stay at the Reef Club for much less money and get a nice relaxing vacation without breaking the bank.

Reviews.Title: “Great family resort”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just want everyone to know about the best family value all-inclusive resort in Playacar. The Reef Club is an affordable family resort located on an absolutely gorgeous stretch of beach. Rates start at only $58/nt per adult (for travel in December), and kids stay free! We loved the small size (only 200 rooms) and layout of the resort, with the tropical forest and cenote still intact in the center of the resort. We visited it last year, and have just booked a stay for early December. The kids club is well run and located near the beach. The staff is very energetic and enthusiastic, with activities arranging from aerobics to beach volleyball. Feel free to email me for help with making your reservations: vivianthornhill@attbi.com

Reviews.Title: “a wonderfull holiday in mexico”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: In may 2003 we had a wonderfull holiday in the Reef Club Playacar. This was our second time in this resort and everything was 100 procent ok again.The rooms are nice and clean. All the food was excellent and there was a lot of choise. Especially the Botticilli restaurant was very nice to visit. Also the buffet had a big choise. The entertainment team did a very good job making everybody happy. The shows in the eveninig are fantastic, every night an other show. We made some trips (swimming with dolphins, got to Tulum, snorkeling) All the trips are expensive, 80$ per person is normal. The beach and the sea are wonderfull. We really can recomment this place to you. Our doughter from 13 years like it very much too.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Amazing”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I just returned from the Reef Club Playacar (05/17/03 - 05/22/03) a few days ago. This resort completely exceeded my expectations! The beaches are amazingly crystal clear, the grounds and rooms are immaculate (they are always cleaning), the people are very friendly and the weather was beautiful. I had no complaints whatsoever. I had read other reviews about this resort on this website and now think that those who were able to find something to complain about must be incredibly hard to please. The food was yummy, there were several selections on the buffet - including enough healthy choices to keep me pleased (not always an easy feat) and the Italian restaraunt was outstanding. Here's a tip, at least occassionally tip the bartenders and they will go out of their way to please you. Try the Banana Mama drinks; delicious!! We were a group of four, and I did all of the research to decide on where we would stay in the Playa Del Carmen area. The presssure was on me...I was so pleased with this decision. I knew as soon as we left the hotel lobby and started walking toward our room that I had made the right decision regarding choice of resort. As you leave the resort and head toward your room you will walk across a bridge (waterfall to your right) and into a beautifully maintained jungle/garden. At night it is eloquently lit...during the day music plays throughout the jungle. The nightly shows are very entertaining. At the end of the show, let the dancers drag you up on stage...it's fun and you are on vacation! I can honestly say that this has been the best vacation (and by far the most relaxing) that I have ever taken. The beach is breath-taking by day and diehard romantic at night. You won't be disappointed if you choose this place... Check out the "Isla Mujueres" tour offered on Mondays (go to the watersports shack on the beach to book). The cost is $65/person and includes all you can drink (liquor as well as soft drinks), all you can eat lunch on Isla Mujueres, swimming with the sharks (relaxpping, spinnaker parasailing, etc., etc. The snorkeling is beautiful and this booze cruise is sure to please. I could go on and on about this resort and all that it offers.... Seriously Satisfied!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Getaway!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a long weekend stay at the Reef Club Playacar and i had such a wonderful time i had to write a review! The resort is beautiful! We had a gorgeous room with a large patio with two lounge chairs and a table with chairs--all surrounded by these beautiful yellow flowers! It was so beautiful! The trees and 'forest' in the center of the resort with cenotes flowing through it, smells beautiful, and adds a shady romantic feel to your walk to the beach, or back to your room, or over to Chula Vista for dinner. The beach is beautiful, clean and the water is so clear! Wake up early to reserve your beach chairs under a shady spot--they go fast--and don't try to leave your towels out overnight--that doesn't work---but honestly, if you don't really mind where you sit--it is not that crowded that you won't be happy with what is open at noon! That's what we did--and i was never unhappy with where we were! The food was GREAT--even in the buffet restaurant and the snack bar! Drinks were tasty! Pablo, the bartender at the pool-bar was great! All the staff there was so nice. We were only there three nights, Friday through Monday, i wish we could have stayed longer--but for the time we were there--i had the perfect getaway weekend! If you are up in the air about choosing The Reef Club--rest assured, it is a great great great place!

Reviews.Title: “great escape”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: this is a great place - very quiet and everyone keeps to themselves! the staff was fun! the food was great and the beach was wonderful. Beds are a little hard, but very clean rooms!!! Great stuff to do around there also.

Reviews.Title: “It was the most relaxing resort I've ever stayed at.4-16-03/4-21-03”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I'm only 18 and I loved the resort. It is so relaxing, if you are wanting to go to a party resort I would not go here. If you would like to relax and have free drinks along with free food this is the place. The food was excellent along with the drinks. I thought the workers were really nice. Of course you always need to put important things like credit cards and passports in the safe otherwise I guarantee they will be stolen. My favorite part about the resort was the ocean. I have been to Jamaica, Florida, California, Italy, and Louisiana and the view at the resort of the ocean topped them all. I would definitely recommened coming to this resort if you want to kick back and relax

Reviews.Title: “Theft of credit card # may have occured”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We believe that our credit card number was taken from the hotel in-room safe. We were traveling with another couple and their number was taken too. My card was in the safe for the entire week and I did not use it at a single place during the trip. The cards were not taken, but the numbers and names were used to make new fake cards that were actually swiped (yes swiped, not punched in) at the same grocery store in Mexico for close to $500 each. My travel companion's fake card was only used at the grocery store, but my fake card was also used at a liquer store for for again close to $500. My concern is not the cards, but the fact that our driver's licenses have our SS# on them and that our passports were also in the safes; every number assigned to our identies may have been stolen. As of right now the hotel has not been of any help and completely denied that there is even a remote possiblitiy the theft occured from the in-room safe. Since my card was not used at all and was in the safe at all times and my travel companion's was only taken out on one day, I don't see any other explanation. Please, if you had the same thing happen to you e-mail me and let me know. We can discuss the details to try to piece together the puzzle. We were at the resort from 4-19-03 to 4-26-03 and other than this event, I really enjoyed my stay at the Reef Club, but I would like to see the person responsible removed from the hotel so others do not suffer the same ordeal.

Reviews.Title: “Fire the beach supply outfit”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The people at the resort were great. The outfit that manages the water sports on the beach were terrible. They lied to me, were rude to me, and almost ruined the whole trip. All I wanted was a snorkle/mask/and fins. They said they didn't have any, they were all stolen, they don't give them out any more, and even told me the resort told them to stop giving them out. If I owned the resort, I would find an outfit that had one or two people with communucation skills.(and I am not talking language) It took two trips to the resort manager, and 4 or 5 confrontations and a day and a half before I got to snorkel, and even then they said I had to re-check out the equipment each hour or pay $15. I had the equipment back to re-check it out at exactly an hour, and one butt head came over and started ranting and raving about how I was 10 mins over the hour, and all the while he was showing his butt, he was pointing to the wrong person on the list. When I pointed out to him that my equipment was signed out exactly an hour earlier, he didn't even apologize.They had quite a few sets of equipment, and none of it was new. If I had people like this working for me, I would be out of business. A little mildew smell in the room, especially in the closet. The beds were hard. (I am used to a pillow top.) The food was good, and the resort people were fantastic. The pools and the beach was clean and nice. If they had someone else operating the beach activities, I would go back.My wife is a spanish teacher, and we have taken many vacations to Mexico, Costa Rico, & Spain, and we have never had a problem like this one.

Reviews.Title: “great trip! will go back!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: we stayed at the reef club 4/16-4/23. weather was perfect. great hotel for your $. there was always plenty of food and drinks kids never complained ages 8 and 9 and even for picky kids they could help themselves(snack bar has hot dogs hamburgers, chicken nuggets or some sort of mexican rolls, chips/guacomole, popcorn, french fries, rotisserie chicken pizza, and lots of fresh fruit) and never bothered us once. they ate all day long and even went to kids club whenever they wanted. boogie boards,kayaks,hobie cats avail by the beach. ceramic painting available- daughter did one it came out beautiful. staff is wonderful- very entertaining and friendly! especially fernando, adianna, jimena, and valerie and everyone.. beds are hard but not that bad and we brought our own pillows. save your pool towels- trade them in for clean ones at 5:00 you can use them in the room and save pool chairs and then get clean ones when they open. walk to town is not that bad or you can use one of their bikes-they give you lock and key, or take a cab only $4 or $5. staff all work very hard and constantly cleaning. room kept very clean no bugs at all and air conditioning worked well(we were on 2nd floor closer to the pool). nice small hotel so you are not piled on top of each other like at other bigger hotels. will go back!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Second Honeymoon!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Reef Club from 4/11-4/18 and it was the perfect vacation. The beach is absolutely beautiful, the staff was very friendly and always eager to help. The rooms were very clean and the maid service was excellent. Yes, the bed was hard and the room sometimes was a little musty. But we brought our own pillows, opened the windows, and hardly spent any time in the room (who goes to the beach to stay in the room?), so it didn't really matter. I would definitely recommend that people save their towels and claim your beach chairs early - they go quickly. As for the entertainment, it's what you make of it - if you wanted to get involved, the staff was very energetic and encouraging and seemed to plan fun games/activities for everyone. If you didn't want to participate, you could avoid it. A complaint I read on this site before we left was that drink sizes were small and/or drinks were watered down. Real simple solution - ask for more. The staff was good about honoring requests if you wanted multiple and/or stronger drinks. We did do the resort guided snorkle tour for $30/per person since it was our first time. It was worth the price, but I've heard there's also good snorkling in Cozumel. The ferry to Cozumel is easy to get to and Playa is a fun place to walk around for shopping (I would definitely shop in Playa over Cozumel - Cozumel's prices can be twice that of Playa). Anyway, the whole trip was completely awesome and I would recommend the Reef Club to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Good value hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The beach is great with plenty of personal space. Neighboring, larger hotels had guests on top of one another at their beaches. The staff is friendly and helpful. They even prepared a birthday cake for one of the members of our party and sang Happy Birthday at the table. This resort is great for the money. The only complaint is the overly firm bed.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The hotel was really nice. It was small but not to small you knew almost everyone there. The food was decent but it had no variety. The snack bar was good and so were the drinks. The rooms were nice except for the hard beds and pillows. The sports and entertainment staff are great. They involved you in everything. They made my trip what it was. Overall it is a great place to stay if you get to know the staff.

Reviews.Title: “what happened???????”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My friends and I stayed at the reef club for the third time on march 8th-18th we we're very disappointed from our previous stays the entertainment staff was all new whitch would have been ok if they would of actually entertained you. At least the old staff got you involved this staff diddnt even make a effort.Our room sucked the air conditioner broke 3 times before they finally fixed it for good not to mention the strong musty oder in our room. As for the food terrible its pretty much bland the Italian restraurant is very good but you have to make reservation the day you want to eat there whitch means 7:00am too early for me on vacation.there are some nice staff members antonio and yara r great. playa del carmen is great but I wouldn't suggest staying at the reef club.

Reviews.Title: “We will be back!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Paradise! Not sure I want to tell everyone about this secret treasure. I am coming back next year and do not want you all to take my spot. The jungle setting for the rooms is so soothing after a long day of beach, pools, sun, boogie boarding, volleyball both beach and pool, water aerobics, swimming with cool fish, and swimming up to the pool bar to order a "bushwacker". A new drink brought to the bar by the Kansas City, Mo. folks. Met people from all over the world. Loved that!!The staff is so friendly and helpful. The Entertainment crew is delightful and keeps you enjoying yourself! The rooms are clean and everyday you receive new sheets on your bed! (leave a tip daily and they will treat you like royality). Now, remember you are in the tropics....there are bugs and lizards. But they are mainly outside they are interesting to look at! That ocean was spectacular. It truely is that blue. Had a 2 hour rain storm, then the ocean layed flat and we had the most spectacular evening ocean swim. I could have stayed in there all night!The food was beautifully presented and very tastie. We ate at the upstairs restaurant twice. Make your reservation by 7am.....it fills fast! Keep your towels daily. Just trade for a clean one as they get them in. There were 8 in our party and we would take turns reserving our beach spot with towels in the morning. (before breakfast) We always found a great spot that fit all us. Bring a pillow, they are very hard. Beds are firm, but I slept fine. The lighting is flourescent in the rooms and are dimly lite because of this, but I appreciate the conservation of energy. Why stay in your room when there is this wonderful paraidse to see. 15 min. walk to Playa del Carmen. Barter! Items are high dollar to start. Xel-Ha and Tulum a must!I could go on and on.....but reality calls. I will be back. See you next year

Reviews.Title: “Had a great time with the Canadians!”
Reviews.Author: NDvacationer
Reviews.Content: Would just like to say, I was at the Reef Club on 2-15-03 thru 2-23-03. Had a great time. Met up with Canadians who liked to party. Teased them a lot about saying "A" If they read this, I hope they respond. The Reef Club is a very clean place, with a beautiful beach!

Reviews.Title: “Had a great time!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Spent school vacation Feb 14 to 21 at the Reef Club with children aged 7, 13, and 15. A great smaller resort (around 200 rooms) so everything is close by. You feel like you're in a jungle rain forest. The beach is FANTASTIC, with warm water and great waves a couple of days for boogie boarding or body surfing. We took a boat from the resort for snorkeling and saw some great sites for a good price. My two older children were 1/2 price ($15.00) and my 7 year old was free. Met many nice people from the United States and Canada. The resort is small enough that you can make some nice friends and the kids can meet other kids. The buffet was very good and the pasta at the Itallian restaurant was fantastic. Make reservations early (before 7:30 am). The chicken and guacamole at the snack bar were marvelous. You can walk to Playa Del Carmen or take a cab for $4.00. The week we were there, the hotel was offering two nights at a resort in Cozumel with the ferry, cabs, and all inclusive resort included. We took advantage of this and it was wonderful. A little bit bigger resort with wonderful ocean-view rooms. Great pool, miniature golf course, kids club, and snorkeling nearby. The beach wasn't as nice as Playacar. It was nice to experience both.The staff at both places were very nice and accomodating. Our first room was on the first floor and a little dark and rather smoky. My husband can not sleep in a smoky room and we were changed to a much nicer 2nd floor room nearer the pool. Can't say enough about the constant upkeep and cleaning at the reef club. They were always picking up, pruning, and cleaning. All in all we had a great time.

Reviews.Title: “We had a great time!”
Reviews.Author: janelley
Reviews.Content: We just got back from the Reef Club Playacar. We were there from 2/15-2/22/03. This place was absolutely beautiful. The grounds are always being cleaned and groomed from early in the morning until at least 11:00 at night! The staff were very friendly and always eager to help if you needed it, especially the entertainment staff, Fernando, Omar, and Carlos, to name a few. They kept our children, ages 12 and 17, busy all day long. They certainly weren't bored at this place. It is very family oriented. They had activities all day long starting with aerobics on the beach and in the pool in the morning. There was always something doing if you wanted to participate. The beach is beautiful and not too crowded like the beaches at the other hotels. This was the best beach compared to the others because you weren't sitting on top of one another. The snack bar by the pool was excellent. They had a good variety of food to eat. Nachos, hot dogs, hamburgers, pizza, etc. and the rotisserie chicken is awesome, but it goes quick so get it as soon as it's done. The drinks were good, but they were watered down. If you tipped them they would put more in for you. The Mango Bar had the best drinks and waitress staff, especially Yara, which is where we went at night located near the theater. Each night the entertainment staff put on a show. They were pretty good. These people work from early morning until late at night. I give them a lot of credit. The buffet in the morning had excellent food. Anything you wanted. We only had bacon one day, though. Any style of potatoes they made were excellent. Botticelli's had excellent food. You need to make a reservation for this place starting at 7:00 a.m. You make it at the buffet restaurant Chula Vista. The line starts at 6:40 a.m. By 7:20 a.m. it's full so get there early. The rooms were just okay. The beds were very firm and the air conditioner was very loud. It did smell musty in the room at first because it is very humid there. We just brought oed to work okay. Also, we brought insulated mugs with us to bring to the beach to be filled up with beer or tonic because they give you small glasses for the drinks. You need to put your beach towels on your chairs early in the morning to save them. What you need to do is instead of turning your towels in at the end of the day which in turn they will give you a towel card, bring the towels back with you to the room and put them on the chairs in the morning. When the towel hut opens, turn your towels in and they will give you new towels. We learned this after a couple of days. Check out the Reef Marina on the beach where you get the kayaks, sailboats, etc. to use. They have an express snorkeling that will only cost you $30.00. The boat takes you right from the beach to the reef, you snorkel for about 45 minutes and they take you back. If you book with other tours, they will charge you double to include transportation, lunch, and longer snorkeling that you really don't need. Also, the staff goes to Senor Frog's every Friday night. They will charge you $25.00 per person which includes transportation, open bar and admission. We went on our own and didn't spend nearly as much as that. There was no admission price either. The cab costs $4 to go there.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the quiet hotel”
Reviews.Author: selnuit
Reviews.Content: We just returned from 2 weeks spent at the Club Reef in Playacar...the best all inclusive holidays we ever had! Quiet hotel, superclean (someone is always cleaning something there!), excellent food: eating at the same buffet for 2 weeks, it better offer enough variety! The beach is lovely. And we could take very long walks along the beach. Would recommend this place to people who like a quieter, relaxed amotsphere!

Reviews.Title: “Great Vacation! Stay here!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The reef club was a great place to stay. we had gone to the one in Cozumel beforehand and thought it was the best place on earth. We got to go there for a day while staying at the other one and found out that the playacar one is 10 times better. We wanted to go back to playacar after just a little bit. It is a fun but easy going resort with a great snack bar and breakfast(the dinners were so-so) the bars had everything you wanted though. The rooms are like anyother hotel room. the staff is very fun and helpful and We had left our safe open while we were out for a whole day and everything was still in there after being cleaned. there is an aviary that is very cheap but a fun thing to do on a quieter day right down the street and you can save a lot a money by walking into playacar (it's not far and it's a nice walk w/ beautiful houses along the street. Just an FYI we got 7 nights and air and everything for around $650 a person but i have seen it's been around $950. hope this has helped someone!
